Absolutely beautiful... :). Old town Square is amazing to see in both daylight and at night. We were amazed at the buildings. It is a tourist attraction so it is very busy but you can still see everything. There are lots of restaurants to choose from. If you go to Prague you have to visit the Old Town and you will be left speechless.
Get a Seat. Recommend getting to the astrological clock 1/2 hour early get a seat outside in the restaurant order a beer and just wait for the hour to strike.

Vibrant square with lots of street artists. This was one of the most liveliest places in Prague and me and my friend just sat down watching the street artists perform.So many talented people were doing some acts here and a lot of the pubs were advertisig their pub crawling deals here.You can just sit down with some snacks and drinks and chill here or even just stroll around or do the segway ride!

Beautiful. This is a busy area, lots going on, lots of people on tours and lots of people vying for your business. There are restaurants and cafes surrounding the area. The food and drink in these establishments is pricey. If you want to sit and watch the world go by be prepared to pay £6 a beer.
Old Town Square. A very touristic spot, a junction to various attractions, hence you will not miss it. Very crowded at times. The surrounding view is great, good for taking photos.

Historical square with astronomical clock. Amazing square of old Prague town. The most interesting thing on the square is astronomical clock, but around it is very overcrowded. Also in neighborhood, there are a lot of restaurants and bars.
Like a fairytale town. Beautiful, like being in a live-action Pinocchio. Total fairytale square, with tons of restaurants, shops, statues and people-watching.
Jan Huss looks moody.. The quintessential old city square complete with cathedral and a bevy of horse drawn tourist traps. This one has a statue of Jan Huss in the middle.
A must see. You must go to Old Town Square. It not only has the astronomical clock, but has lots of shopping and restaurants.

Meeting Place. Old Town Square is very much the place to meet. It is a lot bigger than I thought it would be and very pretty! The Art Gallery (I call it the pink palace) is lovely to look at. Lots of bars and restaurants - It is the ideal place to start discovering Prague.
well worth visiting. This is a must when visiting Prague. Architecture is stunning. Square is vibrant and alive with people and eateries.
Good feeling to stay there. Must is to climb up the tower, the view is amaizing over the red roofs, towers, pariska street, crowd in front of astonomical clock...absolutely wonderful

Go up in the Tower. It doesn't cost much, can't remember how much. There is an elevator that we took up but we walked down. The views are great and my husband took a fast motion video from the top of the Tower that makes the people move around like ants. On the way down there are pictures that show the history of the tower.
take you time and watch the people. From the astronomical clock to the street park with beer and sausage to mimes and actors, music and lots of people. Fun experience but crowded.
A tourist attraction but worth the time.. So much to see and do throughout the city. If you are in Prague as a Tourist then make sure you don't miss this place.

The meeting place for most visitors. By far the busiest part of Old Town. Here you can find a number of the top ten attractions. Here you will find an abundance of small hotels and restaurants, plus street entertainment. Can get very crowded so just be cognizant of all around you.

Meeting point.. A very interesting square, all sorts going on from blowing bubbles to small bands playing, we were sitting having a coffee when over a 1000 motor bikes arrived and parked for about 20 mins an amazing sight to see so many pristine Davidsons, plus the roar as they left, brilliant.

Stunning place. The Old Town Square is a stunning place. The town hall and the analytical clock are beautiful. A climb to the top of the clock tower is rewarded with a breath taking view of the square and city . Sitting at a table at one of the many fantastic restaurants in the square sampling the local beer and watching the world go by is a must.
Great vibes. Truly awesome. Sit at one of the sidewalk cafes and have a drink whilst soaking in the sights and sounds...

Bustling with tourists. The old town square is the heart of Prague, bustling with locals and tourists alike. It is a huge square lined with cafes. There are many old and magnificent buildings around it. Just sit there and absorb the energy of the place, watch the people walk past and admire the architecture. We loved the square and visited it a couple of times.
Great atmosphere and loads to see. Lots of places to eat and drink (try the chocolate beer). A truly beautiful square buzzing with activities day and night.

Beautiful, but jam-packed with tourists. The Old Town is at the top of the list to visit in Prague, but beware, it is jam-packed with tourists. Florence is maybe the only place as crowded. It is literally wall-to-wall people. Regardless, the architecture and charm remain. And it’s central to everything else in Prague. Great restaurants line the square and the buskers are fun to watch.

Beautiful and bustling. The centre of the life of the old city is wonderful for people watching on a sunny day. The buildings are all individually worth gazing at and the cafes are worth sitting in! Don't miss the Hussite church - not spectacular but very significant, as it the memorial outside.

Joust about everything to entertain you. Visited at night to watch the interesting astronomical clock strike the hour, then again during the day and watched an unexpected medieval pageant complete with jousting. This is the Centre of Old Town activity.

Impressive Square. The Old Town Square is big, bustling but with many splendid buildings to admire. The restaurants and bars are a bit on the expensive side but just off the Square there are some fine restaurants which are reasonably priced. There are also several tour guide firms operating in the Square, if you are interested in booking a guided tour during your stay. We had pre booked one such firm for a tour which turned out to be really good.
Very pretty . We walked here one day its a bit of a steep and long walk from our hotel but was definatley worth it to see the old town
Busy square. Guess this is another must see landmark after the Charles Bridge. Very happening square with lots of restaurants and shops around. You can't miss the astronomical clock at the square.

Day Trip. Arrived on a Sunday and the place was packed with tourist and football fans but a great vibe to the city. There was josting and barbecue kiosks around the square with fantastic old historic buildings.
Great architecture. Beautiful architecture, so much history but too crowded this time of year to really appreciate it. Gorgeous buildings everywhere you look.

Beautiful city . Architectural this city is one of the best iv had the pleasure to see. Every building is one of grandeur and exquisite architectural planning and beauty. In the old square you will have the chance to try local cuisines which are sold on the street by local vendors. There are many tourists that hire out side ways to explore the city. You can sit down in the local pubs and bars restaurants, which sell local beers which are very nice and great value for money. Night life normally starts around 8pm which the city transforms into place of fun and excitement. There are a mixture of cultures in this city due to high tourism. And the club's will cater for everybody needs. Club M2 playing rnb which pulls in a good crowd. Expect lengthy cues. And others places which are more chilled and relaxed.
Beautiful!. hundreds of years, so much history and still standing! this place is amazing both during the day and the night. There's usually hundreds of persons but the place is definitely worth it

Beautiful architecture but packed with tourists. I have mixed feelings about Prague's Old Town Square. The architecture is stunning but the place is crammed full of tourists, lame buskers, and reckless segway riders. Probably much better during off season.

Charming. Busy, charming square with many exciting and talented street performers. Astronomical clock show on the hour is very disappointing. Many cuckoo clocks are more interesting. Not worth waiting more than 5 minutes to see this attraction.

The most happening place in Prague always full of tourists. We were in Prague for 3 full days and all 3 days we were in old town square. It is always busy, morning afternoon or night. there are so many vendors around and the architecture there is just beautiful. It is a nice place to even sit and people watch. be mindful of the stores and bars in the square itself, very overpriced compared to ones just around the square.

A Must Do When in Prague. If you're in Prague, you must visit the Old Town Square. There's plenty to see and many vendors as well as restaurants and bars. We went there a number of times during our 5 day stay in this gorgeous city. It's not too far of a walk from the Charles Bridge and well worth you time.

Visit on the hour. If visiting the old town square, try to be there just before the hour to see the astronomical clock's figures move. Something a bit special. Watch your personal belongings as someone might want to own them instead of you!
Beautiful. Beautiful square with nice old buildings and architectures which suits Prague and is exactly what everyone is imagining when speaking about this city.

Return from Charles bridge. It's a lovely walk from the Charles Bridge down the cobble stones to the nearby hotels. Definitely one crosses the quaintest streets, majestic architecture, many clock towers, the Powder tower and astronomical clock.It's beautiful and old world.

Changing every day. The square is a happening place. One day it had a Harley-Davidson rally and the next a Renaissance fair with a jousting arena and everything. It's a good central point to start your stay with the churches and the Old Town Hall. Watch out for segways.

Touristy. Wish Prague would regulate the tourism and restaurants, such a beautiful square and the clock is gorgeous , but jostling with tourists and drunk rowdy hen and bachelor bashes just makes it a place you can't wait to get out of.

Heart of Prague. I stayed on the square and loved every minute. It is big and beautiful. The Clock.... Churches.... Restaurants....Plus of course, plenty of tourists. But, do be careful, a friend had his bad snatched with his camera... While we were eating dinner by the clock.. These crooks are opportunists and know what they are doing. Beware. But that's the same wherever crowds gather. Unfortunate experience but did not diminish the beauty of this place.

Congested with tourists but why not!. A beautiful square with elegant architectures. Very busy with people but why not, the astronomical clock is here that chimes oh so beautifully. Lots of restaurants although pricey for obvious reasons.
Lots of history. Great place to look at architecture, clock tower at midday fantastic. Lots of places to shop, eat, drink. There is also underground homes under clock tower.
Gorgeous square!. Beautiful square to grab a coffee or drink. Lots of cute shops nearby. Definitely a must see in Prague.
Lovely Atmosphere. Great place to stroll and people watch. Food and drink on sale from cabins in the square due to Easter celebrations.

One of the busiest areas of Prague. This is a great meeting spot in case you get lost. It is extremely busy and lots of tours start and end here. There are lots of shopping and places to eat in this area.

Always something going on. This is the main touristic attraction in Prague and as such can be considered a tourist trap of sort but the place is very lively and full with shows and restaurant and such.Be careful of Pick pockets as the love tourist.
like an old town square in any country. Large square. always something going on. We saw bubble blowers, mimes, musicians and similar there. nice restaurants around with reasonably cheap food.
Good starting point . If you're going to meet someone in town, this is a ideal place, since it's wide open but big. Also a good starting point to explore the city

Impressive!. How could you not be impressed by the beautiful architecture in this square!Everywhere you look is a feast for your eyes!It is busy every minute of the day, with segway and walking tours.It has a fun atmosphere in the evening!I loved the fact you could grab a snack and beer here at night, from a bratwurst sausage, Prague ham and beer to an icecream.A great place to people watch and chill.

The Heart of Prague!. Be prepared to be awestruck! From the beautiful colorful architecture, to the astronomical clock, to Tyn Church, there is so much to see in this beautiful square. Besides the historical beauty, it is clean, safe, and reasonably priced. Been to most historic cities throughout the world. Prague rates up there with the best and this square is a major reason.

Prague from the top - the best idea. Prague is a gorgeous city. The Old Town Square is really cool and busy so I recommend to see the city from the top.
Prague is a perfect city for a city break, to walk around the streets and enjoy this amazing view from the top.

One of the most beautiful squares on Earth. It felt like walking in fairy tail; the Gothic Church and the Astronomical Clock are unique in the world. The restaurants in the square might be a rip off but will offer you an amazing view.

Nice area day or night. We came here on a few occasions on our trip in Prague very busy area especially when the clock goes off as many people gather to get photos and videos of it going off. Its a very nice area and you never feel unsafe day of night. in the old town square there are little stalls where you can get pints of beer for a pound or so, freshly made crisps, and burgers.

Buzzing with people, even on a week day. If it's summer, and sunny, the place will be buzzing with people, and for good reason: plenty of restaurants, shops, gorgeous architecture and cultural attractions.

Beautiful at night, lively during a day. Old Town Square is a centre point of Prague. I especially recommend to visit it after the sunset. It's so beautiful!! During the day it's also very lively place with many ententainers.
Convenient . Right in the middle of everything. Astronomical clock, restaurants, Jewish Quarter, souvineer shops.
Beautiful buildings. Beautiful buildings, lots of cafes and restaurants, but gets really really busy. Worth going to see the astrological clock.

Nice buildings and a clock!. You have to visit the square because of the astronomical clock probably. There's not much else to draw you here, some really nice old buildings some nice cafes and restaurants and a big open square with an horrendous great statue to one side. Best bet here is to have a quick walk around the square then find a table at one of the many outside bars order a large beer and sit back and watch the world go by. Or even better have lunch opposite the astronomical clock and watch the clock perform, it's great and prices are still very reasonable here too.
Wonderful experience!. Even being really packed of turists from all over the world, the visit is worth! Beautiful city with all possibilities to explore: bike tours, vintage cars, boats, walking!

Old town square, Prague. This the centre of Prague. Everything happens here and all paths lead though here. Majestic Tyn Church and Orloj the astronomical clocks is what makes this place special for me

Stunning building. The buildings around the square are stunning. There are also some cafes and restaurants around the square but they are very touristy, over-priced and the service at them wasn't great so would recommend going elsewhere for food and drink.

Prague City Stay. Great city with lots to see, including Town Square, Charles Bridge, Astronomical Clock. Terrific beer with micro-breweries everywhere, many restaurants, not expensive. You need a map since the streets are like a maze and easy to get turned around.

Old Town Square Czech Republic. A nice place to stroll, meet up with walking tours or sit and have a drink while people watching. Be sure to check out the tower clock. It's not very big, but it is unique.

Magnificent but beware. As others have said, a magnificent and beautiful square with exceptionally impressive architecture. However, beware of several things:1. The pig-roasts on the edge of the square will cost you, for a piece of pig and a beer, the equivalent of a two-course dinner and beer (despite the displayed prices - these are hypothetical)2. The restaurants on the square are up to three times more expensive than anywhere else for the same menu.3. The square is constantly criss-crossed by touts on segways - watch where you're going. And avoid - prices are astronomical.4. Avoid peak times - you won't get near any of the buildings and may have to wait for an 89-person guided tour to pass.Other than all the above - truly impressive.

If you visit Prague you have to see this . If you don't visit the old town square while your in Prague... Well then you haven't been to Prague. The oldest square in Prague filled with musicians playing on the cobbles towns, and bubbles being blown by a few guys looking to make an extra buck. Then right next to the town square you have the anatomical clock which makes a wonderful performance every hour on the hour. Although it's very touristy the square is still very enjoyable!
Great ope space!!!!. The beautiful buildings surrounding the square take you back in time. A great open space with a a lot of things to do in it. I really love it.!!!!!!!!!!!!

Busy but beautiful.. Lots to see. Note opening times of churches around the square. May close for mass or at midday or be entirely closed on Monday. Good garnet shops off the square. Street performers in the early afternoon and evenings. most "happening " place in touristy Prague.

Massive, vibrant and pretty square. Good spot to people-watch while enjoying a drink on a sunny day or at dusk. We didn't dine there although it was surrounded by restaurants. Nicely spacious, clean and offers a good vantage point to appreciate the beautiful architecture.

A Must See!. Perhaps the most beautiful town square I've seen in all of Europe. 5 stars for the architecture, history, and atmosphere. Cafes right on the square can be pricey and of mediocre quality but there are quality venues as well.

A must see in Prague. Beautiful spot in the Old Town. The architecture is impressive. Make sure to visit early in the morning. It'll be easier to really take in the sights, take pictures and just walk around, as it gets really crowded later in the day.Magnifique endroit dans la Vieille Ville. L'architecture est impressionnante. Visitez-la tôt le matin. Ce sera plus facile d'apprécier la vue, de prendre des photos et de se promener parce que la foule devient très dense plus tard dans la journée.

Watch the world walk by. The square is full of life. We sat on a bench beside the Jan Hus memorial and watched tour groups, lovers, a bridal party getting photographed, musicians,families, tourists and more
Great place.. We visited Prague for the Christmas market as a city break. It would have been perfect if we had snow, but one can't have everything!!
Beautiful square.. Lovely, busy, great architecture, nice terraces. One of the must-sees in Prague. Somehow reminded me of the big squares in Brussels and Antwerp.
Central city square. The architecture in and around the square was amazing. The vibe in the square was unique when we visited multiple times during our stay.
Interesting. The old town area of Prague is very interesting. Easy to walk through and end up at Charles Bridge. Dont miss the Astronomical Clock in the old town.
Got to be seen. You cannot go to Prague and not visit the Old Town Square, can get very busy but there are plenty of places to grab a snack or a drink, good place to chill when the sun is out.

Jump to history. Wonderful place in heart of prague, charming atmosphere in the evening drinking good beer, sightseeing from the tower brings the picture of town with 100 towers as well as from the top restaurant U prince

What a truly beautiful city.. No where in the world do you see what is on offer in Prague, every where you look there is something of beauty, in fact sometimes you just cant believe what you are seeing!!
Square with Orloj. Another must to see attraction, as near by this square there's an "Orloj" clock which are one of the most famous part of Prague.

The old town square. Stunning architecture beautiful place to visit, i dont think was anywhere that we didnt go!! Restaurants aren't too pricey either,it was really nice just sitting outside one of the restaurants having a drink just watching the people!!

Beautiful. Must visit!. Old town square is so beautiful. So many worth seeing churches, monuments and the famous astronomical clock. You can spend hours in and around the old town square and not get bored. A lot of shopping places nearby, lots of great beer and restaurants. I'll suggest visit old town square and area at night with all the lights and happening crowd. During the day might be a bit boring. But I would must visit!!

Beautiful buildings but very busy. Another must see in Prague but watch out for the segways! Bustling with stag and hen does on Saturday night. Prague might have over sold themselves to this market as we found it very rowdy in places after dark.
Worth visiting!. Really nice to see, a lot of restaurants in the area which are good and normal priced. Places to get a good icecream as well! Also good and many shops around here.
Heart of the City. A beautiful old town square at the centre of Prague. Full of tourists and locals alike. A great place to watch the world go by at one of the cafes around the edge of the square.
Lively atmosphere. The old town square is always buzzing with life and had some nice places to eat with the beautiful buildings surrounding you.

Busy Square. Visit the Old Town Square in Prague to see the architecture of the churches, the astronomical clock, the street performers (Michael Jackson, Winnie the Poo, baby in a carriage, and more), the statue, and the throngs of people walking around.It's is a very busy square with people everywhere! Be careful with your purse and wallet and watch out for those who try to pick your pockets.

A place where everybody are. If you go in Prague this Square is the most important and attractive of the City. I think there is no one went in Prague that missed this place. Most of the tourist will go for the famous clock, but square is full of nice buildings and restaurants, pub's, take away and more more more...

Beautiful. The historical old town square is truly stunning, full of history definitely to be visited. Me & my family loved it. It is very busy with tourists & the refreshments are a bit pricey other than that we have no other qualms.

Easter time has interesting Vendors and Activites. We went at a great time. Easter had music, vendors, activities for adults and children. It was a very festive feeling. Great restaurants and pubs around the square.

Must see in Prague. Old Town hall with astronomical clock, gothic church of Our Lady Tyn, st.Nicholas Church, Kinsky palace, Jan Hus memorial, Marian column, Christmas and Easter markets and many bars and restaurants. Don't miss the night atmosphere especially in winter when the roofs are covered with snow.

Substantially upgraded. The upgrade works are finished and this square looks wonderful. Very different and much needed work has been done to bring it back up to the standards of pre-soviet occupation.
Fairytale charm. Its staggering architecture will certainly impress you a lot! So will the vibe of history, peace, democracy & intelligence!
Nice one . If you get there by night you'll see it at a different light, so be site to do so, next to it there is a little garden you can have a very and enjoy the night
Very Busy in the middle of the day. An exciting place to walk thru and it is a excellent land mark. There are many restaurants and you can watch the tourist walk around.

Spectacular history. Going around the old town square of Prague is a walk in history - the art, the architecture - beautiful, classic. It's amazing how this city can be so beautiful yet modern. Classy yet homey. Must see!
great place. wonderful central spot to see everything. Just watch out for the Segways. Lots to see, many photo ops and lots of food choices. Also the most beautiful women in Europe, maybe the world.

A stroll in Prague's old town square. My husband and I were in Prague on a group tour and we took the opportunity to go to the old town square the night we got here. There were numerous people there but it wasn't standing room only, probably due to the rainy day that it had been. The stroll we took around the square was very nice. There were several restaurants and food huts lining the square. In additional to the monument in the square, there were several performance artists doing there thing. There were some shops also. From there, you can wander the streets for more shops, food and sights. A lovely evening.
Nice place to visit. Watch for thieves near atomic clock! At restaurant right next to it, they put one prices out to catch tourists and then charge you 3 times more.

ADORE ADORE ADORE. I went to Prague and I had no idea I will be so overwhelmed with the beauty of this amazing city!Old town is amazing and specially Namesty Republicy which is the Czech name of this square. You can easily access the walking street, a nice concert hall, several exchange places a lovely rooftop restaurant bar open from 11 to 11 called the T-anker and much more.

History in a square. There's a lot to see here - the astrological clock and the big fountain. Also a lot of restaurants full of tourists - you can find cheaper and more interesting places if you walk away from the square! But this place is a must see for tourists - a lot of street artists and street food also. Just beware of pickpockets and segways.

Town square. The Town square is an amazing place. Usually it is quite crowded and filled with tourists, but still gives you an impression that you've gone back a few centuries.Old style architecture all around,a cathedral, a tower and the famous astronomical clock stand out.

Great Experience . This is one of the must see places in Prague. I recommend going up the clock tower for fantastic views of the city. Mornings are less crowded. Late afternoon and early evening are very, very crowded. There are lots of places nearby serving good food for very reasonable prices.

Extremely rude restaurant staff. generally try and avoid the small restaurants at the Old Square. For some strange reason the restaurant waiters and owners are extremely rude and snappy. One even went to the extent of saying "this is avery expensive area.."Maybe they are unable to cope with their own ineptness and therefore take it out on the hapless customers.
a wow sensation. everywhere you look it's a wow sensation. Also go look at the Meridian, waarmee men vroeger de plaatselijke berekende

Great at christmas. Im sure its great in summer as well, because the beauty of the buildings and history and great vibe, but at christmas it is whimsical. The great big trees all light up at night, the stalls of vendors. It is beautiful with many shops, museums, eateries. The walk to the square will be dotted with stops at many shops and sites along the way. which is half the fun
Amazing place to visit at night. Vibrant place to visit day but especially at night. Lots of cafes, restaurants and bars in and around square. Nice just to sit and soak up the atmosphere.
Cobblestone streets. Must have good flat walking shoes to navigate streets and sidewalks and tram rails. You can revisit this area many times.

Love it! But be careful!. a lovely place to go to check out the vibe of Prague. You have a selection of restaurants (be wary it is a tourist trap and the prices will be more expensive and if you find their service to be rude you may find extra charges on your bill such as bread and condiments!) and the clock tower and other historical buildings. It is a great centre point to start and then make your way down the winding alleyways. Another tourist trap you will see a few meters down from the clock tower. You will find stalls where they are selling ham on the rotisserie. The seller decides how much ham you get and the price you see advertised is per weight so if the seller is feeling lucky you could end up with 1kg of ham at the expense of your bank account! Be very wary.

A must place to visit.. I found the location to be very convenient to other major attractions we visited. The old architecture surrounding this square is just amazing. The restaurant in this square seems to be pricey, but there are plenty of really good restaurants within walking distance. Plan enough time to visit the square if you plan to visit many places within the square. Our visit to the top of Astronomical clock itself took couple hours (1.5 hour of it was spent waiting in line to go up).The surrounding during Christmas time is just wonderful disregard you visited this square in the morning, afternoon or evening. There are may stalls selling food, drinks and Christmas decorations.We stayed in Old Town Square for three days overlooking huge Christmas tree with blue synchronized lights matching the Christmas songs played. If you wake up early enough to get to the square (before 7 am), you can enjoy the huge Christmas tree and its surrounding without the crowd. Then go to Charles Bridge and go across it while it still early in the morning and the bridge not having too many visitors.

Feels like you're in a fairy tale but pick another spot to eat!. Old Town Square is awesome - everyone you turn it feels like you're in a fairy tale - so much beauty all around. There are loads of people day and night so it feels very safe, just be aware as it's a target for pickpockets. While there is lots to see and do, pick another spot to eat - this is a tourist trap so the vendors and restaurants in the immediate vicinity offer mediocre food for inflated costs - much better options a few blocks down the road.
Lively. Lovely lively square, the House "At the Minute " Franz Kafka's childhhod home is definatley worth stopping at to see the wonderful black & white designs covering the facade.
People watching. Spent an afternoon people watching with a few beers. Had wild boar to eat for the first time in one of the quaint restaurants. Lovely time.

Amazing feeling. Day or night. This is how amazing old town square is. I have tons of pictures and i can only upload 10.. but believe me when i tell you that this is a trip that you will never forget.

A must!!!. When in Prague, come and visit the delights of the Old Town Square, from organised family events, wooden stalls selling food, beverage and souvenirs, what treats are in store for all of the family.

So Much Beauty Everywhere You Look. This is one of Prague's best. A big square in the heart of the Old City with a lot of street performers, beautiful buildings, churches and restaurants. This square has been the site of many historic and political events during its long history.On the north side of the square you have the lovely St. Nicholas Church on the left, and the Ministry of Commerce building on the right.On the east side there is the Kinsky Palace on the left, and the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn on the rightOn the south side there is a line of beautiful houses, each has its own colour and facade.On the west side you have the Astronomical Clock and Tower on the left, and a little park on the right. This park is located where the East Side Wing of the Old Town Hall stood before it was bombed by the Nazis in 1945.In the middle of the square you can see the Jan Hus MonumentDay or night, this square is a must when in Prague. Can get rather overcrowded during the day.
Lovely safe square . We really liked this square. nice restaurants with various different menus. Good during the day and evening though very busy

Most Beautiful City. In my opinion, Prague is the most beautiful city I have ever been to. Old Town Square is the perfect place to start a visit. I took a walking tour the first day and then went on my own after that.

Beautiful Historic Town. If you love to people watch you must spend time in a cafe here (and there are many)Beautiful building with wonderful architecture. This city is quite charming and very crowded. Don't miss the Astrological Clock which goes off every hour on the hour. Get there a few minutes early to save your spot - it gets crodwed.Wear comfortable shoes as the cobblestone streets and sidewalks are not easy to walk on.

Very touristy.... The area is gorgeous and filled with tons of tourists. Prague is filled with beautiful buildings and so much history...this area ok. I love Prague...all my reviews clearly indicate this. Old Town Square is mostly walking only with very little street access for cars. I needed transportation to get back to the Four Seasons from Old Town and I was financially accosted by a taxi driver. They got me at the airport, so once I got into Prague I used Uber. Please use Uber. Uber…is all credit card, you have a picture of the driver and you never have to worry about currency. I'm sure there are wonderful taxi drivers in Prague...I never found them. I over paid significantly on Taxi rides--no credit cards--cash only. Until you understand the Czech currency, using a Taxi is an expensive adventure. When we were dropped off from the airport to our hotel, I gave the driver his fair in US money. He looked like he won the lottery. When I got stuck in Old Town Square, the driver could see I was a single woman, frantic and stuck. He not willing to speak to me, then said no to all my questions regarding payment. I had to get cash from a random cash machine and it only gave me 500 Koruna— it was then, he agreed to drive me. I had been in Prague long enough to know he was taking advantage of me. He took me the longest way possible from Old Town Square to the Four Seasons. Finally I get to the hotel and he wanted some of the fair in Koruna and some in Dollars. I was running so late that I didn't even bother making change...I just gave him the 500 K. I was annoyed because I had given him a huge tip by their currency standards. I had no option but to pay his expensive fair. Be warned.
Amazing. We love The Old Town Square. Its the heart of the city of Prague. The lively square is lined with magnificent buildings in different architectural styles, from Gothic to Baroque.
Lovely. History, fountains, cobblestone streets, horse and buggy rides, cathedrals and European beauty. A lovely time walking and experiencing the sights and sounds.

Soak up the architecture and history. Another must go spot in a Prague visit... rather obvious. Take some time to really look at the buildings in the square and reflect on all that they have seen over the ages. A real gem of a square that was not damaged in WWII like so many other squares in Europe that had to be rebuilt. There are many restaurants and shops nearby... but take some time to get off the beaten track. As a solo female I never felt unsafe walking side streets and discovered some great little cafes.

What an amazing city!. Old Town Prague definitely delivered with its amazing character and architecture. Just keep an eye out of your surroundings especially when the area is over crowded. We will be back!

such a nice place!!!. This square has so many things to see!it's a very popular place to visit when you are in Prague.Everyday there are several things to see. every night there are artists doing cool stuff and you can sit at the many restaurants and other places to eat or have a drink.
Active square. Lovely square. full of activity, people mingling about. buildings around the square a stunning. many good restaurants' too

Pretty amazing. Old Town Square is something that must be visited when in Prague. The Square does get very busy and crowded.There are many little shops, as well as restaurants, art galleries, and just general sightseeing. While it was not my favorite part of Prague I'm definitely glad we made a day of it.

You can't miss this. Weather you are visiting alone or in a group you will definitely intentionally or unintentionally visit this place and be amazed by it, it's a "wow" factor of Prague and an amazing piece of their history.
Amazing rollicking time . Had a great summer time, enjoying, shopping, eating at various spots at the old town square. Lovely arcades, great energy
Not very interesting. there isnt much to see except some old buildings. next time, I would prefer to visit this place after 5 PM when it is little dark
Tourist Area. Lovely Bridge, lots of statue, so many things to see at the area, lovely picture I took, amazing view from the bridges
Magic touch of history. Come and enjoy this wonderful place! You will be feeling like in fairy tail! It is a magic touch of history!

Old Town Square . This square has the wow factor the streets are filled with thousands of tourists, there are so many things to do and see on and around the square. This is a place you must visit if you come to Prague.

The place where everything starts. The Old Town Square is the hub of everything and everyone gets there. There is lots of Czech culture in the historical buildings and food. Many performers entertain visitors all day and night

Day 2 . Started our day going to old town square using the underground which was very straight forward. Lots to see and do. Fantastic buildings with beautiful carvings. Visited the Manto Gallery which displayed beautiful pieces of bohemian art. The chocolate factory had so much chocolate to choose from. Wax museum was great too. Spent hours just exploring and then ate.
Stunning. Despite the fact I've been here many many times it's still a beautiful place to visit any time of year. A must see place in Prague.

Nice to hangout!. Folks, this is just a cool place to hang out and enjoy the atmosphere of Prague. Pretty much crowded during good weather. Lovely restaurants close by and almost the center point for major tourist sites to walk to.

Excellent atmosphere .... even in December !. Excellent and engaging atmosphere .... even in December ! guess Especially in December . But go appropriate dressed , Girls leave those heels at home ! you will either slip over on the cobblestones or ... fall over on the ice on your way back to your room !

Beautiful architecture, relaxed atmosphere. Lovely buildings, plenty of street performers and musicians. A good array if cafes and restaurants. A lovely place to take a seat, enjoy a drink and a bite to eat. Gets quite busy but doesn't feel 'crowded'

A wonderful view. Although there's not too much to do the square is a lovely mix of art and architecture, there are some wonderful sites, the church and the clock as well as many statues. The square is a great place to sit back and people watch too! It's certainly one of the places to go when wondering round Prague, especially if you're into taking pictures and architecture!

Great place to rest and people watch!. This is a huge square with so much to see at all angles.
Watch out out for segways though.
Find a seat and sit back a relax and take in the buildings, statues and people watch.
Beautiful on a summers day.
Buzzing. Prague in an acre. The beauty of Prague architecture is here. The buildings are wonderful and the atmosphere good.

Enchanting place. Be a part o Romantic time when we didn´t need cel fone. The Old Town Square transport you to the past. There isn´t sofisticate places, just warm streets, cafés and lovely people to meet.

Majestic. Just to sit in this square and watch the wonderful clock and people passing by was a real joy. The cobbled stones and of course beautiful sunshine were a real treat for an Irish couple. We also got a tour here from Jana Navratalova Who is always at the Czeck tourist shop at 11am and 2.30pm in the afternoon. She has an umbrella with tour with tips. Brillant to get a tour from a person from Prague
perfect pictures. you should visit it and take perfect picture scenes. Also many places to be visited (e.g. astronomical clock), restaurants, bars are located there.

A must place to visit. Old town square is full of life, people all around, lots of places to eat/drink, astronomical clock. Every building is marvellous . So much happening at this place that you will land up going here every day during your visit to Prague..
nice view of the astronomic clock. the square have a nice view of the astronomic clock, and other buildings around it, artist, music and a lot of coffee to spend some time

Fabulous Town Square . You have to visit the old town square while in Prague. Lots of places to eat and a great choice of shops. You have to watch the street performers as well with the hip music bands.
Go on the hour to see the famous clock. Lots of fun to be had in the Town Square of Prague. Entertainers, shops, restaurants and beautiful architecture everywhere. Go And enjoy!
To much of a crowd . Our tour guide made it clear that the real town square was fifteen feet below the present day town square. The astronomical clock was interesting.
Full of Life. It's a lively place to people watch, shop, rest, eat, or hire an antique limousine to take you on a grand tour.
Beautiful. just like the rest of the old town very beautiful,plenty seating areas close byto sit and listen to the buskers,prague food stalls,and horse and carts

A Great People Watching Place. Lots of activity in the square: buskers, horse-drawn carriage rides, a small market selling local produce and products and lots of people milling about till late at night. If you get there on the hour, you can see the Astronomical clock in action.

Brilliant . My Dad (60 this year) was raving about this place and telling me and my wife we HAD to visit it while in Prague. Apparently one of his favourite places he has been. With that in mind, I thought it might have been a bit boring for younger travellers but it was actually fantastic irrespective of age. It can be very busy but if you want to sit in a nearby bistro and have some food/drink (at a premium I hasten to add) while people watching, seeing the street performers and taking in the sights of the astronomical clock, National Gallery and Church etc. then this is for you. I enjoyed my time here and would say that you haven't been to Prague if you haven't been to Old Town!

A touristy hotspot, but a must see/do. This is the heart of it all, with so many things to explore and do in the winding streets and surrounding areas. Everything is aimed at tourists, including many vendors/guides, and prices reflect it, but a beautiful area with many nice restaurants, cafes, and of course the astronomical clock. Explore the square, but be sure to venture down the adjoining avenues and alleys.

Mesmerising. We were in Prague for 5 days and found ourselves in the Square everyday. It was just fantastic wandering around and watching all the different displays, shops, eateries and people having fun. Highly recommended.
Visit At Night. Great to see at night, bring your tripod and set the exposure to high. Try the Trdelniks, they are a must and just enjoy the atmosphere.

Astronomical Clock is here as well as lots of street performers. Busy spot for tourists, especially on the hour when the Astronomical clock does its thing. Live music, men pretending to be statues holding themselves very still and then scaring tourists, bubbles, beggars, all here. Food and shops nearby.

Watch the world go by. Beautiful setting to sit back and admire the wonderful buildings and watch the world go by. Gets very busy on the hour, everyone crowds in to watch the clock, which personally I found a little underwhelming. Prague is just full of fascinating buildings, we didn't see any run down buildings or areas.
Beautiful!!. Stunning place with plenty to see and do. So many places to eat and drink too. Very elegant buildings seeped in history! Xx
Niceee. Great place to stop and look around on the beutifull sights of the clock and buildings around. Even when crowded there is still enough place to move around
steeped in history. spent an hour just sitting, observing the horse drawn carriages, people milling around, inhaling the smell of the old prague ham being roasted. wonderful immersive experience
Very quaint. Nice main square and church in the middle of old Prague. Many restaurants and shops in and around the square

Must-see visit: Astronomic Clock Tower Hhorologe). It's a famous attraction of the Old Town Square to watch it, be an eye witness of walking Saint apostles within, showing their wooden statues in windows above, finished by a public applause and cheerful ovations.
Must see . Lively square with alot of shops and restaurants surrounding. The astronomical clock is so huge and beautiful. The square is always very crowded. Be aware of pick pockets.
Simply amazing. I loved old town sqaure atmosphere , it is always alive with street arts & small shops day and night , it is a must go when in prague :D

Walk back in history. Very old and traditional town square. Actually fairly large in area with a lot of side streets worth exploring. It is very touristy and prices for things are a little more than in the back streets but still actually not bad by some city standards. From this area most of the old town area is easily accessible on foot.
Main market square. Beautiful heart of Krakòw and a people magnet. Street musicians, colorful flower stalls, special events, markets and festivals. Breakdancing teens business people.
Town Square in Prague. Outdoor cafes, churches, shops, and sometimes free street entertainment in the old center of town. Must visit when in Prague.

A happening, fun, beautiful place. Beautiful, perfectly maintained buildings, street performers, sculpture, fine dining and a fantastic antique clock all in one place for you to enjoy. It is also a safe place for tourists to visit. Three are several designer retailers on the square and adjacent streets. You can even get a Thai massage within 1/2 block of the square.

cobbled square. Beautiful architecture in a beautiful cobbled square. I particularly liked the clock which is an atronomical clock which is three clocks in one and the only one in the world. It is surrounded by eating places and its such a magical place which I loved. It has lots of street performers and lots of life and culture.It has so many visitors and great fun as everyone chatting in various languages. I love the fact that its so individual.

Old town of the ages. This old town square makes it to the top of my list for Europe. You will need at a minimum...2 days to see all there is to see here. Find a jewelry shop and find a garnet or two to purchase.

Great place to lunch. The Old Town Square is busy, full of outdoor dining options from which to watch the variety of happenings in the square, take in the beautiful buildings and cathedral, and astrological clock.
Highly recommended. Highly recommended for a stroll, lots to see and do including street performers, street foods, artist, shops, restaurants, and of course Czech beer.

Lovely cobbled square with some fantastic architecture. . Very busy but great to people watch in one of the restaurant or bars dotted around the square. Prices are more expensive but at £1.50 a pint you can't complain! Try some of the street food from the pop ups. The roasted pork and chimneys are amazing!
Nice place to have coffee or eat something.. . Can't say more it's place where u can visit every day and enjoy the atmosphere and old building.. Bespoke place..

Breathtaking . A 2 week solo trip and old town square in Prague take my number one place as best first impression. Stepping into the square for the first time in the evening time was breathtaking, I found it stunning. Of course, there was a lot of tourists (like myself) but this wasn't an issue - there was a nice atmosphere and being surrounding by the stunning buildings really stuck out to me looking back on my trip. During the day it was equally as pretty.

Can't Miss!. If there is one place to not miss it's the old town square and the astronomical clock. You must come to this place at night to see the lights and the crowd, have some ice cream and enjoy one of the best public places on Earth!

Lovely spot to visit. A lovely little piece of Prague which is absolutely Worth visiting.However be aware that the square gets extremely busy, after about 10.30am the crowds in the square are prone to getting very large.Also be aware that buying anything, either food, tours, souvenirs, drinks etc in the old square is MUCH more expensive than purchasing the same items just a few streets away.The square has become rather over-tourist orientated but is definitely still worth a visit.
Have a coffee..... And watch the world go by. Well worth a visit. So much the better if the weather is good. Very atmospherice.
Historic plaza. So much going on here! Always something happening. We felt very safe visiting the Old Town Square. This place has such a refreshing cultural mix.

Busy place. On this square you can find many guys and girls offering to ride on a sigway. It si quite populare, however, I have just rented a MTB and drove through the city. It is cheaper and in my opinion more exciting. Be careful of traffic, were a helmet at all times.

A must see in Prague!. So much to see and especially during the Christmas markets--fantastic tree and loads of crafts and handmade articles to purchase, I personally bought a beautiful handcrafted leather purse at the market for my daughter AND you can bargain on price with some sellers. Great restaurants around the square also.

Old Town Square - full of life. I enjoy coming to Staromestke Namesti, it is vibrant, full of life and one meets people from all over the world. I love the look on peoples faces when they look up at Orloj, clapping their hands after the procession of the wooden figures, one sees the inner child which is in all of us. I love Prague. Küsnacht - Schweiz
Nice Old Town Square. Big Old Town square awaits you at the entrance to the Old Town with its fantastic buildings and nice houses and facades, cafes, restaurants, bars and attractions.
very cool to check out. Must see. Tons going on in August. I would watch out for pick picketers! They seemed to be all over the square.

Full of life. The square is big, with two churches (one gothic and one baroque), the Old town hall and tower and the Astronomical clock. There are also places with street food (Prague ham and trdlnik) and restaurants.

Hard to believe that there are so many old grand Buildings still standing. so much so see, this square is a delight on the senses, we were lucky enough to be in place when the square clock in the Tower struck one and the small windows opened to show the 12 figures , short walk to many shops and Restaurants

The starting point!. The Old Town Square is THE place to start your visit to Prague. It houses the Astronomical Clock, outdoor cafes, talented musicians and artists, the best street food, and interesting people from all over the world. The Square is within easy walking distance to the Jewish area, the Charles Bridge, churches and synagogues, and other popular sites. You will see architecture from medieval times - amazing!

day or night. very beautiful square for day or night time. many shops still open till 10 pm. with lots of restaurants and street food in the square. you will find some shows during the day. but it has the magic in the knight.

Buzzing with Life and History. This is certainly not a quiet spot. It is the very heart of Prague and is alive with tourists, tour operators and buskers. This is Prague's equivalent of Venice's St Mark's.Thankfully it is a big square so there is room for the crowds. They come to see the beautiful old painted buildings, the stunning cathedrals (take your pick, there's more than one), the monuments, the astronomical clock and the street entertainers. The place is brimming with life, but also with segway riders so take keep an eye out for them; they seem to career everywhere.
Lots of History. You'll come across the old town square as you explore the City. Lots of old architecture and buildings. Be sure to bring your camera as there are lots of photo opportunities.
Bit Crowded. A bit crowded but worth take a look. there are bars and cafe in the area, good place to spend a couple of hours

People Watching And Amazing Architecture. This is a must on any Prague visit. The outdoor cafes are perfect for people watching . They do charge quite a bit extra for outdoor seating which surprised us. We hired a private guide from the service located on the square and were very disappointed. There are churches and synagogues that are fascinating within easy walking distance.
Entertaining and educational. The old square has a lot of history around it. There are lots of snack food places together with restaurants and watering holes. Another great place to visit.

Vibrant place... One of the biggest square I have seen in Europe, lots of places to eat, drink and entertain. I guess this is the nucleus of all the activities and many free live entertainment available to enjoy.

Lively square with lots to see.. Beautiful both during the day and lit up at night. The square is another must see in Prague. Architecture is beautiful and there is always lots going on. Plenty of spots to sit and watch the world go by.

The Times Square of Prague. Visit Old Town Square for its historic buildings, and the Astronomical Clock, but with so many unique and beautiful neighborhoods in Prague, don't use the Square as the focal point of your trip. If you are looking for a vacation that includes over-crowded tourist areas (don't expect to find Prague natives here), rip-off exchange bureaus, over-priced restaurants, antique car rides in cars that aren't antique, then this is the place for you. Honestly I went there twice: for a stop at Starbucks because I was desperate for ice coffee, and because my walking tour originated there. Go a few blocks in any direction to find a more pleasant atmosphere.
A must to visit on your break. There is so much to see and do in the square. The buildings are amazing. If you get a chance, go to the top of the tower in the square. Amazing views.

The promo banter square. The best banter occurs in the square from every country. They try to sell you things first but are all pretty cool people once you get talking. The Clock Tower Bar Crawl guys are definitely the friendliest and will help everyone out

Visit early. I'm gonna give the same advice for the old town square as I did for Charles bridge... The earlier in the day you visit the better the experience will be. Mid to late afternoon will result in a pushing and shoving session with you running the risk of being hit by one of the hundreds of segway stag and hen parties that are flying around.
Busker heaven. Wonderful experience of the astrological clock and the buskers while having a quiet drink. This square is a wonderful experience especially for the architecture that surrounds you.

Plenty to See and Do. This place is packed in on a sunny summer day with tourists from all over the world. Beautiful buildings everywhere and statues that highlight the artistic talents that built this city.
Great open space. This is the heart of the Old Town Very busy place with Museums and eateries all around the square as well as being to the Astronomical clock
Busy but beautiful place. I really enjoyed Old Town Square as it was always busy and upbeat. There are lots of restaurants and bars in the area and it is a nice place to chill.

Such a lively place, full of happy people. During the entire day and night there are a lot of people here. I did get here early one day (7:30am) and there was 3 wedding couples that got there wedding pictures taken.. few people at this point and you have the entire square for yourself.Lot of things to see around this square.
Stunning square in prague. A must see. A truly stunning square in prague. Not a bad angle to look at this square from.Bars and restaurants on the surrounding square sides.A must see when in prague.

Beautiful but don't eat!. The old town square in Prague is a sight to behold and all of us tourists know it, however I wouldn't recommend eating around this area as it is full of tourist traps and you don't get to enjoy a more ´authentic´ Prague, venture out a little more and you´ll be delighted. Tip: Restaurants with a ´Pilsner´ or green sign outside are where the good food and beer is at!

Really nice but be careful . It's a beautiful square with many nice spots to take photos. Be really careful there because there can be a lot of pickpockets. Also, avoid eating or drinking at places directly around the square because they're all mostly just overpriced tourist traps.

A must see during the day and at night . Amazing place that shows the true wonder of Prague. The architecture of the surrounding buildings and churches are a sight to marvel. Go early before 10am to take nice pictures without crowds. After that it gets very busy, being the heart of the city. At night it's a great place to wonder and take in the warm lights of the buildings lit up and people watch. You'll visit this place every day your in Prague.

Wonderful and Entertaining Square. A very attractive square in the heart of Prague, this area is a focal point for old-style buildings, cathedrals, historic statues and parks, cobbled streets and much more. Must-see attractions here include the Prague astronomical clock, the remains of the old town hall, statue of Jan Hus, church of Our Lady before Tyn and St. Nicholas Church. There is plenty of great entertainment acts to be seen here throughout the day as well as a great number of cafes, bars and restaurants in the square and surrounding streets. Great atmosphere at night as well with large crowds viewing the nighttime attractions. The only reservations I would have about the square are the close shaves with an over-abundance of reckless Segway drivers during the day and the very noisy stag and hen parties which throng the square in the night. Also, if walking around the the square (and the city centre as a whole) at night, you will almost definitely be approached by dodgy characters standing by their own asking if "you are okay". Pretty obvious to everyone what they selling, and not even subtle about it either. An unfortunate side to night-time Prague which does bring down the square
Old town Square.... A lot of restaurants, noisy all day, and I miss the Christmas market in Old Town Square when I visited Prague in 2008.
Great atmosphere. We stayed in a hotel near Old Town Square so it was great to be able to go there after dinner for a drink and to watch the street entertainment!
Very lively. This is a very lively places with lots of restaurants and lots of people and stands and food trucks. Great place to walk around but cam get pretty crowded

Apparently there's a clock there.. With only 24 hrs in Prague and no idea what was there, we noted a few landmarks on a tourist map online and went for a walk. We got the impression there was some sort of clock worth seeing. Not knowing what we were looking for, we walked some (beautiful) circles and almost actually missed it! The square itself is huge, there are many tourists but it's so open it didn't feel crowded, and it's all very clean and friendly. There were street performers and magical giant bubbles. Then we found the clock, just off the square. Everywhere else Prague felt quiet and spacious with wide streets and not a stag do in sight on a Sunday afternoon. Apparently every tourist in Prague was looking at the clock. Every time we walked past it there were what looked like several thousand people with selfie sticks waiting to see a skeleton dance on the hour. The clock itself is stunning and bizarre, I've never seen anything like it before.

Love the buildings. There was live music being performed by all the schools/colleges/uni's at the time which was great! Free music, food trucks everywhere and wonderful buildings and architecture to see. Busy with tourists also.

Key location. There is so much going on in the Old Town Square -- music, performers, shopping and food. Everything you can need is right here, you just have walk the edges of the square and absorb the sights and sounds.

Great Beautiful and cultured place - Very Busy!. The old town Square can be compared to the business and liveliness of Leicester Square in London. There is always something going on here whether an individual entertaining, an event, or the millions of tours that happen here with nationalities from all over the world. It is a great place to visit but the places to eat and drink around here are obviously slightly more pricey.

Delightful!. I loved going to Old Town Square. The lively atmosphere, food vendors, cafes, people watching, shops, museums within easy walking distance. It's a must see in Prague. The public transportation in Prague is inexpensive. I got a 24 hr ticket from the hotel gift shop that I could use for the metro, tram or subway for $2.20. A bargain for easy access to all the city sites.
While away the days. Great place to sit and people watch. Lots of people but a really nice atmosphere night and day. Plenty of places to sit and have a drink and not too expensive.
Amazing. The architect on the buildings is amazing nice to walk around leisurely to see plenty of places to eat and drink too with shops dotted around gets busy for the clock every hour
Wonderful people watching. When in Prague you must visit the Old Town Square. It is touristy yes, but it is fun and interesting..
European Atmosphere. Such a beautiful place with so many beautiful things to see. The crowds are big but the sights are free. The lights come on in the evening and it makes it even more lovely.

Old Town Square Prague. Beautiful, vibrant square with lots of street entertainment and steeped in history. Only drawback is that the restaurants in the square are very expensive and the food is not so good. Much cheaper and better restaurants in the back streets.

Get there early!. The Old Town Square is truly unavoidable if you are walking around Prague. And it is exquisitely beautiful, like so much of Prague. Unfortunately, in the summer months, it is overrun by tourists. It felt like St. Mark's Square in Venice, right after the cruise ships dump their passengers off. The best strategy is to arrive early in the morning. At 8 or 8:30, the square is much more manageable. The kids are still sleeping off last night's revelries, and the tour groups are not out yet.Beware of pickpockets!!!

Nice place to spend the evening. Typical small european town center. Perfect place to just sit outside in a nice weather enjoying public entertainers. Also be aware that some of the waiters in some of restaurants in the area are not very nice.
Great square, great buildings. It is a lovely place. You cannot miss it if you go to Prague. Great architecture, restaurants, cafes and bars and loads of tourists - it is really crowded.
Nice Area. Beautifull area, with nice architect for people who love taking photos. many stores are located there plus cafeterias and restaurants! nice place to walk around!

One to see . Definitely will recommend this square but be careful.Be very very careful where to eat.Going into Caffè italia can be an experince you won't forget.Avoid this horrible place full of horrible waiters .Lots and lots of restaurants around.

Amazing!. I'm not an architect expert/hobbyist at all, but the generations of buildings around this area is amazing. One good thing to note it that during WWII, the people sure suffered but the historical buildings remain intact. A rarity in Europe.

nice feel to it. nice just to wonder around , pleanty shops / restruants and history
best bit , no beggers or street sellers to hassle you
Old Town Prague, takes you back in time. Free, WC close by, astronomical clock, museums and tours are all available from the square. It can be very crowded. Go early or late.
Very busy with beautiful buildings. Well worth the visit to see the beautiful buildings. Very busy all the time. But a must do in Prague
Shopping. If u wanna enjoy shopping do it on city center ..alot of mall's and shop's for any kind of type just super

People watching at its best. This square is pretty big and has several old churches and the town hall located on it. A nice statue is there and needs some explanation by a guide, guidebook or local to understand. From here you can get almost anywhere! There are benches to sit on and lots of cafes for refreshing yourself! Definitely worth several visits!

Magnificent buildings and great atmosphere . I really like the old square. Prague is steeped in history and the square is an example of the splendid buildings of yesteryear. I stood in the middle and looked all the way round, bathed in the magnitude of the buildings that have defeated demolition ad you see in so many cities to make way for modern builds. Prague was a great place for a 2 night stay and I could have found more things to do fir a 3rd or 4th night.
Amazing. It takes fifteen minutes to sit and rest, observe everything around you, relax and enjoy, then visit market stalls, eat something in any

Impressive square.... ... but way too crowded. It could become tiring. Buildings are nice, everything is nice, except is crowded all day long, no matter the hour. There are hoards of groups roaming any direction, it is difficult to enjoy the square's beauty.

Another beautiful Town Square. Like most ancient cities of Europe, the Town Square is the heart of the city. Thus, Prague's town square was bustling with life during the afternoon, evening, even unto late in the night.It has several beautiful buildings: churches, town hall with an astronomical clock tower, in addition to the space, restaurants and bars, a 24 hour money exchange, etc.It's a great place to hang out.

Always something going on here.. This should be one of your first destinations in Prague. Surrounded by cafes/restaurants where you can people watch. Lots of street entertainers of all types but if your lucky, there will be a music festival or food market on. In May we were treated to a superb ethnic minorities music festival where the audience danced along with the varied acts. In August it was a jazz festival. There may also be an event hidden behind where the horse and carts are parked. Saw one brilliant festival, on a small stage, here, where the very talented entertainers were all children. The only downside for me is the constant flow of segway riders offering you the chance of a tour. No thanks, not required. the public transport here is first class.
Heart of Prague. Charming square with restaurants, shops. Walking distance to main attractions , real heart of the city. The astronomical clock close by.

It's a must.. The highlight of a visit to Prague. The Old Town Square has everything. With the Clock Tower and the Tyn Church standing as sentinels, the interior is filled with wonder. Traditional food, music, art, street performers. The place to be seen in Prague.

Great atmosphere.. We 1st visited at night in darkness and it was amazing to see everywhere all lit up. Loads of people just sitting around enjoying food and drink. Plenty of street entertainment too. Stay away from the restuarants near here as way too overpriced and the food quality leaves a lot to be desired. Walk further out to get a great deal and much better food

Amazing place in the wonderful city of Prague.. This is a real must see if you are on vacation in Prague. You can walk around in this part of the city for days and find new and gorgeous houses and streets, and interesting places all the time
Iconic site. Have seen this in many movies, it was far better in live. Come early and you can see how nice this is. Afternoon it's packed and mode difficult to see those nice buildings.
Very pretty. The square is very pretty and offers gorgeous views. It feels like the center of everything. Despite the crowds this is a must visit attraction.

1 day in Prague. Beautiful city with a great night life and tons of shops in Old Town to explore. A very walkable city and seemed to be very safe. Walk out of the tourist area a few blocks and find restaurants and bars with cheap fares. Definitely a city to explore more of in the future.

Beautiful part of city with lots of restaurants. With many attractions packed in close proximity, we had a great time visiting the Old Town square. There are many restaurants in this area with good food.
The heart of the Prague. I can say that it's the heart of the Prague. The place, where you can spend hours and hours. Miraculous place with a number of caffes and restaurants.

Beautiful Architecture, but avoid the shops and restaurants. This is beautiful part of Prague and is very popular with tourists, because of this the shops and restaurants are far more expensive then those just a few streets away so they are best avoided.

Just lovely! Not to be missed!. This is a wonderful area of Old Town. You truly feel as if you have stepped back in time. The architecture is amazing! Cafes area little more expensive there but are a part of the experience of taking in Prague. It is nice in the evening as well where younger Praguers tend to gather and sit down and hang out in the Square. Be sure to go to the top of the astronomical clock tower for a breathtaking panoramic view of the city and the Old Town Square.
Surrounded by Bars And restuarants. Centre of the Old Town, a good place to start. Plenty of roads and alleys off it to explore. Does get busy.

lovely place. a spacious place where you can enjoy looking at the quaint architecture of Prague. the day i visited it, there were some street shows. most of people visit this place to see the astronomical horloge. ( old clock)

Lovely atmosphere but very busy. Picturesque, historical area with plenty of restaurants, bars and sights to see- a particular interest with tourists is the astronomical clock which is extremely busy at the turn of the hour! Good, overall (:

Busy central square with lots going on. Steeped in history.. Quite a lot of tourists here. Very pleasant architecture and surroundings. Quite an active center of Prague. Restaurants in the area are very tourist orientated.
Beautfiul town square. A beautiful town square (albeit crowded). Nice statues and architecture all around with beautiful roads leading to everywhere!

THE must see in Prague. Beautiful place, animated 24 hrs a day. There is often a band to make the visit pleasant. Do not miss the visit of the tower, with its beautiful view of the place and of the town

Very pleasant. Went for a walk through this area today. Thoroughly enjoyed strolling around, with many different street performers and attractions to see. Wouldn't miss a walk in this area during a visit to Prague.

So interesting.. The square is a hive of activity, from bands to live statues and much more. There are so many restaurants and bars, with various cuisines. Food and drink were great value too. You can take a ride in an old classic car, horse and cart or segway tour from here. Many, many little streets leading off of the square to wander through.
Gorgeous, spacious, gracious--but crowded!. Go early and savor the marvelous, spacious square--but after 10 or 11 am... it's a crowd season in summer.
Amazing. What's not to like? Old Town Square IS old Europe. It is vibrant, beautiful and historic. You will get addicted to the Tredlnik.

Beautifu buildings, huge crowds.. It was nice to walk around in the old town square. The buildings and the history is amazing. It was very crowded when I visited mainly through tour groups and the fact that it was the weekend. Perhaps later in the day would be better.

Classic Euro Square . A must see - the historical and storybook old square of Europe. Amazing architecture and statues. The Astronomical clock is right there as well.
Gotta visit - then wander down the side streets to get another great taste of Old Prague.
Cool Place. Old Town Square is a place with lots n lots of hustle n bustle. Tourist enjoy a lot over there. A must visit place when you visit Prague.

The Hottest Spot in the Old City.. Old Town provides more than enough historical culture, as well as the tourist centrality. A great place to view amazing arches and astronomical clocks while enjoying goulash. A fun time and a must see; Prague 1 is the spot to be.

Very nice . You will find yourself here on more than one occasion as it draws you in. Saint Nicholas church seems to have a midday mass call and plays the most ear piercing noise. At first we didn't know what was going on until I asked one of the waiters and he told me that's what it was. Needless to say we avoided been around there at midday!! It's a lovely area and great for people watching. Most if not all the tours seem to start in and around here and watch for the segways whizzing around the square trying to get their customers!!

Lovely square. Lots of lovely buildings in this square. On the hour it fills up with tourists who gather to see the figures come out of the clock as it chimes. Crowded, but that's what gives it the atmosphere.
beuatiful. one of the nicest cities to see, so much beauty in the buildings ,churches , watch your step, cobble stone streets can be grueling

Heart of the Old Town. We couldn't really decided between four and five stars. We've been to a lot of European town squares. This one is large, packed with tourists, but it has something of interest in every direction. It is certainly not to be missed.

What fun!!!. So lively and fun!!!! So much eye candy that you don't know which direction to look. Very very crowded and you will find every tour here. Lots of restaurants surrounding square. The famous Parizka street right there too.
Avoid buying. Nice place to spend time but avoid using expensive terraces and restaurants, take couple of hundreds meter out from the main square and you will get better service with better price

Great . Great square with lots of different things on offer. From food to segways. Cheap to expensive they have it all.
The reason for the down point is you get hassled quite a lot by people on the square. There are people trying to sell a lot of things.

Can't miss this in Prague. It's the main place in Old Prague to visit. Gorgeous buildings surround the square. For eating you'll pay more here than side streets. Be forewarned that it's very crowded with tourists.

Lovely square . The town square is very vibrant and entertaining and good for people watching there's so much going on you just don't know where to start its worth standing under the clock when it reaches the hour to see the little figures going around and the street entertainers are so good .
Beautiful city!. This city is just so beautiful and has so much character! We were so taken at the beauty of the buildings. And there are loads of tourists around.

Very touristic. If in Prague, teh Old Town square is pretty much all tourists. Everything is within walking distance. Food, drinks, snacks, pubs, bars, restaurants, and many hotels. You can olso ride the trams, buses or trains that pass through the area. Very beautiful place to walk around in. People playing music everywhere and very safe.

Always a delight. Not my favorite square in Europe, and perhaps not even in the top ten, but it's still enjoyable to spend some time here, taking in the surrounding buildings and engaging in some serious people watching.

Like something out of a fairytale. Beautiful and stunning. Old Town really looks like it came directly out of a fairytale book. Go early in the morning before the crowds and you will have the entire square to yourself. Fabulous photo opportunities everywhere. A lot of restaurants and food venders as well as people attempting to sell you souvenirs and trinkets. It will not take very long to see all Old Town Square has to offer, but it is a must-visit place if going to Prague.

Wonderful but too much chaos. This is the place to cafe sit and if you miss this experience,you are making a real Prague experience! However too much chaos is allowed...buskers of all variety and the press of hawkers plying bar crawls,Segways etc. we were constantly being approached in the most annoying way!The restaurants and cafes surrounding the square can be very crowded...as expected.

Picturesque square with beautiful architecture. The old town square is simply charming, super beautiful. Perfect place to go and sit and admire its beauty, very picturesque. There are also monuments, people doing tricks and blowing bubbles, horse rides, and restaurants all around. It can get very crowded at times but it is still worth a visit.
nice place to walk. nice palace to walk and do some shopping buying some souvenirs and even know the history part of czech
Lovely. I enjoyed the rain in square and the food / cafe surrounding the square. It is a busy square especially to see the clock
Amazing architecture. The city is clean, the architecture is so beautiful and the prices are affordable and certainly cheaper than Germany and France.

Historical Center of Old Town. The square is the center of the tourism -- with several historic sites. However, it is also where you will find the most hucksters -- be careful of the food vendors (they will definitely try to cheat you). Also, there are many people trying to sell you sightseeing tours, concert tickets, etc. Enjoy the sites, but be very careful.

Really lovely square. You can people watch for hours in the Square. We had a beer and sat infront of the monument. Loved every minute of the hour we sat. The buildings are amazing , brilliant colours, always something new to look at. You have to visit the square and sit and relax for an hour.

Electrifying armosphere. We were in the old town in European summer and few countries had long weekend. Of course Prague was full of tourists but the atmosphere was amazing. It is THE happening place of Prague.

A great afternoon!. We walked around the whole morning and had the chance to relax in the afternoon in the square. There were a lot of people, but it wasn't too crowded to just relax. The quaintness of Prague is breathtaking!

Fantastic!!. The old town square is fab, there is something for everyone! Whether you want to have a coffee in a cafe people watching the several tourists, or see the lovely sights such as the astronomical clock! You can also pay to go up the clock to see the views around!! There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and the food there is very nice... Over all a great experience, just be patient with the amount of tourists walking about.

So busy, but you need to see it - especially for all the architecture. This square is incredibly busy - with tourists everywhere you turn, people offering segway tours and horses pulling carriages. Just don't get your map or camera out here, or you'll get pounced on! Other than that it's an amazing vast square and you shouldn't miss it if you are in Prague. It's also the location of the famous astronomical clock - you'll be able to find that by the crowds waiting underneath it on the hour.
