A must see. If you go to Prague you must visit this place, It's beautiful and full of history. If you don't go to this place you haven't been actually in Prague.

Beautiful, not to miss at all.. Just to stand in the middle of the square and look in any direction you will be impressed by the beauty of all the buildings and the scenery. The horse carts, the Tyn Church, the Geological Clock, the square itself and so many other buildings are each in their own way a diamond of the square. Spent time wondering around, sitting down and watch all the tourists and local enjoying the venue or just passing by, bye a bite of any sort and just move to the one side and sit on a bench and watch and maybe feed the birds. The only negative might be the people drinking in the public and the beggars (mostly half drunk and smoking), but just ignore them and enjoy the moment.
Beautifull central square . Nice old square wich is surrounded by beautifull old buildings. Adjacent to the atomic clock and the Tynchurch.

Walking Around the Old Town Square is a MUST DO. It is very nice to walk around the Old Town Square and be surrounded by the old style buildings made many many years ago. There are also places to sit to enjoy your surroundings.

It's big and provides access to all of Prague. We did not get to explore the square as thoroughly as we would have liked due to time constraints, but we plan to return to the city just to see the square.

Great atmosphere and cold beer . Checked out old town square around 4pm on a Friday and found that there was the Prague jazz festival on meaning the square was buzzing and some great tunes were being played . Lots of yummy food around and an all round great atmosphere . Defiantly check this place out if in Prague - metro is close to this square meaning it's easily accessible .
Must see, cant miss. Can't really miss Old Town if you go to the center at all.... it is beautiful, it is right next to the clock tower
Full of life. The Old Town Square is really beautiful and was always full of life when I visited it. Plenty of places to drink coffee and watch people enjoying the summer.

Good entertainment . Visited this weekend . The square was rammed with people including large groups of child pilgrims dancing and singing and generally have a great time . There was loads of street entertainers to watch . Only issue was the huge number of Segway hirers trying to get business

A stunning place with amazing architecture.. Worth going up the tower for spectacular views. There is a lift to the top. Don't bother queuing in the ticket office to the right (and they don't take credit cards there in any case) - go straight up to floor three in the Information Centre to the left of the clock tower. You can use a credit card up there and that's the entrance to the tower too.
Great for people watching. A great spot to sit down with a trdlink (a cone-shaped donut) and people-watch after a day of trekking about town!

Fun, fun, fun........ If you venture to Prague, you have to come here! The shear beauty and energy from this environment is invigorating! Just go to hang out! Lots of different people from so many different cultures.

Amazing. I've never been to a town square like it. There were hundreds, thousands, of people milling about. Groups had brought instruments and were playing, others were singing along. Restaraunts had tables & chairs spilling out on to the street, mobile vans were selling some weird doughnut twizzle thing filled with icecream. And all this? Yep, on a Tuesday morning at half 10. This square is a sight to behold and if you're in Prague you simply can't miss it.

Lively atmosphere. During the day time it is crowded by the rush of all guided tour walks and tourists and at night people enjoy sitting and drinking here, the biker gang did a lot of rounds around it in the evening

Great . Charles Bridge offers fantastic views up onto castle district as well as both sides if the river. Generally crowded for this reason making it difficult to take pictures. Best to visit early in the morning. Sunset offers spectacular views but large crowds as well.

A gem of a town square . As town squares go, this one in Prague is one of the best I have seen absolutely crowded with great buildings and there are always things going on a n the square. Always crowded and busy but as it is large you never feel claustrophobic. Worth to spend a few hours doing things and seeing things

Great!. It's like walking into a fairytale.The buildings are well-restored and bright, there's always music and hot food, tonnes of people from all over the world are milling about to see the sights, and the atmosphere is magical. You can watch the Astronomical Clock while you eat an overpriced breakfast, walk 2 minutes to any number of amazing destinations, rent a segway for a tour, and more. What a great city.
Busy. Plenty of places to eat and drink with prices to match the location. Crowded and full of singing children when we visited.
Nice place. The square is very wide .. very nice and filled with people .. many attractive places to set and drink the good local beer
Full of atmospher. A wery crowdet, beautifull town square. surroundet whit historie at soul. The guide took us back in time.
Square.... Pretty, surrounded by lovely bars and restaurants. Some street entertsiners at times, but its a really just a square...?

A gem. A great place to wander, but as ever in city centres hold on to your valuables. Also watch out for the guys who roam around on segways looking for clients, as they are not looking out for pedestrians except as potential riders. And a lot of those who hired the things were not confident and needed to be avoided too as they had little control over the machines.

Filled with people... lots of tourists. There seems to be multiple groups singing or gathering or listening to tour guides all day every day. And, there is much more to see other than the clock or the John Hus monument. Take your time, grab a beer or cappuccino and sit... watch humanity and think of all the stories each one has.

Its a square in Europe. Its a square in Europe. I cannot say that its unique but has great history if you have a tour guide to explain it. Not really going to jump out at you, but there are some GREAT restaurants off the square.

Stunning from every angle.. A great place to visit with friends,family and older children. The place is alive with music,food and quirky people. You can have a meal or a drink and just watch the world go by, beautiful in the evening.
Amazing. Just people traffic many acts take place which wer really enjoyable surrounded by restraunts and bars and shops... one of my favorite citys Night or day hot or cold Youll love it

The Center of Prague. This square is centrally located in Prague and near the Charles Bridge as well. There are lots of crowds here so keep an eye on your valuables. Go up into the clock tower and see the views, but do yourself a favor and take the elevators up and down.

Definitely should go here . At first when we arrived in Prague, we were slightly unsure what to do. A friend suggested this place so we thought we would pop along. We liked it so much we went again the next night. The square had a few stools surrounding it with good priced beer and cider, and there was always someone performing on the square. It was such a lovely area to just sit and relax in the sun. Highly recommend

Beautiful historic buildings. Old Town Square with its old buildings is very difficult to miss. It is populated by a possee of segways and their keepers. Restaurants/cafes in this location are very pricey. Among the cafes are one or two interesting shops to find. A good place to visit at all times of the day.

Stunning, simply stunning!. Totally love this place, it is so vibrant. The sheer number of tour groups can be a bit overwhelming but push on through and stare in wonder at the wonderful buildings. The cafes dotted around the square are great but step a few streets back for a quitter and more peaceful experience. Great to sit in the square for a beer though.

Nice open central space to start from.. If you have never been to Prague I would start here. It is one of the bet palces to start and take a walk from and keep as one of your bearings. it also has the austronomical clock on the church thaths right on the square and in the same building a place where you can go up to the top of the church and have a great view of Prague.

Crowded but amazing. The Old Town Square is one of the marvels of Prague. You find yourself crossing it often during your visit, and you have to stop and stare each time you see it from a different angle. The sheer size and scale of it demand attention even without the spires of the Old Town Hall and churches, the facades of the many old buildings, the cobbles and the general life going on. Go to see the astronomical clock do its thing and stay for a coffee to watch the world go by.

Surrounded by beautiful buildings!. I loved all the great architecture, musicians, bubble-wand and street performers, sidewalk cafes and the people-watching of so many cultures and languages pass by. I think Old Town was the most architecturally beautiful area I've been to - everywhere you look there is something to look at and it's all real, not some restored version like in Köln (Cologne).

Lots of fun. From buskers blowing bubble, to Klezmer groups and yummy food there is always excitement at Old Town Square. Enjoy the variety of architecture, from Gothic to Renaissance and the safety of the setting.

Fabulous old town square. Definitely worth going to the old square....it's great!! We were tracking down the horoscope clock and it was really worthwhile. There's lots of activities in the square and a throng of people are either in the square ir eating in tbe many restaurants nearby. Do yourself a favor and go!!
Such character. Stunning architecture mixed with the atmosphere of the bustling crowds and smells of delicious food from the street traders make this an experience of a lifetime.
Enlightening!. You can stay here for hours meandering around the shops, eating, strolling & just people watching. Great central meeting point & surrounded by so much history!

WOW! My Favourite place in Prague!. It just makes you breathless this square (in particular if you get in from Týnská), with its buildings, the the tower of the Old Town Hall (you must climb to the top).

Amazing. It is absolutely, one of the most beautiful squares in Europe.The churches and buildings around it are amazing.The Astronomical Clock is one of the wonderful things you can find hereIt is a wonderful place to sit in one of the lovely cafés that are around and just enjoy the place, or climb the Clock Tower and have the most beautiful view

Old town square - Prague. We visited the square last time we were in Prague. It was busier than usual but the attraction remained. The Old Clock is as fascinating as ever and the view looking over the old buildings to the ornate spires of the cathedral were still most impressive. The outdoor cafes served great coffee and the shopping was also good. We loved it.

Tourist spot with lots of souvenir shops and restaurants.. Crowded with tourists waiting to see the clock tower. Many shops selling the same souvenirs. Restaurants where you could sit outside and people watch.

An Architectural Delight. I still marvel at the style of the very ornate and beautiful buildings and structures. The square is filled with cafes, restaurants, shops and of course, crowds. The astronomical clock is a main feature; our guide explained the intricate details that the clock represents and the functions it performs. This a "go to" place. Lots of crowds, but clearly a must see.
Beautiful. Beautiful romantic square, with many nice cafes and restaurants. In hot days there are water sprinklers :)
Lots to do and see. We had a great time walking around Old Town. Lots of beautiful shops, historical buildings, and great music.
Beautiful square. Awesome, with some great shopping stores and restaurants around the square. Beautiful for taking pictures

Old & beautiful. Must walk all around the square, sit at a cafe and take in the ambience of a beautiful country. We did it in the evening and the square was so full of life! An amazing visit to a great country!
The square that never dies. This square is the center of the center of Prague city. nice Italian & local restaurants around the square and you can enjoy shopping and local market souvenirs everywhere
holiday. very busy square with plenty of place to eat and drink and people watch. The famous clock is situated in the square

Must see place in Old Town of Prague. Spacious place full old buildings constructed in different architecture styles and centuries. See Prague ORLOJ with rotating sculptures and musical clock - playing at every full Hour. Go to Parizska street with most exclusive shops (Dior, Burberry,...). Visit some of goods restaurants with local or international cuisine. The Old Town Square is especially beautiful during Christmas period. You can enjoy the market with local food and souvenirs and see the annual Xmas tree nicely decorated.

Crazy people staring at a clock. Don't stare at the clock, crowds of tourists gather in the square in front of the astronomical clock to watch the hour change. Take my word for it, don't bother. Every time we passed through here we were pestered by segway riding vultures who wanted us to take their tours. Don't fall for that either. Plenty of weird and wonderful street performers to entertain you and/or scare you in equal measures.Great place to chill out after a long day exploring old town. Plenty of restaurants to choose from, we enjoyed one of the many offering traditional Czech food. Beware, the prices on the menu advertised outside the restaurant were much lower than the actual prices we had to pay.Many beautiful buildings here and you should not pass up the opportunity to climb up the old town hall tower, which offers views of the old town that you can't get from anywhere else.

Central.. The Old Town Square is a large cobbled square surrounded by interesting old buildings with a monument in the centre. It is used for all Prague's activities, parades etc. The square is the starting point for the "free" walking tours, old vintage car and horse drawn carriage tours. A good place to start your own walking tour taking in Charles bridge, Wenceslas square and a host of other interesting places along the way. The square gets pact with tourists as the day goes on and beware of cafe prices, its cheaper just to go round the corner.

Before 10 AM!. Very crowded, go in the morning, you can feel its character much better at that time!
The clock however does not working on full level, go back to watch it in the evening!

Perfect combination of history and entretainment. One of the main attractions of Prague, the Old town square provides its visitors the very best of history and also an excellent place to hang out. For taking pictures I would recommend to go early in the morning. During the day the square is pretty busy. Every hour people gather together to see the Orloj (astronomical clock), which is a masterpiece!

Vintage .... . Fabulous all arnd ... very happening loads of resturants arnd shopping ... n jus sit in d middle n enjoi medieval tym ... they have vintage horse cart which stamp the feel of old tyms ... beautiful conserved ...
Just sit and take in the square for 5 mins!. A really nice square don't forget to watch the clock on the tower change every hour! So much much to see here
Lovely square to hang out - people watch - awesome. Visit the clock tower. Walk through all the great shops. Get to the square - fantastic spot to hang out with significant other or friends
Visit early in the morning. The square is extremely crowded during the peak of the day. I'd suggest early in the mornings are the best time.

The Astronomical Clock is a real piece of history. Everyone visiting Prague must visit the Old Town Square. Forget the shopping paradise of Wenceslas Square and see a bit of history. The astronomical clock is a real must. Visit it on the hour to see it at its best.

Tourists a' plenty. The main square is the meeting place for TONS of tours and is naturally packed with lots of tourists. The restaurants are crazy overpriced so definitely look at menus first. Not a bad place for a beer and people watching on a nice day. There is a rumor that segways won't be allowed as of August 1st so take that as good or bad. There are old fashioned cars and horse carriages offering tours from here as well. Great starting point for walking on your own as well!!

Crowded but nice. Here you will find many restaurants and bars, however, you will pay tourist prices. Just a block back from there it is much better value. This is where you will pick up the free walking tours which are excellent and where you will see the famous clock among other tourist attractions. Prague is so easy to walk around and this is a nice place to stop, have a drink and watch the world go by. Prague roads are cobbled, so be careful when it is raining as they are very slippy!
Good Place to meet. Must visit location which is surrounded by a number of restaurants and historic places. The famous clock is located there. Most of the free city walks start from here.

So pretty!. A trip to Prague would not be complete without a visit to the old town square. The square itself is very busy and there is a lot to do and see. Lots of restaurants with the view of the astronomical clock. Would definitely recommend!

Great place to watch the world go by.. Enjoyed a drink or two in the White Horse and enjoyed relaxing and taking in the atmosphere.
Lovely place.

Essential place to visit Prague. The square is huge so even with the crowds it didn't feel packed. We started at the astronomical clock and wandered all around to see the different buildings. When it started raining we visited an exhibition of art by Dali, Mucha & Warhol which was a great way to spend a couple of hours until the sun came out. One downside of the square is that it's Segway central, but I read that they will ban these from the old town soon which is a great decision!
Favorite spot. Magical at night!!! Like the magic kingdom, but not Disney!! The Astronomical Clock is a must see. Every hour on the hour for 15 seconds. Get off the square for less touristy shops.

Christmas destination . We spent Christmas in Prague and it was an absolutely wonderful place for Christmas spirit, food, atmosphere and activities. If you could pick one city in the world to visit for Christmas Prague would be it! Enjoy the street food and hot drinks!
Central location to old part of Prague. Most everywhere we went, included going through Old Town Square. It was quite crowded, even in May. Perhaps because AC/DC was doing a concert.

Very Eclectic and Bustling Area. The rich history of Old Town, the amazing mix of Gothic and other architecture, street performers, food carts, segway tours, etc. make this a place you don't want to miss.

The old heart of the city!!. You shouldn't miss this square as it was the the heart of old prague. From there you'll have easy and quick access to most of the most important landmarks of the city :)Keep in mind, however, that it will be constantly crowded!! Lots of street artists there thou.

Beautiful, Peaceful and .....Beautiful!. The square has a perfect pic waiting from every angle. The Clock is here and many restaurants and live performers. You can see my video of Prague on you tube at " quick trips and tips".

Fabulous at Christmas. I visited Prague during the Christmas period, and the whole place was transformed into a wonderland. Large christmas trees, Christmas stalls and food everywhere, live Christmas concerts. It was really stunning, and was great way to spend the evenings whilst we visited. Also, some great areas to grab some beer as well.

Awesome. We went to the famous Old Town Square four times.You can walk through hours.Amazing view with wonderful buildings,many restaurants and shops all around in terms of Churches & Astronomical Clock.

Transported back in time!. Standing in the middle of the square could be a life changing experience: 1) the architecture from the centuries is all around you-- from the 1300s to present day 2) you could be struck dead by the aggressive segway tour guides peddling the experience.

sooo crowded. The tenements surrounding the place are actually charming, but to their fans I propose to delve further into the narrow streets of the city. There will be a little less tourists and you'll feel the atmosphere more. Delicacies served at the stands may be interesting, but they are also quite expensive - better to go a bit further and try them in not at an inflated price.

Lovely. Old Town Square is full of charm. Street vendors sell great food including scrummy Todo - a local pastry type creation that can be filled with a myriad of different things! Men making bubbles with lengths of string abound and certainly keep the kids occupied for a few minutes! If you're away to Prague then head over this way - it beats Wenceslas Square by a country mile!

GREAT HISTORIC CENTER OF CITY. This is one of the best old town squares we have seen anywhere in our numerous travels throughout Europe and this is one of the best old town squares we have seen (much better than Wenceslas Square) and it is the center piece of Prague. The buildings that surround this square are 600-700 years old and are dominated by the Old Town Hall Tower (great view over the city), the Astronomical Clock (a major tourist photo opportunity), Church of Our Lady Before Tyn and St Nicholas Church. There are also large numbers of restaurants and shops that encircle the square. While we were there, Prague was having a music festival so we were also able to view and listen to the folk music and dancing from our room at the Grand Hotel Praha which was directly across from the Astronomical Clock and with a clear view of the stage and parade area. The parade consisted of over a hundred costumed musicians and dancers from all over the Czech Republic, surrounding countries, Mexico (a mariachi band) and even a large contingent representing Vietnam. This square is also where you can get a "free" 3 hour walking tour of the city (you pay what you feel the tour was worth). I highly recommend that when visiting Prague, you stay in or around the Old Town Square.

Magical. As soon as we arrived to Prague, we went to the famous Old Town Square. It's a true charm to go. The architecture is breathtaking and reminds you of Disney. The cafès, the restaurants!! Everything is absolutely amazing and makes you feel like you're in a fairytale. It's truly wonderful. You wouldn't believe a place like this exists.
Nice Square. This is a very spectacular square in Prague, you can walk here through hours... Wonderful buildings, fairytale towers, particular clock-tower and medieval athmosphere...

A place to feel Prague Skin deep. This square is a great place to walk or to seat for hours, either during the day or all over the night, to see and feel the pure sprit of Prague. Lots of places to drink, to eat, to shop, to play, to listen, with afordable prices. Not only you can listen to people playing in the public outdoor area of this plaza, but also you'd have veraiety of choices to listen to profferional classic music concerts normally held in numerous cherchus in every conrner around. There are always some activities for young children to play and evacuate their youth energy.This is not only a simple square or plazza but it is one of the major places for social interactions and learn.Whenever you'd have an extra time, just hang out arround this place in every part of 24 hours a day.

The heart of the city!!!. Every tourist has to pass by the main old town square to see the sights of PRG... It's an amazing melting pot of the old & the new with alleyways of coffee cafe's & restaurants plus History all around in terms of Churches & Astronomical Clock.

A Must-see But Crowded!. Everyone said I'd love Prague before I left for the trip. Prague was very well preserved and beautiful. However, it was a bit too touristy and crowded, especially the Old Town Square. You can go up the Old Town Hall and see the entire city center. The astronomical clock also plays every hour.

Beautiful View. Old Town Square in Prague is the ultimate place to be in Prague. You can sit at one of the many sidewalk cafes, listen to beautiful music being played by a street performer, watch street performers spray bubbles in the air to entertain the children for tips, or just simply people watch. Being in Old Town Square in Prague made me feel like I was truly in Europe. Take a moment to look around and view the beautiful architecture.
Busy, alive and humming. A central meeting place for alot of tours. Often has horse and carriage rides, buskers etc so interesting place to watch the world go by,

Unmissable!. Prague's old town square offers hustle and bustle during the day, with an abundance of cafes to sit and watch the world go by- rather pricy for this privilege, but worth doing for the experience. By night, imaginative lighting transforms the square into a fairy tale location.

Ancient downtown . The old town square is a crowded place packed with tourists You will find a lot of local performances going on the the open area of the square The Astronomical clock is around The State maestro is there tooMany souvenir shops Ice cream stalls And restaurants

A great place to have Fun. We walked from Museum station and reached here. Lots of writers, painters, artist all around. Lots of nice restaurant on both sides. In the center are the gardens and flowers. My daughter started feeding pigeons but was told not to by public. There were street entertainment and just had fun.Worth the experience. We enjoyed Italian food at a nice restaurant, have fun

Lively Happenings. This vast square can get quite crowded during peak times, however, arriving early or later it is less so. You could miss some great entertainment, though, so weigh your options. Lots of impromptu bands, dancers and combinations of both seem to have an unspoken rule. Be good, loud and bold in your musical selections. It is all a great time. Without the Segways, the law just changed, it will be much safer as well. Pay attention to your surroundings, we were cautioned re: pickpockets. We did not have any negative encounters.

So busy, but fun and active. If you haven't already booked segway tour you will be bombarded by hundreds of offers (full disclosure you should do one - you see a lot) but the square is alive and active with people and street performers and food venders. We had fun!

See during day and at sunset. The Old Town Square is beautiful, with a clock tower, church and lots of other buildings, restaurants, cafes, etc. Pretty commercial, but must see nonetheless. BEWARE: the vendors selling fresh off-the-spit ham will rip you off. They sell by weight, put way too much food on the plate, and if you don't have Kroners give you a horrible exchange rate on Euros. We paid 28 euros for about 6 euros worth of food.

Rain or shine, this is the place to be!. Everything seems to be within walking distance of Old Town Square so you're always strolling through. Take time to enjoy a meal, a drink, or a dessert while people watching in the square. There are vendors selling good quality souvenirs nearby in little huts. Old Town Square is not to be missed!

Take a stroll!. Beautiful Old Town Square, filled with restaurants and shops and tourist-tee places... You cant miss the place, its filled with lots of people. We love the buildings and it was a beautiful day for a stroll.

so many people. Apart from every man and his dog being there it was very ice place . The buildings are stunning and one takes a lot of photos. Every one is trying to take you on a tour by foot or Segway, bus car and horse. Enjoy
Good to see, but very crowded. I am glad to have seen this, but it was way too crowded and touristy for my tastes. Make a stop here, but only on your way through to better parts of the town!

Lively and beautiful experience!. The square is definitely worth spending at least half a day as it has so many facets to it. Numerous artists displaying tricks, segway tours, line-ups of restaurants...not to forget the astronomical clock. Its a really cool place to just sit and observe people and soak in the whole ambiance.

A Must See in Prague. This is one of the larger town squares we have seen in Europe and it is filled with beautiful buildings of various architectural syles. The top of the Tower offers panoramic views of Prague. There are many good restaurants in the square, but the main attraction is the astronomical clock on the Old Town Hall. This ancient marvel puts on an amazing display of movement and sounds every hour. As we stood there mesmerized, our guide told us to beware of pickpockets. None in our group had any problem, however. Personally, I use a small leather card carrier that I got from a cruise with one credit card, a copy of my passport and some local currency. I then use a large safety pin to attach it to the inside of a front pocket. In 6 European trips through many countries and dozens of towns notorious for pickpockets, I have not been pickpocketed.....so far!

Must visit. Must visit place if you are in Praguevery crowded during summers flooded with touristslots of sellers everywhereRestaurant around old town are reasonably pricedwalk to Charles bridge from old town during the day

Beautiful square. Went during the German markets at Easter and it was sensational. All the shops, including the big designer ones go out of their way to decorate for Easter. Never seen a more decorated city at Easter.

Wonderful old square. One of the main reasons for travelling to Prague would be to spend a lot of time in this beautiful old square. Plenty of tourists in the square day and night which adds to the atmosphere of the square
Old Town Prague. The Old Town Square in Prague is well worth seeing, albeit absolutely heaving with tourists so be careful......

Beautiful, expensive and crowded. Part of the standard tour of Prague, the square is large and has many attractive buildings and expensive restaurants. However, it also has crowds and pickpockets!There are better town squares in other European cities but it is still worth a visit.The medieval astronomical clock is located on the Old Town Hall. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still in operation. Visit when the hour is striking and see the display then.

A can't miss spot on a visit to Prague. The Old Town Square is at the heart of Prague. It has fantastic architecture and historic attractions. The Archeological Clock is a draw for the tourists. Be sure to go up into the Tower for great views of Prague. We were at the Old Town Square a half a dozen times during our three day weekend in Prague. It is a must see destination.

Old Town Square Prague. one of the most beautiful main squares in Europe.
Baroque,Gothic and rococo architecture styles with Astronomical Clock made it unique in the world.
From main tower on the square,above the Clock there is great view and panorama of Prague.

Lots to see. We ended our walking tour in the Old Town Square. there are lots of restaurants and the Astronomical Clock. It was a rainy day and there were still thousands of people in the square. We did not have any problems with theft, but I imagine that this is a place that one should take care of pickpockets.
The best of prague. Go during the day, during the night, anytime...and make sure you have a guide because this place is full of hidden details. Lovely!

A great starting or ending point. The square is nice, but in tourist season it is very busy and hard to enjoy. You'll likely pass through it a few times during your stay and it is likely the same busyness each time.
Still a must see part of Prague.

Very nice !. Quite similar to the town squares in the historic city center of most European cities. Very busy and the segways are annoying and should be done away with. Many beautiful buildings in different architectural styles. Chilled vibe if you don't let yourself get overwhelmed by the segways and hordes of tourists.
Beautiful architecture and history.... But the prices are pretty steap if you're on a budget. Though lots pf people were sitting around in groups enjoying the sun it was a cosy place.
It's a big square.. Constantly rammed to bursting with tourists. The astronomical clock is underwhelming and the bars and restaurants are pricey.

Busy but not over crowded.. I went with my friends for a stag party in Prague, this place is where people rest before going to the next bar/club. you'll find a lot of people there sitting and enjoying an amazing scenery including historical buildings and nice bars and restaurants. definitely one of my favorite places in prague

All about the clock. The town square has lots of historical symbols and a tour guide is helpful (either person or a written guide). Covered with tourists day and night. buildings are magnificent and the mix of architecture is remarkable. The astronomical clock is fun - not as much activity as clocks in Germany, but has fun statues and commentary built into the clock. Get a guide/info and watch death call the hour.

very charming. one of the best city centers which I have ever been. to good to be true!! you simply enjoy the sightseeing while grabbing their famous desert (the rolled type of bread with either chocolate or other flavors). full and packed of tourists which adds up to its beauty. I highly recommend taking the horse ride at night
The place to hang out. This is where all the action is. Large crowds for all the activities. Many colorful building to take pictures of, if you are into historical architecture.

A must- see location. Old Town Square is the centre of the city, with lots of monuments and historic buildings. Cafes and restaurants. There is a state-of-the art stationer´s on one of the entrances to the square, with fine paper notebooks, cards, etc. The restaurants around the square are expensive, but on a Saturday in july, there was a take away food car selling very nice grilled sausages and beer. Very convenient for a quick meal before joining one of the free walking tours of the city .
Historic Beautiful Spot to Watch the World Go Bye. People watching, building that tower above with colors, spires and history beaming. Day or night, a must do when in Prague.
Amazing. Spent an evening mesmerised in this beautiful city, horse pulled carriage ride, dinner and drinks, absolutely amazing!

Busy square. It's the most tourism square in Prague thus you would expect a lot of people at this place! Beautiful culture and interesting boutiques along the street, but watch out for pickpockets. The Clock Tower perform every hour and worth to see :)
Beautiful Town center. The old town square is a beautiful place to visit, but please note the clock is a bit over rated. Many people are waiting to view a short performance!
Must do.. Very busy area, but easy to visit, one of the nicest area in Prague, can not be missed. plenty of restaurants and places to visit and shop.

wonderful public space of great architectural and atmospheric charm. The heart of old Prague, this is 10 minutes from Charles Bridge, and is a large public area featuring some good restaurants, as well as several top cultural and historic sights. Impossible to visit Prague and miss this!!!

Beautiful Square.. Don't miss going up into the Old Town tower. The view is worth it. The Town Square itself is very nice, and usually has a lot going on. Get there early if you want to watch the clock tower as it strikes the hour. Can get a bit crowded.
The history. you will be in the middle of the history, take a look and feel it, close your eyes to see how this place was during the last age

Very quaint and Historical.. No trip to Prague would be complete without at least one visit to the Old town square. We entered from the Powder Tower end where gunpowder was once stored and wandered past all sorts of shops and stores selling everything from ice cream to designer goods. There are often street entertainers in the square and some are really worth stopping to watch.From the square you can see many items of historical interest including the art gallery, the astronomical clock, the town hall and numerous other buildings of note. Highly recommended at any time of day for an interesting stroll.

A hub of history. The Old Town Square is the hub and heart of the Old Town in Prague. It is a great historical square, very crowded and lively most of the time, but full of the charm and the spirit of the city. Make sure you go up the tower of the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, it is definitely worth the 360 degrees view over the city and the panoramic view towards the Prague Castle.
Heart of the old town. The buzzing old town square is a favourite of any visitor to Prague and it's home to the astronomical clock and many walking tours begin from this location.

Crazy wonderful part New York part Amsterdam part Las Vegas. Very crowded but safe and fun. Lots of people but if you can get past the people it is amazing city, super nice people. Prices are low except that to see inside any building you have to pay. Get a bit tired of paying to see church's but the Prague Castle is the most amazing. Not destroyed during WWII
Lot of history. Lot of story of Prague and how it came into being ! Surrounded by many important places take some 3/4 hours time for this place alone!

Marvelous!. How can you go to Prague without visiting the Old Town Square! There are lots to see. During my visit, it was raining cats and dogs and some restaurants even needed to close its outside sidewalk. However, it was beautiful as always and it won't affect my mood. After the rain, we could see the beautiful reflection from the rain on the ground which was unexpected.
great historical square. enjoy the big historical square and see the main monuments: the statue, the Týnský cathedral, the old townhouse and others

Amazing place and crowd. We spent a whole afternoon there. It was amazing and soaked in the atmosphere and the crowd. Number of churches around the square. The hustle bustle was fun. Just off the square were the street venders. The sausages and beer were amazing. Some guys with snakes were showing them around and scaring th girls. Good place to visit in Prague
Many street performers!. Our grandchildren were entertained by street performers like a gold mime, clown in a baby carriage, and people making giant bubbles.

Busy with Tourists!. It's probably better the snap your photos and move on to some of the back streets behind this square.There are lots more interesting places to see! Segway seemed to be everywhere and not at all people friendly. The building are magnificent if you a brave enough to look up.
Great Place. There is music, food and places for a drink. Lots of history and beautiful architecture. A great place to spend time
Lovely. Amazing square although very crowded lovely place to have a coffee and people watch .an amazing mix of nationalities walking about taking in all the sights

Fascination history - watch out for Segways. Visiting this historic square is well worth any frustration that you might experience by being surrounded by hundreds of people. During the day you could spend hours just going into all of the museums, churches, and other historic buildings and monuments. If this isn't your interest there are lots of benches to sit and watch and watch people mill about, and even more spots available at the pubs and restaurants that abound. Entertainers are everywhere and Old Town Square shouldn't be missed at night.

Absolutely the best part of town.... The Catholic Church, Protestant church, Astronomical clock, fabulous sculpture right in the center, cobbled streets, romantic horse carts, gourmet food stalls, lovely faces and a soothing weather..That's Old town square for you..and a lot more than that.If the old town is the heart of Prague, old Town square is definitely the heartbeat. Cannot afford NOT to be here.

Must see in Prague. This beautiful square combines 600 years of history in one romantic location, usually packed with many tourists. You cannot miss this, but be prepared to face the crowds. Don't miss the incredible art in the Cathedral of Our Lady Before Tyn (no photography and limited hours), the astronomical clock, and the nearby jewish quarter

Magestic, alive at night, beautiful buildings. We so enjoyed this square both during the day and at night. Food stalls, musicians, clock which operates on the hour, cathedral whose tower you can climb. Great atmosphere.

Crowded but super cool. From the astrological clock to the buildings, it is a must see. When I was there they had a jazz festival with music, food and drinks. Lots of people but you should miss it. It's like going to Washington DC and not visiting the national mall. You just have to do it.
Old Town Square never gets old. Busy place but worth a see, so much to grab and enjoy! Dont forget your camera and an umbrella in case it rains!
great square. one of the best and prettiest i have ever seen. loved it. great people watching, some good restaurants, especially the downstairs and insides that most people dont see

Just Historical & impressive monuments. Our free guided walking tour by Givi from Discover Prague Tours, took us around including the astronomical clock ( beware of pick pockets when its time for the show - specially when you photograph). The square itself is jaw dropping & you can spend an hour easily gaping :) Lot of history woven around it.

A nice and lovely Town Square!. Everyone who visited Prague will surely come by this place for a walking tour, for shopping, for food or just to immerse in this lively and vibrancy city. There are so much to do here and the only problem one will face is whether he/she has sufficient time to spend here or not.After walking across the Charles Bridge (leading from the new town to here), you will find rows of shophouses in many small lanes (that look similar) selling all kinds of things catering to the needs of everyone. Besides souvenir shops, money-changers, common things sold here include fashion, shoes, bags, jewelry, cosmetics etc, besides cafes, restaurants, pubs and fast food chains. You will have a hard time deciding what to eat/drink, what to buy etc as so many options to choose from.Standing right in the center was the well-known Astronomical Clock, the iconic landmark here. Further in, you will see museums, theatres, open-air market (Havel's Market), makeshift stalls, boutiques etc. And there were also street performers doing magic or bubbling acts, singing etc. Very lively and full of activities here! (please refer to my earlier reviews of these places here too)Well, the place was indeed touristy and visitors here were more from foreign lands than locals. But it may still be a good place to get to know and understand the local culture, lifestyle and people.Word of Caution! Like any other cities in the world that attracted large crowds of visitors, do pay close attention of your personal belongings as pickpockets like to operate in these places to pry for targets especially foreigners.

A lively place to visit. By mid morning, old town square is dotted with tourist but you can not pass up the opportunity to see it. Bands play and artist perform, you can grab a bit to eat and do a little shopping.
Astro. Clock. Be there on the hour to observe astronomical clock. Surrounded by many bistros with outdoor seating. Watch for pickpockets -- especially near the clock.
Beautiful part of old town. Old Town Square is a must see for most visitors to Prague. Wide open square, centrally located and surrounded by beautiful pastel coloured buildings and towers. Beautiful!
Impressive . This is one of the gems in Prague. Walk the bending and narrow streets and end up at this square. You'll love it.Ps. Have fun with the street artist in the square.
quintessential spot in Old Town. You need to go to Old Town Square -- to see the clock, the tourists, observe it all. Don't spend your money anywhere on the square -- just wander and watch the sites.

Beautiful square, gets very busy though. The Old Town Square with the Astronomic clock is really beautiful. All cobbled, with picturesque buildings and a great atmosphere, especially at night. The area is very busy day and night with mostly tourists so obviously keep your wits about you. Also, just a heads up that there are a lot of people trying to get you to ride segways which can be annoying though a firm no and they will go away. It's a great square with plenty of restaurants and bars (prices will be a bit higher as it's a main tourist spot though) and a must to visit at night too.

Must go there, experience the people/sights/food. I expected along the lines of Amsterdam; this is much bigger and busier, much more to see and do. It is mainly people watching(except the clock) and eating. So many market stalls, with everything. Or sit/drink and watch.

Center of Prague. If you love people - most of all tourists - and old architecture Old Town Square is paradise for you. The mood is mixture of very old history (buildings) and today (shops and people). I think it´s not a good place to eat (expensive) but take a beer in some restaurant and enjoy pure Prague feeling! I once had a dinner OTS-restaurant and it was pure robbery :)

Busy busy busy. Great old buildings, lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. They have market stalls selling everything from fruit to souvenirs and paintings. When we went there was a jazz concert in the evening. You can ride around in a horse drawn carriage or sit out and enjoy a drink. It can get very crowded in the summer.
Beautiful historic square. At the heart of the old town pedestrian area and always packed with tourists. Great to walk around at night with beautiful lighting and lots of bars and clubs around.

Beautiful architecture and lively place. This is a historic Square, surrounded by beautiful architecture of different styles, and lively with people. There is a medieval Astronomical Clock, and every hour 12 apostles pass from one window to another for a few seconds. People gather in huge numbers to watch this. There is also St. Nicholas Church and the Church of Our Lady before Tyn. It's a charming experience to be in the Square watching people,and then walking along the many cobbled side streets to the river. Do try the ice creams sold in the side streets.

Beautiful area, just be aware it's touristy. As with any popular tourist destination, there were plenty of tourist-aimed shops and pricier meals due to proximity to a tourist attraction. But overall, this was a beautiful area to walk around and wander the side streets coming off of it. There was the Astronomical Clock which was really cool to see, as well as just some beautiful buildings.
Wonderful Place. A got to do place. Full of interesting places at every turn. Close to Jewish quarter and where most walking tours start. So many beautiful buildings

Beautiful but very busy. The Old Town Square is so picturesque. It was very sunny the day we were there & it was very hot. There is a shaded area in the square with benches where you can eat ice-cream & have a drink. There are lots of tours leaving from the square e.g. Horse drawn carriages. You need a good map as there are so many streets leading off from the square that you can easily get lost! As we did many times!
nice area. a very nice place to relax and watch or listen to the artists. The young pianoplayer was very amazing
Beautiful architecture !. This is a central part of Prague which is very interesting from an architectural point of view. Not enough good restaurants around in my opinion.
A MUST. Definitely pick your hotel close to the square. We stayed at the Buddha Bar Hotel and couldn't have picked a better place and ,location.

Tourist Haven!. We visited the old town area of Prague on a few occasions during our visit. Truly a beautiful area with some amazing architecture and always something going on. The atmosphere is brilliant and usually some kind of live music going on and hundreds of people milling around day and night. I don't really understand the fascination with it being so busy all the time when there are many equally lovely areas in the city that are so quiet but at least I could enjoy them without being pushed and shoved and getting in the way of peoples photos. There are many lovely streets to explore off from the main square. A Prague visit wouldn't be complete without a visit to Old Town Square.

A nice long walk across the bridge. This bridge, strictly for pedestrians, is a great place to see some incredibly awesome architecture and hidden views of Prague. We even saw a Czech wedding on a boat that was passing under the bridge. The streets are lined with shops and vendors.
Too many people on a small but nice square. Only option for having a good time there is to go early. Like to every tourist hotspot in Prague if you wanna enjoy your trip.
Great. Most happening area in Praque so many activities Pubs restaurants,enjoy every moment spent there.Horse carts,cycle rikshaws,vintage cars
One can visualize days of yore.. We walked down here on our own and also on a tour, many hordes milling about, it might get better in the autumn.

Tons of photo opps. There's just so much to see here! In some cities the town square is it and all around it is "standard buildings." But not here. You can walk in a variety of directions and come across even more gorgeous buildings. There's the historic clock, a great Dali museum, and all sorts of other things to see and photograph here. Or grab a table at a cafe and people watch. Wear a hat if it's sunny! The stone everywhere can make it a bit brutal.

Beautiful and historic area. Not much needs to be said about this. If you're in Prague then obviously you'll be going here, and you'll see how awesome it is. I recommend paying the few dollars to walk up to the top of the church tower.

This is the place to begin your exploration of Prague's Old Town. This large square is full of action including street performers, musicians, vendors grilling meat, and tourists--lots of tourists. Walk to the Astronomical clock and watch a performance. Duck into Starbucks for coffee and to use the restroom. Then, begin to explore more of delightful Prague's Old Town

Characteristic square with lots to do. Very characteristic with lots of quality restaurants and cafés. We visited in February close to the time of Chinese new year and saw a show of people dressed up in traditional Chinese costumes and a dragon. One negative thing was that we were beckoned over to have a photo taken with a man dressed as a statue who then demanded money for each photo my boyfriend took off me with him. The town is quite central and you can easily walk to other attractions from there, such as Charles bridge and Prague castle. The clock tower is beautiful, and you can really appreciate the Gothic theme of this city from here

Imagining life a hundred years ago.... ...that is the way we chose to appreciate the square. The square is VERY busy and the solar clock is a huge draw. The clock chimes on the hour and the crowds start queuing up a good 15 minutes early. Should you have to travel through the area between the clock and restaurants you will find it impossible until the chime is done and people disburse. The views of the church and surrounding architecture are very interesting. Watch out for the Segway drivers they are everywhere in the square. We have never experienced so many Segways in one city and the nucleus of them seems to be the square. Not all are experienced drivers so be careful when traversing the square...
Nice stop along the journey. Must walk around in the Square and soak in the atmosphere. Check out the cute street markets that are in and around the square in nearby streets.

A must visit when in Prague.. The Old Town Square is central to one of the oldest parts of Prague. An easy place to convene, surrounded by beautiful churches and historical landmarks. It's a popular place day or night, yet has a relaxing vibe.

Good for tourists . Good place to visit. .Lots to see and do. Totally geared towards tourism. Prices are high relative to rest of city. Everything about Prague seems designed to get as much money from you as possible. As a discerning person I do not like being used in this way.

This is a must visit.. This is one of the places you must visit, be there on the houre to see the clock function. Watch out for the segways, these things should be banned, they are dangerous to the people walking.

Like any other square in Europe.. Best to walk through with a brief stop to see the church and clock. Mostly young people will sit in the sqaure as the only seating is at the tourist focused Czech restaurants around the outside.

Amazing Place. The astronomical clock and the Church of the Old Tyn are there, it is an excellent place to take pictures at daylight and at night. Cafes in the area are very expensive and the food is not that great. Beware.

Stunning. Wow.. Maybe I'm more easily impressed than others, since this is my first European trip...
But wow. The sights, the smells, ...breathtaking.
If it's your first time here, make sure to get a Trdelnik!

Nice place to hang out, eat, and shop. Just a nice place to hang out. We saw the best bubble blower ever who attracted a herd of children. It was delightful. The Mucha Museum is there as are some good eateries. This was only a couple of blocks from our hotel, so very convenient too.

Prague is amazing but beware currency exchange. Old town square is amazing , magic place. There are small hidden streets. Don't spare your legs , walk and discover. Don't expect good restaurants in the center- they are all touristic. And I would like to warn all travelers be careful while changing your money. 90/: of currency exchange spots charge up to 30/: - this is definitely a fraud. Search for no commission places and ask anytime you want to change money about commission.
The old town hall clock, on the hour is a must see.. Lovely area full of places to eat brilliant atmosphere in the evening / night. It is friendly loads of people but that just adds to the charm.

totaly amazing. the old town square is fab the culture every where you looked I especially love to people watch and the street entertainers were fab bubbles for kids, music, choirs, people being statues just amazing and free

Nice Stroll. Another one of those sights you can see for free in Prague by just walking around and soaking up the atmosphere. Take your time and get lost; there is so much to see! A great place to check out when the Christmas or Easter markets are on.
Lots to See. A must see while in Prague. Lots of shops and sites to see. Also found an English style pub to watch football matches with a knowledgeable crowd.

Nice to walk around. The square offers many street performers and restaurants. It was very crowded when we were there in the early evening in early to mid July but everyone is relaxed and well behaved. There are also plenty of police patrolling the area. It is very civilised and very pretty to see all of the architecture.

Landmark!. Atmospheric and quite crowded, but in a relaxing way!
Loved to walk around and admire the architecture!
Just gorgeous!. Beautiful place to hang out and people watch, lovely architecture, and of course everyone's favorite the astronomical clock - join the crowd every hour on the hour!
Festive. Loved this place. I went around easter , so there were bands of children playing. With the backdrop of the church of our lady before tyn and all the easter markets, it was lovely

Worth the visit. It is worth taking a walk around the cobblestone streets to the square. So much is going on and it is close to the astronomical clock. Take your time to sit and have a coffee or beer (the beer is great in Prague) to observe the atmosphere and the many amazing colourful facades.
Very nice. One of Prague's landmarks. Very nice specially in the evening. Crowded with tourists but really worth walking by!

Bustling with activities. This is like the gathering spot for tourists to Prague. Many interesting and beautiful buildings are around it - the one which was most fascinating was the old town hall building with the astronomical clock.Many street artists perform here - mostly musicians, both old and young, who are extremely talented. You can hire segways, go on a horse carriage or a vintage car, or just sit and enjoy traditional Czech snacks - of which I enjoyed the Trdelnik - the most.
Best!. This is the most happening place.. great place to enjoy nightlife.. The square is pretty big and a kinda center of the city..
Always a sight for sore eyes . Beautiful and, except for all the overpriced tourist traps, a must for every trip to Prague. Vibrant and historical. Like a storybook.
World meets Here. Beats all caste, creed and religion; its such a positive place to explore and loads of cusine to taste
Great place. Nice restaurant, lots of shops and lots of stuff to see. You can also hang around there during the night to have dinner or go out for drinks.
Beautiful. Is is one of the dry european squares you could find in any european city. This one is very big, full of history. The buildings facing the square are beautiful
Definitely a place you must visit in Prague. Lots of cafes and shops to see and a good place to wander around. Lots of activity. Check out the astronomical clock while you're there.

weekend with friends. The old Town Square is a lovely place to visit. Be there at midday and you will see the special chime of the clock. There are plenty of restaurants and bars to relax in and watch the world go by.
Historical architecture everywhere. Historical architecture everywhere, I cant wait to return. The Astronomical Clock is a must see while there

Astounding tourist attraction. . Old Town Square ( Staromestske Namesti ) is a stunning area of Prague that I love to visit on any holiday in this most gorgeous of cities. The architecture here is awesome with so many beautiful buildings and the Astronomical Clock has to be one of the most photographed buildings in Prague.This really is a major tourist destination and as such their is a multitude of pubs ,bars and restaurants catering for all tastes and prices but be warned the price in some of these establishment's will seriously damage your wallet. As this is Pragues number one attraction and is a beacon for the tourists be aware that pickpockets are in operation so take sensible precautions but that said Prague is a super safe city.A great area and well worth checking out.

love it. The square is just beautiful, full of interesting buildings and lively restaurants, bars, and pubs. The astronomical clock is a must-see (every hour on the hour) and the shops are good for having a browse. Perfect place to spend a relaxing afternoon!
Charming. This is where everyone gathers either to check out the astronomical clock or to just chill with friends. There are many good restaurants on site. I would recommend an evening visit.

Fun. This is a fun place to hang around in..lots of people , history , shops and cafes. There are also street entertainers and of course opportunities to start a trip or tour of the lovely city here via foot or carriage.
Old Town charm. although we thought that we would be bothered by noisy evening crowds, our place was soundproof enough to allow rest when needed. Great place to visit

Great for architecture buffs. This is a great place to hang out and admire the architecture and the best way to explore the area is on foot. Enjoy strolling and sitting at any of the bars / cafes etc.
If you are in Prague you will visit the Old town square. You can spent 2 hours here to see the many faces and culture of what is now the Czech Republic. Very many stories and history in this Square,
Great spot. Like many old town squares, a great spot to get a sense of the culture and people who live in Prague and come to visit.
Lots going on. Much busier at weekends than during the week (which could be a bonus) with loads to see and do (and eat and drink). Beautiful.
Worth Visiting. The old town square is huge, very busy, but worth the time. The buildings are excellent and the shopping is also excellent. Avoid tourist trap shops.

Start here. Or finish here. Just don't miss here!. A breathtaking beautiful centre to the Old Town in Prague. Forget bars, clubs, and all the reasons that many come to this city for. Start your walk around the Old Town Square. Whether you are enjoying the architecture, recovering from an outstanding hen party, exploring the history, pursuing your stag, or simply meandering (and please, do look up whilst meandering!) then this beautiful part of Bohemia will not let you down!

Something for everyone. First off, this is most certainly a massive tourist trap. But who cares? It has something for everyone, from street performers to horses, beer to scenic photos, this place is a must for everyone visiting. It has a different vibe depending on the day and time, so try to visit more than once.

Crowded But Vibrant. Standing in Old Town Square is a great experience due to the various architectural styles of the surrounding buildings and churches that have stood for centuries, the street performers, cafes, and the "clock show" (which is overrated). Although very crowded, the Square should be on any traveler's "must experience" list.
One of the top attractions in Prague. Nice place for a coffee or just for a short walk. Amazing buildings with the famous world clock on the corner. Lot of restaurants but bit pricey.
Just lovely. Great place to people watch , good bars, slightly more expensive than other streets but definitely worth a visit.

Prague Old Town. A really beautiful part of Prague. The architecture is something else. Loads of bars and restaurants as well as shops to visit.
Would recommend a night at the medieval tavern just off the square for great food and entrainment.
A must see if in Prague.
Old and Charming. A lovely place to walk and view the square, the people and the surrounding shops. Many restaurants serving local beer and good strong coffee.

You can see a lot of "stuff" here!. If you are in Prague, you need to come to this square several times, because you will always find something different happening. There are several decent restaurants on the sides and there is no shortage of places to get snacks. In the early evening it is always crowded in the summer. The surrounding buildings are all beautiful and the3 astronomical clock is also here.

rich heritage !. this historic square features super architecture marvels including Gothic style too. It has so many heritage buildings, statues & churches. Heavily crowded tourist spot with delicious BBQ & eateries in and around the square.

Spectacular square. The square and the area around it are super "pottering" territory. The square itself is huge and largely traffic free. Cafes are very popular at night as the square begins to light up. Crowds gather on the hour to watch the astonomical clock. The procession of figures is not that spectacular.

Nice vibe. The square is very much like squares aroubd the world obviously very differnt architecture but the vibe and general atmosphere is lovely. A very nice place to sit and watch the world go by or one day when we visited they had a market whixj was nice to wander around, another time there was a really good jazz band playing you never know what you are going to find there each day.

A trip back in time.. We loved walking around the square and people watching. What a great place to relax and watch all the activities going on around you. Also a great central meeting place for friends. Loved all the different architectural periods placed around the square.

Very Busy Place. A big square with lots of visitors. Lots of things to do and see around the square. Took a free tour (gratuities) by Discover Prague Tour will give you an idea what and where to visit.

Perfect apart from Segways. You will pull your neck muscles from looking back and forth at all of the AMAZING sights! This is such a fun and beautiful place. Truly, it's perfect for any time of the day, but it comes most alive at night. You'll find great architecture, rich history, street performers and good food. My main complaint is shared among almost everyone there...segways. They are everywhere, and people have been ran into. It takes away from the vibe, and is in the way at times.

Gorgeous, interesting - but a little touristy. The square's buildings were old and historicly interesting and pretty, but there were mainly tourist souvenir shops surrounding it and the area felt a little non - authentic.

Full of life and excitement - and SAFE. My walk tonight in Old Town Square was super. it was very busy with tourists but it was nice as you feel good to be in the middle of a busy place, admiring the happy mood around you. The restaurants were full ( and affordable ) there were Police around the Square too, to make sure that tourists will feel safe and protected. Prague will always be my favorite place to visit.
One of the world's most beautiful squares. Gorgeous old buildings, medieval towers, cafe's to people watch and shopping streets with crafts or high end brands...Prague's Old Town Square has it all.

Love Prague Square!. I think my girlfriend and I ended up in Prague Square at least once every day that we were there! It's super nice (especially if it's sunny) and there are some great little restaurants and things to stop for lunch or a quick drink (even at reasonable prices). That being said, be aware of the tourist traps. We went to one restaurant and ended up leaving because the menu we received once sat down was different to that which we had read outside the restaurant when deciding whether to eat there or not. It didn't look different, but the prices had been increased by a markup of 50% (without us being informed, sneaky...) apparently because that's the additional fee for sitting outside. Be wary, also, of the Prague ham stalls - the prices are per 100g, but when I asked for some I got a 500g+ slice. Don't get me wrong, it's super good ham and I wasn't that upset about it, but I saw a few people who were, so just be prepared or ask before you receive a piece :)
Trip Across The Pond. The Old Town Square was home to all kinds of street performers, on the outer edges where the street vendors selling all kinds of food and beer.

Fantastic Meeting Location. Old Town Square is a fantastic meeting location, It has lots of character, good restaurants and cafes around and some historic building and cultural activities on a regular basis.

Like a fairytale.... I loved visiting the Square...so much to see, especially in March before Easter with market shops open. There are stands selling every kind of trinket and thing that you could only get in Prague, including honey wine and ornaments made in Prague. Way too many things to name. The buildings and the architecture are beautiful...all the different colors, the horse drawn carriages, food vendors...I could go on but you should just go visit and see for yourself. Prague is one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to and I hope to go back and visit again someday.
Wonderful!. Great atmosphere and very busy when we went. Lots of restaurants off the square. Segway tours from the square by different promoters but never pay the asking price.
Really beautiful!. When you are in Prague, visit the Old Town Square and taker your time for the astronomical clock. Very interesting to see how it works.

Weekend in OldTowne. We arrived at the Old Town Hilton on Friday and wandered a few blocks only to discover the Old Town Square. There was a weekend market setup with interesting local crafts etc as well as food stands. Nice place to pick up local presents for friends back home. That evening we returned and had dinner at one of the indoor / outdoor restaurants. Food was reasonable priced and good. Not gourmet - but good.The square is also near the center of town so staying at a nearby hotel is a plus.
Wow moment. Arrived in the middle of the night on our first night in Prague. We were blown away by the size and the beauty of this square. Touristy? Yes. A spectacle? Absolutely!

Very attractive. Lots of good restaurants around to make sitting in this attractive square a real pleasure and enough to look at to make the time pass pleasantly. The one cause for concern is that with Prague being such a magnet for stag/hen parties the happy atmosphere could be spoiled by excessive "jollifications" by the participants.

Charming Area with Plenty of Shopping. Lovely market square that is a gold mine for photographers and artists. There are all kinds of shops, walking tours, cafes, people watching and the amazing astronomical clock. On the day we were there, a beautiful lady dancing with fire was in the center of the square. Absolutely fantastic day. Our tour guide mentioned that we should be alert and aware like in any other big city in the world as pickpockets are a concern.

Focal point of Prague- Vibrant and full of life!. Old town square in Prague is the focal point of every tourist activity in Prague. Most of the walking tours start from Old town square. Also many places to see such as Astronomical clock, St. Nicholas church etc. are in Old town square. Also there are many stalls of food items and numerous other restaurants, cafes and shops selling various stuff nearby Old town square. Square also attracts lots of performers and entertainers plying their talent to impress tourists. This place is the tourist hub of Prague!Bottomline- Must visit place!

Beautiful. This was my favourite area in Prague. It had a wonderful atmosphere and beautiful views. You can just sit in a cafe (lots of free wifi about) or take a walk to the top of the astronomical clock. Make sure you catch the hour change at the front of the clock too.

Must do. This old town is perfect if you like to walk while enjoying beautiful architecture. If you may you could grab something to eat or to drink or simply sit in one of the many restaurants for a proper dinning experience.
Restaurants for tourists. Lots of restaurants, lots of people. There might be better and more inexpensive restaurants just a couple of blocks away.
So beautiful!. This was the gathering area each day. Such a pretty place to start the day off. So much to see and do in this area of the city!

Just lovely. In my opinion it is one of the top 3 best squares in Europe. Prague is a magneficent city and very very beautiful. The square has the famous astronomical clock of Prague and numerous buildings with beautiful architecture. On the square there are many performers, musicians, actors, artists, etc. The square has a unique flair that cannot be explained with words. Just go there and visit it! Prague is one of the prettiest cities in Europe.

Fun, romantic, fun, romantic!. Lovely place! I went there with my wife and had the best time ever! What a great atmosphere! Music, horses, cathedrals, Astronomic watch (MUST SEE at o'clock), restaurants, boutiques, bubbles!! There is something for everyone in this square!

Lovely . We visited the old town square after we had finished our trip on the boat. There is lots to look at and do in this part of Prague. They had clocks, statues, cafes bars restaurants and ice cream parlours.We saw horse and carts for people to go on and Segway tours are sold here. Overall lots of tourists and lots to do.
Beatiful Square. Beautiful Square with all statues, churces, old buildings, restaurants. All activites done by different artists. Recommendations

Good atmosphere.... There are lots of really nice buildings around the square - much more appealing than Wenceslas Square. There are some very good restaurants not far from the square in side streets although those alongside it are always very busy but I doubt that they offer the best value for money although I'm sure that they serve sufficiently good food. "You pay your money and take your chance" as they say.

It's where all the action is.. This is the main square of the city and is very similar to most other city squares. There are plenty of Al Fresco restaurants, street vendors, food stalls, musicians and entertainers. They also have horse carriage rides there. Side note: I have never seen horses as big as I did here; they are HUGE!!! This is also the meeting/ starting point for all the guided tours etc, so there are plenty of tourists here. The square is also surrounded by some key sight seeing places like the Clock Tower & the St. Nicholas Cathedral.

A lot to see and do here. Like most of Prague, this is a busy place. When we were there many people were performing in the square. There were the gold painted people statutes who didn't move and must have been roasting in the heat. The buildings surrounding the square are interesting. There are a number of restaurants - outdoor cafes when the weather is nice - and this is a great place to stop for something to eat or drink and watch the crowds.
View the clock tower on the hour. Old Town Square in Prague is always teeming with people - but none more than as the minute hand approaches twelve and figures on the clock face go into motion.
The best. Everyone who goes to Prague NEEDS TO BE THERE for the clock coming every hour. Street bands, mymes, and wonderful archecture.

Something for everyone. A wonderful vibrant city full of new and old buildings an eclectic collection of styles over the centuries well worth a visit. Very friendly people and something for everyone. plenty of shops bars and restaurants and street entertainers.

One of the most magic and entertaining places in the world. This place is magnificent. If you take a 360° view all you can see are marvelous buildings, churches, monuments and people from all over the world. It's a place to stay for hours sipping a beer at one of the nice restaurants bordering the square. The astronomic clock is the masterpiece of this area. Magic.

Beautiful But Busy Square. Despite the crowds we thoroughly enjoyed walking the square & photographing the beautiful buildings. We also enjoyed seeing the Astronomical Clock & going up in the clock tower for gorgeous views from above. We did the self-guided tour from Rick Steve's book & it was just right for us.

Worth to see – beautiful market square.. There’s a lot of nice monuments and buildings in the rage of market, like Kostel Panny Marie Pred Tynem, Monument of Jan Hus, Old Town Hall with magnificent astronomical clock and etc. But be careful and don’t be fooled by nearby restaurants and pubs – there are here only to make profit, waiters are extremely rude and unpleasant. Main road connecting Square with Charles Bridge is constant stream of tourist, so to get there it’s better to take a small detour through Josefov or parallel streets.

Tourist destination thats worth it. In the old town of Prague there is a big square similar to ones in other european cities. As you might guess, it's filled with life, shops, resturants and stands. You'll always have something to see here, if it's the architecture, people or the performers. The St Nicolas church and astronomical clock is also located here, and it's nice to catch them as you're here.Some good resturants here as well, so that you can sit down and relax with something to drink and eat.

Beautiful. A really beautiful Square, one that you cannot find just anywhere. The shops, the cafes, the restaurants, the church, the 'cuckoo clock', so many things to see and admire. Absolutely irresistible.

Spectacular. This huge square in Prague is the meeting and gathering place of the city - especially if you are a tourist! Thousands of people everywhere enjoying the astrological clock, the sidewalk cafes and the general ambiance that it Prague. HINT:. We enter to see the clock chime first thing in the morning (9 am) and the crowds were greatly diminished, giving you the opportunity to see it as it was meant to be seen. You can take your pictures, enjoy the relative quiet and take it all in without so much worry about those pesky pickpockets!
The center of the center. The Old Town Square is unique thanks to the really old buildings. Nothing really new, just rebuild old ones. Also you can find there Astronomical clock.

Nice, but expensive. You should visit Old Town Square for the Astronomical Clock in the first place, I think. But be careful, because in the weekends it is almost impossible to see "clock show" - there are crowds of people. Better choose working day for it.If you want to eat in the Old Town Square and count your money, better don't, because there is quite expensive to eat (e. g. Halušky - 49 cz for 100 g).
Shopping, eats and people watching. Strolled around the square with the hubs. Enjoyed the beautiful architecture, great little restaurants and gift shops. There were also street performers to watch.

Picturesque square. Easily one of the most beautiful European city town square, just sitting around and admiring the different building facade and architecture. The bubbles floating around gives it an uplifting
Busy but part of what you do. You will see the square if you are in the old town area and / or near the bridge. Not awesome but part of what you do.
Beautiful buildings and a clock. Beautiful building and a lot of good restaurants ,be sure to get up in the church tower for an amazing view is nice to see but not anything fancy
Beautiful must-see top tourist destination. It is a beautiful full-see tourist attraction. I could imagine this place can also compare with romerburg in frankfurt.

Better than Times Square with Jugglers, Dancers, Crowds and Fun - Feels Clean. This is just a great big square, with classic eastern European style architecture, a wild bigger-than-life cuckoo clock, Segway tours for the lazy, and lots of young people. When we were here it made us realize that there's just so much more to Europe than Paris and London. Eastern Europe is a different vibe, and it's a cool vibe, and Prague is fantastic. Don't miss wandering through here at various times of the day and night.
Old town Square. Beautiful old buildings great to sit and people watch. Don't forget to visit St Nicholas church and the astronomical clock.
Sit down on a bench and enjoy the crowd. Find a place with a glass of wine or beer and study all the people moving around. Avoid all the typical tourist invitations.

beautiful but.... whilst the city itself is beautiful, it seems like they hired people who use water guns to "cool you down". unfortunately. most of the people who were sprayed were girls and it was either in breast region or butt area. not funny
Buildings on the square. the buildings surrounding the square were so beautiful. You find yourself spinning around to take in the nest one.

Cannot Miss Old Town Square. Old Town Square is a must when visiting Prague. Lots of people, lots of entertainment. It's truly breath-taking at night. The surrounding buildings are highlighted in lights so it is really fantastic to stroll around. Many of the restaurants & retail stores surrounding the area stay open until 9 or 10p (or perhaps later!), you can spend as much time or as little time as you wish.
