Much to see in this fine public square. Although the square is large, it can get quite crowded with tourist groups. You can also hire horse drawn carriages and vintage car tours from the square as well as stops for the various tourist coaches and mini train tour. Around the square is a wealth of historic buildings as well as many cafes and restaurants.
Architecture. It's great to see the unbombed architecture and the way buildings from different eras fit in. The clock is quite amazing.

Tourist spot . Very nice pieces of architectural buildings and churches all around this Square plaza. Tyn Cathedral, Astronomical clock, St Nicholas church, restaurants and shops. Plus a mini garden covered by trees sit besides St Nicholas and the Astro clock.Oh , we had the Old Prague ham just within the square, it was so tasty and tender and well recommended for people who enjoys Roast pork.One street besides St Nicholas church leads you to the expensive shopping street, more like Champ Elysees in Paris.Lots of Tour guides offering service from Segway, walking tour or those fancy old looking Limo city tour.For more decent price restaurants, I'd recommend going somewhere inside the streets, there's a lot of local restaurants offering local cuisine. Roast duck or the roast pork knee/ knucklesAveraged meal for 3, about CZ2000. Save the coins, it have value more than they appear to be.
Fantastic atmosphere. Visited at the height of the Christmas market season, the place was buzzing! So much going on, would recommend a ride on the horse-drawn carriage, and a visit to the art gallery
lovely place to people watch. watched the street entertainment, just watch for the people on segways, they zoom around, made me jump a few times

Never a boring moment!. With the Astronomical Clock, St Nicholas Church, Tyn Cathedral along with all the shop and restaurants, there is so much to see and do in this one square that if you could spend an entire day or evening there and never be bored! Be sure to stop into Mincovna Restaurant for delightful Czech cuisine.
Fantastic place. Day or night it's full of atmosphere and is a great place to be. Try the cellar bar/restaurant at the white horse for an unusual place and much cooler when it's hot.

Surrounded by history. Loved the Old Town Square, huge open space surrounded by beautiful buildings and churches, busy and bustling with great eateries where you can sit and people watch. One of the main attractions must be the famous Astronomical Clock, which draws large clocks on the hour.

Great place to watch the world go by. I loved my visit to Prague and spent my final afternoon sitting outside a bar enjoying the sun and the atmosphere . The square as you would expect is beautiful and there always seems to be something going on.The prices in the bars and restaurants that look directly into it are higher than elsewhere but that is the case wherever you go.If you want a Segway you will find plenty there and you will be asked but very politely and with no pressure .It does get busy especially in the hour when the clock goes off , it's another Praugue must dos

Beautiful architecture . The Old Town Square is beautiful, the Gothic and Bohemian architecture is stunning. The square has a lovely feel, calm and relaxed even when busy. If you are looking to attend a trip with the company who use the green umbrellas, be careful as we wanted to attend a trip which went from the clock in the square. On the leaflet it clearly stated "no need to book in advance, just turn up at 10am". When we arrived at 9.45am we were told that the tour was fully booked due to a large party from the Hilton hotel booking in advance! The tour was a full day so we were stuck after that!

Nice time. Great spot, lived 5 minutes away and spent time there daily. Great spot to relax, take in the city, people watch. It is busy at all times which makes it lively and exciting. Lots of photo opps and great way to kill time if your just strolling and having a relaxing day. :)

One of a kind beauty . If we weren't so intrigued to see all we could of Prague, I could have just sat here all day looking a the beauty in this square. The clock is intriguing, but can get crowded int that area. The kids loved the horse carriage night tour ( and horses seem to be treated very kindly) strongly recommend taking enough time to sit for a while and take it all in and enjoy the beauty.
Lively at night . Beautiful buildings. Lots of activities available. We were always able to find dessert no matter time of the day. Lots of restaurants and shopping.

Crowded but nice to see.. Lots of tourists and locals all around, but some very interesting sights. Lots of restaurants and stores, even a Burger King and Subway. Store owners friendly and all speak English.

Lively. It's a place where there are concerts and speeches and food and shops. Frequented by tourists and the young it is a delight for all age groups. The live food stalls sell smoked ham which it to die for. The ice cream's r good too. The stalls sell souvenirs and worth it picking a few. About 5 E each. Great Shops are just adjacent but you will need a lot of cash.

Beautiful buildings but crowded. It has to be on any visit to Praugue as the area is full of buildings straight out of a fairy tale. Praugue is one of the most beutifull cities in the world and this is at the center of it

Pretty pretty pretty!. This square is alive and vibrant. The buildings are gorgeous and a must-see. The clock is OK, but kind-of disappointing after all the fuzz about it. Beware of pick pockets, as in any major city. Loved the atmosphere.
Loved the vibe here. It's a quaint historical area with some grand churches, an ancient astronomical clock that chimes on the hour and a cobblestoned square.loved the vibe there in the late evenings.

One of the world's most beautiful cities - PRAGUE!. Spell-bindingly beautiful! Magnificent architecture, awesome vibe! Old Town Square amazing! Restaurants, coffee bars, ice-cream spots! Prague is a must!

Touristy but still fun. Spent 3 days close to this square and at times it was overwhelmed with tourists and other times we felt like we were being granted a glimpse into the local culture. One evening the square held a rock concert with local Czech bands playing. The locals loved it. Another day there was a wreath laying service commemorating the Czech war dead. Both really cool to see and be a part of

Great architecture. Loved the wierd winding narrow streets, old buildings and places of worship mixed with modern retail. The guys out soliciting for the topless clubs was annoying and reminded me of new orleans.

Love this area of Prague. The buildings are amazing, the clock tower not to be missed, as it does its thing every hour to a great crowd, and I never tired of stopping and watching it. The square also is home to several markets on different days, and the Christmas one is very special in the evenings, Its lovely !!! take extra room in your case and so some Christmas Chopping whilst you are there. There are plenty of lovely places to eat, have a drink, and relax and people watch, and its just a short stroll from Chrles Bridge through some charming streets of the Old Town
WE LOVED THE PLACE. Many street shows and many people who re coming to see the famous clock near the square. we took a city ride with horses from there that we ll loved.

pre cruise tour. Fun to walk see architecture astronomical clock.
lots of food vendors to try local delights. also entertainment, musicians, and arts. loved the city of prague
Another must see. Another must see in Prague, would recommend visiting at different times of the day to get the overall feel of the place.

A must see. The square is beautiful peaceful and full of relaxing bars and restaurants.we took a ride on the horse and carriage, again it was cheap and well worth a trip.
There are plenty of bars and restaurants just off the square, which are really pleasant and cheap.

What a hoot!. All roads lead to… Uh, Old Town Square. And those roads are meant only for pedestrians—and they’re paved with stones. Exquisite buildings surrounding OTS, such as Saint Nicholas Cathedral, Astronomical Clock, and Jan Hus Monument statues are in the center of it all. I was there on a Saturday afternoon. What a hoot! A beefy, bearded guy was garbed in a pink dress and veil. A line of guys in matching T-shirts were chanting catcalls. A crowd had surrounded the spectacle and tossed in their own (humorous) insults. The pink-clad guy laughed and strutted around encouraging everyone to chant louder. (See accompanying photo.) Nearby were two guys dressed in what appeared to be brown monks’ clothing. One “sat” in midair above the other. Each held onto a bamboo pole. (See accompanying photo.) Near the church, a violin soloist performed magnificently. Everywhere there were performers, like a loosely organized street fair. There are bars and restaurants with sidewalk tables, so that you can enjoy a brew and the performers’ antics. Walk in any direction and there are phenomenal examples of architecture. I enjoyed the entire afternoon here, after visiting the Jewish Quarter, Charles Bridge, Powder Tower, and a boat ride on the Vltava River. The best thing about the Old Town Square “street fair” is that it’s free. Enjoy!

Old Town Square is very large for walking by disadvantaged people. We visited the square for about an hour waiting for the Astronomical clock to go off but it never did. It was hard to find a taxi to take us back to the Hilton but we found a little pedicab driver to take us back for a very reasonable amount.
A Delight to see. So many fascinating buildings to see - Visit if you're in Prague. Very busy but a wonderful place thats great to see
Old Town Square at Christmas. Another unforgettable Prague experience. So beautiful to see the variety of foods, crafts and other items specifically associated with Prague. Great spirit.
great place. Bring your walking shoes, this is a great place to explore, people watch, have a drink and relax at one of the many restaurants along the square.

embracing old time prague. the big square, small vendors, old architectures, all complete. a long stroll from Charles Bridge, to the old town. the blend of tradition and modernity is just perfect. the best time to enjoy is in the morning of waiting for sunset. there you'll found the old clock. the whole experience is just fund and serene at the same time. i went there in 2012, and will be back again this coming summer^^

Absolutely stunning in every corner. Most medieval cities and old towns in Europe are beautiful but this place is truly special! Lot os rich history and fantastic combinations of architecture from different periods. Worth spending a day or two walking around! Nice shops and local art! Fantastic restaurants and cafes with seating outdoors. YOu can enjoy many things and it is appropriate for all ages and safe.
The center of it all.. Worth it even with the crowds. Be prepared for beggars and some people who are down on their luck scavenging through trash barrels
Tianmen Square equivalent. Has history of Prague spring uprising in this square where someone brunt himself to led the freedom movement, else now a busy market place with shops all around

Great architecture, street art, and food.. Old Town is just that - part of an ancient city with the respective architecture and design. It's a fun place to wander around - looking in shops, eating local cuisine, and people watching. There are lots of shops and restaurants. It's a great way to take a "step back" in history and imagine what it was like to live in the city long ago.

come early. It's quietest if you go at 9am - the first time the bell tolls with the figurines doing their parade. If you just want a picture of the clock any other time, the square was practically deserted at 8am.

you will fall in love with this place. from 10 am to 2am(mid night) this place is happening, people of all ages roam around, mesmerised by the beauty and charm of the historical monuments around this place. you can just sit there for hours, watching the people, buildings, cafes etc.

Impressive. The old town square is a must visit. Out of our 4 days in Prague we ended up spending three evenings at the old town square. There are numerous nightclubs,pubs and restaurants in and around the old town square. The square was always hustling with tourists. If you visit Prague, make sure to spend your evenings there.
The heart of Prague. This is all about tourists and vendors selling to tourists but you gotta see this square and stand in the middle and enjoy the architecture.
A gem. The whole city is full of cultural attraction and I must say that history lovers will certainly be pleased here.
Beautiful. It's all about the architecture and the offers for tours. Watch out for pick pockets, especially during the astronomical clock show

The town light up with joy . The old town square looks most beautiful in the evening. old town square and astronomical clock is the heart of the Prague . One can just walk around in the area and feel happy . Each corner of Prague is beautiful . The phrase "Old is gold" actually true for Prague . It's one of the most old style architecture with beautiful surroundings. You can just spend whole day in this places . walk , shop . Eat and have fun
Gathering point. This is the real center of the town, where citizens and tourists gather together to buy small presents or eat a hot dog. Very beautiful and crowded.

A historical square. This old town square seems to me a hub from where you can explore the town centre to its fullest. This square is packed with cafés, restaurants and food stalls. This square is often used in peak season for all kinds of events.

one of the most cheerful old town squares i have been to. we were always moving around teh city tehn ending again there to spend some time or starting our day with it , it has alot of restaurants and shops too
Lots of tour groups. Even tho it's a 'must see' it was very crowded with tour groups. Some buskers entertaining the crowds and selling their music or looking for 'donations'.
Super!!!. For me the best part of Old town. A lot people with amazing stores. Me with my friends enjoyed the buildings while drinking coffee.
Beautiful buildings. The square is full of beautiful buildings and architecture with lots of interesting things in and around to see. It is lovely to just wander the streets and get lost in them.

A zoo. Sunday afternoon was like Times Square on New Year's Eve, with the added annoyance of a not-very-good rock band playing a painful volume. But you have to go there, if only to see the truly amazing clock.

Beautiful. Paradise for tourists!!! Mixture of gothic history and modern designer stores!! Astronomical clock is a must visit and great if you can go on the the top of the clock!! What a view!!! It has segway tours, great Czech local ham shops, bohemian crystal stores, chocolate museum, wax museum, local pubs, absinthe bars, ghost tours etc are great attractions!!! Must visit if in Prague!!

Best place to see in Prague . This is the best place to be in Prague as you can take in the architecture of the old Europe while enjoying the area. This area remains quite crowded all the day but mostly with tourists. Please avoid any restaurants here as most of them are overly expensive and remain a rip off. Try to be there at the start of an hour so that you can see the astronomical clock make its sound - quite cool in my opinion

Very nice square. A very nice and busty square all day and night there are people here, there are lots of things to do and usually a meeting place for groups and trips. It is a very good place to go at night time as well as it offers easy access to the bars in the area.

Soak in the sun, laze around, drink and eat...do all that you feel like. I know the title of this review is quite frivolous but basically you can do anything at the square, besides seeing some marvellous sights. There is some interesting hot and deep fried street food, some fancy restaurants around and yeah, also horse carriage ride!
Going back in time. Could have spent a lot longer going around old town, so many twists and turns into different areas , at night time with thunder and lightening was unbelieveable.

Atmosphere!. The square has imposing and interesting buildings on all sides, as well as the huge Jan Hus statue. We could wander around here for hours. The restaurants are a bit pricey but we ate elsewhere at more reasonable cost. Crowds gather on the hour to watch the spectacle at the astronomical clock. Don't bother; it's a big disappointment compared with other similar events, for example in Munich.

Hearth of the Old town. Fantastic place - you feel like going through the history! The old Town hall with the tower and astrological clock. The gothic and renesaince houses all around. The mysterius Tyn church. The Golz-Kinsky Palace stepping into the square. The Meridian in front of The Jan Hus memorial... And the lovely St. Nicholas church! One important - do go here early (like till 9am max), otherwise badly crowded!

A place to sit and watch. Can be very busy at midday and a place to pick up tours or individual trips around the centre. After a walk around the area there are bars to sit and have a beer and watch the world go by

Too many visitors. Could not see much because there are large groups of other tourists gatjering in front of the astronomical clock and there are stages at the square maybe for concert. We could not get good photos and overall view of the square.
The astrological clock and tower. Splendid clock and worth going up the tower for good views over Prague. Lovely buildings in the old town. Found a classical concert in St Michael's Monastery.

Majestic Beauty of Prague. This wide square though very touristy and full of scams and traps, but still you can't get enough of the ancient beauty of its churches and buildings. Be careful and keep your belongings in your hand, avoid huge crowds, then enjoy the marvels. Avoid the cafes and restaurants within the square and enjoy loosing your way in the surrounding small streets, you will find better choices.

So much history!!. What a great place to visit. Literally you are surrounded by history. These building are amazing to witness in person. This area always has a lot of activity. Many things to see and places to shop. They had so sort of festival when we went so there was music and entertainment.

an amazing place to visit. Absolutely one of the most beautiful place to visit , eat , discover , and spend time . It is very crowded , so avoid July , August and weekends if you do not like to be too close to people .

A must see. Historic town square with beautiful buildings to view and imagine what life was like in a different time. Be prepared because every tourist and tour group will also be there so it will be very crowded most of the day. it does take away from the experience but you still must go.

Beautiful Historic Area. I loved walking around the old city and town square absorbing the atmosphere. The building are old and beautifully maintained. There are many tourists and many guided tour group walking by - so it is crowded. Watch for your belongings.

Of course you must visit, just be ready for the experience. This is a must see in Prague and everyone is there. The restaurants and shops are Very touristy. The crowds can be daunting. Watch out for the crazies that decide that they must use their rented Segways to criss cross the square and somehow show off. This seems to be the favorite pastime of many a young man. The clock is special (and crowded on the hour - you can get close at other times). I recommend visiting and then eating/drinking elsewhere if you're looking for a quality experience. But then I'm not a young single ;-).
Beautiful site to visit. This center represents a world heritage that should be kept for the whole world to visit I will visit again, had not enough time to see all the beautiful sights to see.
Stunning. The old town square is a lovely place to grab a drink, get a great photo, find tour guides and enjoy some local cuisine. There are limited benches though so don't rely on getting a seat.

Nice place to people watch. The town square is a great place to people watch. It is full of tours though and can be very crowded. Sometimes it is difficult to navigate. There are lots of restaurants on the square. I would avoid these as they are expensive being on the square and really no that great. They are so busy that they really don't have great service or care to provide great service because they work with such volumes of people, Their job is not to impress as they know you won't be repeating your business. At least that is the feeling we got. Go off the square and there are much better places to eat.So enjoy the square with a coffee not necessarily a meal...

Must visit in Prague . Visited old town square at Easter and was the best experience in Prague. The local cuisine, Easter decor, ambience... everything was perfect. It is one of the places where time stands still!!

Crowds. As a tourist I should be patient about being among crowds. However, I found this Square to be overwhelmingly crowded. I believe that in early spring of late fall this could be an inspiring square. But, for me, not in high tourist season.
Busy Place. Old towns square if full of cafe and bars. Grab a drink. food can be expensive. check out the astronautical clock. good place to go both during the day and night
Historical town. Nice old houses, narrow streets, a lot of little shops and galleries. Friendly people. Romantic, poetic feeling

Beautiful. Prague is a beautiful city, and the old town square shows that! The architecture is beautiful and its worth to go there for seeing the buildings and the famous church clock. its also surrounded with the beautiful old-town, and a lot of restaurants and shops!
Spend some time here. Don't miss seeing the Astronomical Clock in the Old Town Square, especially on the hour the twelve Apostle come out in procession.

Beautiful Architecture Here. This is a popular, very crowded and picturesque gathering place in the center of Old Town surrounded by restaurants, shops and churches. In the center is the memorial to Jan Hus, symbolizing the long struggles for Czech freedom. You can see many architectural styles, including Gothic, Renaissance, Baroque, Rococo and Art Nouveau. Churches in the area are Church of St. Nicholas, Church of Our Lady Before Tyn and Church of St. James. The main attraction is the Old Town Hall with the Astronomical Clock where large crowds gather on the hour to hear and watch the performance. There are usually street entertainers on hand to perform. I hear this is a great place for pickpockets, although I did not experience or see them.

Nothing you can miss when in Prague. Beatuiful in the winter with the markets and the christmas trees, most restaurants had their outdoor space opened with heating so you could sit outside and watch everything. But I would recommend to eat somewhere else since the restaurants around the square are much more expensive than other great locals just around the corner.

Must see the clock.. Had fun jostling for position to see the astronomy clock strike the hour. Lovely view of the square from most of the cafes and you can take a ride in a horse drawn carriage to see more.

Fun in Prague!. The old town square has some wonderful buildings, historical tribute statuary and the amazing astronomical clock. The complexity (and beauty) of the clock is mind-boggling and woth the visit. The square gets more crowded as the day wears on but is great fun. It can get a little campy when you head off to the shopping/entertainment area of the square and encounter Bruce Willis in Madame Tussauds but there are nice shops with marionettes, toys, Kafa artifacts, and books. Come here and enjoy yourself!

Beautiful Square. This is a beautiful square and full of life! "We stayed at the Hotel U Prince, right in the square, and it was wonderful. There is the Astronomical Clock here, and we recommend going to the top for the view of the city of Prague. It is within easy walking distance to other sights in Prague.

The centre of Prague. Old Town Square is the centre of Prague in that it surrounded by old historical buildings and it is the best way to kick off your visit to Prague. It also has numerous restaurants and galleries. There are also public toilets. any tours use this as a meeting point and from there you can visit other numerous sights.

Relaxing Friday. Spent a sunny Friday afternoon viewing all the quaint and historic buildings which surround the square. The square has many buskers and street entertainers to keep you amused and many bars and restaurants to wine and dine. Nice to relax with a beer and wine and watch the world go by. Also worth a visit at night to see the buildings lit up.

Crowded like an anthill, rip offs abound. This was an ok square some years ago. It never was great, but it was ok. Nowadays it is a beehive of rip-off artists, pickpockets, bad, overpriced restaurants and herds of tourists crammed like sardines in a tin can, almost one on top of another. Junk sellers abound, trying to peddle some idiotic toys that have nothing to do with Prague. Restaurants hardly serve actuall Czech food anymore, instead you may have imitation italian, american or wanna-be-continental. Crowds lend themselves perfectly to thieves, my girlfriend was robbed of her wallet. Police officers we approached about this shrugged their shoulders and smiled sarcastically. "it happens" we heard. Souvenir shops selling "made in China" garbage complete the picture. It only took twenty years to go from a wonderful plaza to a place one cant wait to run away from asap. Actual residents of Prague, I'm told, avoid the place like the plague, so should you.

Crowded like an anthill, rip offs abound. This was an ok square some years ago. It never was great, but it was ok. Nowadays it is a beehive of rip-off artists, pickpockets, bad, overpriced restaurants and herds of tourists crammed like sardines in a tin can, almost one on top of another. Junk sellers abound, trying to peddle some idiotic toys that have nothing to do with Prague. Restaurants hardly serve actuall Czech food anymore, instead you may have imitation italian, american or wanna-be-continental. Crowds lend themselves perfectly to thieves, my girlfriend was robbed of her wallet. Police officers we approached about this shrugged their shoulders and smiled sarcastically. "it happens" we heard. Souvenir shops selling "made in China" garbage complete the picture. It only took twenty years to go from a wonderful plaza to a place one cant wait to run away from asap. Actual residents of Prague, I'm told, avoid the place like the plague, so should you.

Partylike atmosphere. We visited Prague during one of their music festivals in June. The square had concerts and live musicians playing day and night. The gypsies were entertaining the public a parade one afternoon. What a sight to see all their great costumes.This is a happening place to see local color and activity. Many, Many tourists and tour operators meet here.Beautiful buildings, churches, many side walk cafes and an impressive clock tower which entertains every hour. Cobble stone so wear comfortable shoes.
nice place. well preserved interesting architecture lots of pubs and caffs definetly worth to see when you visiting Prague

Nice Place For Quick Photos Then Get Onto side streets. Want to know where all the tourists hang out during the day - it is here. Best shots of the square are in the evening when everything is lit up and some tourists have departed, but place is always busy. Recommend not eating here as there are much, much better and cheaper places to eat just 5-minutes off the square. Been to Prague a few times and this place never disappoints but it seems it is becoming overcrowded with vendors and folks trying to sell you a tour.

Cracking architecture and culture.. A great part of central Prague to visit, whether there on a family holiday, as a traveller on your own, as a couple or like us, a stag group (very well behaved I must add). The architecture is very nice and the area is full of history. There are some really nice bars and restaurants here too and like most of Prague, the prices are very cheap in comparison to back home.

Great People watching. This seemed to be the center of the universe for our visit. We went there daily. Enjoyed a great dinner with super people watching. Admired the silhouettes of the great churches and the very unique city hall. We shopped. We bought. We ate. On the weekend we saw political booths and craft booths. Had an ice cream treat at a sidewalk cafe. And found a very easy place to catch a cab. Enjoyed it greatly.
first time in pregue. nice place, excellent views, we get the free tour with Andreabut also the castle tour an pay 10 euro

Time Travel back to Medieval Bohemia!. I just love the Old Town Square which I first visited 25 years ago! Every trip I discover more "Secrets of the Square" . I always check out the Astronomical Clock which is amongst the best anywhere in Europe. The Square has a wonderful historical Spirit with the painted merchant houses, and backdrop of the Gothic Style Church which reminds me of "The Castle" in Franz Kafka famous novel!

Beautiful. When we visited the square there was a maratona of music. Orchestras and singers all very young adults from around Europe were taking part. The square was full of people and the atmosphere was wonderful. In the square you see all types of transport from see ways to electric cars,to horse drawn carriagesture with which you can visit prague.
Nice to sit and people watch. Great to eat ans also to sit in a bar and just people watch whilst enjoying the local beer, especially when the weather is good.

Old town square Prague. A great place with a wonder atmosphere. Loved the astronomical clock! We went back a couple of times to watch it - so much happening. The square itself is cobbled and a big fountain, performers and something happening all the time.

Beautiful old city square with lots to see and do.. This is definitely a highlight of a trip to Prague. The square has many very old buildings that are beautiful. There is also lots of great places to eat and shop. Definitely something to do while there.

Impressive Clocktower. It's simply amazing that the clocktower was built centuries before. We arrived approximately 10 minutes before the hour - anticipating the show at the top of the hour. Well worth it...it's unbelievable the ingenuity so many years before. The square is extremely busy. We were cautioned about pickpockets - we were fortunate to not have an issue.

All day activities. It is best to start your day here and end your day here! There are live perfomances throughout the day and they are amazing! I would recommend the Argentinian restaurant near the Astronomical clock the food is exceptional
I love this place. So interesting. Different than any other city on earth. So glad it was preserved during so many issues over the centuries.

Nice square for tourist!. I feel like this is quite a good place for tourists as there were groups of performers. Most of them were entertaining. I recommend grab something to eat from food stalls alongside and enjoy the good show!
Very clean . Beautiful area. Astronomical Clock is a must-see. Lots of outdoor seating. Great people watching. Climb the Old Town City Hall Tower.
Old Downtown Prague. The city has a beautiful downtown and the square is wonderful to visit. Prague is one of the most well maintained and safest large city in Europe.
Very busy.. Make sure you eat at one of the food booths. Less expensive that restaurants around the square and I felt the food tasted better.

Busy. The old town square is a very large and busy area surrounded by amazing buildings. The square is full of people, visitors, buskers and people selling tours etc. There are a number of benches around and it is a good place to people watch. Restaurants around the square are more expensivthan those a few minutes stroll away

Highlight of Prague!. Highlight! Always intrigued by this city based on a song I heard when I was young (though the MV was nothing like it); nevertheless this is where people gather on a daily basis to catch the Astronomical Tower Clock in action :)

Superb place to browse. We enjoyed strolling around the square, taking in the sights and visiting the Mucha exhibition (Art Nouveau artist) along with a Dali and Andy Warhol exhibition all housed on three floors.
Plenty of tourists. It is a beautiful square with many nice shops and the famous church tower but it is also a huge trap for tourists with many streets sellers. Pickpocketing danger!

Beautiful old city . It is a beautiful old city square. Street performers keep the family entertained. Lots of restaurants surrounding, horse drawn carriages wait for passengers. It is a nice place to relax a bit.
Romance surrounding. How beautiful it is! Cannot believe that there are more than 900 years ago construction. Too many people, should watch out your wallet and all stuffs.
Entertaining. This is a charming square where you will find street entertainment and beautiful sights. There are wonderful shops and great cafes as well.
Good place for Xmas. Good place in xmas for that xmas market. Nearby Market and cafes and restaurants. 2 church and astronomical clock. Good place to hang0ut in evening
A magical place to be!. Great restaurants, tasty street food, beautiful historic buildings, carriage rides, the wonderful clock show very hour. One of the best places to be when you're in Prague!

Great feel and energy. . Walk down the Charles Bridge towards Old Town. While walking through the lanes you reach this square which suddenly opens out. An enchanting feel with quaint cafes and the Astronomical Click which one must see Arthur strike if the hour.

THIS is the Prague you came to see. Out of all the areas, Old Town was my favorite. I couldn't stop taking pictures of all of the buildings with different architecture styles-- Gothic, Rococo, and Baroque. If you have seen pictures of Prague, they were probably taken in Old Town. There's so much to see here, such as the Astronomical Clock, and so much LIFE. Even at 11pm and later it was very lively and active.There are plenty of restaurants, bars, and shops here, plus it is close to Charles Bridge, Lesser Town, and the Jewish Quarter. Old Town Square is a must see at night and during the day.

Beautiful . Beautiful. Nice to have a wander around while looking at the stunning architecture.
Lots of little restaurants and shops also.

Amazing Area, Cheap Food, Fun Gift. I absolutely loved traveling to old town square. During my time abroad, this is probably my most visited location. It's accessible by a few different metro, tram, and bus stops. It's right near the Charles Bridge and a few other attractions. If you're looking for an array of food, music, gifts, and people this is exactly where you need to go.

What a skyline!. This bustling town square is a sight to behold! From the Jan Hus Memorial on the north, to the Tyn Cathedral on the east, to the Town Hall and Astronomical Clock on the southwest, to St Nicholas Cathedral on the northwest- this is a skyline of architectural beauty! This square is often crowded with tourists, some on Segways, with entertainers and street musicians scattered around it. Be sure to come back at night when everything is lit up, and don't miss a trip to the top of the tower, where the views of the city are spectacular.

I not at the height of the tourist season please. Must be something to herded around in tour groups of 29 or more with guide holding little signs on a stick to keep you in right group. Amazing how many tour groups there are
Nice square. It is the center of everything, great vibes, feels like in a movie. Nice buildings and lots of beer and trolo..

Must see old town. Enchanting and very lively and colorful. Be sure to try the treble cake with ice cream. There's an elevator to the top of clock tower. Extra charge but worth it. Too many people, very crowded except at night.
Marvelous experience!!. This is old meets new in a romantic and friendly city. Lots to see, lots to eat and drink, and all within walking distance. Worth the time to spend exploring. Lived it!

Soak up the atmosphere of Prague. Lovely looking buildings surround this square and it has a mix of old and chic shopping in the area, plus access to many tourist attractions. Lots of little cafes for a taste of Czech cuisine.
wonderful. Wonderful square, Every coner of this city is clean and full of life. There are a lot of stands with food and souvenirs

Exquisite architecture and magical feelings. The square is filled with so much to do and you could spend hours basking in the sights. Photos do not do it justice and the feeling at night is like a fairy tale.

So glad I followed TA advice ;-). This is definitely the big attraction in Prague. I am SO glad I read Trip Advisor and learned a few key tips. First, be warned that walking up to the castle is a steep climb. Take the tram if walking a steep incline on the cobblestone streets is an issue. There are actually several buildings to visit and you can buy tickets to all or some. However I read here that they were all overrated. There are huge crowds, so we just looked from the outside and enjoyed the amazing views. You can go in the cathedral and get a general feel for free unless you just HAVE to tour everything close and personal. There is a changing of the guard every hour of that kind of thing is exciting to you. The best tip was to go quickly to the palace gardens. They are amazing! Beautiful views. Almost no one is there. Well kept. So large! Great place to stroll. We came across a place where you could pay $4 and hold one of ten Eagles, owls, and Falcons. My son loved it. Great experience and the keepers were extremely friendly.

Fantastic for relaxing and people watching. The Old Town Square is perfect for cafes and restaurants. Lots to choose from while you while away the time people watching or reading. Prague is a very relaxing city but especially round here. There are lots of people selling Segway tours which is the only downside as sometimes there are too many whizzing around but it doesn't spoil the overall experience.

Historical beauty!. This ancient town square comes alive even today, and becomes a happening place with tourists and locals alike. It's surrounded by ancient buildings that have withstood the test of time.

Where it's all at. This is only a brief. The square is beautiful in itself has the astronomical clock and a big cathedral that I cannot remember the name of. In the square you are surrounded by bars and cafes (some can be a little pricey but walk like 1 Street away and alot cheaper). You can go up the clock tower for peanuts and get great views of the square and the city. The main square had a variety of events take place in it free music public speaking and all sorts. You will not struggle to get hooked up with a segway tour here as they are everywhere. One of the best part of this square is its location it is incredibly central to all areas of prague it's a 10 min walk to wencelas square (shopping district) Charles Bridge and the Jewish quarter and loads more it's almost as though the square was built first and the city exploded out from here.Also helpful is there's a tourist information centre on the square for those looking to get the most out of prague

Beautiful buildings and lots fo history, but crowded and overpriced. Old Town square is lovely - plenty of interesting historical bits and architecture... but it's very crowded, the food and drink around the area is overpriced, and there are the usual 'performers' drawing crowds ... living statues that aren't very statue-like, Punch&Judy type guy in a box that kids appeared to like (creeped me out), and the jazz bands set up (they were pretty good). Generally, it was a lovely medieval town square but I enjoyed other smaller, less crowded squares more.

Majestic!. A majestic, clean square worth visiting. You can either enjoy the view by sitting on a bench, or visit the National gallery to enjoy some art, or eat in the restaurants and stop by in the shops. Definitely a touch of history.
Ms. You got everything around here. Nice food, tourist spots, shopping, night life. Don't miss some small streets in this area, it is full of suprise.
Very Large Square!. If you like modern shopping, this is the place to be. Very large space with lots of retail shopping!
Always worth a walk. This is one of the worlds most beatiful and widely known square. Of course, more enjoyable with nice weather but always worth a walk.

Beautiful square. This is a lovely place to visit. The astronomical clock is located here. There is a lot of restaurants and shops around here. Plenty of hustle and bustle and lots of tourist attractions close by so the square is central for seeing other attractions.
Popular square. Impressive buildings and a must-see in Prague. Don't eat here though as it is really expensive. If you walk one or two blocks you get better value for money.

Beautiful but crowded. You won't feel alone for sure. But the square is quaint and a must do when in Prague. It resembles "Stortorget" in Stockholm where "The bloodbath of Stockholm took place" if you want to see the show at the Astronomical Wath, be there on time as it will end on the hour.

Stunning. The square is large and is surrounded by architecturally beautiful buildings. The main attraction is the large astronomical clock, which has a fascinating history. The square is crowded on the hour to watch the clock display. The square is also the centre for many live music events and other forms of free entertainment.

Prague Old Town Square. This is a great location. Big open area right in the centre of a the action. Cafes, restaurants, great shops. Amazing buildings and history. There's always plenty of fun there with jugglers, tricksters, bubble blowers etc. great place to sit and people watch. Watch your valuables though.

Charming but crowded. The Old Town Square is charming and historic. The square is surrounded by beautifully preserved historic buildings and houses the Astronomical Clock. The only real drawback is that the square is incredibly packed with tourists - especially as you near the time when the clock performs.

Don't miss this spectacular square. I was in Prague several years ago when the huge Christmas market was set up and it was magical. The square maintains its charm in May too. Love wandering through the Old Town of Prague.
Another must do if in Prague. We went when the sun was setting and it was beautiful! The buildings are amazing and seems to be the meeting place for a catch up and a beer with friends

This is where it all happens. Be aware there are a ton of people and pickpockets. This is a fun place where everything if happening. Many vendor stalls selling wonderful food. Segway tours of the surrounding area start here. (Rumor they may be stopped soon because they are dangerous to people walking through the Square), There are tons of bars, restaurants, coffee and ice cream shops around the Square. The Clock is the most famous feature.
excellent. old town square made me feel in Harry Potter films background. I felt marvellous. Being in Prague means to go old town square
Nice place to stroll. One of the places that has a lot of restaurants in the vicinity. Tourists and locals are staying here during weekends

busy. dates 12th centuary one of the beautiful sights in Europe.Wenceslas square is located nearby.there are many coffee shops and even I see people relaxing with beer cups. I even feel in INDIA people must make use of going to such places in their hometown and get the stress out of them.if we take a ticket of about 20 e to go by lift and visit the astronomical clock and the stunning view of whole prague-wonderful to look out. they sell some souvenirs few are worth buying

Magical the first time I saw it.. The first time I saw the old town square it was A frosty night in January, it was pretty deserted, very cold & misty at 1am in the morning & it was completely magical.

What a scene! It Is a Must See. The square can be full of it seams thousands of people so be aware in case you have any difficultly manipulating through crowds. But what fun! One of the largest squares I've seen. Great people watching and the architecture you are surrounded by will astonish you. Then of course there is the astronomical clock that everyone gathers to watch on the hour with its fun whimsical characters.It is the most visited place in Prague and for good reason.
Interesting place. Spent an afrernoon in here, whats a great few and relaxing with friends. Many resto and shopping around.

Touristy but Undescribable by Words. This place is always crowded and full of tourist. But this place also has many unique and unusual things. Here you can see the Astronomical clock, the view of tyn church, and other architectures that make you feel stepping back to the past. Sometimes, a horse-drawn vehicle will pass you and here you will also find many artist with stunning attraction.
Beautiful . Beautiful place but not different from others like this. Anyway everyone should visit it and I can't imagine not to visit it while visiting Prague
Shopping. Great place for shopping, eating and fun. Found many locals and tourists. Great spot to walk to. Wifi everywhere and malls huge.
it's an old town square!!!. walk around, enjoy the sights, sounds, people & ambiancethere's music, food, cafes, shopsmove out of the square fro some things that are less expensiveelsewhere
Amazing!. I can truly say that this is one of the most beautiful squares in Europe. It is the place to see and be seen in Prague. Amazing! You can chill and relax with a cup of local Czech beer!

Like a carnival in the middle of town. There are quite a few must see historic buildings here. Copious opportunities for great photographs. Try to be around for the selling of the hour by the clock and check out the trumpeter at the top of the Clocktower. There are so many options for food here that it is dizzying. Check out all of the grilled meats sold at small stands. Very cool.

Hive of activity!!. Nice big square surrounded by lots of shops and cafes. Seemingly lots going on all the time. We had free music which was really very good. Lots of artisan food vendors and a good place to pick up a car tour or mini train tour. Beeare of pick pockets and dont be suprised by the amount of drunks eating out of the bins. Its still very safe and the local police patrol alot and keep good order

Fascinating. The Old Town and Old Town Square are areas that you simply cannot miss from your itinerary. The architecture and general bustle creates a fascinating atmosphere. There is a small street train well worthy of the hour journey which incorporates the Old Town and the Castle area.
Architectural masterpiece!. The town square is a real masterpiece. The clock is magnificent and there are some restaurants which are very nice. I will revisit Prague for sure.

Decent way to pass the time. Not much to do in the square as such, but its nice to chill. Or enjoy a meal and a drink at one of the restaurants and watch the variety of local artists perform. Its the starting point for most tours, so we ended up there almost every day.

Recommend Rick Steve's excellent audioguide on Wenceslas Square and Old Town. We enjoyed the quaint, beautiful buildings on Old Town Square. The astronomical clock was interesting to see but the "show" on the hour was not very dramatic. We listened to Rick Steve's amazing free audio guide of Wenceslas Square, Old Town, and the Charles Bridge as we walked.
Magic. A really buzzing place, full of bars and raetaurants, fabulous buildings and of course, the astronomical clock. Don't miss it, we went back we ark times.

One of the best squares in Europe. Beautiful old buildings with stunning architecture and of course the world famous astronomical clock this is one of the best places to sit at one of the many cafes or restaurants and people watch.

Don't miss Old Town Square, when visiting Prague. One of the most beautiful historical places in Prague, surrounded by many old and historical buildings, palaces and churches. In the middle placed the statue of Jan Hus (John Huss), Czech priest, Christian reformer, convicted by Council of Constance and burned 1415 in Constance.The Old Prague City Hall with the astronomical clock ( orloj ). I thing you will still remember your stay in Prague.

Explore Prague outside the Square. The Old Town Square & Charles Bridge were absolutely crammed full with tourists when I visited Prague recently, but I found walking around the uncrowded parts of the city a joy. If you're a fan of Art Nouveau architecture, then the streets of Prague will amaze and delight you. The many beautiful Art Nouveau examples along the quiet streets close to the river really are extraordinary, with spectacular figural entrances & highly stylised Nouveau doorways. Away from the crowded town centre, the surrounding hills not only give fabulous views over the city, but have many interesting buildings to see.

Like time travel. You feel like any moment a lady with a big dress and pompous hairdo will come out of one of those houses and get on a carriage. At the same time there are all these modern tourists around. You feel like a time traveller.
Amazingly Beautiful. Never seen so many tourists in one place, but it was all very exciting. Stunning buildings and the Astronomical clock is just amazing. Nice bars, nice buzz. Good to visit.

Another must see stunning destination. Prague is simply an incredible city to visit. so much to see and so many places to eat. People are all very friendly and keen to help. best way to see as much as possible is to take one of the many site seeing guided tours. the square is open till 10pm so there is plenty of time to take it all in.
watch out. the square represents the heart of Prague, it is super nice, full of crowd all the time, but watch out Pickpocketing
Beautiful, be wary of the tour touts!. Wonderful place with stunning views of the famous Astronomical Clock. Only downside is the number of people touting for business, Segway tours in particular!
Crowded. Lots of tourists and that was the place tourists must go. That was part of the attraction and we could not miss it.

Always Full of Tourists - Don`t Buy Anything. I was unfortunately one of the dumb tourists who paid the equivalent of $40 for street food. You can eat like a king in this city for less than $20. Don`t be fooled. Food was great though, and the square is beautiful.

Fabulous day or night!. Old Town Square is a must to see with its beautiful historical buildings and the Astronomical clock. During the day there are street entertainers and fabulous "huts" to have amazing food while at night the square seems to be a meeting point. Loads of great restaurants with outside dining...all of which have patio heaters and blankets...just incase you feel a little chilly.

Interesting buildings ,especially the astrological clock,glockenspiel. Many places to see and eating places to enjoy,we managed it with a wheelchair,challenging but possible!! Plenty of walking so strong shoes required plus a good camera..

Beautiful historic place to enjoy a drink and lap up the surroundings. Absolutely lovely place to visit whatever the time of the day you decide to go. Something for everyone; young or old. Have a beer or try one of the traditional 'Ice creams' while watching one of the many attractions.

Great for people watching and entertainment in the sunshine. Lots of over priced cafes,but great local delicacy snack bars to try,good sitting areas,nice fruit and gift market off the square to wander around.

Old Town Square. Definately one of the best piazzas in Europe. The buildings spires are just spectacular a unique architecture. The clock is really a technical winder and a good laugh. Lots of food vendors for a quick authentic meal and use the park behind to sit down, eat and relax in the shade. Be sure to visit at night.

Beautiful but busy . Stopped by both during the day and at night. Both very very busy. Clock tower goes off on the hour with a 15 second display. 4 different types of architecture in the buildings of square. Difficult to to get a nice photo of the church due to modern buildings at the base. Worthwhile to view at night. Very expensive restaurants etc in the area
Magical Place. You just walk around it or sit there just thinking you are in a stunning beautiful place with stunning buildings, it takes your breath away. Lots to do and see there.

Hub with many sites. This is another area just teeming with tourists. However, the Astronomical clock is here along with some lovely churches. If you don't like crowds you should try and skirt along the edges to get where you want to go. Also, drinking in public is apparently allowed so as the day goes on there are groups of young men who clearly have had too much so you want to avoid that.
place to go!!!!. you are streaming in the old town and you fill that you are in a different time of century nice bars to sit and enjoy the view..

Clock trip. We just had to see this clock in action. It was well worth the wait! Rather than describe in detail what happens i think you should come and see for yourself. I do not think you will be disapointed. There always seems to be something going on in the square. One day a big band concert. The next a jazz band entertaining the crowd...

Medieval History Meets Hard Rock Cafe - It's ALIVE !!!. Both literally and figuratively the focal point of the town that side of the Voltava, the old town square is bustling with activity all day and evening. The architecture of the churches, buildings, monuments, and the square itself relates its history and local significance, but the closer inspection and ground-level views reveal the life, the energy still flowing through the cobblestone streets. Take time to observe the Astronomical Clock; inspect the stone work and inset statuaries on the balcony-like facades; walk a circle (a very large circle at that) around the square to get a complete view. Stop at one of the cafe's for a Klaster, or Urquell; on a chilly day, have a seat in the sun, or if a bit too warm, there's plenty of seating in the tree-lined small park setting as well. Take in the street performers, or just people watch. Enter the churches (I found the Huttite Church particularly beautiful inside), or just shop (the world of shopping surrounds you on every street extending from the square). You're an easy walk to many of the city's historical treasures. Take it all in.

A must see when in Prague. This charming spot, with its Asrtonomical clock and gigantic square surrounded by beautiful old buildings is one of the greatest spots when visiting Prague. Take a seat at one of the many restaurants, order a yummy Dunkel and people watch. Buskers, celebrating tourists and people from all cultures congregate here to revel in the beauty of old Europe

Full of gorgeous buildings. While the square is not the biggest one you've ever seen, it probably is the one with most historical and interesting buildings in the same place, including the Orloj (astronomical clock). Don't miss the opportunity to walk around and stop by to eat or grab something to drink while appreciating the square.

When in Prague, you must go here. Watched over by the gigantic statue of Jan Huss, the 15th century Check cleric whose radical reformist views predated Martin Luther by almost a century, Old Town Square is the center of the oldest part of Prague. It is an easy walk from the Charles Bridge, dotted with boutique-y hotels, restaurants and bars, and fabulous restored old buildings richly decorated and often marked with the "house signs" that Praguers used before they had a number system. I ranked it 4 instead of 5 because it is very crowded with tourists and too many shops geared to tourists, but it still should be seen.
Nice and beautiful . Beautiful square with lots of activities happening around. One of the must do things in Prague. Don't eat at places at the square as they super expensive
Beautiful town square, not to be missed. One of the most beautiful town squares in eastern Europe. Perfect place to people watch, grab a bite, and check out the famous astronomy clock.
History History History. Wow what a sight to see. Marvelous old buildings. The clock tower was fabulous. Imagine being in buildings older than the country I live in. WOW

Not overpriced. We stayed near here and ate and drank here most nights. Considering this is where the Astronomical Clock is you would expect it to be overpriced but it is not. Everything was very reasonable and was inline with the prices elsewhere.

Old Europe!. Old Town Square is a must-see or anybody going to Prague. It is a beautiful, clean, historic location that takes you back in time. At the same time it is filled with the hustle and bustle of smiling tourists. There are tons of restaurants , food stands , and shows. Me and my family loved it.

Good starting point. This square seems to be the heart of Old Town, and a good starting point for sightseeing and exploring in Prague. Several key sights surround the square. On the hour a large crowds assembles to see the clock "perform". Just off the square you can find same day tickets for musical performances at Via Musica by the Tyn church. Watch out for segways, we almost got run over.
A Tourist square. This place is extremely popular mainly due to the numerous attractions and cafes and the architecture.

The old Feel. The old town square is usually very crowded. Restaurants are also very expensive so if you want some Czech authentic meals at its best price try to go further blocks away from the square. The old town square is best to see at night. It gives you a medieval old feeling especially with the awesome lights created by there old lampshades.

A Must Stop. This is the tiny, quaint old town square that most people read about when researching Prague - it's everything you would want it to be. It's old, quaint, busy, happy - lots of culture, cafes and just a great hang out spot.
A hidden gem. Spent the day wandering around the streets of the old town stooped by several bars on the square and enjoyed a cold drink whilst watching the people go by lovely location

Heart of the City. This is the heart of Prague, and all roads lead to here. Make sure to walk to this beautiful square, and across the Charles Bridge. I also highly recommend walking down to Vysehrad, but it is a very long walk, so take a cab if you are not up to it. This is an incredible city and although I spent 8 days here, there was still a great deal that I missed. Spend as many nights as you can. The US dollar is very strong here so hotels, food and sights are very affordable!
Old Town. Old Town Square is beautiful. He breathes history, the atmosphere is amazing. Everywhere is full of stalls with refreshment and cake. You just have to just sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

Beautiful. Easy to walk around which gives you plenty of time to fully appreciate the stunning architecture Prague has to offer. There are lots of unique shops to nose around and you have to see the astronomical clock, it does get really crowded when it chimes on the hour but it's worth seeing. Take a walk along Charles bridge which gives you great views and itself is beautiful, get your camera at the ready :)

Definitely one of the most lively parts of Prague. Always a fun time here. No entrance tickets - just show up here and soak it in. You could walk around, admire the different buildings, catch one of the tours which begin outside the tourist information office, join the crowd outside the astronomical clock every hour, eat some local food fresh off the carts, check out the souvenir shops or just sit on a bench and observe - pick your style.

A charming old town square. We visited Prague for four days. The apartment we stayed at was very close to this charming old town square, only 8 minute walk away. Right after we settled in we walked over there to join the fun with other tourists. The square is full of history and several beautiful buildings like The Old Town Hall, Church of Our Lady before Tyn, St. Nicholas Church and Jan Hus Memorial. The most interesting was the astronomical clock. Besides pubs and restaurants the square also has vendors selling fresh roasted ham and freshly made crepes and pancakes. They were all yum yum. We went back there every day, this is the place to be.Happy Travelling!

Crowds, Segways, more crowds and hawkers!. A visit to Prague wouldn't be complete without going to the Old Town Square. It's definitely worth the trip. Take the time to explore all the side streets off the Square as each one has it's own identity. Sit outside one of the many outdoor restaurants, relax, have a drink and spend some time "people watching." If you are not interested in lunch or dinner, go as early in the morning as possible before the crowds and the hawkers. Particularly annoying are all the Segway hawkers, showing off by doing loop-to-loops in hopes of attracting business. They expect you to get out of their way which is not easy to do especially when surrounded by different tour groups wanting to stay together. Make sure you see the clock tower. Prague gets 5.5 million visitors a year and they all visit Old Town Square as it is a major tourist attraction.
Plenty to do. Really beautiful place to spend some time. Lots of good bars and restaurants. If you are into shopping there's plenty around also.
Historic, but then most of Prague is.. Avoid during mid-day hours otherwise a nice stroll especially early evening - warning of "pickpockets" but we saw nothing to be wary of.

Party central.. All roads seem to lead to the old town square. It's certainly where most tourists end up. It has many restaurants, bars and hotels around the perimeter.There is often music or street theatre in the centre of the square.It's a great place to take in the atmosphere of Prague. We ate nearby on a couple of nights, even managing to avoid the numerous stag and hen parties.

Beautiful place. It was really interesting. Many things to see. There are always some performances on the square. So many possibilities for refreshment, lunch or dinner. I recommend for you to go just little far away from the square and the prices will drop immediately for everything even souvenirs. At the square you will hear every possible language in the world. It's very popular so be prepared that there will be a huge amount of people.

Historic, lively & touristy. This square will be tourist filled, as the Astrological
Clock is a must see, but there are numerous buildings that are interesting for historic or architectural reasons. We were advised to avoid the restaurants and shops on the square as they were likely to be priced higher than elsewhere, and not have authentic Czech food.

Quite different. Clock tower & restaurants were so attractive. Be careful about crowded times such as evenings. It was also not easy to choose restaurant. So it would be good to decide before you go there. Very close to Charles bridge.

Lots to see. Lots to see and take in around the old town square and we'll worth exploring each corner lots of side streets with bars,restaurants and shops to see. The actual square does get busy and your constantly having to avoid the segway's which seem to be everywhere these days. Lots of street vendors and performers a great vibe as well so worth the visit.

Very relaxing place with rich heritage sites. Old town square can be visited anytime of the day including late night as it offers great night clubs/pubs on Dlouha street. In itself the place has important heritage monument, churches etc. Right adjacent to it is street with super luxury brand stores. Overall a must visit.

An interesting place that gives you the essence of Prague. This place is magical by day and by night. The astronomical clock tower is amazing and the hourly show of the clock chimes and creatures moving is amazing. Lots of options to eat around here. You could just sit here for an hour and would still be yearning for more. People can usually be seen performing in the open square here, and the view from the clock tower is apparently great too (didnt go up there though). Definitely on the to-do list for this city !
Buzzing with people. Plenty to do and places to eat every side road you found something different, Irish bar well worth a visit when you find it food is really good plenty of it!

Evening with rainbows. Buzzling Old town square is the must visit of Prague city. We visited in a dazzling evening just before sunset. Then we went up the astronomical clock tower. The view was stunning. All the churches and monuments are all around. A setting sun and couple of rainbows made a perfect backdrop.
Great Place. Nice place to walk around enjoy the scenery and lots of good places to eat!!!There are two wax museum to take the kids !! Lots of stores A must do if you are in Prague!!!

Beautiful square to people watch. Almost everywhere you go in Prague is going to be beautiful, but this is a must see. Go and check out the square and watch the people go by. Enjoy the buskers and take in the beauty of the architecture.
center of prague. The heart of the city where you can reach everywhere. just beware of the overly priced restaurants and the segway guys running all around

Great way to spend the morning!. In the heart of Prague's imposing and very popular town square you'll find the world's oldest Astronomical Clock. Located on top the Town Hall, with its hourly chime, the clock is a major tourist draw and has become an icon of sorts for Prague. Built in 1410, the clock indicates the phases of the moon, seasons and some Christian holidays as well. Colorful baroque houses, oodles of shops and restaurants, Gothic churches add to the lovely ambience of the popular tourist square located just between the famous Wenceslas Square and Charles Bridge. The viewing gallery on top of the Old Town Hall's tower offers magnificent views of Staromestské Námestí. A lovely way to spend the morning!
Place of the Old town . Definitely you should have diner in one of the restaurants who serve typical Czech food. The clock is also nice.

Lots to see, but can get crowded. We stayed at a hotel steps from the Old Town Square, so we visited several times, at different times of the day. We found that first thing in the morning or in the evening was the best time to visit. In the middle of the day there are huge crowds of people. Try to go in the morning and evening as the area has a different vibe at different times of the day. There are a couple of old churches that are worth the visit along with the astronomical clock. Lots of shops and restaurants. The Square is also where many of the tour companies will pick you up for your tours. One tip: There are several booths selling gifts and food. The booths selling Prague Ham list the price of the ham as 89 kc per 100g. That is about $3.70US to try 3.5 ounces. BUT, even though the price list does not say it, they try to force you to buy 400g, by saying that is the minimum that you can buy. That's almost one pound of meat for $15. I did notice that other people (read non-tourists) were purchasing smaller portions. We were not given that option even though I asked. Also, before you go, do your research on tipping and service charges.

Beautiful But Busy. I think as many have commented on the square it is fantastically beautiful but very busy unless you go early in the morning when one can better enjoy the architecture. Otherwise just find a spot and watch the World go by.
Another great sight in Prague. Another great sight to see in Prague. Shops & restaurants are all around here ,could be a bit more to eat & drink in square but not over priced
Culture. A place steeped in history. Can get busy but central to Prague and has great architecture. AND NO PIGEONS! BRILLIANT!
Beautiful Square.. A beautiful setting with many amazing sights. Just sitting down watching the world go by in this wonderful historical square.
Great area to walk around. Everything in Prague is around this area for tourists. Great places to eat and drink, lots of tourists around here. Be sure to do the Segway tour here.
Old Town Square. Amazing square in the middle of Prague. Despite hoards of tourists in the square, the beautiful buildings and the overwhelming sense of history comes through.

One of the loveliest old squares anywhere in the world. I have visited Prague many times and never fail to admire the timeless beauty of the square. Now very busy, especially near the hour mark, when the Astronomical Clock goes through its motions, the square will still find room for you. Enjoy the winter market near Christmas time, or just people watch. It's worth paying that little extra for your coffee or your beer just to enjoy the atmosphere. If you visit Prague you mustn't miss it - but do remember that Prague has much, much more to offer.

Absolutely over rated over crowded. They have "haridwar pundas" trying to sell you Segway tours every 30 seconds... More of them then the tourists... And then you have hop on hop off bus tours, vintage car tours, walking tours, cycle tours, limousine tours, tuk tuk tours, peddle Ricksaw tours, horse carriage tours, etc... So if you are with British training and polite to say atleast 'no thank you' to each one of them it barely gives you time to see what you are there to see, actually what is there to see!? Oh the clock! Really? The recommendation would be to go late in evening or early morning.
Beautiful. Lovely buildings and atmospheric too. Can get crushingly busy with tours. Plenty of bars and sidewalk restaurants

A great place to watch people.. We walked to the Old Town Square nearly every day to sit near the center and watch people. There are vendors selling food as well as a couple restaurants nearby. Our favorite was the "Meet Burger". We sat outside and ordered a hamburger and fries with beer. It was a huge burger and lots of fries. We shared everything except the beer. There was enough for both of us. The Astronomical Clock is nearby and is interesting.
A place to enjoy and reflect. It is well preserved, a people gathering place, a place reflecting the great achievement and history of Czech people and historical buildings. A must-see place.

Beautiful area and great for use as a landmark. The Old Town Square is stunning and great to use as a landmark by which to orient yourself in the somewhat confusing Old Town. There are a ton of restaurants and attractions in and around the Old Town Square and a lot of tours start from here. Plan to spend at least a couple of hours here to begin with and it's likely you'll keep gravitating towards it or at least pass through it several times during your stay.
Worth seeing. Lots of tourists but worth seeing. Enjoy a coffee or a beer while waiting. Good area to people watch.

A real old town squre!!!. The squre is very big and has lots of places to have a drink or a meal. We enjoyed walking through the squre as well as wxtching the clock(with so many other tourists standing next to us....)
Entertaining!. We got our walking tour here, the Tourist Office is here, the astronomical clock is here, many restaurants surround it. A wonderful place to hang out!

24 hour hot spot in Prague. This is one place you should be at any time of the day; if you have so many days to spend in Prague that is!We were here for a long time and were staying close to the Town Square in Karlova.Spend time seating; watching crowd go by. Or visit it at night to see the splendidly lit monuments. Ideal place for photo enthusiasts.
Fabulous clock. Visit on the hour every hour to watch the clock, gets very busy. Loads of bars and gift shops nearby. Great experience

Great place to people watch. The Old Town Square is a buzzing hive of activity with lots going on. There are restaurants, bars, cafes, shops, horse drawn tour vehicles, street food vendors, churches to visit and the wonderful ancient Astronomical clock. Everything is lit up in the evening giving a magical feel.
Nice place for photo ops and good food joints around. Wait for the clock chime every hour with the puppet dance, click many photographs, sip coffee and have palacinky

U Prince Hotel roof bar. From the U Prince Hotel roof bar you can simultaneously imbibe beer & absynth while looking out over the square and many of the rooftops of Old Town. Not all that expensive considering it claims to be one of the 15 best rooftop bars in the world!
People watching. Lovely buildings, always something going on lots of cafes and restaurants to sit and relax and people watch.

crowds don't interfere but give a festive air so there i.e. something for EVERYONE!. A perfect day helps. Ours was that. Do read up on the history of this great city. You won't be given a crash course anywhere but learn on your own what history and conflict was part if the development herewith.

Lots going on, classic postcard opportunities . The Old Town Square is easily reached from the Riverside streets within a 15 minute stroll. The square is faced on all sides by many colorful and fascinating buildings. The tower looks like a storybook creation, and around the corner is the astronomical clock. Plenty to see and do. Many street performers, carriage rides as well as some classic car taxi rides. Very unique area of the city. Many restaurants and shops on all the streets in/out of the square. A must see area.
One of the coolest place in Prague and in Europe. ten different style of architecture in a 360 degree turn. Right up there I took the Martin Tour Prague sightseeing bus tour. Totally cool!
Lively and Congenial Crowds. People of all ages enjoy themselves on the Square. Music, mines, bubble blowers keep everyone entertained. Wish we had something like this in USA.

Beautiful. A square of amazingly beautiful buildings. Lots to see, street performers, stalls, etc but very, very crowded!!! Go early to avoid tourist parties. Clock is a great little attraction - it's tower can be climbed too.
Classic Gothic architectures. Still retains the old time charm. Archaeological clock is good to see and old Gothic architectures are really beautiful to stare.

Wonderful experience. It is really to good to be at the heart of the city and all the important monumental places, palaces, market squares are at walkable distance. You can enjoy the city just by walking and explore really astonishing places, architectural work, small shops, special visits to local wonders and so on. City is worth visiting at least once in a life and it is at its best during summer. City shines in the day time and glitters in the night time.

Great place to chill out . A Beautiful square with lots to see great places to eat drink and people watch lots of side streets with shops only down side was the constant pestering to hire out a Segway how many times do you have to say no I'm not interested But well worth a visit

Lovely, but getting spoilt. It's a must do, but avoid all shops and restaurants within about 200 yards of the square. Prices are up to double in the square to what they are just a few street away. Typical commercialism I guess, but the soul is being lost rather,

Famous, classic, lots of people. I don't think there is a way to avoid the old town square if you plan to visit Prague. Lots of other places of interests are around. It is a beautiful and interesting square, but do take extra care of your personal belongings. And don't trust any exchange. If you need cash, go to bank or ATM.
Very picturesque. Lovely area with the famous Astronomical clock it's less busy before 12pm but resturaunts and bars around to take in the view you can also go on Segway tours from here
Fun stroll. We walked around this lovely area. There were outdoor markets and we ventured in and out of small shops. The stonework on the ground is gorgeous. Everything to do is in this area.
Sight seeing. Lovely area of Prague - wear comfortable shoes though as the streets are all cobble stone. Would definitely return
Best when lights on. Lots have been written, must visit when you are at Prague. Astronomical clock is located in the old town square. Close to Charles bridge, Jewish quarters.

Heart of the city . The Old Town square is a great place to go to eat, people watch, see the sights & the street entertainment. It's the heart of the city for tourism so gets busy but can also be empty if you time it right. The astronomical clock draws crowds every hour so be warned!

Weekend in Prague. Was in Prague on a 6 hour walking tour. We walked through Old Town pretty quick to get to the clock on the hour. It was VERY crowded and uncomfortable. I didn't really want to stop due to how crowded it was. Would love to come back when it is less crowded for sure.

Easter in Prague. Gorgeous, filled with Easter Market! So many booths of art work, crafts, local foods! Many historical landmarks are just off the square. There is a park near by just to sit and watch the people!

Interesting but maybe become an attraction for all the Stag and Stagette parties?. Excellent square with lots of attractive architecture around it plus all the restaurants and bars. When we were there for us there were too many parties just out to get drunk.

A little disappointing . Prague is a lovely city, with great views around the river, and a nice old town area. However this square was rather disappointing. The hordes of tourists didn't help, but it's an area you will want to see once or twice, then wonder what the fuss was about. The clock at noon is very underwhelming, and there are far too many hawkers in the square, especially those trying to get people to take a tour on a Segway - with a marketing approach that seems to be to obstruct as many tourists as possible.

An ideal place to talk a leisurely stroll. Do not expect complex attractions, just walk around the area and enjoy being submerged in a middle age square, surrounded by beautiful buildings and churches, enjoy a nice gelato, or maybe some coffee. Definitely a must.

Must see in Prague. The town Square in Prague is absolutely a must see place. Going there for an afternoon of drinks and staying for dinner to watch all the comings and goings is a delight. Great restaurants and taverns surround the square and you can go visit the famous clock Tower.
Tour group . Our 1st square that was not rebuilt after the war. So nice to see original buildings from the era they were actually built. Quaint shops and restaurants. And people, people, people!

Old Town Square. The Old Town Square is one of two main squares in Prague. Wenceslas Square is the other, just 5 minutes walk away. With its ancient buildings and magnificent churches, this is one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe.The wonderful sights on the square are the Old Town Hall Tower & Astronomical Clock & St. Nicholas Church. To soak up the beauty of the Old Town Square, sit back over a coffee or a cool beer at one of the pavement cafes at the square. Or just climb the Old Town Hall Tower for a breathtaking view of the square.
