Our favourite spot in Prague. A sunny day is a perfect time to relax at one of the many bars/restaurants and watch the world go by.From the square wander off along many of the narrow streets to reveal lots of interesting shops and cafes.A must place to see when visiting Prague
Great. A great historical place full of life, attractions, enjoyable in a sunny day , a lot of food choices. Beautiful sightseeings

Where to look first??. What an absolutely fabulous place, I didn't know where to look first. The architecture is amazing, from colourful facades, narrow cobbled streets leading to the Square, sgraffiti frontages At The Minute house where Franz Kafka was born, Town Hall, astronomical clock & Fun church. Very crowded during the day, but very good to see all the buildings lit up at night too.

Constantly busy. During the day it has the hassle and bussle of endless amount of tourist. Plenty to see, great for the entire family. Horse driven carridge, shops, churches and so on. Endless amount of cafes on the main high street, but beware, the coffee shops, cafes do seem to excessively over charge tourists..
prague in 3 days. between the smoking in and out of restaurants and in every open space; as well as graffiti on every single surface, 3 days is quite enough

Visit during the Easter Festival!. Really fortunate to have the chance to visit during the Easter festival. The square is full of different booths of food, gift items and everything in between. There are several churches and other things to see, including the Astronomical Clock nearby.If you're not there during the festival, there is still plenty to see and many shops nearby for shopping. It is in a fantastic location and not too far from many other attractions in the Old Town area.

Don't go in those overpriced restaurants on the square. Dear visitors, I'm local. Please use Tripadvisor to check the restaurants and bars on the square and in its vicinity. Lots of them are very expensive but the quality often doesn't correspond to the price. If you want to see the real Prague, try some other places and not only those touristy and overcrowded monuments you found in your Lonely Planet...

A must see in Prague. When visiting Prague, this is one of the many Old Town squares to slowly walk and absorb the sights and culture. Plenty of restaurants and bars. See the performing astrological clock.
Reference Point. Many restaurants and attractions around this area. Here you can access many walking & segway tours. Street performers and tourist spot.

Huge Old Town. Been to many cities with an old town but Prague's is very impressive with a lot of history and things to see. Also every corner you turn, there is a nice building or church, etc. As such the place is filled with tourist and to me worst than others so just be aware and try to go out early in rhe day.
The Center of life in the Old town. The clock, the restaurants, the shops! if you come to Prague you must visit the old town square! Really fascinating and full of history.

Full of shopping and tourist traps. It is like the Prague version of New York City Times Square, full f shops and restaurants, but it is also full of tourist traps, beggars, guitar players, Segway tour sales and pickpockets. Take a few photos and head to specific places to avoid the tourist traps.

Beautiful old square with remarkable buildings. Very busy with tourists especially on the full hour when the astronomical clock chimes. Excellent tourist information shop. Many restaurants on and off the square and little streets off the square with countless souvenir shops. Street performers and street food in abundance. Armed police and army presence.

Popular Square. This square in the oldTown in Prague, is a very busy place, lovely buildings to look at, among other things there is the Astronomical clock, there are many reataurants around the Square, and it is walkind distance to the River and the famous Carls Bridge

Great experience!. It's a beautiful Old Town, lot to see and dine in. Had been here many times with friends and family. Love the street traditional foods during Xmas and summer. A must to see if you're in Prague.
Watch out for the Chegways. when visiting this sguare watch out for the chegways. They charge in all directions including many people trying to get you to rent them
So much there, a must visit. You will do this in conjunction with the Astronomical clock as it is in one of the corners.Always crowded and much photographed.
very nice. lovely architecture but really full of tourists. Lots of bars, clubs, restaurants and segway hires. Who knew.
Great time . We wisited tha square every single day with my friends . It was Christmas time so.it was full with people and an open market. It was so much fun to go and try everything

Looks beautiful and is always bustling with joy.. the best place to be in prague. So much is going on here that it is difficult to keep track of time. I loved it so much that i went back the next day also.
The Astronomical Clock. Every hour on the hour the clock chimes and the 12 apostles rotate at the top of the clock. Not to be missed if you visit Prague.
A lot going on!. A lot going on on the Old town Square, especially during Christmas holidays. Easy access by metro or just approx. 10 min.walk from Vancel Square.

People watching is a plus.. Very busy, but there's a lot to see around the square. The Astronomic Clock is a must, but don't miss the other architectural details all round the square. I preferred the Church of St Nicholas to the Church of Our Lady Beyond Tyr, but both offer interesting details. I also very much enjoyed the Mucha museum - if you like Art Nouveau, then it's well worth a stop in. The same museum also offers Dali and Warhol, but you pay more for each exhibition, and neither of those had the links to Prague of Mucha.

I love this place. Staromětské náměstí (Old Town Square) is the heart of old Prague. In last 25 years it was very well restored. The best view is from above, be it the Cityhall tower on any other elevated place. And if you see it lighted in the evening ... :-)
Worth a walk round. Very quiet in the rain, but full of Segway touts and tours in the sunshine! Lovely old square, eorth a walk around, avoid the sway touts!
Very Busy place.. Met a tour group in the square and loved it busy atmosphere. Great place to grab some snacks and people watch.

Good place to start from. The square is centrally located, you can walk to the Jewish Quarter or Republican Square from there. The Astrological Clock is the big attraction but there is also lots to see, plenty of palces to eat adn drink.
So many segways and no where to sit. A busy square with a number of stalls along the outer edge, severing hot food and drinks along with some souvenirs.
Old Town Square. We came back day after day and saw something different each time. I loved the architecture and the history of the buildings.
Absolutely amazing!!. Heard about it a thousand times but when you see it for the first time, well come and see!! I am visiting Praha for the first time, a week, I make my homage every day11

Amazing place. Take a walk at night time on the Karlov Bridge.. Prague you need at least 2- 3 days. A lot to see. Nice place! Must see. 100% recommended. We been in May. Weather was +20C. Very nice people and friendly atmosphere.Spent some money on souvenirs.

Great Meet up Point. Great Meet up Point although as per very busy with tourist, Usually lots of stalls about to peruse, Gets extremely busy by the clock so be prepared to have to push your way through, Be aware of pickpockets here caught a wee lad trying to steal out a lassies handbag in front of us. Lots of police around so he was quickly taken care of....

Must Visit. We spent quite a lot of time here in our two day visit to Prague, mainly because it is beautiful and there is so much to see. The astronomical clock is there, and the square itself is gorgeous. There are many, many souvenir shops surrounding which were great, lots of restaurants (though probably not the cheapest you'd find) and lots of street food/more specific shops. There was also a great street performer on one of the evenings we went and we were very entertained! Definitely take a visit while you're in Prague.

A fun place - Day and Night. You can not just miss Old town square even if you want to. It's right at the center of old town. Most of the pubs and cafes and restaurants are at walking distance from old town square. Don't miss the famous astronomical clock - It announces every hour with 12 apostles passing by the window above the astronomical dial and with symbolic sculptures moving aside.Though it seems highly overrated just by looking at the show, you will really appreciate once you know complete working and details of the clock. Give special attention to this clock during your free walking tour (assuming you are taking one, which is a must).
Town Square. We went here with a tour guide. It is a place you could just explore by yourself as well. So beautiful and historic!
The place to be.. If you dont go there you will miss a big part of the old prague. A lot of shop, cafe and bar. Dont be shy to go in and vistit them.
Beautiful!. Old Town Square is a beautiful area and best recommended to walk throughout old town and just "get lost" as there are plenty of shops, food, and beautiful sights to see!!

Mesmerizing. I was extremely lucky enough to visit this lovely square during Easter celebrations. The place looked liked taken from a fairy tale story. People were in festive mood and the square was beautifully decorated. It's undoubtedly one of the most beautiful squares across entire Europe; with stunning architectural beauty. The Astronomical clock still plays every hour and is definitely a treat to watch.

" Old Town Square". Old Town Square another example of the city's fine architecture. Daytime is teh best to see the astronomical clock at the Old Town Hall.Prague wasn't bombed during the World Wars like most of Europe was, and as a result the architecture is intact and absolutely stunning.

A Glimpse into the Past with Stunning Architecture. There is something majestic about an old town square like this. If you can ignore the segway tours and tourists in shorts, it feels like you stepped back through town. Prague wasn't bombed out during the World Wars like much of Europe was, and as a result the architecture is intact and absolutely stunning. Aim for daytime for best visibility to see the astronomical clock at the Old Town Hall in all its glory at the top of the hour.Try to wander through when there's enough light to see the details of the buildings. There are a lot of walking and segway tours going through with guides shouting to be heard, so you might actually catch some history even if you don't join a tour. Pick up a sweet, cinnamony trdelník pastry from one of the many vendors to enjoy as you look around if you don't need your hands for a camera (though it's a great place for some amazing photos on a sunny day). Watching your purses, camera cases, etc is necessary and prudent as on my trip one friend found an outside pocket of her purse open even though she doesn't use that pocket and another found that her purse strap had been cut (luckily she was using a travel bag with wire, so her belongings were safe).
Lovely place. Another fine example of the city's architecture and well worth looking around. There is much to see and do here.
Old Town. Lovely old town square with a lot of boutique shops and restaurants with outside seating. The grand astronomical clock tower there plays at every hour
to be transport to the past..... a nice place, pretty square where you can remember an important part to the Check history.- Also small kiosk sale traditional food
Best Old Town Square in the World!. Superb setting...no matter the day or time...always photo-worthy. Lots of street performers and musicians make for a wonderful time to just sit and chill.
beautiful square stunning architecture. visited at Christmas simply stunning lots to eat and drink so much to see and do will go back again soon

A memorable place to visit. The Prague old city square and the Prague city is worth a visit, it is having a very unique and different taste compared to other European cities. the ppl are really simple and easy going, enjoy life. a lot of attractions to see, the astronomical clock and you can talk a walk up to Charles bridge ( a bit long but interesting). the cafes and restaurants around worth your while.

Beautiful Gothic square just mind the segways. A really beautiful and interesting example of Gothic architecture, worth seeing both during the day and at night. A good place to start or end your day. Plenty of cafes around the square where you can sit and watch the world go by whilst enjoying a coffee or a beer. Only downside is the segways they are a real nuisance.

A must in Old Town. When you are in Old Town you must visit the square. Its a large square just on the east side of the river. Lots of restaurants and tour groups! Check out the clock and then make your way towards Charles Bridge.

Just fun . There is just nothing but fun about this place. Lots of activity, street performers, music, restaurants, etc. Of course, we are not talking 5 star venues here, but it's busy and fun. A great place to people-watch, chase huge bubbles, and watch vaudeville performers. We spent many an hour sipping a glass of wine and watching the show. The views are great, second to none. If you're looking for refined entrainment, go somewhere else. But if you want to experience some plain old fun, come here.
Beautiful. Beautiful buildings and interesting architecture , lots of nice cafes and restaurants , the Czech people are so friendly and hospitable . Can't wait to return

Nice atmosphere. This place is one of the most popular touristic attractions in Prague therefore it can be really overcrowded even in the evenings. Many visitors come there to stare at twelve apostles appearing every hour at the unique astronomical clock (the Orloj) on the tower of the gothic The Old Town Hall. One must be aware also of the Segway riders crossing the Old Town Square in all directions.

Nice. This was really a beautiful area and would have enjoyed it more but there was the marathon happening and we really couldn't appreciate the view and take pictures like we wanted. But we really got to explore a lot of other places because of the marathon.
Must see first. all people usually start the tour in prague from this Square which have many historical building and the famous clock , then you can walk to start Charles bridge !

Fun Sqaure. A friend and I were traveling together and by some weird coincidence, we had other friends who were in prague at the same time! We met them in the square and walked around a bit, it had a lot of nice restaurants around, but we didn't go in any of them. It was a cool place that I think everyone should go if they are in Prague.
Great place to see. A great place to see, lots of history. Consider a tour guide if you want to know more about the history in detail.
Buzzing area. Great selection of bars and restaurants. Great atmosphere day or night. Gets very crowded on the hour to view the astronomical clock

Popular location. This is a very popular location, with lots of restaurants, activities, and sights to see. Roam down the small ally ways to discover unusual shops or street markets. Don't miss the astronomical clock, at the old Town Hall.
GREAT PLACE. We visited this place along with forty people in a group in late evening ,it looks very grand illuminated with lots of lights Must visit

A Beautiful Part Of Prague - Another Must See. The Old Town Square is literally 5 minutes down the road from The Intercontinental Prague, down "Parizska" Ave, where all the high end shops are and the Old/New Synagogue.Once there, you are just round the corner from the Astronomical Clock, don't forget also to visit The Old Town Hall (Next Door To The Clock) - The square is home to a lot of street entertainers, Museums & a Gallery (Works by Warhol, Dali & Mucha) you will find plenty of places to eat and drink here also.This area is normally the start for "Sight-Seeing" tours, there are numerous horse drawn carriages that parade this area that offer a "Better" look of Prague together with the "EKOExpress" train that I can definitely recommended, costing 280Kc for Adults & 250Kc for students this 60 minute trip starts & ends at "Old Town Square" but visits "Lesser Town", "The Loreto", "Prague Castle / Castle Square" back through the Lesser Town then down Parizska Ave passed the Jewish Town and the New/Old Synagogue back to the Old Town Square.Overall, this is a very nice place just to sit and enjoy and relax and watch the world go by.
Interesting place. The historic square is one of the most popular places in the city. It is very crowded but still has lots to see.

In the midst of masses. Walked Down here today on the way to the Jewish quarter. In the midst of teeming hordes on a nice day. Easy to get lost in a city you are unfamiliar with. Prague is not really prepared for these crowds and you are really on your own trying to find venues. Plenty of food, drink around, bathrooms for charge too. Maps are not great, signs awful. Good luck
Fantastic place. a very nice place to visit , don't miss it if you ever travelling to Prague , it is very nice to walk around this area

Allways busy and interesting. We were in Prague at Easter and lots of activities in the old town square. Good really at any time, lotsa of market style stores, food and history. Good place for crystal.

What a Great place to start a tour. We met our free walking tour manager he was just fantastic. Found him on the internet.
We were told the history of the old town including the Jewish quarter and the changes over the last thousand years. Very good tour made arrangements to join further tour of the Castle.

Visit the inside of Old Town Hall. Yes, yes, we all know about the astronomical clock viewed by thousands of persons every day, but if you want a real treat and are a history fan go inside the building by use of a door to the left of the clock and purchase your ticket for the guided English visit. The hall itself is now used for functions of the Prague mayor, but you will visit the chapel with plaques from the 1400's, you will see the historical Council hall and the Municipal hall with its staircase leading to the medieval prison where the Bohemian rebels who lost at the battle of White Mountain spent their last hours before being executed by the Habsburg Emperor in 1621. Walk through the Romanesque cellers 6-14 feet below street level which were also used to hold prisoners. The main vestibule in the Old Town Hall is decorated to celebrate the real and mythological history of Prague. You will also get an inside close-up of the apostles normally only viewed from the outside of the the astronomical clock. This is an hour well spent. p.s. make sure that you have the $$$ to pay for the use of the inside toilet since the lady on duty really "went after" a man who tried to use the facility without paying--great entertainment.

Very nice place to hangout . Very nice place to hangout in Prague.One can sit and enjoy whole day.In night all kind of services all are available be it cabaret, strip dance bar etc . Many guys will takr you to different strip bar , dance bar. This place is very lively and is a must visit place in Prague.

Always a pleasure. Fun 24/7. You should see it during the daytime and when lit at night. This time I did however witness two beggars fighting over location between Tyn Cathedral and St. Jacobs. Also in front of Moser Glass were two nefarious types. Quiet but eyeballing people. Strong police presence. Shy of that incredible history and incredible architecture. I downloaded an app for self guided tour and it was really good. Saved me money and could break it up depending upon where I would be each day. This is my favorite area in the city by far.Enjoy.

The place to see. The old square is the place to see. There are lots of restaurants, cafes to sit and people watch. There are lots of buildings to look at and street entertainers. Lovely ice-cream vendors.
Beautiful & Entertaining. This is a big and busy area. A lot to see and do, and it isn't difficult to find somewhere to eat. There is a lot of history in the square so if you can - get a guided tour.

Nice buildings and the astronomical clock. In the square it-self there wasn't much to see, but the buildings. There was a lot of restaurants there, but they were a bit more expensive than the restaurants further a way from old town.

Crowded, But a Must See in Prague. Old town Square is very unique and beautiful. There are many places to eat and you will be able to take many great photos. It is bustling with people and that is the one downfall. I'm sure it is much worse in season. But you should go no matter what. The architecture is gorgeous and unique. Sometimes there are musicians and the people are very friendly. Of course, there are many many tourists in this area. But it is for good reason. There is a little trolley you can take to tour the city that starts here. There are also cool convertible cars, which I recommend.

Loved the Christmas Market!. This was my first Christmas Market I've been too and I loved it. Lots of intersting things to browse through. Loved the food stands! It was decorated real nice for the holidays.

Enjoy the architecture and crowds. Wonderful place to soak in the architecture of Old Praha. Beautifully designed buildings. The crowds can be a little too much at times so watch your pockets and belongings.
Awesome. Full of people, lots to see. Awesome atmosphere. Great stalls for food. Worth a visit. Be careful with your belongings like in any big cosmopolitan tourist attracting city.

Lots to see and do. Stopped here for couple of days on a tour and really enjoyed it. I was overwhelmed by the history, beauty and shopping. The fresh grilled ham and bread that i bought in between shopping was delicious. I walked for couple of hours until I was exhausted
Fun place to be. Beautiful envirioment, fun to watch, magnificent buildings, the cathedral is beautiful, so the astronomical tower

Amazing outdoor marketplace. What a fun place to visit! The Old Town Square in Prague is filled with vendors, food booths and positive energy! Lots of fun to sample the very fresh and delicious "street" food and try new dishes. The vendors have very unique items that are fun to buy for souvenirs as a remembrance of Prague. The beautiful architecture surrounding the square is so stately and picturesque - especially at night when everything is lit! We loved it!
Popular attraction. There were a large number of tour groups with the obligatory umbrellas waving about, but away from them it was much more pleasant and less crowded.

Rich in Culture and historic !!!!. An amazing cultural and historic combination. Nice kind and smiling faces all around. people live their lives in present. no hush hush. different special foods display will be seen around the old town. home made recipies. And then the plays and artists from different interior villages with different types of talent would be seen.

Great place to spend the day.. Lots of things to do and see. Many shops, restaurants and an outdoor market. Be sure to take the elevator up to the top of the tower - don't need to avoid it because of the stairs. Ban selfie-sticks, since the people with them completely jammed up the viewing platform.
Travel back in Time. You will find yourself gravitating back to the Square - try the Prague Ham. Day or night you will fine people everywhere having fun

Pigeons.. This beautiful place was spoilt by the MANY hawkers/ Salesmen and refugees around the place. Every step was hindered by beggars asking for money and people trying to sell you rubbishy goods. There were thousands of Pigeons, and people feeding them. Apart from this the area was lovely and the buildings beautiful.
Interesting place to have a drink. Big square, worth the visit to see it but not a lot to stay for. We had drinks and did some people watching.

Centerpiece of a magnificent city. Old Town Square with its Cathedral, Astronomical Clock, Monuments and General Ambiance rivals any city in Europe. I would wager that an objective visitor would compare this location favorably with London, Paris, Vienna or any other of the European Metropolises. From a price standpoint, it far exceeds those cities in value. I am only sorry that I waited so long to visit as it was a total delight.
History. Many things to see and learn. Shopping and restaurants are close by. Historical buildings and the Jewish sector within walking distance.

Old Town Square, Prague. There was Easter Market in this old town square.There were many small temporary shops which serve the specialties of Czech Republic.You can definitely spend several hours leisurely walking Old Town square and the surrounding streets.

One of my favourite spots in Prague. You can just sit there and watch life happen. Soap bubbles all over the square, musicians playing, the smell of pancakes and sausage, the ancient buildings and the colored houses, the museums and the restaurants, the small shops... Just relax.

A MEDIAEVAL DREAM. Dominated by the Gothic spires of the Church of The Lady Before Tyn, this is the beautiful centre of a lovely town quarter, step back into the hub of a mediaeval town - watch the street life, magicians on their poles, people with painted faces (modern robotic style but hey), horses, segways, - all surrounded by stunning buildings with their own decorative signage. Interesting alleyways/lanes lead off into other areas, twisting so you can't quite see to where. Follow me, they say.

Beautiful Place. When you first walk into the square be ready to be amazed. Look around and just take in the beautiful architecture of the magnificent buildings. We found that there was a wonderful atmosphere. Lots of tour operators offering guided tours but not in your face. Took no thank you for an answer and were very friendly. We did take a segway tour of the city which was the highlight of our trip. Don't be afraid to try it as they give you a little training before you do it. It's very easy. Also don't be afraid to bargain with them on the price.
Great place. Even if you're just walking arround, or stay at a caffe or restaurant, admire a street performer, or waitting for the clock to sing, this is not a place to miss when you're în Prague.

Christmas market. The best Christmas Market in Prague and perhaps the best in all of Europe. Interesting genuine Czech vendors with lots to eat and drink. The scene is quite amazing with horse drawn carriages and lighting of all the historic buildings and trees. The view down from the clock tower is definitely worth the admission. You can definitely spend several hours leisurely walking Old Town square and the surrounding streets.
So much to see. Another busy place but what can you expect so much history to see. Loved the clock tower you can climb up to the top the views are amazing.

Cathedral, clock, restaurants... Great afternoon spot. A beautiful place to relax for a while, and take in your surroundings. The clock chimes on the hour and there are lots of restaurants where you can stop for a drink and wait for it. Must see experience!

Disney Prague. Walking near- and on the Old Town Square is always an adventure for me. Every moment of the day is different. Every minute of the day gives you a different view because of the light, the shadow, morning - noon- and afternoon - evening - night, sunny - rainy day. That makes PRAGUE UNIQUE! If you walk with around Prague with your head up, you will discover more beautiful things! The entire market square is full off nice decorated facades of very historical buildings. I adore it!!!
Great crowd... Good hang-out place. Must see place... You can spend hours at this place admiring the people and the architecture.Multiple options to eat and drink.
Easter Market Central. The place to be for a great Easter Market. A vibrant atmosphere with plenty of food, drink and gifts.

A must see!. This area of Prague is fascinating! Be sure to be on hand for the hourly astronomical clock mechanical performance! Climb to the top of the Old Town Hall for amazing views of this beautiful city.
Beautiful buildings. There is a buzz in the square. Full of interesting buildings and buskers. A lovely place to watch the world go by. This where lots of guided tours start.

Nice place, but beware of pricey restaurants. Nice square with interesting buildings, performers, etc. The place of the best Prague's Christmas market if you are in Prague in December. The restaurants and cafés on the square, as well as close around it are overpriced, so beware where tou sit down and check the price list first.
Stunning Prague. Stunning city oozing history. Easy to walk around, we used the Lonely Planet book to guide us and felt like we covered most things
Crowded. Lots of activity and lots to see, watch you purse or wallet. Local food a challenge for us so we had great pizza in the area.

A must see, but be prepared to be bombarded by Segways. A lot larger than I had anticipated and surrounded by loads of fantastic restaurants and views. The one down fall is you get harassed by Segway tour operators and guides offering pub crawls, especially if you are a woman. When you politely decline the offers they persist relentlessly.
Wow.....great!!. Lots to see and explore. Architecture fantastic loads of different cultures on tours and plenty of restaurants around for people watching

Nice place to see. Old town -staromestske namesti is very nice place. You can admire here the Astrological watch painted by Czech painter Manes - figures are moving every hour. Please, be aware that this is the tourist location and that prices at the restaurants are little higher as usual. And as always on places where are maany people, be carefule on your belongnings.

A fine example of a classic Baroque square. This square, with its fine, well preserved buildings is a cousin to those to be found in many Austrian and Bavarian cities. Perhaps not very original but with a feeling of well being and stability which must have provided a sense of continuity to the Czech population during the unending years of Soviet occupation.
Lovely. Beautiful architecture and interesting astronomical clock. Another must-see in Prague. Shame about all the people on Segways getting in the way - shouldn't be allowed in busy areas.
Love it here!. Wonderful place to visit. I was there everyday. So many beautiful buildings and so many shops and restaurants and things to do there.
Amazing architecture!. Uniqueness of the each building tells us of the richness of the Czech culture and of course how clean they keep the city.

A key feature of Prague city centre. A wonderful square, full of gorgeous architecture, old buildings, shops and eateries. Also the central point for the departure of a range of Prague tours by bus, carriage, trolley and seqway.

Splendid place. Heart of the city. .marvellous and deserves max time that you can allocate. .very lively and great eating out options. ..visited this place twice in 3 months as a tourist and it was equally charming second time too
City break . Stunning architecture in a beautiful and friendly city . Loads to see and lovely restaurants all so reasonably priced . Czech it out!

The square. Experience the square before heading to the bride, and other side of the side. You can see the astronomical clock and entertainers doing their fete. There are offerings for tours, and Segway rides to see more given the streets are cobblestones. Yes hard on your shoes and feet.

Wonderful colours and architecture. I love the architecture & colourful buildings in Prague. If you are visiting this city the a look at Old Town Square and the astronomical clock is a must. There's also a great selection of cafes to choose from.
Beautiful. The old town square is filled with so much characters and charm. You will love watching people walking by and the cafes and shops.

Enjoy the life and feel the good atmosphare from one of The May. Old Town Square is the heart of historic Prague and is often called The city's most beautiful place. Here are Gothic spiers projecting on top of the Tyn church tower and most of the buildings are adorned in Baroque facades and you really feel you go 600 years back when you step onto the town square. The Square has always been a lively place, today it's one of the most popular parts of the town Both for Czechs and visitors from abroad, and offers plenty of restaurants, pubs, shops, entertainment, galleries and museums. The history goes back to 11th century when it served as a marketplace. It was known throughout whole Europe at that time. The Square began as a central marketplace I Prague. Within the next subsequent centuries buildings of Romanesque, Baroque and Gothic styles was built around the Square, and each of them had stories of rich merchants and intrigues. In the center Stands Jan Hus Monument raised on July 6 1915 to mark the 500 anniversary of his death. He was one of the forerunners of the Reformation and in 1415 he was accused of heretic, anathema to the Church and burned on the bonfire.

Weekend City Break in Prague. My two day City Break in Prague one of the best weekend breaks I have experienced. It is a compact city designed for walking and exploring its many sites, where prices are reasonable and the politeness and helpfulness of the Czechs towards visitors helps create a relaxed atmosphere.
Beautiful. Go early to avoid the crowds. We visited in April and it was already very busy by midday. You need emptiness really to appreciate the beauty of the buildings all around the square.

Fascinating and fun!. Old Town Square is huge, full of interesting and entertaining characters and surrounded by wonderful old buildings. On the hour, crowds gather before the astronomical clock to watch the animations. Prices at cafes in the square are high though, and it's better to wander off the square when you've seen enough.

A beatuiful place just to stroll by. Very nice plaza with plenty things to see (Clock tower, the church and the monument). The place is usually filled with tourist and for a right reason.Here you can get a glimpse of Imperial Prague and how beautiful it is, all the buildings are worthy of note, especcialyy the Clock Tower.Awesome place also to get some street food.
Must see in Prague. Picturesque, always full of tourists. Great restaurants and much of the year hosts various markets and events. Don't miss the Celestial clock, or the view from the tower.
Old Town Square. It is quite interesting to see the different buildings in this square. Looking at them from a distance you can admire their appealing looks and character.
Large town square with wonderful Astronomical Clock. Very busy square. Watch for pick pockets when the mid-day performance of the clock is ongoing. Places to eat and drink on the square.
beautiful. great historical place, loved it. It's right in the city centre and famous street Parizska which is full of luxurious shops is just next to this beautiful square.

Wonderful historic square. Fabulous place to visit lovely atmosphere especially at night when the buildings are lit up. Nice to sit enjoy a coffee and take in the scenery a very busy area especially around the astronomical clock but don't be put off by the crowds just go with tbe flo oh and watch out for the segways!

Romance all around. A place worth remembering in Prague.it's ambience,sizzling life,couples dancing on live music,gothic style well preserved buildings,nearby astronomical clock...all adds to the romantic chilly February afternoon at old town square....a must visit place in Prague.
Beautiful. Loved the square so many lovely buildings and the famous clock. Had a cocktail in a rooftop bar overlooking the square which was special. It really is a beautiful place.

Beautiful, but full of tourist hunters.. Worth seeing for its history and beauty and there are some free tours, but ultimately it is filled with people trying to make money off us! So it pays to be prepared for that reality, and know what you want from the visit. Look out for rogue segways!

Great spot, lots of culture. We stayed in Prague for 3 days and was in walking distance of this historic square. There are a lot of people that come here and lots of things to see and do. This is a must do if in Prague.
The heart of Prague. Square is clearly the heart Prague, but the small streets nearby, especially the ones who aren't so crowded, definetaly worth a visit.

By far .....TOP 5 places to see. During a business trip I had the opportunity to spend a few days in old town Prague. I could have spent another week just walking the streets and shopping. Incredible town and incredible people.....Loved it and will return next year.

Always packed with tourists, always lovely to look at.... Fascinating place, very evocative and atmospheric...... If you get there early enough. It becomes a packed tourist hive from around 10am - hawkers, touts, guided tours, hundreds of people, shuttling around in groups. Still unmissable, though. In good light, it's stunning. In the rain...... Still stunning.

What a wonderful old square. . A visit to this square is will worth your time.
There is lots to see through the narrow streets and at the square you will be very happy you came to Prague.
Very nice!. I went with friends and we took a tour starting in this square, It's very nice, specially all the history around here.

Old Town Square - beautiful part of Czech history. This place is - based on the opinions of many tourists - the most beautiful square in Europe. Tourists visit the square mainly due to the Astronomical Clock, which follow a moving apostles. This place has its own magical atmosphere that you can feel the rich history of this place. The most popular building on the square is the Town Hall (with the Astronomical Clock mentioned above) construction of which began in the 14th century. This building used as the base the house of buyer WOLFIN even from the 13th century. On the Old Town Square we can also see other very nice historic buildings - St. Nicholas church, House at the Stone Bell - the most precious Gothic House in Prague, Jan Hus Monument, House at the Golden Unicorn, Cathedral Mother of God, Pauline Monastery and many others. Surrounding the square you can walk the beautiful, ancient streets and you can feel whole history of Czech. This place has its special magic atmosphere in spring, summer, autumn as well as in winter. Absolutely special picture you can see during Christmas time, when the square is dominated by the Christmas tree, Christmas markets take place here and many people are walking with smiles on their faces.

Best Christmas experience in my life. Absolutely amazing experience, the old town square at Christmas time is even more amazing than i hoped for. There is usually a choir of an orchestra playing (for free), enough place to sit and watch families and friends gather around to drink gluwijn and beer while eating pretzels and other foods. For Christmas eve me and my wife bought food and something to drink and just watched Christmas lights and people enjoying life. The astronomical's clock story is absolutely amazing, I would not really to to spoil the experience so go on a free tour, the meeting point is every hour from 9am to 2 pm, in front of the madam tassau wax museum. 5 me from the old town square.
Heart and soul of Prague. Square is clearly the heart and soul of Prague. Every journey through town passes through square and clock viewing is a must. As are the bubble blowers
Amazing place. Central part of Prague, a must see when visiting this beautiful city. Amazing food markets, great for lunch. Great atmosphere

Worth spending a day!. Besides watching the Town Hall Astronomical Clock strike the hour, the restaurants are picturesque, the art deco building facades from around 1900 are beautiful and the museum across from the Town Hall is worth a trip. The tour of the Town hall itself will give you a backstage show of the intricate clock, a view of the old underground city and a guided introduction to Czech history. Watch the jugglers and the musicians entertain and give them a few Koruna for their efforts.

Beautiful historic square worth visiting. We came across the Old Square whilst out walking and it is a MUST to visit. The roof line all the way round is a sight to behold on its own. There is usually a lot going on in the square to amuse and/or entertain the crowds. One evening, we sat in a street restaurant opposite the Astronomical clock and waiting - with front row seats- for the clock to strike the hour! Highly recommended!You can see the Tyn Church, the Old Town Hall where you can climb up to the top of the Tower for an unprecedented view of the roof tops of Prague, the Jan Hus Memorial and St Nicholas Church. Enjoy a coffee at a pavement café and just people watch. Perfect!

Lovely to sit and see the world pass by. Its one of those European Town Squares with lovely heritage buildings. Close to the famous Clock. You can opt for one of the free walking tours there to see and learn about the history around the square. There are shows and performances by locals that one may enjoy by sitting on the benches there. Wear proper walking shoes and visit.

Easter Market. If you happen to be in Prague near Easter, you will be able to visit the Easter market which is lots of fun! You can buy traditional products, food and drinks and the atmosphere is fun and lively. This is one of our favourite squares in the world and it changes depending on the season. The only downfall is the dumb segways that are just plain annoying and dangerous!

great place to chill and people watch. We were really impressed with the old town square. The restaurants are a little more expensive but don't rush you to move. You are as welcome having a coffee or a three course meal.The atmosphere is really lovely and there is always something to see day or night.
crowded and watchout for the segways. Lots of shops and food and drink, very busy with alot of segways zigzaging the squareclock is very cool good choice of places to eat around whole square
So much history!. We spent a good amount of time admiring the buildings and the square. We also had a cup of coffee in the restaurants and relaxed seeing people walk by.

The brightest place in the city. Wherever you look, you will see a beautiful and historically significant building/monument/cathedral. The square is so full of living historical images and characters, that you may get a headache of these bright colours, in a good way, of course:)
Old town square. Great area of Prague lots to see & do very impressive buildings great places to eat & drink plus loads of shops.

The best place in Prague!. The Old town square is always full of tourists and surrounded on all sides by beautiful buildings, some old colorful ones whereas some are the iconic and famous ones.Dont forget to go to the top of the astronomical clock tower to see a superb view of the city of Prague, full of red roofs - I have attached some pictures from the top, here.

great architecture.... If you enjoy and appreciate well preserved buildings and monuments, its a nice place to walk about and around..alot of tourists, so its a tourist trap of sorts..alot of tour groups out haggling their services…kind of annoying if it's not what you are looking for...

Awesome !. One of the greatest medieval squares in all of Europe.Very touristy with high priced drinks and food but a must see! Great photo opportunities both night and day and a huge police presence.

Since the clock tower is here see that review. Lots of food available, although we did not buy any as well as souvenir shops. Lots of people always gathered as well as meeting others and picking up tours. Very picturesque.
Pretty and representative of the architecture. Cute cafes and shops, places to book tours. Very pretty.p and easy access by metro and tram systems.
amazing. it is a great place not only as the architecture is amazing, but there is the astronomical clock, so many secrets, find out more before coming!

Must go up the clock tower for the view. Very busy around the astronomical clock - get there 10 mins before the hour but you should get a good view as it is not so high up the tower as we imagined.Go up the tower for the wonderful view of the city, castle etc from the top and a bonus if you are over 65 - it is half price. There is also a two-stage lift from inside the town hall (one goes to the 3rd floor where you buy the ticket, then you choose either the lift to the top or walk up a spiral path with history boards & old photos on the walls - the trouble with this option is that the final part is a very narrow, spiral staircase which can be problem if meeting people coming down! So take the lift!!)Back down, watch out for the Segways everywhere in the square.

Stay in the Square. The square has it all...beauty, history, culture,
and excitement. Of course there is night life, opera and various music. Restaurants within walking distance. Old town is another tour with a different experience than day time.

Old Town Square. Lovely square in the Old Town which is the focal point in Prague City Centre. Many nice restaurants, bars and shops located around the square. The astronomical clock is also in the Old Town.

One of the best people watching spots in the world. When you combine the comfort in one of the bars or restaurants with the heated seating areas ( so good in winter) with the great beer and food and a busy and historic square it is onlyreally surpassed by St Marks Sq Venice -but cheaper!!!

Awesome. What a fabulous place. Amazing architecture at every turn. Great atmosphere and loads of places to eat and drink. Statues, shops and entertainers galore.
A really wonderful place during the day and spectacular at night.
Brilliant!
Historic beautiful place. Lovely town square with lots of places to eat and drink with Shops too. Only 10/15 walk from Prague city centre. Can book local tours here too.

Beautiful, Leave Yourself Time. Unfortunately, I was not given much of an opportunity to really explore the area due to an insufficient amount of time on our tour, but aesthetically speaking, it's gorgeous. I'd recommend it as a place to people watch, since there are SO many people around, and plenty of cafes with outdoor seating to grab a coffee or tea and watch the world go by. There was a wonderful Big Band-esk group performing while we were there that sounded lovely. They made me wish my swing dancing partner was with me on the trip so we could bust out our moves, though that probably wouldn't have been the best idea on the cobblestones. I'm sure on a nicer day, there would have been more street performers there that would have been equally as good.Oh, and definitely bring your camera because there's PLENTY to look at, like the 21 white crosses. Also, make sure you're there just before the top of the hour to get a good view of the Astronomical Clock. To be honest, the performance itself is a little overrated, but the fact that it's still working after all these centuries is pretty impressive. On top of that, it's quite a lovely clock.Although I was not a huge fan of Prague, I'd go back if just to better explore the square.

Take a tour guide. There is so much to see that without a guide u miss out.Every hundred yards there is another story to tell. The 27 that were beheaded, the uprising, the heresy victims etc...Plus the variety of stores and restaurants - the beer and the BEER!!!

Relaxing walk. I took a relaxing walk in the evening here. It's quite crowded but you can enjoy the view and also choose a terrace where you can eat and drink. There are various people singing or doing other nice shows here. I really enjoyed the atmosphere!
You can't go to Prague without time spent here. The heart of the old city, filled with people, cafe's and all the tour walking guides you might want to join. Just follow the umbrella's.

Old Town Square . Absolutely amazing place,beautiful buildings the architecture is amazing,the town clock,which is very popular,the crowds gather upto about 15mins before to watch the clock strike on the hour,it does get really busy in the square,there is a lot too do too keep you entertained with lots of cafés and bars and lots of street entertainment,keep a eye out for people on the segways they seem to think they have right of way on public areas,overall a great place to visit

In the middle of it all. The sights and sounds of the square are wonderful. It can get very congested with people so keep an eye on travel partners as it can be easy to lose people among the crowds. There are many restaurants to tantalize your taste buds.

You can not take enough photos.. Visit the clock, walk through the ally ways, stop and have a coffee, fins somewhere out of the way, they are offer warmth and feeling you can not believe. Go up into the tower of the old city building. Have a meal, take in the sights and if you are lucky you will get to see it covered in snow, truly breathtaking.

My favourite place in Prague. If you're the type who enjoys good food, good music and friendly homely vibes. Chill out here in the evenings. I was there for the Easter markets with my girlfriend and it was truly a beautiful place to be. There's plenty of places to eat, fresh food to go all around and plenty of activity going on in the evenings. The only thing that's annoying are those petty drug dealers who stand and whisper weed and Coke as you walk by. Almost like Amsterdam. They don't hassle you though unless you stare at them, giving them the idea that you are a potential customer. It's a nice place to go for a stroll with your loved ones or friends overall. Don't miss out!
A vibrant place. Be there any time of the day. Spent an hour or two looking around . The food and drinks can be expensive yet worth it. Many tours start from here. Worth visiting.

People watching central!. If you want a true buzz - and excitement level - combined with history and architecture - just look up - this is your kid of place. The vibe of the square is remarkable - the clock tower and its automation - the church spires, all combine with street performers and tourists to raise anyone's pulse.Be aware of the usual petty thieves, especially after dark - but do go and experience!

Beautiful and fun, all in one!. This is a definite must when you are in Prague, for you see so much while you're there! It does get really busy on the weekends, no matter what time of year, so would recommend during the week if you can. But if you do go when you can, you will not be disappointed!

One of the prettiest town squares . This is a great town square complete with multiple churches and outside restaurant seating. Horse drawn carriage rides and old vintage car tours. Lots of booth foods too. The astronomical clock is just off of the square.

Fantastic - Just watch out for the prices!. This has to be one of the most delightful squares in Europe. It is surrounded by fantastic buildings, with a key attraction being the Old Town Hall (well worth going up the tower) and astronomical clock. It has a lot of hustle and bustle with street entertainers, bands, etc.As with any key area such as this, bars and restaurants can be a little more pricey, but the prices are clearly displayed, so at least you know what you're in for. This is true in most cases, although, as another reviewer pointed out - be wary of the 'Prague Ham' stalls. I too had a bad experience here. I just wanted a small portion to try it and this is what I asked for. They served me up a huge plate and were very pushy about buying beer with it. I mentioned that I asked for a small portion and pointed at the price, to which they replied very rudely "well they are just guide prices, the portion is 500 grams, how can you expect us to sell a small amount" - In total it was well over £12 - which was the worst value I experienced for anything in Prague - I asked them to make it smaller and I didn't want the beer but they just got even more pushy so I just walked away. Sorry guys, you picked the wrong tourist to try and fleece. You don't have to look far to find great traditional food at very fair prices, so wander round.All in all, a fantastic place, up there with the best.

Ethereal old world charm in the most beautiful town square in the world. Of all the old towns in European cities, Prague scores the highest in terms of elegance, architectural beauty, grandeur and the sheer atmosphere there in the evenings

Centre of Old Prague!. This is the centre of the Old Town - you can conveniently walk to any of the main attractions of Prague from the Old Town Square.. It can be quite crowded though, and be careful of the many unskilled segway drivers!

People watching. Lovely food in "el nirgo torro"return to on the square not expensive and giant beers to boot..🍻
Carriage rides and street performances all day
Fairy Tale. A visit to Prague wouldn't truly be a visit unless you see Old Town Square. So much to do and see, and so whimsical.

So beautiful-- even when crowded. Wow! What a gorgeous plaza! Every time we went there, lots of tourists-- but it's magical! My gf said she felt like she was in Epcot-- the old buildings surrounding the space seem surreal. Gotta try the 'fast food' stands! Sit on a bench & people-watch. Never got tired of doing that ☺️

Centre of Old Town - and all roads seem to lead to it!. I confused Old Town with Old Town Square, but the two go hand in hand. (The Trip Advisor picture for Old Town is actually a building flanking Old Town Square!) The square is the easiest place to base your explorations of Old Town from. We were lucky to have an Easter Market happening there when we visited.
Beautiful Square in Old Prague.. Lovely Old Square right in the middle of Prague with a great athmosphere. It can be packed with tourists but it is still well worth a visit.

Lovely place. A lovely way to spend an afternoon. So much to see and do and you certainly won't go hungry.
A must visit for everyone visiting here.
Centre of Prague. Good place, center of Prague. Everything starts here. We however got cheated by the currency exchange shop here, and most are supposed to be cheaters. Be very careful!
Best square in world. Old town square is the best square I visited in my life, due to the beautiful restaurants and cafes in the area .

Full of history. At the Old Town square, you can find Astronomical tower and many museums and restaurants. Every spot on square has a different history written on it. What caught my attention were 27 white crosses on the ground where 27 protestants were killed. If you are interested in more, find more information online or with some guide, you will learn a lot, especially about how Czechs likes to throw people out of window. :D

the sqaure. very busy all day , lots of street entertainment to keep u amused and segway users. Avoid the meat stalls offering prague ham for 89 korona for 100g..no matter what u ask for you get a huge piece of meat , very fatty and ends up costing abut £8!! very disappointed .

Nice central place, lots of things to do. The Old town square (Staroměstské nám) is a typical European main square; street activities, street-food, lots of cafes/restaurants around, sightseeing spots (Astronomical Clock, Old Town Hall, Church of Our Lady before Tyn). One of our favorite spots for eating traditional Czech pastry (Trdlo). Usually the square is nicely decorated on Christmas and Easter time (we visited Prague on Easter time); In order to take some great photos of the square, climb to the top of Old Town Hall building;

Great for people watching.... A large, central 'square' with a good sense of history, plenty of restaurants and shops and the added bonus of the Astronomical clock. Go twice - watch it once and prepare to be underwhelmed, but then go again and watch the gathered crowds. The sight of hundreds of people taking phone videos in the expectation that something else will happen after the (all too brief, but still charming) show is a surprising delight.

Great place to hang out . An amazing place to hang out. Lots of attraction, tourists offering, restaurants, bars and cafes. If you are looking to book a tour, take a segway ride, visit the tourists information centre, just get to this place. I just loved sitting at the square and killing time. It's lively !
Beautiful square. I loved the old town hall and clock, the churches, restaurants and events around there. Easily accesible by metro and tram.

Nice and safe. The old town square is an excellent place for walk with no cars ... lots of souvenirs shop... you can also see madam tussauds which you can visit and see lots of celebrities... if you continue walking you will reach the famous Charlies bridge

Beautiful Old Town Square. Loved Old Town Square, with all the interesting little streets & lanes stemming from it. I was thrilled to find a tiny little shop, selling only Santas Claus - As I collect these from all over the world, it was a great find! SO many other interesting little shops & cafes in the area. NIce to grab a coffee, and sit on the square and a just people watch for a couple of hours, taking in the sights, sounds & smells.
Very pleasant!. a nice place where locals meet and tourists mingle. Lots of history and interesting buildings and monuments.
Charming place especially during Christmas. Charming place especially during Christmas, when you can enjoy different Christmas market activities, local food, hot wine and everything else.

A city square with more than four corners!. A fantastic place to visit when in Prague. The square is busy and active from morning to late evening. Lots of streets to explore from the main square, all leading to new sights and new experiences. The stalls selling street food are well worth a visit if you fancy a quick lunch or a bite to eat late afternoon or early evening. Lots of bars around the square if you want to sit down, relax and watch the world pass by!

Magical. Visiting old town square was like going back in time. Beautiful architecture all around. Lots of fun street performers too. Nice shops and restaurants. We enjoyed a nice glass of prosecco while relaxing in the square.
Nice to wander around. Nice place with lots of interesting buildings and of course the famous clock. Nice area generally to spend some time.

Definitely a must-do in Prague. Worth a walk through, buy a trdelnik, some pork, watch the astronomical clock strike on the hour, and climb to the top of the old town hall. Great view! Great pics. Not too much else here.
People watching paradise. The ideal place to stroll around or sit in a cafe and people watch . Beautiful buildings abound, there's loads to see and lots of options in terms of food and drink

Marine Le Pen in Prague.. It was really great honor to welcome such a guest as Marine Le Pen in Prague at my conference. We took a strol on Old town square together and enjoyed the magical atmosphere of the ancient city of Prague.

A place that wins your heart. At the outset, I would say that I was lucky to visit Prague during Easter. The festivities were something I have never seen in my life. Truly enjoyed the programs that were organized to celebrate Easter.
I would recommend traveling to Prague in during Easter.

Beautiful but overcrowded. Marvellous, vibrant full of tourists. This is one of the most beautiful old towns I have ever been to. Gothic, Romanesque, Secession - you can find examples of many architecture styles. On a LARGE scale! When we add variety of bars, restaurants, souvenir shops and cultural spots - we get unique bohemian atmosphere. It is never too much of Prague's Old Town, as there is always something new to be found

The heart of Prague - Lively and crowded. The Old Town Square is the heart of Prague, lively and crowded.It's a great place to buy street food; rolled pastries, sausages and grilled pork - and there are lots of pubs and cafés around. It's also a good place to buy souvenirs, and in one "corner", you'll find "The Astronomical Clock".There are many street artists, performers and different kinds of entertainment.Tips: Bring a camera, good walking shoes, and take the usual precautions to avoid potential pick-pockets.

Good. The main attraction in old town square I would say is the clock every hour figurines come out near the top and circle the window if you will it literally only lasts a minute if that but the crowds it brings is amazing.Around the square is restaurants, shops and when we was there food stalls All in all a good visit to say you have been

Lots of Human Attractions. I went here with my baby (1.5yo) and he was super enthusiast with the human attractions there. You could take a picture of them (and yourself) with paying around EUR 1 each.
Busy. Square was very busy, but nice attractive buildings. Plenty of places to eat with outside cover. Bug crowd for the astronomical clock.

Lively and happening. Like every town in Europe, Prague too has a central place which is always crowded and lively. You will find all sorts of eating joints here, especially the expensive ones.!You have to cross the place to reach astronomical clock and other parts of old town so no skipping.. There are various artists and performers who keep you entertained while they showcase their talents.A great place if you are okay with the crowd.

The very heart of Prague. There is always something happening in Old Town Square. Christmas Market, Easter Market, Street Performers and sitting out in pavement restaurants in the summer. It can become crowded, however is a must for anyone visiting Prague.
Amazing Square. The Old Town Square has a lot to offer, from restaurants to gift shops to artists performing all day.

Interesting . The old town square has lots of places to eat and drink also shops to buy souvenirs. The astronomical clock is in the square and Street entertainers. Interesting place to visit - beware of the cobbled walkways, sensible walking shoes or trainers a must throughout Prague

Beautiful but expensive. Old town square in Prague is definitely worth a visit. The atmosphere and architecture is fascinating. However, like in any old town with lots of tourists, everything is overpriced. So keep that in mind.

Simply beautiful. Being surrounded by Baroque and Gothic architecture was just amazing all by itself, but we were very fortunate to have been there during the Easter Markets which added another dimension to it all! A must-see for this stunning city.

Nice, but too touristy . It was definitely worth walking around once during the trip, however like a typical European touristy restaurants district, the restaurants were trying too hard to bring in tourists, which is usually not a good sign in terms of authenticity of their meals. It's better to just walk around the square and get out to a less mainstream street for a meal.
A stroll through. Great place for a stroll and to people watch. Pretty busy, but lots to see and do. The clock tower is fascinating to watch. Plenty of cafes and shops to browse.

Fish and Segway. Lots to here, climb the clock tower, visit the Warhol / Dali exhibition, shop, watch the buskers. In addition we hired Segways and ended up doing 2 hrs touring the city for £30 each. They were easy to master and a great way to see the city.Afterwards I visited a Thai massage and had my feet eaten by small fish !

Great. Loads to do in old town. Eat, shop and sight see. Visit the old town hall which is also the information center and pay to see the underground first city of Prague, then use the ticket for a discount to see the famous clock from the inside and the view from the top of it's tower, there is even a lift up there!

Best Views of Square from Top of Clock Tower. There was a great vibe at Old Town Square when I visited. Live music/concerts were being held in the square & a row of portable toilets were lined around the monument of Jan Hus. I must admit the pink portaloos tarnished the look slightly but the vibe was amazing.For the best view of the Town Square I recommend you pay in to see the Astronomical Clock/Tower & go straight to the top. Not only do you get great views of the square but also the Old Town itself. Great to view at night.
Beautiful square full of history. Very busy on the hour when everyone goes to see the famous astronomical clock chime. Well worth a visit.

Stunning views. Stayed right on the old town square. It is without doubt the busiest square I have ever visited. The views of the old buildings and the astronomical clock, which draws the crowd all day and night. Well worth the visit.
Interesting old European square.. Worth seeing and spending a relaxing hour in one of the coffee shops round the old square. If the market is open there are good things to be had.

Just browsing........ This square is a wonderful place, one of my favourites. Its the meeting place for most tours that are on offer. There is something here for everyone. Really good places to eat or drink. There is also a good shopping mall, which covers most requirements. The Palladuim shopping mall has an excellent food hall covering all tastes. If you like to eat fish, try the Nordic resturant, good value and delicious.
Simply Amazing, must see!. We took almost 2 days to wander around here, great food, bars and coffee shops...too many Segue tour hawkers though....LOTS of churches...beautiful!!!

A wonderful place to be. What can be nicer than sitting in one of the restaurants or cafes out on the square, watching the world go by? The architecture in the square is incredible, a real mixture of shapes and colours.... a feast for the eyes. I could spend all day here, popping in to the various shops and eateries or watching the street entertainers.

A must do for Prague. Visitors to Prague are likely to make the square one o father first stops - and that is highly recommended. The main tourist information centre is located on the square and a great place to start and start planning your visit. Eat away from the square. It is very touristy and the restaurants onor near the square are typically that. For better quality food, get to t some often side streets away from the square,All main streets will eventually lead to the square and a great meeting place and is used for major calendar events (e.g. Easter - square is packed with people food and celebration).

Good at night. Great for grabbing a bite to eat at a nice restaurant and visiting the stalls, but during the day I found myself being hassled by segway tours and other tourist traps which was really annoying. At night the square is nice for taking a leisurely stroll in, but it's much more fast paced during the day

Easter Market. We visited Prague 1 week before Easter, so the Square hosted the biggest Easter Market in town. It was charming, with traditional Prague street food, embellished eggs, sweets and other artisans' products, with concerts and with the magnificent architecture around.

Lots to see. Need more than a one day visit that we had.
Just a beautiful, historical and enjoyable walk.
Much to see, food to eat and places to shop.
Crowded! . Unfortunately very touristic and full of tourists everywhere. Full if people trying to sell a segway tour or to offer to change your euros. However nice place to test the prague ham !

Beautiful and full of history. A lovely place to sit and watch people go buy. Visit the old town hall for a guided tour of the the municipal rooms, the catacombs below and the tower. Tourist info shop very helpful. If you visit at Easer there's a lovely market and an Easter tree. Buskers and street entertainers contribute to the lively atmosphere. Restaurants in the square are expensive and a bit mean (e.g. not providing tap water!).

The Old Town Square. The Old Town Square was a remarkable experience. There were plenty of people from all over the world having a good time. That in itself was a good thing to see. There was plenty of shopping to be done, good food to eat, and MANY points of historical interest. The Clock Tower was a favorite!

Busy but beautiful. great atmosphere with tourists from all over the world and horse drawn carts and small stalls selling local produce to eat and treasure. multiple surrounding coffee shops and restaurannts

Fun Place To People Watch. This place can get crowded, especially at the top of the hour when the Old Town Hall clock chimes. Best to fet a front row seat at one of the adjacent restaurants and watch the happenings with a Pilsner Urquell.

If you like crowds, this is the place to be.. Old town square is where all the tourist action is. There are many booths containing shops, food, deserts, etc. The square is surrounding by the raw beauty of historical buildings and the astronomical clock, which is a must see. It is hopping day and night. Although I loved the Square, I could not help but wish I could have seen it before tourism, in its natural state.

Worth a Visit. Lots of amazing buildings to see. Great atmosphere the astonomical is here and every hour on the hour twelve apostles appear when we visited there were also food stalls in the center also you can take the tour bus ans the bus that looks like a train from here.

Central location to start or end your day. . The square is a nice place to start or end your day. I started early in the morning to be at the astronomical clock tower, at 9am, in order to miss most of the tour groups. Later in the day the area is swamped with tourists, tours, and in general is quite claustrophobic inducing near to clock tower. Keep your wits; watch for pickpockets. Also, head over to the statue area for a little more space. If you are looking for a quick drink or bite to eat check out the cute little kiosk-type stalls along the western perimeter street of Staromestské namesti, right behind the astronomical clock tower. There are benches behind the stalls to sit and chat or plan the rest of your day/evening. The statue in the center of the square offers a nice photo opportunity, especially in the evening when everything is lit up and looking either westerly or to the east toward the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn.
Beautiful, quaint. The architecture is fabulous. Great way to spend a few hours checking out the square. If you go near Christmas or Easter, there are markets to see.
Historic and picturesque . Loads to see, with buildings and statues alongside the clock tower. Clock is amazing and the views from the tower are amazing. Not expensive and very informative too.

Very busy and full of tourists, but most reputable stores seemed clustered on square.. I visited during the Easter season so there was an Easter market set up with vendors of all types. There was a lot of great people watching opportunities. The astronomical clock is off one corner. Once you leave the square there are many "tourist trap" type stores. However, on the square itself seems to be more reputable places to shop. For example, a factory store for Turnov garnats is located on the square so you know those are not fakes or cheap imitations.

The priest´s memorial. This is just a small note in case you are crossing the Old Town Square. Please notice the huge statue complex approximately in the down left part opposite the Tyn church. It is a statue of the priest John Hus who was put on fire 14th century because he opposed the Church as they offered people that if they pay money to the Church, the Church will delete their sins. I love this statue because apart from some other quotes it says on it Love each other and Pray for everybody to know the truth.
Busy but a must see. Located next to Charles bridge, the square is a must do location for all tourists. With lots of bars and restaurants, the square offers plenty of eating and drinking options.

Lovely place. Old town was lovely, we walked a couple of miles from our hotel. Very historical, we loved St Nicolas church, the building is stunning inside. The medieval astronomical clock is here, you can go inside. The markets here are very nice too.

Charming Easter market . The Easter market was on when we were there and it was charming. Many different food stalls and lots of decorative Easter eggs. The buildings around the square are great to see. So many different styles. It's very busy and full of people.

You will love it. The best food variety. They do cook in front of you. Still if you need a classical restaurant you will find more than one in the area.There are lots of shops around and the area is very safe though busy. This is a must visit even if you have limited time in Prague.

All roads lead here. It seems wherever you go I Prague – you keep coming back to the square, all roads seem to lead to it.It was filled with wooden cabins selling food or handcraft goods …. This runs we were told form Easter to 3rd April – so we timed it well.There are so many places selling Grilované Klobásy (Grilled Sausages) … try the paprika ones – they are superb.There are also a great number of stalls selling the Czech Cinnamon Pastry-Trdelni, being rotated on large open coal fired ‘grills’The square is absolutely packed by late morning – if you want a good look go early or late.There are amazing photo opportunities almost every building is form 16th century - really is picturesque.The one pain is the number of Segway ‘punters’ , people selling Segway tours of Prague – these are in extreme abundance – and most are not regulated, not insured and many disperse as soon as police arrive - we also saw one bad accident with someone coming off a Segway – so be warned.One side of the square are the horse drawn carriages, if you want to pay 900 czk for 15mins then go for it, I think it very expensive.The ‘mock’ old fashioned cars are even more expensive.The famous mechanical clock goes through its animations .. and there are many hundreds of people who queue up in front of the clock to watch this ……. Honestly I thought it a significant anti-climax … and not worth the wait.Take any one of the myriad of streets that touch the square and you will find restaurants and coffee shops … and at much better prices than the ones on the square itself.If you visit Prague - you will keep finding yourself back at at the square.

great atmosphere. The old town square is buzzing with people and is a must place to visit when in Prague. The Easter market served me nicely for some occasional sweet treats and the many restaurants around the square are perfect for a relaxing evening meal sat outside.

Buzzing with life !!. The old town square was a beautiful experience. Lovely structures all around you, small stalls that had beautiful souvenirs, lots of food stalls and there was various types of music & entertainment. In the middle of the square you will see the beautiful Gothic Tyn Cathedral and the St. Nicholas Church. I recommend you see both of them from inside and don't miss to see the astronomical clock. Its simply amazing! Also dont miss to eat different kinds of delicious local food.

Must visit. As my first introduction to Prague (I was just randomly walking around), this was brilliant. I ate so much amazing food; sausages, crepes, hot cider. I also loved exploring the nearby clock tower.
Nice. Nice town square with lots happening we were there just after Easter so lots of stalls happening. Certainly worth a visit but would eat outside the square as prices are a lot cheaper.
Old clock. Buildings and people nicer than the old clock. We felt it was a bit disappointing, but the rest of the square was nice.
Busy and full of energy. This was such an amazing experience. Lots of little shops, lots of food and drink to try, and the energy was phenomenal.

City break to Prague and the Old Town Square. The Old Town Square was a brilliant experience, there were singer who were really good performers and the whole square has so much to see the buildings are stunning and the clock in the tower was fabulous I would recommend anyone to go to Praque and the people were so friendly and the restaurants were excellent to great place to visit for a city break!!!
Buzzing! . Everything seems to happen here, it has it all. An Easter fair when we were there, restaurants, bars, museums, church's and shops. It really feels like a hub for more or less everything.

Christmas Market. We have been there for Christmas Market opening (well, they did not announced exact date & time because of terrorist attacks :-)It's a great experience when it starts! The Christmas tree was beautiful!

Essential to visit. A busy and bustling square with plenty going on all the time. The vibe is excellent. There are Lots of local trader stalls and food outlets, but no pushy sales nonsense. A must visit.

Nightmare. I really liked this place when I first visited 15yrs ago. Now it is too busy and has too many tourists, like most of Prague. Had to laugh when a guy offered me a segway ride because I would just run into everyone.However, you must go there and see the astronomical clock and get on one of the free walking tours

Part Of Guided Tour. We had a free guided tour(only tip necessary) that included this delightful square,,beautiful buildings,ingeresting people,various types of music & entertainment..many food vendors
Loved it. I love architecture and colours, so i was very happy to finally visit this square. It is so cheerful, there were many stalls and restuarants so it will take an hour or two

Really nice . Great for night life lots of food and beverage stands, amazing churches and atmosphere.
Recommend going inside the churches and getting to know the places around.

One of the best squares I have been to. Very nice square basicly in the heart of prague. The time i went there they had stands serving different kind of delicious food and souvenirs. people playing music and dancing. it was just amazing for 3 days in a row. nice cafes and restaurants too. also has the beautiful astronomical clock that you will not miss. people where very nice. I just felt a lot of positive energy being there even when the weather wasn't at it's best

Old Town. When I was there I really felt history. I enjoyed the palace and the areas around. There are many restaurants to have a coffee or dine. You will enjoy the shows that are spread all around the square. Don't miss the magical watch tower. Go the to the top of the tower to enjoy the view. And there are some restaurants with a top view.

So beutiful!. This is the best place in whole Prauge!There is beutiful house evrywere! In the middle of the square is the lovley Týnchurch and S:t Nicolas church. I recommend then both. But the biggest thing to see is the old astronomical clock! It's awesome!If you're geting hungry, then don't worry, there is a lot of nice restaurants and traditional coffehouse where you can eat the traditional czechish bakery - Trdelink. Even if you're just there for one day, you must visit the old town square! Enjoy your stay! Take the tramlinje 17 or 18 or metroline A to Starometska or metroline A or B to Mústek and walk in five minutes and then you're there! But remember to keep an eye on you phone and moneys, there is a lot of pickpockets!

Beautiful place. Spent a lot of time in the square visiting different eateries and loved it. Trees laden with Easter eggs made it so pretty. Absolutely buzzing with life and we fell in love with it. A must if you ever visit Prague.
