i love the square. the square was very busy when we were there at easter however with the Easter markets there it was really lovely to walk around. I loved sitting in a restaurant in the square soaking up the atmosphere, watching the hustle and bustle of travellers and enjoying some goulash and local beer.St Nicholas church in old town square is lovely and there are some lovely art stalls seeling beautiful pictures of Prague

Heart of the City. The Town Square is the heart of the City and a great launching point for expeditions to the other major sites. Check out the town hall, clock, Jan Hus memorial and a number of churches while you are here.

Lovely for the Christmas Markets. This is a very nice area of the city to visit. I was lucky enough to visit when all the Christmas markets were there so the atmosphere was amazing! Everyone is very friendly and there are lots of shops, cafes and restaurants to visit.
Lots of things to do.... Cool place with lots of bars and places to eat! Beware of the guys on segways trying to sell you Segway tours!

Perfect place to chill . We came here several times on our holiday. The best was on a sunny afternoon. You can wander and soak up the atmosphere of the stalls, grab a beer or 'hot wine'- really nice, or a snack. Often people are playing music and in the sun the buildings almost don't look real. Lots of restaurants to choose from, as well as bars and tourist shops. Well recommended. We never felt unsafe but hold into valuables as it can get busy.

Amazing at Easter. We were in Prague this past Easter weekend. Old Town Square was all decorated for Easter. Kiosks and a stage for performances were set up. It just added to the already impressive square. Do go up the Old Town Tower. Definitely check out the Church of Our Lady before Týn. Eat and drink at the cafes.

Lovely square with a great atmosphere.... Had been to Old Town Square during late evening and night time. A beautiful square flanked by lovely historical buildings. Great atmosphere and feel. The Tree with Easter eggs just adds to the charm..

Heart of town. Really nice old town square which with the Easter Markets made it very lively. lots of stalls selling a various goods. Also lots of restaurants and bars a great buss too the whole place
Plenty to see and do.. Everybody who goes to Prague will pass through the square at some point. The buildings are stunning and there are lots of eating places around the square.

Place you must see. This is the real heart of the Old Town. You can see and visit Old Town Hall, church of St. Michael, church of our Lady at Tyn or National Gallery (collection of Asian art). Houses facing it are also nice. There are plenty of venues there, such as Christmas market or Easter market ...

Thé place to start getting to know the city. This is the place where almost all tours are starting, whether on foot, by bus or horse and carriage. It also has a few or the main attractions such as the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn and the Prague Orloj (a medieval astronomical clock).

Lots of stalls, good for a cheap lunch and a souvenir . We went over Easter weekend and he square was filled with stalls selling mulled wine, donuts and sausages. Not sure if these are here all the time but they were great. We got a couple of cheap lunches (a sausage in a bun and a cup of hot wine or cider is about 120kr, or around $6-7 AUD). There is a lot of tat, but you can also find a couple of nice souvenirs here, like honey wine or small wood toys.

Big & Beautiful. One of the nicest town squares in Europe. The Easter Market was an added bonus this time of year. Lots of places to grab a meal or drink and people watch. There was a beautiful tower, steeple, church or other building in every direction.

Historic square in Prague. The square is a must go if you visit Prague. It's not too big, but a good insight in the historic side of the city. A lot of nice restaurants and stores can be found in the area, but watch out for the overpriced "old Prague ham". It's tasty but really expensive.

Heart of the Prague. One of those places in Prague you can't and hopefully won't miss. Old Town Square still gives you the feeling of old Prague and touches you through the historical nostalgia. Watching Orloj at the evening, or just walking through and stopping for Czech cuisine at the place is memorable for the entire life.
Lovely. We had the added advantage of being there on Easter Sunday, and there were merchants of all types set up with their little shops. The atmosphere is festive and the square is wonderful.

Beautiful place to experience the Christmas Markets. Beautiful and busy part of the old town. Christmas Markets are a must Dec/Jan. Rug up as it is very cold if you come from warmer climates. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area and high end fashion leading off from the square. Astronomical clock is also here. Lots of local food and drink at the markets. Try the mulled wine in winter and the Kilbaso sausage with bacon and potato.

Center of it all. This is the center of the whole area. Giant open town square with many, many cafes, coffee houses, desserts and shops all around. Still many more as you walk past the square and into the smaller cobblestone streets. There are often musicians and other performers in the square.

Easter Holidays on Full Display. The Old Town Square is always a worthwhile stop, but the special attractions for Easter - vendors, decorated churches, and so on, made this visit extra special. We also learned about a number of Czech traditions, and saw many Czech families on holiday - which made the visit more personal for us.
Loved this place.. We were there just before Easter and there was a market here. The atmosphere was great with as much food and drink as you could want and we visited here many times during our stay.

Beautiful and Scenic. This was just Beautiful, the buildings the cathedrals. Plenty of shops only problem was we got lost exploring, there are so many side streets you just get a little confused. One of the cleanest cities ive been in.
Crowded, but also full of life, history and culture. This town square can sure be crowded, but its worth going here. You don´t go to Prague without ending up at this place, so you can´t miss it.

Beautiful Square. You need to remember to look upwards to see all the beautiful architecture. From the square you can wind your way around small alleyways to lose yourself in the splendour of the buildings and the small unusual shops.

Old Gothic town square. Keeping everything in perspective, this square offers a view of old buildings (some requiring major repairs after WWII) many vendor stalls with food and tourist trinkets, and of course lots of people. There is enough to see and do to keep occupied for some time, with the churches, town buildings, museums, etc. If nothing else it is worth seeing just to be in an old square, and wtih a little imagination, get a view into the past.

Here during Easter market. We were in Prague over the Easter holiday weekend, and the Square we filled with the Easter Market, which in true European fashion was quite charming with little knick knacks and great food (the Prague specialty - rolled pastries - are delicious! Without the market though the square is absolutely stunning by itself. There are multiple enormous churches and the Astronomical Tower, as well as exceptionally ornamental buildings all around the square. Photographer's paradise, seriously.

A beautiful place to be!. I visited in March, the weather was cold but we had beautiful sunshine. The Easter stalls were in the square and it was full of life. The buildings were just amazing, gothic and magnificent. There was a lovely atmosphere, plenty of opportunity to just stop and take it all in. There was no litter, it was clean and there was no traffic to speak of. I would rate this as one of my favourite places ever and will definitely go back!

Everything a walk away. Beautiful Old town square has so much to offer, It was vendors that sell yummy food, tons of souvenir shops and everything is within walking distance to so many other famous historical sights.

Tourist Trap. The buildings give you a great old town feel but you share it with 10,000 people. Cool spot to check out and get some quick street food and a beer. I wouldn't center my trip around this.

Lovely area . Nice area to wander about the various stalls and try out the local cuisine and beer. Astronomical clock is quite impressive. It gets very busy during the daytime especially on the hour when the clock bell tolls. We came here a few times. Our pictures are from the rooftop bar at Hotel U Prince in the square.

Beautiful and Magical. My wife and I have long planned to visit Prague and finally took a romantic late winter trip there a few weeks ago. We spent far more time than we had anticipated touring the old city, and almost always found ourselves returning to Old Town Square. There are always new things to see and new experiences in the square with street performers, food vendors, artisans and interactions with fellow visitors and locals, alike. The shops and restaurants around the square cater to all tastes and budgets, and the street acrobats and musicians are a delightful entertainment. Our visits to the square were enhanced by reading about the history that Prague, and the old town square, have witnessed. It was worth sitting and contemplating what the buildings and paving stones had seen and been touched by over centuries of pivotal events. Any visitor could spend a full day just touring and photographing the square. We look forward to our next visit to Prague, and will spend hours experiencing and enjoying this square at the heart of that beautiful, romantic and historic city!Jimmy and Catie Brown

History lovers dream!. This was an immaculate and well kept square that had immense and beautiful buildings that were all well preserved and taken care of. The area was clean and filled with fun things to do (museum, Kafka bookshop, world's greatest thai massage place, gourmet restaurants, and more). There were outdoor stalls where fresh meats were served as well as beer and many other lovely treats. This place was honestly magical and I highly recommend it. A gem!

very attractive buildings and amazing clock. all of life in Old Square with street food hawkers and tourists seeing the sightswell worth being near the clock on the hour as really good clock movement and apostles coming out to be seen
An Old European square. This place is really nice to visit. You can see a lot performances going on there, people from all over the world. It is a must see place in Prague

Breathtaking architecture . Old Town Square (Staroměstské náměst) is a breathtaking and historic square in the Old Town quarter of Prague, between Wenceslas Square and the Charles Bridge and is famed for its marvellous architecture, especially the amazing astronomical clock on the town hall. The square is also the starting point for many tours and is a great place to hang out. Don't forget to sample the old town ham or crepes from the many vendors in the square.

Don't miss the action on the Old Town Square. Beautiful architecture surrounds this large square. We were there during the Easter markets so it was a different experience for us. Cafes and shops line the square and seasonal stands with traditional food, Easter themed crafts, jewelry and more were set up throughout the Square. There was a large stage with lots of entertainment, from children's singing and dancing groups during the day to folk groups and a rock band at night. Famiies, teens and adults of all ages gathered and locals mixed well with the throngs of tourists that were there every day despite cool March weather. The famous astronomical clock is also on the Square and is a sight to see. While I didn't climb the tower, others with me did and said it was worth it to see the views but not very well-managed with crowds. The usual hucksters were out in force, especially annoying were those on Segways trying to entice people to take a two wheel tour. All in all it was lots of fun and I wouldn't have wanted to miss it
Good atmosphere. Visit the square during Easter preparation, lots of small houses offering handcrafted things. Atmosphere was good, day and evening.

Yes!!. Old Town Square is a cite to see if you are visiting Prague. While it was ridiculously crowded when we visited, we managed to avoid huge crowds by getting our and about early. Plenty of restaurants located within the square.

Nice place.. Historic site in downtown Prague. On the left side of Tyn Cathedral on the right side of the astronomical clock. Amid a statue of Jan Hus. There were many tourists but the beauty of the place does not change anything.
So historic!. Old town square is absolutely beautiful. The architecture and history associated with the buildings is incredible. Absolutely loved it

Prague Easter Market. Just to warn other tourists not purchase any of the tins of chocolates or biscuits at the Easter market stalls!! I bought a tin of what the lady told me was a tin of chocolates for my mother as a gift from the holiday. When she opened it a small bloody of inedible cooking chocolate was sitting inside the box. A small rough block of chocolate wrapped in cling film. This was approx. 5 euros and was available at many of the stalls, not a huge amount of money but still beware!! So disappointed with this and have attached photos!!

An excellent attraction to visit. This area has both a lot of excellent street food vendors and trendy restaurants, and there appears to always be some sort of local entertainment going on in the plaza
Beautiful. This square amazing. If you are in Prague don t miss it. Allways beautiful winter and summer as well.
Wonderful European square. Fantastic buildings, ornate churches and clocks with a story to tell - the Old Town Square has a real sense of history as you wander round it.

special atmosphere !. Old town square can only be compared to Stockholm or Helsinki old square because of its beautiful buldings, the markets that for Christmas and Easter are giving a special atmosphere to this place.
Beautiful Square. The old town square is a lovely place, there are lots of shops and bars / cafes. there are lots of beautiful builds to see.

Lively and quaint at the same time. Really enjoyed the atmosphere here - great food, Easter decorations everywhere, and Czech folk music on the stage. Found a wonderful bookshop on one side of the square and spent time aside quietly and comfortably browsing there. Astronomical clock looks amazing although the show is brief and subdued.

Prague - Old Town Square. When in Prague, take the time to actually 'experience' the Old Town Square. There are so many things to take in during your experience. The local food vendors compete with the restaurants and both are worth a try. Do beware that the vendors often sell their food by weight and it can be confusing. We found that if you ask; they will show you how much you get for the price. There are also many photo opportunities in and around the Square. Stop and look around.... Experience and Enjoy...

the place to be. You'll find yourself passing through here many times while you frolic around Prague. It's unavoidable! This is the hub of the city and rightly so as many attractions are right on the square or right off it. Be sure to stop here after sunset to enjoy the entertainment of traveling musicians.

Beautiful but avoid weekends!. We were fortunate to visit the old town on a Thursday and were able to enjoy a cold beer in the hot sunshine and watch the world go by against a backdrop of rich history. We sauntered around, ate lunch and enjoyed the atmosphere.What a different experience on Friday. The town was absolutely heaving with the newly arrived weekend crowd.So without ruining my personal experience of city breaks I will quietly whisper this tip....if you can, avoid Friday, Saturday and Sunday's as the world and his wife and all their extends family and neighbours and acquaintances and acquaintances of acquaintances will be there with you!
Avoid the segways. Like most cities it has been 'segwayed' but you're better off wandering around and then just sitting in a bar of cafe and taking it all in. Really nice when it's sunny

What you expect. Have you been to one Central-European city square, you have been to them all. This does however not mean you shouldn't visit the rest. In the Old Town Square, you can find several shops and stands selling good food and sweets. Only by going here, you get the feeling of the soul of this old city. A great starting point in your further exploration.A good idea is also to come here during different holidays, such as Christmas and Easter. The Praguers are good to celebrate such holidays, and the Old Town Square is the place to participate in the celebration.
Wonderful architecture, very busy, loads to do and see. Great for sitting having a coffee and wonderful pastries, just watching the wold go by with the street entertainment
Watch the clock tower!. This is the center of old town. Hard to miss and surrounded by merchants selling gifts and great food. Enjoy.
Buzzing place sometimes very busy. Surrounded by stunning architecture and home to the Astronomical clock which 'chimes' on the hour but bit of an anticlimax really

Colourful and lively at Easter. Lots to see here especially it being Easter time. The Square is filled with small wooden cabins as shops and there is also a large stage on which local children mainly do dancing and singing. It's a stunning square and not to be missed. Again better at start and end of the day when it's quieter although having said that try and avoid the stag parties who can be rather obnoxious

Walk through the old town. It's the happening place. Stalls and huts selling their wares and food and drink. Yours passing through. Old building and churches stunning. People watching and watching the world go by. A great place to potter. Love it. Music being sung it played all the entrances of the square.
The heart of old Prague. Lots of history all around the square. Also a good navigational cornerstone if you are not paying for a data plan while traveling!
Easter . Visited the old town square during Easter week. What a fabulous place. Festive and amazing. Amazing beautiful architecture all around. Plenty of places to stop for lunch or drinks.

A must visit. We visited this area a few times day and night. Slightly higher prices restaurants but explore up some of the side alleys for more authentic and cheaper restaurants where the food was fantastic at a fraction of the price. Lovely architecture around this area.

Amazing Bright Colours. This square with cathedrals and clock and all kind of amazing buildings. The market was amazing with hot drinks, beers and food and plenty to see and do. About 5 mins walk from Charles Bridge must see if visiting Prague

Beautiful square. Such a very pretty square with its astronomical clock and its church with black turrets. You must see the churct lit up at night, its stunning. the square has plenty of restaurants around is edges and other restaurants are found down each little alley way
Hmmm. As to the description in my guide book I was rather disappointed. Nothing special, really. The City Hall was beautifull.

Beautful. Very pretty lovely atmosphere, wander around all the surrounding little streets and visit the various shops etc, streets are very quaint, architecture is amazing, lots of different cuisine to choose from.
Lots to see. the Old Town Square has lots of historical buildings churches and of course the Astonomical clock. There are large crowds around the twelve o'clock time to witness the clock.
Beautiful!. Visited at Easter time when most of the square is taken over by Easter stalls selling artefacts and food and drink. Very crowded at weekends.

Cultural centre of the city. Visiting the Old Town Square was the highlight of our 3 day stop in Prague. If you can get a seat just rest a while whilst taking in the impressive architecture and colour around the square. I remember commenting on how quiet it was considering how many people were milling about. All we could hear was respectful conversation between people; no one running about or shouting or making a nuisance of themselves.
Nothing like a good square!. Can't help but love a good square. Even if you're just going there to people watch, there's much to do. Food, drink, beautiful buildings all around...it's a must see.

Beautiful . Lovely town. Plenty pubs nice restaurants . Food on a whole lovely , lots of beer choices and can see why a stagger/hen venue. Lots of things to see and do all within walking distance. Quite cold in Feb so summer venue if to go back .
One of main attractions in Prague. + history peeking out of each corner+ wonderful smell of various local foods- throngs of people- even more people during holidays
A bustling lively place. The architecture is magnificent old world, & the place is abuzz with colour, activity, & the magic of the local artisans.

Lovely square ruined !!!!!!. This is a lovely square ideal spot for taking photo's plenty of tourists about BUT BE WARNED please people be very wary of the Ham Vendors !! they will rip you off !!!! Look at the price list and make sure you confirm the price before you part with your hard earned cash I was massively overcharged !!! I stupidly paid over £20 for a piece of ham and pot of pasta and bacon in what really should have only cost me around £6 the vendor could see i was a bit bewildrerd and after handing over my money i was given a really sarcastic comment of ahhh its only money he knew i was confused and it was only later i relised i had been ripped off. These people are a disgrace to the good people of prague who are generally very honest nice polite people the authorities should do something about these scam merchants. if you do want to purchase a Ham please look at the price list and confirm a price first !!!!

Lovely square. Visited on a few occcasions as Easter markets were there, started on the 12th, good atmosphere. Lots of interesting stalls with Easter products and gifts for sale. Plenty of food and drink stalls. Very busy at this time due to market stalls but very enjoyable experience.
A must see!. You simply cannot miss this sight when in the beautiful city of Prague. From the history and architecture to the food and drink this is a must!

Feels like medieval market. We explored the Old town and took a closer look at the Old Town Square. A lot of people, smells, noises, stalls selling delicacies, souvenirs etc. They had some farm animals at display. A few goats, odd sheep, a donkey with her foal and a pony. For 20 CZK you could buy some feed to give to the animals - and they know you're going to! There they were, a bunch of well fed, adorable, cuddly fellas. They totally stole my heart!I felt necessary to keep my bag close to me at all times, there is always a crowd and I've heard that pickpockets operate in area. We didn't see anything suspicious and all our belongigs were safe at the end of the day, so I feel that common sense is all you need. Don't keep your wallet in your back pocket, or your purse open..

Nioce Place to watch the Tourist and world go by. Quick weekend break and we were lucky with fine sunny weather, so we sat and watched the world gop by before meeting a guide for a tour of the old Town.

Central Hub of Prague - particularly great with the Easter Markets. We spent a lot of time in the Old Town Square as it was quite close to our Hotel and also is so central you can navigate your way into the Jewish Quarter or onto the Charles Bridge etc very easily. WE were in Prague during the Easter Markets, which were based in the Old Town Square, so that was lots of fun with all the authentic hand-painted easter eggs, and the amazing Czech food.

Great Expierence. We visited during time of year when they have the Easter market, so the square was filled with 50 or more booths offering Easter decorations, lots of different foods, and off course a variety of hot wines, punches, and great Czech beer! Even if the market had not been there the historic buildings, churches, restaurants, and shops would've been more than enough entertainment.
Hard to describe the beauty after the Communist were thrown out. Czeck Republic is great in the Cities and in the country. Small towns south of Prague are great!Good Driving.

Beautiful but extremely busy. The architecture is exquisite and you feel like you've gone back in time. However this feeling is diminished by the hoards of tourists (just like you) who are all packed into this square. If you like waiting in lines and then feeling underwhelmed at the little time you have to read the information boards due to 100's waiting behind you then enjoy away. We were thoroughly entertained by the petting zoo, the pony and donkeys were very cute.

Always something going on!. In December there was the New Year tree and all the associated celebrations, now in March there is Easter, but also St Patricks Day!I saw green beer, I tried to get some Guiness in an Irish pub, but they were all so busy, I couldn't get served!The live music on the stage was fitting, even if the announcements didn't have an Irish accent!I will be wondering what will be happening next time I visit!

With the surprise of an Easter Market. The old town square is a hub of tourist activity. We were lucky to visit during the Easter Market so there were lots of little stalls selling crafts and tasty snacks. A little more expensive than the surrounding streets but we enjoyed coffee on the square for around £2 a cup.Throughout the day we enjoyed some quality street musicians and entertainers including a guy who made bubbles with just pieces of string. The slight downside is the place is full of people trying to sell segway hires. We didn't get hassled at all. Didn't openly see any police but we felt very safe here even late at night.The surrounding architecture facades are stunning.A must visit place.

The Old Town Square, Warsaw. The Old Town Market Place or Old Town Square is the true heart of the Old Town, and until the end of the 18th century was the heart of all of Warsaw. It originated in the late 13th century, at the same time that the city was founded. Here, the representatives of guilds and merchants met in the town hall (built before 1429, pulled down in 1817), and fairs and the occasional execution were held. The houses around it represented the Gothic style until the great fire of 1607, after which they were rebuilt in late-Renaissance style and eventually in late-Baroque style by Tylman Gamerski in 1701.The main feature at that time was the immense town hall, reconstructed in 1580 in the style of Polish mannerism by Antoneo de Ralia and again between 1620-1621. The architecture of the building was similar to many other structures of that type in Poland (e.g. the town hall in Szydłowiec). It was adorned with attics and four side towers. A clock tower, embellished with an arcade loggia, was covered with a bulbous spire typical for Warsaw mannerist architecture (an example being the Royal Castle).The district was damaged by the bombs of the German Luftwaffe during the Invasion of Poland (1939). The ancient Market Place was rebuilt in the 1950s, after having been totally destroyed by the German Army after the suppression of the 1944 Warsaw Uprising. Today it is the major tourist attraction in Warsaw and is always very busy.

Thriving tourist attractions . We visited this square on foot and soaked up the atmosphere. it is currently designed with Easter markets I would imagine it is as good for Christmas markets as well. The smells and festivities will draw you in .well worth a visit.

Nicest but busiest attraction. Great stalls, great food and drink with a myriad of tiny lanes leading off in all directions with fantastic shops (inc lots of tat shops). Very busy at most times but at its quietest before 10. A must see, similar to a German Christmas Market.

Worth a visit although everything revolves around this square. Hardly a place you could miss out on your visit to Prague as almost all the excursions leave from this square and it is in the main centre for the restaurants.

Historical and pretty. The old town square is picturesque and gives you a sense of Pragues history. It was nice walking around the Easter markets which were on whilst we were there and trying out all the food. We ate tea in the square and it became our central hub to stand around it whilst we decided what to do next. Everything was in walking distance from here and there are lots of nice restaurants around the square and on the back streets. Quite busy but as expected. Brilliant food stalls around here.
Easter market. We visited the square close to Easter so we were lucky to see the Easter market. Beautiful with very warm atmosphere. View from the tower is great.
A must see in Prague!. This square is always full of activity. There are markets or street artists, depending on the time of the year. Around the square there are also a lot of things to do.
Very pleasant.. Lots going on here, if you can see for the hordes. Lots of stalls, some street entertainers, cafes on the street. Everywhere selling hot wine!
Lovely place to visit. Nice square. We were there 2 weeks before easter, when they have an easter market. It is always busy on this square, especially before the astronomical clock.
Stunning. The old town in just stunning. When we were the the Easter markets were on. Lots of lovely smells and interesting sights. Lots of shops and restaurants to explore.
Good for shops. Good round here market on for easter. Loads of shops for clothes, gifts, and niknacs. Clock aint all that seen it when it goes off not alot happens ok to see once but not all that...
Good area to visit. The most touristy place in Prague and is well worth the visit.Astronomical clock, easter markets, crystal shops and so much more

Cannot be missed. You will, even if not by choice, when in Prague, visit the square. Many restaurants, bars and historic buildings and churches adorn the area. Whatever it is you want to see or do, you are spoilt for choice.
beautiful prague. The old town square and in fact any where you walk in Prague,you are just over whelmed by its beauty.All you need to enjoy this City is good walking shoes and nice weather.

Awesome, you shouldn't miss. The history all over the place. The heart of Old Town. Holds Astrology clock tower.
Architecture, art, street artists, carriage rides, restaurants. If you are in Old Town, do not miss its square!
A bit crowdy, especially at every full hour when the Astrology clock tower activates the show.
Was there everyday. This is in the heart of the city and we lived close by so would go for a walk every evening. Lovely and a very lively place to be in.

Watch the world go by.. Sat here often, for a coffee or beer, watching it all happen around you.
The astronomical clock, the food stalls, the segways.
Lovely location even in March.

Old Town Square. Old Town square is one of top Prague attractions. You can see here astrological clocks.
Also don't miss amazing view to historical center from nearby tower.
Wonderful sights. A beautiful part of Prague, and a must for every visitor. Marvel at the buildings whilst wandering round the market.
love love love. we will be back , such aa vibe such life in that square, mmmm hot wine t the stand the magnificent clock tower.

Great place to visit. Old Town Square is a great tourist destination. 100% of the buildings in the square are the original buildings dating back to the 1500's. If one were to remove the cars and street lights, you would have the same view today, as they did hundreds of years ago.I live in Prague, my wife is Czech and we still visit old town square just to recapture the beauty and awe of it all.

What's not to love?. I enjoyed every trip I made to the old town square, which was daily, seeing that I stayed in a hotel nearby. It is a place that’s constantly bustling with people – the energy here is amazing. There are buildings with beautiful architecture everywhere you look. Lots of street shows happen on a daily basis. There are loads of restaurants, coffee shops and bars in the area, as well as street food. There are lots to see and do and you somehow come across something new or different on every stroll you take. Love this place and never tired of it during my stay in Prague.

Somewhere in Time. one of the great destination in the world. As if, you where in the medieval times, hotels are great with cheap prices, cuisine is amazing and reasonably priced, the variety of activities within walking distance, the open market, the booze is out in the open, this city is a treat to everyone with wide range of price...pack your bags and experience Prague at it's best!

You cannot miss it. You cannot miss it because you'll pass through here eventually :) There is currently an Easter market on the Old town square and it's adorable. Lots of stalls selling typical Czech trinkets and street food. A small stage for concerts in the afternoon/evening.

Too busy for me but beautiful all the same. We visited in June 2015 and Prague was heaving with tourists. We were just shopping in the surrounding streets not really looking at the map for direction and we ended up here. Beautiful old square with lots of character and bustle of a usual tourist trap. There are plenty of sights to see in this square and restaurants surrounding the square. However, if you search a little bit further you can find less expensive restaurants but with great food and service.
Beautiful area!. Old Town Square is a beautiful area of Prague with lots of shops and eating choices. The clock is fascinating.

Beautiful. The beautiful old buildings around the square are amazing & the Old Town Hall & Astronomical clock are a must see. Plenty of nice restaurants/bars around the square & nice little shops to browse in. Also lot's of Jewellery shops selling Garnets & Amber. Really busy, even in February & stays busy well into the evening. Keep an eye out as you're walking though as the Segway's are everywhere!!
nice place to go. u must take a tour and drink ur morning coffee at one of those lovely restaurant and coffee shops .if it began to rain .... u r lucky.

Just revel in its beauty. Baroque and gothic style buildings in different colours make this square a feast for the eyes. Even more beautiful as the sun goes down. Watch for touts wanting to change money... not recommended! Also avoid restaurants in the Square as they tend to be more expensive.
Splendid Buildings. The old town square in Prague boasts some fantastic architecture. There are street performers to see and the astronomical clock is a wonder to behold.
Good to walk !!!. It's a pretty good area to walk by, if you want to go for shopping or eating everything is here in this area and also there are quite a lot numbers of casinos in this area.

Wonderful!. What a wonderful place to wander and just take in all of the awesome old buildings with their beautiful architecture. There are also quaint little shops tucked here and there as well as restaurants.
Old town Suquare. So many building to see here and not just on the square, behind as well. Lovely places to eat have coffee as well as eating 'hand held'
Very historic site. We were intrigued by the many restaurants and the cleanliness of the square. The clock is so fascinating and when it is the hour everyone gathers to see it perform.

Has to be included in your plans but other parts offer more character. in mid-november it was really busy but there are groups of people trying to get your business and the segways are a pain. i would say this would be a prime site for pick pockets as there are so many distrcations and people pushing past. but its a lovely place to just wander the shops and restaurants around the square

Crowded and commercial. If it's your first visit to Prague Staroměstské náměstí is a must see, just like Karlovy Most, but don't spend more than 10 minutes here. It's simply too crowded and too commercial.

Stunning, and 10,00 other visitors agree with you. This setting is exquisite, but unfortunately the rest of the world will be sharing it with you. New to me this visit - the Easter market (similar to the Christmas one, slight variations like a petting zoo and an Easter Tree). The architecture is at its finest at night with brilliant illumination.
Heart of the City. The finest part of the Old Town with city hall, astronomical clock, nice churches and lovely buildings. It is always full of people and the atmosphere is amazing.
Beautiful but crowded. The square itself is amazing however this is like Times Square in NY where almost every single tourist in the city is waving their selfie sticks around.
things to see every where. Everything touristy is there for your perusal. Really a fun city to visit. Truly does remind one of a cheap and friendly Paris.

Well worth a visit. We found it was better to visit as early as possible, gets really crowded (even in March), lots of cafes and restaurants, but they're more expensive than those on the periferi of the square. Beautiful architecture of several styles surrounds the square. But be warned according to a guide we used, the square is the favourite haunt of pick pockets, so hold on to your wallets and purses.
Beautiful city. Just back from this beautiful city It is my third short break here and I found it just as magical It is a must to visit

You will definitely visit !. It's the main point in city. You can find there all free walking tours, information office, astronomical clock ..........,if you get lost just ask for this place.everyone should known it!

ONe of the classics in Europe. Love this square currently dominated by the Easter Markets, a new convention in Europe's move toward commercialism. Great views from every direction- one concern is the tall gothic church hidden by what looks to be an art exhibit space. I can hear the bells but don't know how to access the church.

Beautiful. The square is bursting with character. and the must do is to see the astronomical clock when it chimes on the hour. We where warned to watch out for pickpockets though we never encountered any ourselves Another tip is to take very comfortable walking shoes for walking around Prague. the streets are cobbled and not suitable for heels! especially after visiting on of the bars!

I think this is here so you can always figure out where you are. This is a good central location from which to orient yourself. It's worth seeing the clock and the other things in the square, but you probably won't want to hang out here too long; it is packed with tourists and also draws a lot of pickpockets. But, there are plenty of stands to grab a hot wine or snack while you look around.
lovely place. one the best old town in Europe, just needs to explore it by going to every alley... you should fall in love with this part of town.
Buzzy!. A lively part of old Prague where tourist congregate and view the sights. Very buzzy and lively with street entertainers. Really can't avoid this area in Prague.

Magical Atmosphere. The Old Town is lovely. It has beautiful, gothic buildings and cobbled streets. It is extremely busy at most times of the day as it is a tourist hot spot but I think it all adds to the magical atmosphere. Nothing is very far away from The Old Town so I would suggest getting some comfy shoes on and walking your way around. My partner and I fell in love with Prague!

Fantastic square. You must not miss the most famous sighseeing in Prague. There are plenty of things to see( Tyn Church, Astronomical Clock) and eat (trdelnik, pancakes) and of course traditional shops.

Great atmosphere. At the square there are always many people. You can choose to have dinner in a restaurant or drink coffee after a day of walking. If you not so tired you can buy Prague`ham and potato salad from the stands.

A nice start when one visits Prague. I just loved the old town square with all its historical buildings like the old town hall with its medieval astronomical clock"Orloj" which is still in operation with a parade of apostles on the hour, the Church of our Lady before Tyn, the Jan Hus Momment that commemorates a religious reformer burnt at the stake for his belief, the Salon of Mrs Berta Fanta where Einstein spent time, and all the food kiosks that sell Old Prague Ham and Trdelnik, Al fresco dining restaurants and street performers doing musical numbers and other stunts. Remember to go up the old town hall tower where you can get a panaromic view of the square and the surrounding areas which is definitely worth the while. For your reference, the Old Prague ham was sold at the kiosks for 89 Czech crowns per 100 gm and as it is supposed to be a local delicacy, I ordered a plate to try and it turned out that I was given more than 200gm paying close to 200 crowns and I was told they do not sell 100 gms as it was too little. I have to say that the ham looked better than it tasted as it was on the dry side and my advice is if you are not a solo traveller like myself, share one portion with your friend(s) just for the novelty. In fact, a very respectable entree like knuckle of pork at some of the restaurants at the square would only cost you around 250 crowns and you can sit down, relax, be served and enjoy leisurely the surrounding atmosphere. One last advice, do come to the Square at night time as well as the lit up buildings really looked gorgeous!
Breathtaking. Stunning place lots of little side streets. Plenty places for food and drinks and great photo opportunities , close to everything.
Beautiful and buzzing. Old Town Square is very lively, with lots of beautiful buildings and history to look at. Food stalls are good, with traditional food served.

Lovely place to meander. You cannot fail to be impressed by Old Town Square and surrounding area. Brilliant atmosphere day and night with artistes, musicians etc entertaining everyone. Food is readily available from stalls and the smell of the huge gammon joints cooking over hot logs is just gorgeous. Vast choice of restaurants/bars nearby and shops selling anything and everything. A visit to Prague would not be complete without spending time here.
Lovely, but busy!. I loved the Old Town Square. Wonderful architecture, and a great vibe with street performers and buskers. It is very busy, and you do have to be mindful of pickpockets.

Lots of things to see. Lots of bars, restaurants and shops with lots to look at. A must see when in the city. Only downside is a lot of people trying to get you to take tours but this is expected when there's a high density of tourists- wouldn't hold it against the area!
Stunning . Lovely old square with beautiful buildings and churches. Lots of open air cafes to sit and watch the world go by. Worth a visit
very good. very good place. beautiful. in the middle. very lovely please visit in the evening. not good for food a lot of tourist please
Touristy - but hey you are most likely one of them. It is fun to walk around the square, make sure to watch the clock perform every hour on the hour. do some shopping, and grab a beer. it feels good
Very fun. Great street entertainers, watch out for pick pocketing, they almost got us while taking a pictures, otherwise a great place

Center for travellers. I've mentioned in another similar review : In my opinion, it is not the best town center that I have seen in Europe, but certainly charming and full of life. The interesting part about the town center for me was the people. The artists, mimics and performances. Ofcourse, the astonomical tower situated here, is certainly not to be missed. Also, you should go on top of the tour to get a brilliant view of the city!
Old Charm - Old Town Square. The old charm of the Old Town Square is intact and makes the whole place nostalgic. The place has some great local food to offer. Try them for sure.
Good place to walk around. Really fun to walk around, a lot of great shops to visit. Very touristy though, which has its pluses and minuses.

Old Town Square. We were staying very close to the square so passed through at least a couple of times a day. We also visited the sites in the square. We were there Tuesday to Friday and it was getting really busy, dont think i would like to be there at the height of the season

If you're in Prague, you'd be silly not to come here.. Old Town Square is amazing. There's so much to see and plenty of shops, bars, restaurants and unique buildings. Not that we did any but there's plenty of walking tours, Segway tours and car tours if you don't wanna walk around and explore on your own. Plus Charles Bridge is a stones throw away.

Magnificent on any time of day!. Go there by daylight to take a good look on the house with black murals, the tower clock and the surrounding buildings and watch various performances on the square itself, check the shops an galleries in the streets branching off. Come back in the dark to look at Kostel Panny Marie Pred Tynem - the view is fantastic! Or rather, fairy-tale-like.
Worth a look round. Worth a look round many shops bars and resteraunts and the odd street vendor selling reasonably priced food goods etc it has very good views of the castle up on the hill

very interesting. enjoyed the buildings it was very interesting to see all the designs. dont eat around here if on a budget as it was a lot more expensive than the local resturants which sold good food up the side streets

Beautiful. When you are in Prague make sure you visit the old town square. The tower and the church are breathtaking and you will not regret it! Prices for drinks and food will be a bit more expensive than other places but you do get a lovely setting that is worth it. If you get a chance, make sure you go up the tower. It is worth the money for the views of Prague.Word of warning, if you go to some of the street food carts they may try and rip you off with costings if they know you are tourist.
It's a Must . Mater piece! It's the magical square right in the middle of Prague. It's a must to explore the history of Prague Charming moments

Ripped off.. The square itself is ok to walk around, better in the summer, there are more stalls out. Anyroads, we should of known, been wise but still we were starving and silly sods us saw the ham stall and stupidly ordered something from them.On the menu the price for a sausage stated 69K and a cabbage bacon and pasta dish 45K. So just over 100K, "that's reasonable" we thought, was served my order and told "that will be 290K", I had to think for a second and realised I had been overcharged, but too polite to say anything and just paid, the bloke took my money with a sly grin and a sarky comment like "ah-ah it is only money".STAY WELL AWAY FROM THESE RIP-OFF HAM VENDORS!!!

Very tourist-friendly, almost all parts are pedestrian-only, and lots to look around even just for window shopping. I came here for the Astronomical Clock Tower, but after I reach here, I can go to many other tourist attractions on walking distance: Charles Bridge, Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, St. Nicholas' Cathedral, Parizska Road and many many others. This area of the city is almost all walking distance it's almost useless to buy day tickets instead of single tickets.Souvenir shops, tourist attractions, music shows and food, there's all of them. For beginner travelers like me, it's a comforting feeling to not be alone at all at all times since there will be people from day until night. Plus there's a lot to look around!

Tourist Central. A visit to Old Town Square is a must if you are in Prague . It is huge square by European standards so when the hoards of tourist show up it doesn't feel as claustrophobic as some of the small Italian squares . I suggest a guide to explain the various buildings and statues and of course the famous clock . Prague has a complicated but glorious history and understanding some of it will enhance any tourist 's experience .There are segways running about but they are usually well behaved and mostly part of Segway tour groups . Thanks to the cobblestone there are not bicyclists too as in Berlin .

A nice Place. Quite a shock and what a nice shock, Lovely old buildings makes you think how they did they build such great structures back then. Few nice cafes around to sit and take in the whole scene, only pain was the segways sellers

wow. Been here quite a few times and am never disappointed, an amazing place with lots of side streets off with little trinket shops selling all sorts of nik-naks, loads of shops, cafes, restaurants and bars to choose from , Prague is an amazing city witha great transport system, a huge amount of attractions, shopping malls, restaurant's etc to whet any ones appetite

A bit of a dissapointment. Lots of questionable characters lurking around the square. Segway's everywhere so if you are travelling with children proceed with caution. Only made worse by the crowds of tourists. Avoid peak times and go early in the morning or late at night. Some nice architecture tho and easy to get to many attractions from here.

One of the Best Old Town Squares Going !. There is a lot to love about Prague & a lot to do but you must immerse yourself in the Square at least once ! It is crowded , noisy, busy , segwayed & a lot of interesting sights and buildings to admire ! Plus Bars, Food, Churches & did I mention People ? Lots of people watching, if that's your thing , you are at home !! A great way to spend some pleasant time !! A Bohemian Beauty or maybe Rhapsody ?
Buzzing place. Good fun, lots to see, including clock in the corner, and restaurants around. You'll pass through if you walk anywhere in Prague.
Old vs new. So stunning and beautiful, we came in late winter which I hear is best. The number of tourists wasn't overwhelming, we enjoyed ourselves a lot.

Buzzing, lots go on, could spend all day just here!. This square has everything going on - markets, entertainment, lovely cafes and restaurants, a Punch & Judy.......Whilst we were there guys were promoting Segway hire to get around the town - really reasonably priced and well worth a go!

Beautiful architecture. Wandering around the old town square in Prague is a must. The architecture of the surrounding buildings is great, and the atmosphere is buzzy. It is particularly lovely at dusk.

Like a Disney fairy tale . An old square with many tourist oriented bars, food stalls and cafes around it. The old town hall and its famous clock are here along with many other interesting sights. We were lucky to see it snow at which point it looked like a Disney film set. A must see for any visitor.
Wow oh wow. I was herev today didn't plan to I got lost. It is beautiful behind words. A most see. Shame about the chain stores and fast food places
Old Town Square. We went to see the clock in the Square fantastic buildings lot happening ,Restaurants,Bars ,Entertainers

Just beautiful. Lovely place to stroll around, relax & take in your surroundings. Loads of beautiful buildings plus street entertainment & food vendors. Its especially beautiful at night time when its all lit up.

Perfect for Christmas (but beautiful all year round). The Old Town Square is a truly 'wow' place. Gorgeous buildings, the famous clock and the tower that you simply must go up. And then add in Christmas, all the festive stalls and the best Christmas Tree I have ever seen. It truly is impossible to exaggerate how good this square is at Christmas!
Main square . Lots of places to eat bear here. Also lots of tours meet here. The main square of Prague. Clock tower is here and street artists are plenty. It's a must see in Prague.

A must-see in Prague. It's a beautiful, but always crowded spot. Good to hang out if you know where to sit. It takes you away for a journey into Czech history especially when Jan Hus is looking at whole square from its monument.

The most romantic place. This square absolutely oozes charm and class. All the buildings are impeccable, the towers are magnificent and the buskers in the evening make it unbelievably romantic. Having come to prague expecting wenceslas square to be the big thing I was disappointed to find it was a bit rubbish, but the old town square sure made up for it. The fairy tale towers are some I will never tyre of seeing!

Touristy but fun.. This was my second trip to Prague. My first trip was in the summer and the extra day light allowed me to hit all of the tourist attractions. This time it was winter, so instead I just walked around the city in the evening. I found myself ending up in the Old Town Square every night. The shops and the restaurants and the street performers were just so attractive that the people just naturally gravitate there.
Vazlav Square. Fun and history combined. Many fun and classy shops. We had a wonderful experience walking around.. great.

History all around. . The hub of Prague. St Nicholas and Lady before Tye churches. Plus The Astronomical Clock. Loverly cobbled streets lead off this square to more lovely cobbled streets. Shopper if history seeker. A great place to start your visit to Prague.

Good starting point. One New Year's Eve this place was heaving with people celebrating. But even on other days it's always a lively location and a good starting point for any tour of the old town of Prague

Great place to spend evening. After a days work you can chill around the square with some artist entertaining you with the art.
Some street food and restaurants just adds spice to your evening.
Had great evening though crowded but very entertaining and refreshing.
Snow fall can spoil the party tough.
Just lovely. Another must do; so lovely. The church towers are like a birthday cake. Fantastic at night too as its all lit up.
Fabulous buildings. Lovely buildings in this very busy square however somewhat spoilt by segways which fly around at great speed
Center square. Many attractive shows that you watch, listen and enjoy. I recommend to eat tridelnic which is traditional dessert on the square.
Old Town Square. Lovely atmosphere and always something going on from stalls selling food, to music. And of course there was the Astronomical Clock and all the lovely restaurants.

Interesting square but very crowded. We liked the square with the clock tower and the massive sculpture but found the two cafe's that we stopped in to be average at best. The crowds at times were suffocating and there were many street performers and segways. We did find a good gelato cart that we stopped at several times.
Absolutely beautiful. Nice place to sit with as beer and appreciate people watching and old architecture. There is always something going on and has a real buzz about it.
Nice area. A great place to find a nice restaurant or a good bar. It is a very charming district with interesting constructions.

Great Street Entertainment. Did not matter what time of day or night we walked through the square there was alway some sort of entertainment, some good some not so but there were always large crowds and a great atmosphere. Always felt safe and the street cleaners were always out sweeping up.
Beautiful. Old square is great and magic with the amazing clock tower is a center of medieval Prague. Today it is a place where tourists and local people meet and spend time.

Something for everyone - especially the Christmas Markets!. Ahhh. The magic of Christmas is alive at Old Town Square at Xmas! The decorated tree is majestic, the smells are Devine coming from the various food stalls (try the roasted chestnuts!) and the beer is fresh and delicious. Street musicians, the spired and cathedral backdrops make you wonder if this isn't some wonderful movie set, but it's real, historic and simply amazing. Go early. Crowds build during the day. It's a sensory overload but soak it all in and try many foods but be aware many are priced by the kilo. Omg. The real hot chocolate?? We were in heaven.
got to visit old town. lots of history here. Should do a little history lesson including the Soviets parking their tanks right in the squar

History and food at old town square. Lots of food stands, and a feeling of being in another centuryThe old clock from centuries ago is a focal point ... Good place to meet peopleLine ups in summer for attractions
Romantic square . Really was fun here loads to see, the only draw back was it was full of sedgways spinning in and out still is a pretty place to go.

The Best Thing in Prague !. The Old Town Square is arguably the best attraction in Prague. It's more interesting at night. The large square with the Twin Castles and the Clock Tower is a great place to be at ! The twin castles at night remind you of the medieval castles of Dracula because of the way it's lit at the top. We visited just 2 weeks ago, I bet the place will be terribly crowded but even livelier in summer !
Awesome. An area absolutely packed with places to look at with awe especially the astronomical clock which is really one of a kind

Impressive and central square of Prague. You must go on top of the clock tower where you get to see the beautiful city of Prague from above. There are many beautiful coffee shops and restaurant where you can sit, eat, rest and enjoy the great and enchanted atmosphere of Prague.

The first thing we did when we got to Prague. We arrived in Prague mid-afternoon, dropped our bags at our hotel and went straight to the Old Town square. It didn't disappoint, we enjoyed seeing the clock and the area was very cosy once the sun went down. Plenty of places to eat, drink and sit too.
Nice.. Not as beautiful as other attractions, though there is a great statue of Wenceslas at one end of the square. Lots of traffic.
Amazing Happening Place. Just stay at this location every thing is next door, Charles bridge is just 5 mins walk walking tours are the best to explore the city

Loved the history. To be in a square that was established in the 10th century was amazing. Even in February, a low tourist season for Prague, the square was packed with people. Great restaurants and cafes surround the square and the churches and bu8ildings have a wonderful history. Terrific place.

On a lovely sunny day.... You would love this place...food trucks...crowd...music...cafes...worst(sausage) beer!!! One of the best places to visit in Prague. The atmosphere is usually very energetic. Stroll around the square...munch on something..check out the astronomical clock round the corner..try segways. Beware of vagabonds and food scavengers. Don't be surprised to find people scavenging litter bins for thrown away food.

Old Town Square the heart of Prague. This is one of the main areas that you come to see in Prague so be sure to include it on your itinerary. It's a place where you can people watch or get involved (including Segway riding..streetplayers etc). There is always something going on in the square. We were told to beware of pick pockets in amongst the big crowds but did not witness any crime while we were there. St Vitus cathedral is magnificent but be sure to take time to look closely at all the architecture both at eye level and beyond.

Simply awesome. A must visit in Prague. Lots of pubs, restaurants (all kind of food), street vendors and street musicians all in one place. The square is surrounded by beautiful old buildings and you can just spend time by roaming around and seeing the buildings. The square is packed with full of energy.

Fun area to visit. If you like shopping and activities this is the area for you in Prague! In the center is a church where on every hour the clock tower has an attraction so make sure you watch that. There are several glass shops in this area make sure that you are going to a shop that only sells glass so you are not getting knock off items. If you are in town for several days it can be cheaper to ship items back to the states on your own rather than through the shops directly.

A must see. We stayed around the corner from the square, you will see architecture surrounding you from all sides, street actors and musicians. Lots of restaurants and bars also the autonomical clock which chimes every hour amd is very beautiful.

A visitor must see!. This is a hustly bussily type of place with lots of places to stop and eat, and lots of shops to poke around in...what's not to like?! The famous clock sits in the middle of the square, and weekends seemed to attract many visitors to it.

Prague was fantastic.. Prague is one of those places on your bucket list that you would love to revisit. We enjoyed everything from the people to the great weather. The shopping is fabulos and with their dollar value compared to ours in Canada...it was very reasonable. The leather products are beautiful and like I say...very good in price. The evenings spent in Old Prague square with the romantic lights and music were definitely a hi-light however you got the feeling that some of the waiters didn't want to be at work. Lucky for us, we had a friendly one the last night of our stay which made for an awesome evening with wine and tapas. We went on a Segway tour which was worth the money and Anthony our tour guide took us all around the Castle which we probably wouldn't have walked up to because of distance and hills. Great fun for sure. We even found a billards place off the beaten path. The architecture throughout is stunning and although the cobblestones on the streets and sidewalks are sometimes tiring to walk on ... they are beautiful. We stopped to chat with some of the men doing repairs on them ... the older gents are the only ones working on the actual stone work as they are the sxperts. It's a dying trade unfortunately. We stayed at the 987hotel and it was about a 5min walk from Old town. Great place, service and had a full continental breakfast. It was right across from the train station but very quiet. Excellent hotel. Prague is or should be a definite on anyone's Bucket List.

The Middle Ages atmosphere under the moon light. This icon plaza is a must visit place, highly recommended during a full moon. Don't forget to walk around the surrounding streets. Every alley is a new discovery.

This is what you come to Prague to see.... During our short stay in Prague, we couldn't help but walk through this square as many times as possible. It is beautiful, spacious, full of history and a great site for pictures. It feels like all roads lead to the square so it shouldn't be hard to find but once there it sums up the charm of Prague all at once.
nice and free. nice place to hang around when its nice outside. lots of resto and little shop. it doesnt cost a dime either and i believe its a must when you go to prague

Family tour to Czech Republic 2015. Old town square is one of the most beautiful places I ever visited with a lot of interesting buildings, street shows, tasty food and many other attractions!!! Strongly recommended for any kind of tourists...
love to hang out here. Old town square is lovely place to hang out, people-watch, eat trdelnik, watch the horse carriages pass you by, take in beautiful buildings around.

See the past. Witness the future; it is all around you as you stroll through this magnificent locale. Old World architecture and statues populate the past while New Age talents attract your attention.

Never a dull moment. We had a bird eye view of the historical Astronomical Clock from our room at the U Prince, always a crowd in front of it. Enjoyed the laser light show against a building. What a square is all about, people watching, enjoying food on the patios, admiring the architecture. Can't check out Prague without strolling through Old Town Square.

Astrological Clock and Architecture. Visit the square at the top of the hour and seek out the astrological clock. Architecture around the square is spectacular. Check out the two churches. Good place to grab some local beer and interesting souvenirs.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful place, with lots of coffees, restaurants, bars. The architecture is very colorful and pretty! If you go to Prague don't miss this place! I recommend it 100%
Relaxing. The square is definitely the place to people watch. Plenty going on with lots of bars and eateries to chose from.
Sisters 40th birthday. A beautiful place to visit, everything is just lovely. Very much enjoyed our girls holiday.... Hoping hubby will take me back one day.

Very cosy and beautiful, but full of tourists . Take a stroll around the old town square and make sure to pay to go up in the Astronomical Clock Tower. On your way up you can learn about the history of the tower and at the top you get a great view over old town and the castle.

Old town square fun. What a lively and bustling place! Old town square will steal you heart away with its many attractions and sights! This is one of the many reasons Prague is my favorite city in the world! Highly recommended!!!

the main Square. A nice,cultural and arhitecture square with a lot of stores and cafe.Its always crowded but be alert for local scammer that want to change your money currency and DO NOT BUY food from the cantines there, serving low-quality food and overpriced take away food

A must see!. The old town square is a must see when you are in town. There are plenty of shops and there were some stands with local food and sweets. It is really central and near the astrological clock and st vitus cathedral. Do not miss it!
Beautiful . Lovely bridge full of character and interesting stories! Make sure you rub the gold statues and the golden dog for good luck! Best to see the bridge both day and night!
Prague. Loved all about Prague, but the old town square is incredible, plus, if you're young people sit together drinking their beers on the floor at night.
A must see in Prague!. The must see place when you come to Prague. The historic old buildings and the most famous astronomical clock. Bit crowdy but not to be missed.

a stunning square. Been coming for 30+ years and never get tired of it.
Best visited around 8 in the morning or earlier, when it´s empty and beautiful.

You'll love every part of Prague. I've been once before and there is nothing i do not like about Prague. Hard to fault the place.
The old square in particular has many restaurants and street vendors. During the warmer months (spring onwards) there are some amazing street performers. If in doubt, be reassured, Prague has plenty to do and see!
Great Square. The square is quite big and it has a lot to see. It is surrounded by well preserved old buildings, some churches and the famous clock tower.

Great landmark as a base to explore Prague from. Easy to find and a pivotal place to explore Prague from. Beautiful architecture and lots of streets going in all different directions offering shops, cute restaurants and just great walking and sightseeing. Get lost? Find your way back to the Square and start over with your Prague exploration.

A must-visit place in prague. At the old town square, you can see the famous cloak tower, the old town hall, and the gothic church of our lady. It is one of the most historical places in Prague and I would strongly recommend tourists to go there at least once in a life time!

A lot of people. This was where most of our time was spent. We used this as our meeting point for tours too. There are a lot of restaurants and stores around here and this is a main square for tourists. It has the famous clock. There are always performers here and it's always a good time. Get some food and beer from the outdoor vendors. You'll enjoy it!
Very crowded but nice. Always full of people with little markets every whereDuring Kristmas is wonderfull lots of street food and musicalAttractions
Tourist all over but cool!. I think this is one of the most amazeing places on earth with histsory in every nook and cranny! I found myself just looking at shadows at sunset!

The heart of Prague!. No trip to Prague can be complete without visiting this square. You see historical buildings here. You see entertainers snd musicians here. You taste delicious food here.All the guided tours start from here. Overall this is the heart of Prague.
Fantastic old town center. Fantastic and beatifull old town, majesty view, nice people, drink, foot, visit is recomended year-round

Feels like medieval with a big buzz. We visited the Old Town Square every day of our visit. It has heart, the amazing clock, some good Italian food on one end of it, and a huge buzz of energy. Great place to people watch and to soak up the atmosphere of Prague. Highly recommended as a center-point of activity.

Enjoyable. A typical place where people meet, pigeons circle, musicians play, while you can enjoy small sale booths with hot drinks and local food and bread, all surrounded by beautiful houses. The Segway rentals may be a bit annoying, but are not bothering people once No.

Very eclectic. If you are visiting Prague, Old Town Square is a must see. There are vendors, shops and people all around for endless entertainment. Plan on spending at least 2 hours here in order to see all it has to offer. Absolutely stunning.
One of the places you must visit. Very busy, lots of free music acts, segways everywhere a great church with quarterboys that put on a show every fifteen minutes. If in Prague, you must come here.
great. Great place relaxed and charming great buildings to see and the multi cultured people who comes here are so nice.

Gorgeous. Breathtaking buildings, gorgeous people, fabulous food.... Beware though of the cobbled streets, watch out for the pastries being cooked in tiny shops along the pavements, the smell is wondful.

Beautiful old square. A beautiful old square in the centre of the old town, lots of interesting buildings steeped in history, get a guide & do a half day tour of the castle & old town if you want too do it justice, not the same reading it from a book,, as with any busy place, watch your wallet though.
Photo Op. Definitely worth heading down there to take some photos! Tourist vibe! Just watch out for the all the salespeople trying to book those Segways. They were pretty aggressive on Sunday!
A must. Scenic buildings and statutes that go way back in history along with bands playing in the square plus quite a few restaurants if you want to partake of the excellent Czech food available.

The old town square is a place that you cannot avoid.. I would recommend that from there to visit the tower with the zodiac, I mean the tower of the old town hall. From there just walk heading the Charles Bridge or get lost in that beautiful area. It is a magnificent place.

Old town sqare. Visited here many times over our few days stay. Always interesting day or night. Always something going on, various buskers, human statues, action. Picturesque and a lot to see nearby. Plenty of cafes nearby also the astronomical clock. You have to go here if you're in Prague!
stunning. busy but beautiful by day and night and of course the Astronomical clock - A must see to wander around and absorb the atmosphere

Amazing at night!. Such a brilliant view and such a nice place to walk around and enjoy the nice open air. The tower is worth the visit and the cafes are also great.
Visit before 3 and then continue all the tours before enjoying the cafes.

Interesting Architecture . Lots of shops surround this area, different foodstalls, small art galleries and plenty of history. You could easily spend a few hours wandering around the little side streets. Here is also where you can hire a segway or buy tickets for the hop on hop off bus ( not worth it by the way)
Great Views !!. Take the time and walk around the Old City.. each street has a new experience that you will never see anywhere else in the world. the art work building designed are amazing!!

Relaxing part of the city. If you just wanna explore the city by wandering through the streets, this is a good place to start. People in prague seem to be more relaxed anyway which might be in relation with the smell of illegal substances that you can sense every 15 minutes. If you go in several little market and souvenir shops, you will find many things with marijuana in it: beer, absinth, chocolate, everything!
Amazing. Old town square is just amazing! Walk around and will see many interesting things such as astronomical clock and many shops with gift and souvenirs. Watchout pickpockets!!
Great in the night. Strip club peddlers, late night drunks, hobos, batchelor party piss drunk Brits, occasional brilliant display from a street performer, love it.

Gorgeous. . The Old Town Square is absolutely stunning. Everywhere you look is gorgeous historical architecture! There are street performers, tour touts, food stalls, and the area is surrounded by restaurants and shops. Don't miss it.
One of the "must see"!. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Like in the title... You must visit this place if you're in Prague for the first time.

Enjoy a walk around Old Town Square. View the street performers and watch the Astronomical clock when it strikes the hour. To climb the clock tower will cost 5 Euro each (Cash only) no credit cards accepted.
Lovely place. The city of Prague is so lovely and would never get bored of just looking out onto this square and the clock tower. It's a must visit.
Breathtaking. Beautiful stroll through historic Prague. Vendors selling sausages and shops with so much history. Love!
great place. Old Town Square is charming just like the rest of the City. Just a short walk to Charles Bridge and the old town.

Nothing but romantic. Everything about Old Town Square makes it a couples paradise. Walking onto the square simply takes your breath away. The outside of the square is surrounded by restaurants and bars, perfect for sitting and watching what is happening on the square. On the Saturday when we visited there were all sorts of entertainment, including a couple of men playing bongos who were especially good. The Jan Hus monument sits proudly on the bottom of the square, but most people come onto the square around the hour to watch the marvel of the Astronomical Clock show. The Church of Our Lady of Tyn, sitting just behind the square, but also dominating it, looks great when lit up at night.

Lots of interest in a small area. If you stand in the middle of Old Town Square you will see things of interest all around: different styles of architecture, churches, monuments, the astronomical clock, lively bars and restaurants, street traders and entertainers - there`s always something going on. It looks particularly atmospheric after dark and one of the bars opposite the astronomical clock is a great place to sit with a drink and soak it all up.
WOW!. There is so much happening, it's mind-boggling. From musicians to people selling souvenirs to ancient cars giving tours. Oh, and segways and more segways!
Truly Beautiful. The old town is chock full of wonderful architecture and the atmosphere at night and especially over Christmas is magical. Not to be missed.

Beautiful square. We visited in December and it was very busy, but with a great atmosphere full of shoppers and people enjoying the trednelik (local delicacy) and mulled wine.The surrounding buildings are really characterful and make this a really wonderful winter scene.Plenty of shops on the square and sights to see. A must do whilst in Prague.

December visit . We visited in December whilst the Christmas markets were on and the place was just magical. Loved the massive Christmas tree, it was just beautiful. There were lots of Christmas markets stalls set up and a great atmosphere in the square.

All roads lead here!. A lovely vibrant square surround by narrow streets and old buildings full of shops and restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets. You can visit the church tower or wait with the crowds to see the astronomical clock strike the hour, albeit underwhelming. The square has plenty of charm and is a magnate for the crowds, it a great place to sit around and people watch on a sunny day.

Great square- some times events are held here such as music events. Prague is an amazing city with architecture that is somewhat unparalleled.The old town is a great sight to see. Those pictures you see on the internet are real.I suggest going in summer. Be warned there can be music festivals and events in the square sometimes so check ahead.

the motorized train tour. pick up this tour it is 1 hour well worth it as it will take your round the castle and back those who are finding it hard going on the stone cobbles and marble walk ways great ways to get some lovely pics without too much effort
Beautiful and interesting!. Such a mixture of old and older! Fascinating and with so many bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from. Street vendors and street-performers - even in February!

Buzzing at all times. This is the place to see street theatre and hear musicians. It is very big with restaurants and bars on one side and historic buildings on the other. People gather to see the astronomical clock on the hour and you can take a lift or walk up the tower for magnificent views. You can find cheaper places to eat round the back streets, all nearby and all the souvenir shops are just a stroll away. Well worth a visit if you are in Prague. It also houses the main tourist office where the staff are very helpful.

A magical little corner of the world. After a slightly dodgy bus ride, where my wife and I were dropped off a few blocks away, walking into the Old Town Square felt like walking into Disneyland. The square was bustling with activity - music, delicious smelling food stands everywhere and hot wine steaming in the cold. The architecture packed into that little square is astounding, and even though our hotel was right smack dab in the center of the square, I never got used to the sight of it all. The surrounding city was also great fun to explore, but the Old Town Square was definitely the highlight.

Old town. The old town square is full of activities . Street entertainers ,food stalls . You can easily spend hours just watching what's going on .Had a meal there one evening very overpriced and poor service . Recommend eating away from the square better service and value

Lovely square with some great buildings. We stumbled into the old town square by sheer luck as we all got lost walking the cobble pavements and the views around the square are lovely, especially the architect of the buildings and decor. The astronomical clock is also located at the square.

Old but alive!. From the hop-on-hop-off bus I found the square headed back there on foot. The square has the astronomical clock and a good view of the surrounding old gates. The square was full of buskers and live bands. Many, many cafe and restaurants. But best of all there are some many beautiful building to look at....my camera went flat!

simply ..superb. one of the most beautifull places in prague..its not only the astronomical watch to see, all the buildings around the square are amazing .....photos can not describe the artistic side of the buildings....
Nice. nice to sit and have a few beers but rather expensive compared to the rest of the eateries and drinking places in prague. Nice to people watch though after a long day.
busy place even when it's snowing. Don't expect this place to be quiet. Busy and crowded even when it's snowing. The clock has to be seen.
