Prague night trip . Such a gorgeous piece of architecture, old town square gave me goosebumps, we had a stop over with the lads as we was on our way to the club, the lights from the tower were so nice, many people were still up and about at about 9pm, best place to visit while in the capital

Fascinating but a clear tourist trap. Old Town square is undoubtedly one of the best places in Prague. It's fascinating and the architecture and vibe and energy of the square is great. There's nothing like a glass of mulled wine while you wander along. Let's not forget the wonderful astronomical clock and town hall is here!!! The little market stalls are also a great place to pick up a souvenir!But. Obviously it's a major tourist trap. Here you WILL get bothered by the tour guides (on and off segways) trying to sell you their tours. All of which are the "Best in Prague". This is not necessarily a bad thing but after the 5th gets a bit taxing. Just bare that in mind. All in all though. A MUST SEE in Prague and a fascinating place. I loved it and we visited several times during our stay.
a must visit. Very nice placeCrowded especially in the eveningStreet performances.In short, everyone went thereAnd for good reason

Ylovely Christmas City break. Lovely old square with lots of Christmas cabins selling lovely Christmas decorations lovely food and mulled wine. Lovely place to visit at Christmas. Lovely atmosphere and very seasonal. Would recommend this short greak.

What a ple to enjoy history and the crowds of local and foreign visitors.. A must place to visit, and do wait for the clock to chime the hour. Good historic buildings and bars in which to rest and imbibe a local beer or wine.
Historic . Lovely buildings here, reminds you of the good old days. Plenty of shops, stalls and restaurants nearby. So worth a visit.

Magical!. I can't describe the Old Town square it's a truelly magical space and the buildings are beautiful. It felt very much like I was on a film set, it just didn't seem quite real. At night all the buildings are flood lit making them look even more amazing (especially the Church of Our Lady before Tyn, which I dubbed the Disney Castle!). We visited in December so the Christmas market was in the square which made it even more special. I'd really recommend visiting at this time of year as the Christmas tree is amazing and the food on the stalls is brilliant.We spent most of our trip hanging around this square, there's just so much going on and so many people the atmosphere was fantastic. I was sad to have to leave...

Great place. The old town square is a heart of Prague with it's atmosphere. It is worth to visit nearby churches and go for one of the many concerts offered here.garden restaurants, street musicians, town hall view these are all the attractions here.nearby chocolate museum, museum of torture etc.

Staromestske Namesti (Old Town Square) Prague. One of the most visually appealing historical squares in Europe - which includes the Astronomical clock, the Old Town Hall, monument honoring the 21 Czech nobles beheaded in 1621 which led to the 30 Year European war, and in the middle of the square the statue of Jan Hus.One of the nation's most significant places.

Amazing place. We stayed in Prague for 7 days. Everyday we kept on going to the old town square. The old town square is very lively with lots of shops and a lot of restaurants to choose from. There are lots offood stalls with very reasonable price. I really enjoyed old town squarer. A must see place if you are n Prague.

Nice square. A nice square with plenty of nice buildings and gorgeous buildings. Be prepared to be pestered to 'try' a sedgeway, there are loads of them here for hire!. See if you can join a free walking tour here to learn some of the history of the square. Plenty of cafes, bars and kiosks to buy food and drink (and rest your feet)

definite must-see. the tower of the old town hall is worth a visit for the panoramas from the top on a clear day, and has lots of information about its history. There are good restaurants in the area, particularly the one just across from the orological clock. Its also near the riverside where the dinner cruises depart from, the high-class Paris St, and the Jewish Quarter.

Heading back for 1st time in 5 years. The square is surrounded by amazing buildings and the clock is great to watch the display at night with either a beer or nice warm hot chocolate. Lots of nice places to eat but walk about 2 minutes off the square and get the same beer half price and much cheaper food. Lovely smell of ham cooking over an open fire pit

So beautiful and full of activities to look at . Went here in the afternoon and there was so many stalls and activities happening around the square. I loved the atmosphere and environment of the place. Great for families,couples or the everyday traveller to see when they are in Prague.
Bustling with life. Lots of people, attractions and street performers. It's a must go in Prague! There are some good restaurants around.
Beautiful. A very beautiful square to sit back and relax in. Very atmospheric at night. Plenty to look at and a good variety of places to grab some food or a beer and watch the world go by

New Year. For the Christmas period a magnificent tree dominates the square, all the surrounding buildings are decorated and the square itself is packed with small wooden huts selling a wide range of craft trinkets and souvenirs. Tree decorations made of lace and wood, cut work cloths, sugar coated nuts, sweets, fridge magnets etc etc There are also beer and food stands, hot mulled wine, hot mead with almond, apple drink, cider and those wonderful spit cooked cinnamon pastries are available as well as bratties, Prague ham, kebabs and roasted sweet corn and chestnuts, very festive and in its own way as good as any German Christmas market, it doesn’t feel tacky just festive and fun

Reminded me of all the places I've seen in movies but never been. Europe is so much different than the US and our lack of squares is definitely an example of that. I spent about an hour here just walking around and shopping a bit waiting for the clock to go off again and again. Okay, maybe I drank a little too but I was on vacation you know...
Amazing and fun. Lots to do in the square, amazing architecture and history and lots of shopping and eateries. A must to stop at!

You'll Strain Your Neck Looking Around. Oh, man. It's just so beautiful! I can't say enough about the incredible intricacy of Prague's architecture. There are, of course, people peddling their wares (mostly tours) as well as large crowds, but you'll be awed by the biuldings.

A beautiful square. A busy square, typical locals trying to entice you into their restaurants, street traders, people on segways trying to tempt you into hiring, politely refuse and they leave you alone. The architecture is beautiful, well worth spending time there.
Grab a beer and relax. Nice town square. See the astronomical clock, churches, and relax with a beer. Very pretty at night.
A Fairy City. Walk and walk along the streets of the the city..(like a fairy tale)Your feet will guide you..Just Live and See.
Beautiful. Wonderful area with good restaurants nearby and entertaining buskers around the main square. A must-see if you're in Prague, in particular the astronomical clock

Literally can't miss it. It's such a gorgeous square, it's hard to decide what to stare at. In any case, if you ever want to walk to anywhere in historic Prague, you can't really walk around this place, and I don't think you'd want to.

Soak up the Prague Atmosphere. This square is on every visitors itinerary I am sure and if not it should be. Surrounded by beautiful architecture this square is quite big so no worries about crowds. It has the great monument to Jus Han overlooked by the beautiful buildings. It is a nice place to eat and just listen to great street musicians.

Probably not at its best. It was very cold when we visited (January) so the square was not that busy and the street cafes were struggling to provide a warm place to sit. The astronomical clock was a bit underwhelming to say the least.
Get there early!. If you get there early you can avoid huge crowds of tourists, plenty to see and very beautiful, would definitely recommend lots of photo opportunities and the buildings are amazing

The Centre of Prague. If Times Square is the heart beat of NYC, Old Town Square may be the heart and soul of Prague without the tawdry aspects of TS. Shops, small hotels, cafes, old sites and wonderful architecture to capture you.

Always something going on here . . This is the real centre of Prague where everyone seems to gather . We were here for New Years Eve and it was so crazy busy , they have a great Xmas market with loads of food stalls amongst all the great Architecture , churches and the Astronomical clock . The free walking tours also start here .
Charming!. A very charming square, really nice just to sit around and feel the city. The views are amazing, but there are better restaurants very near, on the streets that surround the square.

RIVER CRUISE. OLD TOWN SQUARE is main network junction for kind of departure point. also you can find young crowd, beer bar, restaurant, and shopping point and old hotels. you can have good tips of reach history from this point.
Lovely picturesque square.. The real centre of Prague , all roads lead back to the square pricey to eat in the square restaurants but worth it for the views, pick up walking tours from here

Busy spot. By day it's a nice gathering place with lots to see and do. Take the usual precautions you would in any large public space in any large city (pickpockets, people trying to convince you to change currency or sell you something). By night it becomes a very different experience and some of the items you may be offered for sale are... well.... not quite legal?... but hey you decide!)

Iconic landmark!. The star of Prague for me! The architecture, the history, the stunning views make this the place to sit and take it all in. The cosmopolitan and vibrant atmosphere make this memorable; there's always something remarkable to see.

Beautiful surroundings. Walk to this wonderful square and enjoy the atmosphere and the magnificent buildings. Cafes and bars are all around and it's a great spot to rest your feet and watch the world go by. We went in December and the tree was a sight to behold, the largest Christmas tree I have ever seen. We sat at a table in a restaurant just as the heavens opened. We only wanted a drink and they were quite happy about that. Most city establishments around Europe would not offer a table if you were not eating but Prague is a wonderful exception.

a lot to see. there is a lot to see in this big town square - cathedrals, Galleries, Churches, astronomical clock and more. There are street performers to take pictures with and to listen to them play musical instruments - one of them makes bubbles, setting a romantic mood (and fun for children)

Hystorical center of Prague Old City,. Prague is the one to visit, Staromestka is absolutely stunning, also if you are at Staromestka square visit Staromestka restaurant as the prices are low and the food is high standard, so delicious, we had skewers, salads, karlovy vary dumplings, old prague goulash, pork knee, steak, everything was scrumptiously mouth watering food, simply the best restaurant around!

The main meeting point in Prague.... It is impossible to avoid this charming square in the middle of the old town. The main attraction is the old clock. It strikes every hour. Then lots of people gather beneath it to hear and watch... In summer there are too many tourists, so we usually go to Prague in the winter, even if it can be quite cold and windy... There are some art gallerys on the square, wort visiting.The restaurants in front of the clock are expensive

A Perfect Meeting Spot. Although I would avoid going inside the commercial mall, there's a fantastic street food area outside of it, as well as beautiful historic buildings. If you're meeting up with somebody, it is an easy place to find.

great place! bad fillings!. that place is great, very beautiful, but people working in places around (restaurants, shops, bars, etc)i found them bit stressed, everybody try to take more money from you. i try to change euro to czech koruna in authorized spot and they keep 28 % because its city center(?) so be careful!!!

Stunning place and loads to see and do!. Awesome place with history, beauty and culture at every turn - fantastic place. There's loads to see and do just in the old town square itself from art galleries, quirky shops, high end jewellery and clothing boutiques, open air bars, historic buildings and the view from the tower is amazing - if you are in Prague even for a day go there!

Amazing goulash!. You can sit inside, but I highly recommend sitting outside on the large patio. They have heaters for the cooler days and tent tops to protect you from rain. It's nice to sit and enjoy the bustle of the markets and you can hear the clock tower ring as its located almost rihht beside it. The goulash and boiled bread is a must have! If you get the special, you get a nice beer with it!
Great Heritage Square in Prague!. Iconic Medieval Square with lots of attractions and great buildings! Don't miss the clocks in every hour!
History in a square. The square is huge and historical. Lots to do, see, wander, drink, and eat. Grab a beer and a seat and people watch on a sunny day.

Stunning architecture & atmosphere . We were only in Prague for 3 nights but each day we would wonder through the square several times and marvel at the stunning architecture & soak up the atmosphere. There are plenty of places to sit in the square & also restaurants dotted around to grab decent food/beers/wine etc! - We ate at Olivia Verde one evening & enjoyed our meal. Each day there would be somebody performing in the square which would draw some crowds.There also lots of guys on Segways punting for business around the square so just be prepared for that, however, exploring is easily done on foot. If you take one of the side streets by the restaurants & clock and keep going, you will reach the bottom of Wenceslas Square in about 10 minutes (if that).

Beautiful.. Amazing architecture evident and an interesting history. Worth going up the tower to get a panoramic view of the square and whole city as well as a snapshot of it's history. Yes, there are tourists, what do you expect! Go in winter when it's quieter and thus more comfortable. I wouldn't suggest eating at restaurants on the square - they are very expensive. You can get better for cheaper elswhere in the old town. Loose a mark for some crappy "performers" that are hanging about ready to fleece you and the segway tours (and those peddling them) making a nuicance of themselves. If you are to lazy to walk, this shouldn't be the city for you.

Just a beauty. Literally the old city's centre. Just a few minutes walk from every interesting spot of the city , like Charle's bridge , jewish cemetery etc. You can rest and have a coffee while waiting for the famous astronomy clock to ring or have a walk around the square to see all the stores ,espesially the ones with the handmade toys and puppets or with the famous bohemese crystalls .

Old Town Square is breath taking. Doesn't matter if its night or day - the Old Town Square is amazing with it's big clock (Orloj) and towers. I recommend you to go also inside castle of st Nicolas (Kostel svatého Mikuláše).

Carnival atmosphere surrounded by history . . .. Mimes, musicians, bubble blowers in a beautiful ancient town square surrounded by historical and well preserved buildings and an ancient, astrological clock with performs on the hour -- what more could one ask for?
Dream city. The beauty of the old town is endless, each building is gorgeous, full of rich architecture, lovely bars and restaurants around it.
Great place. Beautiful buildings and lots going on! Restaurants around here are a bit pricier than if you go a little bit further afield down the little side streets!

Climb the tower and see all of Prague!. The Old Town Square is surrounded by historic buildings. One has a tower where you can climb up for a fee - students with discounts - and see all of Prague! This is where the famous view of a thousand spires are pictured! This is not to be missed. If one intends to climb up, just take the elevator to conserve energy. The view is simply breathtaking! I suggest that you go up early in the morning to avoid long queues! You can also stay for a while and take scenic photos of Prague!
Ok. The place was common as u can see in other European cities. There was some interesting spot but very crowded.

Evening out at the square. Fabulous place day or night. Enjoyed many of the restaurants. Absolutely love the patios. They have heaters and even provide you with blankets and of course the dogs were welcomed and given a bowl of water and greeted by all the staff.
A must visit during Christmas. I visited Prague during the Christmas period in 2015. The christmas markets are great. The astronomical clock isn't far away from here.

Very nice place but do not change your money !. Very nice place but do not change your money in the office facing the Clock. They claim that they take 0% commission but it is tricky ! Instead of changing for example 100 € at the normal rate giving 2500Kr, they change with a far lower rate to 1500Kr. When they give you back the money, they ask you to sign, do not do it ! WHen you sign, you can not complain and they are very agressive.

No, I don't want to ride a segway.. One gets the impression that this used to be a lovely square to visit, with pretty buildings and the beautiful astronomical clock.However, the atmosphere is spoilt by the tour guides and groups buzzing around on segways and barging you out the way to get photos.
Christmas markets. The atmosphere in the square makes this a fab place to explore the sights sounds smells and tastes of the Christmas markets, would thoroughly recommend !

Focus of Attention. The old town square is the focus of attention for tourism in Prague, so beware! Being centrally located it's close to most places of interest and the collection point for tours. Although the square is dominated by the cathedral and the Astronomical clock (it's not THAT big) don't miss the smaller exquisite decorations on the smaller buildings around the square and the building where Kafka's father had his shop. The clock does its thing on the hour and crowds will gather from about quarter to. See if you can identify the four great fears embodied by the static figures on the clock! Younger visitors might be underwhelmed by the clock, but in its day it was no doubt the last word in technology. Don't eat near the square; you'll pay a fortune, but as with so much of Prague if you walk a few metres you'll always find somewhere cheaper. Visit Bohemia Paper tucked into the entrance of the Cathedral for some unusual gifts.

The beating heart of Prague. I stayed a 100m from the Old Town Square. It's a beautiful square, surrounded by old architecture. I visited whilst the Christmas Markets were on, and the atmosphere was fantastic. It was very crowded, with both tourists and locals roaming. It's a great place to wander, admire the architecture and gather your bearings, as it's so central to everywhere.

Huge plaza with history and interesting places. This is one of the must see in Prague. I suggest that you have a local guide with so she/he can explain the history and the plaza. Within the plaza is the Astronomical Clock.

An Architecturally Lovely Area of Prague . This area of Prague has great buildings and at the time that we went, a great atmosphere as well with so much to see and many Restaurants & Coffee Shops
Well worth a visit when you are in this lovely City
Enjoy
Turist place. Beeing there several times. Collects lot of tourist in the square and of cause the prices are very high comparing the normal price level. Still mus to see.
Homeless Walk. As part of the conference I attended, we were shown a project called the Homeless Walk around Old Town Square and the train station.

make sure you are ready to take pics.. its breathtaking...lots of battery and lots of memory in your camera.....it is so lovely....book a long holiday or get ready to book another one...a paradise for history buffs!!!!

Christmas markets. We visited just before christmas and there were lots of christmas market stalls in the square. there are lots of nice cafes around the square which are good for enjoying a drink and some cake whilst people watching. during the day the square did get rather busy with lots of tour groups.

Take care! . Prague is a very beautiful city and a must for all travellers wanting class culture and experience. The people are lovely and it is a very safe city. HOWEVER one word of warning. DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTACES CHANGE YOUR MONEY AT THE STREET EXCHANGES. THEY ARE ALL SCAMS AND THEY DO THIS 'LEGALLY'. GO TO BANKS/Bank atms. You will get the correct rates. Otherwise enjoy this beautiful place x

Very Nice. Stayed in the square during December and the New Year, with the christmas market in full swing what an atmosphere, great place to visit, plenty of shops and restaurants, with Al Fresco dining even in the winter months, really cool place and well worth a look if you're in Prague, Astronomical Clock located on the edge of the square also
wow. we didn't know what to expect as we have never gone away over xmas ,but wow ,u gotta be there to appreciate there culture and xmas celebrations

Enjoy the history and the people watching!. Enjoy the history and the people watching! Easy walking with history, stores, beer gardens and fantastic food. Be sure to take in the clock at the top of each hour.

Beautiful place. Beautiful place with every kind of architecture and history. Astronomical clock is very interesting. Christmas market was nice and christmas tree was one of the best tree what I ever seen.

Beautiful. Beautiful square full of history! You can also see it from the top, or park in a nearest restaurant. Amazing in winter with the christmas markets (which are crowded though before christmas)
The square. We got a table for drinks and sat outside by the clock and watch with all the other tourist see the bell toll. The creature come out and run around.

Christmas Market. Very nice old world style Christmas market was set up in the square. We were there on the opening day of the market (very crowded) and visited several times on the following days (much less crowded). Plenty of good food and drinks available plus vendors selling Christmas items. I would recommend visiting the square and old town at night--the combination of Christmas lights and the floodlighting of the old buildings and churches was very picturesque.
Beautiful buildings / Surroundings. As part of our holiday in Prague, we visited the old town square which is pretty central in Prague. The square is large with plenty of people. Good visit!
Very Scenic. An astounding amount of history and architectural features here. Lots of street performers and a guy who looks like Jesus giving out free hugs. What more could you want?
Amazing,,. An amazing place to go, everything around is beautifull, loved walking around, also lots of resturants and shops..

Like Stepping Back in Time. Everywhere you look there are amazing buildings, beautifully restored and maintained. If you close your eyes, you can almost imagine that you are in bygone eras. There is no litter and it is so clean.Awe inspiring

Local Bars and Restaurants around. It's a huge square with a lot of restaurants lined around it. In the middle, performance acts and tour groups will crowd in it. Worth a visit to see the 360 view with other tourist attractions round the corner and grab a ice cream along :)
A must see! . You can't go to Prague without visiting the Old Town Square. Absolutely beautiful and full of history. Great place to take photos too.

Great atmosphere and beautiful buildings. My friend and I visited Prague for New Year and stayed in a hotel right on the Old Town Square. The added bonus was the beautiful Christmas tree as well as the food and craft stalls of the Christmas market. The buildings next to the astronomical clock and the clock itself are beautiful decorated. The view from the top of the clock tower over the square was amazing. Don't worry there is a lift! The Old Town Square is well worth a visit.

Old Town Square, Prague. This was my first trip to Prague and I had a whole list of places that I wanted to see and do! The greater part of this list are located close to the Old Town Square and even though this was a short trip, time in the Square was not wasted! There is the Astronomical Clock, which attracts crowds every hour. Behind the Town Hall and the clock. look to the right and the twin steeples of the Church Our Lady of Tyn tower over the building in front. Access is by a passage. It is well worth a visit and whilst it is open 10am - 12 Midday and 3pm - 5pm. There are postcards and guides in English, The Interior is magnificent and you will not be disappointed. There is still restoration work to be completed for the damage dome during the closing stages of World War Two. There is another Church, St. James, which is also impressive and unlike the Church Our Lady of Tyn, they allow photography, providing you do not use flash photography. The Square is very close to the Charles Bridge, an absolute must for every visitor to Prague
One of my favorite cities. Prague is an enchanting city suitable for all ages.Great places to eat around the old town,..but a bit too expensive (very touristic)
Great New Year Market. Brilliant market plenty to see and do. Lots of restaurants and some great sightseeing nad photo oppertunities

Christmas Markets at Old town. Square is beautifully decorated during Christmas season and you also get to eat local food. Must try Czech local food....bramborak (potato pancake) , goulash soup , wafer, sausages and much more. Must drink Mulled wine & hot chocolate. It is a meeting point for everyone , you can shop ,eat n drink there. centre point to all major attractions in prague.

Wonderful place in europe.... I was in Prague and Cesky Krumlov for 5 days, all the landmarks was suprising me, especially old town square and charles bridge! I was really enjoying the trip!!! I will definely return to this city if i get chance!
must see; chill out for a while. Cobbles streets, local food, beautiful buildings, architecture. Segway tours available if you want, but highly recommend just wandering the streets on foot.

Centre of Prague and your trip. Unmissable -- you will and anyway stumble up here. Whole town kind of congregates here, and all roads lead to and from the Old Square. Tons of shops, souvenir stores, and hordes of people. Astronomical clock, Charles Bridge etc all are a short walk from here.
part of your visit to prague. whenever you visit the old twon you have to stand at its square..its that simple ! its the attraction of the tourists and all the trips start there

Old town square, Prague. We went during the Xmas and New Year period. The square was filled with stalls offering everything from T shirts to food. Xmas decorations were everywhere and a magnificently decorated Xmas tree occupied a prime spot. Around the square there were street restaurants enclosed within glass walls offering great food and hot wine. The restaurants we equipped with lots of mobile heaters and with personal blankets for your knees when they were under the table! The square was very, very busy.

Old Town Christmas Market. The square is bustling at Christmas and it is amazing - especially at night. On every side the architecture is 'jaw dropping' with lighting to enhance. Plenty of restaurants, food stalls providing good value and atmosphere.

Overwhelming in so many ways. First of all, you must realize that you are standing on paving stones which were laid in the 10th century. You are also standing on the spot in which the Czech aristocracy was brutally wiped out--murdered--in the 17th century. Fast forward to Hitler's tanks and troops marching through and you begin to get s sense for the rich tapestry of history that was woven in this square.

Beautiful. The Old Town Square is beautiful & definitely a must-see in Prague. I really enjoyed the beautiful architecture & the colorful buildings. We also climbed a tower which made it possible to have an amazing view over the square.Eating & drinking is more expensive because of the amount of tourists, but overall still cheap. Look around, sit down, eat, drink & just enjoy.
Very atmospheric. I loved the vibe and the medieval look of the square! Really neat and cozy! Would return there again!

Busy, Entertaining, Historical. We walked over to the Square after sightseeing on the Karluv Bridge and visiting the Church of St Stanislaus. It was busy with tourists from many countries, colorful street entertainers, people eating at outdoor cafes. It was an exciting place to be plus one is surrounded by so much history and old architecture.

History on view. This is definitely a place to visit, the old town hall certainly worth a visit and draws large numbers of visitors especially to watch the astronomical clock chime on the hour. We visited during Christmas market season and old town had one of the better markets,
In the heart of Old Town. Situated in the heart of Old Town. The square is surrounded by historical buildings, churches. You can feel yourself in the medieval town and time.

The Heart of the Fairy Tale Town. The is the core of the Old Town in Prague, the moment you reached this square you know you are in business, just looking to the surroundings, the architecture, the locals, etc. you perceive the rich History and Culture of the city, from here most of the tours starts and you can plan your daily activities in one of the zillions of cafes and restaurants around the square. If you happened to like Beer, you are in the birthplace of one of the Best beers in the World the Pilsner that is produce in several breweries around Prague.
Lots of history. There are many walking and bus tours -- or combinations of both. Be sure to pack good walking shoes as the cobblestone streets and sidewalks can be tricky to navigate.

Lively place. Everything you want to do is right here. Very convenient for catching a tour our eating and entertainment. Very interesting and a huge gathering place for all. Great shopping for everyone!!!! Everything within walking distance.

Beautiful Square almost a fairytale!. Beautiful town Square a must if you are in Prague! Looks like a Disney fairy-tale. Looks even better in winter, lots of Christmas markets around and Hot wines! A must if in Prague. great bars around the square also.
Site of the largest Prague Christmas Market. A typical European town square that is filled with booths during the Christmas market. Interesting architecture, like the rest of Prague. Easy to access.
attraction. Well worth a wander round and soak in the sites. Great to eat in out side but can be priced but well worth a few beers and watch the world go by

What to say?! This place is in my heart and be sure to visit as soon as possible!. This is for me a special place in the magical city of Prague!
Climb to the top of the tower ( Czech people called "Orloj" ) and enjoy a spectacular view from a bird's eye perspective!
Many attractions, European atmosphere. The square has them classic European main squares' street attractions, from acrobats and clowns to Segway and bike rentals.Good atmosphere. Nice people.

Hive of tourists. The square is wonderful and it is a must in case you are doing a sightseeing. Many beautiful buildings and the world famous clock - Orloj. Unfortunately, the prices of everything are double and you can meet many pickpockets and other people trying to rip off tourists.
Gorgeous. The old town square is a vibrant place to visit...full of charm and very atmospheric...other attractions are near by and at night it is truly a stunning place to visit

Beautiful Facade. One of the most beautiful houses in Prague is known as the Storch House (No. 16). It is also called “At the Stone Virgin Mary”. The house is located in Old Town Square and was designed in the 19th century. The house was owned by Alexander Storch in 1896 and is painted with three different sections. The lower part shows scientific and astronomical studies, the middle has Prague’s Coat of Arms, and the top shows St. Wencelas riding a horse. Take the time to look at the facade. You won’t regret it.

A charming district. An evening to cherish for the rest of your life.the architecture; the cathedral; the history abound is an experience not to be missed...try to be there by noon because the sundown in winters (when i visited) happens at 4 pm

Stunning!. Any visit to Prague must include a visit to the Old Town Square. We visited in early January and the whole area was very festive with a beautiful Christmas Tree and Christmas Market stalls. There is easy access to the Astronomical Clock, Town Hall tower and Cathedral. There is a real 'buzz' in the square which is surrounded by street cafes, restaurant and bars. It is well worth visiting the square at night because there is a wonderful atmosphere. An absolute 'must'!

Drink in the atmosphere. The square is always a hive of activity so you can take time out and chill in any of the many Bars and restaurants on the square. In December the many heaters and blankets provided in the Cafes coupled with a warming glass of mulled wine ensure the chill is about relaxing not about temperature.

Wow. If you get a chance to go here before christmas, you should. The whole christmas feeling gets you when you walk amongst little houses with all sorts of handcraft and christmas ornaments. Buy mulled wine, delicious sausage or the local pastry with cinnamon and almonds. Definetly a place I would go back to :)

Beautiful. Although we arrived when the town was pulling down the Christmas decorations and the Christmas market, the town square is so very charming. Beautiful buildings, plus an added bonus of a Dixieland jazz band playing on a very cold but beautifully sunny day.

Beautiful square with lots of different restaurants around it.. We enjoyed a few meals and drinks here recently. We climbed the tower in the Old Town Hall above the clock, amazing views and well worth it.
Great views!. Stunning views and buildings all around. When you go during Christmas holidays there are some fairs.

lovely area,butsomuch more to see.. Yes a great place to see.
Well worth stepping away from this tourist trap though.
So many better places to see in Prague, it isn't a huge city and the metro is so easy to use.
Get out of the tourist trap and enjoy.

Magical, Especially At Night. It is so easy to get to the Old Town Square.It is always busy and is a bit of a tourist trap. Absolutely everything here is more expensive than it would be in regular parts of they city and I wouldn't recommend eating or drinking here other than to enjoy the atmosphere. May places have heated outdoor seating and it is rather nice to sit and drink hot chocolate of hot wine and watch the world go by.In December there is a massive Christmas tree and also markets where you can by local produce. Again, be aware that the prices are at a premium

Magnificent . Went into the square on our first night. Amazing, with the snow on the roofs of all the buildings, lit up well making it very picturesque. Although it was quite busy it wasn't packed that you couldn't move or people jostling and shoving. The old tower and clock area was particularly popular when the clock struck on the hour.Lots or restaurants in the area not to badly priced outside seating with heaters and optional blankets.Certainly worth a visit so much to see including the lanes and streets of the main square.
Worth a walk around. Another part of Prague that's rich in history. Make sure to take a walking tour to appreciate it most.

best part of Prague. it is impossible to not be amazed by the great architecture in the Old Town Square. It feels like there is not enough time to visit everything and I highly recommend getting one of the free tours, because otherwise you will miss out on all the stories and the history behind the buildings of Prague.

Beautiful in the day and night.. When i arrived the square was full of little Christmas markets. When I left, it had musicians and all kinds of activities there. Buildings are beautiful. With churches, the clock tower and restaurants all around. Definitely worth a visit both day time and at night.

The Heart of Prague. With the astronomical clock and the beautiful Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, this is the heart of Prague, the center of the incredible vibrant city.. A few more churches surround it and during Christmas it has a big Christmas Market. It is surrounded by glasshouse type Cafes and Restaurants. The square itself is beautiful and you will find yourself going everyday by it! Great for people watching.
Colorful. there are a lot of square in European countries, but this one particular stand out because of its colourful buildings, no one would forget and not mention its colourful walls.

Gorgeous at Christmas!. I was here on December 27 and the square was still lively and full of Christmas market stalls. The food was excellent (I recommend the klobasa and hot cider), gifts were pleasant and affordable. Scenes of Our Lady before Tyn Church and the Town Hall Tower illuminated for Christmas was breathtaking. A good place to see the Astronmical clock, too

Beautiful during the holidays. A must see when you are visiting prague. The city gets cold in the winter layer up hate gloves heavy coats . If you have children invest in the snow puff suits. Many restaurants an musuems. Also have czechs many places do not take euros

Busy town square. Was wowed by the Christmas tree here in the square along with the cathedral roof tops I think this was the inspiration for sleeping beauty's castleThe astronomical clock is also a wow.Plenty of bars and eateries in the near vicinity it they can be a bit over priced compared to other areas but your paying for the location I guess.A must visit on any visit to the city is what I would say of this square

Perfect place for New Years Eve. The old town is so beautiful especially when the Christmas markets are on. Not sure what it would be like without the Christmas markets as this is what we predominately went for during the day. We went in a few pubs on the square too which were reasonably priced.We spent New Years Eve in the old town square, there was a DJ and the atmosphere was amazing - Would highly recommend.
Very pretty. Visited the Christmas markets which made the square look so pretty. All the same stuff at each stall, but nice all the same. Fab Christmas tree too.
Tick, Tock, an astronomical clock!. Besides the interesting astronomical clock and its chiming, this square is filled with shops and restaurants to fulfill every need of the traveler.
Very Nice. Take your time and enjoy the old Prague. Just avoid the surrounding restaurants. Contemplate every corner of this beautiful city.

Cute little square. The square is very cute with lots to offer in terms of cafes and restaurants. If you don't like crowds then beware because the square itself and the streets around it are rather small and narrow and get crowded very, very quickly.

Another great square. You'd think after your 10th square you'd get bored but there is always something different, whether it's the crowd, the restaurants, the buildings, etc.
Good fun, there's carriage rides available. Lots of restaurants. Markets. Etc.
Enjoy.

Stunning place you have to enjoy. This area is really beautiful as you saw some pictures from another, but the important thing is you have to touch by yourself. When I arrived here where can remove my exhaustion walked around the town. Sometimes I forgot the time I spent at there.
Christmas. Great to visit at Christmas time, ride in a horse and carriage to see more of the old town or an old vintage car.

Enchanting - Especially during the Christmas Season. We loved walking around the Old Town Square. Every building was enchanting. We felt as if we were walking around in a fairy tale. There were restaurants (that offered both indoor and outdoor seating) and several shops surrounding the square. The views from the clock tower were incredible. We especially loved our visit during the Christmas season because of the dazzling lights and the beautiful grand Christmas tree.

Bustling Square, Great for Christmas. The Old Town Square is certainly bustling around Christmas but that's because of the excellent Christmas market here. You'll find a lot of interesting trinkets to look at, as well as mulled/hot cider and wine. The clock here is worth visiting on the hour just to see the oldest running astronomical clock in the world working. Both times I've visited Prague have been in December and both times the Old Town Square has been one of the highlights of the trip.

What an atmosphere!. Thanks Prague and the Old Town Square for the welcome and making our trip. What an amazing place, the atmosphere,Christmas Markets, entertainment and hot wine! A seriously lovely place for all. Will be remembered and will return! Make sure you see the clock! Enjoy
great place. this place is always nice to visit doesn't matter if is winter or summer you will always enjoy This place love everybody from the first moment

The overcrowded centre of the old Prague. At this time the Christmas Market brings a very special and romantic athmosphere to this mostly overcrowded place.The Christmas market is not small but the offers are mostly the same.The restaurants at the corner of the Square are more expensive than the quality of their dishes.But I am sure that every tourist will find his special place at the square which he likes.

Watch your eyes when clocking this sight!. Staromestske namesti - easier to type than say!A truly delightful square when you catch it without the "entertainment". It's a venue for some interesting additional events but some of these are REALLY LOUD.The whole square (and it's pretty big) tends to be very busy all the time - a real multitude of groups following guides holding up furled umbrellas / balloons / tasselled sticks / almost any form of identifier you can imagine. One side-effect of this is that group members tend not to look where they are going but watch the guide. Hence you get walked into rather a lot (thoughts of pickpocket technique although none seen or experienced personally and there are plenty of police patrolling). The main thing to watch out for are the vast numbers of very small tourists with umbrellas as these tend to be at exactly 'poke-your-eye-out' level ....... laughable not really not funny when it happens 30/40 times. So be warned.The actual Square is delightful, the Astronomic Clock well worth seeing (but don't go on-the-hour, it's so crowded that you'll probably not see anything at all). Cafés are very, very popular and, while obviously tourist prices, still quite cheap by English standards. Better value away from the Clock, across the square (or 50 yards down one of the many sidestreets).Well worth visiting. Keep your hand on your wallet and the other hand guarding your eyes and you WILL enjoy it!

Great Christmas markets . Went for New Years Eve... Fantastic atmosphere, great Christmas markets, fireworks and even snowed for midnight!.. Plenty of bars and restaurants within the square and right next to the clock.

Definitely visit. I visited over New Year when the Christmas market was still in place. There are loads of shops, bars and restaurants but more importantly it has the Jan Hus Statue, The Astronomical Clock and beautiful buildings.
You really must vsit this place, even if you are disdainful of the sights.

Very pretty but usually too crowded. It's a must see in Prague, but be prepared to fight large crowds of tourists aimlessly milling around waiting for the clock to strike. Also segways... watch out for drunked fools trying to run you over with Segways

Wonderful around Christmas and New Year . With a stunning Christmas tree at the centre and the Christmas market all around this is a stunning location to visit.
Very crowded around New Year but a great atmosphere.

Very festive at Christmas time. Old Town Square is a must see in Prague - especially at Christmas time. The architecture is beautiful, and the markets were wonderful, with handmade gift items, delicious food and mulled wine everywhere! The restaurants along the square bring out large heaters so you can still outside. It's the perfect place to stop, grab a warm drink, and people watch.

The Charles Bridge is unique. The Charles Bridge is to Prague what the Empire State is to New York (notwithstanding the centuries apart!). I have crossed several times during my three-day stay in Prague and never became a dull event. I was lucky to see snow in Prague and the Charles Bridge in this weather is even a more captivating sightseeing place. As you trod the bridge, take time to contemplate Prague at its full, whether it be its spires ("city of the 100 spires"), St. Vito's Cathedral and the many castles known to dot Prague and the rest of the country. A paprika sausage washed down with a pilsner can't be a better complement to a Charles Bridge crossing.

Fun...... This is a busy square in Prague and not to be missed. The astronomical clock is in this square. Don't miss it. Beware of pick pockets in the large crowds preoccupied with the clock. Lots of eateries. A lot of good shopping in this large area. Architectural beauties to observe. Fun.

The Heart of Prague. My wife, 2 kids and 2 relatives visited Prague in December 2015. We walked to the Old Town Square. It was mobbed with visitors. There was a beautiful Christmas tree in the center. There was a Christmas market with many stalls and vendors selling things. Various food and Czech articles. The Tyn Church, Saint Nicholas Church and the Astronomical Clock were some of the buildings around the square. The atmosphere was fantastic with music. We passed through here several times during our visit to Prague.

We enjoyed the Christmas Market. Great Christmas Market, some great shops surround the square and we had a very nice lunch at one of the cafes on the square as well. We enjoyed strolling around the square and Old Town itself. My wife found a hat that was made locally in one of the shops that she loves. Makes for a nice few hours out of your day.
Great city. You will feel welcome, happy and amazed. It's amazing and it's the heart of Prague. You must walk around and see everything. Great music groups, great food.

Beautiful architecture:). So beautiful, thats why they called old town!! Lots of old buildings with amazing architecture, church, shops... Have to try warm wine, its everywhere keep you warm in -5 degrees winter season:) you can walk anywhere to shops or train station, amazing castle or church ... So many places...

Historic bridge - worth seeing.. It's good to do this as part of your visit to Prague. The view as you enter the bridge is lovely with the tower over the entrance and the view from the bridge of the rest of Prague and the castle is lovely but the bridge itself is does need cleaning and I was disappointed with the number of souvenir stalls at every step which was just tat really - nothing special so it spoilt the experience of an old-world historic city bridge.

Wonderful place at Christmas!. We spend four/five days over Christmas in Prague, and of course we spent time in the Old Town Square! The atmosphere is superb, with the Christmas tree, festive market stalls, entertainment and the smell of barbecued food making it a magic place. Over the time we were in Prague we either walked though, or spent time, in the square, and there was always something happening - carol service, open air mass, various events on stage, `street` entertainers, and what everyone wants to see - the hourly event of the clock!We have been several times, and it is still somewhere special.
This square is amazing!. There is definitely the Jewish influence when visiting! It is truly preserved like the old days and never has lost it's beauty!

Totally wowed by the beauty of the square.. I can honestly say this square is gorgeous. I stood and looked up at the buildings and felt quite overwhelmed. Lift your head.....so much to see. Ornate carvings and beautiful artwork on every building.

The old town square is well worth a stroll around.. Relaxed atmosphere with fascinating architecture. Plenty of decent places to eat and drink nearby. A buzzy place to start exploring Prague from. Would recommed a walking tour - plenty on offer.

Beautiful!. Very beautiful square, also a bit crowded especially in the summer. Lots of street performers. Many tourists gather to see the clock in the tower or go up in the tower to see the city from above. The view from the tower is amazing although up there is a bit crowded since its kind of narrow the viewing point. If you get to the old town square definitely go up in the tower.

Busy and beautiful. Despite the overwhelming amount of asian tourists, people on segways and a lot of police, it was a great place to hang out. There was almost always music, lots of places to eat and so many things to see as well as loads of free-guides.

For distraction. Nice place to visit! In high season it's so crowded and many ppl drinking and smoking everything better go whit out kids! Be aware of ppl to try exchange your money and also in exchange houses because commissions can reach 50% depend of the hour check your ticket before sing it! In the square you can find many places to visit and try to get some guided tours to learn more about city!

Beautiful place to be in the Christmas/New Year season.. Me and my family and friends went here on the first day o the New Year. The festive markets were all full and open despite the amount of people there. The festive tree is massive, very impressive with all the lights and decorations that turn on and off along with the nice music. A big construction is in the middle were tourists can access and take photos of the town square. I think this is only available during the winter. The buildings around the Square are beautiful and there are many little and large cafes and restaurants to the far right corner of the plaza, including a Starbucks. All in all, very impressive.

The heart of Old Town. The square is heart of Old Town. There's more to see there than the astronomical clock. Don't miss the Church of our lady of Tyne and admire the large sculpture and the other buildings

Beautiful square. Beautiful square. Set amongst sensational architecture and incredible buildings. It's busy during the day. Best in the morning before the crowds get in. It can be an expensive tourist trap, check trip advisor before committing to tours and shows sold around the square. You might save yourself some cash if you venture away from the square for lunch or dinner.

a must place. this one of the best and most important places to be'many restaurants and special shops in the area like boutique chocolate shops ice cream shop and above all the beautiful church and the astronomical shops/
i visited before Christmas so it was full of people ,holydays stands ,and great ambience
Cool district . Old town square has a lively feel. There is something for everyone. There are shops, restaurants, food stands and vendors.its easy to move around in the city

A beautiful beautiful place.. If you're in Prague, you pretty much can't miss the old town (which is a good thing!). It's architecturally stunning, shops everywhere, restaurants everywhere and just beautiful all round.
There's nothing more to say, you just absolutely must visit this place, it's too beautiful not to !

Extremely crowded. One of my friends is a photographer and he decided we should go to the Charles bridge and the square super early in the morning (I'm talking before sunrise) and even though we were all complaining, the result was all worth it. You get a real historical feel when there is practically no one around since during the day and evening people almost fanatically crowd these two places and you can't even enjoy anything.
Nice place . Nice square to stop because it offers you a variety of nice place to eat and drink local food and beer. If you a have the chance, you should try one of their local dessert
Perfect in Christmas time !!! . Amazing plan for new years eve celebration people evrywhere fun drinks food and evrything extremly clean great music and the watch tower insane is a must
Travel dairies - Prague. Amazing place of such an historical importance . Surrounded by so many good restaurants. Must suggested place to see for a vacation .

Stunning architecture but packed with tourists 24/7!. Stunning square, and perhaps the most emblematic spot in Prague. But, beware of pickpockets and be prepared to share your magical experience in the historic centre with hordes of other tourists day and night.

This square is the heart of Prague. Christmas market with small booths, a christmas tree, farm animals, performers, horse carriages and friendly people made our christmas visit in Prague unforgettable.
Charming Old Town Square. The Christmas markets really bring out the charm of Old Town Square. There are several shops along the way and many booths to sample local dishes.

Beautiful square. Great square with a nice and living atmposhere. One of the must see's obviously. You can't get around it and that's a good thing.
One thing that really annoys me though were the segways, but that's a commong thing in the cities nowadays, however it seemed to be far worse here.

Xmas treat. Great little Christmas market with various items available and plenty of food to eat to suit all tastes. Huge Christmas tree takes the centre stage at this time of year. Plenty of people all having fun and a good time restaurants and bars around the square. All in all a Great Atmosphere day and night
Beautiful. The square is beautiful. Very similar to the main square in Kraków. Beautiful buildings and great places to eat and drink. Don't forget to view the astronomical clock.
so much eye candy. So beautiful. Such gorgeous building with amazing architectural detail. Lots of tourists and perfect for for a European visit.
The best square. This square is good durin the day however it really comes to life at night. Great food stalls with lots of other attractions close by.
Amazing. Definitely worth a visit. There are several booths set up selling trinkets and drinks and several restaurants close by. You can also see the astronomical clock. Worth a visit!

Christmas market. I stayed between christmas and new years eve, and there was a christmas market on the square. This made the square very crowded, but nice. I have a hard time imagining what it would look like without the market.
Was there during the Holiday. Its great seeing people enjoying themselves. Was there during the Holiday. Its great seeing people enjoying themselves. It the center of everything

Plenty to see. Plenty to see and do. The Christmas market was still there even though it's the end of December. Most stalls are something to eat or drink so you definitely won't starve. Enjoyed looking about and soaking up the atmosphere by having a nice long coffee at one of the Square cafés.

Magical at Christmas. Christmas is a lovely time to visit Prague, the old town square is filled with a market selling all types of Christmas decorations, and food and drinks, as you approach the square you get all the smells of Christmas! Lovely viewed from above, make sure you take the lift up the tower for wonderful views of the square and the city below.

So beautiful!. I don't know how it looks during no-Christmas time, but when we visited it was full of lights (there was a huge Christmas tree), and there were stands selling food, drinks and souvenirs. The astronomical clock is breathtaking.
Lovely spot. Went here most days while in Prague. Filled with street performers, bars and restaurants. The perfect spot to grab dinner.

Straight out of a story book . Absolutely breathtaking. Old architecture, the Disney castle was definitely modeled after this beautiful city.Easily accessible from all parts of Prague via tram or train (it's best to just buy a 24 hour pass) Lots of markets in the old town square, must try is their traditional pastry the Tradelnik. Delicious, some places offer it with different fillings. Plenty souvenir shops and money exchanges, be aware of the commission charged.Horse and carriages, old city cars and segways are other forms of transport to get through the city

Atmospheric touristic heart of Prague. Almost everywhere we went in Prague started with a walk through the square, which was filled with a crowded Christmas Market at the time of our visit. It's not just the old buildings, there refine churches and the tower with great views over the square. One corner leads to the prestige shopping street and the Jewish Quarter, another towards Wenceslas Square and another towards the Charles Bridge and the Castle along what is really the mail tourist drag
Best time in Prague. I loved this stop on our tour. There was a lot to do and see and buy. My goodness! When you visit Prague, I'm sure you'll be here a few times.
Awesome. Really beautiful place to see by night or day, stunning buildings full of colors. Here is a useless sentence to get the word count

Lively Christmas Market. This square was filled with a lively Christmas Market and a huge Christmas tree when we were there, which gave it a very festive appearance. It was surrounded by interesting buildings and had the commanding Huss statue in it.

Old Town Square. We were in December before Christmas time, it was full of stalls,so we couldnt see square normally as it is. The Christmas tree was beautiful. The atmosphere in the evening very crowded and prices are not cheap in that place. The square is surrounded by old buildings and overall i had good experience.
fab!. Great to hang out at all the Xmas stalls , drink hot wine and eat the doughnut things. Loved it there very pretty and atmospheric.

The Christmas Market was a treat.. With the Christmas Market, fantastic tree and stunning architecture it was a treat. The street food and mulled wine kept the winter chill out but unfortunately meant that I couldn’t treat myself to a restaurant meal.

Fun atmosphere!. We walked through here several times in 1 day and once a large marching band was playing and people were dancing. It was VERY crowded, but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The food vendors around the edges were very yummy. Overall, one of my favorite town squares in Europe.

Bustling and atmospheric, especially in December with the Christmas markets and mulled wine on offer!. We loved the Old Town Square! We wandered there at least once on each of the 4 days we stayed in Prague. Bustling and atmospheric, with the famous Astronomical Clock and the Old Town Hall Tower to visit, it was one of our favourite bits of Prague. Especially in December when the Christmas Markets lit the place up and offered warm food and drinks on cold evenings.

Christmas market in the Square. It must be one of the biggest Christmas markets that I have visited so far. Excellent food (mostly meat products) for sale, for good prices, music is played from two stages, and a great Christmas feels to the all place attract local and visitors from all over the world.

Winter break . Back in old town square for Christmas this time during the winter and I love the winter market. It is fill with a lot of local food and nice Christmas decorations. You can feel the different atmosphere for every season.

A busy square, but lots to do. The main attraction in this square is the thirteenth century clock tower. Views from the top are spectacular. Many eating places and easy access to the entire Old Town including Charles Bridge and other squares. Very crowded on holidays/weekends.

Xmas atmosphere at square. A few people and a lot of street food. Nice and picturesque buildings with strong signal of cultural strengths and hard working people. The center of Prague with connections to all attractions.
Wonderful lively historic Square. We felt we had really found the stunning Prague we had heard so much about once we entered the square. Gorgeous Christmas market in the centre.
So Much to See!. We were in Prague in December so not only is Old Town Square filled with beautiful architecture it's also full of Christmas Markets. Beautiful tree too!!

Beautiful square with well kept buildings but restaurants are overpriced. We were there today and the Christmas atmosphere was absolutely lovely. Large Christmas market and Christmas tree and beautifully kept buildings. Restaurants are hugely overpriced though, don't fall for this tourist trap but wonder off the square a bit for better quality at fair prices.

Christmas market bustle . Great Christmas market in a stunning setting. Beautifully lit up tree. The bell ringing piano playing machine is great to watch and the music really helps the atmosphere. A great evening out.

Great Christmas markets. We usually visit Bruges in December for the Christmas charm etc. But Prague has it all and some! This was our first visit to Czech Republic and we loved it, our hotel "U Prince" was right in the heart of the old square (see review) and didn't disappoint. Bigger, better ans at least half the price of Bruges...See you next December..!

Amazing. Prague is the most beautiful city in Europe o have visited. The architecture of the buildings in the square is awesome. The Tyn church and the clock tower towering over the square make it even more majestic than it already is. If you come to Prague, you have to go the square.

xmas markets. . We came here for my 59 th birthday to see all the Xmas markets. We loved it here.lovely craft stalls an food ones.so much to choose from. The atmosphere is so magical..An made us feel Christmassy. .Even had snow flakes one day..Took some lovely pics..

Most beautiful square in all of Europe. I'm so enamoured by how beautiful this square looks in the night with all the lights on and the unbelievable Christmas tree. I wonder if there's a more beautiful square in all of Europe!

Sublime and perfect...like a fairytale!. A must see while in Prague.A gorgeous restoration of an area so beautiful and historic as this.Walk around the homes and mansions of the well to do 3 or 4 hundred years ago as well asmagnificent squares and public offices way back then.A place to dream about days gone by...

the place to be. this is where all the action happens. the town hall and the famous clock are located there. happened to visit during xmas and the area was full of small food kiosks decorations all around, bands playing music,.... a very nice and happy place

Trip Highlight!. Not only the square but the warren of medieval streets surrounding are fun, interesting, and a great place to spend hours. Wander, explore, eat ... there's something for everybody.It's also the location for one of Europe's best Christmas Markets. If you are dangerously overcrowding adverse, try to avoid weekend nights!
Fabulous . When in Prauge, visit old town. The atmosphere and life is such a great (and affordable) experience. We surely loved it!
Great Town Square. Buzzing with tourist and places to eat and drink. Full of historic places to visit and beautiful churches.

Страхотно място.Awesome place.. Much can be written..
must-see, touch, taste, smell, must be experienced. brings its charm during the day & night

Old City Square. The Old City Square is a must visit in Prague. It's always packed with people, including several entertainers in the street. Also, there are several tours you can start from here (such as hop-on-hop-off buses, segway tours, and walking tours). From there you can reach many other areas of the city with a short walk. It's a great meeting point, if you're able to find each other among the crowd.

My New Favorite City. This was my first visit and my expectations were far exceeded. The architecture, history, buildings, galleries, concerts...to me this grand city beats anything we have in the USA only because we don't have the history of this city. The people were gracious, the markets unique, and the food fantastic but so inexpensive. It's on my return list.
Plenty of shopping and restaurants. Huge Chistmas market in December and lots of good restaurants around here. Main shopping streets are also located around the square.

Attractive Buildings with a good Christmas Market. The Square itself has some tremendous architectural buildings together with the Astronomical Clock. The Old Town Square is surrounded but some very attractive and historic buildings and the centrepiece statue is also very good. Within the Square is contained the Christmas Market and the Squares exceptional Christmas tree which makes the overall experience delightful. ing buildings are also extremely attractive and well presented

Christmas Markets 2 night stay. I loved this square - it was beautiful all lit up with the Christmas tree and lights. The market stalls were lovely with a variety of trinkets and food/drink. I can highly recommend the gingerbread!We are in a restaurant overlooking the square, and saw the Christmas tree display where there is a light show on the tree to music.Here you will find the famous astrological clock too, which is well worth finding and watching the display.

Wonderful Christmassy Atmosphere. It's first time to visit the old town square during Christmas season. Wonderful atmosphere with cheerful events and activities around the square.One should be mindful against pickpockets!

It have got everything. Very crowded and happening. It is very crowded with tourist. LOVE the christmas market. Been to at least 10 in the last few weeks but this is the best with a lot of interesting local food. There is a lot of restaurant, souvenir shops around!

Visit at Christmas time. Another must see/do. We visited during the Christmas markets time. Try and be there for the tree lights being turned on at 5. Eat and drink just off the square as it's cheaper. Find the free walking tour just off on one of the side streets at 11 am every day, yellow umbrellas, it covers all the history you need about the square.

I felt like in a Harry Potter movie -Amazing !. I felt like in a Harry Potter movie -Amazing atmosphere especially during Christmas time.
Beautiful buildings surrounding the square, and good restaurants and coffee shops just as I was wishing for !

Way too busy and crowded..... The old town is lovely and picturesque but unless you like crowds I doubt this is the place for you....it is way overcrowded , to the pint of being shoulder to shoulder and I takes away the ambience. We found other places in praise in a and around the old town that were not that crowded , enabling us to enjoy what the city has to offer..
Lovely area, and is a must to visit !. We just couldn't fault the whole city. The architecture is beautiful and interesting. We really enjoyed what Prague had to offer.

Brilliant just before christmas. We stayed in Prague the weekend before Christmas so it was very busy but the atmosphere was Christmassy the big Christmas tree was up with dancing light shows, the Christmas market was there selling all sorts of handmade items and lots of different food. There were carol singers, horse and cart taking people around the city and plenty of streets off the main square to investigate. We spent the majority of our trip in and around this area. Great for all ages.

Definitely worth a visit. My hotel was near this square and as a result I passed it many times. There is always something to do, day and night, and always a nice experience. Make sure to take your time to experience and soak in the nice atmosphere.Around the square and in the streets you can find many nice restaurants, bars and shops. During Easter and Christmas time there are nice markets here as well.The corner with the clocks is regularly overcrowded, but don't let that scare you off.
Nice Place to Soak Christmas Atmosphere. We visited during Golden weekend in December. It was covered with Christmas market. We enjoyed the Christmas atmosphere and did some shopping.
June 2015. We were here as an extension of a Viking Cruise through Eastern Europe. This is a great place for tourists to visit while in Prague.

Christmas Markets in Old Town Square. Probably not the best time to see the true value of the old town square, a couple of days before Christmas and it's jam packed with people but worth every minute. The atmosphere is great, the Christmas tree is magic and the food is plentiful, but not cheap. Try a visit around 9:30am to get a feel for the place then come back during the evening and fight your way all the way to the tree. A must try is the Prague Ham, but it's served and costed by weight and the average weight is between 500 - 600gm at 80ck per 100g, so it's not cheap, but 1/2 kg of ham is enough for two or three people. Felt very safe there, so it's a must do if your there for the Christmas rush.
Like a gigantic living room!!!. Even in the rain, the place was packed. And like the Charles Bridge, we always ended up at the square, day or night!!!

A Must See area of Prague. This square is completely different in summer as it is in winter and of course especially at Christmas.Market stalls with glass ware and decorations, food and of course drink (hot wine!) with a very large and pretty Christmas tree. A sage is one corner where you can catch anything from a band to children's choir.All very nice.Tyn cathedral dominates and looks so impressed kit up at night and of course everyone gathers on the hour to see the astronomical clock "chime"

Unique, fascinating, beautiful. The Astronomical Clocktower and the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn are the focal points of this Gothic Square, also dominated by a very large monument to Jan Hus, an influential religious thinker long before the times of Martin Luther. The monument was apparently paid for solely by public donations. The astronomical clock is a marvel of engineering genius for 1410. The Square is a very popular place and in December is home to some of the Christmas Markets where roasting chestnuts, Prague Ham, sausages of all kinds, crepes, mulled wines, beers, trdlenik, potato spirals and ginger breads are so plentiful. Gothic splendour leading to the "Paris Street " where the major fashion houses of the world are aligned in one street makes this a magic place to visit and the history is palpable.

lively square right in the thick of it. unmissable experience loads going on with street entertainment and plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from come day or night you'll have some fun in the square
wonderful history. fantastic place , . too much people , but it was so incredible with all tipycal Czech food ready to eat. I think it is one of the best square in the world

Breathtakingly beautiful. Totally in love with this beautiful city and the amazing town square. Best time of year is Christmas! The place is alive with Christmas markets, entertainers, tourists, music and the best Christmas tree you'll ever see.Want to enjoy it in a more peaceful way? Get out there in the morning just after 8am when sleepy Praha is just waking up. Best time of day! Move freely around and soak up the beautiful architecture of the buildings surrounding the square :)

Wonderful and interesting place. Start with the astronomical clock from 1410 on the Old Town Hall - it still shows the correct time and date, the sun and moon - a wonder, indeed. Continue with the Church of Our Lady before Týn, it's a little tricky to find the entrance...Then there is the monument for religious reformer Jan Hus who was burned at the stake in 1415. Then you'll see performers of all kind to entertain you for a $ or two. Did I mention a few nice restaurants to restore your strength and serving excellent local beers.

Must see during Christmas season. If you get a chance to be in Prague during Christmas season, this is one of the places I can definitely recommend visiting. Great atmosphere, traditional Christmas fair, music and dancing performances and of course huge Christmas tree.Tourist information agency is at your service, even tax refund point is there for you.
Center to everything. The center of Prague. But the best time to visit is during Christmas, due to the big market that goes in there and the food stall as and hot wine....

Pre-Christmas terror. I know, I know, many people love Christmas markets - of which Prague has several - and if you do, too, you'll be very happy there.Me personally, I couldn't get any closer than about 30 meters, when I was blocked by an insurmountable wall of people. Not my kind pf place, but then I also didn't visit the Sex Machine Museum, although there was a long queue, so maybe I have a peculiar taste.

Where all people converge . The town square is where to see people from all over the world in one huge herd. One must enjoy the Christmas market at least one full night. Such a joy to just hang around.

One of the most historically enriched city center in Europe. Stunning, breathtaking and humbling.Just to add, as far as I know, there was no bombing in Prague during WW2.Hence, almost everything is saved from destruction and still dazzles with mysterious stories.Highly recommended.

Great Christmas markets. The old town square is beautiful, surrounded by old buildings and this time of year great Christmas markets. Many people viewing markets and watching the astronomical clock chime the hour.at times too crowded to move. Overall good experience

Xmas tree. One of the finest Xmas trees I've ever seen, a beautiful square especially at Xmas with the bustling Xmas market lovely atmosphere with lots to see and do loads of places to eat and drink within the area, and the architecture is amazing in every direction.

A legszebb tér Prágában / The most beatitul square in Prague. A legszebb tér Prágában. Gyönyörű épületek a mindig nyüzsgő téren. Nem szabad kihagyni. Nagyon szép az adventi időszakban a piac. / The most beatiful square in Prague. Nice buildings on this always full square. A must go. It is especially nice during the advent period before Christmas

One of the most beautiful old squares in Europe. I've been there twice: in the summer and during the christmas time. It's definitely one of the most beautiful old squares in Europe. During the christmas it reigns a magic atmosphere over there.
Splendid buildings with fresco's and baroque stuccos, fairy-tale-like churches, old town hall, horse drawn carriages, cozy cafes create unique unforgettable experience at any time of the year.
Overwhelming!!. This totally exceeded my expectations! Beautifully preserved pastel-coloured buildings with nice traditional shops. One of the best places I have ever been to!

Beautiful walk . Beautiful walk through historic buildings combined in some cases with new.
Very nice environment normally very global with visitors from a lot o nationalities.
Worth the visit.
Beautiful. Went for Christmas markets beautiful place reasonable prices for food etc most of the paving is cobbles and watch out for the trams!

Lovely City. Very easy to get around and lots to see - cost relative to UK prices. Did one of the river cruises late afternoon and certainly enjoyed the views even in the winter! Lots of Christmas markets - very enjoyable trip.

It is magical during Christmas. The square is buzzing with people and wonderful food (trdelnik's are delicious)! There is a giant christmas tree in the middle which lights up the whole square. Walk around the square and soak in the historic wonders of the place such as the astronomical clock and the gothic architecture.
Felt typically local . Service was great, had a waitress who gave good advice. Thoroughly enjoyed the food, atmosphere and service. Prices were excellent as was the food.

Christmas Exhibit. During this time of the year, Old Town Square is covered with commercialization of Christmas articles and artifacts, is beautifully decorated and a spectacle that should not be missed.

Old world beauty! . My husband and I went to Prague for a week and loved every moment of it. The sites are gorgeous, and the people are nice. We really enjoyed just walking around the old town square, taking in the sites and people watching. Be fore warned, the bigger attraction sites not only attract tourists but also people who pick pockets as well. We didn't have any issues, but were warned by guides to be aware. Please don't let this keep you from visiting and enjoying beautiful Prague. Just be aware.

Best square in Europe . This is the most beautiful square I've seen and they have totally filled it with Christmas wonderfulness!The sounds, smells and tastes are like nothing else. This is a destination I will definitely be going back to.
A beautiful scenery. A beautiful scenery. Must be seen. Don't enjoy too much restaurants on the square. Find others place to eat nearby. They are numerous and less expensive

Magical. The Old Town square (Staroměstské náměstí) has to be the finest public square in the world. Bustling, yet expansive, and flanked on all sides by quaint pavement cafes. Cobbles. Horse drawn carriages. The Jan Hus memorial. And the architecture. Oh yes, that stunning architecture... Standing proud, Tyn church on the east side absolutely dominates the square. Every time you see it (especially during the evening when it is illuminated) you fall in love with it. You can almost feel yourself letting out a wistful sigh, as you'll know you'll never see another building more beautiful. With the 600 year old astronomical clock at the other end of the square (the oldest still working example in the world), you simply must make the time in your life to see this square. Oh, and it's even more magical around Christmas time when the markets come to town...
Steeped in history, great architecture and charm!. If you want to experience Prague, its history and culture at its best, the old town square is a MUST!

A must-see. A lovely square at the heart of the old-town, along with the castle this should be at the top of your list of sights to see. It often has a holiday market on it, at Christmas, Easter and any other excuse they can find, and can be very busy. However, it's worth a wander round, and also features the Old Town Hall (Stara Radnice, with a viewing tower and the famous medieval astronomical clock) so you can kill several birds with one stone. It's also very pretty and quieter at night so you might like to go through on your way to dinner. Unless you're wealthy, go a block or two away to get a drink though. The prices on the square are vastly inflated. Also, if you're waiting for or watching the Astronomical Clock do its thing - be on the watch-out for pickpockets.

Lovely enchanting place. A must see place to visit when in Prague, the old style baroque buildings surrounding the square give it a romantic feel, horse drawn carriages, cafe bar/restaurants line the edges. Slightly more expensive than off the beaten track bars lovely to sit and watch the world go by. Astronomical clock is nice to see too. Been twice for Xmas markets which is a must see , local children on stage/ jazz band playing, huge fabulously decorated Xmas tree in the middle. Overall a lovely place to go.
