Quaint and busy but worthwhile.. Pleny of small access roads, aleys leading to this part of the Old town. Very much like a fairytale setting. Busy almost any time, but should not be missed. December time there are Christmas stalls adding to the charm.
Beautiful place!!. It's obviously a must see in the city. Take a walk around or sit and rest. The clock and services are really near.

Do not miss it!!. Went there every day of my stay in Prague! Went in December, so the Square was bustling with activity, filled with the Christmas Market and typical food vendors, there was a giant Christmas tree, there was a stage with performances, people everywhere. One of the most amazing experiences I have ever had, so beautiful and so much fun. Go at least once at night, to see the Christmas trees all light up and the Christmas lights, to drink a hot apple cider and see people celebrating and just having a good time. Go there, and if you can, go there in the Christmas season. You will not regret it!

Christmas Market magic. We visited during December when the Christmas market was in full swing. My only caution is that the square will get very very busy at weekends to the point where it can be a bit unpleasant due to sheer numbers. During the week it is much more palatable! However, the Christmas market is great, the square is beautiful and even more so with an enormous and brilliantly lit Christmas tree in it. There's plenty of delicious street food available from the numerous vendors and lots of Christmas gifts at the various stalls.

Busy and bustling. I'm inclined to write this with the tune of the Teddy Bears' Picnic in my head... Busy and bustling, and, in December, full of Christmas Market stalls selling trinkets (mostly not great), glass baubles, mulled wine, hot chocolate, pancakes, sausages, chips. The atmosphere is delightful, crowds notwithstanding, and there are plenty of restaurants around the edge (which are very willing to part you from your money) and tacky souvenir shops. The architecture is striking all around the square, so take the time to admire and appreciate it. Wander down the side streets that run off the square and absorb the sense of history. And get a good guide book or app so you can really appreciate what you see. Look beyond what is obvious, and it will enrich your experience.

Summer dream-zone. Out of all the places across Europe that I have been to...the Prague Old Town Square has been the most delightful experience. Think cobbled streets, cathedrals and towers all around, street performers in abundance and quaint eating and drinking joints flanking the square. The perfect place to watch the sun go down.

Beautiful place to visit. We went when the Christmas Market was there and it was beautiful to see, as we were staying close by we visited quiet a few times. It did get really busy approaching the hour when the astronomical clock was about to strike but that was to be expected so we stayed over the other side of the square and it was fine.
Wonderful in all it's Christmas delight. A must do any time of the year, but especially at Christmas. A beautiful square with speculate views and a relaxed atmosphere!

Xmas market fun!. The Old Town Square is a fantastic location for Prague's Xmas market. It is beautifully lit and populated by market stalls. Food is the primary product on offer which most of the locals clearly enjoy. Hot wine and traditional fare is very good and great to stand back and get festive.

Wonderfully preserved but surrounded by overpriced establishments. Excellently preserved and picturesque venue with lots to see but the restaurants that face onto the square are expensive... but then you pay for the view I guess! My tip: explore the square and then explore the side streets to eat and drink.

Beautiful old-Europe square. The Old Town Square is THE place to be in Praque. It is surrounded by beautiful old customs houses, the clock tower, and churches. There are shops and restaurants everywhere- all affordable- and climbing the clock tower gives you views of the entire city.

Great fun, good to see but don't buy anything. Its a great place and buzzes after dark. There is an endless variety of excellent very cheap street food. In December the square is packed with Christmas Market stalls and is magic. However apart from the food, you will pay a lot more here for exactly the same stuff being sold from similar stalls all over the city. If you have time and energy enough, go to the top of the clock tower. The view across the city is breathtaking.
visit. It was a good athmosphere, the clock is a must see. There are also lots of food and other old buildings that you can view from this square.
Gorgeous. A wonderful piece of history so well preserved. It's a great place to take so many incredible photos.

The heart of historical Prague. You cannot miss an Old Town Square when visiting Prague. It's a busy place all the year along and especially, when Easter or Christmas market is there. Each top of hour you can see crowds looking at the astronomical clock at Old Town city hall.

River cruise extension. we took a Viking river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest with an extension to Prague. Spent three days touring around Prague on the extension and wished we had had more time. Easy to get around and lots to see and do. Highly recommend going there if you get the chance. People were friendly and food was great, not to mention the beer.
Christmas fairytale. We were here at christmas. It looks like you suddenly came to a fairytale. Very beautiful and full of christmas spirit.
Amazing place!. Beautiful place to visit, often busy, but I feel that adds to it. Amazing food and amazing shops. Family loved it

Alive all the time. The old town square is alive at all hours day and night. Street performances were my favorite, all of them were so talented in what they do. Also the place is so great to take pictures. We enjoyed it lot.
A journey to a romantic fairytale. Just see the photos of the place. As soon as you walk in the square a journey to a ferry tale begins. Ideal for couples in love!!
Worth the visit. This is a wonderful area, always busy with tourists, but rightly so. Visiting in December with all the atmosphere of the Christmas markets was an added bonus.

Christmas markets not to be missed. We visited the old town square every day during our weekend to Prague and walked around the wonderful Christmas markets. There are plenty of stalls selling arts and crafts, jewellery and plenty of souvenirs. There's something for everyone and you'll be spoilt for choice what presents to bring back. The historical buildings surrounding the square are absolutely magnificent. There are lots of food stalls selling local Czech produce, beer and wine, so it's worth sampling them all if you can. The food is reasonably priced and tastes so much better when you're enjoying it outside and rubbing shoulders with all the other tourists. The old town square has to be visited to be appreciated especially at this time of year. At night it's a magical place to be and not to be missed.

Not to be Missed!. This is by far my favorite place in Prague! It's absolutely lovely, with stately pastel buildings, the Town Hall, and two beautiful churches. There is always some sort of performance going on here and food is available at sidewalk cafes or food stands, so grab a picnic, take a seat, and enjoy! One of the best views of the square is from the Town Hall tower (which has an elevator if you don't want to climb several hundred steps). Don't miss the Town Hall clock either when it comes alive on the hour.

Old Town Square the place to visit in Prague. Old town square was great, lovely atmosphere with the Christmas Market Stalls. The historical building are good and interesting and the bars and cafes have good food and drink.

Can't beat it!. Most beautiful architectural and historic spot you will find anywhere in the world! Full of charm, atmosphere, quirkiness and history! Amazing Christmas markets full of excellent food and mulled wine and plenty of souvenirs you will always cherish!
Xmas market.. What an amazing xmas market! Huge tree, lovely food of all kinds and so much to see. Even better at night all lit up.
Christmas market. Great square, loved the atmosphere,all the many different stalls selling many home grown products, there was also some live music being played most of the day
Stunning. A 'must see' place on any visit to Prague. Stunningly beautiful. The Christmas market stalls offer a wide variety of food, drink and knick-knacks. Amazing.
Highlights of Prague:enjoy strolling around. Loved walking around, watching the crowd, segway, eating in the cafes and shopping around for stoles, scarves, knitwear....love the place!
Centre of our trip in Prague. Beautiful town square - loads of things to do and the Christmas markets were stunning. Good food available at every turn.

In summer you miss the tree!. Stayed in Prague for first time, got an apartment about 10 minutes from the square.Found a nice bakery that did the Czech open sandwiches - only 50m or so from the square. 19Kc or approx 50p!The square looks great at night with the tree lit up and all the stalls set up around the square.Christmas is celebrated in January, the tree is for the new year.Don't get run down by people on wheels...Remember to see the Astronomical clock strike the hour,

Great Christmas market. We have been to a few Christmas markets but none came very close to this market. Fantastic tree, good food stalls, great hot wine, various ‘Christmas bits and bobs’ stalls and to crown it all off, music. Nice crowd of people and, forget what people say, safe. Wandered around every night of our short stay and we never got bored. There was too much to take in.

Christmas market. Old fashioned Christmas market is a must for people who would like to have a real feel for Christmas - lot of Czech hand crafted items - traditionally food like Prague ham roasted on open fire, roasted chestnuts, Czech pancakes and of course glue wine to heat up with. Don't forget the fantastic Christmas tree for the right feel. And of course close to the astronomical clock!

Old town square, Prague at Xmas is not to be missed. What a beautiful place. We visited the city December 15 and were thoroughly impressed with the Xmas decorations, christmas tree and Xmas atmosphere. The tree took our breath away with how beautiful it looked in the evening with so many pretty decorations twinkling and shining. If Xmas in Prague old town square doesn't make y feel full of Xmas cheer then nothing will.

Not just see but feel the atmosphere. Yes, not just see but feel the atmosphere of the Old Town Square in Prague. I believe you were in many different countries, see many great sightseeings but this great atmosphere of Christmas you will feel just in Prague. You will really feel real Christmas not just next holiday.So why are you waiting? Come and meet this great atmosphere here in Prague and welcome new year.

Impressive Christmas Tree. This time we went to Prague to experience the Advent atmosphere and were not disappointed. Especially the area in the Old Town Square was transformed into a Christmas Wonderland with the Tree and it's dancing lights forming an exquisite Center.

Christmas Market. The square is really pretty made even more so at thsi time of year by teh xmas market - all the usual stuff, decorations etc lots of stalls selling mulled wine, snacks, hog roasts etc - really nice if you come to Prague you will undoubtedly end up here at some time

Truly Worth A Visit. Visited this Old Town Square in June 2013 and was amazed with the large number of people who gathered here. The historical structures give you a very nostalgic feeling. The are a large number of stalls that sells both food and local products around the square. Is well worth a visit

Best place in Prague. In the summer when i was there, this was the place in Prague that you were always drawn to. Its lively but also very relaxed. A great place to just hang out, to eat, to shop, or just people watch. My friends and I had an unseemly amount of roasted ham here of a street cart and it was divine. It was out first night in the city and we didn't really know what we were doing, so were ordered way more than we would have, but it was the best mistake we ever made. This ham was so good, it was one of the best and most enjoyable meals I had in Prague.

Walking through history!. We absolutely loved walking around that area every night as the atmosphere there was unique and amazing. The architecture is so beautiful and we couldnt get enough of it. We absolutely loved walking there as it felt like walking though history!

Christmas Fayre. We were lucky and visited early December allowing us to enjoy the large Christmas Fayre which was being held in the Old Town Square. Dozens of stalls making the Square a very colourful place with a huge Christmas tree.
Very nice square. Very nice square with the historical buildings around and monumental sculpture in a middle. Heart of the city
Four days is not long enough. Lovely, clean, friendly, hotel will not hesitate to recommend and stay here again. citieslose to city centre and all ammenities.

Day or Night always an interesting walk.. We walked the area early in the morning before the crowds, late afternoon and late evening. There is always something happening and each time you turn a corner you see something you have missed on your walk before. Each time of day lets you experience something new.
beautiful but crowded. Beautiful but very crowded. Christmas Market very nice. Square beautiful very nice cocktail bar around the edge and nice restaurantsl. Must see as you are in Prague

Fairytale. Wonderful, a dream place.
With christmas markets, christmas carols, dancing lights on trees... magical...
And food, food... hot chocolate, hot wine...
In a logical price...

OK Christmas market in a lovely area. Having visited a few places for Christmas markets, I would not say this as good as the German markets. It is quite large and has a few interesting stalls. The square itself is beautiful with many interesting buildings around. Explore the side streets off the square for some lovely bars / cafes/ restaurants.

One of the best Christmas Markets!. The Old Town Square is originally beautiful as it is, but it is especially so when it comes to Christmas, with the big Xmas tree and the very happening Christmas Market there. Lovely city during festive season！

An absolute must. Very picturesque an absolute must with beautiful buildings all round, shops, restaurants, pubs etc. We enjoyed the start of the Christmas market as this is the best place to see it although there are lots of other places too that you can stop off and browse.
Fantastic Christmas Tree. The square was lovely and the tree just amazing. The tree had the WOW factor and had a display to music. The biggest of the Christmas markets.

The tourist hub. The old town square is the justifiably famous tourist hub of Prague. It is great day and night, visit both times because it has a different feel day and night. Some of the restaurants on the square can be a bit of a rip off price wise so look around for something reasonable.

Charming experience, street music, food, culture. Prague old town square is ofcourse a must visit when you visit Prague. Do check out the astronomical clock which is right around the corner. Also, many food joints around. Special tip for vegeterians, look for a speciality vegeterian restaurant inside the Melantrichova lane, walk past the sex machine museum (families... dont hesitate, its a decent area) and you will find a place called Country Life or something similar. It sells bio, veg food varities with enough seating place. Perfect spot for Vegans, Vegeterians (taste is a mix of Indian, Mediterranian cuisine) and average price. Any time will be good to visit the town square. Slightly tough to move on wheel chair or kinderwagen, but manageable with help.

Getting too old for this walking business. Beautiful area to visit more so at night with the tree lights on and all the vendors selling food and drink. It was packed but very entertaining especially with the choir singing carols.

Ham stall criminals on Old Town Square . DO NOT buy anything from these lowlife street vendors operating the roast ham stalls. Filthy, grubby rip-off merchants the lot of them. 1 portion of ham, 1 beer, 1 water and 2 plates of disgusting potato, bacon and cabbage should have cost 400kr tops but the grub wants me to cough up 1400!!!! So I challenge this idiot in no uncertain terms only to have his thuggish offsider (the cook) tell me to be quiet and threaten me. I managed to cause enough of a stir for the price to instantly drop to 1150, which is still outrageous. I feel angry with myself for not reading previous reviews and avoiding this trap in the first place. I am seriously tempted to go back and stand there for an hour and direct potential victims away from the place. Really disappointing and upsetting. Has spoilt my trip to a degree. Disgraceful.

Breathtakingly beautiful anytime but especially at Christmas. Once again Prague, for me, proves itself as one of the most lovely cities in the world but at Christmastime, the Old Town Square is a true fairyland of delightful smells and sights for the traveler. In the square one of the top Christmas markets blooms. I have been to many other markets and it is one of my favorites. The gigantic, amazingly lit tree and the craft booths set against the backdrop of Our Lady Before Tyn church and the surreal gingerbread of the other surrounding buildings are only surpassed by the smells and tastes of the food. I recommend the fried cheese on rye bread topped with mixed berry jam, potato dumplings sauteed with kraut and ham, meat and vegetable skewers, or the Prague ham itself. Wood smoke and spices permeate the air because much of the food is cooked over wood. It is very busy on December 5, Saint Nicholas Day, but if you brave the merry throng, you will be rewarded by the sight of the Saint and his companion devil and angel greeting children. The weather can be nippy but we were rewarded with beautiful clear days this time. Don't hesitate to go during the Advent period, you won't be sorry.

This is the place to meet up....................... Very centrally situated and thronging with people, when we were there they were just getting ready to open the Christmas market and putting the finishing touches to the tree. The place is buzzing and so easy to get to from almost anywhere in the city. The astrological clock was a big draw, especially on the hour for all the moving bits. Vey good. A really effective heart of the city.

It's a must see!. The Old Town Square in Prague with the Christmas tree at the center is absolutely gorgeous and romantic. We love the Christmas market as we got to try different Czech food and hot wine, but it can get pretty crowded. Therefore, we headed back to the square after the market closes at 10pm. We were able to enjoy it more freely without worrying too much about pickpockets. We stayed out until 12:30am for three nights and feel safe in the Old Town area.

seems to be the city's focal point. the square is not very large but on three sides has old and interesting buildings. we were there when it was being used for the xmas fair. on saturday and sunday you could hardly move for people, but, at no time did we feel unsafe or think our pockets might be picked as you do in say.. Paris. Great atmosphere. Plenty of food and drink stalls, try the Prague Ham. Delicious. We went to the market on Monday. Much easier to get to the stalls and we had plenty of time to chose our Christmas decorations. On the hour the astrological clock chimes, but there were so many people we could not get a view of what it did. Without the xmas market it is a square, with it, it is a great place to visit.
Picture Postcard Prague. Lived up to everything I hoped for in a pre Christmas visit to Prague. Beautiful!!! Huge tree, children singing Christmas carols, Gluwein.

Great old square. It is a great place to see especially with Christmas market. Lot of people stacking around and lot of old architecture to see. if you have a tour guide, then they will tell you about the place which was used by emperors, kings and communists leaders for addressing the public

Romantic. Love the old town square, interesting architecture & narrow roads with small shops. Lots of street bars with heaters & blankets where you can sit & watch the world go buy. The Christmas markets started the weekend we went so there was plenty of mulled wine & street food.

Great fun place to wander during December. The square is full of stalls selling mulled wine, sausages, trdelnik ( a sweet pastry - lovely) and various tourist tat. Large christmas tree with lights which go on and off to music, stages for musical entertainment, horse drawn carriages awaiting your custom, various odd street performers, all surrounded by beautiful buildings and open air cafes make this a really atmospheric place to be. Watch out for young men zooming around on segways though.They can be lethal!
the centre of everything - lovely. This is the center of everything in old town prague - the clock towere, cathedral, market area, buskers, cafes and a fun place to hang out in

Christmas Fairytale. As a local I have been to the Old Town Square many many times. This year I must say the Christmas markets are perfectly organized! Goods offered are purely Christmas related and the Christmas tree show repeats every 30 minutes which helped to avoid the crowds at certain times. As a tourist you definitely should not miss the amazing atmosphere here!

Watch out for the hog roast!. Visiting the Old Town Square around Christmas time is lovely - the place is buzzing with people and lots of great market stalls. The astronomical clock is unusual and worth a look as are some of the other buildings around the edges of the square. There is a fantastic array of traditional foods available from the market stall, freshly fried potato crisps, multiple varieties of crepes, kebabs, sausages, traditional cinnamon donuts baked over charcoal (delicious!) and the ubiquitous hog roast stalls. One word of warning; a lot of the hog roast stalls sell by weight, so some will load up the potatoes and big lump of fatty meat - price can go up very quickly! Otherwise prices are about half of what you pay at a Christmas market in Scotland, so get stuck in :-)

A Christmas delight. The square was bedecked with an enormous and well decorated tree. Christmas market stalls filled the square which was lively with many families enjoying the season. Not sure what the square would be like at any other time though.

Impressive square temporarily used for Christmas Market. This is a very large and beautiful square but we were unable to see it at its best as it was full of Christmas Market Stalls. This is not a criticism as we were in Prague to visit the seasonal markets, it's just that their presence obstructed some of the possible vistas across the square. Both the food and craft stalls were well worth visiting and as we were there on weekdays at the beginning of December they were not too busy. I'm sure that later in the month they will be very much busier.
Beautiful Buildings - loads of shops. A beautiful site with plenty of bars/restaurants and architectural buildings and plenty of large shopping malls - great prices
Beautiful place. Was there in December and the Christmas market was amazing. Real cute market, with local food and music and of course lots of decorations
Really nice.. Beautiful. Lots of restaurants etc. Lovely Christmas market.Can get very busy though- so watch your pockets!

Christmas market. Rambled around the lovely Christmas Market last weekend . The first sight to greet us was the spectacular Christmas tree! Fabulous! The market was busy with lots of craft goods and food stalls . We ate sausage and chicken kebabs and funnel cake and a lovely light wafer . The smell of the hams cooking was delicious . The astromical clock is situated here at the side . The architecture is spectacular .

Walk in any direction and discover something interesting. There is much to do around the Old Town Square. Easy to reach by tram. Many amazing old buildings and the astronomical clock. Lots of street entertainment at night. Wander around the side streets to find good, inexpensive places to eat. Good shopping too. Found a shop selling only local Czech-made gifts.
Simply beautiful. What a gorgeous old town square. We have seen many on our travels and this one is just as lovely as the rest. Worth a visit

Fantastic place in Christmas time. Be there in the evening and enjoy all the small shops and the Christmas decoration. And take a closer look at al the fantastic surrounding buildings, and the churches. My favourite is the Tyn Church

Beautiful Architecture. With a Christmas market in the square, and all the Christmas decorations, this place looked great. A lot of old architecture buildings to view with beautiful Churches etc. in the area.
Christmas markets. Lots of choice, reasonable prices and lovely atmosphere. The main market is in old town although there are several smaller markets scattered around

Beautiful Old Square. Old Town Square surrounded by history.....bars,,,,restaurants......gothic setting could easily be used as setting for a new Batman film.......went there for the Christmas market which was wonderful.....lots of stalls selling food, drink and Christmas goods......not to be missed is the Astronomical clock

Christmas markets. We were here during the first week of December and the Christmas markets were in full swing in the Old Town Square which made for a lovely vibe. There are heaps of people trying to get you to join their tour groups though. It is magical at night time.

Old Town Square. Everyone visiting Prague will end up at the Old Town Square at some point. It is nicely restored and well kept...there's often market stalls and at Christmas it's really lively complete with a huge illuminated tree.

Magical Christmas Markets. I had gone for the Christmas markets, to soak up the atmosphere and it did not disappoint, with out a doubt had the Christmas tree to end all Christmas trees which looked OK in the day but came alive with magic at night. Plenty to see and do, lots of stalls, music of varying variety depending on what time of day you visit. You can take tours from here by bus, segway, walking or by horse and carriage. Highly recommended visit.

A collection of gothic architecture. We visited Prague whilst the Christmas markets were there. The architecture is spectacular and well worth the visit. If you are planning a visit to Prague the use the trams. A 24 hour hop on hop off ticket, costs 110 Czech crowns about £3 and is valid on the trams buses and metro. You can use the trams to see the sights especially if the weather is not good.

busy time in Prague with shopping. Very crowded and many shoppers pushing their way through the shops. The old building are what you come here for but beware pick pockets are praying on older couples.

Spectacular. Our first visit to Prague . walked round the corner and WOW!
I have never seen such a huge Christmas tree or decorated so beautifully and when the lights perform to music another WOW!

So much to do.. We were here for the Christmas Market, but there is so much else to do. The Astronomical clock pulls crowds every hour and the the Tyn Church is well worth a visit. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes, but check around as prices do vary.

If this is. Not my favourite square I can't think which is. In this fantastic square for 3 days in fabulous warm (relatively) December sunshine. Christmas market operating in force and mercifully avoiding the vulgarity that seems to endlessly pollute the UK at this time of year. Wonderful festive atmosphere with superb architecture surrounding you wherever you are. Truly magical.

Absolutely beautuful. The old town square in Prague, especially at Christmas time, is like experiencing a return to days of old. The architecture is stunning and the markets, the Christmas tree and all the other periphery remind you of what the festive season is all about.I've not been to the square in the summer but would imagine it's equally as stunning. I love the old cobbled streets: there is not many places left like that in the UK!Definitely worth a visit

My favourite part of Prague. Although Prague has four main areas of interest - The Castle Quarter, Jewish Quarter, Old Town and New Town, the Old Town Square is by far my favourite. It is so beautiful, particularly at Christmas with its markets and huge Christmas tree! But at any time of the year it is definitely a place to visit-the Astronomical Clock is amazing and the buildings round the Square are breathtaking. You can sit outside and have a coffee, lunch or dinner here (even in December), although prices are higher than restaurants just round the corner. Photographers will also try and sell you a fridge magnet of you at dinner... But it's worth it! If you are a history buff, do the World War II tour and you get to go underground and explore under the Old Town Square!

A grand square. The huge square has some lovely buildings all around, some remarkable churches, lots of people, live entertainment and music and many vendrs selling local food. An ideal meeting place, a place to rest tired feet and an excellent way to pass some time.

Christmas markets. We visited Prague for the Christmas markets but the highlight was the huge Christmas tree in Old Town Square - the best I've seen. It can get very busy with tour groups and the area has a lot of trip hazards, but the atmosphere was great.

Nice at day or night. Very good place in the evening if you want to have a walk around when all buildings are lid and then sit in one of the outside restaurants and have a late dinner overlooking the square. Very nice architecture with lots of monuments. I found it more cosy in the evening.
Christmas market. Great visit, Christmas markets in full flow, plenty to see and do very atmospheric great cinnamon smells - roasting pork - and hot wine to sample.

Love this place!. I've been to Prague a couple of times, and I absolutely love coming to the Old Town square. It's big and grand, like all old town squares should be. There are loads of places to sit, relax, and just people watch. You'll usually find some sort of live musical entertainment as well. There are the usual touristy restaurants around too. I love sitting here and soaking up the magical place that is Prague :)

Easy Walk through Town. Prague is a very easy walking city centered around this Old Town Square. It is more unique than any other European city I have ever been to as well. I really enjoyed the feel and the culture of this area!

Wow what a place. Where to start here it's the home of the astronomical clock which is a must see every hour it chimes incredible then tyn standing over the square beautiful then you have the incredible market with many local and handmade gifts lovely people and many place to get hot wine and food in the market the different smells of food cooking over burning wood is incredible all in all prague a beautiful city

Exciting to be here!. The Old Town Square is a hub of buskers, musicians, entertainers and lots of authentic Czech food and music. Lots of cafes at the perimeter of the square. To locate the Astronomical clock with the 12 apostles, you just have watch where a crowd congregates 10 minutes before the hour. If not you could have missed it! From the square you just go with the flow and before you know it you are at Wenceslaus square.Loved the sight and flavour of huge hams slow-cooking in wood-fired stoves, lots of varieties of sausage including the klobasky and fried breads and twirly potato crisps!

A must see in Prague, best seen sitting down sipping hot wine!. This is a place to hang out in Prague. Spend a few dollars and sit at one of the heated terraces (I went in October, we needed the heaters!), sip a local beer or a hot wine and just take in the energy of the city. It is a tourist spot, so expect company and tourist pricing, but it is well worth it.

Magical. What a beautiful square to roam about, get caught up with the atmosphere of the shops and bars. Grab a drink and sit and people watch. Or at this time of the year for me it's great with the Christmas markets etc with stalls and decorations of lights.....truly magical! However people on segways are a pain and need to be more careful, I saw an elderly couple appear rather shocked by someone whizzing past them......have some respect please!
visual treat. place has vibrant feeling it offer great treat to tourist where you get to have a ride in old vintage cars and horse carts
Beautiful. Walk around the town square on a weekend...and experience such a variety of visitors from all around the world. The architecture and history are compelling too!
X-mas magic !. Wonderful place full of peace and joy during x-mas. Only the snow was missing ....amazing walk over Charles Brisge to old Town Square ! Takes only 30 minutes but is breath taking
A place to gaze..... If it day or night this is the place to be in. Come let your self loose. gaze at the blue sky or stars in the night. Eat, drink and make merry.
loved it!!!. just walking around in the old town enjoying drinking thick hot chocolate and gluhwein, very beautiful city. did a segway tour - very recommended
great place. Cant go wrong in old town loads of things around to keep you busy. well worth a visit and full of tourist so you feel right at home.
If you are not there. why come to Prague ? Again a highlight I can not write much about. It is Prague, like the bridge, the old town, etc, etc..

Beautiful. The Old Town Square in Prague is incredible...like walking into a fairytale if you experience it for the first time at night. You are surrounded by beautiful buildings full of history. It will be packed with tourists and locals alike, but just stand and soak in the atmospere - the people of part of the experience and add to the excitement.

Beautiful City. Beautiful city with amazing architecture. The city is very inviting and trams run 24 hours so you can stay out all night. Lots of performers/artist on the street. Beggars too and pick pocketing is common, but travel smart and you'll be fine. We didn't have any issues.
Awesome architecture. Loved the square. Xmas markets had just opened and great atmosphere. Loved the cafes with their rugs so you can eat and drink outside despite the cold.
great square with a dark history. cobbled all over with stalls and cafe bars all around. and street entertainment. look into the history.
Hear of the town!. If you are in Prague so you must pass by that place. I think you can find the authentic beauty of Prague there.

Love this place. One of the best town squares in Europe and full of things to see and do. Iconic buildings including the clock tower are a must see. Join the crowds every hour watching the apostles pass as the bells ring in the hour. The place is buzzing and can get very crowded but it's a great place to spend some time. Lots of restaurants/bars surround the square and perfect for people watching while sipping a cold beer. Prices a little more expensive than the rest of town but you would expect thatThis time of year the square is even more special with the Christmas market. Amazing sights and smells with mulled wine, roasting hams and chestnuts, cinnamon squirls. Add to that a fabulous Christmas tree and various choirs etc and it really is beginning to look like Christmas.
Helpful place. great place to eat watch shows and get anything you need for the night,,,its a big square in the center of old town

The heart of the city. The old town square is the heart of Prague. Stay at the center square and look around. You will never see something like that. it's like a Disney movie. Now it's Christmas time and it's even more beautiful place for all family all day.Don't miss it !

Great. Great atmosphere and the Christmas markets were very enjoyable. The buildings and architecture was amazing.
The people weren't the most friendly except I wouldn't of counted that as a must for this type of thing.

Christmas Markets. The Old Town square has lots of interesting history and today is used for lots of markets. Head to Old Town square around the Christmas period and it's filled with lots of local tradespeople selling their traditional products (great for Christmas presents) or tasty food and drink.The area is well maintained and clean and you'll find lots of people using this area as a meeting spot, as well as many tour guides advertising here.Apparently there's a problem with pick pockets here, as is the same in any densely populated tourist spot, but I didn't experience any trouble.

Christmas Village and Tree in the Square. Old Town Square is a historically rich and beautiful part of town! The buildings are visually stimulating and are a part of why Prague is such a lovely destination. This area is a must visit spot in Prague. It's a quick walk from most any of the major sites.

Lovely square, always busy, beware the Old Prague ham!. Lovely square in the heart of the Old Town, don't forget to visit the Astronomical Clock whilst you're in the area.Beware the "Old Prague Ham" stalls, whilst the meat is lovely they portion sizes are forced on you and charged by the 100g so work out expensive. But one portion between 4 and see if you're still hungry, you can always go back for more!

Lovely little place. We are on our last day/night of a long weeknd in prague and the old town square really is the place to be!The astronomical clock is such a beautiful building but the clock going off every hour is a bit of a let down. Lastnight we ate in one of the restaurants after watching a fire eater, street acts and the huge christmas tree which had the lights flashing to the rhythm of songs playing, fantastic to see!Christmas markets just started today so feeling very festive!

Spend the afternoon in this square checking out the people and sights...it's alive here. Always buzzing with people and restaurants and activities....often tents set up with entertainment and food vendor carts. Don't miss the dough And sugared cinnamon treats.... The astronomical clock is also in this square and folks pack in to see it go off every hour on the hour.
Stunning. You could happily spend all day here. The world famous astronomical clock draws people. We went in winter, and were glad of the bars selling mulled wine.

Slow down to people watch. Old Town Square is a must for all tourists. We enjoyed sitting in the square to watch people go by. There are very often street performers in the square. Buy some food and beverage from the stalls (in the park between the town building and the St. Nichols Church), and take an enjoyable afternoon break in the square!
Buzzing. A main gathering point full of eateries and food stalls and music. Buzzing day and night and surrounded by lots of historical buildings and fabulous architecture.
The heart of the old town. Beside the crowd at peek hours, it's a great place, a must for every visit in Prague. I'd recommend arriving early in the morning or late at night.
Very Quiaint & lovely buildings. This id definatly in the nicest part of Prague - lots of nice restaurants & little coffee shops - some beautiful buildings too. well worth a visit.

Hub of activity especially at night. This square is a must visit as this is where you will find the Tyn Church (which really look gorgeous at night), St Nicholas Church and the Old Town Hall with the Astronomical Clock. Viewing deck (fee required) at the top of town hall gives great panoramic views of the city. At night, this place comes to life with al fresco dining and street food stalls and it can get very crowded. Great atmosphere though, a must-visit.

Enchanting old town. We chose to stay at a Airbnb in the old town square district as it is in the heart of various attractions. There were free walking tours that start right here and takes about 3 hours to complete. Take note the food stalls sell meat by weight, and be specific on how much you want else you may have to pay an arm or leg for it!

Lovely old square. Yes it is a lovely old square with fine buildings. Lots of people. Shame about the food stalls on one edge hopefully they were early Christmas market stalls rather than there all year.Went another day and huge Christmas tree being erected, along with Christmas market stalls.

So much character in one city. Old town square is a must. We visited in November and wandered across the Charles river bridge in the early evening. The square was lighted beautifully. We found a great Italian cafe for desert and espresso. A great walk around. Enjoy !!!!
Lovely. The grand old square is a great sight. I enjoyed the old town and the square is well worth wondering around in.

Fabulous quietly atmospheric place.. Gorgeous things to look at and lots of great places to eat in the historical heart of the city. Great to just sit in a cafe and enjoy a mulled wine or coffee and just soak up the atmosphere.
Full of character. Spent a lovely winter afternoon here. Highly recommended for people of all ages. We used the hop on hop off bus which were every 15 minutes.
You didn't really notice . You need to look up when visiting this square. The ground as such brings nothing but the buildings are why you go here

Place to feel the spirit of the Prague. I often come here to absorb night view of old buildings that are lid all around the square and also a vegetarian restaurant Maitrea that is nearby is reason to hang around more. And the Orloj clock, of course.

It is why you come to Prague. Prague is a beautiful city. Just as beautiful as Paris in its own way, and when you come to Prague, you go to the Old Town Square. It contains Prague's famous clock, restaurants, shops, etc. Is it a fabulous site? No, but it is a pleasant place to spend an hour. You must be there on the hour to see the clock do its thing.

what a nice square. a place you have to visit great clock just off the main square right on the corner lovely buildings all round the square and ajoining roads.there is entertainment all over the square,traditional singers and mime artists.

A memory for always. what a place. surrounded by outstanding architecture and filled with fine people dressed in their finest. a fashion scene all along. extremely clean with pure air to breath. sip a coffee in the open at the numerous cafes ... the true essence of Prague is just here...

Every building is beautiful. Every building in this square is beautiful. Take time just to look at the architecture. There is often live music to enjoy too. Expect to be offered Segway tour offers every five seconds, but a polite "no thanks" works well.

History, sightseeing, people watching, eating........ Visited this area on several occasions during our stay, day and night it is always lively. The crowds gathered on the hour at the astronomical clock, the buskers/street entertainers, the fantastic architecture, restaurants, snack stalls, fantastic!

Old Town Square Prague, absolutely buzzing. The Old Town Square is full of wonderful cafes, restaurants and bars, each offering amazing food and drink. Sit outside and watch some of the street entertainers all while taking in the fantastic architecture. Truly amazing place.

Prague in november. I mean, it's an obligation to look into the old town and it's surroundings at each visit. Not only for all the significant monuments, but mainly for atmosphere, that is a perfect in every season.
Architectural Wonderland. The buildings are drop dead gorgeous! There is a lot of activity with food vendors, street entertainers, outdoor cafes, just a joyful environment!
Wonderful and joyful place. There you can see all kind of people and cheerful peddlers , comedians and jazz players . The Astronomic Clock is also there .
Very picturesque. Lovely for a mulled wine and to people watch. The sales people on the segways are a pain in the neck though, actually spoils what otherwise is a beautiful part of the world.

A fantastic place to relax and watch the hustle and bustle. The Old Town Square is surrounded by affordable places to eat from local dishes served from kiosk's to Sit down formal restaurants. There is always lots going on from people offering Segway rides (it is fun watching people try Segway for the first time) to human statues. There is also some high end shops.The Old Town Square is a great place to start your break in Prague.

Beautiful Buildings!. Great location for people-watching and for relaxing after you have explored the other city sites. Some nice food to be had, if you're feeling peckish after visiting other locations. Got some great night-time pictures here with buildings beautifully illuminated.

Best place for history buffs. Its a nice square surrounded by medieval era which is good for history buffs also to experience Prague in its true sense. The area is quite picturesque but is very touristy with people on segway(quite annoying). As we were staying in area of Ujezd , the approach to old town square is good with little cobblestone alleys surrounded by buildings from gothic to baroque architecture.

A Charming Experience. The square is filled with tourists, unexpected performers and musicians. The scenery is, of course beautiful. People are mostly very friendly and everyone speaks English (yes, I'm spoiled)!
the sqaure. picturesque, though the people with the segways could be quite annoying, waiting for the clock to strike, personally i couldnt see what all the fuss was about

Lots of fun, food & drinking!. I've travelled to many cities that boast an old town square but Prague really does have the best in my opinion. Street acts, bars, restaurants and market stalls. Check out the Old Prague Ham it was brilliant. Watch out for the homeless though as they do hang around at night, the market traders were aware though and kept a watch out and made sure they were not bothering you

The heart of Prague. No visit to Prague would be complete without a lot of time spent in the square. The 600 year old clock, the mimes, artistic to and people. The chocolate crepes sold on one side by a local vendor are incredible

Old palace, not castle. A lot of reviewers seem to be mistaking this place for the Castle which is a few kilometres from here, this is actually in old town square, a fine building all the same, certainly worth a photographic visit on your tourist trail.

The visits start from there. It is the heart of the historic district and logically you start your touristic visit of Prague from there. It is a very large square surrounded by amazing buildings of different architecture. There is a large bronze statue of Jan Hus, a famous religious reformer. The astronomical clock is also located in one of the corners of the place.

Amazing center of the old town. This is a lovely and large square, in the middle of old town Prague. Very crowded by mid day but less so early in the morning. Major people watching place, also we grabbed a Bicycle Rickshaw from this square and found this to be a lovely way to see the old town.
A lot going on.... Definitely a place where people gather for on street entertainment. Always busy and full of people of all nationalities. Restaurants, stalls selling food and hot wine is a must

Lovely square. If you are in Prague, then old town square is a must see. There benches to sit on and watch the world go by, or just admire the beauty of the place, there beautiful buildings area, the church, the famous clock, statues and more. Lots to do in this area, be it shopping for food, clothes or clubbing at night time. This square lights up at night too.

Gorgeous. mentioned the square in my review of Old Town, beautiful churches and you have the Astronomical clock which large crowds gather to watch. Highly recommend Old Town Square and Old Town itself.
A walk through History. A beautiful place for a walking tour ! The cobbled streets historical building are a delight to the eye ! The view of the city from the height is also very nice.
fantastic. Heart of Prague ! crowded but beautiful area. expensive but nice to wander around and watch the street musicians.

The life and heart of Prague. Since I was in Prague a week I had the pleasure of going to the square quite often and also passing through to go to St Vitus Cathedral, the Jewish cemetary, the Charles Bridge and to the many restaurants. Great atmosphere, absolutely great architecture and the astronomical clock is very special. A must of course.

If you want lively. An exciting area of Prague to visit. It's an area which is usually packed with tourists and it's certainly bustling. There is so much going on from markets, music, side shows, music it's all here to see and enjoy. I particularly enjoy the evening here. It's alive. Please visit you will not be disssapointed.
This is one of the prettier squares in Europe. I really enjoyed visiting this square. The concentration of sites with the cathedral, town square and astronomical clock make it a hub of activity.

Lots of life and attractions with good sights and food. This is where you will see a lot of the culture of Prague. It's packed with tourist but there are so many interesting sights and sounds and smells. Many delicious food vendors are station around here as well.
Mid week break. A lovely open area with a beautiful town hall and clock which is very large and unusual. The square is surrounded by all manner of shops and cafes
Good place to try out restaurants. The old square is a nice place to hangout on a sunny evening. The surrounding places have lots of restaurants and clubs. Worth the evening stroll

Speclatular !. It is difficult to describe what you will see here in the heart of Old Prague. You can walk here for days and still find new view to your naked eye. Picturesque Old Historical buildings will take you back in times. Must , must, must!

Just amazing!!!. Perfect town.Be sure to visit the two churches (St.Nikolas and Tyn church) the astronomical clock and the tower beside the clock for the best views of the city .Another must is to eat traditional food from the cantinas in froom of the old town square
Old world charm. Prague is a beautiful city with a long history - the charm really comes through in this square which is often full of life and events.

Heart of Prague!. Probably the most vibrant and lively square. Full of history, architecture and people. Literally full of people! Iconic nevertheless. Don't miss the medieval astronomical clock (watch it at the hour strike).

Worth a walk through. If you're going to Prague, you'll want to go through Staromětské Náměstí at least once. It has a statue of Jan Hus (if you don't know, he's a seminal figure in Czech and world history worth an internet search), Týn's cathedral, Orloj (the astronomical clock), as well a small shops, restaurants, and a really fun Christmas market (if they still do it, I haven't spent Christmas in Prague in a few years).The downside is the crowds. Expect them, get comfortable with the idea that nothing is going to happen quickly and go with it.You probably don't want to make multiple trips, but you'll want to go at least once.

Historic Place to be Seen. It is the reflection of how Prague preserved its history. You can see many buildings relate to Prague and Czech Republic's history from different times. During winter seasons don't forget to sit at ta cafe and drink mulled wine.
Lots to do. Its a must see. there are so many sights in the huge square. Take one of the many free tours and learn the history. they meet by the tourism center.

Beautiful town. Lovely busy little square with lots of restaurants and bars. Sit outside and chill watching the world go by. Very busy as lots of little things going on in the square - little bands singing/playing music etc. We had to come here to start our walking tour too which I highly recommend!
Stunning . Definitely worth a visit, stunning scenery, great shops, very friendly people, one of my favourite places in my favourite city to visit

Magical. Prague old Town Square is a magical place that reminded me most of children fairytale. When I entered the square I though I’m in a Disney movie set with all the beautiful buildings, churches and shops. It is located in the middle of told town between Wenceslas Square and the Charles Bridge. The most important feature in the old town is the Prague astronomical clock (Prague Orloj) is a medieval astronomical clock located on the Old Town Hall. This clock is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still in operation. The cafes around the square are the best place to sit and watch street artists and musician perform and enjoy the afternoon, though they are somewhat expensive.

A big beautiful Square.. What a lovely place, though absolutely jam packed with tourists, which can be a bit of a put off. Maybe it would be recommended to come here earlier in the day, found there weren't so many people around then. Other than that it has that cosmopolitan, European charm that is found in many big cities, cobble stones, big tall buildings with statues on them, a gotyhic cathedral, a palace, lots of bars and cafes with sprawling terraces for you to enjoy your coffee while the world passes through, but please go at a good time, you can't go wrong!Enjoy

Great place to watch the world going by. So much history to take in as where ever you look there are different buildings from different eras of history. The square is always lively with plenty going on but watch out for the segways

An unsurpassed location. This square must rate as a world heritage area. The architecture in all sides is fantastic whether your a castled or churched out by all the like places you've seen in various European cities it is difficult to imagine a more picturesque city centre anywhere in the world. Prague is well worth the visit and a must fro your bucket list.
Busy!. The Old Town Square is beautiful and very busy with tourist. There are many great restaurants. Nice place to grab a bite and do some people watching!

Soup babble . We had beutyfull time. And there was a great girl who made babbles for the children. It was great. So the square looked even more beautiful. Only the people on segways were everywhere what was not nice and dangerous.
A great place for free entertainment. The Old Town Square of Prague is filled with young entertainers, all with different gigs. A fun place to mill around for a while.
Fabulous medieval buzzy place. Lots going on here - all sorts of street entertainment, along with cafes, restaurants - whilst being surrounded by the most incredible medieval buildings
lots to see. very old buildings lots of visitors has a very old clock which is worth waiting for it to chime the designer shops off the bottom of the square are well worth a visit
Heart of historic Prague. Architecture is amazing. Street musicians are found here. Lots of food vendors.. Astronomical clock is here. You can spend lots of time here just enjoying your surroundings.
Must see. I loved this amazing square, architecture and sights. It is crowded and busy, you will find something to do there for sure!

Busy place, but "Must see". Square is technically in the middle of Prague Old Town on the left Bank.
You can have famous prague sasages, hot wine there, while waiting to the right time to see Orbital Clock working ;-)
Great. It was the best part of Prague for me, such an interesting place with the astronomical clock and all the rest: love it!

Nice place but busy. This is just what it says, an old town square with lovely architecture points of interest a variety of ways to spend money and work thought the crowds. This is well worth a visit as there's a lot to see here, it's also where any tour you may wish to go on will be found. There are a variety of statues, real and human, bars and sights. Nice to see but not somewhere to spend much time.

Busy, Busy lets stay busy. Buzzing place lots to see and do entertainers everywhere some very good too!The Orbital clock is situated here so that is a must see when visiting Prague and there are many, many eateries and barrs and shops. You could spend the weekend here and enjoy every minute!

One of the Prague´s must see on the list. You can´t miss the Old Town quare with its iconic piece - Astronomical Clock. Every single hour the medieval astronomical clock located on the south side of the Old Town Hall tower in the corner of Old Town square shows a small performance of Apostles. Awesome spectacle!
Vibrant. It's a lovely and vibrant square, mixing the medieval architecture with a modern life. A bit to full of tourists, of course, but a must see.

Beautiful square. Beautiful place to soak up the atmosphere of Prague. Fab buildings all around and right beside the Astronomical clock so really two attractions in one! Lots of places to eat and drink, try the vendors selling hot wine and local specialities, very cheap and very tasty. We visited a wonderful coffee shop behind the cathederal and had coffee and apple strudle for about £2!
Classic beauty. Lots of very nice old buildings, all different in architecture, but busy with tourists and watch out for the segways,

Beautiful Place, Look for the Food Stalls, too!. We stayed near here, and began and ended many days on our visit, in this wonderful area. So many great photo ops, history, the clock, church and lots of shopping and dining. Grab some cash at an atm (NOT from the guys who try to hawk you to exchange money!),and head to the small food stalls located on one side(easy to find, you will see people eating, standing at small pedestal tables),and get some sausage, or the amazing crepes, offered there. I got a banana and chocolate one that was plenty to share, hot and freshly made. Day or night, you will love Old Town; find a tour, a horse and carriage ride, or enjoy the entertainment from street performers.Something for everyone!

Colourful stay until night. A really popular tourist destination, although really safe take care of your valuables and watch out for pick pocketers as always. This is a majestic place. Here you can find Baroque houses of different colours, its located between Wenceslas Square and the bridge. Stay late and watch it light up at night. You can here the clock tower playing music which is cool.

Old Town Square. A magnificent medieval square, interesting both during the daytime and particularly after dark.Take your camera with you.Too many attractions to list in one square, but do not miss a look at the Astronomical Clock, and have a guide explain its ten features. Look at the House at the Stone Bell. Again after dark this square becomes magical.Action in the square itself takes place throughout the day and evening, with photo shoots, horse and carriage rides live statues and much more. Camera required.
Beautiful . It's a beautiful place. Definitely worth visiting. The only negative part is that it is always crowded. Besides that it's totally recommend!

The highlight of Prague . Of course this is a fantastic place to be in & view. But you may be frustrated or overwhelmed at the crowds. I was there in Autumn &!86 was busy enough, I cannot imagine what summer would be like. My advice is to get to places early, go multiple times at different times of the day & night to see the many colours & faces. Best time: I went for a run at Monday morning 8am for 3/4th time through the square. Of course nothing was "open" but it was basically deserted & I got great views and a sense of the space. Enjoy!

a place to see. i love this place for shopping and also for the colour of this place this place is very calm and also there are some street shows that keep happens over there. the best part of the whole thing is the as Astronomical clock. you should see this
journey to historical Prague. good to visit at night, the night lights are so sublime.Medieval Tavern is a must to visit for a cool Czech beer, Svickova & dumpling.

Lovely . This is the main Square. And we loved the atmosphere. Lots of places to stop eat and people watch. There are performers in the Square. We watched a man making huge bubbles also Fire shows and musicians. Also catch a horse drawn carriage ride think it was 800 krona for two...a little smelly but truly fab. Even though this place is busy it's safe. We saw plenty of police around. In fact there are plenty of police everywhere which is great for us tourists....get to the Square it's worth it

very romantic. very romantic walk through the old town. Its filled with tourists but also with lots of small shops and restaurants and old houses and churches. All very European and very plesant. Just wondered through the allies and enjoyed every moment.
Beautiful!. Beautiful, was yesterday going today again. I am fascinated with the architecture, buildings and the street artists.

Fantastic Square. It is always nice to hang around squares in Europe. Staromestske Namesti is one of the fantastic place to hang around. There are many shops, cafes and restaurant surrounding the square. There were few street vendors selling food such as barbeque pork and the local sweet roll "trdelnik". There were some street performers on the square making the whole square exciting and vibrant. The square is huge that there were also some people riding or teaching how to ride sedgways.

Witness Old Europe at its Finest. Just a great experience and there is so much to see by either wandering around this central square or just enjoying a cup of coffee or a casual lunch at anyone of the numerous cafes. You will never forget this area, it matches the best Europe has to offer.
Great people watching. A very good stop to meet friends and find a bar or Resturant to do some serious people watching...and its a beautiful location
Astronomical clock. Lovely to sit at night or stroll by day check out any of the lovely eateries - share a couple of dishes some beer then move on - but always be there for the chiming clock

Great atmosphere . Lovely square, full of hussle and bustle. If your looking for tours or pub crawls you'll find a representatives there. Although as you would imagine the food and drink prices in this area are very expensive. Though stalls are lovely beware if you order meat it has 100g for set koruna then you need to state how much you'd like in grams or you'll end up like us and paying for 500g ham! Melt in your mouth ham but we weren't that hungry haha.
Very picturesque market square. Old buildings, churches and cobble stone streets...I love the shops, the music, the street stalls...It makes me go back in time of my childhood.

The clock. Every hour hundreds of tourist try to get a good spot to watch the clock. Like every other tourist we waited around to watch the show and where a bit disappointed it was over in a few minutes. The clock itself is worth looking at.

A lovely square .... A good starting point to see the astronomical clock, powder tower etc. There are a number of restaurants etc. around the square - we suggest you rather eat a block or 2 away, the square charges tourist prices.

Don't Mime the Crowd. This is a very high energy place. It's a great strolling theater. You will see more mimes than you want but each has a unique act that makes them very entertaining (tipping suggested but not required). If you interact with the mimes do tip they are very appreciative. Also a really great treat are the music acts from jazz ensembles to classical piano with a little light rock thrown in. The cafes and food vendors around the square can make this an all day outing. And don't forget the hundreds of years of historical sights such as the Astonomical Clock.

Its a dream!. The moment we got down from the cab, we were enchanted by the beauty and feel of old town square! The buildings, the roadside eating joints, the horse carts, the street cafes, simply everything about the old town square is lovely!Make sure to have crepes and meat at the roadside joints! The helpings are big so don't over order. I didn't like the hot wine - beer pivo as they call it, at a cafe is a better choice!My wife loved the mojitos! Just walk around the place and soak the ambience - the clean air over the cobble stone streets!!Worth visiting again!!

A place from the fairytales. Lovely place in the heart of a beautiful city.Open air organized events take place frequently.Close to the beautiful bridges of the river.Musts are Astronomic clock and old gothic churches.Realy a warm atmosphere.

Large square. The Old Town Square is very large and open area surronded by interesting buildings.There are many cafes and shops around the square, just go a few streets away and coffees etc are much cheaper.Beware of the stalls selling food as they sell by weight and may pile on more food than you want.The astronomical clock is found here and it is very busy when it strikes the hour but worth seeing.
Beautiful old town charm. I have been in a number of Old Town Squares, Staromestske namesti is very special and looks to be untouched for many years. Great exploring.

Incredible Architecture, but feels like there could be more going on. . The square and surrounding buildings are incredible. Restaurants in the surrounding area are okay, but I defo felt like I wanted just a little bit more, maybe some more going on, in the big open square.

Loved it! . Makes a good main point so you know where you are going. Very beautiful and not as busy as I thought! Doesn't really get started until after 10 though we were up early and nothing open! The street food here is delicious and the smells of it all are great! Take all the streets off the square to find lovely food and beer!

Not the star of the show. The square is the central hub for many activities in the Old Town, but I didn't find the square itself that interesting. If you like buskers or touristy food stalls you might like it. Otherwise go for the stuff around the square or pass through.

Limited interest and crowded. This square is like many in Europe (such as Bruges, or ones in Germany) and is lined with shops, restaurants and cafes. The best thing to see is the Astronomical Clock, so be sure to be there 'on the hour' when it chimes and the mechanical figures start up.The reason I've witheld stars is because of the idiot segway operatives who zoom around at speed trying to drum up business. The authorities should limit their numbers in such a crowded tourist environment.

Fantastic square. This was walking distance from our hotel. We spent most of the time here only. This square is very entertaining and is filled with restaurants, bars,shops,street performers,local market,sightseeing activities everything. Must visit and spend lot of time here. Its really pretty and is generally jam packed.

Best happening place in prague. This square is the best in Prague. While on the way you find lots of branded shops where you can see & shop from those shops. Also you get to ride in vintage cars of Horse carts from the square to s small tour of near by area. The Segway tour is also available in this square. There are a lot of artist & the famous Czech smoked ham.
classic, beautiful square. i often forget how beautiful this is. It's up there with many beuatiful european squares. Lots of action, buskers, hustlers, magicians, good shopping, people watching.

Touristy. Like so many European squares, people looking to make a buck off of tourists is really making the square a crummy place to visit - the Segways are particularly annoying - it just gets in the way of wanting to take it all in. If you can, put on some classical music and drown the people out. It's nice if you ignore the peddlers and buskers.
Expectations not met. The enchantment of Prague is almost lost to the throngs of tourists and the ubiquitous tourist oriented touts, shops and attractions.

The square is fun, active and full of history!. The square is fun, active and full of history! Many FREE walking tour are offered here and there are many eateries and cultural points of interest here. Bring your money, because there are many shops and stores there as well.

Lovely to sit and have coffee. Great views and there are usually performers in the afternoon, musician, dancers, puppet shows etc. Sun comes into square and bathes the cafes to the East so choose a seat carefully and people watch from the sunshine. Astrological clock gets an audience but I can't really see why. Hope the review is helpful.

Ancient Square in Modern Tourist Spot. This Square has been a public market for a thousand years. It has one of four astronomical clocks built in Europe in the middle ages. Completed in 1410, it is the third oldest astronomical clock in the world, and the oldest that still works. The Square is flanked by buildings, such as the medieval House at the Stone Bell, built in the second half of the 13th century. Next door is the Gothic church, Our Lady Before Tyn, which was built in the 14th-15th centuries. Opposite the Stone Bell House is a Rococo Palace, Kinsky Palace, which is a part of the National Gallery, Prague's amazing collection of fine art museums. The Square is surrounded by 700 years worth of architecture. Within the Square is a monument to Jan Hus. This is one of my favorite places in the world, and is something that must be seen on any trip to Prague.

Vibrant and Charming. All the free tours begin in this square which is a central hub of the Old City, always busy, always bustling with vintage motor vehicles, horse and carriages and lots and lots of people. The buildings surrounding the square are quite exquisite, each one has its own character. A very large sculpture dominates the centre of the square, the Jan Hus Memorial.

Busy location. Very quaint square with nice buildings but very busy. Segway hire, horse and cart tours aplenty, buskers and walking tours. The area is very pleasant though and worth 10 minutes of your time.
Must see. Must see attraction it's like visiting Moscow and doesn't check Red square. Just visit, take something to eat at the street and relax :)

Lovely square. A lovely square with interesting buildings on all sides of it. The clock is really nice and watching it do it's thing on the hour was a lot of fun. There were performers when we went at night which was lovely.

Great fun!. This square is always buzzing. Surrounded by great restaurants, with street vendors... historic buildings and the astrological clock... there is something for everyone! Great fun... shopping... people watching... and of course, food to delight.

Busy busy. A must-do but terribly crowded and not at all relaxing. Probably best to get off the street before the stag groups appear. I've been here early in the morning in the sun and it was pleasant.
Buzzing!. Loved it here. Loads of bars and restaurants. Lots of street entertainers. Most of the restaurants have outside heated areas and blankets if too cold.

lovely old square. a lovely old square with plenty of things to see and do. the tyn church is a massive place on one sideof the square. lots of people trying segways, though they do wiz around and can be a pest at times, a few horse and carriages to take you on a tour. plenty of cafes and restaurants here to.

Vibrant and exciting. This town square is just full of atmosphere. Street entertainment, horse and carriages, historical buildings, a statue ( surprise, surprise). Access to lots of shops and food in the general area. Be aware you will pay "tourist prices" at some of the cafes. We have some reasonable prices coffe, however paid 627kn for one apple strudel and two coffees.No cars in the square, just lots of people.All in all visit it you can.
Our Favorite. We just finished a tour of Central Europe and Prague was our favorite city. Old town square was part of what makes Prague so special. It is a wonderful place to spend some time
Wow!. The Old Town Square was bustling with people and overflowing with Czech culture - we loved it! Prague if definitely right up my street.

A very very attractive square in all of Prague. A must see if anyone is in Prague. Beautiful architecture, plenty of cafes all around with, local, Italian choices including Starbucks. We were there in late October so being all outdoor cafes they have heater running from portable ceiling so no need to worry about being cold. Plenty of different concerts and orchestra going on all the time. We heard nice Jazz, Irish music etc. the street with famous designer shops starts from the square. So have fun. A good place for a beer, snacks and people watching.
Amazing. The square is buzzing, perfect place to sit, eat, drink and watch the world go by. Lots to see including busker and music. You will never be bored.

The heart of Prague. Old Town Square (as is the case in most European historical cities) is the center of old town Prague. It is a pedestrian only zone and houses innumerable places of historical significance. The square also houses the Astronomical clock which I guess would be amongst the most visited of Prague's monuments. There are also various buildings including residential ones from various ages at the square as well as in the alleys leading to the square. A detailed walk (like the big boy travel or many others online) would describe the importance of each. There square is always filled with tourists and houses many restaurants (slightly expensive though). There are also a few stalls if one has to have food/beer on the go. Its a perfect place to start your sightseeing trip of Prague and also to end it. One should also plan an evening at the square for some beautiful artistic road side performances and dinner.

Be ready to Eat. Ok the square is loaded with scenic things to see churches statues ect > but the "main event" is the FOOD that is being cooked every where you turn. Spatzel Snitzel Pork of every kind and sweets! You will gain 10lbs just walking around!

A step into the past. I went during Christmas season and there were markets all over the place. It felt like being in one of those market towns I read about in history class. The lights made the place a sight to behold at night.

people and cafes. Probably the second most crowded place in Prague (after Charles bridge)...filled with tourists at all times of year. Get there early in the morning for far fewer tourists. Surrounded by beautiful buildings, churches, and cafes.
Praga. Lovely city with beautiful old architecture. Very good restaurants with nice local food and beers. Good for shopping as well :)
Attractive Square. This attractive square is in the centre of the old town. It was always busy with tourists and street performers
Wonderful architecture.. A lovely area to visit. Street artists, musicians, horse drawn carriages and some wonderful architecture to enjoy.
Great place to "hang out". This is a fun place to have a beer and snack, and people-watch. It's always busy with varied entertainment, venders, and beautiful old buildings. This is a must see place!

Lively and beautiful. Different cities have different charms, Prague offers a view on what man is capable of doing business and creating when he has the right motivation, by the same token, how destructive he becomes when allows ideologies obscure his mind and soul. It is beautiful to see Prague in her way to recovering
Historical. The old town is a must see in Prague. The place is beautiful; it contains major attractions, wide selection of food options, shopping and entertainment.

Old world Charm. It was a very lively and crowded place, yet it somehow managed to retain a certain old-world charm. There were eateries and shops all around, as well as live music. A must-visit for sure!
Very good looking architecture. The buildings in the place are amazing with details . great architecture. like everything in Prague this place is sort of magical, i always feel like in a movie!

Old Town Square - Tourist Attraction. The Old Town Square's main attraction is the Astronomical Clock. Where peple gather every hour to watch the clock chime and the march of the 12 apostles followed by the cock crow. The other attraction around are St. Nicholas Church and Tyn Church. You can simply sit back and relax at the Old Town Square where there is a statue of Jan Hus which is located right in the centre of the Town Square.

Be careful of the Segways!. This is a remarkable and picturesque place, with some great street food at reasonable prices. The atmosphere is slightly spoilt by the sheer volume of Segway "vendors" and customers so you do have to watch out

A highlight of our trip to Prague. You won't want to miss spending time in the Old Town Square. So much to see. Great people watching spot. Always changing. We were there in the daytime and again and night and came back each day on our 3-day visit as it was so much fun. Highly recommended.

Fascinating place. Loved the atmosphere here. Many places to eat, great architecture and many buskers playing jazz and pop music. Everyone cheered when the old clock had finished. Bit more expensive to eat and drink but well worth it. Great place just to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.
Town Square. Reasonably nice town square but unfortunately full of stalls and other sellers of junk. Nearby is the famous clock and church which are well worth looking at for a short while.
highlight. This is the absolute highlight of Prague, at least in terms of history and architecture.I think it should not be missed.

old town square. spend at least half day in this place
I like the settings of the buildings, It feels like a flashback in the 1800
lovely sceneries , beautiful spot for picture taking
will recommend

Activity hub. The square is the centre of all the activities in the area. Many exhibits are held here and local actors put on performances. The square is also active at night with the Church Glockinspiel and restaurant outdoor serving areas.
Classic "Old Europe" square. Sometimes very crowded tourist attraction, but one that shouldn't be missed. It gives you a great feeling for what ancient Prague was like.

Popular center of Old Town Prague. You can tell that this place is worth visiting by observing the crowds - night and day they stream through Old Town to the square. Ringed with restaurants and bars this is obviously the center of activity. Plenty of shopping, and usually street entertainers in the square. Be warned - if crowds are not your thing, this isn't the place for you!

Historical!. It was so nice to see the town square going back hundreds of years. So much history and so much architectural buildings. Amazing how civilization has been those days. Now, there are so many shops from boutiques to restaurants. A lot of street performers from people of all walks of life. It should be in everyone's bucket list.

Karen. Sat in this old town square for 3 nights in a row enjoying the views watching the clock and all the different shows going on whilst eating lovely food and having lovely wine. Waited on and comfortable chairs with overhead heaters. Perfect. Going back again in december for the Christmas markets

Always something going on!. We stayed at an apartment on the square for 5 days (thru Air BnB) so have intimate experience with the square. It is the central square in Prague so major attractions are right there (Astronomical clock, cathedral, etc). It is a happening place! Very good "street" entertainers - playing/shows for tips, horse drawn carriages, Segway tours, etc. You need to look beyond the hubbub a bit and take it in. The square is HUGE!
