So even though there are lots of people in the square, it doesn't seem crowded at all. There's no pressure from the performers, activity sales folks - all very low key. The surrounding architecture is beautiful! There are lots of café/bars to sit and enjoy the views and people watching. Performers are unique and high quality - great music. Next trip I'll be staying close by.
Fantastic Views. For Malaysian like me, the buildings in Old town square are really special and super pretty. Feels happy even just by sitting there and watching

Lovely town square!. This is a lovely town square with lots of history to see and witness! Good for classic photo ops and, of course, for people watching! It's a nice place to relax after a long day of touring!

beautiful view with beautiful buildings. wherever you look you will see something nice. Old buildings, very nice and picturesque facades. A lot of people everywhere around you. A lot of places to have a cup of drink.

Unmissable if Crowded. The centre of Prague, and a must-visit location. Get there very early to enjoy the view without being distracted by tour groups of all nationalities trudging past in caterpillar formation.
Very impresive architecture. We went there four times during our long weekend, everytime noticing something new. Plenty of small shops selling souvenirs
A must visit. watch the astrological clock chime and marvel at the beautiful buildings and the fun buskers. Beautiful at night as well

Old Town Square. Great focal point to start you visit and getting to know the local traditions from; Restaurants, Bars, street entertainers and views of historic architectural buildings.Like most of Prague this square is a cobbled area so good footwear preferred.crowds gather to view the hourly chimes of the clock tower here, well worth a view.From the square you can explore many of it's lanes that send you down different avenues all different but pleasant for it's views and shops.Dry weather is preferred for this but still worth a visit if wet, even on a dry sunny day as it was when we were there remember there are high buildings surrounding you so still need worm clothing.

Nice place to walk.. It gets very crowded here, and that has been getting worse as Prague becomes more of a tourist destination. Can't imagine it in the spring when it is at it's peak. Must be a pickpockets dream. Still, it is very nice, with lots of fun cafes' and bars. In the early evening when all the other tourists are getting dinner it is wonderfully open and you can get some good pictures.
Go close to the hour!. That way you can see the clock in action. It is complicated to understand but the moving apostles and the crowing cockerel are neat.

Unique but Crowded In Sept. The square is unique with the highlight being the Astronomical Clock which chimes on the hour. The square is very crowded to see the clock chime. There is outside cafes and also shops.

Vibrant place. Very vibrant square. All the time there’s something going on. If it’s not the astronomical clock about to start it’s show it’s the artists in the square either singing or playing an instrument or blowing soap balloons. There are several food stands on one of the sides of the square. Lots of Segway tours begin in this square. The square is surrounded by lots of bars and restaurants. Even though Prague is quite cheap for food and drinks, prices are expensive in this area. If you don’t want to pay touristic prices just walk a few minutes away from the square and prices will drop even 50%
A must visit. Just one of the many amazing places in the city of Prague, the old buildings are just amazing and I wonder how they built them those many years ago.

Variety of building styles. A must see when visiting Prague.This is the meeting point for numerous walking tours, horse and carriage rides also offered from here. Avoid the classic cars as they are over priceds] - the local trams are a better service. Buy a 1 day pass is approx £3.00.I would recommend that you try the Hot Wine (Red) as it is not to be missed, 50c. Very flavoursome and moreish.With exception of Wine and the local donught/pretzel stalls behind the astronomical clock DO NOT buy from the ham/potato stalls as the prices they show are per g weight and they only sell portions which are at least 4 times the published prices - they DO NOT sell at the small 100g portions advertised in the prices. VERY EXPENSIVE for food in Prague as I calculated the 1 portion I bought as around £10 for 3 lumps of ham, and 2 portions of the potatoe/cabbage/bacon as approx £8. There are a number of alternative eating places where the food is good and inexpensive. All our evening meals were £20-£25 for 3 people including Beer/Wine.
Nice.... You can't leave Prague without visiting this square. I'm sure every new visit will be new experience. I'll be visiting again, that's for sure...

A must see in Prague. Magical atmosphere. Check out the music. Cafes and restaurants nearby are all expensive. Have a coffe or hot wine from the stalls to enjoy the atmosphere, but walk 5 minutes away for your dinner and less chance of paying over the odds for pretty average food.
Bustling square. Lots of entertainers and food stalls and restaurants/cafes around the square. Bustling but safe place for tourists.

Beautiful square. This is where it happens! Night or day, something is always going on here. Musicians, Magicians or a market. Everywhere you look there are so much to see and so many beatiful buildings. But look up for the restaurants close to the square, they are expansive and tourist traps!
So fun on the weekend!. The entire city comes out to share time together. It is gorgeous and full of activity. Musicians, nice restaurants, food booths, entertainment. Great people watching

Unbelievable crowds!. Everywhere we went in Prague (Old Town Square, the Castle, Charles Bridge) there were hordes of tourists, often shoulder to shoulder. We were very uneasy since we had been cautioned about pick pockets in crowded places. Prague is a lovely and interesting city but we will never go back because of the crush of other tourists.

Beautiful. The Old Town Square was beautiful and one of the highlights of Prague. Go up the tower which holds the astrological clock for a wonderful view of the whole of Prague. the trip up is reasonable at only 120crz and there is a lift if you don't want to take the stairs. A brilliant experience
Lovely Area. Very busy at times, but well worth dealing with the crowds. A lot to take in and enjoy. Not a bad idea to stop and take in some refreshments just to break up the crowd time

Wondrous Old Town Square. We kept going back to Old Town Square for the sheer joy of gazing at the architecture, the astronomical clock or for sitting at a cafe to people watch. There is a Disneyland like atmosphere but much better because it's authentic. We had the good luck to be there for Signal 2015 during which there was a light show on a beautiful building in Old Town Square.

Crowded Square. Don't rush to visit it because you will walk by if you want to try a few trip advisors recommended restaurants at that side of the town. Always crowded no matter what time of the day, adventure to the side streets right or left of the church, you will find better restaurants.
Travel back in time.. This is wonderful place. All old buildings, clock-tower, little restaurants and unfortunately crazy crowd of tourists :)

Pretty but crowded. It's hard to miss seeing the old town square on any visit to Prague, but it's also quite a frustrating affair as you battle the crowds. Almost impossible to take any pics without people getting in the way. Personally I prefer the old town squares in Riga and Tallinn as they just aren't as busy.

a must see. everything happens hereall kinds of activities going onclimb the clock toweradmire the clocktake a walking tourrelax at one of the restaurants and people watchfor better value in food and drinks move away from the squarecentral for many of the sights ie. Charles bridge, jewish quarter

A must while visiting Prague. Very cool place with street performers and other landmarks in Prague. Very popular place, as it is also a meeting place for all the walking tours. I ordered airport transfer online to pick me up at the Prague Airport - very reasonable and someone waiting for me at the airport with my name on a sign when I arrived. This included a free map and a free walking tour that started here. I highly recommend going here.

The Astronomical clock must see. This is a sensational square lots of activity and things to see and do. We enjoyed the outdoor food stalls there was something special about eating outside and the local delicacies were very tasty. Just be aware that the advertised prices are per weight not per serving so don't be surprised if your bill is more than you expected. However do enjoy the open air eating
A must see venue. Very busy square filled with tourists, buskers and vendors. It was always busy and thick with travelers.
Lots of people and lots to see!. This was on our way to most of the things we did so we saw it a few times. Very cool. Very old european
Nice place to visit. Nice place to visit with a lot thing to see and/or to have something to eat and drink. You can enjoy different styles of music and other entertainment.

Heart of the City. The clock alone is worth it....check out the faces of the people looking up at it. Wander the winding streets leading in to the Square....almost Venice-like. Lots of great shops and restaurants and cafes.
This place has it all!. So much to see here! Beautiful old buildings, restaurants and shopping, and street performers too. Its busy morning until night!

Old Town Square. Old Town Square is an amazing place. It's fun to sit and watch everyone. The Astronomical clock rings every hour and the square fills with people. It is in the middle of many sights so we found ourselves walking thru it serial times each day.
As usual. I have been to there 3years ago, I fell in love with there. This time I went there without many plans, just walk around. she is still lovely.

Super Crowded. Prague has become too commercial and the area around the square, although very beautiful, is too crowded to enjoy. We went in Sept, which is hardly peak tourist season, but the square was packed.
Old country charm. The place is full of energy. you will find mostly tourist there and good restaurants around. Lot of activities one can do like segway tours and walking tours.

Beautiful square. The buildings around the square, the clock tower in the centre, you have to see it all. Perhaps like me you will be a bit disappointed if you end up waiting with a huge crowd for the clock "show", perhaps it is one of those things where you expect too much! It can get really crowded but certainly a must visit
Great to just sit and watch. Plenty to see. Great architecture. Lots of history. I think just people watching is an experience by itself.

You'll want to be here frequently. Walking in Prague starts and ends in Old Town Square with a mug of beer and some Prague Ham. Or try the "turtle necks" - the pastry cooked over open fires covered in sugar and nuts.

Packed with history!. Every stone in this plaza is packed with history. Every building in this plaza is significant in one way or another: The cathedral, the church of Our Lady before Tyn, the Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, the monument to Jon Huss, the Praga Meridian, etc. etc. Take your time, enjoy the view, drink a beer or coffee while admiring the surroundings.

Nice square, Segway hell. The square itself is very nice, but constantly have to watch out for guys on Segways trying to sell tours ruins quite a lot of the attraction. It's a miracle that no one got run over.
Beautiful Square.. Prague has amazing architecture everywhere you look but it truly stands out here because you can be far enough away to appreciate it, not just stuck looking up from the street.
the palce to beguin the Visit. the City begins here, aonce you beguin to walk around averything is going right , you will reach al the interesting point in the city , including the main square itself

Best at Night, but Captivating during the Day!. The square is a main gathering place for tourists as well as locals. It is surrounded by places to eat/drink and some of the city's great sights - Old Town Hall, Astronomical Clock, National Gallery, the Jan Hus Memorial and the Tye Church. Arrive after dark and see the square with the eerie and magical lighting that is cast from the church and the town hall.

Lots to do and see. We seemed to have a Gravitational pull here without realising, it's a beautiful square with lots of entertainment, historical buildings and amazing architecture including the anotamical clock and clock tower, thourourly recomended climbing the tower for some awesome views over the city. There was a gallery in the square presenting an Andy Warhol exhibition with lots of art work I've never seen before.
great place. great at day time many tourist ,artist ,performers and beautiful lights during night time that makes the buioldiong highlighted.

Better at night than during the day. The cathedral lights up perfectly at night. Take a good camera. The traditional Czech sweet snack - Trdelník - can be purchased there and is good. Better than in some of the shops. Try it :)

Amazing architechure. Visited the Old Town Square many tines during our stay in Prague- People congregate on the hour to see the astronomical clock chime, plenty of places to eat or just have a drink
Definitely worth seeing

Everyone goes here and if you are new then you must too.. Its the central area where everyone goes full of shops and eateries and nice to have some pics taken.
Very lively especially at night!

Fun visit. Area is bustling with activity. Beatific sites. Street venders selling local delicacies, such as "Trdelniks", cinnamon covered dough, tasty treats. The Astrinonomical Clock and several churches nearby. Restaurants there.

Mainstay of any visit to Prague.. A wondrous and magical place where historical buildings surround the square. Filled with history from medieval to recent times. Besides history you will also find many shops and restaurants.
enchanting. enchanting square with lots of entertainment and refreshment, bit pricy though, better value in other parts of the city

Must see!. Take in the energy from the tourists gathered from many nations. See the clock tower and climb the stairs to see the view, even at night it is worth the time, however the on hour showing of the actual clock is underwhelming.

The most beautiful place in all of Prague!. The square is the most beautiful place in all of Prague!
We enjoyed sitting there in the coffe shops and restaurants, looking at all the people and the great view!
Must visit place when you travel Prague!
Great place. Love the atmosphere And the building In the middle of the square you will find street food do yourself a favors .

Tick Tock. The only free thing here is the beautiful clock which at the stroke of the hour springs to life with the figures that dance around. The square is home to top class hotels and cafes. with prices to match, and shops selling antiques, crystal glass and toys, mainy puppets. Just off the square down the narrow cobbled streets are hundreds of cafes and bars in which to dine and drink the famous PIVO, Cech lager. The Urquart is a particular favorite of mine and with the famous goulash and potatoe dumplings its a fantastic way to round off a days sightseeing
Lovely. Always a lot of things going on.. Magical to many.. make sure you wait at the clock (every hour)...Could spend about 1 hour or so here.

Lovely. Always a lot of things going on.. Magical to many.. make sure you wait at the clock (every hour)...
Could spend about 1 hour or so here.

Unbelievable!! Not sure what else to say. This place is absolutely amazing. You have everything one spot. Delicious food (both restaurant and street vendor), fun souvenir shopping, breathtaking architecture, street performers and you can't forget people watching. Home of everything from the famous astronomical clock which goes off hourly to a Hard Rock Cafe, this area really has it all.

Great restaurant under ground!. I love the history of this town. There was (not sure if still there) this great restaurant that had word "blue" on it (sorry I forgot). The walls were solid natural bedrock, tables had white table cloths and music acustics were amazing. Food was delicious, ambiance very cool! Water was running down slowly against the walls, so pretty! Candles on tables...worth your visit and don't forget to check out the clock tower!
Magical Christmas. I was there during Christmas time. Decorated so beautifully. There was a show there every night. Carolers, and more. Very magical time.
Huge open city square. Spectacular historical buildings all around, bustling place but mainly tourists! medieval clock is a must see

Prague Gem. This lively commercial square is a must do when in Prague. Shops, stores, restaurants, bakeries, etc. all around. Great people watching and a just a fun place with the Astronomical Clock another must see.

Great place to hang out. During a short city break my wife and I always seemed to come back to this part of the city. It is a good place to get your bearings, grab a quick bite to eat or just hang out and see the sites. One evening we were also lucky to catch a light and music show with video projected onto one of the buildings. Only negative is the slightly agressive Segway tour guides who seem to fly around asking if you want to have a segway tour every five seconds. Some good restaurants nearby also.
Beautiful square. Beautiful Square full of bars and restaurants and several attractions. Worth waiting to see the astronomical clock! It's full of people, so be careful with your belongings!
Crowded but nice!. It's a bit crowded as it is a main tourist attraction. However, the various architecture more than makes it up for the crowd. A definite must-go.
very nice square. even in October this square is full of tourists. Prague is full of life and you cannot decide which shop visit first

Old town Prague. The old town of Prague was a great place to visit. The historic buildings were beautiful that looked even better at night all lite up. There were plenty of shops and places to eat, no one hassled us to go and eat/drink in their bar, which was refreshing. There was plenty on offer to eat traditional or modern and the beer was delicious. The price of a meal was ok seeing as your seating in the main area to eat. Once 9pm can it became very busy with lots of people viewing the clock chiming. All in all a great place to visit and I would definitely go back .

The Tourist Centre of Prague. This is where the Astronomical clock is as well as a couple of other Old Town landmarks. Surrounded by bars and restaurants (and Thai massage parlours), it's also where you can try Old Prague Ham (smoked over a wood fire) and perhaps sign up for a Segway tour (recommended!)

The happening place to be!. So much to see and great for people watching. With the free entertainment, eating and shopping options, the Astronomical clock, stunning buildings, small lanes to explore and concerts at old St Nicholas church, what's not to like about the Old Town Square!

Vibrant place. A very vibrant place located at the heart of the old city. A lot of artists will be around to perform. U can spend a lot of time just watching them. Many cool places are located around the square.
What time is it?. Ok, I didn't travel with my watch. It's way to precious to me. Anyhow, I managed to catch the Old Town Square clock more than twice. It is a must see. Go there for sure!
Can't miss. Wonderful place with non stop activities and great location to start a day from. Just as beautiful at night
very nice place. Old town square is really beautiful, we came 3 times before with family and friends.Prag and old town is always nice and worth to come back many times.
Center of Town. this is the spot one should start their visit in Prague . All are seen and be seen, lots of adventures to catch and experience
A Lot of Fun. A lot of old buildings, a lot of restaurants, a lot of artists, a lot of music... a lot of fun from early morning to late night!
Amazing atmosphere. This is the hub of Prague. Surrounded by beautiful architecture and plenty of shops, restaurants and pubs, something for everyone. The Astronomical clock is the big tourist pull.
Old town square. Very busy tourist spot. Not the place to hang around, but worth going to see the sights. Need to be in exactly the right place to appreciate the clock.
Great location for dinner!. We ate here every night and walked through several times a day as we made our way to the various tourist sights in the area.

Very crowded - hold on to your valuables. Lots of tourists and lots of businesses/touts trying to separate the tourists from their money. There are some interesting monuments and buildings here, but you need to have done some research to understand what they are about.

Great people watching. Prague is one of my favorite cities. Old Town Square is the heart of Prague. Find yourself a table in a sidewalk cafe and watch the people gather to see the clock strike the hour. Enjoy!

A center point of sight seeing in Prague. If your here as a tourist, its basically required to come to the square and check out the astronomical clock. Its fun place to wander around, or sit and people watch all the other tourists. A few cafes on the square are a bit pricy but worth it at least once to sit and enjoy the people of the square

The historic heart of the Old Town. The historic heart, with many places to see around it and a direct road down to the St Charles Bridge and across to the Castle. Lots of bars and cafes and the side streets have many shops selling glass and other crafts

Great place to be and lots to see. This is the center of the touristic town of Prague, with street performers, the great astronomical clock and a huge town square. lots of beautiful buildings all around, a great Salvador Dali exhibition. watch the clock strike and perform very hour, take a horse and cartridge or a segway ride. plenty to see and fun to be.
Amazing. The Old Town Square is a place you must go. It's full of people of all over the world There are a lot of places to seat and appreciate a good music and this amazing place.

Beautiful, but very crowded. It is a beautiful square to walk around. The astronomical clock is located here. There are lots of cafes and shops as well as stalls on one side where you can buy street food such as Trdelnik, sausages, ham, and cabbage. There are lots of street performers to watch while you are waiting to see the clock do its thing every hour. It can get quite crowded during the day and the segways and selfie sticks can be quite annoying. This is pickpocket heaven so beware.

Historic Old Square. Prague is a beautiful city with a lot of history. This is a beautiful square, lots of activities happening all the time and lots of people. Beautiful buildings all around. The square has the town hall, astronomical clock, Tyn & St Nicolas Churches, Jan Hus Statue... A must visit place when in Prague.
Great place. It is a place where everybody go there. Lot of things around there, we went there in evening to enjoy dinners and atmosphere.
pleasant city. much prettier than I thought.. THRONGS of tourists... saw no problems with the border and migrants trying to enter

Good rendezvous point with wonderful Bohemian architecture. Its a wonderful example of Czech Architecture and a lovely European Square. It also includes the clock tower which has an interesting history to it. Its really amusing to see the number of crowds gather in front of the clock tower every hour to hear it chime and then be disappointed as there isn't very much that happens when it does.
The place to brunch . Love the atmosphere Love the design Love the building In the middle of the square you will find street food do yourself a favor and eat the old prouge hum

Beautiful. Each time we walked to the square, or through it, it was always really busy. And it's understandable because it's absolutely beautiful, could not stop taking pictures of the buildings. There's a mini row of market stalls and the crepe's smelt amazing! And there were horse and carriages there too, so cute. Only annoying thing were the people on segways, was asked about 8 times in 5 minutes of we wanted to use one.

A must do but don't spend too much time here.. Beautiful but very busy. Lots to see and do but mostly shops and places to eat. Nice evening atmosphere. Easy to access other smaller but equally lovely sized streets.

Go during day AND night. Lots going on in this classic 14th century square. Food from the tented vendors seemed a little high prices, and the various street performers are mostly very good. DO visit after dark for the great lights on the square's buildings..the square never "sleeps".

As always the center of life in Prague. We love the old clock and the vibrancy of life in the square which is the center of life in Prague. It was my fourth visit and we even found an excellent restaurant next to the square with gypsy music and great food called U Supa.
You will love it. It was raining and we still had the very best of time, it will wow you when the sun is out, a beautiful place to see
Always Interesting. Walked through Old Town Square morning, afternoon and evening. Music, fire breather, mimes to people watching. Always interesting. It is the heart of Prague.
Concert in the cathedral. Negotiate the price on one of the evening "classic, opera and organ" music. Great fun, only 70 minutes, on time and lovely.

Beuatiful town square. Most outstanding is the Tyn Church with its twin towers with their numerous steeples and sharply pointed belfries. Then all the burger houses around the square. Prague is almost unique in that it was never bombed in world war 1&2, so all these buildings are original, not rebuilt like so many other cities. The town hall is a must visit to the top for a view of the square and the surrounding area. The astronomical clock is on one side.

Wonderful Architecture. Old Town Square is a hive of activity well into the evening. The architecture is amazing - so many different styles. One of my favourite things was eating crepes and Trdelnikl, a traditional Bohemian 'cake' that is actually dough wrapped around something that looks like a rolling pin and then baked over coals and then rolled in sugar and best eaten warm. Very tasty and something you won't find in Canada for sure. There were other booths selling sausage, ham roasted on a spit and other treats too. It's a wonderful place just to be in the evening especially.

Old square, lots of restaurants. Pretty spot, lots of photo ops of the old buildings. Mostly restaurants and bars with canopies to sit under. Tried one of the bars prices are reasonable compares to other tourist hot spots.

this is where the energy is!. prague... super charming! old town square, the heart of that charm! the place is huge with cafes and bars all around and in the alleys connected to the main square... this is the place to be when in prague! always full of energy and people! in peak season, there is just too much crowd at times! but come here any time of the day and you can spend hours here hopping from one place to another and enjoy some nice entertainment acts in the centre of the square! worth a visit when in prague? hell yeah! where else would you go!!!

Clock Tower is a must view. Besides the beauty of the square, and the people, and all the entertainment going on, there are two things you should make time for. First, pay the admission fee that will take you to the observation platform at the towers top. Half the fun is getting to the top with a series of stairs, elevator rides. We did this at night and the views of Prague were breathtaking. Second, is listening in on guided tours that explain the workings of the tower clock. Then on the hour, view a quick 20 sec movement of clock tower figurines.
Great for people watching. A lovely vibrant Square, with alfresco dining and traditional stalls. Food and drink is slightly more expensive within this area but worth it for the ambiance.

Beautiful medieval square. Loved walking around the square, visiting the friendly TI office for information. Seeing the interesting medieval buildings, astronomical clock, the food stands, the horse drawn carriages. One of the days we visited, there were numerous Asian bridal couples having their photos taken.

Almost every day and never get enough.... Stunning, gorgeous, incredibly beautiful, outstanding, extraordinary, wonderful, ..... Must see, stop and stare,.... Took hundreds and hundreds of pictures of this square and will continue ;)
A must see in Prague. This place is buzzing with activity. Lots of shops, restaurants, entertainers. Be careful about pickpockets there are a lot of them in the area.

Beautiful Old Square both Day and Night. Although bustling with tourists from around the world, we enjoyed strolling the square, seeing the astronomical clock and enjoying an ice cream sundae. There's always a performance, whether busking or acrobatic. Pull up a chair at one of the many cafes and commence with the people watching.

Overated. Just because it's old, doesn't make it amazing. The clock itself is remarkable because it still works. But in itself it's not actually that interesting. The canny Czechs overcome this by staging a false wedding on the ground & have pretend heralds marching around the balcony miming to a taped fanfare. This is so entertaining, you will probably not notice that your pocket is being picked!!

great attraction. great attraction lots going on in this area, lots of little shops up of main square check them out for shopping ladies some great bargains can be got especially shoes bags and purses lol.

The heart of town. This is the true centre, here you will find some of the greatest monuments of Prague, such as the astronomical clock, the dominating spires of Saint Marys, the beautiful boulevard of Pařížská Street. If you are travelling to Prague, this is the place you don't want to miss.

Do not eat or drink here, and watch your pockets and bags!. It's a great place to walk through, see the clock do it's unmemorable thing every hour.It always amazes me why people are so enthralled by clocks which do something on the hour, every hour. Maybe they like the thrall of reliability.But I wonder how little they have to do in order to be worth waiting for. This one beats the the one in Munich by a narrow margin.Apart from that then there's the church which looks great from the outside but is deathly dull inside.As beautiful as it is then the number of tourists is overwhelming so during tourist season then walking through the square is like being in a bumper car (dodgems?) arena. And worst of all is that this place is pickpocket central, and the pickpockets are very skilled here, so watch your bags, and don't wander around with your wallet in your back pocket because it will be stolen. The bars and restaurants on the square sell decent food and beer, but for roughly three times what you would spend if you took a tram for two stops in any direction.If it's cheap to you then that's fine, but realise that you're being ripped off.Out of tourist season then it's colder but generally less crowded and the vibe is better.I pass through there a lot on my way to somewhere else and the architecture is still amazing. So that's why I give it a 4/5 rating.
Amazing place to visit. Spent several days in Prague. It was Christmas time so each of the town squares was full of life and booths. Loved it. Can't wait to go again.
Lovely. Never expected it to be like this, beautiful architecture that will impress you, just go around and enjoy...
Fascinating. Like the other squares in old town Prague they are lined with the most ornately beautiful buildings. One of the great world cities.
Great walking adventure. I really liked this area. Lots of shops and eateries. Was a fabulous evening walking around with family!

Feeling rejuvenated in Prague. Temp of 15 * c, good bright sunshine , aroma of coffee and hot wine , sweet soothing music by live street (local) musicians, smiling Prague people especially girls / women who looked stunningly beautiful..what more to ask for...had one of the best vacations in Prague !!

Lots to see and do. Large open square. Enjoyed astronomical clock. Many cafes. We opted for open wood pit roasted ham and sausage from one of many street vendors. They sell by the gram and of course try to sell you more than needed. 300 grams of ham with fresh rye bread was more than enough for two(320 Cw, about $13 US). Lots of nice shops nearby for crystal, jewelry, trinkets.
The two clocks are amazing. Probably the most beautiful clocks in the world. It was raining, cold, but still the square was overcrowded with people who stared at the clocks, even between procedures.
Great architecture. Just meander around and take in the architecture for a great day. Watch the street performers and enjoy the local cuisine in the any cafes.
Beautiful. Absolutely amazing place,full of life from morning until late in the night.Full of history and places to see around.
Tourist hangout. I would rather go to other districts and hang with the locals. This area was a bit too overcrowded for my liking.
Great Theatre & People Watching. We enjoyed our trip to the Old Town Square. So much to see--Street musicians, Statues, Monuments, Churches, the old Town Hall and lots and lots of people.

Well worth a visit. There is always something going on but particularly on the hour when the clock bursts into life!! We really enjoyed the tour of the town hall where we got to go behind the clock workings and down into the underground old town. If you dont mind heights the lift up to the top of the tower is well worth it for the views.

Stunning Square. The old town square is simply beautiful, with intricate buildings in every direction, street performers, cafe's, bars and street food. you should take your time to take in all that the square has to offer or simply sit in one of the cafes under a heater and watch the world go by!

Like from a fairytale. Old Town Square and astronomical clock this is like from a fairy tale. Beautiful buildings with significant cathedral, number of coffee shops, restaurants, and street performers. Definitely one of the best squares in the Europe.

Overrated, at most. Well, it’s one of those places in the world which has tons of people loitering around it for no spectacular reason. We must have spent five minutes tops here – it was horribly crowded, with walking and Segway tours, sidewalk cafes and restaurants, food stalls, street entertainers of all kinds, and to top it off, someone has had the brilliant idea to assemble a stage for concerts in the middle of the square – as if it weren’t chaotic enough! I suspected it was going to be disappointing based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, but hey, some things you gotta see for yourself. It was way worse than I’d imagined – it doesn’t look as close or good to the pictures on guidebooks. The architecture, if you get to appreciate it somehow due to the huge amount of visual pollution, isn’t that impressive. The side streets can be more interesting, though.

Great if you are lucky with the weather. . We was lucky with weather. A place to see more than once. There was several small shops that sold local specialties to be enjoyed.
Unlike Charles Bridge it was not overcrowded with shops.
Lovely place. Lovely place with lots of atmosphere. Entertainers to watch and food to snack on. Old clock very beautiful.
in February we could see an amazing European old music concert in Prague.. in February we could see an amazing European old music concert in Prague, just wonderfull a magical place

Walk in the evening. Skip the day - spend it somewhere else and visit Old Town (Square) in the evening and especially walk the streets.. Do not miss Charles Bridge and Prague Castle, that´s the best way to totally enjoy the atmosphere of the city. Just stay away of Vaclavske namesti - it´s not nice in the evening (not dangerous, but just not really enjoyable)

Town Square. What more can I say that hasn't been said already. Take your time observing the beautiful buildings, soak in the atmosphere and sit and have a coffee and watch (quite literally) the world go by. Watch out for pickpockets.

Heart of the action in Prague. This is the central square of Old Town Prague which is littered with people and cafes.......nice place to people watch and totally different atmosphere in the evenings......
Astronomical Clock Very Cool. Part of our tour took us through the square to see the astronomical clock when it struck the hour. Don't blink! It's cute but over very quickly.
Astronomical Clock. Interesting area.....watched the astronomical clock in the town square....packed with people....worth the wait
Prague day trip. Lovely part of Prague with some very old beautiful buildings. A complete contrast to the communist era tower blocks and monotonous grey concrete jungle.
sights for sore eyes. beautiful old architecture is everywhere you look, not just in this square, there are also lovely little farmers markets popping up all over.

Lovely place - service needs to step up. This is one of the key places to visit in Praque, with a great ambience and a feel of what one may expect when visiting Prague, surrounded by many lovely old buildings, the astronomical clock tower being one of them, and many varied shops around promoting lots of crystal and varied souvenirs.The service we experienced in a couple of places is a little less appealing, being on a "grab attention then wait" basis and though pork crackling is advertised by all when it comes soft they tell you they don't have the right ovens to make it crispy on the outside and so is disappointing after they tell you it will be. Once you have your order the restaurants tend to brush aside the fact they misled you.So definitely a lovely place to see, just be wary that the food and service may not match the pleasing surroundings.

Beautiful but sad. Lively and buzzing Square with lots of restaurants, food stalls and of course The Clock. Filled with tourists, even at night. Very sad as there are lots of beggars too, all bent over on their elbows and knees. And beware of the segways competing for space with the pedestrians.
Stunning . Just a great place to visit. None of the buildings disappoint and a vast open square where tourists watch Street entertainers. Lots of men trying to sell you Segway tours.

So much to offer. It's a great place to experience Prague with locals and visitors from all over. Many options to eat and shop. One of my favorite things was the Arquitecture and the beauty of historical buildings.

Just has to be seen. Such a beautiful square. You can barely move for tourists, some buzzing about on segways. Loads of restaurants, with outside seating as well, and unlike most tourist hotspots you can get friendly service and food and drink which won't break the bank while you watch the world go by.

Square with character and characters. Usage of this square apparently dates to the 9th century CE, but things took shape in the 14th century. Old Town Square is crawling with tourists, but like many tourist attractions there's a good reason - the historic buildings are gorgeous. Early in the morning and late in the evening the crowds thin out and you can see better. Don't miss the astronomical clock.

very old heritage. Walk from prague castle , cross charles bridge and enter into lesser town to reach old town square where old beautiful buildings on narrow stonecobbled lane , cafes , souvenir shops and church and statues are present. Tyn cathedral , powder tower ,heritage hotels, astronomical clocks etc are around old town square. Municipal building , republic square (namesti republicy) , palladium mall are just outside old town square. trams are available throughout the day till midnight.

Just love this Square. Busy, friendly, surrounded by quality restaurants, live street entertainers (specifically a local folk rock band called Gral that played upbeat Medeival Czech folk music with pipes, bagpipes lute and drum).For the first time ever, we had a go at hiring a Segway for half an hour, and it was soooooo much fun, even for a couple of pensioners like us. To be recommended. Cheap and easy to use. We travelled all around the square and environs. A brilliant way to sight see with little or no walking. After a 5 minute lesson, we were left to our own devices, though you can join in guided Segway tours.In the evening, we came back for dinner, and there was still a lot of street entertaining happening.I cannot recommen spending many hours here, even if you just want to people watch and soak up the wonderful atmosphere.

Enjoyed by night. Beautiful and overcrowded makes it quite a challenge to enjoy. Loud people pushing their way everywhere, walking little streets away from the main square seem more sensible. Amazing architecture nevertheless.
Worth fighting the crowd. Worth fighting the crowd to see. The clock is part of the Old Town Square. Come at the top of the hour to see something special
you should go. The clock is beautiful, but the show is overrated. it is very nice to sit at on of the coffee shops outside and look at it.

Great Place to People Watch. The Old Town Square is an extremely large square right smack in the middle of Old Town. You just can't miss it. There are many shops and restaurants in the square and it gets super crowded but it was a great place to people watch as the throngs of tourists traversed the square.
Watch your step. The whole old town is just interesting to walk around. Everywhere is cobble stone, so wear good shoes.
weekend away. Visited here for a weekend away with the girls. Great place but hang on to your handbags, pick pocketing is rife. we weren't victim but some people were.

Centre of Excitement. This is the place one will surely visit if you are a first time visitor to Prague. All the attractions are here. This place abounds with restaurants of all hues. Hence this is the most happening place. A number of street performers keep the spectators happy.To sum it this is the centre of excitement.Don't forget to buy the curios here if you are interested.

Best Free tour I have ever done. saw everything there was to see for free by utilizing the free tour providing by Prague Airport tour company. I had a little difficulty finding the meeting place, but it was very educational.
Experience the history- a must see. Sit and watch the day and night pass with a beer in hand, a snack and sense the history and times. A must see in Prague

world of time. the astronomical clock in the old square is a must for all who visit prague time your visit near the hour as the figures in the tower become mobile it does get a little crowded at this time as most tourists visit at this time and for those who are mobile you can climb the tower to get a birds eye view of the old squarelike most sights in prague there is a charge to enter the tower and if you get thirsty or hungry there are cafe's all around

Old Town Prague. This is where it all happens.Great restaurants, but more expensive than those just off the square. The clock on the church is the big attraction; large crowds gather for each top of the hour, stand as far back as you can for a better view; most stand too close.Keep your eye on the rooster!Close to Charles Bridge and various musical events.Rent a Segway!

Cosy and exciting place!. There were always some activities happening over there like musicians playing, some artists performing. Music, people, favourite Clocks, Cathedrals, restaurants - LIFE is there full with history.

Great for people watching. The old town center is a nice place to people watch. The architecture of the buildings is nice. Like all of old Town it's very crowded with hundreds of tourists so watch your belongings. Try the pork, kolbasa, chips on a stick, or chimney cakes from one of the vendors in the square, then sit back and watch the people.

You just have to experience it during high-season!. I guess all has been said about the architecture and the beauty of this square already and there is no way you will miss it if you go to Prague. What I can add is that this is one of the best summer evening experiences you can get: the place is literally bustling with life! Sounds, sights, lights, faces all come together to create a unique memorable experience. Starting from the teens sitting on the pavement, to the street artists and the forest of selfie sticks, that's truly a wonderful street-life experience. You might have a hard time navigating through the crowds, but in my experience they do contribute to the "wow" effect. My advice: plan at least two visits - one during the day, while the sights around the square are still open for visitors, and one in the evening.
a must see. I loved sitting in sun drinking beer watching the entertainers, lovely atmosphere and easy access to everything else from here

Good fun. The old town square is a must visit. It is surrounded by old historic buildings and very good shopping area. There are good cafes , restaurants and eating places and the Bohemian Crystal shops are around. Popular tourist area.

Off season in Prague Old Town Square. October is not normally the high season anywhere, but Prague Old Town Square still had hundreds of tourists visiting. Street artists are still playing music - trad jazz, drummers, living statues, singers, performers, well worth a few pennies given. The restaurants are all open, and unless you are a backpacker on a tight budget they are not expensive compared with other major cities like Venice where a meal / drink in the square will leave you feeling ripped off...put simply, the average holidaymaker can eat and drink anywhere in Prague without considering the cost. Steaks, Czech food, Pizzas, Roasted Hams, Fish Thai, you can get it all here and exceptional quality, even the speciality burger houses (not M, please!) are worth a visit. From the Square with the Tyn Church you can wander the backstreets to the Charles Bridge, of in the opposite direction the Palladium Shopping Centre, 5 stories of well affordable clothing, restaurants, and designer labels; or North through the Jewish Quarter (the shops have no prices on articles here, so if you need to ask the price...well just don't bother joining the Japanese tourists on their buying spree lol). North brings you to the River Vitara and the Jazz Boat / Day / Evening meal cruise, well worth it.

Very beautiful, but way too crowded. Like much of the tourist trail in Prague, the Old Town Square is rammed full of tourist (and those who prey on tourists) at all hours of the day and night. Worth seeing, but try and go early in the morning when it's not so busy. The crowd that gathers around the astronomical clock as it's due to strike the hour is particularly bad - we decided not to hand around to see this.

Perfect display of Bohemia. If you want to explain to anybody what bohemian means all you need to do is bring them to the Old Town Square of Prague (which ironically falls within the Bohemia region). This place is bustling from 8 am in the morning until late into the evening. You'll find several restaurants (almost all with alfresco and basement dining rooms), some stalls selling Prague Ham and traditional trdelnik and various acts put on by people from all over the world. The square has the astronomical clock on the city hall tower on one corner, the church of St. Nicolas on the other and the church of Tyn on the opposite end all guarding over the statue of Jan Husa. The square is also the starting point for quite a few walking tours and hence you may find yourself around here quite often.

Great place to people watch. The square is the center of old town, you can wander down all the roads that lead to the square and then come back and have a nice lunch or dinner or coffee to rest for awhile. There are numerous schlock merchants in the square and surrounding areas but you can easily avoid them. The astronomical clock is off to one side of the square, don't waste a lot of time there, it's good for a minute. If you want to book a hop on/off tour in the square you will have to walk a mile or so to get to your bus, there are better tours available in the square.

Lovely place to sit and watch. lovely old town square,very historic and a nice place to sit and enjoy,only let down by the loads of Segway things,that spoil it,plenty of trips and tours to do from here,I liked it,very nice.

Great place, lovely atmosphere, beer very expensive however!. Watching the clock is a must do in Prague, along with soaking up the atmosphere of the Square!!!We had a great few hours here, just beware of the prices, mulled wine is cheaper than in other parts of town, but beer is nearly double the price! walk 5 minutes down the road and you get the same beer for alot cheaper!

Astronomical clock not quite what we were expecting. You can tell the time not by looking at the clock, but by looking at the crowds coming to view the clock when it strikes the hour. The clock itself is amazing! The "show" of the few characters that move is underwhelming. Better is standing by the clock looking back at the crowds and watching their reactions. Our guide said that since the show has limited hours (something like 9am - 9pm), that when people come later expecting to see the show and nothing happens, that the people themselves become the show...
Crossing by. A nice and clean old center town nice thing to drink and eat and very quiwet during the day and women are just simple beautiful
Nice view from tower. My first visit to Prague, definitely do not miss the view from the tower and the hourly chiming astronomical clock.
Busy and attractive. A great spot to people-watch and check out the architecture. The old town is an expensive area for dining. Watch out for hidden costs, e.g., 100 koruna for condiments!
What the world go by. Perfect place to get a drink and something to eat and what the world go by .lots of interesting things to do .
A must visit when in Prague.. Old Town Square is a must visit when in Prague. There are numerous restaurants, museums, shops, and sites to see and spend time in.

Tourist & Segway mayhem. Tourist mayhem at most times of day - coupled with dodging Segways manned by nervous clients. Music to listen to - some of it extremely good. But for me its the architecture surrounding the square which is the main attraction.

Best Spot for Prague's Energy. This is where everything happens in Prague. I love the energy of this place. I notice that both locals and tourists hang out here. I love it especially at night when the church of Tyn is lit up. It is great to go up the tower to have an aerial view of the city, both day and in the evening. Great restaurants are all over the place. And the variety of beers that are available is simply phenomenal. Street vendors selling sausages and local brats offer the best experience of street food in Prague. Great place!

Stunning. So much to see in just one area. The architecture of the buildings is amazing. The astronomical clock is situated here. Street performers, food, drink - all available. This is a huge tourist area.
Looks like a post card. Would advise to visit early in the day 9am-ish otherwise you will get stampede on by tourists. Also must see the square at day time and night time

Must see but don't stay too long, very crowded.. Classic large square in central European city. Overflowing with large tour groups and people driving Seqways. A must see but very crowded. Mimes, musicians, and street entertainers.

First Stop in Prague. This was our first stop while in Prague. Walking the streets was very nice. All the shops, restaurants, street performers and overall feel was a great start to our short vacation. We only had 3 days in Prague before we went off to Paris, and I would have to say that we enjoyed our time in Prague more then Paris. People, location, costs, food, drink. I would recommend Prague to anyone looking for a place to travel.
Perfect place for walks. The old town square is just perfect for having a beer with friends and having a nice meal. Beautifully ornamented façades and unique Prague atmosphere.

square entertainers worth visit..clock tower nice but not as great as munich... crowds gather early for the hourly chime of the astrological clock..find seat opposite in outdoor cafe and hear crowd sigh with some disappointment..bohemian band of three very good and punch and judy baby captivating..
Allot Some Time for This. Musicians and historic buildings are plentiful. Restaurants abound and views are photogenic. Prepare to spend time here.
a city with memorable places. you have no time to think , just a little time to see . but you will never forget it . a city with memorable places .

Look at the whole picture. The old town square and its clock is worth a visit Well you'll have to go anyway if in Prague! But spend a little more time looking at the clock and you will see not only do the apoltiles move at the top of the clock the figures below shake their heads in defience of Dead who rings the bell to start the whole chiming off So most people say its a lot of nothing I enjoyed it and the whole square in general
Old town square. Great location - loads going on and restaurants goodEntertainers all around the squareGood position to explore the city

Prague (and the it's old town especially) is one of my favorite places!. Have been to Prague for at least 5 times. Never tired of this place! This town it amazing! Every time find something new! stunning architecture! Nice friendly people! All the buildings, small and cozy cafes, great restaurants, museums... You just can't not to fall in love with Prague!

Start you visit to prague here. Packed with history. There is starbucks across from the astronomy clock - the only place on the square with free bathrooms. Nice ice cream stores on the plaza. The only downside - it is PACKED with tourists.

they sell by weight. The Old Town Square is a great place to sit and people watch from one of the many bars, the street performers are good, some very good and the architecture beautiful. It's very touristy but still enjoyable, always worth a visit.To get the real info on the square etc. take one of the free walking tours, you'll get much more from your visit.Plenty of food stalls which serve some tasty stuff, but remember many items are sold by weight. So the roast ham portion (everywhere) is overly generous (obviously) - so def one portion for two. I watched one guy order for two and faced a bill 1000czk (£30) !! They barely ate half and gave the rest to the street dwellers waiting for the inevitable.

Don't Just Walk Through; Absorb. Prague's Town Square is like many others in Europe; it is bustling center of activity, beauty and disorder. That is no reason to avoid it, though. First, it is a hub, and it leads to many other features of the city you will want to visit, but it is a destination itself. We were led to the square after visiting the Tyn church, whose spires are tucked back off the square itself. It's a wonderful place to people watch so even if the restaurants are a little over-priced and tourist-oriented, sit outside for a lunch or dinner and just watch everything and everyone that circulates through the area. Of course, you have do join the crowds that watch the hour strike at the Astronomical Clock (but make sure your purse or wallet is secure; it's a favorite place for pickpockets). There are plenty of other stands with street food if you are in need of a quick bite or a Pilsner, and you can even take an over-priced carriage ride around the area. The square here reminded me of similar locations in Bruge or Brussels or Amersterdam or Venice. They are just fun to hang out in and lead to better adventures.

It's the Architecture. I found the architecture to be very interesting. Different styles blend well together. Good photo ops. It's best to get here early. Once the tour groups start arriving (around 9:30) it gets very congested.
Must see in Prague. Fun and interesting place to see and people watch. Street performers, astronomical clock, restaurants.

Interesting. Nice area to walk around and the astronomical clock was interesting to watch. Plenty of shops and restaurants but this area gets very crowded especially on the weekend. We were able to watch various street performers as well.

Better than it looks in photos. The old town square is a beautiful place. During the day is full of people, who mainly came to see the asthronomic clock.Full of stores, restaurants, cafes...You can find there a horse wagen ride if you like. you have to see it at night time, the dark atmoaphire of prague is juat amazing.

Very gothic but lovely. The buildings are very gothic,dark but beautiful. The square is very nice. There is always markets. The feel of the city is friendly. Near this big square it's a big avenue with big brands! Worth to visit there. In the square there is a clock and exactly at 12:00 it's starting to make a little show.

Worth a look. Tourist hub. Beautiful old buildings surround. highlights are the astronomical clock and sculpture. Very busy with tourists and locals and street performers. Cafes and restaurants everywhere. Worth a look!

Wonderful buildings!. Prague was bombed only once, when American fighter pilots mistook it for Dresden, so the city looks like it did a century or more ago. The Old Town Square has several buildings, the house at Stone Bell and the Rococo Kinsky Palace, that are particularly worth noticing.
Old Town Square. Fun to just walk around and see the views and street activity. Easy to just sit and people watch or enjoy the sights.
Stroll around the old town. A lovely old square, bustling at all times day and night, the is a lovely clock to see and enjoy, fabulous glass shops, and some really enjoyable restaurants

For me most beautifull. Working here in the peak summer or before the Christmas can be nightmare. Also notoriously dodgy taxi drivers spoiling the spot.The ovepriced muled wine during the Christmas brings you headache.Apart from that, Old town square is a five star seeing sight. Every bulding has a history and there is no angle, that the Old town square woudnt be photogenic. As a local, I never go in the restaurants on this square, asi it is mainly for tourists. But I visit the gallery opposit the old cityhall and sometimes here take the place great gigs and venues and Christmas markets have great atmosphere too (watch out for pickpockets).Also the views from the tower are splendid.This is one of most beautifull squares in Prague and I cant tak fond of it.Welcome to Prague!

Lively Square. This is a pretty square in "old town" Prague. It is lively with a lot of people and many musicians and other street performers playing almost all the time. It's lively until the wee hours of the morning (I can hear it from my hotel) with lots of restaurants and bars in the area.

Standing tall after all the years and "landlords". Following the streaming crowd to the Old Town Square we came out of the shadows of a side street into the open very large square with historic tall buildings not able to cast shadows on this large sprawling square. In summer shade is at a premium. Cafes use umbrellas. Sprinklers soak dancing kids to cool them offChurches are open when the staff agree to be open and not on any schedule apparently. We tried three times when expected to be open to find the church locked. The astronomic clock draws large crowds and delivers on the hour . Beware of pickpocket on the hour as the crowds get pushy . Most often the square is vehicle free but beware of the passenger train and some exempt vehicles as they chug through the crowds.
Nice and croudy. As said nice and croudy. I do not recommend to shop in this area as prices are high. There are nice performer in the evening and early night.
Must See the Old Town in Prague. A must see for all tourists, especially at night as the area is beautifully lit, with plenty of shopping and good eating places

Super touristy. Obviously visiting the Old Town Square in Prague is a must. However, once is enough, and I would recommend going at night or in the morning when there is slightly less people. Everyone is a tourist and there is people everywhere. Do not eat anywhere on the square. It is expensive and not as good.

Impressive architecture surrounds. This very touristy part of town is home to many shops and restaurants. Keep track of your belongings, as in any touristy locale pick pockets may find prey. Rather safe and friendly place to enjoy some of the beautiful architecture, take a trip up the tower for a more scenic vista.
Amazing. Beautiful place, old buildings, clean public places, nice terrance, and everywhere you look, you can see bohemia cristals!Perfect place for lovers!

The historic watch can be the best attraction.. A fantastic square full of historic building and churchs!You can immagine to live in the middle ages or dream to partecipate to an historic event!An architecture carefully mantained help the visitors to live this beautful place!Also in the winter this place can be actractive!Visit Praga please!
The Old Town Square is Charming!. We so enjoyed going to the square. On one of our walks through, a brass band was performing and they attracted an enthusiastic crowd. The architecture was stunning!
Nice evening walk. You will be pampered with tourists flocking into this area during evening and nice ambient for photo session...

A go-to stopover. Definitely a go to place in Prague since it is really a small city to visit. Great people watching center. Stay away from the tourist restaurants as there are better places to go to. Otherwise, what can I say, Prague is small. You can clearly do it in 2-3 days and this should be one of your first stops

My favourite place in Prague. The true "center" of the city. It will be crowded during day and night and offers a lot to do (historical buildings, restaurants, pubs, etc.).
I love old cities with nightlife. This square has exactly that: a lot of historical buildings and several restaurants and bars that will be crowded until late hours.

Its like any other historic City Centre. I mean its a tourist trap - not in a bad way necessarily. Its fun to walk through, people and things to see. Bad restaurants that are over-priced but you feel safe, there's energy, etc. I will say, I am very glad we did not stay anywhere close to the square let alone Old Towne. there was just too much going on and too many trinket shops. You only need to plan on going here once and it should be to see the astronomical clock.

You have to tick the boxes. Great at night, buskers, musicians, tons of tourists, food stalls and carriage rides. Watch out for kids on Segways. The famous astronomical clock is a bit of a let down but a good conversation starter.

Visit during different times. Great to visit this square more than once as things go on in the square at different times of the day. We also did this during a guided tour which was the best as they point out things that one would normally miss. I was surprised how much was pointed out to us as to all the important significant things that happened in the square over the last few hundred years.
Nice square. A must-see place in Prague. You can catch the history of Prag there and see that amazing Astronomical Clock.

Prague - Old Town Square in a wheelchair. Old Town Square was one of the first sites that greeted us as we strolled from our hotel to explore Prague with our disabled son, who was in a manual wheelchair. We were met with a row of small wooden chalets serving food and entertainers/musicians performing in the main area of the Square. The cobbled area was very busy especially when the beautiful Clock Tower was due to chime. However, a visit to Prague must include a trip to see the Clock and the Tower even has a lift!! At the top the views are well worth the effort ~ so much history and beautiful buildings. Around the Square there are many places to sit and relax with a coffee/meal and and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere.

Christmas Market. A very good Christmas Market takes place in the square every year with food stalls, Christmas decorations, and various entertainments. The square is also surrounded by a variety of very good restaurants. Enjoy the festivities!

Lots of fun!. This large square in Prague is one you can hardly miss if you're walking around Old Town, and there is so much going on in the square at all times, you won't want to miss being a part of the fun......and it always draws a crowd. There are mimes, some very good musicians, bubble blowers, food stalls and restaurants all around the square and just about anything else you can imagine to please every age. We were in Prague for 3 days, passed through the square at least once a day and loved all the entertainment. Enjoy!
Beautiful architecture everywhere you look!. The architecture is stunning, the building well kept, plenty of restaurants and cafes to choose from and street entertainment aplenty.

Historic Centre of Prague. One of the most famous place in Prague and even all over the world and it has it own historical atmosphere. There are sometimes the markets - Christmas, Easter or this place is used for special events and ocassions. If you will visit Prague, you had to visit the faboulous Old Town Square, see the Astronomical Clocks and Tyn's Church and enjoy the breath of the history :)

A quick stop. A quick stop is all you need. Everything is cleaned and shined up, the clock is disappointing and the crowds of tourists maddening. Go to other places in Prague and meet someone who actually lives there.
Crowded but worth it. Many buskers and rour group crowds, a la Prague 's Times Square. Even more impressive at dusk. Watch purse and pockets. Enjoy the architecture.
well worth a visit. old town square in Prague is well worth a visit, surrounded by beautiful old buildings it is the hub of Prague, from here you can take trips to all the interesting sights

City centre. Unless one just stays in their hotel, there is no way to miss Old Town. There is shopping, sites to see, and restaurants. The Astronomical clock is located here. A view of the square and the surrounding city can be viewed from the tower of city hall, next to the clock. I would recommend this view.

Don't miss this place!!!!. While we were in Prague we visited Old Town Square everyday! All of our adventures began and ended there because our hotel was nearby. The crowds should not deter you. Soak it up... and enjoy the beauty, the authentic historic areas and the young and old people taking pictures, chatting, and enjoying the atmosphere. Every corner of the squre is relevant. When you visit try to see something new to you!

Good Street Food. Instead of going to a restaurant, we ate from the food stands on the square several times. Excellent food, especially the Prague Ham, the chicken kabob and the spiral "potato chip" on a stick. There are lots of park benches to sit on, but watch for the pigeons and a few beggars. My wife made a ham sandwich for one of the beggars, but he already looked well fed to me.
Old Square. We loved the old town square really buzzing plenty to see and do. Visited lots of places while we where there .

Lovely town square, but beware tourist trap. The old town square in Prague is beautiful, well maintained and appears safe at all times. The foot traffic through here is huge so beware of wallets and cameras as you would in any large crowd. Check the great shops and cafes but beware this is a tourist trap and the cafe prices are double or triple what you will find even a block away.
Worth the visit. If you have time , then take your time and visit, lots to see and do ..Watch the astronomical clock or just sit at cafe and watch the crowds go by
Wonderful... . Prague in general is lovely and definatly worth a wander around for a couple of days! Lots of history and wonderful architecture...
Must see. This is a must see for anyone visiting Prague. The astronomical clock is worth seeing, specially on the hour when it chimes. You can also go up the tower to look over the city.

Do not miss it. Praha is a beautiful city, that has so many interesting places to show. I was twice in the last 4 years and I would like to go again. I think a must experience is to stroll on Karluv Most in the evening, to listen to the wonderful tunes played on accordion, to watch the people, the lights on the shore. And afterwards to go to the Staromestske Namesti with friends, to eat some Czech sausages with a glass of beer and to listen to another well-played music.
amazing atmosphere. stunning and you must see the clock! lots of street entertainers. Everyone was so friendly....... a must.. great shops, great food and great people.
Lovely place for Sunday walk!. Lovely place for Sunday walk! Unfortunately, it's very crowded during weekends and holidays, but still worth to spend some time

A bustling town square surrounded by stunning old buildings. I really enjoyed the old town square for its ambience the fact that you can sit and eat and drink outside all year round in the little heated bars and cafe's while watching the medieval astronomical clock chime every hour which draws in hundreds of tourists. The whole place is charming even the street entertainers were cool and somewhat disturbing (Man dress as baby in push chair)
Shouldn't miss!. I loved the site seeing, tours offered, waiting for the astronomical clock to ring and the apostles to parade, the choices of restaurants were large.

Beautiful place. Busy square with lots of places to eat, drink, shop, watch street performers, admire the buildings, jump on one of the touristy car trips, horse rides or one of those annoying segway tours.

Old Town Square Prague. We visited the old square many times as the atmosphere is always great and there is lots to see and do. We went in the daytime and at night, the street artists were great to watch and the buildings are lovely.The little narrow streets leading off the square are really great to walk down and so many shops. There are lots of places for food and drinks, great just to sit and watch the world go by very relaxing. It is lovely to visit at night as the square takes on a magical feeling with all the buildings lit up.

Charming. This place is breath taking during the day and in the evening. Can be very crowded. We watched the astronomical clock which wasn't much of a show but the clock is amazing and we did walk into St. Nicholas Church which is beautiful..
The center of activity. This is the place to start your old town walkabout. Here the church and the All-City open older streets to you. The statues in the center are incredible. A must see

If you are in Prague - do NOT miss the Old Town Square. Do not miss this if you are in Prague! The anatomical clock is neat. The statues do not move though until it starts to strike at 9am. The El Toro Negro is a great restaurant and has a lot of seating (covered) outside. There is also good food at the open pit During the day there may be a magician or bubble blower and at night wonderful musicians are in the square. This is the perfect spot to grab a beer and people watch to just take in the atmosphere. Horse drawn carriages are available and if you want to go to the top of the clock tower, do it between a quarter to the hour and the hour as most people will be crowded out front to watch the statues and this will give you more room to maneuver around the narrow area at the top of the tower. All ages will enjoy the square and there is a lot of great shopping within walking distance.

Beautiful Buildings and Sights. Old Town Square is a happening place, always a crowd and always some performing to the crowd. While this is nice and fun the real reason to visit Old Town Square is to view the magnificent building that you see in every direction.Look one way and see St Vitus Cathedral, another way and see Prague Astronomical Clock and Watch Tower. Just an amazing place.Prague has a distinct advantage over many European cities. It was occupied during World War 2 but not bombed. This allows all the beautiful buildings to show their best. Old Town Square is one excellent example of this.There are cafes and restaurants directly in Old Town Square. They are overpriced and mediocre. Do some homework and walk a block or two for a better experience.Lastly, as in all major cities around the world, be aware of pickpockets. Don't be an easy target.
Great Night spot. Spent 3 enjoyable evenings have dinner and drinks at the various outdoor cafes along this beautiful square . Often music was being played and great place to people watch

brilliant and Enjoyable. An excellent experience to get a feel of Czech life, from the old buildings to the markets to the historical clock, which in itself is a mind blowing experience just looking and watching it.
Historical and Timeless. I really recommend walking around this place. It has a lot of beauty, timelessness and just a certain amount warmth that makes this place worthy of revisiting.

Best preserved old buildings. Fortunately for us, but not for many people at the time, Hitler marched into Czechoslovakia and thus did not bomb Praha. The beautiful buildings are still intact and Staromesto Namesti is one of the best parts of any European capital. Don't die without seeing it.

Beautiful Old Town Square. Fabulous spot! Be sure to look attentively at all the facades. They vary a lot, having been built at different periods in history. Also, try to go early in the morning, to avoid the crowds!

Heart of the city. Even though it is crowded most of the time, the square is an inspiring place to be. You can just take a seat somewhere or have dinner and drinks next to the old astronomical clock. Not to miss the Prague meridian line marked across the square.

It's just fun to the nth degree!. When the weather is nice, the square is filled with clowns, music, shops, and people having a ball--with lots of interesting architecture all around. It is hard to leave....

Beautiful!. A lively beautiful square crowded with tourist & locals. The square is framed by old beautiful buildings with many different types of restaurants & shops. Good place to dine and people watch or see a performance.

Must visit at night!. Even if for a short while, one must visit old town square at night - it has a buzz around it. You can see the astronomical clock (it announces every hour with 12 apostles passing by the window above the dial), the lit up church in the background, watch the pop up artists (music or magic) or horse carriages. Park yourself at any of the numerous cafes or just sit there and absorb the place. When in a mood, you can go shopping in the stores on the way to Charles bridge mostly for souvenirs.
What a sight. This is an amazing place to be. The clock is a stand at look at all day feature. Lots of eateries and watering holes. Very crowded though.
Relaxing on the square. Find a nice restaurant on the square and you could get lost in watching the world go by, listing to music and just relax with good food.

Beautiful both day and night. Spent some time discovering the shopping charms of the square. The restaurants were great. Just to sit outside and crowd watch whilst having a drink and some food was fantastic. Loved it. The lighting at night was brilliant. Don't miss it

Really interesting. We visited Prague during the week. Must admit it was an interesting visit. The old town was good, the bridge had lots of craft stalls and musicians. The old town had the clock. Lots tourists.

A must see in Prague. Early morning or late at night, Old Town Square is always a great place to be in Prague. There are restaurants to enjoy people watching from, street entertainment, astronomical clock, amazing architecture etc. There's something for everyone! Warning...the square gets very busy. If you prefer the square at a quieter time, go early in the morning before the crowds start arriving. 8am to 9.30am is ideal! Enjoy

Fairytale - Lady before Tyn spires. The town square is lovely but at night it lacks a certain magic. It would be lovely if it was well lit at night. You can pick up some tours - ie segway, horse carriage, mini bus, peddal bikes.There are many churches nearby and also worth stopping by - Old Town Hall & the Astronomical Clock which has a very short display every hour.

Never gets boring. Every time I come to Prague I come here and am in total awe of the beauty of this square. Depending on what time of the day you come, the scene changes - whether its crowds of tourists rushing through in the day or the quiet of the square late in the evening with the building glowing in the dark, you will love the square no matter what. Try to sit somewhere and enjoy the view.

Brilliant attraction and fun atmosphere. Loved the old town square with its quaint huts and shops and there is a light hearted atmosphere and you always feel welcome and safe there. Hope to go back to Prague- highly recommended.

A lot to see. The old town square is a must visit. there is the astronomical Clock. the old lady church, and a lot of street entertainers. in the night you can go enjoy at local shops. they have a bazaar in the morning in which you can buy some things. Great place to visit.

Great social area,. Lots of street artists frequent the square, and lots of restaurants around with plenty to choose from, safly not a lot of Czech food, the resturants tend to cater to the tourists. But a good selection. Slightly more pricy than other ereas. The architecture. Is fabulous. All around the square and there is a monument jn the midle of the square, wich is allways filled with people having a rest.

A wonderful bohemian venture. The history of this prague old town stands for all to see, from its multiple decorated and ornate buildnings, national statues and a sense of pride from the folk within. Plenty of chances to visit tthe area, from the ride around the square via very nice horse and carriage or a mdern side via Segway tours. There are always entertainers from human statues to bohemian bands and resturants galore serving good quality food and local beer.Well recommended.
very noisy, busy place. Very crowded and filled with a lot of noisy activity. We never spent time there, only used it as landmark getting from A to B. Astronomical clock is okay.

A tourist Mecca, but not to be missed. If you go to this beautiful old square early in the morning, you will enjoy its beauty. If you go at night, you'll enjoy the vibe and its electricity. First of all, the buildings are gorgeous. But, secondly, in the evening, it's just plain exciting. When we were there, on our way back from dinner, an American with his guitar broke out singing the Beatles' hits, and there was a huge crowd around him all singing along. Drop some money in his case, or not, it was still fun to sing along.

So much to see.. The horse carriage tours start fro9m here and there are always musicians and other street entertainers to keep you amused. you can have a leisurely lunch or dinner in one of the many cafes and restaurants in the square or just watch the passing show for free from the plentiful public seating.
