Amazing historical square!. I loved this square! It is packed with people and always busy. There are tourists everywhere, but it’s a great vibe. There are great entertainers, lots of choices for food and drinks, and it’s def worth checking out the Old Town Hall, the Astronomical Clock, and the Church of our Lady before Tyn.

GREAT Place to See the Sights. This is one of the most beautiful city squares in Europe. We enjoyed seeing the baroque architecture and the many churches. Be sure to see the Town Hall with the Medieval Astrological Clock. ALL of this for FREE..... There are many, many small restaurants and pubs - sit down and have a beer.

All the sites and great people watching.. When visiting Prague, you have to visit Old Town Square. Many of the attractions you want to see are located here. If seeing the site, try to go during the less busy time - early morning or late afternoon. If you want to grab a drink (but not dinner) - come when it is busier as there is great people watching.
Heart of Prague. Vibrant square, great architecture, street entertainers, restaurants. Definitely not to be missed. We eat at a restaurant just off the square, good value, good food.

Very Beautiful!. Old Town Square is really beautiful! After going in all the sites in Old Town, we just sat in the square and had wine while watching the people go about their business whether they were locals or visitors. Interesting! Watching the Astronomical Clock was also interesting and seeing the looks on people's faces the first time they see it. Priceless! Take your time while you are here and take in all the sites, smells, atmosphere, and people. You will be glad you did!
Tourist attraction. Lots of tourits and restaurants (eat somewhere else) but also jazz music. Beatiful buildings, but not easy to enjoy due to the many people.

A Must do whilst in Prague. Such an amazing place to visit - feels very typically eastern European with the architecture etc. Plenty of places to eat and sit and watch the world go by, or the astronomy clock strike on the hour. I've been twice , in Feb and in September - and they are well set up for all seasons, in Feb with outdoor heaters and blankets and Gluwein, in summer lots more tables spread out, ice cream and street entertainment.
Enjoy the sites. Great restaurants and great area to just sit and have a drink and people watch. Old Town feel and very inviting.
Magic square. Visit it during daytime but especially at night and at the exact time (at 20.00 or 21.00 or 22.00 etc to experience the strike of the clock

Beautiful square. A large square surrounded by food and shopping. The building architecture is beautiful and of course the astronomical clock is there just off the square. Not much happens when the hour is struck but the crowd gathers for the event

Meet the world in the square . Everyone visiting Prague goes and walking around it is a good reference point.Plenty of crazy street theatre to keep you amused.Pity about those stupid segways going around all the time for no reason glad they are thinking of stopping them on pedestrian areas.
Fairy Tale place. Very, very beautiful place. Get your camera ready. Perfect to take gorgeus pictures IF you wake up early, otherwise prepared yourself to be pushed and surrounded by the crowd.

A great European city square. Not quite as over the top as other central city squares such as in Brussels for example but really nice none the less. The central statue of Jon Hus dominates the square with all the other interesting buildings around it. All paths, roads and side roads come to it and so you can never get lost. An interesting place to see interesting people.
Church is blocked from view. The square is nice but they've built a row of buildings (shops/restaurants etc.) in front of the church which blocks the front of it from the square- knock them down!
History, Great Architecture and Good Food. Everywhere you look you will an architectural wonder. Do not miss the clock tower and make sure the many concerts in the various churches and monasteries.
Come over and see!. Definitely a historic old town square - pretty much like all the town squares across Europe! But each has it own cobble marks and beautiful history! :)

Fantastic architecture, overpriced views in Restaurants. One of the best places in Prague to shake hands with the divine spirit and architecture. Not for agoraphobics - huge crowds. Lots of pubs and restaurants. Mind that being seated with view to the square usually comes at surcharge, which might be 50% on the regular prices.

Nice and typical. Nice square typical of most European squares of its typea must to visit but do go to it just pass through it as you visit Praguevery busy at night with restaurants and street artists

The place to be!!. It felt surreal being here. Apart from Charles Bridge, this place is what makes Prague Prague. It is a place where you could just sit on a bench for an hour and observe people and their activities. With food vendors and street performers all over, there is always something happening and interesting to see. Plenty of attractions in this area, among others the Astronomical clock, Tyn church and St Nicholas church. Take your time and immerse yourself here in a typical laid back Prague atmosphere.
People watching extraveganza. Crowded, but great fun. The perfect place to people-watch. Don't eat on the square. Make a reservation at Casserol, or find a little place on a side street.

Most Crowded place in Prague.......... The most crowded place being visited by every tourists coming to Prague. A happening place with numbers of eating joints, souvenir shops, currency converters & branded showrooms nearby. Walking Tours, Rickshaw , Horse cart & sightseeing tours start from here. Historic Astronomical Cloak is also located here which attracts tourists all over world. You can also go up the cloak tower but with lift only to have a bird view of the Prague City. Amazing 360 degree view of Prague City from top of the tower fascinate you & you can click excellent photos of the Prague City from top. However there is a ticket to go up the tower.
Beautiful square in a picturesque city. We started one of our free walking tours not so far from this square. The guide gave a great explanation about the clock and the whole square.

Go to the top of the tower for unparalleled views of Old Town Prague!. A beautiful central hub of old Prague -- be sure to get tickets to go to the top of the tower (that houses the astronomical clock) for some spectacular views and photo opportunities (no worries-there's an elevator).

Old Town Square. It is a pretty good size square.
In it was Rest, The clock is in there, horse and carriage rides.
It is crowded but manageable

Wonderful ambience. Once again a great place to spend an entire evening. Full of street entertainers which is such a European thing. Plenty of joints to eat across all budget levels spread all over the square.

Charming and crowded, with excellent panormic view from the city-hall tower.. Very charming old-town suare, with impressive builngs surrounding it, amonng which Tyn Church and the old town hall, with an interesting astronomical clock, attracting many tourists with a show every hour..Throughout our visit - the suare was crowded and several street shows took place, while visitors watching them from one of the many restaurants or coffee houses surrounding the square.We were especially impressed by the panoramic view from the city hall tower (an elevator took us up, for a reasonable fee).
great vibe. with tourists from all over the world and different backgrounds and price points there is something for everyone here.
An experience no to be missed. Benn many times but still never enough. There is always something going on and the buildings are superb.
It's so beautiful. You cannot go to Prague without visiting the square. Take you time, see the clock, go in the churches, visit the shops and have a coffee. Fantastic
A Live. Busy all day and lots of cafes to people watch, most of the time there is live acts in the square and off courses the famous clock
Don't miss specially our lady church at night, it looks like a Disney castle.. Always crowd but always nice to visit and stroll around the old town. Magic at night because of the lighting.
We love Prague!. MUST see this area, especially at night when it is well lit. Looks like Disney World at times. Easy walking to many shops, restaurants. Be sure to eat at an outdoor cafe.

Beatiful!. Absolutely beautiful but extremely crowded. Mind that I was there just after Christmas and the Christmas markets were still running. Prague, in my opinion, is one of the most architecturally beautiful cities in Europe and this square is a highlight!

Architecture. While I have seen a few town squares on my travels this is one of the most impressive. It was very busy with crowds and people on Seg-ways trying to get you on tours. The architecture is very impressive but the king of the show is the Astro clock. There are a lot of restaurants on the square but we didn't eat in any so don't know if they're reasonable priced.
Lovely. Charming place as a central piece the clock where u can wait to watch it turn. Go up the lift to have a panoramic view of prague.vibrant with colors and architecture.

Must visit in Prague. Beautiful venue with the Old Town Hall (the astrological clock), The Church of the Lady of the Tyn, Ungelt and so on. Beware of all the vendors (E.g. Segway in daytime, night- and strip clubs in the evening). Restaurants galore, but check out ratings on Tripadvisor first. Some are downright bad.
breakaway. Just very beautiful. people everywhere and food, entertainment and delights here. busy day and night. brilliant place
Old Town square. Be at Old Town square on the hour to watch the clock tower. Lovely to watch. Many crowds.Be careful of bureau de change at Old Town square, very bad rates.
Best place to visit in Europe!!. We have been to Prague 3 times and Old Town Square is the place to go. It is the highlight of the city and also our favorite place to visit in Europe!
Good Vibe. Great Vibe.. History all around.. Full of tourists... Good place to spend an afternoon, have a coffee, or eat at the surrounding restaurants...

Beautiful epicenter of Prague. One of my favorite locations in Prague. Free, easily accessible, and charming. Use the square as a launching pad for your time in Prague. It's conveniently located near many main attractions (astronomical clock, Charles Bridge, museums, etc.) and offers plenty of food options- although I'd recommend going a block or two off the square for less expensive and more authentic food.

Best at night. The church and clock tower are dramatically lit at night, and the effect is amazing. The entire area is full of fabulous historic buildings with beautiful, intricate facades. The cheesy street performers in the main square were a distraction, but the views were well worth it.

The crowds are ok!. Probably the biggest gathering place in Prague is Old Town Square. It is all centered around the cathedral, where people line up hourly to watch the clock put on it's show of marching saints. The area is abound with street performers, who truly add to the experience. You can dine at any number of restaurants (they are all kinda the same, but all good), or at one of the many stalls behind the church. The streets radiate out from the square leading you on to other adventures ones you had your fill, but you may just wanna stay a while. Hopping from restaurant, to bar, to cafe could occupy an afternoon. There are also numerous Thai massage places, that are reasonably priced and quite effective and rubbing away your weariness from travel.

A Lively Square. Very busy square with lots to see. The surrounding buildings are awesome and there is enough hustle and bustle that something is bound to catch your eye. Sit and listen to the music from random musicians or watch a busker ply his trade.

A great spectacle . I agree with the other commentators. The square is beautifully laid out - surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafes and beautiful historic buildings. I stayed in the old part of Prague just off the square for five days. I was continually drawn to it and the streets of it. The prices are higher than the areas just off the square, so I tended to walk down some of the side streets and was never disappointed in finding somewhere peasant to sit and eat and drink for as long as I liked.

Three ring circus. The epi- center of the old town has street entertainers, jugglers, singers, snake handlers, bull whips. But the astronomical click is here, many goid food choices are here, much shopping and getting almost snywhere passes you through the center

Busy busy. Nice square but extremely packed. lots of people offering segway tours and herds of tourists with walking guides. Not somewhere Id like to hang out. the streets around there are nice too and offer better value for food/drink. Architecture was beautiful.
Best seen from above !. A must see on any trip to Prague, it naturally gets very busy. The best view is from the top of the old Town Hall
WOW!!!. wow, nice place, nice building, exciting architecture, i really loved it i visited this place 4 times in different times of a day, different vies in day and night

Must see. Without doubt the whole area is just amazing. It is the reason for visiting Prague a must see. It is amazing everywhere you look there is a fascinating building to see and the atmosphere in the square is electric. Don't miss it! Can be very busy.

totally loved it. a most beautiful place,the lovely buildings,all different live entertainers night and day, i especially loved the musical act called Bohemiem Bards, should not be missed. Watch out for pickpockets in the crowds though, but same in any tourist attraction sad to say.

nice view for less. If you want to have a good few over the Square without paying for drinks, chose the Mattoni. You can sit there, they ignore you as good as they can and if you ask them for beeing served, they will let you know, they are busy. :-(
Awesome. I have been here twice, once with my now wife and once on my stag do. Both times I absolutely loved it. Their is always something happening here and the architecture is just stunning.

Still Spectacular - Improved from Years Ago. My wife and I first visited Prague and its Old Town Square in 1998, not too many years after the fall of the Iron Curtain. We remembered the square as very beautiful with its old buildings. We recently returned with several good friends. It had changed, but was still very impressive. Many of the buildings have been restored and are painted much brighter. At night it is also lit much better and the sights are different, but no less impressive than in the daylight. Another big difference is that now, some 17 years later, Prague has been "discovered" and is a major tourist destination. The crowds were HUGE - both in the daytime and at night. Its still well worth seeing, however.

Very lively and entertaining square. Old Town Square is a very lively and entertaining place. One can spend hours listening to the music played or to the singers or the bubbles plopped or the street (dressed-up) statues or watching the most interesting Astronomical Clock every hour. Overall Prague is a very beautiful city one can never get bored of. It was my second visit.
One of the best squares in Europe. Great experience, medieval scenery, really worth walking on it again and again in the morning afternoon and night! Magnificent architecture, a must!
Amazing Views. This is where the astrological clock is and the center of everything!! Beware of pickpockets in this area.

Fascinating place much to see - would suggest eating elsewhere as food here is only ok and expensive. Great, bustling, square, clock strikes with figures every hour, fascinating array of people, musicians, entertainers, expensive food that is only ok - would suggest eating elsewhere
Daily nice changing setup and huge crowd. Very nice and and interesting crowded square full of tourist restaurants, amateurs shows and more...
Happy place. Astronomical Clock, Church of Our Lady before Tyn, Old Town Hall... and lots and lots of tourists... this is perfect.

Good shows and Restaurants.. Walking distance from many hotels.Good shows.Good restaurants around the square.You can walk all the adjacent streets and alleys if you like shopping.The main shopping street is just few blocks away.
Make sure to go day and night.. You're in the center of it all when in Old Town Square. Make sure to go during the day AND at night.

Old Town Square. Try to walk around early in the day to really get to see it before the crowds start to arrive. Of the course the Astronomical clock is a must for everyone and the crowds can really get thick. Lots of tourists and so many little tourist shops. The Segway tour people are fairly aggressive in rounding up business.

A must see. A must see in Prague. Very crowded. I recommend eating away from the square for better prices. I did enjoy some of the street performers. Didn't take a carriage ride, but that looked romantic.

Fairy Tale Architecture. Prague City Centre is one of the most imaginatively preserved medieval cities. Cobbled streets, churches and towers topped with unusual spires make this a truly unique experience. Walkable and explorable (many side streets and inner courtyards add to the fun. Lots of restaurants ranging from casual to more upscale.

THE place to be in!. Beautiful place to be in. Many shops, food and attractions. Stay in a hotel near this place and you will have a wonderful vacation. The candy shop nearby is also very recommended especially for children but adults too.
Great town square. Very attractive square with plenty of things to do around the outside and down the streets/alleys that lead from the square.

An excellent of the type. European capitals often have central squares and Prague is an excellent example. So we have people , cafe society but plenty of space which in the best weather gives a great strolling experience.The buildings are grand and varied adding to the atmosphere.

Beautiful place but very very busy . This place is absolutely beautiful you could spend hours staring at all the buildings and their detail. The clock didn't blow me away as I thought it would but lovely all the same. The food and drink is very over prices here and there is no need to eat or drink when there is cheaper better food and drink elsewhere in prague

Worth a visit. Lovely both in the day time and evening. Great for people watching, eating and drinking. The famous clock is ok but nothing spectacular! The buildings surrounding it are very picturesque

Old Town Square is definitely a great starting point to your Prague visit!. Great vibe in the square! Great views of all the buildings, close to the astronomical clock, watch all the street performers, catch a horse-drawn carriage or a vintage car for a city tour, great eats all around. Old Town Square is definitely a great starting point to your Prague visit!

All of Prague is wonderful. Although full to overflowing with tourists the centre of the old city of Prague is still a magical place! Go a few metres off the square and you'll find some very good value eateries. Take a tour of the undergound parts of the old city and you'll be amazed!
Wow. Stunning websites. Historically interesting. Stellar in terms of architecture. You should take a local guide.

A must do, but go before the crowds get there.. Great place to take pictures and get a feel for Old Prague. Iy gets very crowded with tourist, Segway tour vendors, buskers etc. I got up at 6:30 one morning and did a complete walk around the old town and it was much more enjoyable. My advice, beat the crowds, go early.

A good meeting place to start an evening. Since the early 90's I have been coming to Praha regularly for business. For several years I had an office on the corner of Celetna and the main old town square. A very central, must see part of town. Interesting on its own right for the ad lib street performers the unique combination of architecture facing each different direction. And the hidden church which the two spires oversee it all. It makes for a good starting off point for your journey, regardless of which direction you go there are new and interesting things to see. Down Celetna street to the powder tower and you are at the theater and across the street from the Palladium modern shopping mall. One street over Doulha, is you best direction for variety and quality of restaurants. Pariska will take you straight into the Jewish quarter for fine shopping and possibly a visit to the old Jewish cemetary. Follow Staromestke , left from the clock for the scenic route to the Charles bridge and possibly continue on the the Prague Castle, after a stop along the way at one of the many cafes along the route. All other streets and alley ways will eventually get you back to vaklvske namestiOne word of caution, when the change of the hour is near the area in front of the clock will be completely congested. Just stay aware that now every one is there to see the clock and once in a while a few are there to watch how well you watch and photo the clock and not watch you pockets and belongings. If you want your own video of the clock in action, go around 8-9 am and have the place nearly to yourself. Be kind and reward the street entertainers if you are going to stand there and take in their show. Some are very good.

Good to see but don't eat here, it's expensive. Great for crowds, food and architecture, the restaurants are expensive round here though. The clock tower is interesting but not worth the wait if you want to see it chime.

Can be crowded, but and excellent starting point. The square is the heart of the old town, lots to see, but lots of people too. The 2 churches are outstanding. The astromical clock is interesting to look at but the hour strike us disappointing. I would not waste my time. Don't eat or drink their as the prices are 3 times as high as anywhere else.

Beautiful town square. This is a beautiful, wide-open town square. Don't miss out on the Jan Hus monumental statue which is sited smack in the middle of the square. Watch out for tourists gallivanting Segways, which are present in plenty on the square.

A Must See. This is truly beautiful and amazing. Don't miss it as the sun is setting and evening begins! it glows beautifully and the buzz begins to liven. Enjoy strolling through at the top of the hour to watch the clock strike.

Must do. Lovely architecture and historical sites in the vicinity. Also a number of restaurants around the square at which to relax with a cold one. A number of interesting places and shops to visit around the square.
Full of pavement cafe's. the whole of the experience with street entertainer and market stalls as the Sq is used for many events over the year

Recommendations at day and night. During the day:- watch the clock at the astronomical tower- start a segway tour in your language- get a massage (see online-specials)At night:- enjoy the street performersBoth day & night:- eat & drink surrounded by a great view (at night light up)- climb the astronomical tower for an even better view- relax on one of the benches by the statue or somewhere else

Lovely place. Visited Prague March 2011. Really enjoyed walking around. Lots of stalls to make purchases from. Food stalls were delicious. Atmosphere was brilliant. People were very friendly. Really enjoyed our visit
wow!. it was sooooo amazing.. just like a town out of a disney movie. the weather was just perfect too.. i'll definitely be back soon!

One of the best squares in Europe !. The architecture on the Old Town Square is absolutely fantastic!
It is always busy and there is lots happening but try to go down early around sunrise when the square is empty. Truly wonderful !
Beware the Chequepoint exchange on a corner near the clock tower. It is legal theft !

This is where it's happening. The Old Town Square is the center of Prague. The Medieval through the Art Nouveau building surrounding the square are amazing and beautiful. Yes, the Medieval Clock is the center attraction and not to be missed but look around at the other buildings; the Medieval painted building just to the left of the clock to the Art Nouveau building with their statuary and painted facades across the Square. And the churches on either side. The square is packed with people; tourists, performers, touts of all kinds. There also a number restaurants around the square.This is where your tour of Prague starts!

Wonderful old town center . Must do in Prague! Beautiful old town center. Take a look at the astronomical clock and try the ham sandwich from the street vendors for a good quick lunch! Can get very crowded here however so pay attention to your valuables.

Great during the day, sleazy at night. Old Town Square was really vibrant and dynamic during the day. The Clock Tower was a major attraction. We enjoyed our day visit so much we went back for dinner at night but left early after a terrible experience at El Torro Negro cafe. In addition we found the square became more 'sleazy' aided in a big way by the sheer weight of the cigarette smoke which pervaded the whole square. In addition, expect to pay top prices here - esp at night and don't expect the service to be anything more then acceptable.

Terrific place. The square is a fantastic meeting point for architecture and people. You'll get a stiff neck gazing up at the fantastic facades and spires. The " astronomical clock" is amazing and ingenious for 1490 technology! It's activity on the hour is totally underwhelming but special none the less. Great buskers and great for people watching. Well worth a visit but, as always, watch your pockets!

Must see in Prague. We visited Old Town Square a few times during our 3 days in Prague. The vendors in the square offer a great variety of foods to eat and items to purchase. If you do not want to patronize the vendors, the square is located on a street with restaurants and stores in which to shop. I highly recommend this area when visiting Prague.

Great view. The view there is great. It's one of the top attractions in t he city. I highly recommend also climbing the astronomical clock tower. The birds-eye view from up there is awesome. Also it could give you a good ideea of where you are and get you better oriented.

Unmissable!. This is a fantastic way to experience the atmosphere of Prague. The astronomical clock attracts big crowds every hour so if you arrive early people push in front of you - it's better to get there a few minutes before the hour and get the best view. For about £3 you can go up the tower to great views of the city and of the other impressive buildings on the square. In the square itself there's a range of free entertainment including Bohemian music and there's also Segway hire as well as a number of restaurants. Prices in these restaurants are a bit higher than elsewhere nut not too bad as Prague is definitely not an expensive place to eat and/or drink.

Prague Old Town. A must see....all the old world charm with plenty of opportunities to try the local street food for a reasonable price. Plenty of local talent performing for free in the square. Truly remarkable experience.

impressive in size and architecture. Most of the restaurants and shops are actually off on the side streets, the square itself could use some benches or low concrete walls upon which to sit. There were some fascinating food vendors, but only stand-up tables, one or two tables in park behind.Most interesting, the church of Our Lady of Tyn is so nestled in, that you have to go through a restaurant to get to it. We did have a great 2-hour lunch there, chatting with Japanese businessmen and a Canadian mother and daughter. No one rushed us.
Loud and lively. Lively and loud with plenty of street entertainers, cafes and shops. The Old Town Hall and the tower are worth a visit.

Spend an Afternoon People Watching. You spend your whole time walking around the square with wide eyes and your head on a swivel because there are so many things to see. It is almost like stepping back in time with all the old buildings! Great restaurants in the area too!
Nice!Nice!NIce!Nice! Thank you. Thank you. Was nice and food was really yummy. NIce! And big Thanky you to the Ametyst Hotel staff. NIce

Play "dodge the Segway"!. Interesting old square overlooked by the very impressive Astronomic Clock. The crowds in the square are quite immense during late morning and the afternoon and dwindle in the mid evening. One many buildings there are mural decorations including a glorious image of St Wenceslas. Many restaurants surround the square (many charge a premium of 15% for dining "al fresco"). "Takeaway" stalls on one side sell local delicacies including Old Prague Ham, Sausages and sweet items. The high speed Sedgways (ride by folk trying to tempt you to ride on one) are a decided health hazard for pedestrians (especially if they have mobility problems). Street entertainment is good at night. BEWARE pickpockets at peak times - and they seem to work in pairs.

The heart of Old Town Prague. You can't go to Prague and miss this area. This is the heart of Old Town Prague. There are a ton of shops and restaurants here. Every time we walked through the square, there was always some type of street musician or group playing. There is always activity going on here. This is a must on your list.
Stare Mes. This is beautiful as is everything in Prague.you walk miles to see the beauty of old.there are many she's along the way to by beautiful garnets or Czech cut glasses made inC.R..

One of the musts. Old Town Square cant be missed on your Prague visit. It is usually very overcrowded - just come here early in the morning and you will see it own magic. Also in the streets around y will find many nice non touristic cafes and restaurants.

Tower good - clock not so!. The astronomical clock was a little bit of a disappointment when it came to the chiming; nice to see though. A climb of the old town hall tower is well worth it for the views.

Old Town Square. This was an easy walk from our hotel. We went here several times to see famous landmarks like the Church of Our Lady before Tyn and the Astronomical Clock. Plenty of places to get something quick or a meal here.

Lots of people.... Great for people watching but save yourself some money and find somewhere else to eat and drink. Most if the places that are on the square are about 30 percent more just because. The astronomical clock was not worth the wait so if you have to wait more than 5 minutes, skip it.
Wonderful place to see. The most beautiful and very romantic place. Wonderful architecture with nice statue of John Huss. Do not miss the tower clock show.

Beautiful square with varied architecture. Whichever direction you look, you want to reach for your camera. There are Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque buildings.
Highlights are the Astronomical Clock (be there on the hour to see it working) and the twin Adam and Eve towers of Tyn Church.

Happy hustle and bustle.... Lots to see in the square, particularly, the old mechanical clock. Go on a good weather day as our experience was seriously downgraded by the rainy, cold weather (in early September). Many cafes to get good fare, and lots of shopping opportunities in the square.

Magnificent, but overcrowded. A no. 1 must see in the whole of Prague. That's why it is soo full with tourists, especially near the astronomical clock, which is the main attraction of the sight.Good cafes on spot, not as pricey as one may think.If you're on the site, look for the nearby Parizska street, the most high-end shopping street in Prague.Stroll down the narrow streets towards the Charles bridge to soak up the true vibe of the city.

Worthwile to take a good look.. Nice, fairly large square surrounded by old and architecturally interesting buildings. Of course, it can be crowded with people and the usual events to amuse the tourists and make a bit of money. Painted people, segway battery powered two-wheelers, musicians, etc. which one may expect in an old town square.When visiting Prague this square is a must-see!

not to be missed!. it all happens here...lots of bars and areas for a beer, good for people-watching. Pedlars and beggars very few, but kids on Segways are a pain in the butt. The little tourist train which takes you over the river to the castle area is an absolute bargain. Watch out for Russian conmen in the vicinity of ATM machines!

A lovely old town setting. A visit to a coffee / restaurant in Staomestske Square is a must. It has so much atmosphere if you want to sit outside and drink good coffee, eat Slavakian food and watch the bustle of a busy day go by. The architect of some of the buildings of long past are intriguing and the [people so friendly and helpful. A wonderful hour's experience.Colin Luke
Nice place to walk. Really beautiful and relax there!!You can see many artists and experience a horse car ride to guild you around the old town.Nice place to visit!

Beautifully Medevil. Prague was the most beautiful city ive ever seen and old town square was the icing on the cake.The buildings were so much to take in with the art and style i didnt know where to look.With horse and carts roaming the streets I felt like i was in a fairy tale.So damn straight is it worth it.

The Square you love to go Round. The Astronomical Clock is situated here so anyone coming to Prague would not miss The Old Town square. The amount of tourists that mass around the clock from about 15 minutes before the hour is immeasurable, everyone of them want the same photo so be prepared for a bit of hustle bustle! That said if you are prepared for that, then that can be part of your experience. The square is a place you can wander around and sit and listen to or watch the various entertainers on a daily basis Some good music being played whilst we were there.

Spend time in Old Town Square and be there to see the clock figures move....slightly.. Our apartment was close to Old Town Square and we walked through there more than once a day. The two spires were great guides when we were in other parts of Old Town...Adam and Eve, one guide called them. There are places to eat, people to watch, shops to browse, markets to peruse....just a great place to be. The clock that chimes every hour with active figures is interesting, but read about it first so you won't miss the names of the figures and what they represent.

Breathtaking architecture. The buildings around the square never fails to impress. Truly magnifiscent! However it gets very crowded at some times of the day and that can make moving across it a bit uncomfortable at times. I would recommend doing a bit of people watching here as there is always something/someone interesting to see. For me the area is too busy to feel tempted to sit in the restaurants around the square to and eat/drink.

People everywhere. The old town is amazing with a lot of beautiful buildings and the large clock. But if you look beyond the buildings there are nothing more, just a lot of tourists, painted people wanting money, old cars for sightseeing, Segways for sightseeing and a lot of tourist shops around the corner.

Something for Everyone. The square is the focal point of Prague old town. It is lined with numerous old buildings, cafes and restaurants, and street performers entertain the crowds of tourists throughout the day and evening. There are also a number of shacks selling typical Czech street food and beer.
Old Town square. Very beautiful especially if you like architecture. It had a great atmosphere and market stalls an extra attraction. Good reasonable priced restaurants too.

It's like a scene out of a fairy tale!. This has got to be the most beautiful square I've seen in Europe! It is breathtaking at all times of the day. Especially at night when it's almost empty but the lighting is shining on the buildings in the perfect spots. It's magical and almost fairy tale like.

Main town square visit day and night. Town main square , recommended to visit at day time and at night as it looks differently when lights are on the castle near it. In different occasions there are boots in the square and street shows (check according to your visit dates)
Well worth visiting. Lovely old square with the Cathedral at one end and the Astronomical Clock at the other. Lots of eating places.

The Old Square in Prague. A square full of character. Several performers singing and dancing. The churches nearby are interesting with baroque interiors. It is surrounded with interesting architecture. The tower is well worth climbing. I found it interesting to walk up rather than use the lift. There are photographs of the last days of WWII when the Czech resistance rose against the Nazis on MAY 5th 1945 - just THREE DAYS before the end of the war. The resulting damage was horrendous. Much of the tower was destroyed. It has since been restored. The view of the roof tops of Prague from the top is very good. Nearby also is the astronomical clock. The performance of that on every hour was a little disappointing. I have seen better clocks. It also was seriously damaged by the Germans in the last week of the war and has been restored.
Old Town Square, Prague. Just beautiful and picturesque, many options for dining from $ to $$$; quaint stores and boutiques, a few unusual museums

Nice!!. You can walk around in Prague and then emerge the stunning buildings or view, and this also apply to the old town square. It is a very beautiful and large area full of stunning buildings and restaurants! highly recommended!
Beautiful. You can visit it in summer and winter.A lot of street artists, booths with food or suvenirs and beautiul architecture.Also lot of turist ;)

Heart of Prague. This is where you get the feel of the beautiful city ! There are lots of live performers and good music around. Most tourist attractions are either in or around Old Town. This is definitely the place to be in Prague though it can be a bit too crowded in the evenings.
Beautiful. Stunning square in the old city, surrounded by historical buildings.A great place to grab a bite to eat and watch the buskers and artists performing for tips.

Old Town Square is Gorgeous. Stunning area, very clean and lots to do and see! Old Town Square is breathtaking. The old building have been well restored and they take you back through the years. Avoid the small italian restaurant next to the clock tower though. The service is poor and the waiters and waitresses were extremely rude, they could not even smile.
a must see. Beautiful old town square, great people watching, shopping, always street performers maybe several going on at the same time and plenty of restaurants.

a beautiful city. The square is a fantastic place to visit with its lovely buildings. Have a close look at the buildings to see the decorations and art work that make this a special place. Make sure you walk along the side streets to see all of the buildings becuase you will miss out if you just stay in the square. There are lots of shops and places to eat from expensive to more reasonable if you go down the side streets. There are many shops that sell the local crystal and you will find some lovely and varied pieces. Viewing the clock on the hour mark is a highlight. It is over quite quickly and so we viewed it a number of times to make sure that we had time to enjoy it. Its quite amusing when the rooster crows once and moves. Look carefully at the 4 figures especially the skeleton who signifies death as he beats a drum as well as the 12 apostles who only appear for a short time.
An amazing space. The is plenty to see and many places to eat and drink.Give it a look when you archery as you cannot really miss this place.

Very vibrant. This is a pedestrianised square, with lots of activities almost all day. Lots of small 'huts' all round serving inexpensive food and drinks of all varieties. Also lots of cafes and bistros serving very good food under canvas canopies some expensive and some very reasonable especially if you eat in one of the little ally ways just off the square which are. Cheaper still and just as good. Musicians of all descriptions also playing most of the day. Very very busy with crowds watching the astronomical clock which strikes every hour.

Historic and beautiful .....absolute must visit in Prague.. Fabulous location with great buzz. Buildings add so much character. Plus great restaurants and lots of nice little bars for a relaxing Czech beer.
out of a fairy tail. I'm not sure I would eat in the square out of fear of subpar tourist menus, but the architecture and astronomical clock are great to marvel upon with a pilsner urquell :)
Very nice square. Beautiful square with lots of interesting architecture. Beware, it gets quite crowded. Good place to have a drink and people watch.

nice square, just a lot of tourists depending on the period and time. Definitely one of the most populated area in Prague; especially with the tourists in. Despite that, a lot of hotels restaurants are in the area as well. Moreover there are a lot of place accessible from here so it's some place that for sure you'll go through in Prague

History and Architecture. Lots of things to do around this area. It is a very busy square during the day, but early in the morning or late evening it is beautiful for pictures if you can manage to wake up early. The restaurants around the main square are expensive (because you pay for the view) if you wander down the adjoining streets there are more affordable and delicious places to discover.

enjoy this square day and night time. Take some time to enjoy this beautiful old town square during day and night. Don't miss the Jan Hus monument, the Tyn church (gothic), St Nicholas church (baroque), the old town hall clock tower (great views of the square) and the astronomical clock.

A must see.. No matter what time of day or night we visited this place, it was buzzing! The square is lively, surrounded by restaurants and cafes, street food stands, beautiful architecture and usually some form of band or musicians playing. Definitely worth a visit!

Crowded not authentic anymore. The Prague as destination was a little fairy tale just 10 years ago when I first visited. Now looking at all those restaurants, cafe (most of which have nothing to do with Czech cuisine) put on every step as you go, I feel petty.The main streets leading to the Carl's Bridge are all about shopping, no sense of cultural architecture, everything is covered with shops. Among souvenirs you may find anything from anywhere but Prague. On the street you can seat down for a Thai massage, smoke shisha in Arabic lounge and eat pizza in most of the places.On the Carl's Bridge - one of the main attractions, you can find plenty of beggars in a relatively young age and its quite shocking. overall, the charming Prague is no longer there, instead the shopping, the eating and crowds can be found.

Hectic and Enjoyable!. Even though this place remains crowded through the entire day but even then the charm is unmatched! It is like watching the world passing you by and still experiencing tranquility! Full of history, loads of good restaurants and innumerable live musical/dance performances made our visits enjoyable and comfortable!

Worth seeing. it was very crowed but enjoyable nonetheless since I like crowdsWe went up the tower which allows for 360 degrees view of the City. Also noteworthy is the fact there is a lift for people who cannot easily walk up stairs.  the architecture of the various colored houses is very pleasant to look at and contributes to the Prague reputation of being a beautiful City
Energy Abounds. The square was filled with minstrels, restaurants, vendors and tourists. So much to see so little time!

Prague's central pedestrian hub.. We visited this square in early September and it was teeming with people. All the pedestrian routes in the central part of Prague converge here, making it a natural gathering place. The square is surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, souvenir shoppes, and pubs, and of course the historical buildings that dominate the centre of the city. Street performers vie for the attention of the crowds. Tour groups wind their way through the crowds, led by raised umbrellas and signs. There is a general atmosphere of celebration and leisure and love of life. Not to be missed on any visit to the city.
Wall to wall people. Intense part of Prague especially on the hour when the tours all gather for the Astronomical Clock the square is just a sea of faces and electric atmosphere, just fantastic

Vibrant and pulsating center of the city. During my visit, it felt like the pulse of the city radiated out of Old Town Square. From street performers, to restaurants to baroque and gothic architecture, everything that was important for me to see seemed to be within a 1 mile radius of the square. The space itself is very beautiful and historic, and there are fine architectural specimens to view. There are monuments with the statues of some important figures in Czech history, and the Old Town Hall with the astronomical clock can also be found here. By venturing off into the surrounding streets, I was able to discover many local delights that I was not even aware existed. It is an excellent place to relax, or meet fellow travelers. A necessary stop on any trip to Prague.

Busy, crowded and beautiful. The Old Town Square houses some of the most beautiful and historical buildings in Prague including the stunning Gothic St Tyn church which is a must see for the lovers of art and architecture. The square itself marks the heart of Old Town with charming side streets directing the flow of visitors to various points of interest such as the Charles Bridge and the Prague Castle. The square is populated with restaurants, street vendors, performers and shops, all adding to the already rich texture of this magical city. The astronomical clock on the side of Old Town Hall Tower and St Nicholas Church are among other remarkable attractions in the square. It is a haven for street photographers who never run out of subject matter. It offers a wealth of material for art, architecture and cityscape photographers.

Really romantic . We where there while it's snowed just enough to be romantic but not annoying. The place is full of people but doesn't feel crowded. Enjoy a cup of hot wine while sitting on one of the benches in the square and just people watch. A really fun thing to do
Just lovely. Brilliant place to see, enjoyed everything there was there , so much going on every where plenty places to eat and drink

American in Prague. i had a great time here in Prague theres so much history here and great places to shop and eat people are so friendly its like traveling back in time when here in prague one of the most beautiful cites in all of Europe
Nice Square. Nice sqare with old buildings , nice place to visit .. If you are hungry there are stalls of crepes , prague traditional sweet roll .. worth try ..

Lovely and most lively place. Lovely and most lively place I have ever visited. The place is full of young enthu people doing something unique in the middle of the square be it dancing, music, playing musical instruments. You cannot see a dull moment at this place.
Old Town Square . We visited Old Town Square in the morning, afternoon, early evening and after 10 PM on different days. It was delightful every time.
Must visit. A lot of life and happiness here. Try to visit at Night - evening. Buildings with wonderfull light on it, what A sight. Allways go here when in Prague.
Great views!!. Such a great experience, the clock tower was incredible! You have to go up the tower and see from above!

Whatever you do don't buy anything!. The old town square is very lovely and a mandatory visit. Best experienced around 8am before the crowds, in the early morning sun.Here is my caveat and something that really ruins it for me: everything in the square is a rip off! Do NOT, under any circumstances, buy anything in this vicinity. When I say rip off, I don't just mean it's a bit overpriced. You expect that. One restaurant charges double prices to sit outside. No joke. (We didn't go in here...) One restaurant we did reluctantly eat in, after checking carefully for fine print about surcharges, slapped a cover charge 'tax' of 60czk on top of the bill (see my separate review of Hotel U Prince), and charges to use the toilet. Need to change some money? That's 20% commission. In real terms, we changed £40 and lost nearly £10 in charges. So turn up early before the rest of Christendom does, see the clock strike, take some chocolate box pictures, then leave and see the rest of Prague in peace and at a reasonable price.
Prague ham. Sat and had a lovely coffee, people watching and enjoying the lovely building. The clock was fantastic. Local food stalls we had the prage ham it was enough for six people.
Stunning. Beautiful buildings, lovely atmosphere. Great place to sit and watch the world go by. A must see in Prague!

Packed with people, but still beautiful and interesting. Expect to be packed in with thousands of other tourists and be approached by street vendors to buy a selfie stick a few dozen times as you make your way through the square. It was incredibly hot and crowded during our visit to Prague. While we still enjoyed the Old Town Square, the masses of people did take away from some of the ability to soak in the beauty of the buildings in the area. There were some interesting street performers, horse drawn carriages, and excellent people watching, if you could find a place to sit for a few minutes.

Street performer was great. This square is normal touristy area with shops and crowded with people however there were a couple different street performances happening and they were fun to watch. There are also fancy stores if you're into that kind of thing

Fabulous square. This is another 'must see' in Prague. It is of course full of tourists, and people taking pictures, but the square and the buildings around - not to mention the clock, are totally worth a look. There are loads of cafes and restaurants around, which, given that it's such a tourist spot, arent the cheapest, but you can find some nice food/drinks. The one thing that surprised me in this old, architectural town, is the fascination with segways. I've never seen them in such an abundance anywhere - and they will try and rent them to you constantly!

Fairy Tale city. A fairy tale square, you can walk hours and lost yourself at the details of Our Virgin Mary Church or Astronomical Clock Tower, we stayed at U Prince hotel at one of our visits, which is excellent location, just opposite side of Clock Tower and at the heart of the Old Town Square
History Alive. Plenty of attractions, best was the astrological clock. Shops and food facilities to meet all needs.

Charming Square. It is a charming square with lots of activities like buskers and small food stalls. Architecturally it is very scenic with beautiful buildings surrounding the square. Sit at a cafe and people watch is a good thing to see how lively the square can be.

Lovely place. Lovely ,lively place to be , crowded at all times partly due to the the clock tower and mostly due to the numerous other attractions,restaurants, shops.
Evening time long of live performances by musicians are there.
you can just sit there and enjoy .

Fun Tourist Area of Prague. Go and walk, find a place to sit for a coffee or tea and enjoy "people-watching". A delightful, but crowded, tourist area. Be prepared for street performers, horse-drawn carriages, a lot of window shopping.

The Old Town Square. What a surprise to turn the corner and be greeted by the charm of the old town square. It takes your breath away after the wide streets and rush of the rest of Prague. You wander around looking at the crowds wandering around the square. But at night at sunset and beyond your eyes drown in the beauty of this old town as lights are directed up at the buildings from strategic points. One of the churches almost takes you to Disneyland with its steeple highlighted at its points. A must see at both times.
Interesting.. Our tour here was a walking tour and got lots of info about history and other things to do with our free time. Great place to roam.

Like stepping back in time, stunning.. A central meeting point for everyone. The square attracts people of all ages and nationalities, looks beautiful day and night with the lights and amazing architecture.

Like Disneyland on steroids. A must see both by day as well as night. While it can get quite crowded with tourists, especially by the Astronomical Clock, while in Prague this is a destination that shouldn't be missed.

A must visit location in Prague. Always busy, lots goig on but watch you personal belongings in the crowds, a few dody looking characters around. The Astronomical clock is very unusual but worth a look ( though is it just me who was disappointed with the striking the hour "performance") Lots of street artists at night, the people sellig tours etc wer enot at all pushy, and lots of cafes and restaurants at tourist prices around the place but not a bad atmosphere and a pleasant place to pass some tme on holiday

I got out asap. I was in the old town square for about as long as my walking tour covered it... Ok, obviously you're going to go see it, and you'll be glad you did (if only to reassure yourself you're not missing that much) but I had a much better time wandering around less crowded spots (and randomly discovering burcak, for example)... So see it, so you can say you did, and get out.
Lively! . The liveliness of the place won't be mistaken with baskers and good restaurants around.Definitely a must stop over for a couple of days

Beautiful and historic. This beautiful square with its remarkable astrological clock is a must see. Even in October - normally a boring month - this square is buzzing with people and the architecture with its long history, is exciting to see. Prague has so much to offer when it comes to beautiful and colourful buildings. Remember to bring a camera!

Nice square, but typical of European squares.. A very nice town square, a bit plain and bland, but like most European squares it is the people and markets that fill them that is the attraction. Because it was Christmas, there was markets galore, performers and music, and the atmosphere was amazing!

Astronomical Clock. The Astronomical Clock is one of the main attractions. The clock chimes on the hour every hour. Stand directly in front of the clock to be able to see the characters appear. Watch out for the skeletons on the right sight and the golden hen.

Great atmosphere and interesting architecture. Wander off the main square to find smaller squares and hidden places to eat and drink. If you want to see how the other half live then take a walk down 'Paris St' where you will find all the high end designer labels and you know it's expensive 'cos there are no prices on anything in the windows and they have bouncers on the doors! We can but dream!As of July 15 things are pretty cheap generally as the exchange rate is good, so take an empty hand luggage to stash your purchases

What Do You Want? It's Old Town Square.. Among the more beautiful sights in Prague. You WILL go here. If you don't, what the hell are you doing in Prague? Is it touristy? Of course. Are the square-side restaurants overpriced? Definitely. But what do you want from such a popular location. You might even be there when there's a free concert or a film shoot happening.

Wonderful buildings and sights. We spent a good while just walking around enjoying the architecture and taking a lot of pictures. We wandered through the tourist shops selling basically the same thing.One word of warning the exchange shops they have all over are a huge scam...one we sadly fell pray to. The guy quoted us a great exchange rate which he then failed to give us. We lost about 28% in the deal, when we demanded a refund he became belligerent. Sad to say that this is such a common occurrence that when we complained nearby we were given a template to fill out about what happened. Three other couples were there with their complaints as well. Not a pleasant way to begin out Prague vacation. I don't understand why it's allowed to continue, but now we know better and hopefully others can be warned. There is a big mall with over 200 shops, it's hard to miss...this is a good pace to go for free and clean bathrooms.
Beautiful square. One of the most beautiful town squares in the world. Must see when in Prague. Both in the daytime and at night. Always vibrant.
Sevdalina O. Amazing and wonderful place,Prague is so beautiful!!!This is the greatest gift for my birthday-4 days here,but I think it's not enough to see all of fantastic places in this city!

Music, bubbles and actors. I could spend hours here. Listening to Bohemian Bards, watching children chasing bubbles, and enjoying all the actors in different characters. But all the segways ...? They contribute nothing to the square atmosphere. I wish they were more on the side. (People from all over the world will come home with photos of these beautiful buildnings with gorgious facades - and segways in front ...)
What a clock. It may be touristy but you are a tourist and you will love it. Skip the open air cooking and eat at one of the restaurants along the square. Prices are reasonable and the beer is good.
Must see center of pragu. Must see. Center of Prague. All walks of life are present here. Entertainment provided by local musicians and performers.

Ignore the crass commercialism at ground level by looking up at the grandure around you, and you will be impressed. The alleged star attraction is the astronomical clock, which, though a remarkable piece of engineering for the 14th century, is not astounding really when it does it's limited thing on the hour. No, what is astounding is the genuine, completely original 14th century plus buildings all around you, each very different but a blended part of the whole square. No reconstructed WWII buildings here - its the real stuff 500 or 600 years old. Best seen on a sunny day or in the warm glow of a setting sun. The square looks different and nice again at night when most buildings are well lit.Just ignore the crass commercial exploitation of the square at street level. No matter what you want, walk 50m up any side street and you will find it cheaper, as well as in some streets some very quaint shops selling cool stuff.Beware pickpockets unless there is a street presence by police.
Lovely place. Great atmosphere here, it's in the old town (obviously) lots of tours around in all languages and lots of people about. Lovely place and lots to see.

Also interesting at moment is a photographic and art exhibition in old town square.. Lots of street entertainment in the square i.e. music, fire eaters etc. Don't miss the clock that strikes on the hour with little figures in doors. Lots of restaurants, great atmosphere.
Good buzz. Good buzz around the square. Beautiful buildings and nice street entertainment. Passed through it a few times each day and still got the happy vibe from the area.
It's an old town square. . Yep. As advertised. Old town square. Worth seeing when passing through. Quite a bit of street meat available.
NOT real.... Historical, mesmerizing, breathtaking experience...Past is mixed with present , and you are in the mix having some gelato in front of the famous clock...almost not real

Try this site at night. A great place to view at night! Lights come on, people come from everywhere! It is a great vibe. Buildings are amazing. Many street stalls and resteraunts. Just an amazing site. Some great food, fresh drinks and souvenirs.

Soul of Prague. No words can describe Old Town Square. It seem to be such a lively place almost magical. You get to see beautiful historic building, all sort of activities from dance, music, tours to some really nice food and drinks. One can spend a whole day and night at this place.
Staromestske namesti are beautiful as all Prague. Prague gives me peace inside. Staromestske namesti are beautiful as all Prague <3 You must go there.

The heart of Prague. My favourite place in Prague! We loved it here. It's like the centre of the capital. So many beautiful buildings and attractions to take in. I could just sit in the square all day. The restaurants had plenty of outdoor seating, perfect for the weather we had whilst there.

Beautiful. it was a magical city
we didn't stay there for long
we visited the old town and the castle
we loved every single part of it,, i would have to come back for a longer stay

Lively square. This is a very busy square with street musicians and other performers entertaining the crowds. There are architecturally pleasing buildings lining the square, the Jan Hus monument, and a number of churches one of which houses the Astronomical Clock. Like many others I awaited the chiming of the Astronomical Clock, but was expecting slightly more than was delivered. In one corner of the square is a very small park which has a number of food and souvenir stalls. There are lots of restaurants at which to grab a bite, but you can find cheaper establishments just around the corner.

Big and beautiful square. This is a tourist spot no doubt. The square is very big and has statue, church, astronomical clock, ans surrounded by restaurants and shops. You can just relax by sitting outside one of the restaurants or watch street entertainment with some good artist playing music.

Tourist central. A city square edged by amazing examples of baroque, art nouveaux, gothic and neo gothic architecture - of course the tourists will gather here, and gather they do, in droves! Especially in front of the astronomical clock waiting for the hourly show. A lot of tour operators work from here so it is a great starting point to explore the city.
So much to see.. Prague was my favourite place throughout Europe. Wonderful history, people, food, shopping. Definitely a return visit required. Not enough time to see everything.
The Heart of Prague. This is the place to go to find everything else. Everything stems off the square, and it is a hive of activity........make sure you visit.

Drinks. Great bars great prices Cannot go wrong here... This place is clean and great fun.. The buildings are stunning and very historic.The night life is brilliant, just watch out for people trying to rob you. Great place
Unmissable!!. Very atmospheric day and night! So much to see and enjoy! Acts and buskers ranging from bubble blowers to snake charmers with every type of band and singers in between!

Lots to see here. This is a beautiful, busy square. Take a free walking tour (guides work for tips and they are great). We joined a tour by the Astronomical Clock and loved the guide's fun commentary. Beware the food stalls lined up in a row at the square, the prices listed are by weight and they serve you four times the weight listed, making lunch about $40 U.S. No thanks, go to the food stands a few steps away to find a tasty, economical lunch.

The heart of Old Town. Really nice fun area right in the center of Old Town. There's usually small groups playing music and sometimes a few with some magic tricks. Lots of places to eat and shop right near by and it's pedestrian only. At night you an catch the gondolas which will take you where you need to go in the vicinity. We passed through here several times during our stay.

Good for afternoon visit. Pretty crowed it place to it is the best to visit the late afternoon, there are a lot of restaurant around the place where you can sit down enjoy the BEST beer in the world and watch people mingling around.
Pulsating with life. Truly the centre of tourist action in Prague; lively and vibrant. One could spend several hours here. Must visit place.

Square dance. If you like squashing in amongst lots of sweaty bodies then this is the place for you! Every visitor makes their way here, as it is the focus of the city - just keep out of the cafes as they are expensive.

A good kind of old. This was the starting point of our walking tour. Prague has a very rich and interesting history and for a good part of that history (as narrated during the tour) to have happened at the Old Town square was just amazing. Knowing the stories behind the buildings at the Old Town Square made it more special.

Old Town Nostalgia. This a great place to spend the afternoon, people watch, and be entertained by street performers. You don't really go here for a great restaurant experience, you go here to relax and snack on food offered by food stalls, and just soak in the unhurried, nostalgic ambience of the place.

So much to see and enjoy in this beautiful square.... Beautiful buildings and sculptures full of history, worth standing the famous old astronomical clock at the hour to admire the animated figures in action.

Must see, but really crowded. This iconic square is a "must see" during a Prague visit. Because of that, tourists overcrowd this square, unfortunately. Go early in the morning to avoid the conjestion.
A Nice Place. Spent an entire evening walking around the Old Town Square. A lovely place to walk or just sit and enjoy the views with some amazing street musicians playing

Awesome place for a drink. This was an AWESOME place to people watch. There are a ton of street performers, gelato stands and restaurants. I would not eat here (I made that mistake- too expensive and the food was not good) but if you have a chance to sit and have a drink, it's a great place to relax and people watch.
Great day or night. Visited at night and the buildings looked fantastic. Then visited today and even though it was extremely busy definitely worth a visit for restaurants and street performers.

Astronomical Clock. This is in the middle of the Old Town not far from the Charles Brodge. The square is a popular tourist destination and is where the Astronomical Clock is situated. It also houses cafes bars and restaurants.
Prague best walking area. You will enjoy exploring Pragues history every where . The area is also good for shopping fans at reasonable prices. Food outlets are available .

Beautiful square... but rip off food stalls. The square is absolutely beautiful - you could easily spend an hour looking at the various buildings. The Clock Tower is well worth the climb (there is also a lift) as the view is gorgeous but it can get very busy.Sadly, the experience is marred by the lack of transparency in pricing at the food stalls. I was charged 330 crowns for a takeaway plastic disposable bowl of potatoes, bacon, and cabbage - mostly potato. On the pricelist it was 49 crowns (but this turned out to be for 100g!). That's almost 2 euro for 100g or over 12 euros for a bowl of what is essentially boiled potatoes. Needless to say, I didn't complete the purchase.Although this may not seem like a big deal, it is sadly indicative of how visiting one of the most beautiful cities in the world can leave a sour taste.

Must-see in Prague. This is a buzzing place full of energy and people. I live about 2 minutes away from there and whenever I go I have to admire the mangnificence and liveliness of this historical place. But it is empty and quiet at 6 o'clock in the morning when I like it the most.

Enchanting. This is a mesmerizing area of Prague. The square is surrounded by historical and enchanting buildings, cathedrals and statues. Outdoor cafes are dotted all about and there is a feeling of relaxation and excitement all at the same time. The street performers are wonderful. Most of them have real talent...we listened to one singer who brought several of us to tears with the beauty of his voice. You could spend a week in the Old Town Square and never see the same thing on any of the days. It's a marvelous place...a must see.
Wonderful. Filled with lovely architecture all around you. Many restaurants and reasonably priced. Walking distance to the Charles St. bridge and St. Wenchelas Square. A must visit.

Provides Access to Lots of Attrractions. Situated in Old town, there are lots and lots of restaurants, bars and people offering entertainment at the square. There are lists of attractions such as the Tyne Church and Astronomical Clock just by the square. There are also a few shops but look out for pickpockets as this place is extremely busy. Watch out for free shows such as snake charmers, musicians and human statues. You can't miss this place.
beautiful. beautiful! Beware of segway and street performers...they don't look where they are going\stand and be in your way while you walk

Lively and great views. The astronomical clock is just one of the things to see here. Also, make note of the church across the square and how it lights up at night. make sure and hit a gelato stand too!

City Centre. The centre of everything. Lots of tourists. The market around the square is nice and lots of local foods can be sampled. Restaurants were a little more expensive here but not outrageous and lots to choose from.
Lots happenning. Great people place. Lots of crowds, lots of restaurants, vendors, hawkers, street performers. A happenning place.
Don't miss out, visit the square when is Prague. Lovely old town Prague is complimented with this fantastic square and clock tower. If you're ever visiting Prague, ensure you visit this square.

Good place. Very good place to go.
There is always something happening there and it is very central.
If you can wait for it, you should definitely see the astronomical clock's show.

The Highlight of Prague. This is where it all happens, the astronomical clock, the magnificent civic and historic buildings, the street performers, horse & carriage tours, history and beauty in bucketfuls! Lots of great restaurants, hotels, shops, theatres, museums, snacks and open-air eating. Don't miss it!

Medieval, astronomical clock shouldn't be missed. Old Town Square is crowded but it definitely worth the time. Be sure to be near the Old Town Square Clock Tower on the hour to see the medieval, astronomical clock on the facade of the building display the twelve apostles as the clock strike on the hour.

Football on big screen! Italians going wild!. I was on the Old Town Square during World Cup. They had a huge screen showing football. What a wild experience. Lines for beer were almost as long as the lines for the restrooms! The atmosphere was truly international as you could hear every language being spoken imaginable. Ultra Cool!!

old town. One of the best squares we have seen. Numerous restaurants and fantastic architecture with history at every turn. Good service and a little more expensive than side streets but very cheap compared with English prices which would be 3 times more for 3 times worse service.
Interesting. Loved old town square.. Full of character, full of tourists!! Very busy and vibrant.. Watch out you don't get knocked over by a Segway!!
Enjoyed it! . Everything is happening in this square! Interesting people, music, astronomical watch and buildings!
Great Architecture!. Absolutely beautiful. The architecture is worth the trip. Take the time to sit & enjoy the square, day or night..

Can't wait to return to Prague for another visit.. We loved the Old Town. Walking is a great way to experience the sights, buildings and restaurants. We spent a week in Prague and always found something interesting to do. One excellent activity was the free walking tour (although you should definitely tip) we had a great overview of the city, the history, and the important landmarks. It ended at the castle where you can spend some additional time. The tour guide was excellent, definitely recommend them!

International Jazz Festival. The Old Town Square is really a nice place to pass time. Apart of being a very beatiful place, it has a lot of restaurants, bars and coffe shops. My last visit was on July 2015 and at that time there were the international JazzFestival for free. I went a couple of nights and I really enjoy it. The group I like the most was Earth Win and Fire.It is very diferent to hear them in a CD than in a concert. Amazing voices.
Nice centra area to hang out.. This area is so pretty. The architecture is centuries old, the Astronomical Clock is gorgeous, and the cafes and shops are cute to frequent.
Amazing square!. Stunning!! My mouth dropped open as I did a 360 degree rotation to see everything. Muscians in the square were great.

Ideal place for lovers!. Excelent places for lovers! Everything you find here is amazing. Bohemian crystal, glaces, gifts and many other things: food, beer, landscape. Beautiful river bridges, castle, history.

Myfav place in Europe. This is one of my favorite places in Europe. This place has such a laid back charm that you dont need to have an itinerary. You could just walk around the square or eat in one of the cafes around it. I remember the day I was there, a Scottish band played in the square. it made that time more special.
Beauty Everywhere!!. The magical heart of Prague! Loads of pubs everywhere in the square. Just have one drink and sit in the square outside a bar and watch the world go by.

There is so much to see . Following on from the clock which you can see in picture the square is so large. Take great care whether it is wedding cars or carriages but also seg ways and of cause lots of people. Lots to see we enjoyed the monument to the man who understood the bible sooner than a number of others. Enjoy our travels hope they inspire you.

Awesome Square. awesome square filled with restaurants, cafes and bars, but the best thing to do is, to get some drinks, something to eat and stay in the middle of the square at night enjoying the lighting on the old buildings, cathedrals, adam and eve towers, and also the astronomical watch
Great Square. This square is certainly a people magnet. Lots going on here with some great views, talented buskers and the smell of great food

Hub of activity. One of the reasons I vacationed in Prague was so I could see this place up close. It didn't disappoint. From the astronomical clock to the ancient, but well-kept buildings to the live entertainment, this was a place I always ended up at in the evenings. No visit to Prague would be great without it.
Beautiful . I love Prague and the Old Town Square is where it all happens. Very lively and great atmosphere for some people watching. Great place to spend some time.

Even better at night!. If you can, stay by the square! It is where a lot of the action is. Plenty of restaurants and shops as well as musicians playing in the square. It had a nice atmosphere. If you plan on watching the 12 disciples rotate on the astronomical clock on the hour, just come a few minutes before the hour. It does get crowded but its not worth waiting say 30 min for something that only lasts 30 seconds.

Magnificient Old Town Square. Old Town Square is one of the most visited places in Central Prague district. One needs to be go to the top of the tower to see the magnificient views of all the major attractions like Prague Castle , Jewish Quartier etc.

A wonderful evening and golden opportunity to take exceptional photographs. This is a wonderful place to be in, particularly in the evening. We paid to go up the tower to take photographs. Go there late around 7:30 PM and watch the magic as sun sets (don't leave with the crowd) and get your camera ready. You would take photographs for which people will die! Sky turning from yellow to read! Amazing view, the best we have seen . You will not want to leave for everything looks so beautiful. Sadly, I am unable to use the panoramic feature of my camera but it could take amazing photographs. As you come down, stop and take more photgraphs from the place you take the elevator. It is worth paying.From the square, a the top of the hour see the magic on the clock tower as figures come out. Better have your video features in the camera ready (we never did and crowd came in front). i recommend staying away from the crowd and using the zoom to capture the scene. There are many gift shops and restaurants which are open well into the late evening. The food is average and over priced. You can hear musicians playing and jugglers performing (please pay them for the show).
A must!. This is a busy area but well worth visiting. Has lots of history and the astronomical clock must be seen when it strikes the hour.

Beautiful. The astronomical clock is a must see and so is the beautiful gothic church. I visited in September and there weren't crowds which was perfect because i read that during the months of july and august it could get really crowded. The sqaure has a very nice atmosphere. Being surrounded with friendly people, stunning architecture and mesmerising culture is definitely a great Czech experience :)

Fabulous place. What a great place to visit. This square is bustling with people and their is plenty to see. A must is the clock tower, but make sure you spend an hour or two just wandering the streets!

A charming square!. A very beautiful square and a popular place to visit in Prague, hence it is always crowded. Mustn't miss the astronomical show that happens every hour. Lots of restaurants, cafes and souvenir shops around.
Attractive Square. Really enjoyed seeing the Kinsky Palace, Old Town Hall and the Adtronomical Clock which comes alive every hour.

Well worth a visit. I guess no visit to Prague is complete without a visit here. Being the main centre of everything its crammed with tourists. The buildings and churches on all sides of the square are beautiful. But 2 minutes down any of its side streets bring you to much more enjoyable sights, quirky shops, bars, restaurants etc. Well worth a visit.

Piece of ever lasting history. If you into old history and architecture tthis is 100% place to visit in Prague. You don't need to go up to Orloj, just sit down in cafeteria and absorb atmosphere. Is like going back in history lessons.

The Best Place in Prague. The heart of Prague, this place covers almost everything there is to see in Prague. Just stroll around the place to get to the historic monuments and the lovely bars and cafes in the square.

Charming square. The square is absolutely beautiful and is ringed with places you can eat and drink at. The astronomical clock is amazing as is the view of the Tyn church. The night we were there it was extremely crowded. This is the meeting point for many tours. The tourist information office is also here across the square near the statue.
Stay near old town square. Beautiful touristy place. Nice restaurants and lots of hustle and bustle. Nice shops and tours around. Famous chu r check with historical clock. Lots of music places

beautiful square. my first time in prague and i will definately be going back, we stayed by the old town square and frequently went to it, well worth a visit, nice to sit with a drink and watch the world go by, everybody so friendly and helpfull
Avoid it.. There is nothing czech about this square. Locals just try to run across it as fast as they can. Dont take a taxi, dont buy drug, and dont eat there.

Impressive old square. Fantastic place! One of the finest old squares in Central Europe, well preserved and not too commercialized. But of course the best time to visit is in November, when there are least tourists...
