Center of Prague - must see!!. Literally the center of town. Must see. Gets quite crowded with lots of tour groups. Be sure to go up the town hall (tower where the Astronomical Clock is). Lots of restaurants, people, shops (including Pařížská Street - the Rodeo Drive of Prague), and not far from the Charles Bridge.

Hype of the old town!. You have to live the hype and history of the old town square!.
The astronomic click has the special action on the hour every hour, so avoid the crowds and plan your day accordingly

Stepping back in time with great food and gifts to enjoy. The skyline can be seen from a long way off-the twin church spires. Plenty of stalls with food, drinks-including Czech specialties involving pigs- and gifts to buy for yourself or others. Also restaurants galore-and plenty of shade
A fairy tale. You feel like in a fairy tale, the musicians are really good at historical music and local tunes, and the big meat and original dessert with canella

Highlight of the old town. The highlight of the Old Town, beautiful Tyn Church is a must visit. Jan Hus statue is very nice as well, and Church of St Nicolas, Hussite too. Astronomical clock is a must!
Absolutely to be visited. Spectacular view on the Old Prague, with the Astronomical Clock and the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn (which is, strangely, partly incorporated into more recent buildings).
Amazing scenery!. Lovely, busy area. Highly recommend a visit up the old town hall clock tower from where you will get some amazing photos.
Legendary. Legendary square. Felt so good to return after over 5 years. Street performers, good food, ice cold Pilsner all over the square. And the clock... worth a watch and visit.
The core center of Prague. I just loved the astrological watch . The plaza is full of tourists and it has a nice and pleasant atmosphere.
Music and nice atmosphere any time. Come here in the morning and and in the evening. You will found any time someone playing guitar or piano. This is also the starting point to visit the old town.

Must See. Very big square with many historical buildings and place to eat and drink. There are also small stalls and various buskers.
Be careful of crowds and pick pockets which target here.

Were has the restaurant gone. In the middle of MI (1996) Ethan Hunt jumps out of a restaurant and runs across the square, not today is jammed full of folk, its a pleasant and essential location to start the Prague city explore, try the Old Town Hall tower but be aware the guard "helping" people queue for the elevator is a left over from Stalin's main guard force, not friendly at all and no personal skills what so ever. Enjoy.
Must See by Day and Night. The lively center of the city that evolves as the sun passes. Filled with performers and the tourists who watch them.

Bustling Center or Old Town. The Old Town Square is a beautiful square in the center of the old town of Prague. Its amazing to stand there and marvel at the beautiful architecture surrounding the square, including the astronomical clock. The square is bustling with people, but still manages to remain charming. I would also recommend visiting at night as the buildings near the square are beautifully lit.
Great experience. It is really great experience. We all loved it. Some of the restaurants in this area are overpriced!

Have a look.... A very nice and historical place, with a lot of buildings, the Old Town Hall... the Jan Hus' monument... A just to see lot of people around this place... Take time for a coffee, an ice cream... and discover an historical location.

Essential visit while in Prague. During the day, this place is heaving with tourists, segways, horse drawn carriages, street entertainers and living statues.During the night there's more entertainment, including a duo who breathed fire and swallowed swords. Around the square you'll find plenty of bars to rest your feet and quench your thirst, plus there's the Astronomical Clock with a parade of saints every hour.

Amazing. Yesterday we visited this square and I have to say, it is amazing. Thousands of tourist is waiting there every hour for the special singing clock which they have there. I can completely recommend this place, especially at night when all the light are on.
Highly recommend. Fun with street performances. Crowded nearly all year round. Carts with great street food. Beautiful buildings - highly recommend
Classic. It's the heart of the city and has it all with wonderful architecture, fun places to dine and drink, and a perfect spot to people watch.

Must see!. The astronomical clock is really beautiful and the stands near the city hall serves delicious food. The buildings around are very suggestive.
Negative note it mey be the alcohol stores and restaurants, made exclusivey for tourists, but that's ok.
Square. Excellent place for atmosphere and getting the feel of the city. Has restaurants, bars, buskers who take turns all thru the city. Reasonably priced food and drink.
Old Town Square. it seems the main part of Prague beauty is collected here . It was really beautiful and have something special .
The clocks. A beautiful square, especially the clock tower. Very crowded with tourists on the hour. Very walkable area.
full of history and...people. Very busy place as it is a very popular place to visit. Worth to see with a tour to find out more about the love buildings and history of the town.
Beautiful place. I visited in Feb, 2015. It was a beautiful place, historical one. Infact, Old Town Square is the highlight of Prague. Great view all over the city.
Beautiful place. Despite the crowds, the place is awesome to wonder through and people watch sitting in one of the outdoor restaurants on the Square.

Holiday cheer. A must while visiting Prague, especially during the holiday time. The Christmas markets that are set up are beautifully done. The decorations and food are amazing. We spent hours just walking around admiring the city.

Old Town Square Prague. When we visited towards the end of August 2015, the square was buzzing with street performers and crowds of tourists watching the astronomical clock riding their segways or just sitting in a coffee shop watching. Its a great square with a huge monument to Jan Huss a freedom fighter for Protestants overshadowed by a cathedral representing the very power he was opposing. Curious juxstaposition. Here you get a sense of the history of Bohemia, Moldavia and Czech Silesia now called the Czech Republic. It evlokes its history.
Old Town Square. An absolute must see for any visitor to Prague.Turning in any direction there is something worthwhile to see.

"Dont get crushed when the clock strikes". What a beautiful place to see, even with the heat wave there were loads of tourists shopping in and around the Square. There are loads of people selling all different types of merchandise and also a good number of street entertainers who are not far from the professional ranks. It was while watching one of these groups that we were swept along to the corner of the Square by hundreds of tourists with their camera's in the air, it was 3 minutes to 12 and everyone wanted to see the Astronomical Clock strike and thanks to them my wife and I saw it as well.( if we wanted to or not ) Lovely clean Square with beautiful old buildings and a large police presence to make everyone feel safe.
A must to visit. It's a must to visit, the street vendors, the people, the food, the clock, hustle and bustle but fab.
Tower in Old Town square. Watch the astronomical clock animation on the hour, and go up the tower. Great view all around the city.
Jan huss. The old town square is the highlight of Prague. A nice place to chill and admire the statue complex which is dedicated to jan Hus.
Beautiful, but... A beautiful place with old buildings. But so crowded with tourists and street merchants that it took some of the joy out of me - I guess that can't be helped thought.

Astronomical Clock. If you are visiting Prague there are certain areas you must see - the Old Town Square is one of these. It can get busy, but its worth it to see the Astronomical Clock, which strikes on the hour.

Read up. I am glad I read up on this area. So many things to appreciate, but would have missed if I had not read ahead of time about the square. Most people mass by the astrological clock, but there is so much more to see.
Very Busy. A very busy touristic place. Good restaurants all around and in the square but at a price. Lots of street entertainers. Beware of pickpockets as it gets very crowded.

Beautiful. A Beautiful place to wonder around. Lots of lovely old buildings. Many restaurants and buskers for entertainment. Very pretty, won't take you very long to see. Watch out for people trying to get you to go on bar crawls etc...very annoying
A landmark square. The square have various architectural styles including the Gothic Church which is the main church of the city since the 14th century. Try to go early as it is crowded

this is a good value and interesting tour with memorable sights.. From the heights to the dungeons the was an amazing tour. Lots of steps but at least a lift to the tower.. Plenty of history in various time zones.

Old Town Square. Prague is my favorite city for good reason - it is so clean and beautiful wherever you look, especially in the more touristic areas of the city. In Old Town Square be prepared to get assailed by SEVERAL different groups of people advertising pub crawls.

The square where it's all happening. . This is the place to be in Prague. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Beautiful buildings showing the history of old Prague. The Clock and Town Hall right there. Performers, shops and much more to see.
Tour. İt was very magnificient. You May think that you are in the 18th. Century. Thé buildings are really have restorated very carefully. ..

Nice architecture. Nice old buildings. You snap a few photos here. It is like timetravel.
The next time you are there you are likely to be on your way to some place else.

Not to be missed. Old Town Square is full of people and high energy. Great people watching from the many eating/drinking place around the square. The astronomical clock is awesome if only because of its existence from Medieval times...and it's a fascinating working clock. From the square there are many little side streets full of quaint shops. The Square and surrounding areas make for some good photos.
My number one european choice. My beloved place! Always my first option when visiting Europe . No matter if on business or just enjoying the unique atmosphere with friends.

One of Prague's many must-see places. Great place, great architecture, lots to see, lots of people. Take the elevator to the top of the tower for wonderful views of Prague. Arrive before the hour strikes to see the Apostles emerging on the clock.

You have to see it!. Square is truly wonderful. Amazing architecture, everything is beautifully repaired, except for the clock, which passes through the long-term reconstruction. But it is functional. Everywhere there are an awful lot of tourists !!!

Captivating Square. The lively Old Town Square is lined with multi-colored magnificent buildings in different styles from Boroque to Gothic.It is precisely here that the winding lanes of the old town spill out onto the most beautiful square in Prague which captivated & charmed me.Here one sees an ever changing cast of musicians,protesters,dance troupes,tourists & vendors who enhance its color!

Must see. The square is beautiful. We enjoyed walking around day and night. There always seems to be something going on. The cathedral is breathtaking as well as watching the clock on the hour. Bring your camera.

Very nice. Very pretty square with lots of restaurants and bars around. Definitely a must visit and of course you must see the famous clock. Its not all its hyped up to be and you will find hundreds of people swarming the square and waiting for the clock to toll on the hour where the figurines do some animation. It tuns out the animation was a skeleton ringing a bell and some little figures going around in a circle. Which we could believe we waited ten minutes for.Lots of talented entertainers in the square though!
Must visit. The old square is full of great bars/restaurants for coffee or a meal. You must see the old clock tower clock strike on the hour. Easy to reach from Charles bridge.

Absolutely worth a visit.. The only bit of the square that is a tourist trap is the restaurants. Overly priced and mediocre quality compared to the rest of Prague. The square is a very large space, and easy to navigate if a little crowded in front of the charming astronomical clock. Those that don't appreciate the clock clearly don't realise it's not a digital piece of plastic. It's the oldest working astronomical clock in the world from the medieval ages. The full description inside the old Town Hall tower is definitely worth a read. And the view from the top of said tower is great.The presence of a police van constantly overlooking the area in front of the clock is a reminder that pick pockets are about, but are clearly being watched themselves.
historical. Nothing to dislike..Oh the history so much learnt on our visit.the, people are so friendly and you always felt safe
Falling in love with Prague. If you come here by the day, make sure you make an extra trip during the night where all the lights are lit up and Prague will make you fall in love instantly.
WOW. Great place to sit and have a beer - although you will notice a substantial price difference for the pleasure!Beautiful buildings and lots going on around the square

awesome place. lots of attractions, entertainment, food. Just the experience of sitting on the benches and watching the crowds go by as you enjoy the street food and a beer is fantastic! Free tours start here. Restaurants are a little expensive. Segway tours can also be bought here with some bargaining on price.
Don't miss Old Town Square. No trip to Prague is complete without a visit here. Join the throngs oohing & aahing at all you'll see around you.
Nice square, good music.. Nice place, the clock is a little disappointing. But for the rest one of the nicest squares in Prague.

many things to do. The square is surrounded with many shops and restaurants and there are many activities to do! I highly recommend! There is also the famous clock, which you can also visit. There are also monuments and churches and you can also get to see live music bands in the evening especially.
Huge square, with lots of places to sit and people watch. You absolutely must go here! You can get terrific pictures of the Astronomical Clock, even if the square is chock full of people watching it.

Very crowded but great atmosphere and architecture.. I only had a couple of hours so basically limited to a walk around. I used The maps app on my I-phone to navigate; good because it actually pinpoints where you are. It is difficult to navigate your way through the small winding streets with just a paper map. The square is brimming with fantastic architecture although I found it extremely crowded when I was there. You can escape down numerous side streets for a slightly more relaxed drink or food.Great atmosphere. A must place for visitors.
Good. It is one of the famous square of Prague, every one must visit it. There are so many shopping markets near by this place.

Middle Age Movie Scenes Feel!. It's a must visit! I feel I am in the middle age of movie scene when I visited the square. Every building looks so historical and full of culture. Lots of interesting shops in the nearby streets. Just to sit there and see the people, feel the atmosphere, hear the old clock, are sensational! Pay attention to the details of the building decorations and the stories, you will definitely feel worth of it. I really love the architecture style. If you also love architecture, you will fall in love with the square. Have a traditional Czech meal to indulge yourself in the ancient times. This place is definitely the one of the most beautiful squares I have ever visited! I sat at the fountain for half an hour, really enjoying it. Don't miss it. Stay at least 2-3 hours for the square so that you can fully "experience" it. Highly recommended!

Good spot to hangout. Good place to hangout when you are in the city. There's a lot of cool vendors selling all sorts of snacks/desserts. If possible, go to the top of the tower, usually a long line for it though.
Too Crowded. Yes this is a beautiful square but the crowds make it very difficult to enjoy. Perhaps visiting in the off - season (if there is one for Prague) would be better.

Just gorgeous!!. Amazing, amazing, amazing!! Loved it! We went during Christmas so it was extra beautiful! You can get lost in the old-time beauty in this place, there's amazing food, open markets, watching the astronomical clock on the hour is also great!

Great Place. Old Town square is a lot of fun. They have vending shops on the side of small souvenirs and food, and the square has multiple restaurants (most more expensive because they are on the square - I recommend walking a few blocks from the square to get more reasonable food). At night people get drinks and sit around in the square and hang out, there was also some awesome music.

The Old Town Tower is a must-visit. Lots going on here: history, architecture, sculpture, vendors hawking just about any & everything, throngs of tourists & street performers; the whole thing ringed with cafes & restaurants.
Must visit Old Town Square!!. Must visit place in praque! Beautilf historic clock! Lots people! small food spots! great atmosphere!

Great area but prepare for crowds. Fascinating and historic, but you have to be okay with the maddening crowds. It's literally packed from morning to sundown, particularly in the summer. Lessened the enjoyment quite a bit, at least for us. Still, a magical area to explore and the architecture is amazing.

Beautiful square. Very busy centre of the tourist trail. Go early whilst it is still quiet. It gets busy with big tours and when the astronomical clock gets ready to strike the hour. The clock is fascinating but we sure to get a good spot. Look up at the buildings and the painted houses and name signs - can you guess the name of the house is good for the kids . Take time to,explore the history of the square and watch the entertainment
Clock on the Hour!. Very crowded area, don't eat on the square as its very targeted to tourists, though its nice to have an ice cream and wait for the hour to see the astronomical clock!
Shouldn't miss. Lot of people, everyone watch the Orloy. Pretty buildings - everywhere. Shops with puppets, stalls with food, bars, restaurnts. And great mood!

Amazing. It was really nice old town. The clock was amazing. It was Christmas time when I visited Prague and there was a Christmas market with shops selling all kinds of traditional stuff and local food and desserts. It is like the whole place is taken from a fairy tale.
Main Place in Prague. Wow Place lots of things to see in it- 800 years old Clock which works so well even after a long tears with impressive statues.

All tourists go there. Very noce to have a glass or a light meal in the take away small spots near the Town Hall. You also have many more expensive restaurants all over the place. Usually there are street musicians doing their performances. It is a very lively place.
Old world architecture. Great architecture. Some areas have a lot of graffiti was ruins the beauty. Very touristy. Beware of people pick pocketing and overcharging because you are a foreigner.
Old Town. A must see while in Prague and the people ahh but the art and buildings are great. Can't mention any food to get because, well none worth mentioning.

Amazing but be careful of your possessions!. Excellent view of the city, lots of shows and activities; but be very careful of gypsies and pickpockets! Keep your bag in front of you, leave important documents in hotel safe, split your money and put them in several different places. Do not take pictures for anyone, avoid taking money out in public, and it is best to stick together. Most of the time you cannot even tell if you are pickpocketed. It is a beautiful city, but the amount of people trying to steal from you is insane. big giveaways to pickpockets:- they will dress like tourists; cameras, iphones, backpacks-they spend an unusual amount of time trying to take a picture (especially with selfie sticks) and most of the time, they are just keeping the camera open to see what is behind them.-they might dress a bit more extravagantly: and usually they are paired or in groups. -they will also stand in one spot and watch, their eyes dart back and forth scanning you for where you may put your money and your important documents. other than that, definitely wait for the hour for the clocktower to show the 13 apostles and the skeleton shaking his head!

Good to visit. There are many attractions located in this sqaure. There is a church to visit, segway tours, castle tours, and restaurants and càfe are located in this square. Night visit is also good.

Visiting Prague. Absolutely loved this city. We took a guided walking tour and briefly hit all of the main sites and learned the history of the area before revisiting some of the sites we found most interesting.Planning on returning in a few years. Way too much to see in the 2 days we spent there.

Crowded but lively. Like a lot of European cities, Prague too has a buzzing square. This square is adjoining the astronomical clock. This square is crowded but if you are looking for a lively place to spend sometime in the evening, you can visit this place. It has street performers and many restaurants to grab a bite or enjoy a drink or two. We also saw silent protesters supporting political causes. Do not come with too many expectations and you won't be disappointed.

A Prague delight . The old town square has a lot of fine architecture and squares and churches to see also it has a bustling market and cafe bars a plenty This city has a lot of old world charm mixed with a modern twist you will have a pleasant few hours getting a feel for this vibrant area

An incredibly vibrant and beautiful city center. The old town square is an unmissable part of exploring Prague (you can't miss it if you're walking around and neither do you want to). There's also a very famous clock design on the main building that has some rich history surrounding it. Overall, a very beautiful place

Visit during the night for a greater appreciation. We met such cool people in this part of the town, grant it they were dressed as ghouls, and ghost, as we took a night tour of the town and learned a great deal about the haunted parts.

Crowded but a center for your visit. For a tourist this is a must. Not only can you start to several destinations, Charles Bridge, Jewish Quarter, there are sites on the square. The Astronomical Clock, the Jan Hus statue/memorial, buildings of architectural interest, Tyn Church, etc.

Charming square and clock tower. Old Town Square is so charming that you feel like you are in Disneyland. The large square is perfect for walking and people watching. There are often musicians playing a variety of music in the square. Don't forget to see the astronomical clock (every hour on the hour). You can also go into the clock tower (stairs or elevator) where you can walk all around for a 360 degree view of Prague.
Spend a while. A delightful place to spend some time, just admiring the buildings and the life going by. It does get very crowded, especially around the astronomical clock each hour.

Interesting Sites to Visit. Old Town Square has many nice sites to visit including the Astrological Clock, has many street performers, cafes, bars, and food places to choose from. Well worth a visit while in Prague.
The clock is a BIG disappointment. Nice square, surrounded by shops, full of tourists, lively, a must place to go, visited two or more times daily during the trip

Good point to start with the tour. You can´t miss this lovely place with the main tourist point called Orloj - The Clock on the Town Hall. This is also the place with the most expensive restaurants in Prague and place, where you should watch your bags due to mass of tourists. In the Town Hall is located the main Information centre.

Stunning architecture!. The Old Town Square is breathtaking. The buildings surrounding it are beautiful and gives you that "sense of place". It is a lively place with lots of tourists, so an early morning visit will give you the opportunity to take pictures without the crowds.

Stunning. First time in Prague and I was not disappointed!! The Old Town Square is a must see with beautiful architecture, shops and small bistro restaurants which provide excellent food which wont break the bank. Am amazing place to visit and cant wait to return

Walking into a Fairytale. Being Old Town Square, it's bound to be touristy. That's to be expected because the Astronomical Clock is what most of us visit Prague for. There are plenty of cafes and lovely bars nearby, and enjoy the many many talented buskers along the streets. People are there mostly to sightsee and shop. Don't forget to bring home some lovely Bohemian Crystals whilst you're at it, but buy at recommended outlets only to avoid a hefty price hike. I enjoyed getting lost in quaint little lanes the most to discover some real shopping gems and old bars, some breweries are at least 600 years old!

Nice area good location shops and galires on the square. Also there is a free walking tour that starts there and you can. Nice area good location shops and galires on the square. Also there is a free walking tour that starts there and you can also walk up the clock tower for an amazing veiw. Great area for restaurants and to meet people

Very live. All roads in historic town of Prague lead here.. Full of action.. Excellent positive vibes here. Cafes, performers, street food add to the entire experience. Absolute must visit while in Prague.
Easy to visit and a must see. Who would go to Prague without visiting Old Town Square? We didn't stay there but somehow ended up there every day of our trip. Stunning in its beauty.
Too crowded and touristy. I tried to avoid this place by going around it as much as possible. Too many people and always the fear of being pick-pocketed.
Live !. Being in this place is very enjoyable. You feel you are full of energy to spend your time and have lots of fun in this place.

Wonderfull place. This place is the heart of prag that's why first interesting monument to visit at begining so you can start to live real prag. Around there are the restorants and also most importants monument. On the place you can see a lot of street a rtists. Everybody should live this place. Enjoy it!

Charming Square. This is the most happening square in Prague and of course very crowded. Anytime of the day you visit its wonderful experience. The square is full with street performers. The atmosphere in square is very vibrant. Don't miss to visit Old Town Hall. It provides amazing views of square and as well of the Prague city.
pleasant surprise. there is so much going on either day or night don't miss the clock at night and free entertainment in square at night
Beautiful. Great atmosphere here. Just wandering around so many little things to look at. The clock was certainly a highlight.
A lovely experience.. Enjoyed every minute the bands playing were fabulous what a lovely atmosphere. Tourists all around taking photographs and selfies. Enjoying all.
Must visit area in Prague. Buzzing atmosphere, great entertainment day & night, must visit area, spectacular photos in the evening

The Hub of Prague. We stayed at a hotel near the Old Town Square and visited on quite a few occasions during our stay there. The Square has just about everything going for it that you can think of. First of all it is a huge town square that is a major meeting place in the City. There are always tons of people there with many street performers providing various types of entertainment. But even with all those people it never felt crowded and we were there during the high season. There is of course the main attraction there: The Astronomical Clock, which everybody needs to not only see ring at the top of every daylight hour, but should hear about the story of its creation and design. There are alos a nice variety of shops in the area, from everything ranging from little souvenirs, to Swarovski Crystal, to luxury high end fashion down the nearby streets. Plus there are also a variety of restaurants with patio seating around the edges of the Square. One word of caution, if you eat at one of them don't get 'worked' by one of the waiters for a bigger than customary tip just because you they realize you to be American or British.And when you've done everything you want to do at Old Town Square, it is a hub to head towards the Charles Bridge, of the Prague Castle, or the Powder Tower and Opera House or nearby Republic Square, or Wenceslaus Square.There's a lot going on at Wenceslaus Square, but for my money I'd choose the Old Town Square as my desired destination to stay by.
Felt like 18th century magic. So vibrant and interesting, shops and eateries all around. Vehicles banned in sections. Watch however you don't get run over by a Segway.

Absolutely packed but beautiful if you get a chance to see it!. quite a big square, lots going on so make time for it and if you can, enjoy some of the bars and cafes in the square - unlike other cities, they are not a rip-off and quite pleasant! we enjoyed a few cocktails whilst sitting beneath the church. avoid midday as it gets ridiculously busy.
A great place. This is the hart of Prague. It is a lot of tourists here but you can easily see all the sights. A trip up in the bell tower is a must. You'll get a great wiew over the city.
Busy and interesting. The square is a hub of activity with performers and special wares for sale. Local food products are also available

a vibey great area to enjoy some dinner and chill. lots of people around , a busy tourist centre. many shopping places to walk around. It had so much culture and Prague is really a great place to visit , people here are very nice. well done Prague.

Delightful Piece of Old Europe. Lots of history, architecture and an astronomical clock that it will do anything short of predicting tomorrow's weather. Just don't expect it to sing and dance like a cuckoo clock. It mostly just sits there with a crowd of tourists waiting for it to do something.
Go by 8-9 am to beat the crowd.

Its a clock like no other. A visit to the Old Town Square will allow you the ability to take in the fantastic astronomical clock which puts on a show every hour. The square also boasts some great outdoor eating establishments.

action square. this is a great place to visit, full of history and action ,street performers, people selling food, realy good sausages, lots of tourist shops and this is where you pick up the local tours , the clock tower is well worth the wait.DO NOT CHANGE MONEY HERE GO TO A BANK>
Beehive of action. Center of activity from street performers to restaurants to an astrological clock. The Jewish quarter where Kafka lived is ot far away.

Beautiful buildings, lovely area to walk around.. Such beautiful architecture and a bustling atmosphere makes this area somewhere you must visit when in Prague. Really it's the centre of town, bars, restaurants shops. Wonderful.

The Square That Never Sleeps. Old Town Square in Prague's Old Town is a thriving meeting place. There's several historic buildings around the edges of the square, the square itself is dotted and flanked by many different bars, Restaurants and Street Food and there always seems to be something going on.First day I was there I was watching the ornate mechanical display on the Old Town Clock as it struck 11am while off to the side of me on the Square itself, people clad in old style military uniforms fired muskets into the air.If you like your global brands, Hard Rock Cafe, Kayote Ugly, English Pub, Irish Pub (2 of the many in the City) and KFC are all at or close by the square.
Great Rail Journeys - Beijing to London. There are great buildings to see, people performing in the square & the famous astronomical clock. This is a great place to visit. Loved all of Prague

Wonderful . A must see when in Prague. The astronomical clock and the church of the Lady of the Tyn are both on this square along with some excellent restaurants including Caffreys Irish Pub. Very busy as you would expect. Have a coffee at one of the places there and enjoy the people going by.
Worth a visit. Worth a visit :) Beautiful buildings all around. Personally i found it all similar to the other cities but still while in Prague , the old town square is a must visit

Amazing buildings and too many people. The place was so beautiful with its architecture and the buildings around. It cant be missed when visiting the city. STILL this place was so crowded, it makes the stroll really hard to enjoy. The atmosphere (apart from all the tourist walking around) is great! During the day there were several really amazing musicans there playing!

Beautifuk. We managed to visit just as the sun was setting and sat in one of the cafes for a drink. Lovely atmosphere, shame we missed the clock and could have done without the annoying salesmen trying to make me go on a Segway!

Great Atmosphere. The centre of activity in Prague. The square is always very busy, even at midnight! lots of Bars and restaurants, live performers and people trying to sell you pub crawls and Segway hire but it all makes for a good atmosphere. And of course there is the Astronomical Clock which is a must see on the jour.

Crowded but well entertained. This square is overcrowded with tourists that's for sure, however we where here to and that had a reason it's a nice square with some stunning buildings around it. the whole day street artist here around to entertain with various acts, some of them where actually very good.

Main Square Disney. This is a gorgeous square but it is ALWAYS packed with tourists! It feels a bit like Disney Bohemian Style. Still it is a must if you are in Prague for the first time. Make sure you walk a few blocks away from this area if want to eat without overpaying. There are great little restaurants everywhere fin Prague so you won't have to walk very far.

Plenty of entertainment!. So much is happening on the square. The sights are impressive in every direction. The old town tower is worth the hike up. There are street artists performing - from bubble blowers to soccer stars to magic tricks, etc. Most tourists seemed to understand that a tip is the price of entertainment, but some observed and then just walked off. Shoddy behavior. We had already eaten dinner so we had a drink on a second floor restaurant with a great view out. This removed us from the traffic and noise of the crowd below, but still allowed for great views.

Wow! Thank god for this ancient Prague town square.. More than the Prague Castle, this zentrum (Town Center) is a must, must visit. If not, you never been to Prague! right? In the center you will be surrounded and mesmerized with theancient and beautiful buildings and taken back to ancient culture and times in this Czech capital.

That clock!!. Loved this old town! Tricky to get around the streets (I got lost a couple times) but so charming! The clock in the old square was magnificent. Loved the story behind it and was awestruck at how incredible it was. A must see.
Beautiful Square. It is the main square in Prague. It is a really nice square, where you can look everywhere and the view will always be stunning.

Lovely. Always busy. Always being asked to go on some drinking crawl or tour. Always being asked to hire a Segway.
The thing is, you ignore this as it is so beautiful there. The clock, the buildings, the history.
A must on all itineraries in Prague.
Historic but crowded. Historic but crowded, at all times of the day.. Fun, nevertheless.. Better to visit with a tour guide

Just amazing. Amazingly preserved building of design and architecture. Visit Charles Bridge or the Palace, spend time sitting in the squares with quaint restaurants or in the evening just walk around the old jewish quarters in the narrow streets full of people, shops and buskers playing music.

This is how Europe looks in my dreams. Prague was my first stop on a concert tour I took last summer with my choir, and I long to return to that city. I could spend all day strolling the Old Town Square, visiting the shops, dining in outdoor cafes, visiting the sites, enjoying the street musicians and simply people-watching. The architecture is spectacular and so well preserved. Dare I say that you haven't seen Europe until you've been to Prague, the heart of which is Old Town Square.

Nice place - the square.... We have visited Prague in December, Xmas time and I was a bit disappointed. Thank God for the Old Town Square, cause I think it's the only place in Prague where you can feel the Xmas spirit. The rest of the city is dull in my opinion and did not meet my expectations... Maybe I should visit in the summer again, but I don't like doing this to be honest.
Awesome place . The place is so active with talented people.. The buildings are amazing there, an awesome place for photo shooting :) it is a must place to go ..
Old Town Charm. This is the main square in the old town. There is lots of activity and things to see. There are lots of places for shopping, food, and the clock tower is lovely

Fun and lively area. Teaming with people, lots of traveling students, open mike in the Square, horse and buggy rides, restaurants, astronomical clock tower attracts hundreds every hour - very lively all the time.

Lovely spot. I was traveling by myself and spent a lot of time at the restaurants on the square. It was December but the outdoor cafes were covered and offered heat and blankets. Loved sitting there with a glass of wind and watching the people.

Great place with lots of history - but a bit too overcrowded.. Went there several times during my stay in Prague in May 2015. A nice historic place but a bit too overcrowded with tourists. Probably best early morning or late afternoon/evening. I would recommend Googling for some history walks. Made one with an old guy who told us about Prague in modern history. Part of the tour centred around this square. Really brought everything to life and put the city in context - also this old town square.

Back in time at the Old Town Sqare. On a hot summer's day of 38C, the town suare was full of people eating ice creams. Buskers and bands were entertaining the holiday crowd. If you want to se the famous Astronomical Clock chime at midday, get there early as there are 1000's of tourist with their selfie sticks!

Old Town Square- Prague. This a vibrant town square and a good meeting or hanging out area. Street theatre, music and amazing buildings. If you are staying in the Old town you will enter this magical area on many occasions when on your way elsewhere and that is no hardship. Enjoy.

Endangered species. How can I not rate this a "5"? I've been visiting Prague often for the past 7 years (lived in CZ for 3 years) and of course I enjoy the architecture and history of Old Town Square, despite hordes of tourists. But Prague needs to think more about preserving what really matters...the architecture and historic atmosphere. A sex 'museum' at one entry to the square...really? And since a couple years ago a Thai massage parlor "defacing" the facade of an otherwise exquisite building facing the Hus statue. Does free enterprise really have to result in this?
Expectation of Old Town Square. Lovely preserved square and well worth a visit. The Astronomical Clock is worth seeing although the expectation of what happens on the hour could be disappointing.
One of my favorite places. I went to Prague 3 times and this is one of the places i must go to every time, day and night is wonderful there
Vivid day and night, flavour of old times preserved. Cozy place to be, very busy day and night, lots of restaurants with terraces, street concerts, food stands and souvenir shops.

wonderful place, just dont eat there!. Lovely square, full of tourists in August - JUST DONT EAT THERE! This is one of the centre pieces of Prague and its well worth the time to wander around it, especially outside the mad tourism number hours. Spectacular architecture across a wide range of styles and eras, but the restaurants all trade voraciously on the location. It was quite possibly the worst food and service experience I have had in twenty years. Appalling. If you go to any restaurant away from the obvious tourist traps, you will find better value, better service and FAR better food!

Everything here to see and do. Lots and lots and lots of people restaurants bars and entertainment, also the main astronomical clock is the attraction to see but there is plenty more also, there is a great deal of history for Prague and worth reading up on before you go o you do not miss anything

Brilliant Square with a lot happening. This is a beautiful square with a lot of restaurants around it - which I would recommend not eating at as they are overpriced tourist traps - as in any main square!In the day the square gets pretty crowded, largely at the changes of the hour when everyone wants to watch the clock! There were usually buskers or people doing some kind of display.

Spend a day in the square. This is area is so full of history. There are many old buildings to explore and all around the square are places to eat or have a drink. There are shops, which we really enjoyed and many jewelry stores with jewelry you don't see in the U.S.
Loads of fun and historically significant.. Beautiful architecture, fun shopping, good restaurants, steeped in history, and a fantastic place to people watch. What more could you want?
You cannot miss it.. Visiting the three main squares of Prague is easy and fun in order to see the buildings and people watch.

old time square. So cool. Great vibe and beautiful architecture. We arrived when the Bohemian Jazz Festival was on and it was super awesome. The entertainment was wonderful. Lots to see in this area. Great shops and restaurants although we ate a little off the main square in a small traditional more modestly priced establishment and then went for a beer near the main square to watch the live music. It was very beautiful.
Beautiful and romantic. Beautiful and romantic. Historical places to visit. Full of life. There's music, stores, restaurants, enterteinment. Try the saussages !!!!!

Great Atmosphere!. Great place to sit and relax over a drink or meal. Main hub of the city centre with good selection of very good and reasonable bars and restaurants to sit and watch the world go by. Lots of narrow cobbled streets leading from the square with great wee shops and bars, restaurants etc. There was entertainment in the square in the form of street acts and bands playing and thousands of people gather to observe the old town clock on the hour to watch the 12 apostles appear from the old wooden apertures. I would definitely recommend going In the summer months because you can walk for miles around the sights of Prague which is much more pleasant in the better weather and you have the option of sitting outdoors relaxing eating and drinking which would you couldn't do In the cold winter weather. Prague is a great city to explore with lots of history and beautiful architecture. Definitely worth a visit and we will almost definitely go back! Great shopping too.......every designer store you could imagine and definitely very cheap to eat, drink, transport and shop!

Amazing square!. One of the best squares in Europe!! Lots of great places to eat and drink and at night we just sat down in the square and talked to lots of people from all over europe, not rowdy very relaxed and everyone really friendly
Nice but to crowded. this place is very nice to see, but i feel that the restaurant there are very touristic and expensive.

Fantastic historic town centre. A beautiful old town square with some fantastic buildings. Be sure to visit the old town hall (the tours are informative and are a good way to get a feel for Prague's history), the tower (great views of the city, but fairly slow-moving queues) and the church of 'Our Lady of Tyn'. The sausage stands around the square serve traditional hot Czech food and cold beer; perfect for hungry tourists!
good atmosphere . beware of being ripped off though with food and drinks right at the edge of the square. go a few streets back and it's cheap!

For the romantic at heart.. The old town center is like coming out of a fairy tale with princesses and witches. It has such a romantic atmosphere and the hundreds of people there at all times, mostly young, feel and express their romanticism . There is music in the air, clowns in the center, carriages, all leading to a festive atmosphere full of life until very late. Loved it but beware of pickpockets.
Beautiful . Very beautiful. Crowded of course. But still beautiful. Funny thing is that there are these water sprinklers everywhere to cool the crowds!
Walking the sin square. Perhaps one of the most stunning city squares in Europe. Best time for pics is very early at dawn. Then return to the same location at 1300.
A must see. A must see in the old town, the old clock is beautiful and the architecture is stunning. It gets very crowded, early hours of the morning are best.

Hub of the old town wheel. We walked through the square from our hotel to just about everywhere we went. It was magical each time we went, day and night. We were there once on the hour for the astronomical clock event and that was cute. Nice Starbucks there as well as restaurants.

Bustling, cultural spot. If you want to soak up the ambience of Prague, this is the place to be early evening. Near the clock tower there are usually hundreds of tourists. But if you round the corner slightly and find a spot to sit you're suddenly emnersed in locals. A lovely place to relax with an ice cream and people watch.
Intelectually free. Excellent atmosphere, everybody felt good. We saw people doing what they liked and everyone liked to do something good, not just to sing or to sell something.

Visit both at daytime and at night!. This is a main square of Prague old town, the historical center on the East side of the Vltava. A must-see in Prague. It offers beautiful buildings, restaurants and unbelievable amount of souvenir shops to the visitors. The most notable sights are the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, the astronomical clock and the old town hall.

Very Lively and Crowded. If you are in Prague you have to visit Old Town Square. It's lively and crowded with lots of restaurants, food vendors, and performers, not to say tourists. You can stroll around, eat, drink, kick back and people watch. The architecture of the surrounding buildings is beautiful! The whole square is beautiful! A must while in Prague.

Don't miss a day without visiting the square. Don't miss any day in Prague without visiting the Old Town Square, charming place with its two major attractions, the astronomical clock and the Church of our Lady before Tyn. Perfect place to take lunch or dinner, in addition to the musical activities that always exist in town.
Lively square with lots of everything.. Amazing views, lots of happening to late evening. Just remember not to litter or drink after 10pm, you maybe fined.

Beautiful but full of tourists. The place is beautiful. Looking like fairytale or something. This can also be seen in the huge amounts of tourists visiting the city. Our tour guide phrased it very well: it's like Disney, a complete different world; however nothing like the rest of Czech Republic.
Great atmosphere. Loved the buzz and the friendly atmosphere. Found it easiest to jump on a rickshaw for a couple hundred krona to get to places we wanted to go.

Worth It.. If you are in Prague you must go here. Night and Day - loads of fun. We stayed at a hotel in the Old Town so an easy walk. You just stroll baout once you have your bearings. The Bridge - the Castle etc. The square is nice for a coffee, food or a drink. Nights are grat - make sure you buy some sausage or Trblnka (?) from a stall the first can be spicy - the second quite sweet. Can be busy - watch for the con artists - and never stop to talk to people who want to hussle/hassle you. DO NOT use the on/off bus - see my report.But - do go to the square and allow some time in light and dark to experience it.
Nice, crowded, must-see. Nice and quite packed, just as you'd expect from a respectable landmark such as this. Try and visit it on the hour, to experience the astronomical clock show.

Here you can enjoy the very animated Prague. The animation is everywhere, with dancers, mimes,... You can have the best view from the tower of the old town hall. The astronomical clock is also here with animation every hour. You can eat and drink on the terraces.

The place you must not miss! This was our first outing, totally worth it.. It's the place you can not miss, bring comfortable shoes, it's a happening place. Lots of walking, We sampled some of the goodies from the street vendors, totally worthy!

Old Town Square that breathes history and culture!. Prague as a historical city offers many great attractions for tourists, but Old Town Square should be among the first to visit. The Square breathes history and culture, is filled with many wonderful restaurants and people and tourists just flow through it with joy and energy. On holidays and christmas, the Square is filled with wonderful markets that only add to the atmosphere.
There is no word to say. it was excellent.. Forget every thing and don't think its crowded. Just enjoy. Because you will find many thinks to do. people are very friendly and humble.

If you dislike crowds, avoid the old town on weekends.. Avoid the old part of Prague on weekends, especially on Sunday. The square was wall to wall people, many selling junk. There are about 4,000 Americans in Prague, and it seems like most hang out in the old town, soliciting American tourists for hotels, Segue tours, and other 'attractions'. Shades of 1990s Amsterdam!
An absolute must see in Prague. A lovely square surrounded by lots of brilliant architecture. The Astronomical clock is great. There are a lots of restaurants to go to.
A Must See. This is an area for museums, cafes, shopping and siightseeing. Plan to have a look around for at least an hour. There will be a mix of locals and tourists.
Beatiful. One of the most beatiful old ities in the world. Not as large as Rome or Venice but very beatiful, romantic and also extremely easy to tour...
Awesome. The old town square in Praha is a must see for all tourists. Most people go to Praha just to see the square. Lots of restaurants, old buildings, etc. I can stay there the whole day.

It's crowded for a reason... Absolutely beautiful and worth going to! :-). As a lot of the reviews have mentioned most of the times that we went to Old Town Square it was pretty busy. However, sometimes it wasn't bad at all! It tends to be the most crowded every hour on the hour when the Astronomical Clock strikes, which is one of the main attractions at Old Town Square. If you have the time to go up to the top I highly recommend it... the views we had from looking down were absolutely gorgeous! There was also always something fun going on... Magic shows, horse and buggy rides, a person painted like a statue, etc. Definitely a fun place to go and walk around!

it was too touristic. It is great place, but there are always too many people. Maybe too touristic. We tried several times to get there in time when there are not so many people but it was impossibile.

Very nice square but is usually very busy. As others have mentioned, this is a particularly nice square to visit but the only slight gripe is that it does tend to be very busy. This isn't a problem but just be patient and be calm enough to handle the crowd. Staromestske namesti shouldn't be missed!

Charming but crowded. Really picturesque town square with old buildings, statue, lots of space, fast food, cafés, but can get very crowded. If you want to climb the tower , do it at 10 mins to the hour as everyone will be gathering to watch the astronomical clock at the base. Free walking tours depart from northern end.
Great for night. Spectacular musicians of different types play for coins in their hats and the atmosphere was great there on Friday night.

Nice monuments but a mix between the hell and Disney Land. It is well known that the the inhabitants of Paris are worldwide top one in unfairness with the tourists. I believed that but Prague is better. This is the fourth time I visit Prague, 3 for business, one private and I have seen the deterioration of the situation. In the touristic area the Czech people are there only to grab your money with nothing in return. The monuments are superb therefore I would prefer to spend a few hours on Google Street View than spending money to be highly disappointed. Food is awfull.We have shorten our stay in this town and last advice, be carefull in the metro, stay quiet and be aware that emptying your pockets is a national sport

A must-see in Prague - we started each day here and explored off in different directions!. A fantastic and very romantic square, especially of an evening with the tolling of the clock, all the buildings lit up and the throng of the visitors.

Crowded, but gorgeous. This square is easily one of the most beautiful European squares. Crowds gather before the Astronomical Clock strikes the hour so if you're there for that, get a good view. You can catch a 20 minute horse and buggy ride or a rickshaw/moped type ride from the square also.

Astronomical Clock. Wonderful place to visit, such a lot to see. Lovely market. Do not miss the Astronomical Clock. It is amazing. So many gather every hour to see this clock when 2 small doors open with rotating fiquares & the bell rings

Too many people to fully appreciate the square.. Crowds of tourists, a long line of fast food carts that sell smoky stinky meats, cafes seating people all over the squad so you can't walk, tour groups infiltrating, music groups blaring their music.on stages....this is not a place you want to be in.. Please go early in the morning, or find your route a block away on any side of this square for the ambience and culture that you came for in the first place.

Everybody hisits because of the clock. There is not too much particular interest here except the astronomical clock around here. The buildings are old but they are old everywhere around this area of Prague. But of course a place to get nice pictures of the old town. Once again shops and restaurants are overpricee because this is the main touristic area so better avoid them.

Very beautiful, but busy. The architecture is beautiful. Interesting to watch the tourist, street performers for awhile. The Segway tour hawkers are a nuisance. Grab lunch or coffee at one of the patio restaurants & enjoy people watching.

Beautiful but busy. The architecture around the square is beautiful and varied. The astronomical clock is a key feature to see on the hour. The square is dominated by the towers of the church which look splendid at night. There are buskers, street entertainers and cafés everywhere. However, in August it was packed and eating would be better in one of the many side street restaurants.

Still has its charm. The square is now different compared to twenty years ago when I first visited Prague. Frankly, I more like when I first visited this square because there isn't so much crowd and no stage at the middle of square. After all, Prague main square still has its charm.
Old Town Square. Completely insane unless you get there before the crowds. Aim for 8:00am so that you can fully appreciate the magnificence of the square.
Charming Town Square. Old Town Square is charming. the cathedral is lovely and the old buildings amazing. The square is teeming with street vendors selling their handicrdafts.

Astronomical Clock and so much more.. Make this your central point - a wonderful space full of life. Ride on a Segway or horse and carriage or watch a street artist. Plenty of good places to eat but don't miss seeing the Astronomical Clock on the hour.

Must see in Prague but not for chilling out. You have to check the place out because of the Astronomical Clock and the church towers and those are indeed beautiful but however I would not recommend staying very long in peak season as it's very very crowded.

Lots of tourism attractions nearby.. Many famous tourism attractions near by and there are lots of restaurants to choose from here. Also, you can get most of the Prague souvenirs here, such as Koh I Noor stationary. Plus, Many boutique stores are just beside it.

Fantastic!. The Old Town Square doesn't fail to impress. So much going on. The "clock" is the centre of attention on the hour drawing huge crowds congregating to watch the mechanical operation of this iconic marvel for its time. Restaurants, shopping, entertainment, the old town square is a definite one for your list of places to visit.

Great architecture and history. You have the astrological clock built in 1410. You have the statue of Jan Hus and the historical perspective on his influence on Protestant movement. And then you have the great vibe and beauty of a bustling and fun city. There is a drawback though. You have to watch out for the obnoxious Segway vendors that zip up next to you. I just found that really annoying.
Fun, Lively Area. We loved Prague and thought Old Town was charming. Definitely stop by for a look around and soak it all in.

heart of prague. if u are in prague u cant miss out on this square its worth paying the visit, its always crowded in the morning and at night. u will get to see the astronomical clock which is very famous. there are segways around there. the shops in this area is a bit expensive tho.

Beautiful area. Beautiful area and would be more so with about 10,000 fewer people in it but can't blame them for wanting to be there. Lot's of street entertainers and just a few of them with any talent.

A fairy tale center for the city with architecture for everyone!. Einstein played his violin her - yes he was an excellent musician too! Walk through the cobblestone streets and look up - the architecture is splendid. If some of the locations look familiar, Prague is a major destination for movie and commercial production because you can go from baroque to gothic to revival to neoclassical to art deco, just by going around the corner!

Worth A Visit. Worth seeing but avoid lunch time when the crowds are crazy. Don't bother waiting around for the clock tower 'show' we happened upon and were glad we hadn't waited, its a nothing novelty.Good place to get pick pocketed. Its a shame they allow segways on this historic site. Far to many people around for first time users to be learning how to uses them around groups of elderly and children
Great city. We loved everything in Prague. Old Town full of life and character. Prague is a beautiful city. We felt safe walking everywhere.

Old Town REview. It was really great to do one of the free walking tours they offer. We went through our hostel. Its a long affair so make sure you bring water. They give you a chance to get a snack and cool down. Definitely worth it!
A Must for the Prague Experience. Great spot to visit, eat, enjoy a bevy and people watch. It can be very busy so be prepared to share the space with lots of people and segways

Avoid July. Old town is clearly worth a visit. It's just not worth a visit in July when it's crowded and you are continually warned about pick pockets. The clock, the people and the environment are great. I rated this as average just based on the July visit. It would probably get a higher rating from me on September

Busy, buzzing and very picturesque.. The heart of the Old Town. Picturesque and buzzing, it is almost impossible to avoid if you are in Prague. Surrounded by interesting buildings and full of street performers and street cafes and restaurants. At popular times though it will be crammed with people.
History ticking along. A great place to visit with lots of interesting features all around. The clock is amazing, the surrounding buildings are all well decorated and the place is always busy.
loved it. Amazing place to visit with the most fantastic buildings,churches and monuments,lots of great restaurants/bars lovely atmosphere even in the small hours,it was a pleasure just being there.

Old Town Charm. I was there in the winter. It was cold, but still beautiful. I was lucky enough to be there when the Christmas market was still up and running. I was able to get warm wine and other drinks to keep me warm as I wandered the streets.
amazing. was there at Xmas and it is magic at that time of year.loads of markets and some snow if your lucky.wonderful lights and plenty of places to eat and drink.put this on the to do list.
Very nice place!. Very nice place! Must visit when you're going to Prague! But be careful. Always take care of your stuffs. There are mamy pickpockets there.
Busy. busy and vibrant. many shops. Shops in the area are a little more willing to ship! The hourly clock tower is as short as rumored- don't feel bad if you miss it.
Proper old European city square. Lots going on when we were there. Some great street entertainers and food. Impressive buildings all around - luckily survived WW" pretty much intact.
walking around. After short bussines trip, I stayed for a weekend and walk around the Old town. Tried to avoid the crowd andhords of tourists I enjoyed in small and narrow streets, little shops...
Visit the Christmas market!. The view itself could take your breathe away! we really enjoyed the cold weather with the hot wine served at the Christmas market

Happy time. My wife ,I and 6 other close friend visited old town square on July 2015. There were a lot of tourists everywhere. The buildings surround were very nice. There were several food vendors at street side. You can try some indigenous food over there. Don't forget to rush to the reputable Astronomical Clock to watch its performance in every hour.Even though there was a protest from local people while we 're browsing around. The riot police controlled the situation quite well. Anyway,our tour leader reminded us about the pickpocket, particularly during the clock performing. Fortunately, nothing happened to us.That evening,we walked,we ate,we took pictures, we bought a lot of souvenirs,we watched the performance,we exhausted with happiness

Gorgeous town square buzzing with fun, music and THE clock!. The Old Town Square is really like a permanent party all the time from late morning onwards - there are beautiful buildings on all sides, including, of course, the famous astronomical clock, which sets up its funny orchestra every hour, leading to the gathering of crowds that melt away afterwards, only to return an hour later! There is always music going on in the pedestrianised square, with sizzling sausages, beer and trdelniks always available. There are of course the typical restaurants surrounding the square - but these are really overpriced places selling bad food, whose business plan consists of selling a comfortable chair to sit on and a beer or two. Quite worth it, actually! There are also Segways, vintage cars and horse-carriages to hire. One could spend hours just sitting in the square - and we did!
Weekend in Prague. Old town- place where you can spend hiurs, hours and hours just looking around. The most I like old clock on the church. We where sitting in fron of it by the restaurant!

Beautiful old town square. The Old Town, for me, is the key attraction of Prague. The square is lively and very musical. Loads of food stalls lined the street and you might want to try the tredl or the traditional Czech pastry. There are many crystal and garnet shops as well as other souvenir shops. Do not miss the Astronomical Clock around the corner - the best time to go is before it chimes the hour.

Lovely. To be honest I have visited many cities and many 'old towns'. I feel there are others equally as nice - perhaps nicer.
However there are a number of beautiful buildings here. Lovely place to wander around and/or have a drink and people watch.

People watching at its best. The cafes outside, spilling people onto the steps are a joy to see. Everyone is happy to be in Prague! As you turn around you are greeted with one historical building after another. Should I visit the Powder Tower? The Clock Tower? Street performers? Its a lot to take in, and you'll have fun doing it.

The most beautiful part of the city.. This is a must-see. On the market there are several performances of all kinds of artists. Stay away from the restaurants and café's here because they are all tourist traps. The best food you can find behind the astronomical clock in the food stalls. They have very good Prague Sausage and Ham.

Beautiful but overcrowded square. The square is a gem in the old town of Prague. The houses surrounding the square look surprisingly well maintained, but this also applies to the other old parts of Prague. However, it is difficult to enjoy the beauty of the square because it is overcrowded. Sometimes you are almost pushed aside by guided walking tour groups while guys on a Segway make the square very unsafe. The best time to visit is early in the morning. It is a must whenever you are in Prague.

Really unique square . This place is always very busy as there's heaps of buskers and stalls set up during the day. The churches and architecture in this area are amazing to take in. Be careful with pickpockets in the large crowds, although didn't see any trouble personally. The restaurants in this area offer a fantastic backdrop to observe whilst enjoying a meal, however you have to pay more for it in this area.

Crowds gather on the hour, every hour to watch and listen to the astronomical clock, which has moving figures and a. Lovely architecture, narrow streets and alleyways with plenty of shops,restaurants,churches and museums to visit.

Old Town Square Prague - The Good, the Bad, and the don't Bother. Peer through the throngs of tourists, all led by the ubiquitous umbrella person, and dodge the segways to glimpse the unique and fascinating history and architecture of Prague Old Town. Fascinating avenues all lead to the square, yes its busy, yes its geared up for the tourist but don't let it put you off. Museums, Church's and Attractions all in one small area. Go to the top of the clock tower for a great view. (cost is about £2). Don't hold your breath or wait to see the astronomical clock strike the hour, but do have a good look at it, between 5 past the hour and about quarter to. Lively yes, just go with the flow, dance to the impromptu music and relax. Well worth at least one visit
Beautiful building.. Lovely building but difficult to see for the crowds, visit on the hour nto see the mechanism working.
A must see. great atmosphere, great street acts. superb choice of restaurants, menus and prices and the clock is a must see.

Interesting but CROWDED!. The square contains the Astronomical Clock that attracts many, many visitors. It's really hard to make one's way across the square because of that. Many little cafes and shops. Worth seeing, but don't expect to cross it quickly!

A must see!. Stunning architecture; Astronomical Clock worth watching on the hour every hour; busy, bustling part of the city, very popular with tourists. Only downside is food and drink very expensive here, definitely priced for tourists.

Center of Old Town. During our six days in Prague we found ourselves in the square time and time again. Restaurants and street stalls selling fun food surround the square and side streets lead to many venues. Saw the opening of the jazz festival and the large crowd in the square was so well behaved we were able to really enjoy it. The sound system was one of the best we had ever heard. Sat in an outdoor cafe eating dinner and listening to jazz!

Miserable in the summer. The one star applies to the square in the summer, during regular day-time hours. During that time, the square has all the charm of an airport terminal before the holidays, perhaps during an airline strike. While you're scampering the get out of the way of a horde of zombie tourists who don't know what's around them because they are listening to their guide through an earpiece, you're likely to get mowed down by one of the sleazy Segway guides who zip around chatting up the girls they'd like to have on their tour, or trampled by a mob of teens walking backwards while they film themselves. Whatever you do, don't try to stand still here! The old clock has already been replaced with a replica, and it might be for the best if they did the same with the rest of the square -- just put up cardboard mock-ups in the train station, let people photograph themselves there, sell souvenirs next door, and you'd eliminate 98% of the people in the square. By the way, if you were able to stand still and actually look at it, the square would be quite magical, but again, not possible in the summertime. If you've been to Prague before, you'll find it particularly sad.

Romance. This place is absolut romance. Great for couples for Valentine weekend or Christmas market. Architecture is lovely, food very tasty, prices are ok/not overprised. It's good to change your money for Czech Koruna.
Take in Prague. The architecture surrounding the square are beautiful. Lots of entertainers on the square, plenty of cafes and restaurants. Definitely walk through it and take in the scene.

Ham vendors, Prague Old Towm.. TOURIST BEWARE!Ham cooking on smoking logs looks and smells delicious, in the Old Town Square of Prague. Was looking forward to sampling.Advertised as 89Kc/100g (about £2.50), but they cut you a big slice of around 500g and refuse to give anything smaller saying this is a "portion". Nothing to say this on the stall however.For one person 500g is a ridiculous sized portion. And £12+ for a lump of ham from a street vendor is a rip off which some tourists are willing to pay - I suspect some are shocked at the size and price but too embarrassed to say anything . . and walk away . . . like I did.My "portion" was actually 2 pieces. I said I only wanted one. They refused. So, after an enjoyable (for me as I believed I was right) and loud argument I walked away . . . No sale.Tourists are being ripped off here. The young girl who was supposedly in charge was being totally unreasonable. Her side-kick cooking the ham and cutting the portion was verging on aggressive when challenged, the guy cooking the sausages looked so embarrassed.A German couple came to me afterwards saying they agreed with me and decided not to buy either.Everyone's choice how and where they spend their money - just please be aware of this con trick they employ to make you buy more than you want.Note - there are 2 stalls in Old Town Square (about 15 yards apart) owned by same operators. Neither would give a more reasonable portion.

Good atmosphere. Many many people here ,let you feel happy and excitedBe safety and comfort ,even back to hotel late ,be secure here Many bars ,restaurant inside ,you can walk around to search what you want to taste Nice and helpful of all citizens and staff Wonderful experience here

Center of Old Town. During our six days in Prague we found ourselves in the square time and time again. Restaurants and street stalls selling fun food surround the square and side streets lead to many venues. Saw the opening of the jazz festival and the large crowd in the square was so well behaved we were able to really enjoy it. The sound system was one of the best we had ever heard. Sat in an outdoor cafe eating dinner and listening to jazz!

Wonderful Old Town Square. A lovely Square, with much to see. Many attractions are clustered around here. The only downside is the number of vagrants begging. Something you done see in Krakow. Also too many Segways about the place. Food and drink are freely available in the bars and restaurants. I would try an establishment just off the Square as prices will be lower.

A delight for the eyes. This place is for sure the best for all the photographers. You can walk around and taking amazing pictures. Again here as it is true with most of the tourists destinations there are a lot of restaurants and bars nearby. Walking on a nice sunny day s the best you can get. Amazing architecture.
Great location.. Has amazing ambience, is open air though but gives a great view of the square. The waiting staff is not so warm but manageable,

Great place for a beer, snack and photo. Yes, surely it is full of tourists, but still it have some of its old charm left.
Sit down for a beer or twenty or a coffee and icecream.
There are all kinds of crazy busking with one man orchestra, mini pigs and such, love it!
Just beware of the wobbly tourist on Segways...

Why does everyone stand and wait for the clock to chime?????. Overpriced restaurants and shops line a busy, huge square. Don't bother watching the clock tower on the hour, the display is disappointing. Great for people watching and grabbing a snack,,,hit the side streets for smaller shops
A fabulous place to be on a sunny day. the square was filled with tourists chatting taking photographs having fun enjoying the space and standing in awe or the famous astronomical clock

It's all in the details . This is the centre of the town. Every meter owns its own history. From the legend of the how the giant clock was contracted to the demise of its architect to the subtle differences in the church towers hence referred to as Adam and Eve. The square is filled with people, cafes restaurants vendors musicians as well as guided tours and horse and carriage rides. The square also leads to the most prestigious of streets in Prague which boasts Cartie, Louise Vuitton etc...Read up before visiting or hire a guide it is wellWorth it. You need to know its history to fully appreciate. Marked as must visit for me.
Not to be missed. A must-visit place, to see the clock and there is a handy Starbucks nearby if hot and tired after all that sightseeing!

Centre of Prague. This felt the epicenter of Prague and we found ourselves returning several times over our stay. Plenty live music , looking at Astronomical clocks tower, horse & carriage and vintage car rides. Pubs a plenty, loved Caffreys bar with good Guinness.

A photographic moment amidst the city. If you want to join the tourist crowd wait at the clock at the top of the hour. People are trying to sell stuff all over, but if you just go to sit, take some pictures and observe the happenings around you it is a great place for people watching. In the winter there is a nice little market as well.

Wonderful square. For me this is one of the top attractions of Prague. You can hang around this square for a day and see new things all the time. Artists, performers, musicians, ball artists, human statues and thousands of tourists all the time. The square has nice food and drink stalls all over and their are lots of terraces all around. Mind you, on these terraces you pay the highest prices for drinks and foods, but it is worth it.
excellent. The Old Town is very nice everywhere many people everything is perfectly organized no clashes anywhere and I never noticed even a single policeman
Interesting square. Old town square is the liveliest spot in Prague. Walk around and enjoy a nice meal at one of the restaurants there to be able to soak in the beauty of Prague

Great ambiance!. Located right at the center of the Old Town, this place is surrounded by many landmarks and monuments, It really is a must go if you visit Prague. Plus, it is always full of musicians and street performers, giving it a great medieval ambiance.

Don't miss the historic astronomical clock!. Lots happen in the Old Town Square. Restaurants and shops line the large open square. Musicians and other performers abound, but are not overwhelming or annoying. That is a delicate balance. The astronomical clock is a big draw.

Don't let the details get lost amidst all the attractions and noise.. Read up prior - lots of little things can get lost in all that's happening here, Use the morning to go over the various historical sites in and around the Square, then avoid it during the afternoon. Come back in the evening for whatever concerts and/or buskers are playing - there's always something.

Fun. Full of all kinds of people, great architecture, and food.
Tons of photo ops and great people watching.

Wonderful!. The old town square is the most important attraction to visit in Prague. Most of the other attractions are located in the square. You can visit Pariszka street which has luxurious stores and brands. It's located near the square. Wenceslas square is an another nice place to visit and it's near the old town square.
Old and Original. A venue for weekend performances, good food and the astronomical clock. When in Prague you can't miss it.

BEATING HEART OF PRAHA. You simply cant visit Prague without going to the square, in all honesty you will find just by wandering around without even looking for it due to its magnetism in drawing pedestrians to it. it has got busy over the years and you will find all you want in it, bars and restaurants, street performers, markets and offcourse segways everywhere. Be mindfull of money exchangers on the streets you can get ripped off with Belarusian money worth nothing so use the berau de changes they are everywhere but rates differ so shop around. Euros arent widely idely accepted unless its a larger venue such as hotels.

The Place to be in Prague!. The Old Town Square is a “must-do” in Prague and is the heart of the city. Prague is a very walkable city so I’d recommend booking a hotel that is just minutes away. We stayed at the Green Garland B&B which was a 2 minute walk to the square. I’d recommend to go early in the morning before 8am to explore the city and the square as we did practically have the square all to ourselves. It was fun to see some brides take their wedding pictures this early in the morning. You have several sites in the square including the famous astronomical clock, Old Town Hall, St. Nicholas Church, Jan Hus monument and more. You don’t want to miss the clock striking 12pm where the Apostles come out. Popular sites including the Wenceslas Square, Charles Bridge, and Jewish Quarter are only minutes away from the square. The square is filled with street vendors, performers and lots of tourists! There is a market off the square as you walk toward Wenceslas Square, which was suggested to us by our tour guide to be the best place to purchase souvenirs! I’d recommend eat the traditional trdelnik, go to the top of the clock tower to view the city, and also eat at the U Prince Hotel, which is across the street from the clock. This is a very nice restaurant with a terrace that offers a 360 degree view of the city! The price was very reasonable as we ate pasta and salmon for only $35. If you don’t want to eat there you can order just drinks or just go to the top and snap a picture! The terrace doesn’t open until 11am.
Cute stalls. Beautifull place, nice atmosfare. You can eat and drink here, but prises are littlebit higher than in the other plases.
