Beautiful!. Saw this place both as part of a tour and on my own. So much beauty in one place! Take your time and enjoy the architechtural masterpieces, but watch out for the 'authentic' food stands - it's overpriced and not at all that tasty!

Square with an athmosphere. Very nice and clean place, with restaurants, musicians, many tourists, onlookers, waiting for the watch to play every hour!
Be part of it, sit down, drink a good Czech beer and enjoy life!

Beautiful.. Loved the views from the top of the astronomical clock tower.
Enjoyed having a pint of beer whilst sitting in the square..The place has a good buzz.
Must see the display the of ther twelve apostles as the clock strikes.. In my opinion is the most beautiful clock I have ever seen - the medieval astronomical clock was built in 1400 It´s amazing !!!

Can't visit Prague and not come here. Yes it is your typical tourist trap, but we're all tourists and for good reason it attracts people. Expect it to be super busy when the clock is nearing the hour, it's not the most exciting show but when you are there it is worth a watch (pun intended!) The buildings that line the square are beautiful and if you fancy spending your money in likes of Cartier and Salvatore Ferragamo you'll be in the right place next to Pařížská street. There are cheap food stalls and street entertainers. Expect reps selling tours and bar crawls and the like.
Crowded but worth the look.. Definitely a crowded area but worth the visit. The buildings and surrounding area were pretty. If you go up the clock tower, you will get a good view!
Best place in europe. The best town I Europe, this is the place to be when you want to relax and enjoy a nice atmosphere! So go there whenever you can!

entertainment and many bars and resturants. Packed at weekends too many stag parties do not be around after 10pm Pretty place with churches and the old town clock and visit the Charles Bridge and the Palace

Who could deny its beauty?. It is full of tourists, not surprisingly, but it does mark the start of a visit to Prague. Look out for the various concerts in the city; they are good value, especially held at the Clementinum.
Clock at the Old Town Square. Very popular place for visitors to hang around by the clock. It is very busy all the time, lots of churches to visit and live music.
Nice lively town square. This town square captures the essence of Old Europe. It is picturesque and quaint. Don't miss the historicJan Hus memorial.
Lovely but crowded. Great place, only downfall was that it was very busy but that's expected for such a lovely place!! There was live music when we went there and food stalls which were lovely :)
Tourist Square would be a better name. Great Prague ham from street vendors. Otherwise very packed with tourists and not an authentic feel.

Lovely square. Lovely square. Seems during my trip in Prague ended up there a few times. Especially nice during the evening with the open food stalls and the buskers doing shows and singing. Bit crowded, for obvious reasons, but definitely a must visit when in Prague. Interesting to see the church in the square - with its walled off front. Prices of the restaurants in the area are a bit above average for Prague centre, but nothing to write home about.

Like and outdoor museum. The tourist crowds in June were nearly overwhelming, but that's not the Square's fault. It has everything and more you'd expect from an Imperial (Holy Roman Empire) city square, with all the temporal (old guild halls) and spiritual (mighty church - Our Lady Before Tyn) monuments that would imply. The Astronomical Clock, which narrowly escaped being bombed in 1945, dates from the 14th century and is a marvel. Everywhere you look is something interesting and beautiful. The square is huge, and hosts many nice cafes which are perfect places from which to view the square and the other people, as well as to cool off in the hot weather. It's just a world-class medieval square, and you have to go see it; that's all I have to say about THAT.
Old Town Square. Lively and bustling with carts, food stands, musicians, street performers and plenty of tourists watching the Astronomical Clock endless. Wonderful for a stroll at all times of day.

Super-crowded but worth it for the pictures. Just avoid the touristy places that line it, which for the most part are sub-par and overpriced. The Astronomical Clock is a thing of beauty that's worth jostling your way through the throng of tourists alone.

RED UMBRELLA CITY WALKING TOUR. I enjoyed every minute of this - our guide Tijo Knol was amazing and I would recommend this way to see and gain knowledge of the City and the Czech Republic history to everyone!!I DO NOT RECOOMEND THE HOP ON HOP BUS TOUR IN PRAGUE!! It was a huge disappointment and waste of time and money!!
Loved it. They were having a festival and it was so much fun. I ate a pastry covered with sugar and cinnamon and they asked me if I wanted chocolate and I almost swooned.
Fairytale square. Must visit square in Prague. Amazing buildings and pubs around there. Check all the little streets for hidden places :)
Beautiful. A most pleasant, beautiful and perfectly located town square in the city center from where one can walk into all directions to visit plenty of monuments and shops.

All visitors to Prague must come here!. This is a must visit destination for Prague. Its busy almost all day and evening and has some stunning old buildings to observe and photograph. The bars and restaurants are all overpriced with dismissive service in most places. When you have taken your photographs head off in a different direction and find a bar or restaurant that is pleased to see you!

Must see square. One of the most beautiful central squares in Europe I have seen, with lovely shops, restaurants and architecture all around, the clock tower is an amazing feature, and this is a must see in Prague. However like others have mentioned, try to also explore outside of old town square as it can be busy, and it is important to look at other parts of the city and neighbourhoods. I think although the restaurants in the square can be overpriced, don't expect much in terms of food quality/service, but really stop to have a coffee or drink because I think its one of the most beautiful places for people watching and just to sit and relax to watch the square and all it's lovely activities.
Most happening place in Prague. This is the place where best restaurant and attractions of the Prague are located.Lot of activity takes place here. A must visit place spend time in evening.
Lovely European Feel. Lots of excitement in this beautiful european square. Nice for hanging out when the weather is good.
Nice. A lot of tourists and free tour agency, so a little crowded but it's one of a few wide place's the rest is really narrow.

Very similar to other squares elsewhere. Pleasant enough square but you could be in a number of other countries. Very busy with tourists and organised tours but still pleasant enough. Preferred the surrounding areas.

The place to be in Prague. It's the place to be in Prague. The big square is flanked by the churches and the astronomical clock. It has some great restaurants and pubs around. The atmosphere here is absolutely invigorating and bustling with people from different nationalities.

lovely place. i was there with couple of friends, i really enjoyed walking around and dinning in one of the restaurant around the square, the place takes you back to the beautiful history in a very inspiring way

do it.......then explore further out. a must for all travellers...but stay for too long. do the main attractions and then wander off and find somewhere equally as lovely but not full of very slow walking tourists.
must see. quaint and fell in love with place, lots going on in this area, lots of eateries, street acts etc, can get road train tickets here, horse and cart rides of city etc

Prague has lost its charm. Crowded with large groups of rowdy people, cigarette smoke overwhelming, street buskers with shocking things like large boa constrictors. This was my 6th and last visit to Prague. Never again.

Except for the crowds, a proud place to see. Next time I'd go there early in the morning to avoid the mobs. In the Kafka Museum I saw an old film of the square in the 1920s, with no gawkers or tourists. With the intense history and the magical astronomical clock, there's a lot to absorb while the selfles are going off.

Unbelievable. When people mention checking out a city's old town square in Europe the first one I think of and the first I would suggest as a must see would have to be Prague. The first time I experienced it it just didn't seem real. Looks like the back drop from a movie. Make sure to check it out during the day, and see it lit up at night! Try not to get sucked in and pay higher prices for food/drink at places on the square, go a street or 2 away from the old town square to pay more traditional Czech prices!
Lovely history. Beautiful area and buildings. Lovely ambience. I hope Macdonalds don't get too widespread in here. Garnet stone jewellery is proliferant here and good value.

Food and Fun. This is probably one of the largest and most beautiful squares in Europe. There is lots going on day and night from tours to performers. Where else can you find potato chips on a stick? If you are hungry, you will find every kind of pork and other foods in the various stalls as well as coffee, ice cream, and pastries. Too fun to experience only once.
Simply stunning!!!. Get your runners on and stroll is the best way to describe it!!! fantastic views and lovely bars and food!!

People. This square is constantly bustling with tourists viewing the street performers, astronomical clock and enjoying the shops and restaurants. A good spot to watch the world. If you wander through, know that the tourist information center has restrooms. Try to wander on the side streets as well, a totally different world.Enjoy the people watching.

Architectural history in one frame. This is a must have visit in Prague. You are able to see 4 different genres of architecture covering roman, baroque,Renaissance and Gothic all in the frame of one lens.Lots of good entertainers in the square as well. The astronomical clock is quite fascinating.The only down side was a big number of Segway drivers over running the square in their bid to rent you one of their machines.
Very Busy. Very popular area if you have young children then have eyes in the back of your head. Lovely square though, loads of small acts going on i.e fire play bands playing & more.
Great clock. The clock in the square dates back to the 14th century and is an astrological clock. On the hour you have to see the show. There are terrific views from the top of the tower

Lovely!!!. Lovely town square. We just came from Brussels so were not as blown away as we would have been otherwise but it was beautiful. Don't bother waiting for the clock to strike, though. It's really not worth waiting long for.

Picturesque. We were staying in an apartment which was 2 minutes away from the Old Town Square and some time after checking in, I just stepped out to see how the place was. Picturesque and breathtaking was the word. What a magnificent first impression of Prague.
Beautiful Area. extremely beautiful building and great architecture all around - beware of pickpockets that loiter and the prositutes on the squares.
fun shopping. The clock is beautiful. The buildings are so old! Great Architecture. Eat street food! Great pizza and goulash

A place not to miss. A place not to miss if you are in Prague. There is so much to see including the clock which is fascinating. Often a market with stalls in the centre of the square, good for presents.

Visit in the AM. A very enjoyable square, the tourist center of Prague. The traffic grows from 1 person per 100 sq ft in the morning to 15 people per 100 sq ft (literally) by nightfall with music being performed.

The very heart and soul of Prague. This square is undoubtedly the centre of the old city,and also the centre of the whole city of Prague.The vast space is bordered by mansion houses,palaces,the Old Town Hall,and two majestic churches all looking down on the monument to the nations hero Jan Hus.The famous astronomical clock built in 1410 is at the corner of the square and draws vast crowds to see characters set in motion on the clock every hour(on the hour).The clock also shows the state of the universe and the positions of the stars and the planets.

The centre of everything. Great place to spend an entire day. So much to see in such a small area. Crowded at times with incredible atmosphere. We were lucky enough to enjoy a free concert as they was a non alcoholic drink being promoted.

Amazing buildings, awesome vibes. Old Town square is a tourist magnet and fully deserves to be. Beautiful old,architecture; rich cultural environment; historical buildings and sites; great outdoor restaurants; a must to visit.

Go Early! Very Beautiful!. This is a must visit, the architecture was amazingly beautiful!I would highly recommend the ticket to the top of the astronomical clock tower for views of the city.I'd advise heading to the Old Town Square very early in the day, before the place gets absolutely swarmed with other tourists.Food & Drink here is very very expensive compared to options elsewhere in Prague.
clock. The Astronomical clock chimes on the hour, it is well worth being in the square when it chimes.Walking around the square and the city you nee very comfortable shoes.

Too many beggars . Prague is too wonderful for this overrated place. The most beautiful building was destroyed in during World War Two and the whole place is swarming with annoying beggars, Segway tour guides and basically anyone who thinks he can get money by nagging to tourists.To be honest you should still see this square but I wouldn't stay there for more then 10 minutes.

Too much to see in such a short time. We only had 36 hours in Prague from a day trip that we took out of Munich during Oktoberfest.Immediately upon arrival via train, we made our way to the old town square. There are literally hundreds of shops, cafés, and buildings dating back hundreds of years immediately accessible from the Square.If you make a trip to Prague and do not include the old town Square, I feel that it would be difficult to say that you actually visited the city of Prague.
old town center. There is always something goping around the old town quare. this is the real old town center. So many coffee shops and restaurants around.

Gorgeous area of Prague. First, the entire city of Prague is so special, and the square doesn't disappoint! I was there when the Christmas markets were going and it was just so magical. While I wouldn't say the square is an absolute "must", the area around it is so you might as well pop in to check it out!

Must go. Lots to see. Astronomical clock is beautiful although I can't quite figure it out. It's a must visit. Downside is it's too crowded and the beauty is spoiled by the crowd. Also noted everyone is holding tightly to their purses due to fear of pickpockets. It's a little stressful.

The heart of Prague.. What a wonderful area in the city centre with its lovely architecture and history. The astrological clock was well worth viewing. Wenceslas Square was most impressive too and a great location for enjoying a beer or glass of wine or two.... Many fine shops to get souveniers from.
charming place!. full immersion in history, beautiful buildings, loved the clock tower! very nice experience. Would go back definitely!

Great Architecture, just too many people. The square is huge and is the focal point of the Old Town.The facades of each of the buildings surrounding the square are individually beautiful.The Jan Hus monument is magnificent.Take time to visit the Church of our Lady before Tyn. The church is situated on the east side of the square. It is easy to spot as its spires rise above the buildings which surround the square, but its entry is harder to find - it is at the end of a passage which leads off the square.The interior is superb - well worth a visit.My only problem with the Old Town Square was that it was constantly awash with people flowing in different directions with large tour groups on foot moving en masse.Most of the restaurants and bars lining the square were packed.The people movement problem was exacerbated by the many segway hirers on the square, touting their machines to tourists.The segways flitted constantly in and around the tourists passing through.I liked the Old Town Square, I did not like the congestion.
So much to see. Always a busy area, but the clock faces are areal treat to see and so may things are around the square to enjoy as well as many places for eating and coffee.

Lovely square. This is a very typical European town square. Full of entertainers, segways, and obviously it has the very old astronomical clock, which chimes every hour. We were lucky enough to see it at midday, but there was so so many people! I was very wary of potential pick pocketers. When we visited they were also setting up a main stage for a festival perhaps?Very beautiful square, clock, buildings, but too busy.

Wonderful. The astronomical clock is a must-see. There will be hordes of people there but it is worth it. Grab a Czech beer at the cafe across from the clock and enjoy. Make sure you have lots of Czech crowns for the washrooms.
Relaxing. Relaxin squere with lots of things to watch.Cafe and restaurants are everywhere but you are in a tourist place so its costing more money.

Beautiful but very busy plaza. Like many old town squares this plaza was very beautiful and definitely worth visiting. However, like many others during the busiest parts of the day there are many,performers, day tour operators, souvenir booths etc. along with the usual tourists. As a result, it makes it very difficult to completely enjoy. I would recommend that you visit first thing in the morning then go see other sites in the city. If you are not a morning person stop by after dinner when the crowds are somewhat smaller.

Amazing sight. What an amazing sight to behold. The building is not only huge and historical but the design is so intricate and very beautiful. You could just stare it the whole day and would never get bored. There are a lot of coffee shops and small shops selling souvenirs and good stuff around the area. A lot of tourists and a lot of walking though.

Old Europe Charm. Loved Prague. With a reputation as one of the finest cities in Europe, we still were not disappointed. Walking around the square for the day was amazing. Love the old feel and friendly folks. In fact, the people were some of the nicest we have met in our travels. The square was abuzz with performers, and I loved the astronomical clock. Tip: try the trdelnik (sp?) from the street vendors. LOVE IT!
Place with own ambience. If you are in Prague, it's must see place with lost of thing to see, so many historical buildings form diferent eras, and especialy - Astronomical Clock.

Totally ruined at present. The entire Square is covered by a huge Sound Stage, Lighting towers, port-a-loos and security fencing for concerts at the moment. How can the City Fathers agree to such visual pollution? The whole surrounding area is ruined - its impossible to see the beautiful buildings that envelope the square in its entirety, the garden and statue cannot be accessed, and the lack of access makes the crowds even worse than usual.

Too Many Segways!. The old square is beautiful, and has architecture and is definitely somewhere you have to visit whilst in Prague! BUT - there are WAY too many seaways, it really ruins the atmosphere of the square with seaways whizzing by you every 2 seconds, and trying to give you a leaflet. In my opinion this was the worst thing about prague, there were times when we almost got knocked over by someone going way too fast on one, and sometimes they were just plain annoying!

Awesome. We visited for Christmas and loved spending part of each day here. It was a joy to experience how a different culture celebrated Christmas and loved it. The food and market stalls were awesome and I think I left a stone heavier after eating so much.

Crowds!. We hung around in a growing throng to see the astronomical clock do its thing. Not easy to see although what we saw did look interesting. Don't show up for this if you don't like being pressed by crowds.
Active. Nice and full of festivals. We enjoy walking in the old town. It's wonderful. Restaurants and cafe are amazing. They have the best breakfast I had ever have.

Amazing History and Architecture. The buildings, amazing churches, the small streets and open boulevards with ubiquitous cobblestones, the amazing clock, open cafes, and fun shops - all combine to impress you with the significance of Prague. Take a guided tour! Understanding more about what you are experiencing will make this area come alive. And don't miss the street performers!

Old Town Walking. Old Town Square, A complete package in prague.From clock tower to Charles Bridge, Restaurants, shopping, Street shows. I must say, it's a complete package and highly recommended to stay and visit.
Very picturesque. The square is nice to look at. Watch out for the pick pockets especially when busy. Nice cafes and restaurants.

A must see. Very picturesque. Ornate, old world architecture with colorful buildings that are very pretty to photograph to capture memories of Prague. The square is the venue of public events and there are reasonably priced restaurants with outdoor seating to make the visit even more enjoyable.
Bustling and vibrant. Great for people watching, taking in the incredible scene at night and and for checking out the Astronomical Clock.

I Love Prague. I love this place. Eventhough that it was crowded that time but still I managed to take some nicest view in this area. What I love it most was this could be reached only by walking. Very near in the city center.

Beautiful. This Disneyesque Square with it's surrounding churches and towers is one of the most impressive and beautiful places in any city in the world (and we've been to a few). It is almost unreal, and at night, with the spotlights shining on the towers, it is magic. This was our second visit here, and it was just as impressive as the first.Dinner at the rooftop restaurant (beside the U-Prince hotel) overlooking the square is a must do, but book well in advance. We missed it this visit, because they were booked through the weekend.While restaurants on the square itself are pricey, we can confirm Rick Steve's suggestion that restaurants one street off the square have equally good food at almost half the price...but of course you don't get the ambience.Live entertainment and juggler/panhandler type acts abound...along with throngs of tourists. Flash mobs appear at the famous clock tower at each hour, as the amazing clock does it's hourly thing. You can't go to Prague and NOT visit this square at least once.
Amazing Weekend. Had a fab weekend here for Christmas shopping, loved the market with all the traditional food and gifts, will be going again

Lovely Stroll Time. Just loved walking around the Old Square. The buildings are beautiful to look at and there are all kinds of street performers that make it fun. Sure, they are out looking to make money but in my book...at least they are working! And it makes for some great photo opportunities!
Too crowdy. Nice views if you look over the heads of all the hundreds heads of the tourists. Due to the preparing of some kind of festival the square was partially occupied.

Large square, clock not to be missed. Unique thing about this square is the beautiful tower with the special clock. If you get there at a full hour, you will have an additional experience - but better arrive a bit earlier as the best spots for seeing the clock are taken early
Beautiful and interesting. A classic European town square well worth seeing. Prague was not bombed during the war so most of the town from the middle ages is still intact.
Great place!. It's just a crowded must visit place in Prague! People are incessantly flocking there and with the astronomical clock around it is in fact a place to visit and take some pictures in!

Crowded by Fun. Many tourists this time of year but seeing the facades of the old buildings was definitely worth it. You have to overlook a lot of graffitti to enjoy the elegant buildings.If you like to people watch it is the right spot.
Very interesting place. Beautiful buildings and a very pedestrian friendly area to explore the old town and enjoy Prague. It is a place to enjoy and return to again and again.

unique. With astronomical clock as its highlight this is a definite must see, Square was crowded but worth the visit. It is a major visitor area and full of many restaurants and music place on the side roads

All day chill. make sure you get to grab a table at one of the numerous restaurants & cafes lined along the street specially in the evening. with a view of a mix of different styles of architecture ranging from 1600 till date is fascinating. every evening there are numerous street performers & musicians which are a thrill to watch.

Fairytale Prague. This is just a magical place ti be. The buildings are beautifully preserved and the atmosphere is lovely, especially walking around int he early evening. Being in Prague is like being a fairytale
Lively and exciting. Wonderful experience with music and colour. Go there or miss a wonderful experience. Plenty of good eating places and bars

You must see it. You must see it this place, it is very nice place with great history. The astronomical clock is much nicer than "Big Ben". I really like this place. Also, there are so many restaurant and bars around this area.

Local buskers add a magnificent vibe to this area. Sitting in the sun, listening to/Watching local buskers who are very talented and enjoying a beer/wine and simply soaking up the atmosphere was fantastic- It's got a great vibe and if you have time and the weather is nice, spend an hour or more just enjoying the atmosphere- We did this on a Wednesday afternoon, so it's not just limited to weekends, seems to be throughout the week as well
Architecture + +. great place to visit with lots of interesting old buildings, great range of eateries and plenty of gift shops.

Great choice of restaurants. Lovely old square with church and buildings from the ancient to 19thC modern. Tour groups pass through during the day and stag/hen parties eat there at night -yet, it copes with them all. We ate beside a German hen party of sweet, sober beauties. Lots of eateries to choose from; Czech, Italian, snacks, stalls, or expensive. Street performers too. A lovely atmosphere.
Mind out for the segue!. Very histories square with lots of live entertainment, very vibrant. Keep your eyes open for the segues, they are everywhere and some are only just under control.

Easy walk to Old Town Square.. The streets do not run straight so use a map and follow it. There are many historical places to see along the way and many unique shops to shop in, especially the Bohemian Crystal. There are several restaurants and bars to stop in and have a glass of great Czech wine and beer.
So so. The clock is disappointing, but there are some nice restaurants around the square.Very busy place around noon, later in the day it is more pleasant.

Prague is one of the most beautiful cities I've ever visited.... "Staromestske namesti" is the biggest square of the historical center of Prague. It's very hard to miss it, as it seems ,that all the streets of the old town lead to it. Old Town Square surrounded with beautiful buildings, You can find here many souvenir shops, luxury boutiques also many cafes and restraints ... It is very nice to sit outside with a glass of Czech beer and enjoy the breath-taking beauty and a special atmosphere of that magic place.

A must see in Prague. Of course you have to go here. It's one of the major spots in Prague. Join the huge crowd that gathers on the hour to watch the clock strike BUT watch out because the pickpockets also strike. Tons of good restaurants nearby.

Lovely square. We loved the style of all the buildings and their pretty colour, couldnt put our camera down. Very nice to sit down have a drink and relax ourselves after a long walk. Spent 2 minutes watching a man performing his soccer skills and 1 minute listening to a group of men singing n playing various musical instruments. Segway riders and promoters everywhere in the square. I can really understand why it was crowded throughout the day.

Dynamic and full of history. With a raging atmosphere of bars, restaurants, coffe shops and places like the traditional Hospoda Czech bars to the Hard Rock cafe this city center is packed with life.No matter the time u go to or throught it something is always happening. as other contributors pointed out, it's true there is heaps of promoters but it's very simple say thanks, no thanks and bye and they are gone. Architecture from medieval to gothic to srt nouveau to art deco 500 years of architecture represented in the same place. This place is clustered with history aswell a statue of Jan Huss with a troubled past, churches from all religions and the famous astrological clock.Its a perfect representation of Pragues and the Czech Republic's history. A changing past with lots of different people, food and architecture Grab a coffe or a beer and stay there for a while its well worth it for the time spent and the money.

great square full of atmosphere. immerse yourself in the bar and restaurant culture, take in the wonderful architecture, plenty happening in the square, live music, jugglers etc. I holiday by myself yet I never felt alone in the square.
old town sqaure. one of the most happening place in Prague,with place of tourist interest, all types of food,joy rides like segway,bicycle,fibre rick,shopping...etc

Atmospheric. Wow what a fabulous place to wander loads of different nationalities enjoying the buzz of this pedestrianised location with the Astronomical Clock in the hub wonderful atmosphere and a really welcoming place. There are numerous shops, bars and restaurants but different to other cities with no one pushing you to enter their establishments able to wander easily without any harassment.

Too many promoters. We came here to have a look round and to experience Prague however it was overrun with promoters trying to sell boat parties and bar crawls. Couldn't walk 2 steps without someone trying to sell me something!
lovely place. Beautiful area of the city,lots to see .the old clocks area great,nice outside bars to chill and people watch.the square is enchanting at night when all lit up.
Great cafes and restaurants. The old town square is beautiful with many great cafes and restaurants as well as the old town hall and its astronomical clock
Lovely. The astronomical clock is such a beautiful clock. The square it's self was amazing with everyone walking around. Loads of bars, cafes and restaurants to eat or drink at.
Awesome place. If you are lucky enough you can even get the chance to hear some medieval musicians adding magic to the already special atmosphere that sorrounds the whole area of Stare Mesto.
Nice place. It was nice place and you can go for shopping of almost everything related to Prague. You can get lots of tours from there and I enjoyed the old classic car tours there.
Fun Place!. Do not forget to visit this part of Prague! You will have fun people watching, shopping, and having fun!

NIce atmosphere on a Sunny Summers day. Love walking around here, people watching or just enjoying the sun and views with the crowds. Buy a nice ice cream and enjoy the architecture and such..The astronomical clock is a bit of a let down though. Didn't see much happen when the hour hit.

Amazing highlight in Prague. This is a fun and interesting highlight. Of course, everybody stands in the square waiting till the next hour comes along. Lots of food, drink and craziness in the square. Definitely a must see.

Pretty area, mind your pockets!. If in Prague go and see The astronomical clock - it's lovely to see and you can go up the tower if you want a view over the city but be aware of your pockets. The few guys operating were obvious if you're being aware so just don't let your guard down or have any valuables in sticky fingers reach.Food and drink dearer around here, wander off down the little lanes for a better deal.
Charming. This is a busy square with many things to do You can shop see the famous clock tower or eat. There are stores and stands with everything imaginable.
what an amazing spot. one of my favorite spots in the world. so charming, relaxed, beautiful. will definitely go there again.
good food and icecream. You find anything there - where to eat and drink, what to see, concerts, where to sit in the shadow, very beautiful horseswatch for pickpockets!

Great Welcome!. The energy and atmosphere of Old Town Square are a great welcome to the city and an excellent spot to relax and people watch. The astronomical clock is fun and the top of tower is definitely worth it!

Must stop here if you are in Prague! Go up the tower for a magnificent view of the city!. I went up the tower on my third visit to Prague and it was an amazing experience. You can see the whole city from here, since you are in the center of Prague. The view is unobstructed as there are NO windows on the balcony. Some signs explain what you can see from each side of the tower. Its great to see the crowds gather for the "top of the hour" show of the apostles on the astronomical clock. For a few dollars, you can get a tour of the insides of the tower/building and see the actual statues that show up on the little windows on the top of the hour. Its well worth it. If you just want to watch from the bottom of the tower, make sure to arrive at least 10 minutes before the top of the hour to get a good spot. There are many restaurants around from where you can enjoy your food/drinks and watch the whole "15 seconds event". In front of the tower, to the right, many street performers gather to "busk" and get coins for interpreting piano, singing, dancing, and everything else you can imagine. You can enjoy the "Our Lady Before Tyn" church and if you go behind it, you must visit the BRIC a BRAC antique shop where you can find very interesting mementos to bring back home. Behind the clock tower, you can get traditional czech pork and also traditional cinnamon pastry "TRDELNIK". Also, you can fetch a romantic horse ride. This is the place to visit when in Prague, close to the Starometska Tram Exit.

Beautiful square with pebbled streets. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings and quaint cobbled streets. Shouldn't be missed, but may be worth considering an early morning visit to avoid the crowds

A Step Back In Time. The Old Town Square is one of the highlights of the City of Prague. It is a very large cobble stoned area in the center of the Old Town. One of the centerpieces is an astronomical clock. Beyond that, though, there are numerous restaurants, shops, etc. Do venture down the streets that go out from the square like rays of a star, as there are great restaurants, shops etc. there as well. The Square is one of those places where one could easily spend just and hour or an entire day.

Get ready to be transported in time!. Beautiful view from the top of the Old Town Hall (Astronomical Tower) with the red tiled building and the Prague castle at a distance. Too many beautiful buildings with some of them up to 1000 years old and this is one place where we can enjoy the old world charm of Europe!

My favorite!. This was probably my favorite place to spend time during my visit to Prague. Morning or evening, the square was buzzing with people, and the outdoor cafés around the perimeter and musicians playing in the square added to the laid-back atmosphere. There is a visitors' center, shopping, restaurants, ticket office, and of course the Astronomical Clock. I found myself wandering back here from other sights each day I was in Prague.
Spectacular. the atmosphere is electric, the bulidings are out of this World. fabulous restaurants in tehe Old town square. great value food and drink

Great for atmosphere and people watching. A large square dominate by the Hussite Memorial full of activity but at the same with room to allow you to sit and take in the atmosphere. The bars/restaurants we visited around the edge were all friendly, unusual for a prime tourist location and reasonably priced. A good place to rest and literally watch the World go by.

A good place for social gathering and experiencing the old culture.. I went there in April and the weather was very nice. People came out for meeting and enjoying there Friday evening. There were plenty of restaurants, cafe, and souvenir shops at the Old Town Square and there were some free shows for you to enjoy. A good place for social gathering and experiencing the old culture.
Amazing!. Wow! what an atmosphere! Fantastic place for people watching. Street artists and performers galore. Loads of restaurants and eateries.

Cobblestone Paving and Prague History. Prague.. A wonderful experience. Cobblestone roads & streets, Majestic Clocks, Upmarket shops, "parizza' section of trees. Charles bridge, great to walk the town, tried the prague sausage with the locals while watching the semi finals of the ice hockey. a great time. The food in Europe leaves a lot to be desired... seldom saw a 'green ' vege.. so be prepared.

Enjoy early in the morning. I love a town square and this one is beautiful - lots of people during the day and the night time is lovely too - but I enjoyed it best when I got up early, went for a run or walk along the river and through the cobblestone streets and then come back to the square, grab a Starbucks coffee - they open at 7 - and see the day unfolding, there is usually a bride or two having their photos taken, delivery vans for the many restaurants etc, but it is quite, no people, easy to photograph all the beautiful buildings and just a great way to start the day.

Highly recommended.. This is a must see while in Prague. The Astronomical Clock is here, and is a must see. Be there at least 10 minutes before the hour to get a good viewing spot. Look up at the second level to see all the saints and figures go around. There are all kinds of acts going on in the square from Juggling to Opera singers. There are open air restaurants all around the square, but it is less costly to take one of the streets leading away from the square to find a restaurant. About 3 blocks down a street opposite the clock is a huge farmer's market which is a must if you're hungry for fresh fruit. I highly recommend the cherries. They were the sweetest and best I ever had, although a little pricy. I did not try them until I got back to the hotel, but if I had, I would have bought 5 times the amount. High end shops abound around the square.

Lovely market square. This is a great place to people watch, eat, drink, or just hang about as the buskers entertain you. The clock in the City Hall bell tower and the Hus monument are prime attractions and the architecture of the buildings comprising the square is wonderful. Try some of the foods from the vendor stalls lining the west side. There are often concerts in the beautiful Church of St. Nicholas at the NW corner of the Square.

Favorite Part of the City. Old Town Square is my favorite part of Prague. I loved the liveliness, the food, the festivity, the history. It was just such a fun place to walk around, people watch and eat.

All the world in one square. Around the square are small shops and different kind of restaurants. Only area in Prague where you could find some kind of souvenirs and people were nice to you, even when you were a tourist. Smaller streets go around the square so be careful not to get lost in them.

A Great Site To Behold. Looking in every direction is wonderous. The architecture,the churches, the statues, the street performers, the special astronomical clock, all make this a special place to visit.

So much to see, so little time. Many attractions - you can finish it all in a day, if you don't go in to every one or go for the guided tours. But if you do, suggest you give more time. Beautiful square, regardless.

Simply Beautiful. This place is simply beautiful. The architecture is a feast to your eyes. There are so many restaurants bursting with people and aromatic Czech cuisine. I traveled here solo. It was so much fun to explore the surrounding streets with a map. I got lost while walking from Old Town Square to Lokal Inn. I was solely dependent on the map and did not have mobile internet. But the people are very helpful in directing you to the right place. It was so much fun to visit the Old Town Square.
Interesting..... Lots of people in the afternoons so if you prefer a quieter day, attend in the mornings.The Astronomical Clock was one of the most interesting items yet. The history is amazing.
Great attraction. Full of historic interest this is well worth spending sometime. Nice place to sit and watch the world go by.

Great atmosphere. This square is full of restaurants, street vendors, buskers and much more which creates a great atmosphere. We ate at one of the czech restaurants which was lovely and the best feature is the astronomical clock! Also just off the square is caffreys a fab irish bar and indian jewel, where we had an amazing meal!

Beautiful & colorful. This place is amazing, full of people and yet not noisy, eventful, beautiful architecture, nice restaurants, etc. no matter how many times and which part of the day you are there, you are enchanted by the atmosphere and simply feel happy.
best place in prague. the buzz around the old town square is too cool. the best cafes and shops around and such a nice visually beautiful side of prague.
Magic. Magic place in which we go back to medieval times! The monuments are fabulous !! One of the places that everobody must visit!!

Amazing square. Great place to walk around the square & nearby narrow streets.
Has a thing for everyone to do. Shop Eat watch the street artist.
Stand at clock tower every one hour for the cute display.

Great place to spend a little time. This square is full of activities. The astronomical clock, street performers, special events, or just people watching. You can stroll through it, or sit at one of the many cafes lining the square. There are also food booths and picnic tables in a shady area on one side of the square.

Old Town Square. Yes, it is crowded but well worth the trip and atmosphere is great. Go early in the morning as everything comes to life. Explore all the laneways and areas that connect to this wonderful Square

Great place to relax.. It is great place to take time off and relax. Watch people, there is always some group singing, there is some great ice cream available, great place to have a street food-smoked sausage or smoked meat and beer. Just take time off enjoy local food and people watching.

Fascinating. Indeed, the whole of historic Prague is fascinating. Just walking around, dodging individuals, couples and groups intent on yet one more photograph in front of one more monument, is a wonderful way to spend a day. And when thirst and the need for a rest set in, there's plenty of bars and cafes serving excellent Czech beer to cater to both needs. Perfect!
Crowded. A beautiful place, but PACKED with tourist and street vendors in the day time. Visit in the morning or late evening!

Old Town of Prague. Visiting the Old Town of Prague is like entering a Disney Movie with the Gingerbread style buildings. Clean, quaint and beautiful.Spent the night in a low budge boutique hotel that was $49 USD for the night that also included a nicely organized buffet breakfast.Would go back to Prague and experience it in the Winter.Easy access and in expensive from the Airport via local bus and metro.

best part of our trip.... There are plentyyyyyyy of things in Praha to keep you busy. But something about sitting back and enjoying a beer (and a cigar) in this lively square really stood out as the highlight of our trip. With monumental buildings surrounding you, the constant variety of "performances" throughout the square, and no shortage of good eats and drinks around you, make sure to take a couple hours out of an evening and enjoy it here...

A lively Place. Old Town is a must see for the visit to Prague. It's an excellent place for people watching, beer, and quick bites. It's also connected to little side roads filled with shops for all kinds of shoppers. Old Town is a great place to meet up because it has something for every kind of traveler.

A Must Visit in Prague. the old town square can represent Prague. Especially when night falls, the old town square is like a magical city, so breath taking beautiful. Shop till drop for brands all along the streets! Except for the horse drop is very smelly.

Don't forget the John Lennon Wall. Interesting historical landmark with many other attractions nearby (although the torture museum wasn't on my to do list), many arts & craft sellers with a variety of items (average/comparable prices). If in the area DO visit the Lennon Wall, must have irked the Russians being over the road from them, although there's always new graffiti appearing some original elements are still there. Don't bother with the river cruises, you can walk the area and see the same sights.

Lovely square. Old Town Square is always bustling with music, local entertainment in the square, people lingering in cafe's. Don't miss the astronomical clock. It's a great area to stroll and people watch.

Business and beer. So many attractions to visit but don't skip the coffee shops and the restaurants - the local food Is a must !The Communist Museum was a disappointment.The trip to a glass factory was interesting from a technical perspective but do visit the MOSER shop ! Unbelievable craftsmanship ! We also attended a Folklore Evening in a Beer Hall that was most enjoyable with excellent musicians !

The centre of tourism. Lots of old architecture to see. The footpaths are pretty uneven and there are alley ways everywhere but that is what I liked most about it. Also, lots of tourists!I felt very safe in the area and it is a very clean city. The youngsters will love the nightlife after 10pmNote: as with many parts of Europe, people can pretty smoke everywhere. Even in restaurants. We were forced to ditch the outdoor seats for the non smoking indoor seats.

Where people come in herds. In summer time Prague is too popular. The square is packed by continuous herds of tourists that swell from one place to another on the square. At busiest time it takes time to circle around the vast masses.
Entertainment all day. Always something going on, street entertainers, stalls, horse and carriage rides, Segway tours, lots of people watching.

Great people watching and entertainment!. The Old Town Square is a delightful place to people watch. There are buskers entertaining and on the afternoon we were there, there was a farmer's market with beautiful fresh vegetables, flowers and baked goods. There were also many samples for the taking which was interesting for me, since the foods offered were different from what I am used to in the U.S. All around the square are many and varied shops. It's a very exciting place with much to enjoy.

Very nice. A very nice place to visit albeit that it is full of tourists. A good tip is up avoid the eateries in the square and instead eat a few streets away....far cheaper and the service not so rushed.

Great place for old architecture and street shows. An excellent place for feeling the old spirit, watching the very old architecture, and what is really nice is listening to and watching the street artists, I really enjoyed Bohemian Bards, they are incredibly amusing

It's hip to be square. The Old Town Square is gathering place for many weary tourists who have found themselves milling about all the beautiful architecture Prague has to offer . Once you have made your way through the maze of touristy shop lined avenues you will find yourself in the center of this old city . It is place where you can sit and people watch ( favorite past time ) , check out the astronomical clock , have a cup of coffee or meal or be entertained by one of many street performers. Within walking distance of the Old Town Square you will find old jalopy waiting to whisk you away on a quick tour of Prague . If you don't have a lot of time and want to see as much of the city as you can , then do one of these tours. It is relatively inexpensive as the driver charges per vehicle and not person . The Old Town Square is a must see on one's list of places to go in Prague . I was impressed with the cleanliness of the city . The locals we interacted with were proud of their city . It offered something for everybody !
Old Town Square. Beautiful at day and night. Nice variety of restaurants and little shops. Can be quite busy with people watching Astronomical clock.

Good Place to see LOTS of People. Go early morning and late evening to get your pictures. Go mid-day to witness the crowds and recommend walking down a side-street for a drink and food; much cheaper. The after dark pictures of the church and towers are spectacular.

beautiful and very vivid. A large square surrounded by beautiful architecture. It is crowded most of the time, especially during performances. We didn't like any coffee shops or restaurants here; they were not very appealing and very expensive.

Tourist masses; but a happy carnival atmosphere .... Prague is the "flavour-of-the-month" with tourists this year and most of them will congregate here at some time or other. However, this square has nice vibes and is a happy place, even when ull of foreigners. Watching the haunches of pork being roasted at the perimeter stalls is interesting to watch and they have an "artisan" traditional feel about them and they sell the cooked meat on rolls etc. You will find yourself here several times on your stay or on the way back from visiting the Jewish area nearby and you will enjoy it.

A bit crowded. The Old Town Square was quite crowded when we went in the afternoon. There were a ton of beautiful buildings. However, most of the attractions there were catered toward tourists. There were souvenir shops lining the surrounding streets, and live music playing in the middle of the square. The trdelnik pastry is a must try when in the square! It's crunchy, sugary, and delicious when freshly made. It's also fun watching them roll the dough around the stick.
So much atmosphere. This huge square has so much happening. restaurants, carriage rides, buskers, tourist. Its so easy to get swept up is the magnificent atmosphere! Love this heart of Prague.
Old Town Square (Staromestske namesti), Prague. Beautiful midevil town square. Very picturesque. Full of activities, shops, restaurants, and stalls.

Very Touristy But You Have to Do It.. what are the must sees!. The walk to Old Town Square is fabulous... we went to the square three days in a row and walked a different route every day... lovely... the square itself has all the touristy shops surrounding it and carts set up within square... it will be packed with people, so be prepared.. You will find the Astronomical Clock here (see my other review), St Nicholas Church (white with the 3 green spires) and the Church of our Lady (really gothic black spires surrounded by smaller black spires)... there's a striking statue of Jan Hus, who was burned at the stake, smack dab in the middle of the square.. but what I thought the coolest thing was the 27 crosses... people walk over them everyday and probably have no idea what they mean... me neither til I asked... they are a monument for the 27 people who were beheaded during the bohemian uprising.. the story is that the crosses (which are placed in the pavers, so look down!) are placed where the scaffold stood where the 27 were beheaded... pretty interesting stuff..

Most happening place. It's beautiful place to see and bit crowded, but worth to see. Also there are many shows and concert to see and old churches you can see! Avoid going in Restaurent s here , Bec waiters are very rude and very expensive and bad food! Also shopping in these area not advisable . Over all Prague is ok for one time visite! Specially local people are not so good. Not tourist friendly .

Living up to its reputation. With so many 14th and 15th century well-maintained monuments in a true diversity of architectural styles, the Prague Old Town Square is surely one of the most memorable such places in the world. Once there, one would wish to visit all of them, from the Gothic Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, through the still functioning medieval astronomical clock, to the Old Town Hall with its towers and the Baroque St. Nicholas Church. As expected, the Old Town Square attracts many thousands of visitors daily and is pleasantly lively at almost any time of the day. (Beware of pickpockets !) Enjoy a cup of coffee or a nice Czech beer at one of the many cafes surrounding the square !

Not the nicest part of Prague but fabulous food vendors. I'm not sure what draws everyone to this square but we found the area along the river much, much more interesting. (Especially the Charles bridge and the areas on both ends of it.) And several locals tried to scam us with coins, etc. as Rick Steeves' book has warned. There are food vendors that are making hot food on the square and these were the best part, in our opinion. Try the fried potato chips on a stick or the crepes (palacinka) or the hot meats from the fire pits. We could not figure out how to get into the big black church but the yellow St. James church behind it is very nice; see my separate Review of that church.

Great place to meet. Very crowded especially around the clock watch out for the hawkers and pickpockets. The clock is the main attraction but is a five minute wonder on the hour.If you want to eat or drink go out of the square as the prices are double what you pay a few streets away .Look out for the guys who levitate fantastic trick normally at the back of the square .

Full of life. This square is alive all day and night. Full of restaurants, buskers, some of the best street performers we have ever seen together with beautiful buildings and attractions. What a place!
strange. Felt like Covent Garden meets Christmas markets! Venture to squares outside the main square. Old buildings and Thai massage parlours along side together!

Best part of a city. The best part of any European city for me is the square and Prague didn't disappoint. The square is large - very nice architecturally and filled with bars, restaurants, street food, entertainment and history. Not sure what all the buzz is about the clock, it was ok. As I mentioned in my hotel review - the best place to stay is near the town square. Great place to people watch. There is usually some form of street entertainment going on - besides the usual music - there was an odd guy doing some disturbing things - but it was entertaining. As always - prices are higher on the square than just a few blocks away.

A must when in Prague. You can't visit Prague without visiting Old Town Square. Stay at Hotel Aurus if you can which is just a few minutes away on foot. Ask the front desk for restaurant recommendations near the square. Fun shopping, great bargains too, in every direction.

one of my favourite places in Prague. Old Town Square in Prague is always busy and full of tourists. Life music at each corner. This time we were able to join Etnical Dances and Music Festival which was great. I love coming here, it is one of my favorite places in Prague!

The prettiest square I have visited. Quite simply, stunning. The architecture and decoration is fabulous. The hourly astronomical clock is overrated and you get a little crushed with the number of people flocking to see it. I am told the food and drink here is truly a rip off and con men operate here, don't let that put you off, it is truly a magnificent square. This is the prettiest part of Prague and should not be missed.

The most central turist area in Prague. If your are planning to take a turist trip to Prague this is the most central area to got to. Its medeval square cover e.g. churches, restaurants, horse carriages, an astronomical clock. Really nice to have a beer or a ice cream by a restaurant.
loved it. non stop amazing atmosphire. crowded (for good) all the time. very good resturants. we visited ther every day, we stayed here hours and enjoyed it
Always lively entertainment in the Square. Old Town Square is a great place to people watch! Always lively entertainment going on. The center hub for activities in old town.

The old clock still works!. I love European squares. There is just so much going on...shopping during the day, street food (ham, sausage,cabbage and potatoes, and of course the famous Czech beer), old historical buildings. At night there is always interesting street performances going on and great restaurants.
Not To Miss!. One of the most beautiful, intimate and awe-inspiring public squares in the world. It should be a "must-see" for anyone coming to Prague and a reason, alone, to come to Prague!

A Great Place to 'Hang Out'. The Old Town Square is Prague's answer to Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden--combined into one. It's a fine place to people-watch, join a walking tour of Prague, be entertained by musicians and more. Food and drink are easily available. There is a great mixture of history, art and architecture readily on view. Any decent guide book will list the various places to see. The old Town Hall, with its astronomical clock, is a fascinating, fun and free bit of entertainment. If you don't mind heights, there is a lift in the clock tower to a viewing gallery, offering lovely views of the Old Town. If you are spending any amount of time in Prague, don't miss the Old Town Square.

Cant miss it when you are in Prague!. We were there in a Saturday, there were plenty for you to see and the buildings are beautiful. I suggested to visit there both in the afternoon and night, it is completely different feeling but both awesome!
The meeting point in the city. Every day you can take the pulse of the city in this place. Lot of tourists but still maintaining the essence of the city

Wonderful square!. This is an ideal city square, I'd say! Museums, restaurants & more surround you, including the oldest working astrological clock! You can mosey around & catch all sorts of street performers.

Must see when you visit Budapest.. Wonderful atmosphere, so much to see. Make sure you go to the top of the Clock Tower, the view is spectacular. We had a horse and carriage ride which was great. Loved it all !

Old Town Prague. Prague is a Prague. Large groups of tourists from around the word are coming to Prague for its charming buildings, food and culture. This place is completely full with the tourist day and night and its probably one of the most charming area of Old Prague
Crowded but a nice place. It was nice and sunny when I visited with my wife. As expected it was very crowded but manageable. Easy to get to and a must-do on your itinerary,

Must see, plan several days. We were only in Prague for a day and a half. We were at the end of a 10 day visit on the Danube, then bussed to Prague. Many of the old areas like the Old Town Square are pedestrian only areas. That's great except if you get worn out, you will have to walk back out. Everything is so interesting, shopping is great restaurants abound. Plan a couple of days, especially if a lot of walking is hard for you. With more time you can spread out the walking at a time.

Great place to people watch and shop. Take some time to wander through all the little shops and find something unique to buy. Also take time to watch some of the local entertainers. You can have a very relaxing afternoon on the square.
Great Atmosphere. Pick up your walking tours here. Lots of bars and restaurants. Street entertainers. The Astronomical Clock. Great Atmosphere and vibe - enjoy !
Busy Square. Wow, what a square - we were in the square on a Saturday afternoon.Plenty to see in the square with music and dancing.Fantastic !!!

Very pretty during Christmas. Superb place, we went during the Christmas markets, there were many stalls with lots of mulled wine! Great fun and very pretty with an extremely large Christmas tree! (PS. Beware of the cold!)
Impressive architcture. Home of the Christmas market and surrounded by towers, shops and cafes. Lively with impressive architecture

A must. Square with plenty of restaurants and tourists coming from all over the works, expect gire show and we were lucky to see the tradional czech dance folklore! Taste their sweet specialty rolled brioche with sugar on the top!
Thrilling. What a wonderful square with so much to see. Loved it! The clock is a bit corny but charming nonetheless. Great people watching

We had a blast in the square!. Happened to be in Prague for the hockey tournament - and they had the square set up with large screens to watch it. Then we went back later in the week and it was full of gypsies performing - it was really neat - worth going for the vibe as well as the clock and scenery.
Too many people. You can visit the square just to take pictures and then escape to the narrow quite streets. The restaurants are very expensive and the food quality isn't the best.

Interesting place. The cobbled streets seem to join each other and there are lots of colourful little shops offering different novelties and crafts. Lots of opportunities to take photos of this area to remind you of how things are in Prague. The new town surrounds the Old Town, isn't that interesting?

Picturesque but busy. There are many beautiful buildings on the edge of the square and the astronomical clock is a must see. Segways, walking tours and such like compete for space here but it cannot be missed during a visit to Prague.

Lots to see. After our flight we headed for the square to loosen up some of those knotted muscles from the flight . Great entertainment all around. Shows on all corners of the square. People watching was great and the restaurants around the square were packing them in. Well worth an hour of your day.

Old Town Prague. Fantastic lively atmosphere, lots of cafe/bars overlooking the square. Always a crowd around the old town hall astronomical clock waiting for the apostles to make an appearance on the hour every hour! Well worth the wait.
Fabulous venue. What a venue, the square is surrounded by lovely historic buildings, bars and eateries. You can view the historic world famous clock or take a carriage ride it's great

must see square, but beware the Prague ham tourist ripoff. This one of the most beautiful squares in the world, and the streets leading off from it are also all very charming. If you are in Prague don't miss it. Also, on weekends there may be special events for free in the square. We saw a folkloric dance festival there. I do, however, want to warn about the stands selling Prague ham. Attracted by the hams roasting on a spit, and the sign offering ham at 89 Kronor per 100 grams, I asked for a 100 gram sandwich. I was told that actually the only size they would sell ham was 1000 grams, at a charge of 890 Kronor, or around 40 dollars. Since 1 kilogram = 2.2 pounds, this is a ridiculous portion, and that's just the meat. Apparently if you want anything else you have to pay separately. There were two stands, but they both said the same thing, and it appears that both are under the same ownership. (However, one couple saw the size of the portion that was being offered -- which did look like about 2 pounds of meat-- and refused to pay, saying that there was no way they could eat that much. The guy behind the counter offered them a half portion at half the price, but I didn't stay around to see if they took that deal.) I would also note that Prague ham in a reasonable portion (about 150 grams) can be had as an appetizer at the Café Lippert, also on the square, for about the same price per 100 grams-- and the Café Lippert is a very nice place, with very good food, and an outdoor patio with a view of the square.)

Truly impressive. The highlight of the Old Town Square is the a Medieval Astronomical Clock. We were lucky enough to see it at midday and we witnessed two brides throwing their bouquets into the large crowd that gathered .It was a wonderful spectacle. The twelve apostles appear in doorways as the clock strikes and we all look on in wonder, truly impressive. It does get crowded so pick your spot in plenty of time.

Old Town Means Prague. If you are in Prague, its the first place to visit. You can have a long walk around and coffee to enjoy the crowd and the fabulous ambience of Medieval Ages. Don't expect too much from Prague, but the Old Town is worth to see.
Happening Place. People are watching the clock on the hour, street vendors are performing, people are sitting at outside tables enjoying the action.

Wonderful atmosphere and a can't miss at night!. Old Town Square is truly a majestic place with a great ambience. Don't miss the opportunity to go at night when the Tyn Cathedral is lit up in the near distance. There is plenty of outdoor seating and many great places to eat or have a pint. In the middle of the square there will always be a couple of street performers or musicians. Old Town Square is truly a can't-miss place as we spent the last night on our trip here and soaked it all in.

Full of energy . This square is a brilliant place to visit. It is always bustling and vibrant. There was free entertainment in the square every day that we went there. It is surrounded by beautiful buildings as well as bars and restaurants. Not to be missed.

Very crowded, lots going on. Almost all roads in the old town will lead 'naturally' to this old town square; there's always a lot going on; sometimes a stage with singers, performers, there are all sorts of people milling about and running around; the biggest crowd is in front of the astronomical clock. Do have a look at it to see a tide of humanity, then move on.

Right at the hub. Lovely square with great atmosphere surrounded by beautiful buildings on all sides. There are always entertainers of some sort either musicians or jugglers etc vying for your attention! Lots of lovely restaurants or if you prefer you can just sit on the pavement enjoying an ice cream while soaking up the atmosphere. Also lots of food and drink stalls including hams roasted on wood fires. Don't miss out on a visit here!

Stunning buildings and bustling with activity. A must see in Prague, we just kept going back to sit in bars and watch the world go by, loads of goods bars and restaurants. Go up the tower and get amazing views ot Prague too

Must walk through. Beautiful old square in Prague that is a must-see. There are several restaurants there, along with stands to buy some foods and beer (MUST eat trdelnic - a wonderful treat). The astronomical clock is in this square, and it's fun to watch it go off each hour (it's the 3rd oldest one in existence and the oldest one that works). This square is just a 5 minute walk from the Charles Bridge (or less).
Time to go. Shoulg go to early morning if you are photographer because it has a few people but if you come late there'll be a shop, crowded of people. But if you love people background, it's okay.

Great atmosphere in the old town square. The old town square is a great place to see the astronomical clock on the hour.
Loads of cafés and restaurants to sit and soak in the atmosphere and people watch.
Fantastic buildings and plenty of shop for your souvenirs.
A deff must when in Prague.
Great Atmosphere!. Bustling square with lots going on. Visited in the day and nighttime. Safe environment felt very comfortable there.

Very interesting. Very interesting with all the colorfull buildings, and the architecture of the St. Nicholas Church and the astronomical clock.
Can be very crowded at times but does not disturb.
fun to hang out. There is a lot to see and do...plenty of restaurants to choose from and street entertainment and shopping.
Not much time here.... Looked like it would have been the best place to shop in Prague for artful souvenirs and also had charming little places to eat.

My Wifes favourite place to be. We have been to Prague several times now and the Old Town Sq is my Wifes favourite place to be, It is a lovely part of beautiful city. The Must see of all the Must sees in Prague.

Heart of the city. It is a good place to start your tour of Prague and I would recommend you make sense of the monuments and churches by booking yourself on one of the many free tours offered in the city (I was with Sandemans and it was great!). There are lots of buskers, and some hawkers selling stuff. Lots of people too and it was a little too chaotic for us. Go visit the Church of our Lady before Tyn, and don't bother figuring out how to read the Astronomical Clock! It's really complex! We waited 10mins to watch the clock go DING! And it felt quite silly, so I wouldn't suggest you wait too long for it. People around us went "That's it?!" So that gives you a idea of what it is like.
The center of old town. Like everything around it, Old town square a precious place, very animated and surrounded by beautiful buildings, included the astronomical clock.

An amazing square, except for the smell. Visually, the square is just magnificent and one of the top things in Prague. Yet the smell of urine from the small part and the drunks at the benches are really unpleasant.
Must See. Amazing architecture, but a bit busy during the day. Recommend visiting at night and getting beer and sausages from one of the food stands.

If you enjoy people watching......... This square has it all - cafes, restaurants, snack bars, music and other street entertainers, a splendid church (The Church of Our Lady) at one side, the famous astronomical clock on the other side.We enjoyed coffee here one morning whilst watching the crowds (yes it's a very busy place) and beer on another occasion whilst listening to a delightful jazz group for an hour.Shame about the segways - speeding through the crowds, trying to get customers - not ideal in that location.

Old Town Square. Though crowded at the top of every hour to view the Astronomical clock, it is well worth the trip. Clock is phenominal. A lot of amazing performers and musicians. Many good restaurants, but touristy. Keep vigil for pickpockets, even with police patrols.
Historic look at old Europe. Loved the square. The clock tower is wonderful to watch. Plan on getting there early for the quarter hour show.

Fun area. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Good to see buildings and main areas of attraction such as cathedrals and the clock. Some restaurants charge more than others so you can review menu. The beers are priced really low compared to home so if you're a beer lover you will find light or dark beer everywhere.

So much to see. Lovely place to be and there is much to see here. The only down point is that because of this it is expensive to eat and drink around here but this can easily be remedied by going a few streets away
Marvellous square. Though i currently live in Prague, i cant get bored with this place! :) However be prepared its very touristic destination and often crowded... keep your staff safe! :)

Beautiful architecture . When in Prague, you must visit this area. The abundant history and gorgeous buildings will keep you in awe. Especially the clock tower! Please be extra careful with your handbags , valuables as the area is known to have pickpockets.

Beautiful but busy!. The old town has beautiful architecture and is a must see. However it is extremely busy with tourists on the weekends, which is expected, but almost to the point of being too much.
Beautiful and busy. Gorgeous architecture in all directions. People watching is great too. Pretty expensive shopping area but fun to look.

A beautiful center with history. The clock, the Tyn Church, the balcony where communism was announced, statues, Czech street-food, good restaurants, performers - the Old Town Square is lovely. The downside is the constant hum of Segways and the people hounding you to take Segway Tours. They get old fast.

Grand and glorious. With so much to see and do in Prague, we spent only a brief time in Old Town Square. But what a spectacle! We had the good fortune of witnessing the presentation of the Apostles at the hourly chiming of the astronomical clock. Options galore within the square and along the way for dining, drinking, shopping, and sightseeing.

Old Town Square. A nice place, plenty of cafes and bars and lots going on - good for people watching.
The astronomical clock left a bit to be desired...not sure what I was expecting but it wasn't that impressive...although being medieval perhaps I should have been.

Great ambience. Wonderful place to wander around. Watch out for pickpockets though. Although to be fair any major City has them. Very busy. Lots of great street entertainers and loads bars, cafes too.

Stunning town center. We started our visit in Old Town Square and returned there often over the two days. Beautiful old buildings and the astronomical clock were highlights. Could have spent a few more days exploring in and around Old Town Square.
excellent place to be. very nice and elegant square .would love to be here all the time with friends and family. good choice of restaurants around

Just beautiful. Just don't wear heels. You will be sorry as it is mainly cobblestones! Be sure to look all around, as the amount of beautiful facades is wonderful. Plenty of places to sit and have a coffee or tea and let the world go by.

Bustling & interesting . Visited on a recent hen do & this is a perfect place to sit outside & watch the world & all its sights go by, this is where the astronomical clock is & is well worth a look whilst in this vibrant and beautiful city.

Must visit. Lively, historically interesting and just a great place to have a beer and people watch. While we were there a just married couple came int the square to take pictures. All the while the segway guys were zipping around.
Awesome Architecture. Its very beautiful place. You get to see lot of good architecture from World War II times... We went in a snowy weather so it added to the picturesque view.

Great architecture, but busy and touristy. Yes, there are areas here that you need to see - Astronomical clock, the town hall, Tyn Church - so don't miss. But suggest to go early in am, or later in evening when all the big tour groups are gone. There are many street performers here, if that suits you, and some expensive, touristy restaurants. Suggest to see this area, but move on for food and souvenirs.
Attractive buildings. The Old Town is full of very attractive buildings. The 15th century astronomical clock is very near the Square, and it is the main attraction.
Full of life.. I liked everything.Full of life.Romantic. Perfect place to take pictures.Beautiful at daytime and night!
A must while in prague. The clock is a landmark of prague. Also a very nice place to have dinner or a drink during the evening.

Check it out.. Walked around on my own here when I came to Prague. People everywhere taking photos and going to the top a a tower. Check out the local cuisine in the pop up stalls along the side. Cheap eating and drinking is a great way to avoid paying to much at a restaurant.

Great place to people watch. Large square perfect to people watch. Buskers all around to entertain. There was a police van there, but they seemed mainly there to help tourists find their way. I felt very safe there as I rested between forays into the shops.

Got to visit!. If you are an avid people watcher or love abit of history or enjoy shopping then the old town square is a must visit. Hop on a horse and carriage, or the cute little old town train and let all of what Prague has to offer be presented to you.Plenty of cheap cafes all arounf the square and the street entertainers are fab with something to entertain all ages.
Kids loved the street performers. While it was a bit crowded in the afternoon my kids loved the street performers in the square everyday!
Lively hub. Fab to wander or sit outside for food and drink and people watch the astronomical clock is here also we saw a wedding party as well.

A Must see. We loved the old town square. This is where everyone in Prague converges to quite literally. The restaurants here are good though you need to choose which one to go to. The astronomical clock is magnficent.
Great. It's a really nice town square, everyone finds something there, you can rest, drink, eat or just sightseeing, shopping....everything you need is there

Make time for some serious People watching!. Spent a number of days in Prague and took the opportunity on Saturday and Monday to sit in one of the cafes and take in the sights, sounds and smells of the old square. From modern Segeway riders to bubble blowers and historic statues to the clock and amazing buildings, you could spend hours here just looking. Leave plenty of time to just sit and be.

Old Time Square and Astronomical Clock. Very interesting little shops surround the square. Great for window shopping. Some have inexpensive souveniers others more expensive and excellent first quality cristal. I found the restaurants around the square to be overpriced but the quality of the food was good. The clock is a must see. During the month of May there were too many tourists.

How Can You Not Gush. over a broad, open venue buzzing with students, lovers, families, horse drawns, spires, century old astronomical clock (apostles appearing on the hour), where you can grab a Klobasa or traditional ham, dark bread, and Czech beer for 350 Koruna (about $3.50) or a great pizza or more expensive fare, with stores and restaurants ringing the Square, wonderful Czech glass, fashion (yes, for real), and more
Great feeling. It seemed that we touched those years where it was built. Nice place. Many people. Polite sellers and waiters in bars.

A must see...lots going on and plenty to do & see. Be careful of pick-pockets...they blend in like tourists. Try a crepe or any of the street food...you can't go wrong! The sit down restaurants around here are the most expensive in town though.

Must see. ...and be disappointed. Packed full of tourists, with lots of overpriced restaurants around the sides. Sat down for an expensive beer and checked out the clock going off, which was one of the big anticlimaxes of the journey. It was a pretty enough place, and you can't really avoid the place, but it doesn't really invite you to stay long just because of the masses of people standing around.
Nice atmosphere. It's quite crowded but lively, many different things happening in the square. Finding restroom could be a bit tricky though.

Old Town Square. Very interesting, although not a lot to see other than the clock tower (which is worth the wait to see the mechanics). Some interesting crystal stores in the area, and close to the main shopping area and Jewish quarter.

a mixture of historical buildings and modern day retail shops. the one of the most happening place in prague, other than the charles bridge.
