The square of wonder. I think I could probably sit somewhere in Old Town Square every day for forever and still be amazed. There are so many people to watch and so much to experience here, it's absolutely incredible. Flanked by the clock tower and the Lady under Tyn Church (Cinderella Castle), Old Town Square offers food, shopping, entertainment and history all in one place. You must plan to spend a lot of time in this area when you visit. Words cannot describe how amazing this place, this city is.
Love it. We enjoyed out time in the old part of Prague. Different choices for food and drink. Can get little crazy late night

Sharp at 12. Bars in the centre are a bit more expensive. But again everything here was amazing. Friendly atmosphere, music, tourist everywhere, beer, food, market. I liked the old clock the most of all.

Historical Square & Christmas Market. Tyn Church, Astronomical Clock and St Nicholas Church are found here....including the lively, busy and packed Christmas Market. All added up to a wonderful place to be in during the day and night. A historical square with various architectural styles; we enjoyed time spent wandering in the square and visiting every booth in the market for two consecutive days.

One of 3 top attractions in Prague. It is one of 3 top attractions in Prague (beside Charles bridge and Hradcany) and you have to visit it. There is famous Astronomical clock. On every full hour 2 doors up from clock open and there you can see statues of saints going around and figures on clock are moving. Also, there is one of the most beautiful Gotic churche. At the night they light yellow lights on black tops of the church, so it looks like it is a church from a cartoon where bad witch is living. We were there after NYE and stil there was Christmas market and 30m long Christmas tree and it was magical. The only bad thing is that it is crowded during the day.
Getting lost in cobble stone streets. authentic Czech crispy duck with handmade dumplings, beautiful architecture, cobble stones streets, boutiques, friendly locals...perfect place to get lost <3

Gorgeous at Christmas time. We loved the atmosphere and lighting at night around the square but crowded! Watch out for the pig on spit - roast ham - they give you a huge chunk which works out to be very expensive.
Christmas Market Experience. The square was buzzing! Lots of stalls selling hot chocolate, hot mulled wine and cider, and traditional donut-style rolled delicacy cooked over hot coals (trdlnk).

Old Town Square. Prague old town square is a vibrant place. Some beautiful buildings which include the astronomical clock. Amazing smells from the various restaurants and food stalls which surround the square. Some amazingly talented street performers from musicians to artists. All these things along with the hustle and bustle of all the tourists, make Prague one of my favourite places.

Simply Mesmerizing.. Prague is surely a fairytale city with castles in the background, thin curving roads, a beautiful river, bridges crisscrossing the river and some antique architecture. And this place is right in the forefront of it. This is the place to laze around. On a normal summer day you fill find local musicians, magicians, human robots, painters and more. The entire place feels like a carnival. There are restaurants and hotels all around both expensive boutique ones and the local roadside stalls.

Beautiful! Especially at Christmas!. Came at Christmas time and there was a huge decorated tree and it was stunning! It's more beautiful at night when all the lights shine! Don't know if they got it all the time but at Christmas time they have lots of stands that sell gifts, food and all kind of Christmas staff. There are few restaurants and cafes that surround the square, there's also a Starbucks at the corner in front of the astronomical watch.There is a change at the square that we used cause everything else was close because of the holiday but I wouldn't recommend it because they take commission so if you got the option go to a side street and change at a less central place.At the last day of our trip it was snowing a thing that definitely added to the Christmas atmosphere!

Prague Old Town Square. The Old Town Square in Prague is magical. The buildings are beautiful and the architecture magnificent. The Astronomical clock is one of the main features of course and it is a beautiful clock and well worth waiting for the hour to strike! In December the Old Town Square has many Christmas stalls and a beautiful tree etc. There is always lots going on in the Old Town Square and plenty to occupy you with Jazz Bands etc. There are bars and cafes in abundance.
Beautiful.. great place to go and visit whilst in Prague. Artists, musicians, and plenty of people!!! We were lucky to go in January and it was less busy.

Christmas in Prague - Old Town and Wenceslas Square. Prague knows how to celebrate Christmas in authentic style. Markets selling a variety of foodstuffs including mulled wine, beer, cheeses, sausage, pastries, ham, breads and jams provide ample fare for stocking up for Yuletide feasting. Wenceslas Square and the Old Town Square have fabulous cafes - the hot chocolate is to die for and a feast for the eyes. The architecture is simply beautiful and concerts of classical Christmas music are performed in splendid venues. Tickets are readily available and inexpensive. Historic monuments such as the Charles Bridge and the Castle are part of the regular scenery. Prague is undeniably beautiful.

The Heart of Prague. You haven't gone to Prague when you haven't been to this place. Here, you can find amongst many others: the famous overrated Astronomical Clock, the Astronomical Clock tower which gives you one of the best view of Prague, and Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn. During Christmas, this is where the Christmas Market took place and having visited many Christmas Market in Europe, this is one of the best because of the great ancient surroundings.
Xmas spirit, busy but pleasant. Big Xmas tree , all kind of food and souvenir stands and to forget the famous Clock .the beating hart of this city as al important Streets are nearby
A must visit.. We loved the old buildings here esp the astronomical clock. One of a kind. Ample choices of Bohemian crystal shops. Will definitely come back. Adore Praha!
Beautiful.... The Old Town Square is one of the most beautiful squares in all of Eastern Europe. Best to visit at Christmas to see the Christmas Market.

Christkindlmarkets were wonderful. We were in Prague in December 2014 and thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Christkindlmarkets in Old Town Square. Such a beautiful venue. I HIGHLY recommend Lenka with Personal Prague Tours for a private tour. You will not be disappointed!
Great atmosphere. Packed full of tourists over Christmas but has a good atmosphere. Plenty of places to eat and sample the czech beer and watch the world go by.

Christmas market! . A must visit! The square is surrounding with beautiful buidlings and the market offer many christmas food such as big ham, hot wine, hot chocolate, that czech sweet (the sweet roll with cinnamon) and many cute christmas decoration. Many people come taking photos here with the historical buidling, the cathedral, the clock tower, etc. With the atmosphere of christmas like the lights and christmas tree!

Simply Magical!. This was my first visit to the magical city of Prague, showing off its best side for summer no doubt – it set the scene for what was to be the most wonderful few days.Never having visited Europe in summer I was completely unprepared for the heatwave that hit me, as well as the leisurely lifestyle that accompanied it. We stayed right on the Old Town Square – it felt like something out of a Medieval movie, but with happy smiley people!Long morning walks turned into lazy lunches and late night shopping – so much to see and do! One of the highlights is definitely the astronomical clock right on the square, you can’t miss it as there are about 100 tourists swarming around it at any given time!I loved the small gelaterias and galleries to be seen on every corner and the square played host to different musicians and entertainers every day and night.Whether you want to buy a beer and savour some of the local street food on the square or go for a thai massage or exotic cocktail – you will not be left wanting by this experience.Prague has moved to the top of my list of favourite European destinations, I cannot begin to imagine how different the vibe would be in winter but I plan on finding out one day!

All,roads lead to this beautiful square. This place always reminds me of a Disney movie set from my childhood. The buildings surrounding the square are beautiful. It's always jammed with people, but that doesn't stop the beauty coming through. Taking a stroll through here, especially at Christmas time, is something to put on your list of things to do at least once in your life.

See the Clock at the Square: Fantastic. Every hour in front of the Old Town Hall a 600 year old mechanical clock works! The moving statues come out and they are the Apostles. This is an amazing feat that many consider the eighth wonder of the world. Take your cameras, it is such fun! The square has many nice shops and seems smaller than other European squares. This is a must to visit!
Great Christmas market. A lot of different food choice, various offer at Christmas market on the Old town square. Perfect view to the cathedral and every hour small show bellow the astronomical hour.
Prague Trip. This is where the Christmas Tree is set up at Christmas time and the Christmas markets. Lovely to see very festive
Magical at Christmas. The markets are very popular and interesting with a lot of Bohemian glass and traditional gifts. The food stalls are clean and very tempting and lots of hot wine to drink.
worth it. Its what Prague is all about, loads of old style Europe and small back streets. souvenir shops are plenty too unfortunately .

Perfect Winter Holidays in Prague. First of all thanks to Smartwings for return tickets that cost me less than AED 1200 from Dubai to Prague. You can use the bus then metro/tram to reach you destination anywhere in Prague.I advice you to take tickets worth 32CZK (5AED) which you can use upto 90mins to reach your hostel/hotel. Taxis will cost you min 800 CZK from the airport.Things to do in Prague:Prefer staying in hostels for supercheap accom.Try their local foods like sausage, goulash soup, beef stew, cinnamon bread roll etc.Try their local beers Pilsner, dark beer and hot wine.Visit Old Town, Charles bridge and its tower for great view, Castle, Hanavský Pavilon (for the perfect view of Prague city), Jewish quarter, Wenceslas square & Lesser Town.If you have extra day in Prague, take a daytrip to Kutna Hora (UNESCO World heritage site).Do not miss Pubcrawl (300CZK), Beerwalk.Buy some good souvenirs. There are plenty of free walking tours based on tips.Things Not to Do in Prague.Do no take Taxi even if they say it will be charged as per meter.It is advisable to carry Euros than AED. Or always withdraw from ATM as needed.Do not exchange money even at the most attractive office without double checking. Always Bargain. You can get upto 1Euro = 24-26 CZK.Do not exchange money from strangers.Do not get fooled by food vendors when they sell local cuisine as per weight in grams. (Always mention the no. of grams you need before they make the bill).They have plenty of strip clubs. Becareful to always use money. No credit cards as they can duplicate.Any doubts can always contact me at arjunmenonv@gmail.com
so beautiful. seeing the Square at Christmas with the beautiful Christmas tree is just amazing. Had dinner many nights at the Christmas market and the atmosphere was unforgettable.

Simply magical at Christmastime!!. Wow! The enormous and wonderfully decorated Christmas tree was the centerpiece of this magical Old Town Square alive with food stalls and a marketplace filled with hand made goods! Try a trdelnik! It's a cinnamon pastry dough, rolled on cylinders and roasted over an open fire!! It's amazing! The smells from the food stalls, the energy, the lights with the large Tyn Church backdrop and you can't believe this is all real and not some fantasy movie set!! There is an initial sensory overload but it's easily something to just absorb and feel the magic of Christmas!

Avoid on New Year's Eve. The Christmas Market booths were still set up over New Years and doing a thriving business. Huge crowds. On New Years Eve, the city sounded like it was under siege. There were big bombs going off. We avoided it that night.
Christmas markets. We went there right after Christmas. The square was always lively, offering local food and hot wine.
gorgeous. Liked everything about this square and Safe and secure sauntering around the markets. Would highly recommend visit if you in the city

Christmas Markets. Being there over Christmas the square was packed with stalls of crafts and other goods for sale, also lots of food stands and hot wine to purchase. Wonderful and festive atmosphere.
Lovely!!!!. Very quaint .... Lovely selection of places to eat and beautiful buildings be aware of street traders trying to sell currency

beautiful!. I came to Prague on boxing day. they still have Christmas market operated until 6th January 2015. it was magical with christmas decorations, backdrop of Church of Our Lady before Tyn and hourse carriages roaming around. Something like Disneyland I guess.

Historic Architecture is overwhelming. Between the gothic and the baroque, there's a feast of architecural styles here. Look at the Church of Our Lady of Tyn on the east side and contrast that with the baroque of the St. Nicholas Church on the north west. Be sure to duck down a side street to the east to find a keystone featuring a man's head with a chicken on top.Photo is from the elevator shaft of the municipal building's elevator shaft.

Heart of Prague. The Old Town Square is one of most important places in Prague. You can feel history walking around you... Many ancient buildings, authentic athnosphere, especially at Christmas time, but you can visit it anytime.

Beautiful!!!. Beautiful square, a lot smaller than what I expected! I went to Prague for the New Years and there was a lovely Christmas tree and market in the square for all the days I was there!! Made it even more charming! :)
christmas market. The christmas stalls and lights made the square magical.There is a good choice of bars and restaurants in this location

Not for a New Years. Beautiful square indeed! And of course overcrowded, but what can u expect from such a place in the heart of the city!We have been there for a new years night, which i found quite scary because of the fireworks from all over and out of every corner, you were never sure that you are standing safe..and that's obviously was the worst for me, so avoid it on the new years eve.

Lovely Christmas market. Wide variety of goods for sale. Lovely Christmas tree. Be careful when buying food, we had the ham carved from the bone it was very nice but I think it was a bit over priced. You can get a good meal in one of the many restaurants for a little bit more. But the crepes were well worth the money very yummy.

Brilliant but crowded. We were fortunate to catch the last day of e Christmas markets and while the old town square was crowded it was still a wonderful place to spend a couple of hours checking out the astronomical clock and the high end shops and crystal sellers.

Charming Christmas market. The clock is a must, and the Christmasmarket had locally made items. Bought Christmas ornaments from an art student at the university who hand painted them and offered to paint whatever I wanted on the spot.
Good place for xmas. very good offers from all the xmas markets especially Czech cuisine; place is where the free walking tours meet

Buzzing. With it being Christmas/New Year there was a market selling crafts and souvenirs as well as all sorts of food and drink. Add to this open air concerts and musicians and it was really vibrant. The architecture was stunning with galleries, churches and of course THE Clock. Every hour on the hour the crowd of tourists watching the Astronomical Clock go through its motions made it difficult to pass that side of the square, but we stood there several times, to look. Well worth sitting in one of the bars and watching the world go by

Very pretty. The old tow square was beautiful and full of life, we went by christma time so it was beautifully decorated with a huge christmas tree and there was a great christmas market with ots of food. There are a lot of shops and restaurants nearby and everything is really accesible to an average tourist.

New Year in Prague. Christmas decorations especially tree with stunning waterfall lights. Went away from square for New Years Eve. Think it would have been too busy and full of revellers, (but we are now in 50s)!
Excellent. Well worth the time and effort to walk around the old square and explore the shops and little laneways that make up so much of Old Prague.
Christmas market is great. It is a must place to visit. This is a place of interest as well. Good food as well. The Christmas tree is a central feature.

Great to come here at Christmas time. For me, The Old Town Square is equivalent to Prague and i would never skip this place whenever I come to Prague even for a short stroll in the square. My last visit was in early Dec and this was my first time here during winter. The ambience at the late evening was really fantastic as the square was already packed with people visiting Christmas market, and also gathering around the famous Astronomical Clock awaiting for the bells ringing. It was fun and interesting!

Great at Christmas. This place buzzes at Christmas with the large Christmas market, decorations, street entertainers, Christmas trees and people enjoying themselves. The buildings are spectacular and beautifully lit and the astrological clock is fascinating.

Worth all the hype!... we were in Prague for Christmas 2014 and it was incredible. The Christmas market at the Old town square was amazing with wide range of stores and food places. There was a christmas Choir at the square on christmas eve and a midnight mass at the near by church.
Xmas spirit. Well worth a visit at Xmas time. Browse the markets or sit in one of the restaurants people watching!

Beautiful. Quick stop by to check it out, worth it on a walk. The best way to see prague for me is with the free waking tours, you can see old town in the morning and the castle tour in the afternoon. Prague is beautiful but without a guide you miss out on the stories that give it most of its charm.

Gorgeous square at Christmas time!. Everything about this square and its immediate surroundings is great: the astronomical clock and its magnificent story, the cathedral, the nearby Kafka square, the market selling food and various types of artworks. The Christmas tree was enormous and beautifully made. There was even a stage built for concerts and we attended one on December 31st of a very good Czech young band playing U2 type of music. The stalls are very characteristic of the country and every corner is ideal for a picture. Beautiful feeling all around!

Beautiful square with great market . This is a beautiful square showing so much character and history. However do not eat or drink there as they prices are double those of bar and restaurants outside the square

Eating local fare surrounding by history. We wandered up to the square on our first evening in Prague, a winter market with stalls and stalls of food, drink and other stuff.Ignore the other stuff and checkout the food, cheap and cheerful, if you're there at the right time you can enjoy your snacks whilst listening to some local entertainment.
Great PLace. Must visit to see the clock. Also grab a bite to eat at the U Prince Rooftop restraunt to get a great view from the top of the old square.

New Year's Eve is awesome here!. We spent New Year's Eve 2015 here and it was great.It was crowded and there were many fireworks, also many stands with food and drinks to buy.There was also good music the whole time and there was a very big Christmas Tree.I recommend it if you go to Prague.
Busy. Very busy but worth a visit without a doubt. Loved the Christmas stalls, we tried the Old Prague Ham - delicious.

Prague Old Town Square. Great and atmospheric part of the Old Town with lots of bar and restaurants - but these are aimed at tourists and priced accordingly.A word of warning though - the entire Old Town is cobbled and after spending an entire day walking around, it is highly probably your feet and legs will ache. A good tip is to stop off every now and again, sit down in a bar and have a beer somewhere, before setting off again.Don't miss the Astronomical clock when it strikes the hour, but beware the crowds for a good view. Also best to be particularly vigilant with bags, wallets, cameras etc. Although nothing happened to us, I have heard of other people being pick-pocketed, but as in any crowded place away from 'home' a little common sense is all that is required to avoid any problems.
In the center. This is a lovely place to be. Christmas ambiance was picture perfect. I recommend it. Good location.

Very Neat Place. The old town square is a great place to visit. In the winter time, Christmas markets are setup in the middle selling various foods and items. There are also many different restaurants and permanent shops around the square that offer great cuisine. A must see is "The Tower", which gives you a birds eye view of the wonderful city of Prague. If it's not busy, the astronomical clock is a great thing to watch on the hour. I highly recommend going to this wonder of a place.

Great Christmas Market. We were there just before Christmas. They had set up a really cozy and inviting Christmas Market in the Old Town Square. While it was very crowded the atmosphere was cheery and the shops in the market were among the best we visited in 4 cities. Great historical sights as well. Old town Prague is a very inviting and warm place.
With my wife. It's a unique place to be visited. Special atmosphere with multicultural people around and multicultural / historical monuments. Moments of contemporary and past history.
good at christmas. The Christmas markets seem to be what make it an attraction , wouldn't spend loads of time there if we didn't go during the market stalls

Christmas Market!!!. What a fantastic experience to visit the Old Town Square and get to see and experience the Christmas Markets
Drink the mulled wine, buy marzipan, take pics of the Christmas tree, chomp on a hot dog, take loads of pics...climb the old town tower for the best pics of the Christmas Market!!! Must must do if visiting during Christmas!

Nice market square. Just like Jess L wrote below, don`t look at your feet. Look up. Lots of amazing buildings, churches, tenements, wonderful winter atmosphere if you happen to encounter snow there. The Christmas market is vast and rich in good food, but unfortunately it is all the same - trdelnik, Prague ham, mulled wine, medovina, etc. - the same 10-15 types of stalls multiplied many times. Nevertheless, it is worth a visit. When we were there, there was a Czech bluegrass band (!) playing live in the street, singing in a mix of Czech and English and selling their CDs. People were listening and buying. You can also see the famous Astronomical Clock with its magical figures appearing every full hour and climb the tower to see the wonderful view - for a fee though. There are also some art galleries and a lot of cafes, pubs and restaurants in the vicinity. It can be VERY crowded though, so watch out for pickpockets and just walk a mile or two away to find more peace. During the Christmas time the decorations are fantastic and rich.
Always something to see.. Gorgeous place with lovely old buildings all around, and stalls set up for Christmas and Easter markets. Often a jazz band playing, and always plenty of atmosphere.

So festive. Fantastic atmosphere, loads of Christmas market stalls, including food and drink stalls. Absolutely loved the large Christmas tree, where the lights looked like tear drops. Loads of people congregated there of an evening. If it is icy or snowing, I would recommend wearing sensible shoes or boots, as the area is tiled and many slid over. I was also warned that there are lots of pick pockets around this area, so please hide your belongings.

Don't look at your feet, look up. My mother and I visited Prague just before Christmas. Mother commented on how we spent a lot of our time looking up. there is so much to see, the buildings are a pure delight of architecture and culture and with the Christmas market with delicious food (best part of the market) and it lovely christmas tree the squares ambience was a pure delight. We managed to see the clock go twice on our visit the first time by pure chance as we took a wonder on the first night.

Magical in winter!. Beautiful architecture surrounds this place, and the fact that I went in December when the Christmas markets were on just added to the atmosphere. It was magical. For wonderful views of the area climb up the Astronomical Clock Tower (you have to pay a fee though). A word of warning - it can get very crowded especially when the crowd gathers to watch the clock strike the hour (which I personally feel is overrated and skip-worthy), and from what I've heard pickpockets are rife in this place so keep an eye on your belongings.

Nice market. Lovely square, lively great atmosphere but too cold for tropical family like us. Great architecture, stunning medieval style church. Beautiful festive decoration. It is a must see place in prague.

Festive Christmas Market. We visited just after Christmas and at this time the Christmas market was still on with lots of stalls selling food and Christmas items. There was a large Christmas tree and a wooden bridge that you could walk up to get a good view of the square. Very good atmosphere and of course the Astronomical Clock is here as well. Beware that food and drink prices in and around the square can be more expensive than that are just a few streets away by quite a degree.

Dangerous place with no law and order. My partner and I were strolling innocently when we were attacked by some lunitics with highly explosive fireworks 5m from the police container. My legs and foot is all bloody and bruised. What a disappointment in a country's people and legal system ... beware !!!!!
Very festive. The architecture is beautiful and the ambience wonderful, whilst we were there the Christmas markets were on and it was a lovely setting.
Must see. Quaint square with many architectural features. Evening church concerts can be a little over-hyped. Christmas stalls open in late November.
Christmas Market. Attended before and after Christmas. So much options and sites around the square, not just for christmas.

Favourite place in Prague. Visited here in between Christmas and New Year. The markets were in full swing, and there was a pleasant atmosphere around the whole area. However, it was particularly stunning at night time, with the combination of the lit up attractions, the cold weather, and the fires from the various market traders made it my favourite place in the city.
beautiful old town. I love this place...all around is verry old and it is for me like verry old films.beautiful churches of all religions to visited

Stunning - especially at Christmas. Late at night, wonderful atmosphere, the buildings are stunning, the snow on the ground lovely, the business of the square and all around, Church towers, stunning architecture, wonderful towers.
Christmas Market. Wonderful to wander around, just stay out of the way of the tour groups, especially by the clock. Watch out for pushing groups of all nationalites.
Prague at Christmas. Old town so beautiful plenty of seething to rest after a long day beautiful churches of all religions to visit

Sunday morning an experience ever to be forgotten. All around the square the church bells resounded.
The Christmas market was still going strong ang the architectural sites are simply bewildering
The best free show in town

beautiful market place (December). I was there in December, so the main Prague market was there - it's beautifully decorated, with all the lights, the smell of wine, gingerbread and very merry mood in the air.

Lovely Old Town. Prague has long been on my "must see" list, and it did not disappoint. I visited the city on an extremely cold day, but it was still very beautiful with the Christmas markets and the festive atmosphere in Old Town Square. The markets were not the best I visited during my European tour, but it was still nice to see the stalls and visit with the locals. Interestingly, our tour director had cautioned us to leave our passports and any valuables in our hotel safe and not carry them with us during our time in Old Town, due to the high number of pickpockets in the square. I was prepared for this, as I'd had other friends who have lived in Prague warn me of the same thing, and found myself being especially watchful as I moved alone through the crowded square. I noticed that a man with a large satchel and inadequate outerwear was staying close behind me, and I moved deliberately to see if he was following me. I realized that he was, and I finally stopped in the middle of an open area on the plaza, turned deliberately, and made eye contact with him. He stopped short, looked back at me, then grinned and shrugged, as if to say "can't blame me for trying." He turned and walked the other direction and I didn't see him again. I felt safe the entire time, but my advice would be to stay diligent and watchful in the crowded old square, but enjoy your time in the "City of spires".

Wonderful historical buildings all round. We enjoyed the wonderful old buildings surrounding the square. The churches and the clock were really special. We were there during Christmas and the Christmas decoration and the market made the square look magical.The only downside is the lack of free toilet which is the same problem all over Prague.
Great view from tower. Well worth a visit but make sure you climb the tower for a great view. Visited just before Christmas. The tree was great and the street market was is full swing.

The heart of the city. If you are in Prague, you can't miss it. Full of beautiful buildings and many touristic traps - actually somebody should "shut down" all these tourist shops and the countless "thai massages"... On the other hand, you can find a lot of beautiful places for lunch or dinner - we followed the tips from Trip Advisor and they were totally reliable!

Beautiful, historic square. I've lived in Prague for 7.5 years and never tired of going to this very beautiful Old Town Square filled with historical buildings. The Astronomical Clock is incredible. At Christmas time the square is filled with market stalls selling traditional crafts and foods; the very large Christmas tree has beautiful, cascading lights. Horse drawn carriages are for rent year-round. The only thing I don't like is the Segway vehicles that are there now. I wish they would be prohibited form the square.
Old Town Square Christmas. Christmas stalls were all the same, so a bit of a disappointment. Toilets available in the pink building opposite Jan Hus statue.

Where it all starts. During Christmas this square is PACKED with people at the markets. It's crowded, but beautiful. This is the center point for all the sites in Prague. Once you know this place, you'll never get lost! I dare you to try and find the entrance to the church that's part of the square. It's a little tricky.

Center of a great city. We spent 4 days in Prague, staying in a lovely hotel around the corner for Old Town Square. It's a beautiful Square, with lots of history, wonderful architecture, and lots of activities. Explore the side streets for the best restaurants. And we strongly recommend a 4-hour walking tour as a good way to start your visit and get your bearings.

Nice quaint square. We went there for the xmas markets and found it to be a beautiful square with some amazing restaurants that go 2-3 floors underground The architecture is fantastic. And smell and atmosphere was wonderful
Busy square, historic buildings. Do not buy anything within a 300 m radius of the square, or you pay two times the price... Only visit places around like Grévin, Way Museums, Tyn Church

Beautiful Square!. You will marvel at the beauty and history in this town square. Prague was not bombed during the war and it is breathtaking to visit buildings that are centuries old. Of course, the clock is the main attraction. Be sure to see it strike on the hour.

Great place to spend time waching the live and people walking by. I Spend more than a week in Prague and everyday I spend hours on this square just there, drinking a coffe and enjoying the time looking the people passing by the tourists, natives everything

That's what Christmas is all about!!!. The Christmas market is heavenly. Beautifully decorated food, drink and craft stalls to satisfy all tastes. This is a must see when in Prague. The evening is the best time to visit to appreciate the Christmas lights and the beautifully lit buildings contrast against the night skyline. A great venue for family's with children. The rolled sweet pastry is delicious.

Old Town Square and Prague. My first 3 hours.. Walking from our surprisingly comfortable hotel to the famous Old Town Square was a great introduction to Prague. A sculpture on a small bit of land near an ordinary parking area was an amazing piece of art, with it's bohemian representation of what I would suppose is an expression of the sill fairly recent joy of life in this great city. Struck by the many small shops and the diverse architecture, walking awkwardly on the cobblestone streets avoiding public transport buses filled with locals on their daily routine, the magic of this amazing city had already cast its spell only blocks into our visit to Prague. The unusually high percentage of attractive locals was a another surprise, as well as the unusually high percentage of people that spoke very good English. Like many older European cities, the entrance to the Square is through a typical sort of gate tower. Called the Powder Tower, it was built something like 600 years ago, covered with ornate statuettes and a bunch of generally old-looking stuff. A few step further and find yourself in tourist central, with a crystal shop every 100 feet, and every other manner of trinket shop. Restaurants and desert shops fill the spaces in between, with a few specialty shops adding color to the mix. A hawker in a Shark suit danced and pranced to entice people to try the Thai massage place which was very busy soothing the sore soles or the poor souls that had been walking all day. Prague is spread out, and is generally a walking city, but as you enter the Square, a myriad of choices are presented for exploring what many call the most beautiful city in Europe. Around the square your tour options include walking tours, Segway tours, Buses, Horse and Buggy rides, a sort of key-west-style train thingy, and a number of antique convertibles with willing drivers (many of the cars appear to be replicas of 20's era English touring cars). Immediately struck by the number of tourists from all over the world, walking around the square you can hear the unfamiliar accents from every corner of the globe while at once watching a juggler, a man blowing huge bubbles, a magician, several musicians, and a number of other exotic street performers. The glorious feeling of chugging a beer on a warm day while taking a large bite of a delicious sausage and taking it all in was an un- extraordinary experience none the less burned into my brain as an unforgettable experience. A quick trip to the Starbucks on the Square to fuel up before exploring turned into an experience in itself, with an amazing array of exotic and irresistible pastries and overly charming and very attractive young women serving with perfect English and wonderful service. One of the great attractions in the Square is the Astronomical Clock Tower, which is essentially a huge coo-coo clock built into a tower where you can climb stairs to the top and get an amazing view of the Square and the surrounding areas such as the Tyn Church on the opposite side of the Square, built around 700 years ago and Prague Castle far off in the other direction. After taking in the Square area, streets fan out in almost every direction offering countless shops of every kind, surprising artwork, and a huge dose of Czech charm. Ill write more one of these days about adventures on the streets and nightlife.Anyway, maybe I gush too much, but I loved Prague and its people, the food and culture. Everything was much better then I expected, and I did not expect almost everyone to speak fluent English which made everything easier. The city is not unusually expensive and there is plenty to do keep busy for a long time.

Tourist hub of Prague. All roads seem to lead to the Old Town Square, we always ended up here when we wandered around. It's a large square which had a Christmas market on it when we were here - usual stuff, hot wine, sausages, tourist trinkets etc.The clock tower is the main draw, and we all stood patiently waiting for it to amaze us with it's wonders. When the time comes, two little doors open and some models go round inside the clock. If you have been to the clock in Munich you will not want to breathe all the second hand smoke required to witness this poor effort. It's surprising how offensive being smoked all over feels, after years of smoke free Europe, but it will happen a lot in Prague, even in restaurants.The Christmas tree made up for the poor clock performance, it was huge and very well lit. The whole place succeeded in producing the Christmassy atmosphere we were looking for.

Lovely Atmosphere. The Christmas market was worth visiting, particularly at night when lit up. Plenty of hot food and drink to sample. We paid 110Kc each to climb the clock tower which was worth it just for the views over the city and the opportunity to take photographs.

Best place in prague. In Prague i say this is the best location for tourists . Full of street artists and the astronomical clock is what i liked the most. Ensured to be there at 5:00 PM to see the clock strike and yes it was great sight. Be there 15-20 minutes early , else it gets crowded and you cant much see what's happening .

fantastic Christmas atmosphere. Came back time and time again to sit in the cafe's or at the Christmas stalls people watching. Although the restaurants here were supposed to be more expensive we found the prices were not much more.Even got to watch the annual pillow fight at the clock

Beautiful. Perfect to just walk around. We walked through many times over Christmas break and found something new each time. Definitely a must see and free unless you stop for an expensive coffee or beer.

Christmas market is lovely in old town square. Walked a long way from the castle to charles bridge then old town square. It has a Christmas market offeres a lot of local treats and food. It was cheap and tasty. The clock attracted a lot of people when it's playing on the dot. There are many restaurants nearby also tasty and price is accpetable. It's even more beaufitul at night. Just aware of getting taxi is tricky. Make sure you bargain the price before hop in.

A "Must" place to visit! Especially on time of Christmas... Unbelievably warm and such a good atmosphere during Christmas days. Very beautiful kiosks with many lights and Christmas decorations. It works until 9PM every day during Christmas holidays however few kiosks keep opening until midnight, so you are still able to drink some hot wine with your friends.

Old Town rish in history. This entire city was built on long standing history. The old town in the center of the city was no different. Fun place, lots to do and see and they had a large farmers type market going on at the same time.

Christmas at the Square!. When I went, it was during Christmas time, which totally changes certain aspects of Old Town. For one, there is an enormous Christmas tree that lights up the square. The Square also has a children's puppet show perform for the little ones. Another sight was the Prazsky Orloj, the large clock that stands and rings each hour. Along with the Bohemian architecture, there is an abundance of shops, restaurants, and boutiques. Just a tip for the fellas: not so far from the square is a Hooters restaurant nearby. ;)

Lots to do and so pretty. Old Town Square was just a few minutes from our hotel, and at Christmas it's really lovely, with lots of markets to explore. The Gallery of Art Prague is in the Square, and I visited the Andy Warhol and Alfons Mucha exhibitions whilst here. I'd also recommend going up the Astronomical Clock tower at night for beautiful views over Prague. Lots of street food on offer, and it's a lovely place to sit in one of the cafes looking in to the middle of the Square.

Pretty but hard to get full picture due to the Christmas markets. The buildings around the square are stunning, the architecture is so pretty. However because the Christmas markets were all set up in this area it was hard to get the full picture of what it's normally like. I was told to watch INXS video for Never Tear us Apart which was filmed in Prague and shows the old town square among other places. Worth a visit but I believe when visiting in summer you have to be wary of pick pockets.

Hard to criticise something as wonderful. Went at Christmas and the square was full of festive market stalls. Mainly food and drink and the knick-knacks were aimed and priced at tourists but there was a wonderful atmosphere and 360 degree stunning architecture. Went back several times as this is obviously the heart of the city and everything can be reached from here.

Christmas Time is Magical. We were fortunate enough to visit Prague during the Christmas season. At this time the square is full of color and vendors booths. There are beautiful things to buy and delicious stuff to eat.

Beautiful but crowded. The square is really very beautiful and sometimes there are nice markets around. But it can be quite crowded too and sometimes it is not so comfortable to wait and watch for the clock show. But anyway, it is tottaly worth a visit.

Christmas Market at Old Town Square. Visited the square during the Christmas period on a Saturday afternoon; it was crowded (really crowded) but the festive atmosphere is there; street performers, drink and food kiosks, souvenir kiosks, etc. It is a Christmas market after all. The square is all decorated for Christmas with a big tree in a corner.If you are planing on taking small children be warned that the place gets really busy and even walking around becomes a challenge. (we also went on a Friday evening and it was a lot more quieter)A visit to Prague will not be complete without a visit here.
Beautiful buildings. This is a must lovely old buildings lovely to sit in one of the many coffee/ restaurants and look at the buildings.

Breathtaking. A delightful square, full of great architecture and interesting shops. Crowded cobblestone street make it easy to spill your warm wine. Well worth the visit and the price is right: free.

Must visit!. Interesting, buzzy, fun, at all times of day and night. Top of your places to visit in Prague. Get a seat in one of the bars 20 minutes before the clock strikes. Maybe slightly more expensive beers, but worth it at least once!

great palce to just hang out and enjoy the town. I stayed in a vacation flat over looking this area and it is great. live music playing in the square all day with street performers. a lot of restaurants in this area things tend to be more expensive here but a lot is always happening here.
wonderful place. there you will find everything you want.a fiesta is there.christmas markets are full of food sweets and staff of woods!
very Charming. Square surrounded by historical beautiful buildings.Christmas markets take place at the square every year. Nice and charming square and full of activities .

Christmas Magic. The square has a huge Christmas tree beautifully decorated and food stalls with the smell of cooking. Hot honey wine drinks. Gift stalls, live music and glass fronted restaurants facing the square where you can have a meal and watch the `square` activity.
It`s a must after dark with all the lights - after 4pm.

Excellent Heart Of Prague.. The center of everything. Outdoor food, beautiful buildings, statues, entertainers and a 500 year old working clock. Must see . Full of life and so much to see. Don't miss it.
Old Town square. Clock excellent and the view from top amazing. Great place to start and look over the city to get your bearing.
Not to be missed. Awesome, brilliant atmosphere and plenty of outdoor cafes. The fact the Xmas market was on added to the ambiance.

Cozy square with Christmas stalls and huge tree. Square surrounded by beautiful buildings. We were there with the Christmas markets. Nice and cozy, but all the same. Not that much variety. Huge tree and a must see the clock of course

The Center of it All. With the clock tower and church spires as backdrops, the Square is the center of what is happening. Visiting in December, I enjoyed the Christmas Market that was at home in the square. The space was alive with music, entertainment, and the whafting of delicious smells.

Wow!. We visited just before Xmas and it was picture post card!A fabulous tree in the centre and a Christmas market, I'm usually a bit bah humbug about these things back home but this was stunning. The architecture is breathtaking and you have to look up because the roofs and facades can works of art themselves.Lots of places to eat, drink, sit down, shop.Prices are expensive compared to side streets and lesser and new town.
Beautiful and fascinating. When we visited the city's premier Christkindlemarkt was set up here. It made the beautiful square into a magical place indeed.

Don't believe the Christmas market hype. Lovely square with a lovely LITTLE Christmas market. Don't get fooled by any comparisons with Germany. They have very well-rehearsed groups of children singing carols on various stages which was nice.

One of the most beautiful places on earth. Unsurpassed architectural beauty. You'll pay over the odds for a drink or a coffee here but it's really fun. Try to see the old clock strike 12 at noon or midnight.
Impressive. So great the old buildings, the amazing clock, hot mulled wine. Great restaurants and an italian caffe where you can get a real espresso as well

Great!. This square is especially beautiful in the Christmas time. Its Christmas market is big and it offers a variety of products. "Trdelnik" is a local sweet you should definitely try. You can buy it all around Prague. The church with its astronomical hour is a beauty. It is worth noting that this is quite an expensive part of Prague. It is full of tourists. Take your time and enjoy!

Big Square. There are many attraction around the square. You can just have relax walk and do window shopping. All crystals are amazing. There are many restaurants offering the local food. Some street vendors are also there, selling traditional street foods and breads. Don't miss to climb astronomic tower. Seeing Prague from there is incredible.

Beware the hidden costs. The market stalls at Christmas are great and it is fun to try the variety of foods on offer. But one word of caution. ... Note that food is priced per 100g and therefore when you are served a generous plate of roast pork it will be weighed and priced considerably more than you were expecting!!! Prices are steep in the square but drop considerably as you move outward. I was not impressed by the popular dish of a pizza base squirted with ketchup and sprinkled with parmesan. How basic can food get? However the cinnamon and nut coated pastry curls are a delight as is the mulled wine. At night these markets are beautiful with the fairy lights and Christmas trees.
It is magical. Prague is beautiful city. specially old town center is magical during the day or the night. must seen
Great atmosphere, lovely buildings.. Hated the silly two-wheeled machines that kept getting in everyones way. Loved the old buildings and the amazing clock.

Big fun square. This square with statues in the middle and the biggest Christmas tree I have ever seen (i visited during Christmas), which is real by the way, is filled with vendors of hot mulled wine, trdlo (their sweet pretzel specialty), pig on a spit, and Czech hand-made goods. It gets crowded at night and on the weekends, and the vibe gets festive.
Beautiful. Very pretty, the christmas markets were amazing, restaurants were not expensive and had a great selection of food.
Go go go.. Liked all, disliked none. We went Christmas and all the lights and stalls on the Christmas Markets. Food and drink on the stalls great.
Stunning!!!. Beautiful buildings steeped in history, the monumental clock was interesting, enjoyed looking around the Christmas markets.

Heart of the activity. Probably the best of all old town squares Iv seen in Europe so far. The energy is palpable and one can find people of all sorts with their cameras of all sorts. Pit stop / destination / starting point for many conducted tours, IMO, unless you want all the details of who built what when and why, a lazy walk through the myriad streets are enriching on its own and the square is the cherry on the cake. Even the modernization has added its own charm. The myriad street artists (bless them, truly truly talented) the clock rhythm every hour, the sounds and the yawing centuries old buildings are overwhelming. The restaurants / cafes in the side streets are predictably less expensive than the ones in the core. A holiday well spent for me just walking by the old town streets.PS: Though not as notorious as maybe Paris, pick pockets and con men do mingle with the tourist crowd, so be cautious and enjoy the city without and loss.

The highlight. This old town square is the absolute highlight of anyone's Prague trip. One has to see this to believe how happening this place is at all times of the day. I visited 20 days before Christmas, and yet the festivities had begun. Truly astounding experience.

Amazing Gothic Buildings!. No trip to Prague is complete without a walk through Old Town Square! The amazing Gothic details of the church buildings are breath taking. This is also a great place to people watch. For an added treat visit between Nov. 20-Jan1 for the Prague Christmas Market.
Christmas Market and more. Visited for the Christmas market. Lots of stalls and fast food, although a bit samey. Lots of Restrurants. Lovely buildings.

Gorgeous! . A must visit place. It's beautiful! I visited right before christmas and the whole area was decorated with Christmas lights. It was packed with people and Christmas fair booths. Street entertainers were awesome. Be vary of the guy selling currency on the streets.

Come afternoon to evening and collect the memories here. Walk around the square at noon or afternoon enjoy the attractions of music or other, take photo of Jan Huss statue there don't forget. Check the Astronomical Clock in this area and further walk to shop rows near this place, souvenir, restaurant is vary here.Coffee? ow don't worry you can relax in many of cafe and sidewalk chairs, try the cafe in the garden at the back of Astronomical clock or at the side of square from parizska street.Photo at night?, yes still ini this square, usually there is lighting attraction or laser attraction to paint the buildings by the light while the music playing, interesting attractions and also for travel photo collectors. cheers !
Great Christmas Market. Can be crowded but lovely shops and bistros abound. Can enjoy the Holiday markets and stalls. Spend an hour or spend the day.

A real hub of activity. Old Town Square is the hub for a truly Christmas theme & atmosphere, the place is alive with people in the evening and the foods and drinks are great price and truly tasty. What an experience!!

Buzzing. As it was the Christmas market period, the Old Town square was absolutely buzzing with stalls, entertainers and people. Well worth a visit, even when the market isn't there just to view the churches and Jewish quarter

The Xmas markets. Quite a few stalls, some selling the same things. Lovely Xmas items, delicious hog roast smells, many xmas light. Very busy at weekends, difficult to move. A really good experience midweek.

A good place if the market is on. We visited just before christmas, and the main attraction were the holiday stalls and the giant tree. Not sure if the astronomical clock tower is by otself worth the visit. I would combine the visit as a stop on the way to Karl's bridge and the Lesser town.

Picturesque and historic. The square at this time of year is picturesque. It was very quaint, and the architecture beautiful. The air was filled with the scent of food. The tree was eye-catching. The only issue is that there wasn't much to look at or do if you didn't want to shop, or had a small child. It is more of an adult destination as there is not much to entertain someone small, and it is very busy. However, the architecture was the best thing about it. A must-visit.

Beautiful, but crowded and expensive. This area had a nice, big Christmas market, but the prices were high and it was very crowded.Definitely worth visiting, but you can find great deals a few blocks away on smaller streets.

Truly magical experience. The town square at Christmas is truly beautiful. At night time the church spires are genuinely magnificent. The Christmas market stalls all offer good quality gifts, f shopping is your thing take a stroll down any of the roads leading off the square, no matter which way you go you will find a plethora of shops and restuarants. I especially liked the little restuarants tucked away in the alleys, truly truly authentic.
Wonderful Buildings and Market. Went in December. What a great place for Christmas Markets, Street Entertainers and the lovely smell of Hot Wine & Food

Christmas markets.... Loads to see during Christmas market time, the astronomical clock draws big crowds and there is an opportunity to walk up the clock where you get great views of the surrounding areas.

Lovely Quaint but Busy. This is the most beautiful square. The Christmas Markets meant is was rammed full of people but a lovely place to take in the Xmas spirit. The Astronomical clock shows its wares every hour on the hour. Worth seeing but just once. We also went up to the top of the Tower and had great views of the Town and Castle. The best bar around is Black Angels in the basement of the U Prince Hotel. But you need to book especially if you want to hear the pianist.
old town square. Spend every evening here just soaking up the atmosphere. The church of our lady of tym is just magical at night
Great at Christmas time. Loved he Old Town Square but very busy leading up to Christmas so go early! Take time to have a coffee and watch the Christmas shoppers go by

Christmas Markets. Terrific array of stalls, prices not too bad. Be aware of pickpockets though, especially late in at night. I was nearly a victim but my wife cleverly intervened whilst I was taking a photo. It was late when the market was closed though 10pm

Go see the clock, it will only take 14 seconds. Great to see, but you do not need to plan an intire afternoon for this. Make sure you are there at the hour so you can see the clock doing its thing. Nice, but not impressive.

the best old town. The Old Town Square is not to be missed if you visit Prague. There are plenty of lovely old buildings to photograph, places to eat and drink on the square, and of course the Astronomical Clock to see.

Looks like a film set for 'Harry Potter'. Old Town Square can't do anything but impress. The architecture is quite incredible and some of the paintings on the buildings is amazing. Every time I look at it it reminds me of being in a Harry Potter film. It is best viewed early in the morning before it becomes crowded with tourists and then you can't really take in its beauty

Staromestske Square. Be prepared the large crowds. I am here for the Christmas Market and you can even begin to move. elope are friendly, not rowdy like in the states. The honey wine is not to be missed!

Awesome place, must visit in evening. Lights and decoration are awesome. Its a must visit place in evening. The astrological clock is the center, and there are markets around it. You can also climb up the same building to get a bird's eye view of prague

Nice ambience. Walking on the old town square will be done by the tourists any how when they try to visit the astronomical clock or on the way to Charles bridge or by chance. This a an excellent place filled with traditional restaurants and Bohemian architecture, making it photogenic.

Old Town Square. Beautiful, especially this time of the year, with the festive decorations and atmosphere.
Lots of eating and drinking places. The architecture is wonderful.

Christmas market - great. The beautiful buildings- astronomical clock was amazing
Live music
Restaurants and cafes
Christmas stalls - hot wine
Loved it all.

Gorgeous town square. The historical architecture is simply stunning. We were there for the Christmas market - small stalls selling a variety of small gift items, foods and gluhwein( hot mulled wine). Crowded and touristy, but also a tradition for locals. It was delightful to see the faces of the children when they saw St. Nicholas. Beautiful Christmas tree all lit up.

Christmas markets. This square just had a happy and busy feel to it. The Christmas stalls were OK; much the same as other squares around the city and around the world, but the decorations were tasteful and we didn't feel too threatened - we had been warned about all sorts of dangers but they stayed hidden from us.The mulled wine is a must, the mead is OK but very sticky, particularly when you spill it down the wife's best coat!On the down side, like most good places, it gets very busy.We didn't eat there.

Best Christmas Market in Europe. The winter/x-mas time is a great time in most capital cities - but Prague is another level to the rest. Surrounded by gothic buildings, cobble stone streets and hundreds of spires this old town square has the traditional setting. Great food, music and small shop stalls. A great touristic attraction not to be missed, even my two teenagers loved the adventures of winding through the streets, ducking down small allies and trying local foods

Christmas market. It was great to be in Prague during the time they have the Christmas market in the square. It is a beautiful square normally but with big Christmas tree it was spectacular. It was so festive to walk around and look at what locals are selling. They had quite a few stalls selling hot wine and food. The square was extremely crowded but still very fun.

Crowded but worth it. The Old Town Square is not to be missed if you visit Prague. There are plenty of lovely old buildings to photograph, places to eat and drink on the square, and of course the Astronomical Clock to see. However, be prepared for massive, massive crowds if you go in the summer like we did. It might have been the time of day (late afternoon), or just the season. Still, the crowds are worth it!

A Christmas Must!. The Old Town Square during the holiday season is one of the most magical places I've ever been to. The decorations, the tree, the markets, and the lights were all extraordinary. Will definitely be back there sometime in the future - I'm going to find it hard to travel there any other season though, knowing how beautiful everything looks around Christmastime. :)

Its all here. The churches the views up the tower, the astronomical clock, the beer bars in the square, the statues. Just so much packed in to such a small area. Lots of things to just sit and look at . The Czechs are so hospitable that they staged a stand off between drunken football fans and the police right in the middle of the square?!
Christmas Market. The Christmas tree surrounded by the small christmas market stalls made this a great place to sit and people watch from the numerous restaurants
great atmosphere. Christmas markets were on when we visited, great atmosphere, great shopping and we felt really safe at all times.

Must see During Christmas. Christmas time is a special time in most cities and experiencing this square either during the night time or during the day is a wonderful experience. To me it is about the sense or community, you get to experience during this time of year, seeing the families gather. Sharing in yearly traditions in this open air market. Enjoy.

Christmas market in Dec. Came here on our first evening in Prague to look at the Christmas market, and there were things to buy, eat, and sights to see. The stalls tend to get a little repetitive after a while as they all sold roughly the same things, but we still came back two days later to get some souvenirs and go up the clock tower. Probably one of my favourite places in Prague as you could really feel the festive mood during this season.
How romantic!. Lovely square with all the Christmas decorations and lights and huge trees. The markets, nativity scene and also the donkey, sheep and goat added to this atmosphere.

Stunning... And refreshing view, mouthwatering aromas. Visited the Christmas market in old town square during our stroll through the city. The market do offer a selection of gifts, toys etc, but what caught our eyes and nose was different aromas of freshly cooked food. It was mouthwatering and a wonderful treat to our eyes and stomach. You wouldn't regret it...

A beutiful place with lots of history and great restaurants to dine at. Its a wonderful place to just walk around and spend a lazy afternoon at a cafe in Old Town.Loved the local beer and food.The famous clock is right there in the middle of the old town square
Lovely Christmas market. The sights, sounds an culinary aromas of the Christmas Market added a special atmosphere but the Square is an essential part of any Prague visit at any time of year.
Watch the clock. The clock strikes here every hour, hundreds of people stand and watch the hands swing around. This clock is outstanding workmanship

Great architecture. This is one of the places you can admire the wonderful architecture in Prague. So much history, but still so beautiful and well preserved. Additionally, from this square you can go for a walk on Parizka street with the shops of the most expensive and luxurious brands.
fun spot. enjoyed the shops and coffee shops, and of course the CLOCK, crowds were a bit much, especially in October

christmas market. we came to Prague for the Christmas Markets, the one in the Old Square is by far the best.
Go when it gets dark as everything is beautifully lit.
Dozens of stalls selling similar things but you can haggle the price, there was carol singing and street musicians, try the BBQ sausages and hot wines
Christmas markets were great. Go close to closing time and you have the place to yourself! You can really appreciate the beauty of the square the the Christmas tree.

Lovely architecture. Centre of town. Definitely make sure you go here. It's a the tourist centre of town, and has a real buzz about it. The Christmas markets were fun, and not too packed.
Astronomical clock is here, as are lots of tour guides touting for business.

Beautiful, especially around Christmas. Along with Prague Castle and Charles Bridge, Old Town Square sums up the absolute beauty of Prague. I would recommend going to the top of the tower above the famous clock as the pictures were incredible. We were lucky to be there during the Christmas market which was a gorgeous sight as well. Enjoy!

Nice, but not anything special. Very simply. It's a town square, lined with all kinds of shops, some modern, some old, some very expensive, some just tourist traps. The big draw is the Astronomical Clock on the corner. In the winter the square is the site of the Christmas Market (late November to the end of December).

Beautiful festive feel. Very Christmassy
Very crowded at certain times
The schools singing carols was most enjoyable on the platform.

The Christmas markets were compact but very enjoyable. We loved the Christmas markets although they became totally overcrowded on 5th December when the festival of Angels and Devils takes place, the day before St. Nicholas Day. The Christmas markets are smaller than those in other cities such as Vienna and Cologne but everything was locally made. We particularly liked the stalls selling freshly cooked unleavened dough with cinnamon and sugar. Well worth a visit during Advent and in the week after Christmas. We loved the atmosphere, the enormous illuminated Christmas tree and the views of the floodlit Church of Tyn. There is a small stage where school children and choir boys were performing in the early evenings.
Nice. Very nice place. Very crowded, so on one side it's full of attractions and food but in the either side you need to be very careful from stealing.
Great atmosphere. Nice square with long history...we saw "ringing" Astronomical clock three times - nice experience and nice atmosphere here!
CHRISTMAS FAIRYTALE. this is Christmas fairytale. Beautiful historical building are framing this square. Lovely Christmas huts and tree. Smell of mulled wine and punch. Very special.
Nice walk. Walking around the street is entertaining, the place is full of tourist and multiple walking tours is several languajes. The Christmas markets are a must.
Another must do in Prague.. Especially worth a visit when the christmas market is on. Very atmospheric with lovely gothic buildings surroundings. Great at all times of the day.

Must see, beautiful Christmas market. The Astronomical Clock is a must see at any time of the year, but the Christmas scene in Old Town Square is great! Music, hot wine, a bustling Xmas market, huge tree, and the beautiful archtecure surrounding you.

History & Beauty at every turn - breathtaking buildings!. As we turned the corner and saw the beauty of the illuminated Gothic Tyn Church in the Old Town Square, we were captivated! I think viewing this area during Christmas Market time is magical as there's the aroma of hot mulled wine and roasted chestnuts in the air and it doesn't feel so crowded. We even had flurries of snow and the Christmas trees were beautifully decorated.The British and Irish bars are good in this area too. We were impressed with how well the streets are maintained and the lack of litter that blights other cities. Simply beautiful! :-)

Fun and Festive. We timed it just right to see the Christmas market light up the last Saturday in November. Stunning with all the old buildings. Crowded and festive. The kids adored it and those cinnamon things (Trdelník)? TO DIE FOR.
xmas market. A lovely visit with many stands dotted around in various squares. We liked the old town market stalls better than those in the jewish quarter

Historically picturesque. Visited as Christmas markets opened. Stunning architecture everywhere you look. Lovely vibe, plenty of places to eat and drink and shop. Well worth a visit and the quaint Astronomical clock is there too.

A Must Do In Prague!. I loved this area because there were so many shops and little eateries. There is also the grand clock here that you have to get a picture in front of! This place is especially magical around the Christmas Holiday!
Christmas Market. Open, overwhelming beautiful square with splendidly decorated & ostentatious building. it is lit up with million leds pushing the boundaries of light pollution.

Fascinating. I was travelling for business and just had few hours available, but the Old Town and the Castle are a must if you travel to Prague. Make sure you're are standing in front of the Clock in the Old Town Square when it stroke the hour and go up the tower for a 360* view of Prague, especially at sunset.

Use the panaramoa feature on your camera. If you can only stop one place in Prague to view beautiful buildings, then this is one of the best. The famous clock is right here as well as a huge open square, perfect to stand in the middle and do numerous pan shots. Treat yourself to a hot wine, beer or coffee in many of the eaters and watch the crowds. Yes, prices are higher, but worth the price.

Astronomical ;). Astronomical clock is definitely something to see! Make sure you witness it in action, I believe at noon every day. This square is so beautiful and the architecture is different in a way I can't describe than the rest of Europe.

Great atmosphere, lovely Christmas markets!. It is a must-see when visiting Prague. As I visited in December, it was lovely to see the festive markets in the square. Some beautiful buildings surrounding the area as well as the famous astronomical clock.

Sit, relax and enjoy the crisp Pilsner Beer. Very lively square with astronomical clock presenting an hourly show. We had a great time as we went there practically every night during our one week stay. The food is excellent and the ambience was great in the outdoor tents with heaters. We had sausage platter and it was just awesome! The Pilsner beer was very crisp and refreshing. Must visit!
Very pretty. Very pretty square with restaurants and outside pubs to people watch - has the astronomical clock and street vendors

Great place. Old Town Square is heart of Prague, the perfect place to start your visit to Prague. Church and Astrnomical clock are the most beautiful attractions in Prague. After visiting the Square, a lot of people look at the typical Czech restaurants. You can find them in Old Town.

I visited mant times and will visit many times. Perfect square. I thinks the best in Europe. The atmosphire, the beauty arround, the people, the restaurants and even the air. Just walk arround make many photos and enjoy.

It was cold but full of activities. This square is a prime example of a European city square complete with street performers, sidewalk cafes and great people watching. It is completely surrounded by buildings of interest, churches and the City Hall with the famous clock. It was cold when we visited so we did not stay long but it would be fun to be able to have a coffee or wine at one of the side walk cafes and just watch the people. The only thing to watch out for are pick pockets...they are mostly around the clock, so that when everyone has their arms up to take a picture of the clock...there pockets and bags are tempting game.

Clock. Well worth the visit, the old town square is the home of the famous clock, with plenty of fire eaters and attractions, plenty of cafes in the area and again good for photography, Again well worth it with great views of the city

Can spend hours lokking around here. A great place to explore and take photos. Plenty of great looking buildings and an astronomical clock ( a must see chiming). Lots of people milling about . The Christmas market was being set up when we were there, not fully operational, but still nice to see the preparations. This is where the free walk tours start from, plenty to choose from. Horse & trap rides, tour by intriguing motor vehicles. Many differing street performers, some musical, others visual, like; living statues, soap bubble performers etc. Loads of shops as well as the inevitable tourist trinkets shops. Plenty to occupy your time.The astronomical clock performs its chiming every hour and was a star attraction with many people gathering to watch.We went twice in 3 days, one for a walking tour when we learned about its buildings and history, the other we were free to stay as long as we wished to take in the atmosphere.A must see place.

Beautiful and legendary. The square is beautiful y itself, but knowing the legends behind the different attractions here make the visit so much better! I recommend doing some reading or taking one of the free walking tours to get the full story on the square.
great square eat a sausage. Great town square and hub of Prague. Be sure to have at least on beer there and also try the Prague ham and the sausage that are sold at one of the open air stands!!
Fun place. The old town square was just a fun place to be, with music, food, views, street entertainment, lots of people and lots of stores.

Allwyas an attraction. Old Town Square is nowadays the heart of Prague and a "must see" if you´ve never been here.Beside the Astronomical clock there are 2 interesting churches and one restaurant worth seeing. The restaurant is called U Prince and it is close to the astronomical clock. The food is OK, overpriced and definitely place for tourist BUT it has a roof terrace! It is absolutely the place where you want to be and have a view over Old Town Square. You can sit there and have coffee, beer or anything else and enjoy in peace the beauty of this town. Very romantic and pleasant place. It is heated in winter.

Wow. What a sight. Christmas lights and stalls. The clock what can I say a must see. Easy to get to and a great centre point for looking a little further afield. The chamber challenge was great a must for anyone who likes new experiences and mysterious fun.
Old town Square. Atmospheric, friendly, and very romantic. The street vendors (early christmas market stalls) were outstandingly good.

Very authentic square. The Prague old city square is quite fascinating. It is complete with great cathedrals, old historical buildings from the communist Era.there are many cafes and restaurants to enjoy authentic Czech cuisine. There are many tourists from around the world. The atmosphere is terrific.
Worth your time. Beautiful place to visit, everyone has to visit the square and see the cathedral. Can be busy but worth your time.

Great place to wander. This was a great area to wander and discover a little something different around every cobble stoned street corner. From the clock to the churches and arches to the shopping centre and municipal building holding the ballet, it was beautiful around every turn. The market was set up bug unfortunately wasn't opening until,after we left. The huge Christmas tree was a bonus to see and watch the work crew install and get the lights just right over a few days.
Great place!. We came during Christmas and hung out for a while. There was an enormous Christmas market; it was very crowded so watch your pockets. There is a lot of touristy stuff nearby.

The Heart of the City. Old Town Square is the heart of old Prague and as such it has a charm that I really enjoyed. From the al fresco dining to the ancient clock, it is a pleasant place to spend a few hours and drink some Czech beer.

Square at Christmas. We came to Prague to get into the Christmas spirit and this square certainly helped... It is very festive with lots of stalls and traditional food (which is very good). There is a great big Christmas tree which is at the centre of the market square.A must see for anyone going just before Christmas, and it wasn't too busy.
Beautiful. Amazing clock and busy bustling square. The Christmas Markets were very traditional and beautifully lit.

Astronomical Clock. No visit to Old Town Square is complete without checking out the Astronomical Clock. This clock has the 12 saints positioned and passing at the strike of the hour - 2 by 2.The area round the clock is always crowded with various street performers providing music and other types of entertainment. Their are many restaurants serving food. Apart from this you will find the street carts providing you mouth watering Czech sausages to tickle your pallet. One should not forget the hot wine served at the pavement outlets which is a good stimulant after a hard day of sight seeing. The shops in and around provide various gifts and especially lovely crystal for which the Czech Republic is famous for.
great for people watching. Great variety of shops and eatery's. Plenty of entertainment around to idle away the time.lots of architecture around. Watch out for segways!

Must see must do. This is a wonderful square with so much activity of all sorts i had a Thai massage, attended a classical music concert in St Nicholas Monastery, browsed the Christmas market stalls and attended the Christmas tree lighting ceremony. Travelling alone was no problem the square is well policed and i felt very safe every time I went there. The architecture there is a must see and the astronimcal clock another must see.

Lots of history, beautiful square.. Sat in one of cafes on perimeter of the square enjoying a beer or two! Lovely views and many human statues/artists/entertainers to watch.BEWARE of food sellers positioned behind Astronomical Clock on outskirts of the square - prices seem reasonable on advertising boards, but unless you watch them closely they will sell you second rate food, piled up on the trays and then charge you 'astronomical' price! I was charged 640k (£21 ish) for prague ham and potato with cabbage, meant to be a small snack!

Not the best. Our guide has been extolling the wonders of this great city. Having the Manchester. Xmas markets on our doorstep, puts this to shame. Interesting but every type of stall is the same , no matter where it is in Prague. The food and hot wine are good, the blacksmith is individual, but lacking atmosphere and variety.

Lovely old town square but very busy!. Visited Prague in November 2014 and this square is another "must see" while you are visiting. It can get very busy during the day so I recommend visiting early in the morning (especially for your first view) so that you have less crowds and tourists. You will get unlimited access to take pictures and just breathe a little easier without the crowds! I also went back later it the day to the Old Town Hall and paid the 100 Czech Krona to ride the elevator to the top of the Old Town Hall building where you can get some amazing views of the city. Truly worth the money to take pictures and get a great panorama view of the city!

Lovely old town square with an amazing astronomical clock.. The clock is great, it "performs" on the hour from 9am to 9pm. It's on an old tower which is worth climbing for a super view. There is even a lift to the top - the upper section of which is a very unusual modern sttructure within the old tower.

Heart of Christmas. We were in the Old Town Square at the start of the Christmas markets. Very busy, but with a nice atmosphere. Lots of stalls with food and drink mainly, hot wine, sausages etc. the view over the square is loved from the clock tower too.

Charming. Loved it here… Lots of places to shop and eat but the charm is its history. Just be careful of the guys that come up to you wanting to sell you currency at a discount. Lets face it. How can that be? Actually, they are out to rip you off by selling you practically worthless notes from Belarus that resemble Czech currency.

hub of the city. Old town square is a very lively and vibrant place, The street performers are all very talented and entertaining, especially the musicians, (the jazz band were fantastic) this all helps to create the great atmosphere in the square, there is a selection of stalls offering local delicacies which are definitely worth trying.
