The clock is the main attraction and the way it works is very impressive, however the hourly display is in my opinion only worth seeing once just to say you have seen it. We went to the top of the clock tower and the view of the whole city was stunning. I would recommend taking part in one of the tours talks so you get to know the history of the city and the square, the one we attended was extremely interesting.
Old and charming. Lots of history good cafes & resturants we visited the tower a great view inexpensive with a lift for the less active.

My favourite part. Old Town Square was my favourite part of Prague. It has the gorgeous clock tower and my favourite building, the beautiful the church of our lady before tyn. Old Town Square is such a beautiful spot to visit. The old buildings are just mesmerising to look at.

Top 5 things to do in Prague. I lucked out and was the only person kn the English tour of the historical halls. You see the clock's Apostles from the back of the clock as well as beautiful and historic rooms from the town hall, the original street level (in the basement) and prison. Art, history and architecture are are rolled into one as this was the site of so many things. Timing of English tours changes daily so check in first thing.

Touristy but Fun. Of course the big attraction is the "clock", but there is so much more to enjoy. The cafes, shops and people watching. This is one of my favorite squares in all my travels in Europe. Go and experience it. You won't be disappointed.
A must see. There also an App to download to see what all the dials mean. They are fascinating. Real history of the Middle ages.

Wonderful square. There's everything for you to have a good time: beautiful historical buildings, amazing views, lots of street food and drinks, music, actors, shops and restaurants. This is the heart of the Old town. Don't miss!

Must visit,. Surrounded by architecturally outstanding buildings you have to visit this.There are always street entertainers, the bands are great !There are many cafes and street food stalls all of which are worth sampling and reasonably priced.And of course there is the famous astronomical clock.In December there is a large Christmas market, we saw the enormous tree being erected during our visit in November.

History at every step. Really impressive scenery of the historical center and also modern and lively part of the city .. Everywhere also smells a special sweet bread, it is called "trdelník" ...Opravdu působivá scenérie historického centra a zároveň moderní a rušná část města..

Tourists galore but still worth a visit.. The clock is a must on the hour, but don't expect too much, the street entertainers are generally good but with some rubbish. Lots of bars to sit in and watch the world go by. Try at least one of the churches, all have amazing painted ceilings.
Wonderful. What a delightful place to visit, full of character and atmosphere, with lots of little side streets full of local craft shops which you could walk around for hours.

Prague. Beautiful architecture surrounding cobblestone square. Famous clock tower, busking, horse drawn carriage and numerous other activities make the square a must see for travel. We had accommodation on edge of square , perfect position but not noisy

Rainy nights. Spent a pleasant evening walking in the rain. Great time lovely music in the square. Timing was perfect as I happened to find myself standing by the clock tower just minutes before the 5pm chiming. Well worth the 5 minute wait. Even in the rain. Oh, those cobble stone streets are very slick in the rain!

Look, don't buy. The square is majestic. Nothing can ruin it. The clock tower is most excellent. However, the shops are horrendous overpriced tourist traps, some selling the same Chinese stuff you find in other "glass" cities, such as Venice. Mind the Chinese tourist groups. Their communal ego-centrism is world class.
Old town square. Very beautiful square, really buzzing at night, but feels totally safe. Loads of restaurants and bars, but not tacky. Cant wait to go back to Prague.
Absolutely stunning square . Beautiful square with loads to see. Very expensive but you're paying for the view. There's cheap pubs not far away.

Picturesque. The prettiest square, both during the day and at night when the churches are all lit up make it look like something out of a fairy tale; so pretty; lovely restaurant on the square called Al Minuto; great pasta and wine; lots of buskers and things going on in the square; great for people watching;

This is where it happens!. Loved Old Town- the restaurants, shops, the energy!
Something for everyone. You have to like walking as public transportation is a bit of a walk. We even saw a 35 piece orchestra flash mob! Be aware that it can get VERY crowded, so watch your purse, pockets.

The most beautiful square of Prague. The history of this square started in the beginning of the 2nd milennium by market. There are in: Old Town Hall, St.Nichola Church, The Church of Our Lady of Týn, Týn School, The House At the Stone Bell, Goltz-Kinský Palace. Square is important by history: for example: In 1621 the execution of 27 participans in the Battle on the White Mountain performed here. Nowadays every year during Christmas people market carries out here at high Christmas tree.
Stunning. A beautiful town square lots to see and do the Astronomical Clock is a particularly lovely sight perfect for tourists looking to explore Prague.

Square with a lot of things to see. You can go straight ahead through the Václavské square and then you can enter this very beautiful place with a lot of shops, restaurants, old buildings and street artists. At the every full hour you can see some small performance on the astronomical clock. The Old Town Square will engage your attention for a lot of time, so reserve at least two hours for it.
Experience the culture. Fun place to visit and hangout. Multiple restaurants and great shopping. Street entertainers and street samples of authentic Czech food make this worth the stop.

Sunday in the Old Town Square.... Great ambience. The Astronomical Clock is not to be missed. Good food all around in restaurants and stalls. Dixieland jazz. Locals, families, tourists mingling... Nice place.
Beautiful. This is probably one of the most beautiful squares I have ever seen. Its so beautiful that your eyes hurt.

Lovely, if touristy. This lovely, old square is a must for tourists. It is surrounded by beautiful, old buildings and street musicians and others entertain you as you stroll around. The highlight is the Astrological Clock in the town hall. Do watch on the hour as the skeleton rings his bell and the apostles appear in the two doorways. There are outdoor cafes in the square and shops filled with goodies (especially wonderful garnets) are close by.

Fairytale Vibes. A spooky and mystical air surrounds the Old Town Square - particularly on a foggy November night. Much more lively during the day, but you can't help but imagine the ghosts of former generations crossing this square daily.
Best part of Prague. Old Town Square is the heart of Prague. With so many shops, food stalls and places to view some of Prague's history, old town square is really great!

The astronoical clock is pretty cool.. The clock is a cool feature of this area. We also loved the live musicians in the square at night. It gets very crowded. Sit at one of the cafes and enjoy a beverage and people watch.

A fantastic place to visit. A charming place in the centre of Prague. The facades of the buildings are pleasing to the eye, so different to what we are used to. There are inviting bars and restaurants along with street vendors selling traditional Czech food. Pork knuckle, crepes, grog, fried spiral potato, and a lovely cinnamon, sugar pastry. Plus the wonderful Astronomical clock. All the walking trips , bus trips, horse and carriage and classic car rides leave from here.
cosy. a must when you go to Prague. With the astronomical clock. lots of places to go for a drink and enjoy a view of this square.
I really enjoyed my time. The old town square area is just Amazing, you can spend hours just walking around,dining,and snapping picture. I really loved it.

A must spend time at place. A super nice place to hang out and enjoy the views and the people. Enjoy coffee or local sweets at one of the nice road side cafes the have there. The historic architecture is simply breath taking.I have visited many "Old Towns" across Europe, this place is surely the most memorable, genuine and authentic place I have seen and had the pleasure of experiencing.DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.

Check out the clock, buy your city pass, and get ready to enjoy Prague!. Yes, I guess a visit to Old Town Square is a must. We got it out of the way right after we arrived in Prague. It is crazy touristy, with people lining up every hour to be in place to get good photos of the Astronomical Clock when it chimes and does its thing. We got ourselves a good seat at the cafe right across from the clock - Oliva Verde - a good first Czech meal, and perfect for our clock photo ops.After lunch, I went and bought our Prague city passes at the Tourist office to the left of the clock (there is another tourist office in the square, but that one doesn't sell the city passes), and we were ready to do some sightseeing for the next several days.

Chocalate box architecture. The square is surrounded by beautiful and unusual buildings. It is busy but not so that you cant get pictures.Beware of young men on segways trying to offer you tours. They weave dangerously through the square and are annoying and take away from the experience. You also are approached regularly by those offering to change currency.

Great place for people watching. The Old Town square lived up to its reputation. It was crowded, but not too bad. There were large crowds around the clock, but we just didn't hang out around there. There are plenty of outdoor seating areas if you are just looking for a place to sit and people watch.

Touristy but worth a visit. It was very crowded when I visited (july 2014) but still architecturally stunning with lots of history behind it. I recommend taking the walking tour so you get all the information you need! There are also lots of street performers which is very entertaining.

Atomic Clock. This is a high price shopping district along with a lot of activity going on , It is very walkable . We walked in the evening and there are lots of strollers to keep you company. Prague is safe from violent crime but there are lots of pickpockets. If someone approaches you trying to help.. , hang on to your belongings. Make sure you have some change for restrooms as well.Walk to the top of the Atomic clock and see the view.
Beautiful and a must see. Beautiful square with outstanding architecture. The churches are spectacular and the astronomical clock is worth a visit. Very touristy, but ya gotta see it.
Busy market. Always rush, very busy .. so many people from all over the world. have many choices of shopping and dining.
great place to sit. Plaza is in the middle of old town, has several beer gardens and restaurants around. Excellent street entertainers. A must see in Prague.

Historic but alive. Any visit to Prague should included a visit to Old Town Square. Loads of history, including the world famous Astronomical Clock. Loads and loads of very good restaurants to choose from and alive with tourists and street musicians.
Old town square. The whole atmosphere was nice. Love the outside activities. The clock is not as big as I expected it to be, but nice nun the less.

The Astronomical Clock was remarkable.. Enjoyed watching the variety of people/tourists, performers, building architecture. Fantastic sights, activities, restaurants. Returned 3 times in order to catch on video the working (very old) famous clock.

one of the nicest "big squares" I ahve been. Like every European big city, Prague show off with a very nice square.The astronomical clock on the its side, the charming Tyn chapel on the other side.many street performers, coffees-shops and very nice atmosphere.

Great level of entertainment. Was a wonderful place to be surrounded by restaurants and had entertainers galore, plus the astronomical clock is great although it does get very very busy even when we went in November so you will have to push through to get past the crowds at the clock.

Always a joy. We spent a lot of time here as we found ourselves crossing through the Old Town Square to get to the Jewish Quarter, or Charles Bridge or elsewhere. It was lively without being too touristy.

Must See in Prague. This is truly the heart of Prague and morning/noon/night this square is where all the action is. First and foremost you are humbled by how historic and beautiful it is – you are surrounded by the Town Hall Tower, a cathedral (Church of Our Lady before Tyn), the Astronomical Clock which is amazing, a massive sculpture Pomnik mistral Jana Husa, horse drawn carriages and of course restaurants and shops. This is an excellent place to grab a hot wine for .50 Crowns and sit down to people watch and take in the views. The square is also a popular spot for tours to meet and also attracts people playing music and trying to earn some extra coin for performing. This is definitely worth a trip at night too as the square and the sights are light up with spot lights and look amazing.
Great if you could see it without the crowds. A spectacularly beautiful old square but spoiled by the crowds (even in October). Lovely old buildings but noisy. Best enjoyed late evening.

The place to be in Prague. This spot was the highlight of our trip at night. The Tyne Cathedral illuminated like a fairytale. The astronomical clock is an ancient wonder not to be missed, and the local faire is great. Be sure to peak in the window of the Thai massage shop where people are dangling their feet into a fish tank for a "treatment."
Very interesting. Brilliant area, architecture fabulous, lots of places to eat and shop. Not too many places to sit and watcg life go by though.

The center of Prague. Centrum of Prague. Lots of people.Everywhere Preparing for Christmas - decoration, retail houses, the smell of cinnamon, grilled sausages and sea of beer. Especially beautiful in the evening.Unforgettable feeling.You can ride on a carriage with horses - 700-800 CZK.possible to Segvay - 10min / 200 CZK

Picturesque. Very lovely square, in either day or night. Many restaurants and bars at the square, and is home to the old Bell Tower and Church Before Tyn. But be prepared for some idiots on keyboards pretending to make music.

Atmospheric !. If in prague, make your way to the old town square, park your bum on a seat, order a "hot wine" and enjoy the show. From people watching, listening to the various and varied performers, watching the entertainers, I guarantee you'll not be bored, and surrounded by the most beautiful buildings to top it off.

Old Town Square Prague A Happening Place. Old Town Square Prague is a typical city square. It bustles with food vendors, street entertainers, restaurants, and pubs. The highlight is the centuries old Astronomical clock that entertains for 20 seconds on the hour. The square is the gateway to the Charles Bridge, the Jewish Ghetto. It is very close to several large hotel chains. There are some homeless in the park; but it wasn't a problem for us. Many of the side streets have exclusive stores. It is definitely a must see.

The heart of Prague.. Prior to arriving in Prague, I was under the impression that Wenceslas square was the centre of this delightful city.So wrong. The only thing of interest up this part of town is the balcony where the Velvet Revolution centred. I think it is now an M&S store.The old town square is truly the heart of this charming city. Yes it's manic and you do need to keep your wits about you, but it certainly is worth finding. Bit of a trick if you're from the Southern Hemisphere and rely on a map to show where North is.The streets don't intersect logically and you will get lost.Take your time and soak up the atmosphere, stay till dark to get some gorgeous low light photography in.

You can sit here for hours. We sat for hours just watching all the tourists come and go. Try to sweets made on the barbecue. They are delicious. In fact the only food that I was really impressed with in Prague was the desserts. They were all delicious.

Always Busy. Practically THE reason to come to Prague is to wander around the Old Town Square. Lots of shops to visit, lots of people, and lots to see. You must check out the Astronomical Clock - along with a few thousand of your closest friends. Keep your wits about you and one hand on your wallet at all times.

Another place you must visit before you die. After seeing many photographs of the famous bridge in Prague I decided it was a place I must visit as the phographic opportunities looked enormous. I was right. Within minutes of arriving at the hotel, which was 10 minutes quick walk from the Old Town Square, I had taken about 50 photographs. This was just on the way there. The architecture throughout the city centre is fabulous. In the square are many attractions,stalls, troupes of artistes and it is surrounded by these gothic type buildings with towers and turrets reaching to the sky. At weekends the square is heaving with tourists, especially in the evening, as there are many displays going on, each with its crowd of spectators. During the day, and during the week it is quieter and the best time for pictures.. Just past the square is the famous Astronomical Clock which periodically chimes and displays a series of religious figures in little windows around the clock. So, periodically, there is a huge crowd of tourists gathering at the base of the clock awaiting the display. A camera with a video facility is a must for this. With a short wait, it is possible to climb the tower stairs to the top for a bird's eye view of the square. Worth doing.. Around the square are many open air restaurants with estensive menus at reasonable price and all selling the famous Czech beers. The square is a few minutes from the famous bridge, but this is the subject of my next review. You must visit Prague, good hotels, many restaurants, lovely shops and friendly people.

Beautiful, Bustling Square. Beautiful architecture and a very lively vibe. Expect very large crowds around the astronomical clock on the hour, for the animated figure which were, in our opinion, a but of a let down... But the Square is fantastic, even at night, when it gets lit up like a Disney movie.

Great place to walk around. Loved the atmosphere and the people watching. Can be a good meeting place when you are separating from a group, but also can be very crowded so be careful if you decided to do that.
Prague for a weekend. Must see for anyone visiting Prague, small and manageable. The clock is lovely, the food options were delicious in the square, and photo ops abound!
Heart of the city. This seams like the heart of Prague. Nice restaurants to have a drink on the heated terraces with view on the market place where there is always what to see or do. Very cosy!

History and emotion. One of the strongest remembrance I've got from Prague - in fact of the whole Europe - is the Staromestska Square, a fantastic historical scenario that can entertains a visitor for hours. All the amazing architecture, churches, clocks cafes and countless details on every corner.
Old town square. Buildings amazing. History very interestings. Atmosphere good and safe. Crowds not so amazing. Cafes more expensive.

Beautiful but be cautions!. The right moment to observe its beauty was the late afternoon. When the sun shines on the top of the buildings of the Old Town Hall, the Churches and the centuries old houses surrounding. It is a good opportunity to get a good picture. Special tip and warning: Beware of the the exchange offices located in the area and especially the one in the corner close to the souvenir shop opposite the City Hall. Its exchange rate on display is very attractive. But that exchange rate only applies (maybe!) to when you change HUGE sums of money! Ordinarily, when you change a couple of hundred dollars or euros, the rate is MUCH lower. If you are in hurry and do not read the fine print, you will suffer big losses.The best way to avoid this sort of crooked deals is to use an official bank ATM only, NOT any forex office. They are tourist traps, nothing else.

Busy!. No matter what time of day you visit here, it is packed. Tourists, vendors, eateries, buskers and horse drawn carts. The astronmical clock gathers large crowds....be prepared to be slightly underwhelmed. Lots of streets to explore off here...explore and enjoy.
a must see. the image of Prague you imagine, but add thousand of people! In august it is almost impossible to take a photo

Something new around every corner. Prague is a beautiful classic od European city. Starting from the square you and just walk around and be amazed every time you turn a corner. Take a map though so you can find way back to square.

Amazed!. We had planned to visit the Square during the day but by chance ended up stumbling on it in an evening instead - and we were so glad we did! The sights, sounds and atmosphere of an evening visit topped the day time visit (although still a lovely place to visit!)Wonderful streets to wander through, architecture to see and people to meet. The astronomical clock was great to see, although the Square is a highlight in itself! Surprisingly local and easy to walk around, everywhere is closer than it seems!

Lovely, Lovely, Lovely. A not to be missed part of Prague. Lovely square in the Old Part of Prague with many ornate and stunning buildings from a time long gone by. The astronomical clock resides here as well as many small shops and stores. Not to be missed in any Prague itinerary.
Beautiful Heart of Prague. Fantastic vibrant place to visit. Beautiful architecture, interesting street performers, lots to see and do.

Mandatory!!. The bridge is incredible, all the statues and its structure, the views of the city and the castle. It is even better when is foggy. What we recommend is going very early in the morning, otherwise there are times that you can't barely walk on the bridge.

THE place to visit in Prague. THis is probably the most famous place in Prague, where the medieval clock is situated. it's always full of tourists and therefore keep an eye on your wallets ; ) Prague is a very safe city, but beware of pickpockets on Trains, Metro and... the Old Town Square ; ) Especially when some street show is going on.

Perhaps the most beautiful square in all of Europe. I once lived hear here and walked thru the square nearly each day. Winter or summer, there is always something of interest. The Christmas market is perhaps the best. Sunka, mulled wine, roasted chestnuts, and all of the history and beauty. Prague is very walkable, and this square is a must visit. Nearby is Wenceslaus Square. Take the Royal route, cross Karluv Most, and you're at Prague Castle. Lots of ships and sausage stands in the area.
Typical central European Square. A typical square but the astronomical clock is a real bonus. In November the crowds were not too bad but I imagine it is really hectic in full tourist season.
Nice place to wander. Good place to sit around, listen to the musicians that play for free at the square, nice places to eat, just a bit more expensive that going some 100 meters away...

Enjoy the show of Astronomical Clock - a unique masterpiece. Come a little ahead - the clock show starts every hour, many people want to watch. Read little something about it´s history. And you can climb the clock tower as well, and take a view from the bird´s perspective on many other towers around (remember - this is called ONE HUNDRED TOWER CITY, so you should climb at least one :-)). Or enjoy the view from various pub "gardens" (heated in winter), if you are ready to spend. During Christmas time enjoy the Christmas Market, Light installations etc. One little negative thing - as in every metropolis, beware of pickpockets :-/

A must do. This is the heart of Prague! We spent our evenings here after dinner every night that we were in town. Everything is lit up beautifully, especially the clock and church.the square is bustling with horse and buggy rides, about 800 czk and delicious Prague food such as prague ham, bread on roll, and coffee. There are tons of restaurants, shops, and bars open in the entire area. You will not be bored. Be sure to stay at the top of the hour to watch the clock.

A shame that the history is swallowed up.... Too much neon and commercialization detracts from the beautiful architecture and history in this place. It is loud and crowded, people are rude and so much is lost in all the commotion and chaos.
beautiful. loved spending time here. lots of pavement cafes, the stunning astrological clock and the beautiful Church of Our Lady before Tyn
epicentrum of life. Everybody visit this pretty square for atmosphere, town hall, historical medieval houses and Jan Hus statue. But most important is very intensive activity to very late night time.
Great place. A big place with restaurants and a lot of history around the place. You are not alone on the place at any daytime.
Beautiful but overcrowded. The most beautiful square in Prague. You can see the Astronomical Clock, but choose your visit time carefully because this square can sometimes get really overcrowded.

Great Atmosphere. Walking around late evening is fantastic, a true delight. Busy, atmospheric and SAFE. Of course there is always a worry about pickpockets but hey, hold onto your bag, keep your pockets zipped and no problem.

Architecture is amazing. the square is beautiful, arrive before the hour to see the astronomical clock which is beautiful but crowded and watch for pickpockets! There are musicians playing fire eaters performing! Do not miss
Buzz. Plenty of activity here. Astronomical Clock, Restaurants, Free entertainment, Traditional Food Vendors.Didn't like the crowds waiting for the clock to strike on the hour.
Great place to people watch. A very fun place to people watch with lots of cafes. Check for free wifi as I noticed many cafes offer it for free and it works into the Square.

Very Beautiful. Of course you have to see this area of Prague. It's a beautiful square--lots of entertainment going on, places to eat, and the famous clock. Get to the clock about 10 minutes before the hour. BUT beware of pickpockets!
Just a square. Nice architecture. Overcrowded, bad street musicians, overpriced food. The clock is beautiful but the performance "on the hour" is pretty underwhelming. Get your selfie and get moving.

Pilgrimage Group Booking. Very interesting and historical place. Its astrological clock is the landmark and uniqueness of Czeck Republic among other countries. It is has art,beauty, religion and science connected to this clock. I bought one clock like this and placed in the living room so I can remember the special moment I have in this place. In the shopping area, I bought the same pattern of my scarf, bag and tote bag. It caught a lot of compliments: very classy and dainty.

Magical at night. Great to go anytime but at night all the monuments,towers,pubs,bar,restaurants are illuminated creating a magical sight.It is this sight that keeps people coming back ,year after year.

Great place :). Old town square is a great place for everyone. Families, couples, friends even the solo traveller. There are always bands playing music or some kind of entertainment during the day. You can see the Astronomical clock (a must-do for tourists in Prague) and enjoy some nicely roasted pork (and beer of course!). With all the little streets around you will find a bar club or restaurant almost immediately, theres so much variety in this small little square and its pretty much close to everything you would want to see in Prague. Even at night the stores stay open selling these local doughnut like things with sugar (which are really nice haha). Nice place to be at any time of the day :)
Not a square.... Lively centre of the city - always something going on (buskers, fire eaters, protesters etc). Cafes and bars are very expensive.

Historic. Old town square, historic, crowded. Astronomical clock is overrated, but worth watching. The clock tower offers a nice view but I highly recommend going to the south tower in St Vitus Cathedral where you can have a *much* nicer and higher view of the city.
People watchers paradise. Good range of cafes, bars tourist shops etc. watch out when changing money...commission charges can be very, very steep!
Old and great. Very busy with tourists, but a real buzz about it. View from the tower above the famous clock is worth the trip and it has a lift!

History, Astronomical Clock. Most cities and towns have a centre square but the minute I walked into Old Town Square in Praha I was captivated by the old buildings, churches and the famous Astronomical Clock. Worth a look.

When can I come back?!. This is what you think of when you think of Prague. Go up to the viewing platform of City Hall for the most stunning views of Prague - 360 degrees worth. Watch the Clock, you know which one I mean! Do whatever. This is the place we came back to at least 2x a day.

In the midst of history and architecture. Old Town Square is easily the biggest tourist attraction. It is surrounded by important churches and monuments. Morning or evening, the square is lively with different performers keeping visitors amused. The Old Town Square is also the place where the famous Astronomical Clock is and the clock tower from were one can get a beautiful view of the city.

People watching... this place is always busy with a lot of people, vendors and artists... it's a very nice place to just sit down and chill. Drink coffee or beer while soaking in the view and athmosphere.

great for people watching. The square is filled with entertainers and street vendors. Plenty of good places to sit and have a bite to eat or a cup of coffee of glass of wine. a very pleasant way to spend a few hours. Plenty of shopping and a short walk to many of the city highlights.
Many tourists in November. Lot's of action. Tourists from all over but mostly American, Russian, Japanese and Chinese. I can't imagine how packed the place must be during the tourist season.

Picturesque. Loved the street food and cafe options with the tourists milling around amongst the quaint historical structures with an old world charm.
A must do on your Prague visit.

Put This On Your Bucket List. The astrological clocks should be enough to bring your here. However, the statuary, the medieval architecture, the churches with lovely spires are just plain awesome. Try to be in the area of the clocks when the hour.........incredible movement takes place. One word of caution........pickpockets!! Unfortunately, Prague has a bad reputation when it comes to theft. The crowding of this area makes you a prime target if you do not take precautions. (No, I was not a victim but one of my friends was.)

Wonderful square. Just come back from three days in Prague, passing through the Old Town Square several times each day. It's a truly wonderful square, and much of the area around the square is also great.The square features the famous astronomical clock. This is a complicated device but our free walking tour guide talked it through and told the story of how it came to be made and what it showed. It's worth getting someone to tell you all about the clock. Of course the square features the ubiquitous human statues and entertainers and several restaurants (which we didn't use).

Just like a fairytale.. Everywhere you looked a new surprise took your eye. A building, a window, church spire all simply amazing, Street performers, artists, peddlers and travellers from all over mingling in a cacophony of noise and excitement. Ah Prague, what a city!

interesting. a very interesting square full of excitement and culture. loads of hustle and bustle, music playing and dancing. the only piece of advice would be to keep an eye on your belongings- a few shifty characters were about

Wiew from above. If you are not afraid of heights, it is worth it to go out to a wonderful view of the towers of Prague Astronomical Clock or opposite to the restaurant U Prince. View of Prague is here unforgettable!
square. Beautiful and historic place... good restaurants near by with friendly service. some times just too much people there
well equipped. well equipped - plenty of animal species we did not expect so many, we were surprised !, we recommend this attraction for everyone who spend more than 2 days in Prague

The town center. This is a great place to orient yourself to the center of Prague. There is always a crowd and always something going on here. The main tourist office is located here as well as a very clean WC. Come here day or night for a fun time.

Clock tower. The old town square is the heart of Prague. So much is going on & the restaurants & bars are so friendly & welcoming.A variety of city tours available,either by foot,horse & carriage or land train.It is a multicultural town with lots of activity both during the day & at night. A brilliant trip & would recommend anyone looking for a city break to go & explore.
Old Town square. Definitely worth a visit there is so much to see with lots of people enjoying the atmosphere in the area. There is plenty of places to sit and watch all the people go by.
People watching. Great place to sit in a cafe and watch people from all over the World. Lots of choices to eat and drink

One of the most beautiful squares in the world. Visiting this square you walk across centuries of culture and architecture. Don't miss the gothic house "U kamenného zvonu", the fantastic medieval astronomical clock and the house where Einstein used to meet Kafka and other Prague intellectuals in the salon of Mrs. Fanta. Climb the tower of the Town Hall with a fantastic view. Avoid the tourist trap restaurants and cheap junk souvenirs. You can get better food in other parts of Prague.
Beautiful. lovely place with amazing buildings, plenty of cafes and restaurants to sit and watch the crowds go buy.plenty of street food vendors too.

Embrace wandering.... The square is tourist/shopping central; take time to explore the arcades that open off the square in the ground floors of the buildings. Specialty shops, art galleries; bookshops not easily seen from the square. Dig deeper and you'll have far more satisfying adventures!

So beautiful at night. We hanged around old town for dinner. It was so romantic and beautiful when the lights of the buildings started lighting up, and the busker sang his tunes in the empty square that slowly started drawing crowds. In the day, the narrow pebbled streets were pretty interesting - shops selling souvenirs, restaurants, clothes, etc. A place to go for shopping and also soaking in the city life in Prague.

Walk through these streets: an everlasting experience. Feeling like being transported to the past while walking through the streets that lead you to the old town square. And watching the sunset through the castles and domes is something unforgettable.

Old Town Prague. Get it together, your entering the bombastic old town, even at 10am the place is alive. Amazing Food, Amazing take home gifts for family and friends, amazing drinks ( OI! absinthe) .. I am sure if you go to Prague you will end up in Old Town.

A fascinating hangout place . The town Square was fascinating & loved the walk through the cobbled streets . Amazing shops & interesting crowd . Lots of foot Massage shops & many good cafes . Totally feel in love with the town square.
Beautiful medieval square. I must say that this square really impressed me. His name says it all. I was truly breathed the atmosphere of the Middle Ages...
Beautiful square. This is a central area which every street seems to lead into. It's a great place to sit and grab a beer and just people watch while enjoying it's great architecture.
Busy buzz. Lots of street entertainment. Beautiful buildings lots of photo opportunities. The street vendors were not pushy but plenty of choice if you wanted a tour.
Old town squre. Billiant good place to go in the evening and see the entertainersdrink warm wine and eat the famous cake

The best square ever. We stayed right next to the square and there was always something different happening. The cafés are cozy and warm and you can spend the late afternoon sitting watching the busy square
historic. The clock was a bit disappointing but the old town was beautiful. Historic with stunning architecture and a mix of bars and restaurants to suit everyone
Crowded and a lot of rstaurants. A crowded place, but there is also a lot of places to drop in for a cofee or a beer. And they have a lot of good beers in this country.
Fun cool place. lots going on the square. The clock and fun restaurants and street vendors. great for night time viewing and entertainment.

So much to see!. Don't miss going up the Astronomical Clock Tower. Beautiful 360-degree city views. Several cafes at or near the Old Town Square. Not far from there, at the U Prince Hotel, there's an awesome bar, the Black Angel's Bar in the basement of the hotel.

Lovely old Square. Lovely old square packed with tourists. Street artists and musicians to entertain you all day long. Lots of cafés and restaurants and a great place to enjoy a pilsner while watching the world go by. Also loved the astronomical clock. One of nicest squares we have I sited.
Un equalled. There are several historic churches. Go see the clock too! Restaurants on the square are overpriced.

City Centre Spectacular. Prague in miniature but pubs and cafes are over priced which changes if you walk less than a hundred metres in any direction. Tyn Church spires are inspirational and a Prague icon. Old Town Clock and its hourly display a complete nonsense - I have been before and just laugh when I see hundreds of tourists waiting to see the worst non event every hour only to be hugely let down and wondering if they have missed something or if there is something to come. There isn't!!! Dont waste you time waiting to see it - there is too much else in this fabulous city to see and do.

Beautiful. It is a very lovely square, and the astronomical clock is absolutely beautiful. There are a few lovely architectural buildings that are in or visible from the square. Note: Beware of pickpockets!

Good views over the city from easy to climb tower. The Old Square in Prague is easily found, just follow the sound of the music from the performing acts. The astronomical clock always attracts a large crowd, but take the time to walk up the tower, it has sloping pathways so no difficult steps, until a small amount at the very top. An easy stroll. Wonderful panoramic views across the city can then be seen.
Time machine. As it was in the old days. Well maintained, A great tourist spot. I liked the ambience. Friendly environment and easy transport.

Beautiful and diverse. There is so much going on here, from taking in the stunning architecture to watching the various street artists. There is something for everyone. The street cafés and restaurants offer food from traditional czech, which I was personally glad to see and savour, to more western foods. There is of course somewhere to sample the true czech beer and even an irish pub tucked away. Famous sights are with walking distance and you are never too far from a good restaurant or coffee house.

Right in the heart of things. Street performers keep the crowds entertained Whilst food vendors keep them fed, while we were there a lady was making giant bubbles for the kids and a juggler plied his trade, during the day it's full of the hassle and bustle of a thousand tourists but don't let that put you off.

One Of The Best Town Squares. Full of charm and interesting buildings. One of the great things about Prague is that it small enough to get round easily. The Town Square has some great buildings and lots going on in the square. It's a tourist hot spot so be prepared for the crowds. Plenty to see with Town Hall, Tyn Church, Astronomical Clock which is stunning, St Nicholas Church and Parizska Street, the most expensive street in Prague. An interesting and busy square.

Old Town for the Senses. What a great city. The town square was a feast for the eyes, nose and taste buds. How could one not dine in one of the cafes to watch the street artists and melange of tourists from all over the world. It's architecture and colors are spectacular. Thank goodness for the successful revolution 30 years ago to enable the Czech's the ability to restore this great city to its rightful grandeur.

Great place to visit, but don't eat here. A great atmosphere with buskers providing entertainment and the astronomical clock and town hall here. It's worth climbing the stairs to the top of the tower to enjoy the views.On the downside the stalls selling food are horrendously expensive. However, there are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby (and I can vouch for the mulled wine :-) ).

Great spot. Lucky to have stated right on the square. Spectacular view of the astronomical clock and Church of the Lady of Tyne. Beautiful at night. Always something happening in the square from performers to protesters. Definitely a Prague high point.

Heart of Prague. If you don't see this, you haven't been to Prague.Watch the astronomical clock and the apostles come out on the hour. Yes, it's full of tourists, but that's inevitable. You'll never forget it.

The heart of the city. This seems to be the place where all tourists end up. The astronomical clock is one of the many features. The buildings all around the square are amazing. There's lots of restaurants so you won't go hungry. Prepare for crowds though
Amazing City Centre. You can spend hours around here - sitting by the restaurants, listening to music in the evening, great atmosphere.
Fun. Great area filled with restaurants and shops, street performers and beautiful architecture. Wonderful place for having a fabulous Czech beer while people watching.

The Astronomical Clock. A huge crowd gathers here on the hour to watch the figures pop out which is greeted with a mixture of clapping and disappointment. We watched street art with Chicken Johnny a lot more entertaining!

beautiful place for attractions and entertainment. This place is beautiful with old town clock and other atractions .There is lots of people walking around and there was also a band performing in September 2014.

The Harry Potter Look. Great place very beautiful houses, somewhere between Harry Potter and Disney!
It is magic!
The coulors, the design, day or night

Step into the Past. Everywhere you look here is incredible. Amazing buildings with lots of very interesting history. The square also has lots of great eating places, good for people watching. The astronomical clock in particular is worth seeing on the hour, every hour!

People Watcher's Paradise. After the castle this must be the busiest area for tourists. Lot's of buskers in the square which adds to the allure.
The Astronomical Clock is the highlight although many people ignore it.. There are numerous bars and restaurants close by to refresh the palate after all that walking.

Great Place !!!. The place is one of the busiest place in prague, with loads of tourist/ppl around ... the place is surrounded by lot of small gift shops and cafes ... we were there is july ... it was fun to chill around at the place .. especially in the evening time ... it also has a few monuments around it ...

Magnificent Old Town Square with an Astronomical Clock. This is a beautiful, well preserved old town with lovely architecture, nice cafes and restaurants. It's a hive of activity for visitors and locals alike.

Very busy place. Away from the castle this is the busiest place with all the gift shops down the side streets. On the sunny day it was packed. The following day I was on a bike tour in the rain and was the only one there!

The Hub of Prague!. You just can't visit Prague and not visit this square! The food is good and so is the beer. If you are fortunate enough to be there during something special, like a light show, it will happen here.

Buskers excellent, the rest so-so. This is an assessment of the square itself and not of individual attractions, restaurants and shops in its immediate vicinity.When we were there, there was a band busking in the square, the Bohemian Bards. For me, they lifted the rating from an ‘average’ to a ‘very good’. When we were there they were playing in the square and I gather they play there regularly. The band deserves an excellent rating.Except for that, I didn’t feel any particular magic about the place. Perhaps my romantic circuits are not connected in the right way. Sure, it is old worldly and it looks like a scene from movie. It has the right prerequisites: A statue (of one Jan Hus), a view of a funky looking church (‘Our Lady before Týn’) and funky paving (unfortunately not romantic cobble stones). However, it is also oozing tourism out of every crack.You certainly have to go there if you visit Prague. Except for the Bohemian Bards though, I cannot see the appeal of the square itself.

Forget about Wenceslas Square. This is the best sight seeing feature of Prague, Walk around it and enjoy all the Gothic buildings everywhere and then head down the the Charles Bridge which is the second best thing in Prague, walk over the bridge to the Castle and you are more or less done with Prague. Oh yeah go back again at night!

A beautiful square. Another one of those beautiful plazas that Europe is known for! In this one, everyone stares at the clock, as you have read in other reviews. But there are shops and restaurants all around the square, so it is a hub of activity and a place to people watch.
old but good. looks very good but most of the monuments were under renovations when we came, so you might want to cheak it out before.
a nice square, splended watch. Nice place to visit in Praga, beautiful watch, but too many people, too many tourists. Many shops and restaurants around. Must see..
You starting point for historical Prague. This is where you should start your visit in Prague. The old Clock and lots of activity. Great place to pick up a tour.
One of the most beautiful squares around. Always fun to revisit, lots of atmosphere, beautiful buildings, and good ice cream outside Hotel U Prince.

Quaint - Very quaint. Flanked by the Astronomical clock and the St Nicholas Church, this beautiful open space seems (like most of Prague) right out of the middle ages complete with cobbled paths, baroque architecture and continuous open air performances. The river of tourist starting from Wenceslas square and going on to Charles bridge meander at this lovely square. The cafes are a bit costly but the beer is awesome. It is a very lively place and I would strongly recommend a late dinner at one of the open air cafes surrounding the square to really enjoy the atmosphere. I would also strongly recommend you plan your stay at Prague (and visit to Old town sq) on a fri/sat night to actually experience the buzz.

An Astronomical Time. We joined the throngs to stand and wait for the Astronomical Clock to do its thing. On the hour the doors opened and the figures of the apostles showed themselves for a few minutes. Then the doors closed and we said, "is that it?". Did not take long but still one of the sights of Prague. The astronomical operations & the legend of the clock for sun, moon etc. are best understood by getting a local book. The Old Town Square is picturesque with interesting buildings and atmosphere. There are plenty of restaurants but, if you want to save some money, eat away from the square. There are heaps of good restaurants away from the main tourist spots and the food will be just as good and cheaper.

"Clock" the crowds watching the clock. The centre of Prague is not to be missed. Watch the famous clock but be sure to get an understanding of it before you do. Tereza from Urban Adventures is an expert - book her walking tour if you can. From the clock tower watch the clock watchers - magical around sunset. Spend time people watching from the comfortable cafés and bars whilst being entertained by street musicians and 'artists'.A tourists dream.

First stop. I guess this is the place where you begin your discovery of Prague. Nice and lively. I would avoid those restaurants in the square, get your beer here but food elsewhere, maybe in one of the many down the street to the subway station.

A great plaza in the center of old town... Be prepared for a crowd and lots of street performers. Surrounded by cafés a great place for a coffee or a beer. You need to see the clock. Keep your hand on your wallet. At night a light show will often pack the square. Some access becomes quite crowded and are not well lit. But a nice place in the afternoon.

Wow. Awesome place to start your visit to Prague, tons to see and do! I went to the top of the clock tower and thought it was worth the trip, gives you a cool perspective of the old city. Do the free walking tour under the yellow umbrellas. Don't buy any food or drinks in the square and watch out for people riding Segways.
Busy. A lovely square but gets very busy even in September. Get there early if you can to appreciate the splendour of the square.
Like a theater set. Historical icon, varied architecture, a theatrical aura, colorful bistrots and shops. Our favorite spot in Prague

Beautiful, but quite overrated. The square itself is beautiful, but there isn't much to do there beside strolling around. It is romantic, tough. Make sure you don't change money as the exchanges there will probably rip you off.

True Old Country Town Square. This square is very "old world" with the churches and spires, as well as the many interesting little shops. Many un-touristy spots to eat some authentic pork, sauerkraut and dumplings, or maybe some beef goulash--just need to search a bit off the main path. Also, be aware that much of the "garnet" jewelry is suspect--if the stones are big, they are probably not real garnet. Look for jewelry made with many small stones and interesting settings.

Prgue in a Square. The Old Town Square is a delightful place with plenty to see. From the buildings surrounding the square to the ever changing acts that are part of the street theatre scene. Good eating places abound with food stalls serving local dishes like crepes and sausage. It is definitely a hive of activity and worthy of an extended visit.

Picture Perfect. Every corner is a postcard, you can enjoy Old Town with a walking delight. When I was there in early Oct, there wasn't many tourists. Make sure you go to the top of the clock tower and have a nice view of the old town and the square.

Super experience!. As we wandered around the square just soaking up the history and beauty of Prague,there was a band dressed in medieval gear playing bagpipes,strings and drum who were just fabulous.This is a lovely square with beautiful decorated buildings.A must to visit!

Beautiful Town Square. We have been to this Old Town Square for several times, particularly impressive in 2013 & 2014 because of the nice weather. The Clock Tower together with the surrounding buildings, the food venues, shops around and the lots and lots of people gathering together were the targets for our photo-taking. We have also paid the fee to go up the Clock Tower and watch the people clustering below and the pictures were very special if not stunning. At night time, still many people clustered around for fun in the Square. We will definitely visit this Square again in the future as we considered this venue a "super star" tourist spot for tourists.

Just a town square. There are a lot of open air restaurants and, down from the astronomical clock, there is a nice statue/fountain. Behind the astronomical clock there is a rather nice, although small, park where a tourist can sit, observe and rest one's feet. Other than that the square is bordered by a variety of tourist shops selling virtually the same things.

Fun location to people watch. We were lucky to have a shuttle from our hotel to the quire, with Viking, and so our walks started here. Both morning and later in the day, arrival meant many street performers, and kiosks selling great looking/smelling food. Everywhere you look there is a building with spires, interesting murals, or great architecture.

Something beautiful around every corner. The square has everything shopping, great restaurants, the clock, we went at Christmas so got to see the Christmas markets. It was a little chilly, but worth it see the square with their Christmas lights and to experience the Christmas markets. I would love to come back to Prague, best trip ever.
Very scenic. Although you have to find the best times to see this without a million people around, it is a great square. Go in the earlier morning for best pictures.

sevo99. the town clock is amazing ,all of the local food venues were very good , we could allways get a cold beer ,with excellent service ,horse drawn carriage ride was really lovely, street entertainers were amazing ,girl played her trumpet from the top of the clock tower , on the hour ,hitlers history , in this square & photos we were shown ,were interesting .

Much nicer in winter than summer. Way too many tourists and buskers around in the summer months for coming here to be a pleasant experience. The square seemed to be filled with living statues making annoying squeaking noises at everyone who passed them. On our previous visit at the end of December it was much more enjoyable with less crowds and less irritation.

Beautiful and lively square. Lots of museums and galleries within easy reach. Stunning architecture. Some good eateries as well and, although dearer than away from the centre still eminently affordable.

Lots happening here. Take a seat at one of the sidewalk cafes, order a drink and watch the entertainment in the square. Besides people watching, you can catch folk/rock, living statues, bird handlers, someone playing classical music on wine glasses filled with water, etc., etc. If you are early enough in the morning, you may see a wedding party or two entering the square to have their photos taken.

Old world charm. These days the Old Town Square is crowded with tourists day and night but it is still a place of stunning architecture that has changed little in the last few hundred years.Very early morning is a good time to see Prague, before the masses are out and about.A climb up to the top of the Town Hall Tower is worth the effort for the great views.

Enjoying the Night. If you think Prague is busy during the day you should see it at night. Don't miss the astronomical clock. If you eat food from any of the stalls, be mindful that some of the food is sold by weight. You may find yourself spending more than you originally planned.

Centre of everything in Prague. You can't miss the energy, exuberance, music & romance floating in this place despite the crowds. With many places in the vicinity take a stroll and come back many times a day to catch different performances, grab a bite & beer, shop and relax.
Walk, Drink & Dine. Get a feel for the heart of Prague. We walked around and stopped at a few pubs for a beer and enjoyed the market.

Great!!. We visited Old Town Square on many occasions on our recent trip to Prague and loved it every time. It does get very busy at certain times of the day, especially when people are watching the Astronomical clock, but the buildings are so good to look at and there are always street artists to watch. There is so much going on that I never got boredThe restaurants are very good and not so expensive.Would definitely return.
Chariming. It is a great place to spend the whole day. The restaurants that are not on the square have better food.

All That Jazz (and pickpockets too). Well, of course, you're not going to Prague and miss the Old Town Square! In mid-October it still teems with tourists, with young people on Segways (annoying), great street musicians, the ubiquitous painted "living statues" (plus a man levitating when we were there) and evidently, a slew of pickpockets.As long as you have your money and credit cards safely secured, you'll have a great experience in the square. My son still has fond memories of his first trip to Prague, during the World Cup a few years ago, when there were great big screens installed in the square and every young person from every country who was in the city at the time was packed into the square rooting for their favorite team.We watched the astronomical clock do its thing from the roof of u Prince. My advice is that you don't need to drop whatever you're doing just to run to the square to see the astronomical clock chime the hour. Evidently that is prime pickpocket time as everyone is engaged taking photos and not paying close attention.

LOVELY!. What a beautiful place.....so quaint, so clean, just lovely. always something happening...musicians etc. Join a walking tour from here, join a bus tour from here, take a ride in a horse and carriage or a "vintage" car.......On the other hand just sit in one of the many cafes and watch the world go by whilst drinking delicious coffee, a refreshing wine or soft drink.....Hungry? no problem, good quality excellent value food.
great. Everything looks amazing, almost fake. There are many performers to keep you entertained. Many restaurants to eat, some are not expensive. something for everyone.

Historic, picturesque square. Very lively square filled with tourists at all times of the day and night. The Astronomical Clock, Czech food vendors, street musicians, and plenty of good bars and restaurants make Old Town Square a must see for any traveler to Prague. Highly recommend walking around the square at night as the reflectors shining on the buildings make this beautiful square seem like something out of a fairy tale!

Marvellous buildings. We went in October and it was still really busy but always found somewhere to eat easily. A fantastic place and a great atmosphere.As with all tourist spots in every country, keep an eye on your belongong s though
Absolutely beautiful. an architectural gem wherever you look, street entertainers, bars, eateries.See early in the day, to avoid crowds.
lovely buildings. Lovely buildings. You can sit here, have a cup of tea or a glass of wine and relax. Very relaxed.good street entertainment.see the clock during the day and at night

Breathtaking yet chaotic. This is a beautiful square, one of the prettiest you'll ever see. But it's also full of tourists, segway operators, buskers, etc. This is where you'll see the famous Astronomical Clock. Look out for pickpockets.

Prague Street Scene is Electric. We had such a great time walking the area around the Square and surrounding areas, both during the day and at night. Street artists, food vendors, plenty of sidewalk cafes, and people in general make this an exciting place to hang out.
Lovely afternoon in the Old Town Square. Beautiful 'people' square. Enjoy the architecture, people, street action. Don't forget to be there on the hour for the astronomical clock.
The Center of Prague.. For us, this was the main attraction. Various activities, fun people watching, food vendors, cafes. Don't miss!!

A fantastic and lovely place to visit. Definitely worth a visit. There are multiple happy buskers, musicians and stalls trading all with a very friendly and calming atmosphere. Although there was many people in the square (particularly on the hour to see the astronomical clock) the square did not feel overcrowded or unpleasant. The atmosphere was akin to Glastonbury during the day time: lots of people but everyone in a good mood and enjoying the surroundings. As with all things in Prague though, ensure you keep change for the loos!

Special place. The photos one sees of this place are a true representation of how it actually is. It is a majestic square with the most wonderful architecture and ambience,especially at night when it is really magical all lit up.Despite the fact that there were lots of people around everyone was polite, friendly and helpful. There was no rowdy behaviour, no drunks,in fact one felt very safe.It is a very special place which fortunately has not been spoilt.

medieval look. The all place it´s nice,well conserved although the smog is always darkening the old monuments and buildings.TOurists from all continents gave a cosmopolitan looking.Lot of restaurants,bars and musicians playing classical music ,let us with a nostalgi memory of beatiful Prague.

A place to watch people and buildings. There are always things to see in the old town square Prague. I saw the motorcycles parade, wedding photos shooting and street performances there during my visits. The views during the daytime and at nights are quite different. Suggest people to visit the square at the different time to experience the differnt feelings.

A great way to end each day!. Love the square. There are always things happening there - from puppeteers to musicians, it's a wonderful place to spend some time in the evening. We went nightly and enjoyed each visit.

Great for people watching. Great place for people watching and musical entertainment. The prices for a beer were higher than elsewhere in Prague but still cheaper than the U.S. Absolutely beautiful ar night

Old Town Prague. Full of tourists but still an enchanting. Place. Great archaic true blended together among cafes, hotels, churches and of course the clock. Getting there from Charles Bridge requires you to wind your way past a lot of junk filled tourist traps.

Breathtaking. One of the most beautiful places in Prague, magical during evening when you get the feeling you entered a fairytale. I could stand there for hours and watch Church of our Lady amazing towers.
Fantastic place. It was very busy but great atmosphere all the time. Great place to sit and people watch. The architecture was fabulous too

Fun area day and night. Always busy with many cafes and restaurants the square seems to appeal to locals and tourists too. The Astronomical Clock is one main attraction but also wander all the side streets off the square.
If you are a shopper ( I am not ) there are tons of stores.

love it. The whole feel of prague is amazing. The architecture is fantastic, you never see the same thing twice and each time you look you find something new to see. This place has an old world charm to it
Astronomic clock. At the city hall people come together in every hour to watch the famous astronomical clock and listen to the bells.

The centre of the old town. Spectacular architecture and wonderfully maintained. Clean and safe although pick pockets are supposed to target these areas so be careful. The main attraction appears to be the ancient clock tower which chimes on the hour attracting hoards of camera wielding tourists. Worth considering eating a short distance from the clock unless you want thousands of people watching you eat at a street cafe / restaurant.

Highlight of Prague. Enjoyed the bustling atmosphere, the amazing astrological clock, different architectural styles of buildings. Free tour provided to customers of Prague Airport transfers! (Ross was wonderful!)
Great feel about it. Fun atmosphere with loads of bars and restaurants to choose from. The buildings are impressive and the buskers are brill. Well worth a visit.

Wonderful clock tower. Magical place. A large, very old square with beautiful buildings surrounding it. We bought wrought iron key hangers from a vendor that was making them in a corner street, with an open fire and all. Must see!
Lots to See. You can go up and down the many streets but make sure you have a city map with you. There are plenty of things to see, hundreds of places to eat, and the photo ops are everywhere.

History all around us and memories too.... Always like to return here, this beautiful part of Prague in any season. I especially loved it just before Christmas 2 years ago. The Square holds a special memory for us, as we got married here many years ago. I was a little taken back by the young people -tourists - sitting down or lying on the ground in the middle of the square, with their belongings spread around them. I have seen this new "trend" for the first time in Italy, and I am only hoping that it will be somehow controlled. It is taking away from the beauty of the Square and makes it difficult to walk around.No matter what, we will be back...

Busy busy busy. Try to get photos in the early morning to avoid the crowds. Visit the astronomical clock BEFORE breakfast. This way you will avoid the crowds. After then, just go with the flow. Restaurants and bars EVERYWHERE. Street vendors with amazing food. Street performers with endless entertainment. Gorgeous building rich in history. Take some time and wander!

Disney world meets Middle Ages!. The Old Town Square is a fabulous place to visit and to soak in the atmosphere. So much to see. Beautiful frescos on the buildings, georgeous churches, amazing astrological clock and thousands of other tourists!. A lovely town square in a beautiful city.

Never get tired of sitting on this square, one of the best. A beautiful square surounded by wonderful old buildings and always a range of happy entertainers and passers by to keep you amused.a full range of options of food and drink from very economical to extremely expensive... your choice We loved the square and probably passed through it three times a day while staying in Prague
Stunning. A beautiful square with always lots going on, not to be missed, and if the sun is shining it's a perfect place to had a beer and give your feet a rest

Enchanting!. We stayed two minutes walk from this square, and seeing it in the day time was just where do we look? So much going on and so much amazing architecture! But at night, breath taking! The lights, the people it is beautiful! Definitely a place to visit and spend some time there! Watch the clock chime it's wonderful when you consider it was built so many many years ago!
old town square. Square with the Astronomical Clock , friendly atmosphere, great experience , everyone must see this beautiful place

Magical!. An architectural charm. Quaint & magical. Well Preserved. Rich in history. It is very busy an dfull of tourists. It is tourist friendly. I would visit during the daytime, then return at sunset and see the building is in different shades of light, until is is finally sunset and becomes nighttime.Be aware of pickpockets. The astronomical clock is a main attraction, but also don' oversee the other buildings.

Beautiful. The famous astronomical clock is a big draw but you can always get near. Usually a variety of entertainers to err, keep you entertained. Some good restaurants and shops. Worth a trip up the clock tower.

The Place to Be!. There is always something going on in the Old Town Square and the views of the Astronomical Clock and other buildings are outstanding both day and night. This is a great place to eat and drink and just relax. We spent time there each day we were in Prague and never got tired of being there.

Superb.. Im going to paste my review from the astronomical clock page as I did this as a united day out, and recommend you do the same:Everything about this was fantastic, from the rich history all the way to the tourist-friendly atmosphere.The clock itself is stunning, but the more important aspect is the lively old town square surrounding it, along with the shops, street performers, and restaraunts/cafes.Very highly recommended, and definitely give yourself enough time to see all the nooks and crannies.

Stunning. Take in the sight but move on to escape the crowds. This is probably the best historic square you will ever see. The architecture and history is out of this world. However, every other tourist to Prague comes here so expect big crowds. Those crowds will also double in size every hour on the hour to see the astronomical clock do its stuff. There are also loads of buskers and other people pushing tours and places to visit. Also prices in cafes and shops here are astronomical as well.So definitely come here, take in the sight, soak up the atmosphere, push away the vendors, take your photos, and then move on.
Old world charm. Lovely, lively busy square. Full of activity. Bargain for anything and everything. Restaurants around the square are more expensive than the ones a little of f the main square.
Interesting. I enjoy seeing the buildings and learning about the area. I can not say which portion of the walking tour I liked best.

Beautiful views and great spots to people watch!. Come for the clock and stay for the shopping, peopled watching, and great cafes. Look for shops only certified to sell real Czech garnets (only 3 in town). Grab a quick lunch and watch the couples in the square pose for their wedding pictures to the applause of the tourists.

Beautiful. Beautiful square and an awesome clock! Although the actual tolling which everyone stands around for isn't so magnificent, you still have to see it. there's loads going on in the square from horse carriages to street performers and stalls with food on! If you're in Prague you have to visit here!
One of Pragues must see. Been here on several visits to prague. Always a treat day or night...Recommended to see both in day light and with night lighting.

Clock is overrated. The square is lovely and the astronomical clock is quite unique, however the show associated with the clock was underwhelming. The street performers are fun to watch, but not overly talented.
Fun social area in Prague. Street food and entertainment. Less crowded and thus better in October than in July! Great town square - a Must visit when in Prague.

Beautiful. The Old Town Sqyare in Praha is simply beautiful. I would suggest visiting the church of the Virgin Mary, which is gothic both inside and out. As well as this, grabbing a beer at one of the restaunts dotted around the square is also lovely, and great for people watching!
Must see - climb the tower!. Must see place! For wonderful view, climb the clock tower. Take your camera os smartphone and make panoramic photos!

Wall to wall people. Kept very clean with lots of choices of restaurants and a variety of good street entertainers. The Astronomical Clock is a big crowd puller every hour and you can get to the top of the tower, which has a lift, and enjoy the views over the city.

history and shopping. A large square with statues, the Astronomical Clock ( watch for it to come alive on the hour), lots of restaurants ( including alfresco dining), and shopping. A short walk to the Charles Bridge

This is magical. e sat here for hours on end simply being entertained by everything. The place is alive a chap was blowing big bubbles and kids running in the bubbles. WE just sat and sat and enjoyed the whole atmosphere. Beautiful architecture good food and happy people. :)

Fantastic. Prague is an amazing city, and although I didn't have long there I loved the place, very busy but that adds to the atmosphere in some ways, if you don't like people you will need to be their early, but otherwise fantastic everything, great buildings & history. Definitely a must do, take the time to just wander about and enjoy the sights & atmosphere.
Enter Old World. Full of bars and restaurants place to people watch, quaint street entertainment also . Some good shopping here also for Czech Crystal Glass

Maybe the best scenery of Prague, all in one square. Excellent architecture all around, always packed with tourists! Beware of pickpockets and avoid dining at the touristic restaurants located in the square. Do have some local beer instead while you enjoy the magnificent atmosphere of Prague's old town.

A must-see but get there early!. If you do not like crowds my comments for the Charles bridge apply: get there early, say before 7am. That way you can enjoy this magnificent place without interruption from tour groups, souvenir sellers etc. One proviso: the clock tower opens a little later so to get sweeping views you will have to endure crowds.
Busy but exciting. We loved the buzz of all the crowds and the street theatre. Also loved the astronomic clock whilst waiting for the hour to strike.

Such a lot!. A whole lot of things going on here. The old clock with figures moving around every hour on the hour, mimes in the square, and places where you can just sit and marvel about all the stuff that's going on before your very eyes. Bands are playing and there are quite a few restaurants - a bit expensive ...

felt like Disneyland. Old Town Square had a very artificial feel and look to it. Streets are lined with cheap souvenir shops and thai massage parlors which was disappointing. The Astronomical Clock was a highlight every hour and it's just a short walk to the Charles Bridge from there. Lots of really good restaurants around the square and reasonably priced. Try the local Czech beer Pilsner Urquell and the goulash...delicious
Great atmosphere. The Old Town Square is a lively place, full of entertainers,tourists,places to eat , drink and people watch.
Large square area. Quite similar to squares in other cities but the surrounding buildings may be more impressive to some visitors.

Great people watching and lots going on. Beautiful square with fabulous architecture, the astrological clock, and nice cobblestone everywhere. Surrounded by cafes and restaurants, the square is home to street performers and tourists. It's a MUST in Prague, clearly!
Absolutely lovely. World's best place!!! Gorgeous buildings and live concerts make this place so unique!!! Go there right after your arrival.

Vibrant. This seems to be the meeting point for most people and is very vibrant. There is always a number a street performances going on and the bars and cafés are full. At night the landmarks are all lit up and provide great photos.

The romance of Christmas. A delightful evening spent here just before Christmas. It's pretty; it's architecturally interesting; the food stalls sell all sorts of yummy goodies...but beware the prices are aimed at high spending tourists. Go for the Christmas Market and enjoy hog roast washed down with hot toddies.

Moooooooo. It seems that everybody comes to the square and just walks around like slow moving cattle. it's got some great things to see but sometimes is just not worth wading into this sea of humanity
Can't Miss It . No visitor can skip this area. Very historic from all directions. Also with a lot of people collecting there there's always a kind of performance taking place.

Old Town Square. Perfect setting for people watching and enjoying the architecture from an out door cafe! Street performers everywhere and the amazing style of an over 600 year old clock! A must SEE!!!
Amazing city. Definitely caters to the tourists, but you'll still see some great things. Look for the local famers market area and grab some local goods/food!

It like stepping into an historic novel. This was my third visit to Prague and second since the communists relinquisted power, each time it gets more and more crowded and passing through the old town square is getting labouriest. It is nearly at breaking point. All that aside Prague still is magical being one of the few cities that survived being badly damaged by American and British bombing. Pricing is by and large very cheap, quality of foodvand drink is generally good but there are a lot of unsavoury people willing to fleece the unsuspecting.
Wonderful Place. Old town square Prague centre. Incredibly beautiful Place. I loved old style architecture. It's always crowded here but don't miss out !Highly recommended.
Recommended.. We spent quite a bit of time here and there are many bars, clubs and restaurants in this area. A good area to visit!
You've seen the tourist guides and this is exactly what you're expecting. Doesn't disappoint, nice photo opportunities, but not so easy to find throught eh maze of streets and alleys

Impressed!!. As you approach it from any side (a lot of streets flowing into the square) you will be amazed by the size and beauty of it all. The clock, the cathedral, the small market, all the little shops and restaurants make an impression that you would not easily forget!! Tip: the restaurants behind the market are much cheaper than the ones facing the square.

Interesting. Great place! Always something going on. Street performers, the clock tower, places to have a snack, beautiful buildings, and spectacular churches...it has an interesting vibe and we loved it. Gets very crowded when the clock is about to strike the hour.
must. It has a very nice view, lots of people, lots of restaurants in the sides. Is a must to visit at the city

Beautiful Town Square. Visited the Old Town Square and never lacked for something to see. There were street performers and plenty of places to eat. Take a stroll through there in the evening and it is a completely different feel. One tip I can recommend is to eat inside one of the establishments on the perimeter. The food and drinks are 50% less than what you will pay to sit in the outdoor pavilions.
must see. This is the must see place in Prague. Read a brief history of the astronomical clock and the statue in the square to get a better idea of history.
The center of all things in Prague. The town square main attraction is the clock. The Tyn church is spectacular and so are the bands that play in the middle. worth visiting.
Meh. Yeah, you get to look at the astrological clock and sit in a tourist cafe. Really not that big a deal. Truly average.
Superb, but crowded. Superb. Can be crowded, so early morning is better. Avoid the food stands which are selling roasted ham: this is simply robbery!
Amazing spot. One of the greatest spots in whole Prague. Nice architecture, amazing houses, good atmosphere full of people from around the world.

Fun place to people watch and explore. What a place! Always something going on. Street performers, the clock tower, the beautiful buildings, spectacular churches. And Prague has realized that there are problems with pick pockets, etc. There was a police van parked in the Square everytime I walked through and uniformed officers mingling with the crowds. They are keeping a sharp eye on the goings on. Saw them pick up a street begger who was setting up shop on a side street from the square. She waasn't happy, but moved on.

Beautiful place. Lovely square, lots to look at, lots of people around. plenty of food and drink etc.You can easily spend hours around the square. I didn't actually get to see the clock "doing its thing" as I was never there at the right time sadly.

smaller than expected. A bit smaller than I expected first. Can be quite crowed during the day and night. On the last day went to the square around 6 am and literately had the square to myself.Dislike: the food vendors are quite expansive, do not have the roasted ham, once they slice the meat you got to pay whatever they cut.

Prague's beating heart.
