Must see. No one can come to Prague and not stroll around Old Town Square--it is iconic and the architecture is stunning. Be aware that pickpockets may work the area but Prague is very safe.
Lovely square. You have to visit the old square, every view is stunningly beautiful, with many restaurants and bars,

Timeless. Had a long weekend in Prague, had been looking forward to it for quite a while. The city has an absolutely timeless quality to it. The bridge, the castle, the clock and the square. I took hundreds of photographs. The coffee and cake shops on the square are an absolute must. Not as expensive as I thought it might be so that was a nice surprise. Take your time and try not to hurry past Everything.
Lovely bustling Easter market. Smells and tastes and all very reasonably priced... worth a visit!. wrap up warm tho, this is Pargue and very cold in March.

ASTROLOIGICAL CLOCK. This area becomes very busy, around the 'clock', just awaiting for the hour to perform when the sounds and the portals perform. There are also many performers around the area, the statutes or course, however, a very good trad-jazz band puts on an excellent performance

Lots happening here. Lots going on in this square. Has a funky clock tower - not worth the $5 to climb the tower. Lots of vendors selling all sorts of things. Some interesting churches, loads of restaurants and stores.

Great and even nicer at Night. All the buildings surrounding the square are interesting then there's the Astronomical clock. The view of the Tyn Cathedral lit up at night makes it look like a Disney film set. Again there's so much to look at you don't get tired of walking through there.

Great place but VERY touristy. Magnificent, like so much of Prague, but plagued by tourists (of which I know I was one), even in damp March. As the day wears on, the hard-core drinkers join the throng, so expect to see plenty of drunk Englishmen with attendant African pimps. All the cafes are naturally top price for the city and you can harldy move for shops selling tourist junk, much of it Russian. All that said, it is a wonderful square and not to be missed, although you'll find hundreds of other fine sights in Prague with much less stressful jostling.
fantastic buildings. Simply look left, right and up. every building is unique, so pretty. Try to take some time to find out about each building, and look out for where ablert einstein once stayed!

Not as expensive as might be imagined.... Was here on business in early Feb, however, managed to get in a few brief hours of R&R on the final day of the conference. Provided that one doesn't 1) Attempt to exchange currency (plenty of police signs warning against this...) or 2) Purchase a 'Prague Ham sandwich' (you get billed around £30 for a mountain of extraneous ham...) - it's a pleasant enough attraction, without being as expensive as one might expect for a 'Tourist Hotspot'.I managed to spend around £15 for 2 courses with a couple of decent sized beers at one of the eateries on the edge of the square, which, tbh, was less than I might have expected to pay.A good place to spend a couple of hours, looking at the (very varied) architecture, and soaking up the ambience.

Magical. We have traveled around and seen several town squares and Old Town Square is one of the most beautiful squares I have ever seen! It has majestic buildings and beautiful colors! And the Astronomical Clock is worth the visit alone!
Lovely spot. Lots of old buildings ( and tourists) go up the tower above the astronomical clock for a birds eye view of Prague. Also spot all the couples getting married!
Amazing Experience. Get lost in Prague by walking around Old Town Square. The amount of incredible architecture is truly outstanding!
Music quality on Old Square. The music buskers are of a very high quality, most have CDs available. I would hazard a guess and state they are classically trained whatever musical genre played.
Lots to Eat, drink and see. All the buildings were beautiful, lots of good food! Fine shopping, but i dont travel to shop in the same stores i can find in every city

Where it starts and ends. The square is wonderful! Inevitably you would start your sightseeing here and mostly probably land up here at the end (whether planned or not). It is almost as if all roads lead here. Full of entertainment from bands to bubble blowers to string ensembles....Awesome atmosphere! Beautiful architecture, lots of shopping (mainly for tourists) and food and drinks for any budget.

Nice. If you are in Prague you will visit here for sure.Nice caffes around to lay back and relax while your staring at the old buildings.Actually it was fun to listen Jazz No Problem-Praha band which is performing in the square everyday.

Impossible not to visit!!!. It was the first famous sightseeing in Prague I managed to come to just trying to find Celetna Street;)). So You won't be able to miss it anyway)). It's famous not only because it's the centre of Old Town, but due to buildings and Jan Hus Monument on it, and of course due to unique astronomical clock!!! During holidays it's always full of people and common days - with tourist:). So You may be one them;))

Go for the sights, stay for the ham and hot wine. Wow. This place is beautiful. After standing around in amazed at the architecture I decided to have some ham and hot wine. I can't think of a better way to enjoy the view and have some fun people watching. Go and check it out!
Make sure to visit. Many historical features, see the astronomical clock, what what happens on the hour. Climb the stairs and look out on the city.
Very pretty. The square is so pretty and even more beatiful at night. It really comes to life over Christmas when the market is on. Drink lots of mulled wine, its so cheap and delicious!

Nice Place to Chill Out. Great Buildings ..all tours start from here ...WW2 tour is Excellent : Hot wine sold everywhere ! ,,,tastes Fab on a cold day ...Down side Graffitti & Beggars from Roumania & Bulgaria
Fun and busy. So much history and fun. There were lots of tourists, but I'm told that is the norm. Everyone was friendly.
A lot to see. Stunning surroundings and atmosphere! I would recommend going there both at day and night as the buildings are beautifully displayed with spotlights in the evenings.
great. lots to see and do. archetecture is stunning and nice bars and street food availiable. lots of shops for gifts

a walk to the past!. who can visit this magnificent town and not stop to this square? it is a trademark. observe this astrological clock, take many pictures and maybe you can have a coffee at a local.i loved this square. Of course is full of crowd all hours of the day!
Astro clock is a must. Old cobble streets and cafe style restaurants. The old town has a lot of charm to it. Make sure you see the Astro clock when it plays music every hour

Interesting Square. After reading rave reviews about the clock we had to go and see it. It is a beautiful and interesting piece of art work(?) and historical piece for the square. The clock chimes every hour and after reading that the hourly 'perfermance' was a must see we agreed that we should see it at least once. We caught it twice and to be honest it was a bit still a must over hyped...but still a must see. It is interesting to watch and understand the history of the clock.

Must see if in PRague. If you have been to Prague and did not visit the famous clock, situated at Staromestske namesti, than you have not been to PRague. As the clock runs towards a full hour, the square gets more and more crowded. Great stuff.
Nice square. Actually found watching the clock a bit of an anti climax - but it has to be done - so be there on the hour

a must!. old town square is simply breathtaking. absolutely stunning architecture. take a trip up the clock to get the most amazing view of the city of 1000 spires! from early morning till late night the atomsphere here is great. you really haven't experienced prague without visiting here.

Breathtaking Architecture. We wandered through Old Town Square multiple times during our visit to Prague. It's worth catching the astronomical clock's performance once, which occurs on the hour every hour. We were fortunate enough to hear bits of several excellent street musician performances, all jazz. Avoid buying "Old Prague Ham" from the street food booths. It's a total rip-off and they'll try to give you a piece that costs at least 500Kč. Otherwise, definitely stroll through here at least once on your trip.

Astronomical Clock A Must See. Plan to be there at the top of the hour to see this amazing clock ring out.. This was the most stunning sight for me in Prague. I'm older so I did not take a trip to the top. My daughter did and said I made a wise decision not going, although I would haved loved to. Wine bars with outdoor heating and street food readily available in the square for very reasonable rates. The vendors and shop keeper are very friendly and helpful and most speak a little English. Bought beautiful pieces of Czech crystal for reasonable prices. The Czechs have a good sense of humor.
Has maintained its character. Fabulous buildings and the Square has not been overrun by commercialism. Everything flows off the Square and it makes it easy to explore.
staggering architecture. the bustling square is lively with plenty of eateries. the buildings are stunning. free walking tours are available from the square

Rich history in such a small area. It is crowded with historical places. All you have to do is take a couple of steps and you are in front of a totally different monument, church or a significant building. The surrounding food kiosks are also very delicious and serves quality products. As we were there in the midst of winter we tried many mulled wine and all were tasty but the one at the kiosk right across the Chrám Svatého Mikuláše was especially better.

Musicians and Astronomical clock. Flanked by shipping streets with small museums, crystal souvenirs, and soaps/ creams, this square always has musicians or magicians and is always police patrolled, which is great. Lots of cafes and restaurants in area, beautiful buildings, shopping nearby.
Great views!. Definately take a trip up the astronomical clock tower to see a great view of the city! and ensure you see the clock strike the hour - must see!
Breathtaking !!. We were in Prague only 6 days, but spend time in this square every day. It is like being taken back a thousand years in time. You must see this for real!!
magical. liked it all - you must see it at night when all the lights come on! so many things to see in a small area

Come early in the morning to enjoy the view. Arrive early in the morning to enjoy the view & great pictures. Don't miss the Astronomical Clock 'show' every hour on the dot, be in front of it at least on minute 45 to get the perfect spot.
Avoid eating at ANY of the restaurants/cafe around the square as they are very expensive.

So Beautiful. This is the meeting point for tours, a spectacular spot for food and magical buildings. The clock is just around the corner, and most of the city can be accessed from this spot. A must see spot in Prague - both day and night.

Beautiful Square. We loved the atmosphere and the Astrological clock, have to say I was a little disappointed when it stuck the hour, I expected more to happen! it was lovely though. We sat and had a hot chocolate and watched the world go by for a while. Make sure you climb up the tower (or get the lift like we did!) the views are amazing. Must not be missed.

Beautiful.......!. The old town square is beautiful with its buildings churches and the famous clock you can spend hours just wondering round taking in its olde world charm, its a photographers dream. The clock is the focal point and about ten to the hour the area in front of it fills with tourists all in eager anticipation, er its a bit of a let down two small doors open and these images of apostles trolley past whilst a little skeleton rings his bell. see it once then you've done it and can move on to better sights in the city. Be careful of the men who want to exchange money and the usual tourist scams and its a sight to behold.

Good place to meet New Year. There was load of firework in front of Tower with astronomicat clock, great great blows and police and firemans was ready but aside, didn't no trouble for people. Champaign from boutles - no problem, Crowd was real big but no harm, no offends. Good place and great town masters.

Great atmosphere but don't try the sausage.. A great place to visit to see the history of Prague. The buildings have an almost 'disney' feel to them because they have all been re-plastered on the outside, giving them a fake front. However with the live music and street food a great spot for a short break during your trip.

Must-see in Prague. Great place to spend an hour watching the clock, looking at the buildings, taking some pictures etc etc.Great looking square and good central location for visiting other parts of the City including Charles bridge.Some nice kiosks selling hot wine and food.
best tourist spot. the astronomical clock is worth a watch and climbing the tower to see the whole of prague,,,beautiful

Photographic experience. We stayed very close to the square and spent three days photographimg the square, the old town and the castle with cathedral. Day and night offered different approaches and so did the lower ground as well as the towers. Food was excellent and in February we avoided the crowds. Keep a good watch over your belongings.
You must see the clock "on the hour". The square is just by our Hotel Ungelt. Great place to visit and the starting place for many tours. You must see the clock when it chimes on the hour.

magical!. Amazing place, it makes you feel so good, there is this vibe going on the place that makes it full of life, even if you visit in the morning or at night.
And when you're there, look for the Chocolate Store near a Svarowski store, there is top notch chocolate for good prices!

yes definitely go there. it is a tourist must, go there and check out the shops, check out the cafes, the booth selling food, the buildings, take pictures...etc..its just like walking around any historical cities though, but definitely go...it still has its uniques

If in Prague, must visit!. Just follow the hoards of tourists from Charles Bridge and you will be lead to the stunning town square. The building are superbly preserved. My favorite part was just roaming the streets of Old Town, you will soon get a sense of the magic that people come to Prague for. Of course, beware of the expensive food places in the immediate area- they are aimed at tourists and will overcharge accordingly. Venture out a few streets and find one of the hidden gems- the underground restaurants. I wish I had taken note of the name of the restaurant we had lunch at, was seriously a highlight of my trip! So romantic and had the whole place to ourselves.

it is what it is. Prague can not be blamed for capitalizing on it's natural resources, amazing old world architecture, and fantastic natural setting. That being said, make sure to visit the old square and all it has to offer keeping in mind you have to look past the "gift shops" and other touristy things on offer to see the gems. People go to Prague for a reason so you have to put up with the rest of them too!
impressive. So many beautiful buildings around. Don't forget to go up the tower to take pictures of Prague. Buildings have facades from roman to cubist times

Beautiful very old buildings!. The best way to see old town is from a chauffeur driven vehicle. This keeps you a safe distance from the trashy souvenir shops, other tourists, smokers and food stands. The buildings are historic and cannot be replicated. After completing your tour, you can ask your chauffeur to drop you off at the castle where there are "nice" restaurants.

Beautiful architecture, trashy souvenirs. Old Town Square is beautiful, but surrounded by trashy souvenir shops (as are most of the feeder lanes) and designer boutiques. Beware the food stands - sausages are tasty and good value, but if you opt for the ham/pork carved from the spit, prepare to be ripped off. One sausage, one portion of pork, one portion of potato and cabbage with bacon, and two plastic beakers of mulled wine cost 850 Czech Koruna (= £30)!
Magical. The old town square is the very centre of old Prague. Many narrow streets run from here into quaint hidden little squares.

Beautiful Surroundings. We visited in November 2011. It was my partners second trip and my first so he took me straight to the square to see it. It such a beautiful area and the detail on all of the buildings was breathtaking. They were setting up the christmas markets at the time and so it was quite busy but this doesn't change how amazing it was

Fascinating. Such a well preserved historic area, if you just look beyond the tourist trap shops (which are all owned by one company with over 30 shops in Prague!) the clock, and we had some performances.
Culture Overload. What a fabulous place - from the Astronomical Clock to the Church of our Lady before Tyn - needs to be seen to be believed
HIGH LIGHT. So much to see, lots of great shops as well as lovely buildings. Some of the souvernior shops were a bit expensive, look further into the area.

Fascinating. Although we visited many other areas, we kept returning to the Old Town Square. The architecture is stunning, there are art exhibitions, interesting little shops just off the square and so many bars and restaurants we were spoilt for choice. The astronomical clock is a must to see. Because we went during February we were able to enjoy the area without the hordes of visitors that throng it during the high season.

A well preserved square that is full of life. On the weekend it is full of sellers and food stalls where you can try and buy authentic food and wears. Also at night it is beautifully lit and there are some cafes to sit in.

Remarkable. While walking the area came around a corner and found the Old Town Square.Prague is an amazing area that was almost untouched by the war. Put on some comfortable shoes and just walk. Its well worth it.

The best part of Prague,. My favourite part of our trip to Prague was when we first walked into the Old Town Square. The towers of Our Lady Of Tyn and the chocolate box houses are so magical. The Astrological Clock is another fantastical element with its moving parts on the hour. One of my favourite experiences during our stay was relaxing in one of the transparent heated verandas on the square drinking a hot whiskey and apple juice watching the world go by. A really magical and romantic spot!
Historic. lovely place to wander around, shop restaurants, town square, very historic and pretty too! Close to Charles Bridge.

Christmas travels at the Old Town Square Holiday Market. So many wonderful smells and sights to see at the 2012 Holiday Market at Old Town Square. The market was arranged with five main rows of various booths offering everything from Christmas ornaments to art to different food and drinks to savor. Our favorites included the Elisa medovina (honey mead) booth and the fried cheese (nice and warming on a cold winter day) stand. There were also scheduled performers during the holiday market for added entertainment. If you happened to be at the market on the top of the hour you could view the workings of the famous clock then stroll across the street to the Square and enjoy the lights and sounds and foods of the holidays.

Wow factor. When you enter this square coming out of one of the smallish side streets you cannot help but stop and catch a breath. Like a step back in time. Make sure to explore everything in and around the square and be prepared for some surprises. Don't miss to be at the Astronomical Clock five minutes before it strikes at the hour on the hour, it gets crowded quickly. Have fun.

One of the most romantic places I've been. All within a few narrow streets you are transported from a modern shopping high street to a bit of living history. When I visited it was a calm, cold evening. Bright full moon and midnight blue sky. Practically picture perfect. Standing under the Astronomical Clock with my wife waiting for the stroke of the hour to see the clockworks display. Snow then decides to fall, ever so gently. We then take a horse and carriage just next to the clock. Cuddles under a blanket, and enjoy a near midnight slow ride around this old part of the city. Truly one of the most romantic experiences in my life so how could I not recommend it!

Touristy but good for a reason. The square is a bit of a tourist trap but if you ignore the entreaties and do your own thing there are good cafes and the architecture is worth it. Kick back relax and don't feel pressured. Particularly worth a trip in December during the christmas markets when it's full of activity and tasty snacks

So, so, so pretty. I loved this. It is a very open area with lots of places to meet. I would also get a "free" walking tour here. We did and loved that too. Saw almost everything on the top 30 things to see.
a must see. great place to meet up with sandeman's free tour- this was great even in the cold. Old world charm, coffee shops, people watching, go at night- beautiful
Clocked in. The Astronomical clock is a must, but you must get there a couple of minutes before the hour strikes and the duration of the display is all too short!
worth a look round. you cant really visit Prague without going to the old town, lots of shopping and places to see. many places to eat too and near to main Prague attractions.
A must see. The sites are fantastic. People drawing on the bridge and selling home made gifts. The famous stairs are a must attempt as when looking back down is an achievement
Full of life. Not the area to spend your day at, but a nice starting point for what ever you're doing! A lot of different buildings and architectures around. Live music and tourist trap restaurants.
beautiful. great place to start your trip to Prague. had lots of food stalls and is crowded during the day. Lots of people gather round the astronomical clock on the hour.

Magical Prague. As Franz Kafka wrote "Prague never lets you go". I 've visited the city 8 years ago, and I've decided to turn back with my husband. We have used the self guided tour that are suggested from tripadvisor, as itinerary. We are ihere with an agency tour guide, however we have preferred to explore it ourselves and get the most from Prague. Old town is wonderful. No doubt that's the reason that every tourist wants to spend hours taking pictures or sipping a cup of coffee in front of astronomical clock. But my personal advice, try to skip the tourist crowds and try to enter to real life activities of the city. Bring with you the smartphone or map, and let the journey begin.

The focal point of Prague. This where most tourists will end up sooner or later.The architecture is wonderfull and there are two magnificent churches in the square along with the famous astronomical clock.

Christmas time in old town. Just magical - if you are visiting around Christmas time then old town square is a must visit. The Christmas lights are amazing and so beautiful. So much history and sights like a fairy tale!
excellent attraction. Very beautiful square, full of culture, museums, churches and the famous landmark the astronomical clock which chimes every hour
Great place in the heart of the city. Don't miss the astronomical clock! You can also like the occasional markets (Christmas, Easter etc.)
Fantastic. Fantastic square with a real mix of Prague's architecture. The clock is very interesting, but the hourly show is disappointing.
Beautiful in the snow. Lots to see in the square including the town hall and its astronomical clock. It's worth seeing in the daytime and again in the dark when it looks so good lit up.

Lovely place, nice atmosphere. The square is just very nice, with great landmarks to see. Pity that they allowed for so much 'crap' shops to open there, like foreign exchange offices. It doesn't make the square any prettier.
Old just as the name goes!. I liked the old buildings and most especially the astronomical clock. I believe i returned with luck :)

A Dream Place!. When you get there you see at once why Prague is said to be one of the most beautiful cities in Europe! the architecture, the shops, cafes and restaurants, the little alleys that take you in and out of the main squares ... I'm sure no one will be disappointed!
Old town square. a must see, especially later at night when the crowds die down. Stunning architecture and if there in winter the Christmas markets and lights are stunning

Jumping with Christmas market visitors. The square, like all of Prague, is architecturally over-the-top. And, with the Xmas market in full swing, it was full of visitors enjoying the season and the food and craft offerings. The cafes and stores were all abuzz and it was lively and very festive.

Great place to wander and soak up the atmosphere. Old Town Square is a great place both during the day and at night. The market stalls sell hot chocolate that is like a bar of galaxy melted in a cup, hot mead and delicious pastries. There are lots of souvenirs available and restaurants around the edge. The astronomical clock is really something to behold when it strikes the hour, and if you go at Christmas time then the decorations are beautiful.

We were so lucky to be there on the last day of the Christmas market. When we came upon Old Town Square on the evening of our arrival, we were so pleased to find the Christmas market still there (5th January). It looked amazing with all the lights and stalls, and it was great wondering around and trying the food.

Magical Old Square. Beautiful, busy and great atmosphere. Do watch the pushy jewellery shops though and stand your ground. They really push their sales pitch and suddenly can knock large amounts of money of the sale price. Take care they dont mind you trying on earrings for pierced ears something that is not comfortable for me and put the barrier up straight away!

Fantastic Architecture. My wife and I have traveled extensively in Europe for many years. I must say that, in my opinion, Prague rates as one of the most beautiful cities we have visited. I highly recommend this city to anyone interested in European architecture

Beautiful, gothic, picturesque. It's a beautiful old square, with shops, restaurants, landmarks (and a Christmas market in December). If you are in Prague, make sure you take a few hours to explore the landmarks and shops here.

Lovely at Christmastime!. Visited here during the Christmas Market period, and loved it! If there's anything to get you into the festive spirit - this is it! Got very busy on the Saturday afternoon/evening so if you want a quiet browse then it's best to go in the morning.Also saw it before the markets went up, and the area's very interesting - the architecture's beautiful and the astronomical clock does a display of the 12 apostles on the hour, every hour, which is quite entertaining to watch. Really loved visiting this!

Right in the centre. Right in the centre of the old town with some restaurants. THe tourist information centre is also located here, right next to the astronomical clock. Around Christmas there is a Christmas market and it can get very crowdy then.

Old Town Square - Clean & Beautiful. So beautiful, we were there at Eastertime and there was a festival going on in the square. Lots of wonderfully authentic food, bakery items and wine. The local school children did traditional dancing and it was so much fun.The Astronomical Clock, St. Nicholas Church and so many old, historical building surround the square. Definitely do not miss visiting the Old Town Square in Prague!

Awesome!!. This area of Prague, is bursting with history, people, entertainment, great places to eat/drink & shop!!The clock & tower are amazing!! Make sure you pay a few Crowns, to climb up the clock tower, to the viewing balcony at the top, the views are amazing. Great for a 360 view of Prague!! The buildings are very impressive, so make sure you have your camera!!It was very, very cold when we visited, but with plently of places, to warm up & drink hot chocolate, you were soon on the go again!!The cobbled windy streets that are the `Old town` run in all directions from the Square, and its great fun exploring them!!

Go up to a tasty area - Happy New Year. many delicious ethnic food: pig on a spit, a sea of beer and hot mulled wine in the freezing coldbeautiful market with souvenirs, paintings, clothing. You can buy and try cheeses, sausages and medovitsu

Idyllic Old Town Square. This is a magical place to go. Next to the Astronomical Clock the buildings are amazing, and together with the winter twilight you can experience an idyllic time there. When we were there there was also the Dali exposition! I would certainly recommend this!
Clock and Tower are worth seeing. Definitely see the astronomical clock. The tower gives a great view of Prague. Go up there even if you're afraid of heights.
Christmas market magic. This charming center of Old Prague is always a treat but at the holidays when it's filled with the Christmas Market, it is nothing short of Disneyland magical!
Worth a visit. Old town is a must see for all tourists. Watch out for all of the touts. Walk to the top of the clock tower for a super view.

Favourite place. Spent five days in Prague in September and this was the place I kept coming back to each day. Always something different to see and do depending whether early morning, midday or evening. Loved the architecture, the cafes, the shops - especially loved my purchases from Erpet Bohemia Crystal right on the square. Great times with friends sitting in the cafes watching the clock and just people watching. Very busy square. Loved Prague!

Great Xmas Markets. Excellent Square full of history and a plethora of market stall to tempt all tastebuds and really do put you in the festive spirit. Great day or night. A great deal of tour operators work in this area and it is a great place to buy your tickets for any tours you may wish to go on. Also close to all the high end shops if that floats your boat.

Just like in the movies. Standing in the middle looking at the fountain and the astronomical building with the church behind you is spectacular. Feels like it was straight out of a picture book of Europe

Love This Place. How can you not love Old Town? With the incredible spires of the Tyn Church, the astronomical clock, the tower, the cobblestone alleys and square - it's the picture-perfect medieval-meets-modern gathering place. There is always something interesting going on, and the absolute perfect place to people watch. Plus, it's one of the only places to get "roundy-things" - trdelnik, or round pastries covered in sugar - when it's not the Christmas season!

Old Town Square in Prague means "Very Old"!. From walking along a 1,000 years old footpath which was the first paved footpath in Prague, to enjoying a "pig on a spit roast" meal in a 700 year old original cavern hewn from rock, nothing matches the charm, romance and sheer ingenuity of this quaint intact living history lesson.Take the free walking tour from under the Astronomical clock at either 11am or 2pm daily for a 3hr journey backwards in time. It's hard to decide where to look as every building is a different design and is a different colour and every footpath has varying patterns designed and made by hand, centuries ago. A hint for the free walking tours is to stay up front with the tour guide and ask lots of questions. These guys (and gals) are a wealth of information and you learn so much from them. Sure, you are asked to give a tip...do so...it's well worth it. Then offer to take them to lunch or for a beer afterwards...heaps more info here too!Prague is a never ending treasure trove of discovery...for instance, the cavern restaurant I mentioned earlier.I accidentally discovered it whilst standing near a hot Glühwein stall, just opposite the Astronomical Clock, in Old Town Square, sipping my hot spiced wine (30cz, about $1.50) while it was snowing.I noticed steps going down to somewhere, so down I went.Imagine my surprise as I entered the dimly lit cavern and was transported back to the Viking days of Asterix, Gettafix and those comic characters my boys grew up loving!There was a wild boar, a bear, fox, birds, owls, bats, deer antlers and many types of stuffed (real) animals decorating the walls.It was a thrill to wander down there and imagine the past days of 700 years of continual eating in this tavern/cavern/restaurant.Then I wandered into the big back dining hall and decided a roast pig on a spit was a must do in this unique setting once I saw where they actually roast the pig! Only about 300cz for a 3 course meal too. That's about $15 Ausd...At Xmas time the Square is transformed into fairy land with the addition of the beautiful Xmas markets with all the little twinkling stalls selling hot wine, cinnamon rolls, special continental sausage, fresh wild Prague (smoked in front of your eyes fresh) pork rolls and a multitude of European Xmas goodies we never get to see in Australia.A fairy tale adventure for kids of all ages.
Beautiful with Christmas lights. Beautiful square and so pretty with Christmas lights and stalls, go up tower where astrological clock is for a great view

Doesn't Disappoint. Old Town Square sums up everything that Prague is about - amazing architecture, tourist markets, beautiful churches and great restaurants. If staying in Prague, try to be close to here.

Very beautiful. I visited here with some friends and we all thought that the setting and architecture was stunning and very different from what we were used to seeing which is why we loved it so much. The square was very spacious so alot to see and there were various outdoor restaurants and cafes located around the square, which were pricey since it is a highly tourist area. Defiantly worth visiting this location
Beautiful historical square. Cannot explain, you must see that! There is an astronomical clocks in the square. Best travel time is in the winter when Old town square offers Christmas markets.
Simply Stunning. Beautiful architecture, lovely restaurants although pickpockets in are everywhere but easy to spot when you sit and watch.

Perfect time of year. I am so happy i chose the time of year that i did as Christmas was just over but the lights were still all around which was nice to seeWhen we walked into the square it was more than what you see in any photograph it is just so beautiful :)a few annoying people around asking for to buy drugs but you get that almost anywhere in the main center
Something for everyone. Authentic Cz products next to western big name designers. One can spend hours strolling the promenades.
Prague visitors hub. It is a crossroad, always been always will be. Sometimes too crowded, visit off season or in the early morning.
Sightseeing. Worth a look if you are visiting Prague for the first time. Plenty of shops and you could easily spend a full day here

The heart of historic Prague. No trip to Prague is complete without a visit to the Old Town Square. Often thronged with tourists - try and visit off-peak to avoid the crowds.The area around the square contains some beautiful buildings and historic objects. Among them is the famous astronomical clock. Very popular at Christmas time: enjoy the towering Christmas tree, market stalls and at some times, live entertainment.

Best of Prague. This is the best place in Prague. Top tips: 1. Avoid all the restaurants and bars on the Square2. Go up on the Clock Tower to enjoy the view (show some student card and get half price)

Christmas Market. We were fortunate that the Christmas market was still on so the square was lively and festive. On our last day it was being taken down which immediately changed the feel of the square to just an open area. I imagine that in the summer it is much more lively.

Fantastic lights at night. If you visit Prague you must not skip this square. This is where the Astronomical clock is and other nice churches around. We passed it through during the day but when we went there by night it was a true magic. Don't forget your camera!

jewel in the crown. The heart of the old town and what a heart. Go to the top of the old town hall for amazing views of the square and the old city. Try not to be too upset by having to share this beautiful place with mobs of other tourists.

Best view ever. prague is Great, this Old Town Square is the best place, you can visit the tower and have a nice view of the city, during the night is also great, lights, people and a piece of art architectonic. A+ You have to come to prague.

Great food at the stalls there. Old Town Square of course has the wonderful tourist sights, don't need to review those. But we had the best hamburger and fresh fried chips and Trdlnik - the pastry cooked over coals - made a wonderful lunch.

what is the point in the clock. 3 times we went to see the show at the astro clock on old town square. and thought we had missed it until we spoke to a local and they told us that was it. very busy on old town square and no matter where we seemed to go we always passed threw it. it is very close to the jewish 1/4 which was my wives favorite area because of all the boutiques.

A must see when in Prague. This square is outstanding. The variety of buildings around the square all have an interesting history. Take time to wander around a look at the facades & carvings, paintings etc.Be warned that you cannot move near the clock on the hour due to the huge crowds that are drawn here to see the clock strike. It's better when there is a market as well because you get al the smells of cooked meat, sausages & other goodies.Also beware that if you get into a crowd it's pick-pocket heaven so make sure wallets/purses are well secured about your person.Food in this area can be expensive but go just one street away & you will find value for money in the many restaurants.Most of all enjoy.

You are in old Europe. To use a phrase from a politico that we will not mention his name, here in Staromestske namesti, you are in old Europe. Prague is one of European cities that has not been heavily damaged by WW II or the Communist era or the Soviet occupation..so when in the square, you have a bird's eye view of ..well.. old Europe..with its architecture.

Beautiful!!!. Prague is simply a dream! I cannot wait to go back!! The Christmas shops are simply beautiful, and the streets of old town are a trip back in time. I recommend walking around at 3am, when the streets are empty and you can admire the old world architecture!

Xmas. It smell lovely roasted pig head chocolate cover donuts...not good for the figue but it smell lovely it was lovely but that was because we went at xmas time..small amount of snow fell some of the gifts were a little expensce but I guess that was due to the time of year but the people are lovely

Even Better When Filled With A Christmas Market. Beautiful architecture, beautifully maintained structures. the square was filled with a Christmas Market when we were there. It met all of our expectations of what a Christmas Market should be. Even with all the people, the square was clean and enjoyable.

Quaint but lovely. Really enjoyed the old town square, much preferred it to Wenceslas square. Went there for the Christmas markets. The most beautiful Christmas tree I've ever seen! Brought home lovely decorations. Astronomical clock was lovely. One of the nicest squares in the world.....

A real gem. What a wonderful place! Beautiful medieval buildings, famous city watch, lots of nice cafes right on the square or near it in the small crooked streets. And of course Christmas market with souvenirs, hot wine, pleasant smoke from the roasters where ham is smoked and tasty sweet Trdlo is baked right in front of you.

Christmas market!. I loved the Christmas market. Everything looked especially beautiful during the evening. We bought a couple of souvenirs to take home - they weren't exactly expensive. The clock was beautiful too. Definitely something to see in Prague. It got very busy at times though!!
One of the most impressive squares I ever saw. One of the most impressive squares I ever saw. This place looks magic, expecially in Christmas time. A must.

:-). The most beautiful square in the world :-)
Even if there is so many people every day, I think its the best.

Avoid the crowd by visiting there early in the morning!. It was a summer trip in September so I was expecting a huge crowd in the old town square. I and my friends went there around 9:30am. To my surprise, the square was almost empty, excluding the customers from the nearby cafes. So we took our time slowly there, snapping pictures and posing with the Orloj. I couldn't think of any word to describe this place except 'ah-mazing'!

Beautiful area. I went here the week before christmas when the christmas markets were in full force. There was a beautiful uniquely lit christmas tree in the middle. The astronomical clock is close by and its definitely worth seeing. There are many attractions in this area and many shops to check out. Walk around here during your next visit to Prague no matter what type of visitor you are.

Best place in Prague. Traditional old town square, walking distance from the Charles bridge. Teeming with life, has lovely churches, hundreds of small shops selling all kinds of stuff and dozens of restaurants and pubs.

Authentic Praha. If you want to know how was real authentic Prague looked like Visit old town square...also i visited during Christmas, my husband and i stayed there Christmas eve, a huge Christmas tree was beautifully decorated in the center of the square and a street concert took place ,it was one amazing experience

Amazing place!. Great place to visit. Been there on january and there are a lot of christmes decorations!
Dont miss this place. It is a must
Wonderful. The square is a very nice place, with wonderful churchs / castles and an interesting Christmas fair, with typical food and some handcrafts. It is a worthful visit.

Best city square in Europe. Been here countless times and it never ceases to impress. There may be grander squares elsewhere, but for the complete package of stunning architecture spanning centuries, a huge selection of shops, bars, and restaurants, and above all the lively and colourful atmosphere, Old Town Square is hard to beat. It was further enhanced on this occasion by the Christmas market that was still in full swing with the smell of roast ham, roast chestnuts, and mulled wine wafting temptinlgy across the square. Despite the crowds we felt safe and comfortable most of the time, except perhaps at midnight on New Year's Eve when it did get rather rowdy.

A Must!. Well you have just got to go there on the hour and see and hear the clock strike and the figures appear and wonder at how and why! And afterwards the climb to the top of the tower itself is a must - and the most wonderful views of Prague at the top.
Nice place.... If you havent seen Prag, You must go.... Its a great city in may ways...Try the chrismas market....

Christmas Market. If your in Prague during the Christmas holiday, This is the place to be. filled with amazing sites, sounds, and wonderful smells. This area is full of amazing things to eat and drink, wonderful and affordible things to buy.

Beautiful square - watch the rip-offs. A beautiful square with lots of picturesque buildings around it. We were here over New YEars 2012-2013 so there were lots of stalls about serving hot food. Whilst this gave a great atmosphere, they were a bit of a rip off. We went to a hot meat stall for some ham and were offered this huge plate (we weren't asked what size) for 2000 crowns!!! As it was sold by the 100g, we asked if we could have a smaller portion. We were just told 'this is a normal portion' - so we walked away.The square does seem to be constantly crowded, so if crowds annoy you then try pick a time when it may be quieter.I can imagine it's beautiful in the summer time too.

Nice center square of Prague. Kind of touristy, expect to pay higher price than usual... very croweded during winter christmas market. We were warned of pickpockets. But its the center and most tours meet there.
Christmas Markets Unbelievable. The Old Town square is a magical place especially at Christmas and a wonderful place to enjoy with your family
One word: Astronomical Clock!. Get there right before the full hour. A great spectacle be careful about your valuables! A lot of pickpocketing is going on when everyone is looking up at the clock!

A Must See Market at Christmas. What a great place to visit. Decked out for Christmas, the stalls offered lots of variety, along with many different foods to sample. And of course there is the astronomical clock, the beautiful huge Christmas Tree, and the good Christmasy feeling and good cheer.

Stunning square. Spent 4 nights in Prague over New Year period and visited the square every day. Fabulous atmosphere at the Christmas market surrounded by stunning buildings. Snacks and drinks reasonably priced at market but if looking for a bar or restaurant take a walk a few steps along one of the streets away from the square for lower prices. Go up to the top of the astronomical clock tower for fabulous views across the city.

Take your time and enjoy it !. Fantastic place to enjoy the architecture of Prague, eat - a lot of good restaurants in the area. The prices are high for food in this region but spending a couple of hours enjoying good food on the terrace even in winter is unforgettable.
Not to be missed. One cannot visit Prague without watching the apostles appear on the hour. The trumpeter added hugely to our positive experience!
Beautiful!. Lovely Square and Tyn Cathrdral is its center piece at night. Dont get sucked into the pricey Prague ham tourist trap but therwise it's beautiful.

shame. we go for a meal and a drink when we head down for new year we get there about 10ish we found a table but before we could take our bseats the waiter said 20 euros for this table well he lost a couple of meals and drinks he should ask if we are going to get something put a damper on the night

Must Visit Site in Prague. This place is phenomenal. We stayed 3 nights in Prague and went there every day or night. It being Christmas season, the square was decorated with lights and the Christmas Markets were open. Lots of food and drinks to enjoy. When you are there take the time to see the Astronomical Clock.
chill out. good place too people watch go to one of the bars by the clock order a beer and watch the world go by
Outstanding. Prague's Time's Squarea lot of life, many monuments. centrally located in the city.The tourist office is right there !

Old Town Square at Christmas.... The huge decorated and sparkling Christmas tree, the Christmas market, street performers, astronomical clock, mulled wine, hot meat, cakes and pastries... many photo opportunities, a must for your visit.

A great atmosphere!. Fantastic square. At certain times of day, such as when the clock chimes and comes alive, it is full of guided tours and tourists. At others it can almost be deserted. It is surrounded on all sides by restaurants, shops and fantastic architecture. There are 2 fantastic churches, although St Nicholas is not as big or fantastic on the inside, as the outside.The restaurants here are more expensive and can have a cover charge. But it is good to sit and soak up the atmosphere with an expensive drink. It is also good to see it all lit up in the dark!
Busy. Grand square, really busy, especially on the hour for the astronomical clock chiming.Eating and drinking on the square is quite expensive compared to elsewhere off the tourist track!

Beautiful Christmas Market. We visited the Christmas Market here in December of 2012. It was a very beautiful and "fairy tale" type environment but was consistently extremely crowded. I'd avoid eating at any of the restaurants on the square as they are generally well overpriced compared to the rest of the city. At the market, most of the items for sale can also be had elsewhere in the city for lower prices and much less crowded shopping. All that being said (and sounding negative) if you're visiting Prague this is a must-go place to see the architecture and imagine what it was perhaps like before it became packed with toursits from every corner of the globe.
Christmash markets!. Christmash markets were great. Friday and saturday evenings there were lots of people, maby a bit too much. Atmosphere was the best thing in these markets!
Old Town Square. Loved the architecture and the astronomical clock. Not too crowded this time of year. Beautiful Christmas displays.
Astronomical Clock and more. The square is fantastic and on our December visit is taken up by a Christmas Market and giant Tree. A trip to the top of the Clock is well worth it for some great views.
Place which every visitor of Prague has to visit. Heart of old town is wonderful for its architecture and atmosphere.Always crowded but it doesn't decrease value of this place.

Pretty at Christmas. The Christmas market here is small and pretty. The clock tower is worth a visit for the view over the rooftops of Prague and has a lift which is good, clean and working. The square itself has lots of restaurants and cafe's where you can sit outside with a glass of mulled wine.
Wonderful. The centre for all Christmas activities with concerts, seasonal shops etc. - a definite must and a very easy stroll to Charles Bridge and the other main sites.
Great place to visit. The street entertaianers are great and the square is kept very clean and it has a great atmosphere and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants to chose from.
Great place to visit. The street entertaianers are great and the square is kept very clean and it has a great atmosphere and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants to chose from.

Avoid the roasted ham/potato salad stands. I went there for new years I was charged 780 Czk for chunk of roasted ham, and a big bowl of potato salad, what a bunch of horrible animals they roasted spoiled my stay.

A Square with everything.. This Square has everything - Impressive buildings, lots of cafes and restaurants and of course tourists. Walking around this square the views of all the buildings are superb as most have been well renovated.If you don't mind paying over the odds for drinks and meals for an average meal the restaurants are OK. However personally I would only stop for a beer and some people watching for a short time. The Christmas market during December is the biggest in Prague and the Christmas tree looks great.

Excellent, but a bit busy!. I am traveling here during Christmas time, so they have a fantastic Christmas market! They also have tons of stores, big or small and very family friendly! The Old Town Square also has the well renowned astronomical clock, and since I am here at Christmas time, a huge Christmas tree! Family friendly, and an enjoyable experience.

Beware of pickpockets. The square is amazing and visit to the clock is a must! Beware of pickpockets as my mum got her bag nicked in a restaurant in the square by we believe know pickpockets - luckily we got it back as had been about to pay the bill for our evening meal!
Must do. If you visit Prague for the first time, the Old Town Square is a place you just see. The market is fascinating, the buildings are beautiful, and the clock tower is a must do.
fantastic Atmosphere. We went after Christmas and it still felt very festive. Recommend the mulled wine when you get too cold. Loved just wandering around the shops and market stalls.

Something for everyone. There is so much to see and do here. Enjoy the food from the vendors at least once. I loved seeing the tourists stand around to watch the clock even though it wasn't going off for another 30 minutes or so. You don't need to wait forever in the cold to see it. Show up 5 minutes before and you are good. Going up in the tower is a must and it's also good timing when the clock hits the hour.

Fun place to be. The square can get rather crowded, so be prepared. There's so much too absorb. Christmas market, Astronomical Clock, the churches with their bells ringing, restaurants, stores, horse drawn carriages, and people! Today is Cnristmas Day andthe atmosphere was festive! There were animals to pet, hot chestnuts to buy, and pictures to take. it definitely is a gathering place. oh, I'd add the street musicians too!

Went during Christmas time. Most places in Europe have great Christmas markets this time of year, and Prague was no different! The people were friendly and the food and souveniers were great. My wife and I and our little dog spent most of our time in this area. On the 24th of December this place pretty much shuts down. But it opens up again the next day - Christmas Day! We had a great time here! it is a definite must-do! Avoid the restaurants in the area as they are ridiculously expensive. You can easily find a reasonable one close by if you just walk a block away!
Old Town Hall. The view from the Tower of the Old Town Hall was stunning and worth the effort (the queue can be fairly long ...)

Capital of prague. Of course this is a must visit "everday" of your stay place. You will spend an excellent time in the afternoon eating...or at night just chilling out. You will feel the real spirit of prague in this square. Very nice old architectural buildings. Try the old prague pork.
Fairytale like!. Beautifully preserved architecture with a buzzing Christmas Market... Wish we had more time to climb the Clock Tower... next time definately!
A must. The ambience of this square is superb. The Old clock, the stalls selling food and drink, the street performers make this a wonderful place to visit.
Christmas Market in Prague. This was the most beautiful market we visited. The Christams tree was magnificent and the surrounding buildings were all lite it give it a magical feeling.
great old Square. the buildings and the atmosphere and the christmas market was the best one of the four we visited in Prague
Lots to do. Old town square is full of activity and there is a lot to do. The Christmas markets were beautiful and the carols at nighttime were just lovely. Definitely worth a visit.

back again. very festive great city for attractions ana history and supruisingly good food a great value for money nice resturants and bars history of this place is quiet uniqe the only down fall is that in in resturants and bars you are allowed to smoke but that aside well worth a visit you wont be dissapointed

Picturesque square. Take the tower view!. A must, and one I expect all Prague visitors see. Beautiful old buildings and the wonderful Tyn church, tasty crepes, the famous astronomical clock, and incredible views from the top of the tower. We had a special treat - on one of the side streets we came across a street musician playing classical music on an accordion!

Lots going on in this square. Old town square has a wonderful visual appeal with the churches and clock and fountain. The fountain is the central feature and is worth looking up before you see it (or buy a guide on prague). From there you can walk to any of the sites around there. There were plenty of food stands and hot spiced wine as it was a cool november day. The astronomical clock show was a cool way to spend 5 minutes. Be ready with your camera as the show doesn't last long, but you can catch it on the hour. There are plenty of restaurants to sit at and enjoy food or drink - just expect to pay higher prices for the location!

Municipality has done a good job keeping and restoring. I visited just on the limit of the Christmas season beginning, and it was very interesting. The place was fully decorated with lights Christmas lighting and kiosks for local/typical food. it was outstanding.

Doesn't need words. I used to live in Prague for many years, and whenever I come back, I always visit Old Town Square. It just has the magic. It's a place you shouldn't miss, especially if you are visiting Prague around Christmas or Easter. The markets are great and create additional fairy-tail atmosphere.
A nice Christmas market. the market there in Christmas is not a big as those in Germany. But food is nice and the view at night is especially beautiful.

Nice setting. Went to Prague for the Christmas markets, and walked though this one everyday. The stalls are selling what you can buy in the shops, often cheaper, and the store owners will drop their prices, but thankfully don't chase after you if you decide not to buy. The mulled wine and honey wine were lovely. Thought the stores would have been selling more of a variety. Overall I was disappointed.

Beautiful Square and perfect setting for a Christmas Market. This is one of my favourite areas of Prague, beautiful buildings surrounding the square. Great atmoshphere in this Christmas Market with jazz band playing, hot roast chestnuts, mulled wine and bavarian food to tempt us. However apart from the food, we didnt find anything special on other stalls. If we'd gone to Prague just for the Christmas Market we would have been very disappointed

Christmas wonder. Positively medieval with an extensive Christmas market and the most glorious Christmas tree. There was a stage next to the tree and local performers were featured throughout the evening. Shops feature crystal, amber and garnets - prices are about the same as regular retail stores.
Spectacular. A trip to Prague isn't complete without visiting this square. At Christmas time there is a wonderful Christmas market, and of course the bewildering Astronomical Clock :-)
Wonderful around Christmas. I was there the week before x-mas, and it was teeming with people, an enormous Christmas-tree and lots of stalls selling warm wine. Tremendous.
can give a miss. probably because of the group's choice was veggie - they did not find the right food according to their taste pallette

A must visit in Prague. This is one of the most loveliest places in Prague to visit , around the square there is beautiful buildings and at night time they are better and very romantic .I would venture down the side streets that lead off from the square in all directions and explore them they are very old and quaint ,you will also find some lovely restaurants that are also very good but without the prices that they charge in old town square

Prague's old town. This part of Prague really has a beautiful history.
A lot of monuments that are situated very close to eachother.
This is the part of Prague I would recommend to visit first and to visit if you don't stay for too long, because you're able to see the most beautiful part of Prague in a short time.
magic chritsmas markets. wonderful things to eat and drink and fires cooking food give the best smell and add to the atmosphere wonderful

Wonderful place!. I was in Prague during the Christmas Makrt, and the Old Town Square was in a great atmosphere because of this.
Lots of Christmas lights, very good street food and beautiful craftworks. Every building around the square is really amazing and very well preserved. It is tottaly must go!

Christmas markets with lovely atmosphere. What a beautiful area of the city. Stayed in Prague for 3 nights and spent a lot of time around here. Christmas markets well worth a visit with lovely food and drinks, the large tree was stunning and there were sporadic choirs and singers on stage. You cannot skip this if you visit Prague!

Xmas Markets 2012. So not on the same scale of Cologne or even Copenhagen but passable and quite fun anyway. Certainly better than the stalls down in Wenceslas Square (which was disappointing by comparison.A good mix of locals and tourists, lots of mulled wine - particularly look out for the hot cherry mead... fantastic and very more-ish! Food is standard xmas markets fare - fresh doughnut-type things, sausages and chicken kebabs in baguettes etc but the winner by a mile is the old prague ham - wood-fire cooked and then hacked off in huge wedges served with bread and mustard (or ketchup yeuch!)... a thoroughly good compliment to the gluwein!

A real Christmas feel. I have just returned from a visit to the Christmas markets. The old town square is alive with stalls, decorations and people really enjoying thenselves. Its worth going just for the hot red wine!!!

Give me this over Wenceslas Square any day. This is how I imagined Prague to be at Christmas. A small square thronging with people, little kiosks selling food, drink and souvenirs and one huge Christmas tree festooned with bright lights. A happy place where people of all ages seem relaxed and in good spirits. Wenceslas square isn't, either a square or quite like the old town square, it is still worth a visit but not a place you would keep returning too, in my view.

Quaint. Lots of interesting buildings surround the square - and many restaurants and shops. Musicians were playing in the square which was fun - and students were putting on some kind of perfomance - so it is a busy place.
nice place to see. nice place to see...lot of people gathering and some road shows starts once the clock bell ends..thats to good entertinment

Best during Christmas markets.. We were staying off Wenceslas square but ended up at Old Town Square every day mainly due to the Christmas markets. We enjoyed sampling the food from the stalls. Be sure to be there during top of the hour to watch the trumpeter on top of the Astronomical clock. You can climb the tower for a fee as well. Coffee can be expensive in the surrounding cafes and restaurants. Many interesting shops in and around the square. Take the time to explore. Keep your wits about you as far as your belongings.
Well worth a visit. The old building here are fantastic, great architecture and very decorative buildings, also with the Christmas stalls a lovely atmosphere everywhere.

rustic charm. Wonderful architecture, magical feeling. The christmas tree and market stalls were being set up while we were there. recommend going from the first week in December when the market will be open.

Breathtaking square, especially at Christmas. From Gothic to Renaissance to Baroque to Rococo to Art Nouveau, you'll see it all in one turn around Old Town Square.The churches, old town hall with its astronomical clock, museums, shops, restaurants, and at Christmas a beautiful tree, angels and markets fill the square.I don't believe I've seen a prettier square or one with such history. If you don't see anything else in Prague, visit this wonderful square.

Visit to st Nicholas church in the lesser town.. I was surprised we had to pay to see it! But I'm told that's normal!I believe it is the most famous baroque church in Prague and is one of the most valuable Baroque buildings north of the Alps.We loved the old town square with its huge and very beautifully decorated Christmas tree. The many market stalls were exciting.i was particularly enthralled to see them making chips using a special kind of drill! The astronomical clock,situated on the old town square was amazing. It has to be visited to appreciate its many functions.
Go around and look. Majority of Czech historical events happened in this place. Have a look around and watch those spots. YOu will be surprised.

All roads lead to Old Town Square.. If you're wandering around Prague a little bit lost you'll eventually end up in the old town square. It's a pretty place with lots of nice things to look at. Christmas decorations were really nice, I didn't bother with any of the restaurants or pubs as they were all bit over-priced due to their location, it's a great focal point to the city though.

Prague Real deal - Christmas time. You can spend hours in old town square, the Christmas tree, lights, music, food, drinks & spirit all in one place, you will fall in love with it from the first sight as we did,

Authentic and majestic. I was apparently very lucky: I arrived there after sundown, and the square was INVADED by dozens of pictoresque little "shops" selling typical, impossible to pronounce, on-the-go Czech food. This made the square very lively, with the fantastic church looming in the back and giving an air of majesty to all of it. The fact that it is full of Czech does miracles to make it feel authentic.
old town square. our favourite place in prague,the christmas markets were in full swing with lovely gifts and unreal good food in the square!
Be careful. Although this was a fabulous place, watch out for the Ham Sellers, you can get taken for a lot of money, this is because they sell it by the gram and not a portion!!!!
best place to stay. wasn't sure on locations having no idea where to stay....best by far now having been here and walking varoius areas.....the history, the buildings....amazing!!!

Brilliant Christmas Market. The Old Town Square is the home of Prague Christmas Market for December. It's a bustling, hectic and fun place to be - plenty of Trndl pastries and svarak (mulled wine) always oils the wheels of enjoyment.

Christmas market. Loved it - fabulous setting with all the stalls, the church behind, all the lights, the many varied food stalls and mulled wine too! Wasn't able to do any Christmas shopping but throughly enjoyed the setting and atmosphere.
Xmas Spirit. Xmas market stalls varied in their displays, great atmostsphere, prices very reasonable., local cafes good.

Fairytale. This MUST be the most stunningly charming square in the world, which becomes even more amazing after dark when floodlights illuminate the Disneylike gothic church and the Town Hall with its astronomical clock. Climb the clock tower for an unforgettable view of the Old Town

Best place to relax. Loved this square with all of the outside restaurants, live music, the astronomical clock and trumpeter, the huge statue, and escpecially seeing all the young people just sitting around on the ground in the evening, just hanging out.

Prague Must-See. Old Town Square is a huge piazza in Prague, near the Jewish Quarter, the Astronomical Clock, and several pubs and restaurants. If it is cold when you visit, you can buy the most delicious hot chocolate for the equivalent of about 25 cents (USD) from the street vendors. Sit on a bench in the center of the piazza and absorb the panoramic beauty of Old Town Square.

Magical. Go at night when lit up and if you can in the month of December to see the most beautiful Christmas tree standing so tall against the Lit up buildings. the Christmas market gave an extra dimension. We kept going back to take another look!

Astronomical clock - and so much more!. The square is perfect, day and night, but the crowds are always there, so don't miss the evening when the Tyn Church is illuminated. The clock is extraordinary, but the range of buildings all around, from all different eras and beautifully restored, is wonderful. The Christmas market in December is great too (make sure you hold on to your bag - it's not that it is dangerous, but with such crowds...)
Great for Christmas markets. coming here to visit was a nice way to get into the Christmas spirit, just what we were looking for and would come back again

Hustle and Bustle in Prague. Love it!Try to be there on the hour as the astronomical clock will move (you can see the 12 apostles moving) and then the trumpeter will play a musical solo around the 4 sides of the tower. The tune is really catchy. Lots of street food vendors around for quick on the go lunch

Christmas cheer. Great place, you feel like you're in a medieval story. The Christmas lights are amazing. There are a lot of stands selling various goods, from the popular trdlo and klobasa to christmas decorations.

White Christmas!. What a brilliant experience to visit in December when the christmas market is up and running and it's snowing! (albeit lightly). What a magical and charming place with beautiful decorations adding to the charm of the elegant buildings. The place feels happy, the stalls sell magnets, clocks, clothing, gingerbread and all sorts as well as hot wine and hot mead (my preference!), and traditional foods such as the trdelnik that I was addicted to. There was a stage set up for performances that occur throughout the day everyday through December, and there is a massive beautifully decorated tree and centre part where you can climb up to get a view over the whole area.Definitely delightful

Christmas Market. Most has been said under my review for the Old Town as the square embodies the whole area but we went for the Christmas Markets & while being very pretty they were all very small compared to other cities, but the atmosphere was lovely.
beauty of Prague. great square in Prague..if u r hungry many restaurants around u can eat in :) or if u just want to grab cap of tea and sit at the park close by old town squere n relax :)
Clock. We watched the clock striking the hour and delighted in the trumpeter doing his solo at the top of the tower. Wonderful architecture.

Busy but atmospheric. We enjoyed catching the metro into the centre of Prague and wandering around the Old Town, it was enjoyable people watching too whilst sampling the hot ham or pancakes from the street stalls littered around the Old Town Square.

Great place to start Xmas. I have visited several Xmas markets accross Europe, and this is one of the bests! Just try to avoid the lighting of the tree event, because we felt trapped in a maze of people!!!!

you cant miss it. We got to the see the town square at Christmas time so the market was in full swing. If you want to have a drink or a meal in the square there are several options but you know that you will pay more for the privilidge. Also, be aware that smoking is still allowed in most restaurants so check before you decide. All the buildings in the square are beautiful so take your camera. Make sure you join the tourists watching the clock on the hour.
Wonderful. Just beautiful building after beautiful building and extra interest with the Christmas market. Love it.
Beautiful. Arrived there at night. It is an amazing site with all the lights, people, restaurants, and of course historical buildings. Loved the Old Town Square
Christmas Markets. Beautiful setting with wonderful architecture. The market stalls were selling hot food and hot drinks along with souvenirs.

Christmas shopping in Prague. What an incredible mix of smells, sights and sounds. From the blacksmiths forge to the horse drawn carriages, the lights of the huge Christmas tree and the sweet sound of carol singers on the temporary stage. Mulled wine and hot grog, all mannor of hot comforting foods can be found in the old square. Although busy (and I am not a lover of crowds) a stop in front of the amazing clock to watch it strike the hour is worth the discomfort.

Few places compare at Christmas. Few places in the world compare to Starometske Namesti at Christmas. The Christmas tree was simply unbelievable (my wife has a hundred pictures with the tree), and the Christmas market was amazing. You have to try the Klebasa, the Prague prosciutto and especially the Trdlnik. Not a fan of the wine, war or not, but the beer was good.
Amazing place xmas market. Amazing place xmas market highly recomendedlots of xmas shops amazing xmas tree hard rock cafeegood food

One of Europe's Most Beautiful. Wonderfully preserved, centuries-old architecture. Prague was thankfully spared the WWII bombings that decimated many other European cities. Many restaurants and entertainers in the square while you admire the magnificent cathedrals, towers and spires surrounding your 360° panorama. Be sure to view the clock tower put on it's show every hour on the hour during the day.

Christmas lights. Arrived at 6.00 on ist December to see the lights switched on along with 40 thousand others. Beware as it can be frighting if you are in the wrong place and feel that you could be crushed

Beautiful - especially at Christmas. In the run up to Christmas, the Square is populated by traditional food and drink stalls which at night time fill the air with fabulous smells and light, added to which it's a beautiful square anyway!

Old Town Square - Christmas Markets. Very busy and because of the stalls and decorations not too many places to sit and appreciate the edge and buildings surrounding the square. Probably very different in the summer - another excuse for a visit!
Good eateries. Found a friendly restaurant which advertises that ingredients are from own farm. Certainly tasty. Recommend the asparagus.
A journey back in time. Who says time travel is not possible? Visit the Old Town Square in prague and you will feel back in the past having a beer and ejoying life
facinating. Not super crowded. Some nice eateries. there are always some activity in the middle. Nice mix of tourists and locals

The heart of the city. You can't really go anywhere in Prague without passing through the old town square. The biggest attraction there is is the astronomical clock. Every hour the clock puts on a little animated show and then a live trumpeter sounds a fanfare from the top of the tower. We missed the Christmas Market by a couple of days, but it looked to be spectacular. Lots of free tours start from the square, we chose the Sandemans New Prague Tours (they wear red coats/jumpers) and they were excellent.

Lovely area. Cant be missed on a Prague visit. Buildings and Astronomical clock are stunning and make sure to join the crowd on the hour for the short clock workings. Be sure to read the detail about the clock and all the figures in detail prior to watching it. You will get so much more when you look at the finer detail of why the skeleton figure rings the bell, why the man is holding the mirror, etc and why they shake their heads. I will leave you to find out the answers.
Beautiful. Every which way you turn there is another lovely building. Plently to eat in the way of sauasage and pork at the stalls along with hot wine. Not the cheapest though!
Very Cool Vibe. Cool place to be with lots of shops and restaurants. The astronomical clock is NOT to be missed! It's a great place for the kidlets to run around.
Lovely place. I spent a couple of hours in this very beautiful town square. Nice places to stop off for a rest and a coffee

A nice meeting place. I was there in May and watched a hockey game between the Czech Republic and Slovakia with a large but peaceful crowd. The city had set up a large screen, and food and drink was for sale. A great time. In December there is a Christmas market set up there. So, this is a great place just to hang out for a while. There are lots of tourists, of course, and I wouldn't eat at the reastaurants right on the square, but it is a must seem, in my opinion.

Old town during X-mas periode. Just love Praque during the X- mas season, it starts the 1st of december with lighting the big X-mas tree on the market square. I can advise to go there during this periode.

Very nice. This place was really nice - at this time of the year it's full of christmas decorations and markets. Unfortunately we were a bit early so a lot of the stalls were shut and they're still setting up the Christmas tree. Plenty of food and drink though!

Lot of people, but very nice. Every tourist must see this place, but sometimes is here too much tourist, attraciton only for them, everything for really high prices. It´s problem, but off course you will find there lot of things which you can enjoy.

Favorite part of Prague!. Loved the atmosphere in this part of town. Definitely try the food from the street vendor-the ham is yummy and comes in a big portion, also try the potato, cabbage, and ham dish (can't remember the name but I wish I can have this again!)
Great place. This is the place where people come to see Buskers , Artists Dancers etc etc ... if you want a very relaxed couple of hours go here and enjoy
life in czech. loved the buildings.. the churches ..the clock... the atmosphere... the spontanious happenings...Hated the dog dirt

Great Place. What a great place, we wandered around after watching the Astronomical Clock strike the hour, There was lots of entertainment going on in the Square and little stalls selling hot drinks etc. Also found and English bar & an Irish Bar tucked away in one corner

Nice vibe, beautiful square. The square is surrounded by old churches and the astronomical clock, which give it an almost medieval feel. Very beautiful lit up at night too. There are some little foodstalls selling slightly expensive crepes, sausages and other snacks. There were various street performers and costumed mimes who drew surprising crowds. It is definitely worth climbing the tower to look out over prague although it was very crowded, even in low season. The astronomical clock is nice but the action "on the hour" is utterly underwhelming despite people crowding in to see it.

Tourist attraction. It is certainly touristy but that is the case with every city's popular square. Stroll around the square and make a 360 degree turn around to look at the myriad of styles that decended upon Prague through centuries. Once the capital of Holy Roman Empire, it remains in its artistic incarnations a true jewel of human creativity and originality. This is where you can appreciate Prague Gothic and Baroque too.

A great starting point. A great place to get your berings, visit the clocktown, have a coffee, shop a little, and get your tix for tours and everything. It's pretty much the most central place in the city, and there's a lot to do from there.

Very Atmospheric. This is a must visit when you're in Prague. Pay the £3 to go up the tower, it's well worth it but do it at night for breathtaking views.Also, go to the roof top bar/restaurant of Hotel Au Prince opposite the tower, it's really good and a great way to spend an evening.
The heart of Prague.. The most beautiful and romantic place in Prague. Climb necessarily at Staroměstská radnice. You will discover a spectacular view of the city.

loads going on here. We stopped here for 60 mins whilst waiting for our cruise tour so we had a look around.there were various restaurants,acts,shops as well as vintage car tour rides too.I loved this place so much but if you are interested in the river cruise and dinner which lasts 3hours,then do this in daylight to see more.

The old town hall and the Square is a must. Lively place. Surrounding by beautiful historical buildings all way around. And then the watch and ceromonies every hour it strikes should be seen.
Lots of places for food and drinks.

Lively at night time. I went to Prague with a whole bunch of friends and I will admit we did go to alot of bars and did drink alot of beer. When in Rome as they say. The astronomical clock is a highlight, and the old square in general has a great atmosphere. Do go there with the right intentions to have a good time and you will LOVE Prague.
Lovely!!!!. It's huge and always crowded. Try the coach ride, they are amazing for those who love horses and you'll get to see all the surrounding attractions

Beautiful Architecture, Astronomical Clock, People Watching in Prague. Old Town Square deserves its reputation as a top tourist site in Prague. From the statue of Jan Hus to the clock, to Tyn church and the surrounding buildings, everything is just brilliant.
